Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@1: Scope This Law provides for drug prevention and combat; management of illegal drug users; drug detoxification; responsibilities of individuals, families, agencies and organizations in drug prevention and combat; state management and international cooperation in drug prevention and combat.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows : 1. Narcotic substances are narcotic substances and psychotropic substances on the list of narcotic substances promulgated by the Government. 2. Narcotic substance means a psychoactive substance that is easy to cause addiction to users. 3. Psychotropic substances are substances which stimulate or inhibit nerves or cause hallucinations and, if used repeatedly, may lead to addiction for users. 4. Precursor chemical means a chemical that is indispensable in the process of preparation and production of narcotic substances and is specified in the list of precursor chemicals promulgated by the Government. 5. Narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs are veterinary drugs containing substances specified in Clauses 2,3 and 4 of this Article. 6. Narcotic-bearing plants mean opium poppy, coca, marijuana and other plants containing narcotic substances prescribed by the Government. 7. Drug prevention and combat means the prevention, combat of drug-related crimes and evils; and control of lawful drug-related activities. 8. Drug evil means the illegal use of narcotics, drug addiction and acts of violating the law on narcotics, which are not serious enough or are not examined for penal liability. 9. Control of lawful drug-related activities means the permission, monitoring, examination and supervision of lawful drug-related activities and prevention of and combat against the abuse of such activities for other purposes. 10. illegal drug user means a person who uses drugs without permission of a competent professional person or agency and tests positive for narcotic substances in his/her body. 11. drug test means the application of professional techniques to determine narcotic substances in the body through urine, blood or other specimens of the human body. 12. Drug addict means a person who uses narcotics, habit-forming substances or psychotropic medicines and is dependent on these substances. 13. Drug rehabilitation means the process of providing medical, psychological and social support for drug addicts to stop using narcotic substances, addictive drugs and psychotropic substances, rehabilitate their physical and mental health, raise their awareness and change their behaviors in order to stop the illegal use of these substances. 14. Drug detoxification establishments mean establishments set up to fully carry out the detoxification process prescribed by this Law, including public drug detoxification establishments and voluntary drug detoxification establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@3: State policies on drug prevention and fight 1. To apply drug prevention and combat measures in a coordinated manner in combination with HIV/AIDS and other social evil prevention and combat. 2. To intensify drug prevention and combat propaganda and education activities; to encourage organizations and individuals to participate in drug prevention and combat propaganda and education. 3. To prioritize drug prevention and combat resources for ethnic minority, mountainous, deep-lying, remote and island areas, border areas and areas with drug-related complexities. 4. Officers and men of agencies specialized in drug-related crime prevention and combat and persons performing drug detoxification work in public drug detoxification establishments are entitled to preferential regimes and policies suitable to the nature of their tasks and geographical areas of operation under the Government's regulations. 5. To protect and support individuals, families, agencies and organizations involved in drug prevention and combat. 6. Strictly manage illegal drug users and drug addicts; encourage drug addicts to voluntarily stop their drug addiction and treat opioid addiction with substitution drugs; encourage individuals, families, agencies and organizations to participate in and support drug detoxification and post-detoxification management. 7. Provide funding for compulsory drug rehabilitation; provide funding for voluntary drug rehabilitation and post-rehabilitation supervision. 8. Domestic and foreign organizations and individuals investing in drug detoxification, post-detoxification management support and drug addiction relapse prevention shall be entitled to land rent exemption or reduction and enterprise income tax reduction according to law provisions. 9. To encourage scientific research, technological development and application of high technologies to drug prevention and combat. 10. To commend individuals, organizations and agencies that record achievements in drug prevention and combat.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@4: Funding for drug prevention and fight 1. State budget. 2. Sponsorship, aid, investment, sponsorship from domestic and foreign organizations and individuals. 3. Payment by families and drug addicts. 4. Other lawful financial sources.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@5: Prohibited acts 1. Plant narcotic-bearing plants and provide instructions on the plantation thereof. 2. Illegal research, inspection, testing, inspection, production, storage, transport, storage, trading, distribution, handling, exchange, export, import, temporary import, re-export, temporary export, re-import or transit of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors or narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs. 3. Seizure of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs. 4. Delivering, receiving, managing, controlling, storing, dispensing and preserving narcotic substances and precursors in contravention of law; allowing users of narcotic substances, addictive drugs or psychotropic medicines to comply with law. 5. Illegally using or organizing the illegal use of narcotic substances; forcing or enticing others to illegally use narcotic substances; harboring or supporting the illegal use of narcotic substances. 6. Manufacturing, storing, transporting, trading means and instruments used in the illegal production or use of narcotics. 7. Fight against or obstruct the testing of narcotic substances in the body, determine the drug addiction, manage illegal drug users, detoxify and manage drug addiction after detoxification. 8. Taking revenge on or obstructing persons performing drug prevention and combat tasks or persons participating in drug prevention and combat. 9. Abusing positions, powers or occupations to violate the law on drug prevention and combat. 10. Provide guidance on illegal production and use of narcotic substances; advertising and marketing narcotic substances. 11. Stigmatizing illegal drug users, detoxified drug users and detoxified drug users. 12. Other prohibited acts related to drugs as prescribed by law.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@6: Responsibilities of individuals and families 1. To disseminate and educate their family members and relatives about drug harms and observe the law on drug prevention and combat; to manage and prevent family members from violating the law on drug prevention and combat. 2. Comply with the instructions of competent persons on the use of narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs. 3. Cooperate with competent authorities in fighting against drug-related crimes and evils; participate in supporting voluntary drug rehabilitation in families and communities, drug rehabilitation in drug rehabilitation centers and treatment of opioid dependence with substitution drugs; monitor and assist detoxified people in integrating into the community; prevent and control relapse into drug dependence. 4. Promptly provide information about drug-related crimes, drug problems and growing of narcotic-bearing plants for police authorities or competent authorities; participate in elimination of narcotic-bearing plants organized by local governments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@7: Responsibilities of regulatory agencies 1. Organize drug prevention and fight in their agencies and units; prevent cadres, civil servants, public employees and employees under their management and cadres and soldiers of the people's armed forces from violating the law on drug prevention and fight; propagate and mobilize people to detect, denounce and combat drug crimes and evils. 2. To organize the implementation of the State's guidelines and policies on socio-economic development planning in order to replace the planting of narcotic-bearing plants in areas where narcotic-bearing plants are eliminated.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@8: Responsibilities of educational institutions 1. To organize the implementation of education programs on drug prevention and combat; to disseminate and educate about the law on drug prevention and combat among pupils, students and trainees; to strictly manage and prevent pupils, students and trainees from violating the law on drug prevention and combat. 2. To coordinate with families, agencies, organizations and local administrations in managing and educating pupils, students and trainees in drug prevention and combat. 3. Cooperate with competent authorities, organizations and individuals in carrying out drug tests where necessary to detect students' illegal drug use.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@9: Responsibilities of press agencies The press agencies shall have to coordinate with the concerned agencies and organizations in propagating the undertakings, policies and legislation on drug prevention and fight.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@10: Responsibilities of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front, member organizations of the Front and other organizations 1. To organize and coordinate with competent agencies in propagating and disseminating knowledge and law on drug prevention and combat among the people; to mobilize the people to participate in drug prevention and combat and carry out drug prevention and combat movements. 2. To prevent and stop their own people and all citizens from violating the law on drug prevention and combat. 3. Cooperate with local governments at all levels and competent authorities in encouraging drug addicts to take drug rehabilitation measures and receive opioid replacement therapy; participate in rehabilitation, education, vocational training, job seeking and help detoxified persons to integrate into the community; prevent and control relapse into drug addiction.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@11: Drug crime prevention and control agency 1. Drug-related crime prevention and fighting agencies include : a) Drug-related crime prevention and fighting agencies of the People's Public Security Force; b) Drug-related crime prevention and fighting agencies of the Border Guard, the Vietnam Coast Guard and the Customs. 2. Drug-related crime prevention and combat agencies of the People's Public Security Forces shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with concerned agencies and organizations in, preventing and fighting drug-related crimes. 3. Drug-related crime prevention and combat agencies of the Border Guard, the Vietnam Coast Guard and the Customs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with public security agencies and other concerned agencies and organizations in, preventing and fighting drug-related crimes in areas under their management and control. 4. In the same area, when detecting acts of law violation related to the tasks and powers of many agencies, the agency that has detected first shall handle them according to its competence prescribed by law; if the case does not fall under its competence, it shall transfer the dossier, persons and material evidences of law violation to the competent agency for presiding over settlement. 5. The Government shall stipulate the coordination among agencies in charge of drug-related crime prevention and combat.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@12: Legal drug - related activities 1. Lawful drug-related activities are those permitted by competent state management agencies, including: a) Research into, assessment, testing, inspection and production of narcotic substances (excluding the cultivation of plants containing narcotic substances ), precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors and narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs; b) Transporting, preserving, storing, trading, distributing, using, treating, exchanging narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, and narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs; c) Import, export, temporary import, re-export, temporary export, re-import, transit of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, and narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs. 2. Lawful drug-related activities specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall be strictly controlled under this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@13: Control of research, assessment and production of narcotic substances and precursors 1. Drug research, assessment and production (excluding planting of plants containing narcotic substances) and precursors must be monitored, inspected and supervised by competent authorities. 2. The Government shall specify the competent licensing agencies, the licensing order and procedures, the monitoring, inspection and supervision prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@14: Control of transportation of narcotic substances and precursors 1. Any organization or individual that is permitted by a competent authority may transport narcotic substances and precursors; packaging and sealing shall comply with regulations of a competent authority; take responsibility for the quantity and quality of narcotic substances and precursors, take safety measures to prevent loss during the transport and be subject to supervision of a competent authority. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@15: Control of activities related to narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors The control of activities related to narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, or drug precursors shall comply with regulations of law on pharmacy, except for the activities specified in Point b Clause 1 and Clause 2 Article 17 of this Law.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@16: Control of activities related to narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs The control of activities related to narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs shall comply with regulations of the Government.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@17: Control of import, export, temporary import, re-export, temporary export, re-import, transit of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors 1. The following activities must be permitted by competent agencies: a) Import, export, temporary import for re-export, temporary export for re-import of narcotic substances and precursors; b) Temporary import, temporary export, temporary import of narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients are narcotic substances, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors. 2. The transit of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors through Vietnam's territory must comply with the route written in the license for transit. The transporter must follow the procedures and be controlled by the customs and competent authorities of Vietnam. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@18: Documentation of legal drug-related activities Agencies, organizations and individuals, when carrying out activities specified in Clause 1, Article 12 of this Law, shall compile dossiers and make reports according to the Government's regulations.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@19: Control of lawful drug-related activities for defense and security purposes The research, assessment, production, transport, storage, preservation, use, import, export, temporary import, re-export, temporary export, re-import, transit of narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs serving national defense and security purposes shall comply with regulations of the Government.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@20: Control of narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs and precursor drugs for first aid and emergency treatment during international travel and treatment of persons on entry, exit or in transit 1. The carrying of narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs and precursor drugs for first aid and emergency treatment on ships, aircraft, trains, cars or other vehicles during international travel and tourism is not considered carrying goods exported, imported or transited through the Vietnamese territory. The commander and operator of the transport means shall have to declare to the Vietnamese customs office the quantity of drugs already used, apply appropriate safety measures to prevent the use for improper purposes or illegal transportation of such drugs and submit to the control by the competent Vietnamese agency. 2. The carrying of narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs and precursor drugs for treatment of the persons on entry, exit or transit through Vietnam's territory shall comply with the Government's regulations and be controlled by competent authorities of Vietnam.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@21: Handling narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs seized in a case of violation of law Narcotic substances, precursors, narcotic drugs, psychotropic drugs, precursor drugs, medicinal ingredients that are narcotic active ingredients, psychotropic active ingredients, drug precursors, narcotic substance-and precursor-containing veterinary drugs that are seized in criminal cases or administrative violations shall be handled in accordance with regulations of law on criminal procedures and administrative penalties.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@22: Drug tests on the body 1. Drug tests shall be carried out in the following cases: a) The person is found to be illegally using narcotic substances; b) The person is suspected by a competent authority or person to illegally use narcotic substances; c) The user illegally uses narcotic substances in the management period; d) Persons who are being subject to the administrative sanction of education at communes, wards or townships due to illegal use of narcotic substances; are undergoing detoxification; are undergoing treatment for opioid dependence with substitution drugs; are being under post-detoxification management. 2. Heads of drug rehabilitation centers and opioid replacement therapy centers; persons competent to impose administrative penalties for illegal use of narcotic substances shall carry out drug tests within their competence or request competent authorities or persons to carry out drug tests in the body in the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article. If the test result is positive, the positive result shall be sent to the President of the People's Committee of the commune where the positive person resides, unless he/she is undergoing compulsory drug rehabilitation. 3. The State shall provide funding for testing for narcotic substances in the body in the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@23: Management of illegal drug users 1. Management of illegal drug users is a preventive measure to help illegal drug users stop illegally using narcotic substances and prevent their acts of law violation. Management of illegal drug users is not an administrative handling measure. 2. The time limit for management of illegal drug users is 01 year from the date on which the Chairperson of the People's Committee of commune issues the management decision. 3. Management of illegal drug users includes the following tasks: a) Give advice, encourage, educate and help the illegal drug users to stop using illegally drugs; b) Testing for narcotic substances in the body; c) Prevent illegal drug users from committing acts that cause social disorder and unsafety. 4. Within 03 working days from the day on which the positive test result is received, the President of People's Committee of commune shall issue a decision and organize the management of the illegal drug user who resides in the commune. 5. During the management, the President of the People's Committee of commune shall issue a decision to suspend the management of illegal drug users in the following cases : a) The illegal user of narcotic substance is determined as drug addict; b) The illegal drug user is subject to the administrative measure of education in commune, ward or town due to the illegal use of narcotic substances; c) The illegal drug user is subject to the administrative measure of being sent to a compulsory education institution or a reformatory; d) The illegal drug user is sentenced to imprisonment; dd) The illicit drug user is dead and declared missing by the court. 6. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@24: Responsibilities of illegal drug users 1. Provide sufficient and accurate information about their illegal drug use to the police of communes where they reside. 2. To submit to the management by commune-level People's Committees.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@25: Responsibilities of families, agencies, organizations and communities in management of illegal drug users 1. The family of the illegal drug user has the following responsibilities: a) Manage and educate illegal drug users; prevent illegal drug use; b) Provide information about illegal drug use of the drug user to the police authority of commune where he/she resides; c) Prevent illegal drug users from committing acts that cause social disorder and unsafety; d) Cooperate with competent authorities in taking illegal drug users to undergo drug tests. 2. The organizations where the illegal drug user works and the community where the illegal drug user lives shall : a) Encourage, assist and educate drug users; prevent illegal drug use; b) Cooperate with the family and competent authorities in taking illegal drug users to the drug testing facility.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@26: Making a list of illegal drug users 1. Commune-level police offices shall assist People's Committees of the same level in making lists of illegal drug users residing in their localities. 2. When the illegal drug user changes his/her place of residence, the commune-level police office of the place of departure shall notify the commune-level police office of the place of destination within 5 working days after such person moves out of the locality for listing and further management. 3. Commune-level police offices shall assist People's Committees of the same level in removing drug users from the list in the following cases : a) The illegal drug user does not commit any illegal drug use during the management period specified in Clause 2 Article 23 of this Law; b) The illegal drug user is subject to the management suspension specified in Clause 5 Article 23 of this Law; c) The illegal drug user moves to reside in another locality.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@27: Identify drug addiction 1. Drug dependence is diagnosed in the following cases: a) The illegal drug user is detected to have illegally used narcotic substances while under his/her management; b) The illegal drug user has no stable residence; c) Persons who are being subject to the administrative sanction of education at communes, wards or towns due to illegal use of narcotic substances or within 01 year from the date of completing the administrative sanction of education at communes, wards or towns due to illegal use of narcotic substances but are detected to have illegally used narcotic substances; d) Persons who are under post-detoxification management and are found to have illegally used narcotic substances; dd) Persons voluntarily determining the drug addiction status. 2. The commune-level police office where the person specified at Points a, b, c and d, Clause 1 of this Article is detected shall compile a dossier to request a competent health establishment to determine the drug addiction status. 3. In case district-or provincial-level police offices directly detect or detect in the course of investigating and handling cases of law violation the cases specified at Points a, b, c and d, Clause 1 of this Article, the police offices currently handling the cases shall compile dossiers requesting competent medical establishments to determine the drug addiction status. 4. When the result of drug dependence is available, the medical facility shall immediately send it to the requesting authority and the person whose drug dependence is diagnosed. 5. The person whose drug dependence is diagnosed has the following rights and obligations : a) Have their honor and dignity protected; have their travel, accommodation and treatment for withdrawal syndrome and other comorbidities provided during the period of drug dependence diagnosis; b) Comply with the regulations of the facility that determines the drug dependence; honestly report to the medical staff about the drug use history and signs of drug use; c/An adult aged full 18 years or older or his/her parent, guardian or lawful representative of an adult aged full 12 years to under 18 years as specified at Points a, b, c and e, Clause 1 of this Article, upon receiving a drug addiction certification, shall register voluntary drug detoxification under Article 28 of this Law or register opioid substitution treatment in case of addiction to opiate substances with the commune-level People's Committee of the place of residence. 6. The Government shall provide for medical facilities eligible for drug dependence diagnosis; dossiers, order and procedures for drug dependence diagnosis. 7. The Minister of Health shall provide for criteria for diagnosis and professional procedures for determining drug dependence. 8. The State shall provide funding for drug dependence diagnosis in the cases specified in Points a, b, c and dd Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@28: Drug rehabilitation measures 1. Drug detoxication measures include: a/Voluntary drug detoxification; b) Compulsory drug rehabilitation. 2. Voluntary drug detoxification measures shall be taken at families, communities or drug detoxification establishments; compulsory drug detoxification measures shall be taken at public drug detoxification establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@29: Drug withdrawal process 1. The drug detoxication process shall cover the following stages: a) Receive and classify the documents; b) Treatment of seizures, detoxication, treatment of mental disorders, treatment of other pathologies; c) Behavior and personality education, counseling and rehabilitation; d) Therapeutic labor, vocational training; dd) Prepare for community re-integration. 2. The compulsory drug detoxification must ensure all the stages specified in Clause 1 of this Article; the voluntary drug detoxification must ensure the completion of all 3 stages specified at Points a, b and c, Clause 1 of this Article. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@30: Family-or community-based voluntary drug rehabilitation 1. Voluntary drug rehabilitation in family and community means the voluntary drug rehabilitation in family and community with professional support of organizations and individuals providing drug rehabilitation services, coordination and assistance of family and community and under the management of commune-level People's Committees. 2. The duration of voluntary drug detoxification in families or communities is between full 6 months and 12 months. 3. Family-or community-based voluntary drug detoxicators, when completing at least 3 stages specified at Points a, b and c, Clause 1, Article 29 of this Law, are entitled to financial support. 4. The voluntary drug detoxicators in their families or communities shall have the following responsibilities : a/To strictly and fully comply with regulations on voluntary drug detoxification and professional agencies' guidance; b) Pay the costs related to drug rehabilitation as prescribed. 5. Chairpersons of commune-level People's Committees shall : a/To receive registrations of voluntary drug detoxification in families or communities; b/To guide and manage voluntary drug detoxicators in their families or communities; c/Grant of certificates of completion of voluntary drug detoxification in families or communities. 6. Chairpersons of district-level People's Committees shall assume the following responsibilities: 1. Undertake and manage the tasks assigned by the Chairperson of district-level People's Committee; a/To assign local public non-business units under their management to provide voluntary drug detoxification services in families and communities; b/To receive registrations and publicize a list of organizations and individuals eligible to provide voluntary drug detoxification services in families and communities; c/Notify commune-level People's Committees of lists of organizations and individuals providing voluntary drug detoxification services in families or communities; d/Allocate funds to support the voluntary drug detoxification in families and communities; e/To direct, guide and inspect the voluntary drug detoxification in families and communities. 7. Drug detoxification establishments, organizations and individuals that are eligible for providing one or many detoxification activities according to the drug detoxification process prescribed in Clause 1, Article 29 of this Law may provide voluntary drug detoxification services in families or communities and have the following responsibilities: a/To receive and provide voluntary drug detoxification services in families and communities; b) Comply with professional procedures as prescribed by competent authorities; c/Within 5 working days after the drug detoxicators use the services or terminate the services without permission or complete the services, they must notify such to the commune-level People's Committees of the localities where they have registered for voluntary drug detoxication in their families or communities. 8. Eligible organizations and individuals may register the provision of voluntary drug detoxification services in families or communities with district-level People's Committee presidents. 9. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@31: Voluntary drug rehabilitation at drug rehabilitation centers 1. The duration of voluntary drug detoxification at drug detoxification establishments ranges from full 6 months to 12 months. 2. Voluntary drug detoxicators at drug detoxication establishments, when completing at least 3 stages prescribed at Points a, b and c, Clause 1, Article 29 of this Law, shall be provided with financial support. 3. Voluntary drug detoxicators at drug detoxication establishments shall have the following responsibilities : a/To strictly and fully comply with regulations on voluntary drug detoxification and professional agencies' guidance; b) Pay the costs related to drug rehabilitation as prescribed. In cases where the voluntary drug detoxicators at public drug detoxication establishments meet with difficulties, they shall be considered for reduction or exemption of payable expenses. 4. Drug detoxication establishments shall have to grant certificates of voluntary drug detoxication completion to drug detoxicators. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@32: Subjects to be applied administrative handling measure sending to compulsory detoxification establishments Drug addicts aged full 18 years or older shall be administratively handled by the application of the measure of consignment to compulsory detoxication establishments according to the provisions of the Law on Handling of Administrative Violations when falling into one of the following cases : 1. Failing to register, implement or voluntarily terminate voluntary drug detoxification; 2. During the voluntary drug detoxification, they are detected to have illegally used narcotic substances; 3. The opioid addicts do not register, do not perform or arbitrarily terminate the addiction treatment for opioid substances with substitution drugs or are terminated the addiction treatment for opioid substances with substitution drugs due to violation of regulations on addiction treatment; 4. Relapse into addiction during the post-detoxification management period.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@33: Drug rehabilitation for persons aged between full 12 and under 18 1. Drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 years shall be consigned to compulsory rehabilitation establishments when falling into one of the following cases : a) Failure to register, implement or voluntarily terminate drug rehabilitation; b) During the voluntary drug rehabilitation, the drug user is found to have illegally used the drug; c) The opioid dependence is not registered, not treated or voluntarily stopped the treatment of opioid dependence with substitution drugs or stopped the treatment of opioid dependence with substitution drugs due to violations of regulations on addiction treatment. 2. Drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 years, who are consigned to compulsory rehabilitation establishments, shall have the following responsibilities : a/To observe regulations on compulsory drug detoxification, internal rules and regulations, and submit to the management, education and treatment by compulsory detoxification establishments; b) Participate in activities of treatment, medical treatment, education, counseling, general education, vocational training, occupational therapy and activities of behavior and personality rehabilitation. 3. The compulsory rehabilitation duration for drug addicts aged between full 12 years and under 18 years is between full 6 months and 12 months. 4. The sending of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 years into compulsory detoxication establishments shall be decided by district-level People's Courts and are not administrative handling measures. 5. The National Assembly Standing Committee shall prescribe the order and procedures for the People's Courts to consider and decide on the consigning of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 years into compulsory rehabilitation establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@34: - To compile dossiers proposing the consignment of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 to compulsory rehabilitation establishments. 1. The compilation of dossiers proposing the consignment of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 to compulsory rehabilitation establishments shall be effected as follows : a) The President of the commune-level People's Committee where such person resides or commits violation in case of unable to identify his/her residence place shall make dossier to request sending to compulsory detoxification establishment; b) In case the drug addicts are detected by district-or provincial-level police or during the investigation and handling of violations of law, if they are persons aged between full 12 and under 18 and subject to being sent to compulsory detoxification establishments, the police agencies handling the cases shall verify, collect documents and compile dossiers proposing for sending such persons to compulsory detoxification establishments; c) The application shall include the violation record, curriculum vitae, documents proving the current drug dependence of the drug abuser, the statement of the drug abuser or his/her legal representative, opinions of the drug abuser's parent, guardian or legal representative; d) Commune-level police offices shall assist chairpersons of People's Committees of the same level in collecting documents and compiling dossiers of request specified at Point a, Clause 1 of this Article. 2. Agencies, persons making proposal dossiers specified in clause 1 of this Article must be responsible for legality of proposal dossiers. After completing making proposal dossiers, agencies, persons making dossiers must notify in writing to persons subject to proposal on application of measure sending to compulsory detoxification establishments, their parents, guardians or legal representatives about making dossiers. These persons have right to read dossiers and write opinions about making dossiers within 03 working days after receiving notice. 3. Within 01 working day after the expiration of time limit for reading dossier, the agency or person that has made dossier shall send it to the head of Division of Labor-Invalids and Social Affairs of district level where the person subject to the application resides or commits violation in case of unidentified residence. Within 02 working days after receiving dossier, the head of Division of Labor-Invalids and Social Affairs of district level decides to transfer dossier to request the district-level People's Court to decide on sending to compulsory detoxification establishment. If dossier is not complete, the head of Division of Labor-Invalids and Social Affairs of district level shall transfer it to the agency or person that has made dossier for supplementation of dossier, the time limit for supplementation is 02 working days after receiving back dossier. Within 02 working days after receiving supplemented dossier, the head of Division of Labor-Invalids and Social Affairs of district level decides to transfer dossier to request the district-level People's Court to decide on sending to compulsory detoxification establishment. 4. Dossier proposing the district-level People's Court to consider and decide on sending to compulsory detoxification establishments includes: a) A written request for sending to compulsory detoxification establishments; a) Dossier requesting for sending to compulsory detoxification establishments specified in point c clause 1 of this Article; b) Document of the Head of district-level Division of Labor, Invalids and Social Affairs on requesting consideration for sending to compulsory detoxification establishments. The written opinions of the head of the district-level Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs Section must state opinions on the protection of children's rights. 5. Dossiers of application for consignment to compulsory rehabilitation establishments of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 years must be filled in with book entries and archived according to the law provisions on archive. 6. The Government shall provide guidelines for making application for sending drug addicts aged from 12 to under 18 to compulsory rehabilitation centers; drug rehabilitation regimes applicable to persons aged from 12 to under 18.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@35: Public drug rehabilitation centers 1. Public drug detoxication establishments shall be set up under decisions of the presidents of the provincial-level People's Committees. 2. Public drug detoxication establishments must arrange the following quarters : a) Temporary accommodation for persons proposed for determination of drug addiction status and persons during the time of making dossier proposing for application of administrative handling measure sending to compulsory detoxification establishments; b/Compulsory drug detoxification zones; c/Voluntary drug detoxification zones; d/Remedies for persons aged between full 12 and under 18 years; e/Remedies for persons suffering from group-A or group-B infectious diseases under the Law on Prevention and Control of Infectious Diseases; f/Detoxification zones for persons who commit acts of disturbing order or violating internal rules and regulations of drug detoxication establishments. 3. In the areas specified in Clause 2 of this Article, there must be separate areas for men and separate areas for women. Those who have differences between their entities and gender stated in their dossiers and résumés shall be managed in separate rooms in the areas according to the gender expressed on the trainees' entities. 4. Activities of public drug detoxication establishments include: a/To receive and organize drug detoxification for drug addicts sent to compulsory detoxification establishments and drug addicts voluntarily detoxified; b) Determine the drug dependence; c) Receive, manage, educate, counsel, treat withdrawal syndrome, mental disorders and other diseases for persons who are in the period of making dossiers proposing sending to compulsory detoxification establishments. 5. Public drug detoxication establishments shall have the following rights : a/To admit drug addicts for voluntary rehabilitation suitable to the detoxication establishments' capacity of admission; b/Heads of public drug detoxication establishments may decide to apply appropriate measures to manage, educate and treat drug detoxicators. 6. Public drug detoxication establishments shall have the following responsibilities : a/To comply with regulations on identification of drug addiction, drug detoxification process and management of persons who are in the process of compiling dossiers of request for consignment to compulsory detoxification establishments; b/To respect the lives, health, honor, dignity and property of drug detoxicators, persons proposed for determination of drug addiction and persons who are in the process of compiling dossiers of request for consignment to compulsory detoxication establishments; c/To ensure the rights of drug addicts during the detoxication period and grant certificates of completion of compulsory drug detoxication to persons aged between full 12 and under 18 years; d/Heads of public drug detoxification establishments shall ensure operation conditions of drug detoxification establishments; and publicly post up drug detoxification expenses at their establishments in accordance with law; dd) Prevent and stop the smuggling of drugs into the facility; e/Within 5 working days after a voluntary drug detoxicator is received or stops using services without permission or completes the detoxication process, notify such to the commune-level People's Committee of the locality where he/she registers voluntary drug detoxication. 7. The Government shall prescribe the conditions on material foundations, equipment, facilities and personnel of public drug detoxication establishments and the management regime at such establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@36: Voluntary drug rehabilitation centers 1. Voluntary drug detoxication establishments shall be set up by individuals or organizations providing drug detoxication services. The Government shall prescribe the conditions, competence, order and procedures for granting and withdrawing operation permits of voluntary drug detoxication establishments. 2. Voluntary drug detoxication establishments shall have the following rights : a/To admit drug addicts for voluntary rehabilitation suitable to the detoxication establishments' capacity of admission; b/To collect drug detoxication-related expenses; c) Enjoy preferential treatment as prescribed by law. 3. Voluntary drug detoxification establishments have the following responsibilities : a/To observe the drug detoxication process; b/To respect the life, health, honor, dignity and property of drug detoxicators; c/Ensuring the rights of drug addicts aged between full 12 and under 18 in the rehabilitation period; d/Heads of drug detoxication establishments shall have to ensure the conditions for operation of drug detoxication establishments; publicly post up drug detoxication-related expenses at their establishments according to law provisions; dd) Prevent and stop the smuggling of drugs into the facility; e) Arrange separate areas or rooms when admitting persons aged from 12 to under 18 years, persons suffering from group-A and group-B communicable diseases as prescribed in the Law on prevention and control of communicable diseases, and women; persons whose identity and gender are different from those specified in their applications and résumés shall be managed in separate rooms in the area according to the gender of the learners; g/Within 5 working days after receiving drug detoxicators or terminating the use of services or completing the drug detoxication process without permission, notify such to commune-level People's Committees of localities where such persons register voluntary drug detoxication.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@37: To apply drug detoxification measures to Vietnamese expellees who are returned home by foreign countries for illegal use of narcotics or drug addiction; and foreigners addicted to drugs and living in Vietnam 1. When returning home, Vietnamese expellees who are deported to Vietnam for illegal use of narcotic substances or drug addiction shall be determined as drug addicts. If they are determined as drug addicts, they shall take drug detoxification measures under this Law. 2. Foreigners who are addicted to drugs and live in Vietnam shall register for voluntary drug detoxification at drug detoxification establishments under this Law and pay all detoxification-related expenses. In case of non-voluntary drug detoxification, these foreigners shall be handled in accordance with law.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@38: Drug rehabilitation for detainees, prisoners, inmates of compulsory education establishments and reformatory inmates 1. The State shall apply appropriate detoxication measures to drug addicts being detainees, prisoners, compulsory education camp inmates and reformatory pupils. 2. Superintendents of prisons, detention camps, heads of custody houses, directors of compulsory education establishments and principals of reformatories shall closely coordinate with local health establishments in implementing the provisions of Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@39: Persons aged between full 14 and under 18 years who are undergoing compulsory drug detoxification shall be exempt from serving the remaining duration stated in decisions on consignment to compulsory detoxification establishments. Persons aged between full 14 and under 18 who are undergoing compulsory drug detoxification and are detected as committing criminal acts before or during the time of serving compulsory drug detoxification decisions and sentenced to imprisonment by courts but not entitled to suspended sentence shall be exempt from serving the remaining duration stated in decisions on consignment to compulsory detoxification establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@40: Post-detoxification management at the residence 1. Persons who have completed voluntary drug detoxification, completed treatment of opioid substitution addiction and persons aged between full 12 and under 18 who have completely served the decisions on consigning them to compulsory detoxification establishments shall be subject to post-detoxification management for one year after completing the detoxification or serving the decisions. 2. Persons who have completely served the decisions on application of administrative handling measures of consigning them to compulsory detoxification establishments shall be subject to post-detoxification management for 2 years after the date of completely serving the decisions. 3. Contents of post-detoxification management include: a/To make a list of persons subject to post-detoxification supervision; b) Provide counseling and help in drug addiction relapse prevention; c) Monitor, detect and prevent illegal use of narcotic substances. 4. Social support during the post-detoxification management period includes: a) Support for general education for persons aged between full 12 and under 18 years; b) Support in vocational training, loans, job seeking and participation in social activities to integrate into the community. 5. Chairpersons of commune-level People's Committees shall issue decisions and organize post-detoxification social support and management. 6. The Government shall provide for dossiers, order, procedures, management regimes and support policies for persons subject to post-detoxification drug management.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@41: Intervention to reduce harm to illegal drug users and drug addicts 1. Intervention measures to reduce harm to illegal drug users and drug addicts are measures to reduce harm related to illegal drug use to the individuals, families and communities. 2. Intervention measures to reduce harms to illegal drug users and drug addicts include: a) Treatment of addiction to opiate substances with substitution drugs; b) Other measures as prescribed by the Government.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@42: Responsibilities of drug addicts' families and communities 1. The family of a drug addicts shall have the following responsibilities: a) Assist drug addicts during and after drug rehabilitation and community integration; b) Cooperate with competent authorities and persons in preparing application for compulsory drug rehabilitation; cooperate with relevant authorities and units in supporting drug addicts during the process of drug rehabilitation, post-rehabilitation supervision and community integration. 2. Communities where drug addicts reside have the following responsibilities: a) Encourage and assist drug addicts; b) Cooperate with relevant agencies, organizations and units in supporting drug addicts during the detoxification process, post-detoxification management and community integration.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@43: Making a list of drug addicts and persons under post-rehabilitation supervision 1. Commune-level police offices shall assist People's Committees of the same level in making lists of drug addicts and persons subject to post-detoxification management who reside in their localities. 2. When a drug addict or a person under post-rehabilitation supervision changes his/her place of residence, the commune-level police office of the place of departure shall notify the commune-level police office of the place of destination within 5 working days after such person moves out of the locality for listing and coordinated management. 3. Commune-level police offices shall assist People's Committees of the same level in removing drug addicts and persons under post-detoxification management from the list in the following cases : a) During the post-detoxification management period specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 Article 40 of this Law, the drug user is not found to have illegally used the narcotic; b) Drug addicts, persons who are managed after rehabilitation and have to serve prison sentences; c) Drug addicts, persons under post-rehabilitation supervision who move to reside in other localities; d) The drug addicts or the persons under post-rehabilitation supervision die or are declared missing by the Court.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@44: Contents of state management of drug prevention and fight 1. Formulating, and organizing the implementation of, strategies, guidelines, policies and plans on drug prevention and combat. 2. Promulgating, and organizing the implementation of, legal documents on drug prevention and combat. 3. Organizing the apparatus, training and fostering of drug prevention and fight personnel. 4. To control lawful drug-related activities. 5. Carry out drug rehabilitation and post-rehabilitation supervision. 6. Organizing drug prevention and fight. 7. To make state statistics on drug prevention and combat. 8. To organize research into and application of scientific and technological advances to drug prevention and combat. 9. To organize propaganda and education about drug prevention and combat. 10. To enter into international cooperation on drug prevention and combat. 11. To commend, examine, inspect, settle complaints and denunciations, and handle violations of the law on drug prevention and combat.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@45: State management responsibilities for drug prevention and fight 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of drug prevention and combat. 2. The Ministry of Public Security shall act as the focal point to assist the Government in performing the state management of drug prevention and combat. 3. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and government-attached agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, implement and coordinate with concerned agencies and organizations in drug prevention and combat. 4. People's Committees at all levels shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the state management of drug prevention and combat in their localities.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@46: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Public Security 1. To promulgate according to its competence or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation legal documents on drug prevention and combat. 2. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with related agencies and organizations in, drug prevention and combat; to receive and process drug-related criminal information; to control lawful drug-related activities according to its competence. 3. Organize the assessment of narcotic substances and precursors. 4. To train and retrain persons engaged in drug-related investigation, prevention and combat. 5. Provide guidance on making the list of illegal drug users, drug addicts and drug detoxified persons. 6. To assume the prime responsibility for making state statistics on drug prevention and combat; to manage information on drug-related crimes, illegal drug users, drug addicts and persons under post-detoxification management and results of control of lawful drug-related activities. 7. To carry out international cooperation on drug prevention and combat.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@47: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs 1. To promulgate according to its competence or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation legal documents on drug prevention and combat. 2. To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with concerned agencies and organizations and local administrations in, guiding the organization of voluntary drug detoxification in families and communities, drug detoxification in drug detoxification establishments and post-detoxification management. 3. To guide the setting up, dissolution and organization of operation of public drug detoxication establishments. 4. Provide training for drug detoxification and post-detoxification management officers. 5. To guide and direct the dissemination and education of drug prevention and fight within the system of vocational education institutions. 6. To carry out international cooperation on drug detoxication. 7. To make statistics on drug addicts undergoing voluntary drug detoxification in their families or communities or detoxification at drug detoxification establishments.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@48: Responsibilities of the Ministry of National Defense 1. To promulgate according to its competence or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation legal documents on drug prevention and combat. 2. To organize the implementation of drug prevention and combat plans in land border areas, sea areas, contiguous zones, exclusive economic zones and continental shelf. 3. To direct the Border Guard and Vietnam Coast Guard to assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with related agencies and organizations and functional forces in, receiving and processing drug-related criminal information, detecting, preventing and combating drug-related violations, and controlling lawful drug-related activities in the areas and localities specified in Clause 2 of this Article in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 4. To train and retrain full-time drug crime prevention and combat officers of the Vietnam Border Guard and Coast Guard. 5. To make statistics on drug addicts in prisons, detention camps and custody houses managed by the Ministry of Defense.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@49: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Health 1. To promulgate according to its competence or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation legal documents on drug prevention and combat. 2. To conduct research into detoxication drugs and methods; to grant and withdraw permits for circulation of drugs and detoxication methods; to provide human and medical technical support for drug detoxication. 3. To make statistics on persons participating in treatment of addiction to opiate substances with substitution drugs.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@50: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Finance To direct customs offices in drug prevention and combat activities in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@51: Principles of international cooperation on drug prevention and combat 1. The Vietnamese State shall implement treaties on drug prevention and combat and other relevant treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party on the principle of respect for independence, sovereignty, territorial integrity and mutual benefits; and cooperate with other countries, international organizations and foreign organizations and individuals in drug prevention and combat activities. 2. Based on treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party, this Law and other relevant laws and concluded international agreements, competent Vietnamese agencies shall implement cooperation programs on drug prevention and combat with concerned agencies of other countries, international organizations and foreign organizations and individuals.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@52: International cooperation policy on drug prevention and combat The Vietnamese State implements multilateral and bilateral international cooperation policies in the drug prevention and combat on the principle of respect for national independence and sovereignty with other countries; encourages international organizations, foreign organizations and individuals to cooperate with Vietnamese agencies and organizations in mutual support in material foundations, enhancement of legal capacity, information, training and medical technologies for drug prevention and combat activities.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@53: Controlled transfer of goods The State of Vietnam shall comply with the request for controlled goods transfer on the basis of international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party in order to detect and examine the criminal liability of drug offenders. The decision to apply and carry out this measure shall comply with the agreement between competent agencies of Vietnam and the concerned countries.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@54: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2022. 2. The Law on Drug Prevention and Fight No. 23/2000/QH10, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 16/2008/QH12, ceases to be effective on the effective date of this Law.
Luật Phòng, chống ma túy@55: Transitional provisions 1. From the effective date of this Law: a) The person who is undergoing voluntary drug rehabilitation at home, community or rehabilitation center shall continue to undergo voluntary drug rehabilitation until the end of the registered period in accordance with the Law on Drug Prevention and Fight No. 23/2000/QH10, amended and supplemented by the Law No. 16/2008/QH12, and shall be managed after drug rehabilitation as prescribed in this Law; b) The person who is under post-detoxification management shall continue to comply with the decision on post-detoxification management until the end of the post-detoxification management period as prescribed in the Law on Drug Prevention and Fight No. 23/2000/QH10, amended and supplemented by the Law No. 16/2008/QH12. If the person who is under post-detoxification management and is full 18 years old from the effective date of this Law relapses into addiction, he/she shall be administratively handled by sending him/her to a compulsory detoxification establishment; c/Persons who are serving decisions on compulsory community-based drug rehabilitation under Law No. 23/2000/QH10 on Drug Prevention and Fight, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 16/2008/QH12, may register voluntary drug rehabilitation under this Law. The duration of serving the decisions on compulsory community-based drug rehabilitation shall be counted into the duration of voluntary drug rehabilitation; d/Persons subject to compulsory consignment to compulsory detoxification establishments under Law No. 23/2000/QH10 on Drug Prevention and Fight, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 16/2008/QH12, who are in the process of compiling dossiers of consignment to compulsory detoxification establishments, shall be detoxified under this Law; dd) The license related to the legal drug-related activities that has been issued shall be used until the expiry date written on the license. 2. Within 2 years after this Law takes effect, compulsory drug detoxification establishments set up under Law No. 23/2000/QH10 on Drug Prevention and Fight, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 16/2008/QH12, must fully satisfy the conditions on public drug detoxification establishments under this Law. Other drug detoxification establishments defined in Law No. 23/2000/QH10 on Drug Prevention and Fight, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 16/2008/QH12, which were licensed before the effective date of this Law, may continue operating until the expiration of their licenses. Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@1: Scope This Law provides for environmental protection activities; rights, obligations and responsibilities of agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals in environmental protection activities.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@2: Subjects of application This Law applies to agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, including mainland, islands, sea, underground and airspace.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Environment includes natural and artificial material elements closely interrelated, surrounding people, affecting life, economy, society, existence and development of people, organisms and nature. 2. Environmental protection activities mean activities of preventing and limiting adverse impacts on the environment; responding to environmental incidents; remedying environmental pollution and degradation, improving environmental quality; rationally using natural resources and biodiversity and responding to climate change. 3. Environmental components refer to physical elements that form the environment, including soil, water, air, organisms, sound, light and other physical forms. 4. National EPP means the arrangement and orientation of zoning space for environmental quality management, nature and biodiversity conservation, waste management, environmental monitoring and warning in a specified territory to protect the environment and serve the national sustainable development objectives for a specified period. 5. Strategic environmental assessment means the process of identifying and forecasting the trends of major environmental issues, serving as a basis for integrating environmental protection solutions in policies, strategies and master plans. 6. Preliminary environmental impact assessment means the consideration and identification of major environmental issues of an investment project in the pre-feasibility study or project implementation proposal stage. 7. Environmental impact assessment means the process of analyzing, assessing, identifying and forecasting environmental impacts of investment projects and taking measures to minimize adverse environmental impacts. 8. Environmental license means a document issued by a competent state management agency to an organization or individual engaged in production, business or service activities and permitted to discharge waste into the environment, manage waste or import scrap from abroad for use as production raw materials, enclosed with environmental protection requirements and conditions as prescribed by law. 9. Environmental registration means the registration by investment project owners or production, business or service establishments with state management agencies of contents related to the discharge of wastes and environmental protection measures of investment projects or production, business or service establishments (below collectively referred to as investment projects or establishments). 10. Environmental technical regulations mean regulations on compulsory application of limits of parameters on environmental quality, content of pollutants contained in raw materials, fuels, materials, equipment, products, goods and wastes, and technical and managerial requirements promulgated by competent state agencies under the law on standards and technical regulations. 11. Environmental standards means regulations voluntarily applying the limits of parameters on environmental quality, the content of pollutants in wastes, technical and managerial requirements, which are announced by competent state agencies or organizations according to the provisions of law on standards and technical regulations. 12. Environmental pollution means a change in physical, chemical and biological properties of environmental components which is not conformable with environmental technical regulations and standards, causing adverse impacts on human health, organisms and nature. 13. Environmental degradation refers to a decrease in quality and quantity of environmental components which causes adverse effects on human, biological and natural health. 14. Environmental emergencies mean accidents that occur during human activities or due to abnormal changes of nature, causing serious environmental pollution and degradation. 15. Pollutants mean chemical substances or physical and biological agents which, when appearing in the environment in excess of the permitted level, will cause environmental pollution. 16. persistent pollutants are highly toxic, difficult to degrade, capable of bioaccumulating and spreading in the environment, causing adverse impacts on the environment and human health. 17. POPs are POPs specified in Stockholm Convention on POPs (hereinafter referred to as Stockholm Convention). 18. Waste means material in solid, liquid, gaseous or other forms discharged from production, business, service, daily-life activities or other activities. 19. Solid waste means waste in solid form or waste sludge. 20. Hazardous waste means waste containing toxic, radioactive, infectious, inflammable, explosive, corrosive, toxic or other hazardous elements. 21. Waste co-treatment means the combination of an existing production process for recycling, treatment and recovery of energy from waste, in which waste is used as raw materials, materials and substitute fuels or treated. 22. Pollution control refers to the process of preventing, detecting, stopping and treating pollution. 23. Environment's load-bearing capacity means the limit of the environment's tolerance to the impacting factors so that the environment can recover on its own. 24. Environmental protection infrastructure includes the system of collecting, storing, transporting, treating waste, observing the environment and other environmental protection works. 25. Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@4: Principles of environmental protection 1. Environmental protection is the rights, obligations and responsibilities of all agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals. 2. Environmental protection is a condition, foundation and central and prerequisite element for sustainable socio-economic development. Environmental protection activities must be associated with economic development and natural resource management and considered and assessed in the course of development activities. 3. Environmental protection must be harmoniously associated with social security, children's rights and gender equality, ensuring the rights of all people to live in a clean environment. 4. Environmental protection activities must be carried out regularly, publicly and transparently; prioritize the forecast and prevention of environmental pollution, incidents and degradation, environmental risk management, minimization of waste generation, and intensification of waste reuse and recycling to exploit the value of waste resources. 5. Environmental protection must conform to natural, cultural and historical rules and characteristics, market mechanism and socio-economic development level; promote development of ethnic minority and mountainous areas. 6. Agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals benefiting from the environment are obliged to make financial contributions to environmental protection activities; if causing environmental pollution, incidents and degradation, they shall pay, pay damages, remedy, handle and bear other responsibilities in accordance with law. 7. Environmental protection activities must not cause harms to national sovereignty, security and interests, and must be associated with regional and global environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@5: State policies on environmental protection 1. Facilitating agencies, organizations, residential communities, households and individuals to participate in implementation, inspection and supervision of environmental protection activities. 2. Propagating and educating in combination with administrative, economic and other measures to enhance the compliance with the law on environmental protection, building the culture of environmental protection. 3. To attach importance to biodiversity conservation and protection of the environment of natural heritages; to rationally and economically exploit and use natural resources; to develop clean and renewable energies; to develop technical infrastructure for environmental protection. 4. Prioritize the treatment of environmental pollution, restoration of degraded natural ecosystems, and attach importance to the protection of the environment in residential areas. 5. To diversify investment capital sources for environmental protection; to allocate separate state budget expenditures for environmental protection at an increasing rate according to state budget capacity and environmental protection requirements and tasks; to prioritize funds for key environmental protection tasks. 6. Ensure the interests of organizations, residential communities, households and individuals contributing to environmental protection activities; provide incentives and support for environmental protection activities; promote eco-friendly products and services. 7. Intensify scientific research and development of pollution treatment, recycling and waste treatment technologies; give priority to transfer and application of advanced, high and eco-friendly technologies and the best existing techniques; intensify training of human resources in environmental protection. 8. Commend and reward agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals that make positive contributions to environmental protection activities in accordance with law. 9. Expanding and enhancing international integration and cooperation and implementing international commitments on environmental protection. 10. To screen investment projects according to environmental criteria; to apply appropriate environmental management tools in each stage of investment strategies, master plans, programs and projects. 11. Integrate and promote circular economy and green economy models in the formulation and implementation of socio-economic development strategies, planning, plans, programs, schemes and projects.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@6: Prohibited acts in environmental protection activities 1. Transport, bury, dump, discharge, burn solid waste and hazardous waste against technical procedures and regulations of law on environmental protection. 2. Discharge untreated wastewater and exhaust gases to the environment in accordance with environmental standards. 3. Spread or release into the environment toxic substances and toxic viruses that are capable of infecting humans, animals and unverified microorganisms, dead animals due to epidemics and other agents harmful to human health, living creatures and nature. 4. Causing noise and vibration in excess of the permitted level under the environmental technical regulations; discharging smoke, dust and toxic odorous gas into the air. 5. Executing investment projects or discharging waste when failing to fully satisfy the conditions prescribed by the law on environmental protection. 6. Import, temporary import for re-export and transit of wastes from abroad in any form. 7. Illegally importing used vehicles, machinery and equipment for dismantlement or recycling. 8. Failing to implement works, measures, activities of prevention, response and remedy of environmental incidents as prescribed by law on environmental protection and other relevant provisions of law. 9. Concealing acts of causing environmental pollution, obstructing, falsifying information, deceiving in environmental protection activities, thus causing bad consequences to the environment. 10. Manufacturing and trading products that cause harm to human health, organisms and nature; manufacturing and using raw materials and building materials that contain hazardous elements beyond the permissible limits prescribed in environmental technical regulations. 11. Manufacturing, importing, temporarily importing, re-exporting and consuming ozone layer-depleting substances under treaties on ozone layer-depleting substances to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. 12. Ruin and illegally occupy natural heritages. 13. Destroying or occupying works, equipment and means in service of environmental protection activities. 14. Abusing positions and powers to act against the law on environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@7: General provisions on protection of surface water environment 1. The quality of water, sediments and aquatic environment of surface water sources must be monitored and assessed; the load-bearing capacity of the surface water environment must be calculated, determined and announced. 2. Waste water discharged into the surface water environment must be managed in conformity with the use purpose and load-bearing capacity of the surface water environment. Results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports or environmental licenses shall not be approved for new investment projects discharging wastewater directly into the surface water environment which is no longer load-bearing as announced by competent state agencies, except for cases in which investment project owners have wastewater treatment plans up to environmental technical regulations on surface water quality before discharging wastewater into the receiving environment or plans on circulation and reuse of wastewater so as not to generate more wastewater or cases in which investment projects on pollution treatment, environmental improvement, rehabilitation and improvement in polluted areas. 3. The protection of river water environment must be based on the integrated management approach according to basins, must be associated with the conservation of biodiversity, protection of aquatic environment, management of water source protection corridors, rational exploitation and use of water sources.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@8: Surface water environmental protection activities 1. The surface water environment protection covers the following contents : a) Make statistics, assess, minimize and treat wastewater discharged into the surface water environment; b) Monitor and assess the quality of water, sediments and aquatic environment of surface water sources and publish information serving the management, extraction and use of surface water; c) Investigate and assess the load capacity of the surface water environment; announce the areas of surface water environment no longer load-bearing capacity; assess the quota of wastewater discharge into the surface water environment; d) Pollution treatment, improvement, restoration and improvement of the surface water environment contaminated; dd) Monitor and assess the quality of surface water and river sediments across the country and share information in accordance with regulations of the Law on environmental protection, international laws and practices. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a/Guiding the assessment of the surface water environment's load-bearing capacity for rivers and lakes; guiding the assessment of the quality of the surface water environment; b/To evaluate the quality of surface water and sediments and the load-bearing capacity of surface water environment of inter-provincial rivers and lakes; to inventory and assess waste sources and pollution levels and organize the treatment of pollution of inter-provincial rivers and lakes; to formulate and submit to the Prime Minister for promulgation plans on management of the quality of surface water environment of inter-provincial rivers and lakes, which play an important role in socio-economic development and environmental protection; c/Inspect the implementation of plans on management of surface water environment quality for inter-provincial rivers and lakes and solutions to prevent and mitigate water pollution and improve water quality in inter-provincial rivers and lakes. 3.
