Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Determination of intra-provincial rivers, lakes and other surface water sources in the province that play an important role in socio-economic development and environmental protection; determination of domestic water supply protection zones, establishment of surface water protection corridors in the province; determination of aquatic habitats; b) Publicize information on sources of discharge into the surface water environment in their localities; collect information and data on the current status of the surface water environment, discharge sources and total volume of discharge into the surface water environment of inter-provincial rivers and lakes in their localities under the guidance of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment; direct the assessment of damage caused by pollution and the treatment of surface water pollution in their localities according to regulations; c) Organize activities to prevent and control sources of discharge into surface water sources in the administrative division; implement solutions to prevent and minimize surface water pollution, improve the quality of surface water in the administrative division according to the plan for management of quality of surface water; d) Organize the assessment of surface water and sediment environmental quality, assessment of load capacity and wastewater discharge quotas for surface water specified in Point a of this Clause; publish information about surface water environment in areas where the surface water is no longer load-bearing capacity; dd/To promulgate, and organize the implementation of, plans on management of surface water environmental quality of the subjects specified at Point a of this Clause; to organize the implementation of plans on management of surface water environmental quality of inter-provincial rivers and lakes in their localities.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@9: Surface water quality management plan 1. Plans on management of surface water environmental quality of inter-provincial rivers and lakes must conform to the national environmental protection planning. Plans on management of surface water environmental quality of the subjects specified at Point a, Clause 3, Article 8 of this Law must conform to the national environmental protection planning and environmental protection contents of regional and provincial master plans. 2. A plan on management of surface water environment quality covers the following principal contents : a) Assessment and forecast of changes in surface water quality; targets of the plan; determination of domestic water supply protection zone, surface water protection corridor; determination of aquatic areas; b) Practical distribution of point sources of pollution and sources of pollution generating water pollution in the impact area; risk of cross-border surface water pollution; c) Type and total amount of pollutants discharged into the surface water environment; d) Assessment of load capacity, wastewater discharge zoning and quota; determination of targets and roadmap for reduction of discharge of wastewater into the surface water environment without load capacity; dd) Measures for prevention and reduction of surface water pollution; solutions for cooperation and sharing of information and management of cross-border surface water pollution; e) Surface water protection and improvement solutions; g) Implementation. 3. Plans on management of surface water environment quality shall be elaborated for every 5 years. 4. The Government shall detail contents, order and procedures for promulgation of plans on management of surface water environmental quality.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@10: Protection of underground water environment 1. Groundwater sources must be monitored and assessed to take timely response measures when detecting environmental parameters exceeding the permissible level under the national environmental technical regulations or decrease in water level as prescribed. 2. Drilling for underground water exploration and exploitation must have measures to prevent pollution of underground water environment. 3. Establishments using hazardous chemicals, radioactive substances must have measures to ensure not to leak, disperse hazardous chemicals, radioactive substances into underground water sources. 4. Facilities, warehouses, storage yards for raw materials, fuels, chemicals, waste storage and treatment areas must be constructed to ensure technical safety, not cause pollution to underground water environment. 5. Agencies, organizations, residential communities, households and individuals that cause pollution to groundwater environment shall handle the pollution. 6. The protection of groundwater environment must comply with the provisions of this Law, the law on water resources and other relevant provisions of law. 7. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall detail the protection of groundwater environment. 8. The provincial People's Committees are responsible for the protection of groundwater environment in their areas as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@11: Protecting the sea environment 1. Waste discharged into the sea must be investigated, assessed and subject to measures to prevent, minimize, strictly control and treat to meet environmental protection requirements. 2. Areas prone to sea and island environment pollution must be assessed, determined and announced according to law provisions on natural resources and environment of sea and islands. 3. Exploitation of resources from sea and islands and other socio-economic activities must conform to the master plan and meet requirements on environmental protection and sustainable development. 4. Sea water environment protection must ensure close and effective coordination among relevant agencies, organizations and individuals; coordination between Vietnamese state agencies and foreign agencies and organizations in sharing information, assessing sea water environment quality and controlling cross-border sea environment pollution. 5. The protection of sea water environment must comply with the provisions of this Law, the law on natural resources and environment of sea and islands and other relevant laws.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@12: General provisions on air environment protection 1. Organizations, households and individuals engaged in production, business and service activities that emit dust and exhaust gases, causing adverse environmental impacts, shall mitigate and handle these emissions in accordance with law. 2. Air quality must be regularly and continuously monitored and announced in accordance with regulations of law. 3. The air pollution must be promptly reported and warned in order to minimize impacts on community health. 4. Sources of dust and emission must be monitored, assessed and controlled as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@13: Air quality management plan 1. The air quality management plan includes the national plan for air quality management and provincial plans for air quality management. The national plan for air quality management must be conformable with the national environmental protection planning. The provincial plans for air quality management must be conformable with the national plan for air quality management and provincial planning and serve as the basis for implementation and management of air quality. 2. The duration of the national air quality management plan is 05 years. The duration of the provincial-level air quality management plan is determined based on the scope and level of air pollution, management and improvement solutions and local implementation conditions and resources. 3. The national plan for air quality management shall contain at least: a) Assessment of air pollution management and control at national level; identification of main causes of air pollution; b) Overall and specific objectives; c) Air quality management tasks and solutions; d) Programs and projects prioritized for implementation of tasks and solutions; formulation of regulations on cooperation and measures for inter-regional and inter-provincial air quality management; dd) Implementation. 4. A provincial-level air environment quality management plan has the following principal contents : a) Assessment of air quality in the province; b) Air quality management; air environment monitoring; identification and assessment of main emission sources; emission inventory; air quality modeling; c) Analysis and identification of causes of air pollution; d) Assessment of impacts of air pollution on community health; dd) Air quality management objectives and scope; e) Air quality management tasks and solutions; g) Implementation. 5. The Government shall provide guidance on contents, procedures for issuance of air quality management plans.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@14: Responsibilities for air quality management 1. The Prime Minister shall promulgate and direct the implementation of the national plan on management of air environment quality; direct the implementation of urgent measures in case of serious air pollution on an inter-provincial, inter-regional and cross-border scale. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a) Formulate and submit the national plan for air quality management to the Prime Minister for promulgation and organize the implementation thereof; b) Provide guidance on formulation of provincial air quality management plans and methods for assessing air quality. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Promulgate and organize the implementation of provincial air quality management plans; b) Assess, monitor and publish information about air quality; warn residential communities and take measures to deal with air pollution that affects community health; c) Take emergency measures in case air pollution is serious in the administrative division. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@15: General provisions on land environment protection 1. Land-using plannings, plans, projects and activities must consider their impacts on the land environment, work out solutions to prevent environmental pollution and degradation, and protect the land environment. 2. Agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals using land shall protect the land environment; treat, improve and restore the land environment in areas polluted with land environment caused by them. 3. The State shall treat, improve and restore the land environment in the area of land environment pollution left by history or the organizations and individuals causing pollution cannot be identified. 4. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on the protection of the land environment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@16: Classification of land pollution areas 1. Land polluted area means an area where pollutants are present in excess of the permissible level prescribed in environmental technical regulations, causing adverse impacts on the environment and community health. 2. Land-related polluted areas shall be classified according to the criteria of polluting sources, spreading capability and affected subjects. 3. Land-related polluted areas shall be classified according to the level of pollution, including polluted areas, seriously polluted areas and particularly seriously polluted areas.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@17: Soil environmental quality management 1. The quality of the soil environment must be investigated, assessed, classified and information must be published in accordance with law. 2. Contaminated sites shall be monitored. 3. Land-related pollution areas must be surveyed, assessed, zoned off, treated, improved and restored. 4. Land areas polluted with dioxin originating from herbicide used in war, residual plant protection drugs and other toxic substances must be investigated, assessed, zoning and treated to ensure requirements on environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@18: Soil environmental treatment, improvement and remediation 1. Investigation, assessment and classification of land pollution areas, determination of causes, scope and level of pollution, treatment, improvement and remediation of land environment. 2. Implement measures to control land environment pollution including zoning, warning, prohibition or restriction of activities to minimize the impact on human health. 3. Formulate and implement plans for treatment, improvement and remediation of soil environment; prioritize treatment of areas with serious and particularly serious pollution levels. 4. Monitoring and assessment of quality of soil environment after treatment, improvement and remediation of soil environment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@19: Responsibilities for land environment protection 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall have the following responsibilities: a) Specify criteria for determining and classifying land contaminated sites according to the level of pollution; b) Take charge and cooperate with Ministries, ministerial agencies and relevant agencies in formulating and directing the implementation of plans for treatment, improvement and remediation of extremely severe land environmental pollution in the cases specified in Clause 3 Article 15 of this Law; organize investigation, assessment and publish information about land quality; c) Request the Prime Minister to promulgate the plan for treatment, improvement and remediation of extremely severe land environmental pollution in the cases specified in Clause 3 Article 15 of this Law; d) Compile the list of land polluted areas; establish and update the national environmental database and information about land polluted areas nationwide. 2. The Ministry of National Defense and the Ministry of Public Security shall take charge and cooperate with the People's Committees of provinces in dealing with, improving and remediating the contaminated sites of land for national defense, land for security purpose and other areas as prescribed by law. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Carry out investigation, assessment, identification and zoning of areas at risk of land environmental pollution, areas with land environmental pollution in the administrative division and determine responsibilities of organizations and individuals causing pollution; b) Treat the area of land pollution or seriously polluted area in the cases prescribed in Clause 3 Article 15 of this Law; c) Report to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment on areas with signs of inter-provincial land pollution, areas with particularly serious land pollution; d) Update information about the contaminated site on the environmental information system and database as prescribed.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@20: Natural heritage 1. Natural heritages include: a/National parks, nature reserves, species-habitat conservation zones and landscape protection zones established under the law on biodiversity, forestry and fisheries; scenic places recognized as cultural heritages established under the law on cultural heritages; b/Natural heritages recognized by international organizations; c/Other natural heritages established and recognized under this Law. 2. The establishment and recognition of natural heritages specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article shall be based on one of the following criteria : a) Having outstanding, unique or rare beauty of nature; b/Having typical values in the ecological and biological evolution process or natural habitats of endangered, precious, rare and endemic species or containing particular ecosystems representing a natural ecological region or other biodiversity values to be conserved; c) Have outstanding and unique geological and geomorphological characteristics or contain material traces of the development stages of the Earth; d) Being of special importance in the regulation of climate, protection of water sources, ecological balance, provision of natural ecosystem services. 3. The Government shall detail criteria, order, procedures and competence for establishing and recognizing natural heritages specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article; order, procedures and competence for nominating for recognition of natural heritages specified at Point b, Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@21: Article 11.-Contents of protection of the environment of natural heritages 1. Investigating, assessing, managing and protecting the environment of natural heritages. 2. Protection of the environment of natural heritages constitutes a content of the national planning on environmental protection, regional planning and provincial planning. 3. Agencies, organizations, communities, households and individuals shall protect natural heritages. Organizations, communities, households and individuals participating in the management and protection of the environment of natural heritages are entitled to benefits from payment for natural ecosystem services in accordance with law. 4. The Government shall elaborate Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@22: National environmental protection strategy 1. National environmental protection strategy is the basis for formulating the national environmental protection planning, integrating environmental protection requirements in socio-economic development strategies and planning. 2. The national environmental protection strategy covers the following contents : a) Viewpoints, visions and objectives; b) Tasks; c) Implementation solutions; d) Key programs, schemes and projects; dd) Plan and resources for implementation. 3. The national environmental protection strategy is formulated for a 10-year period with a 30-year vision. 4. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall formulate and submit the national environmental protection strategy to the Prime Minister for approval.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@23: National environmental protection planning 1. The national EPP shall be formulated according to regulations of law on planning and the following bases: a) National environmental protection strategy in the same development stage; b) Climate change scenarios in the same development stage. 2. Contents of the national EPP; formulation, appraisal, approval and adjustment of the national EPP, period of the national EPP shall comply with regulations of law on planning. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall organize the formulation of the national environmental protection planning. 4. The Government shall provide for the determination of environmental zoning in the national environmental protection planning.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@24: Environmental protection contents of regional planning and provincial planning 1. Environmental protection contents of regional planning and provincial planning must comply with regulations of law on planning. 2. The Government shall provide for determination of environmental zoning in provincial planning. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall formulate contents of environmental protection in the regional planning; provide guidelines for formulation of contents of environmental protection in the provincial planning. 3. Provincial environmental protection authorities shall formulate environmental protection contents in provincial planning.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@25: Subjects of strategic environmental assessment 1. National strategy for exploitation and use of natural resources. 2. National comprehensive planning; national marine spatial planning; national land use planning; regional planning; provincial planning; special administrative - economic unit planning. 3. National and regional sector development strategies, national sector planning and planning with technical and specialized characteristics that have great impacts on the environment on the list prescribed by the Government. 4. Adjustments to objectives of the planning are specified in Clauses 2 and 3 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@26: Conduct strategic environmental assessment 1. Agencies and organizations assigned to formulate strategies and master plans specified in Article 25 of this Law shall conduct strategic environmental assessment concurrently with the formulation of such strategies and master plans. 2. Results of strategic environmental assessment of the strategy prescribed in Clause 1 and Clause 3 Article 25 hereof shall be integrated into the application for approval for the strategy. 3. The strategic environmental assessment result of the planning prescribed in Clause 2 and Clause 3 Article 25 of this Law shall be made into a separate report enclosed with the application for planning appraisal. 4. The authority in charge of planning appraisal shall appraise the strategic environmental assessment result during the appraisal of the planning. The authority approving the strategy shall consider the strategic environmental assessment result during the approval process. 5. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall give its written opinions on contents of strategic environmental assessment of the strategy or master plan. 6. Strategic environmental assessment results serve as a basis for competent agencies to consider and approve strategies and master plans.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@27: SECTIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONTENTS 1. Strategic environmental assessment contents of a strategy cover : a) Assessment of conformity of the strategy's environmental protection-related policies with the viewpoints, objectives and policies on environmental protection and sustainable development, international treaties on environmental protection to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory and with this Law; b) Proposing plans for modification and completion of the strategy to ensure the conformity with the viewpoints, objectives and policies on environmental protection and sustainable development, international treaties on environmental protection to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory and in accordance with this Law. 2. Strategic environmental assessment of a master plan covers the following contents: a) The planning contents that may affect the environment; b) Scope of strategic environmental assessment; c) The environmental components and natural heritages that may be affected by the planning; d) Applied strategic environmental assessment methods; dd) Comparison and assessment of conformity of planning viewpoints and objectives with environmental protection viewpoints, objectives and policies, national environmental protection strategy and planning, and environmental protection contents of the regional planning and provincial planning; e) Results of identification of positive and negative main environmental issues of the planning; g) Impacts of climate change; h) Results of forecasting of positive and negative trends of major environmental issues during the implementation of the planning; solutions for maintaining positive trends and minimizing negative trends of major environmental issues; i) Orientations for environmental protection during the implementation of the planning; k) Results of consultation with relevant parties during the SEA; l) The issues to be noted on environmental protection (if any), proposed remedial directions and solutions. 3. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@28: Environmental criteria for classifying investment projects 1. Environmental criteria for classifying investment projects include: a) Scale, capacity, type of production, business and services; b) Land area, land with water surface, sea area; scale of natural resources exploitation; c) Environmentally sensitive factors include residential areas; water sources used for domestic water supply; nature reserves as prescribed by law on biodiversity, fisheries; forests as prescribed by law on forestry; tangible cultural heritage, other natural heritage; wet rice land from 02 harvests or more; important wetlands; relocation and resettlement requirements and other environmentally sensitive factors. 2. Based on the environmental criteria specified in Clause 1 of this Article, investment projects are classified into groups I, II, III and IV. 3. Group-I investment projects are those at high risk of adverse environmental impacts, including : a) Projects in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with large scale and capacity; projects to perform services of hazardous waste treatment; projects with import of scrap from foreign countries for use as raw production materials; b) Projects in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with medium scale and capacity but with sensitive elements of environment; projects not in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with large scale and capacity but with sensitive elements of environment; c) Projects using land, land with water surface, sea areas with large scale or medium scale but with sensitive elements on environment; d) Mineral and water resource extraction projects with large scale and capacity or medium scale and capacity but with sensitive environmental factors; dd) Projects that require the conversion of land use purpose with average scale or more but have sensitive elements on environment; e) Projects requiring large-scale relocation and resettlement. 4. Group-II investment projects are those which are likely to adversely affect the environment, except for those specified in Clause 3 of this Article, including : a) Projects in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with medium scale and capacity; b) Projects in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with small scale and capacity but with sensitive environmental factors; projects not in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with medium scale and capacity but with sensitive environmental factors; c) Projects using land, land with water surface, sea areas with average scale or small scale but with sensitive elements on environment; d) Projects on exploitation of minerals and water resources with medium scale and capacity or small scale and capacity but with sensitive environmental factors; dd) Projects requiring the change of land use purpose with small scale but having sensitive environmental factors; e) Projects requiring relocation and resettlement with average scale. 5. Group-III investment projects mean projects which pose little risk of adverse environmental impacts, except for projects defined in Clauses 3 and 4 of this Article, including : a) Projects in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution with small scale and capacity; b) Projects not in the form of production, business and services with risk of environmental pollution that generate wastewater, dust and emission that must be treated or hazardous waste that must be managed under regulations on waste management. 6. Group-IV investment projects mean projects without risks of adverse environmental impacts, including projects not defined in Clauses 3,4 and 5 of this Article. 7. The Government shall elaborate Clause 1 and promulgate a list of types of investment projects prescribed in Clauses 3,4 and 5 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@29: Preliminary assessment of environmental impacts 1. Subject to the preliminary environmental impact assessment are group-I investment projects specified in Clause 3, Article 28 of this Law. 2. The time of preliminary environmental impact assessment shall be carried out during the pre-feasibility study of construction investment, proposal of investment guidelines or request for approval for investment guidelines of investment projects that require decision or approval for investment guidelines as prescribed in law on investment, public investment, investment in the form of public-private partnership, and construction. 3. The contents of the preliminary environmental impact assessment include: a) Assessment of conformity of the project site with the national environmental protection strategy, national environmental protection planning, environmental protection contents in the regional planning, provincial planning and other relevant planning; b) Identification and forecast of major environmental impacts of the investment project on the basis of the scale, production technology and location of the project; c) Identification of environmental sensitive factors of the area where the investment project is executed according to the location plan (if any); d) Analysis, assessment and selection of plans for scale, production technology, waste treatment technology, location of the investment project and measures for minimizing environmental impacts; dd) Determination of main environmental issues and scope of environmental impacts to be taken into consideration during the process of environmental impact assessment. 4. The agency, organization, or individual that proposes the investment project mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article shall carry out the preliminary environmental impact assessment. The contents of the preliminary environmental impact assessment shall be considered by a competent authority together with the application for decision on or approval for investment guidelines.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@30: Entities subject to environmental impact assessment 1. Entities required to conduct the environmental impact assessment include: a) Group-I investment projects prescribed in Clause 3 Article 28 of this Law; b) Group-II projects prescribed in Point c, d, dd and e Clause 4 Article 28 of this Law. 2. Entities specified in Clause 1 of this Article belonging to emergency public investment projects in accordance with regulations of the Law on Public Investment are not required to undergo environmental impact assessment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@31: Implementation of environmental impact assessment 1. Environmental impact assessment shall be conducted by investment project owners themselves or by qualified consultancy units. Environmental impact assessment shall be conducted simultaneously with the making of feasibility study reports or documents equivalent to the projects feasibility study reports. 2. Results of environmental impact assessment shall be presented in environmental impact assessment reports. 3. Each investment project shall be made an environmental impact assessment report.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@32: Contents of an environmental impact assessment report 1. Main contents of an environmental impact assessment report include: a) Origin of the project, project owner, authority competent to approve the project; legal and technical bases; environmental impact assessment methods and other methods (if any); b) Conformity of the investment project with the national EPP, regional planning, provincial planning, regulations of law on environmental protection and other relevant regulations of law; c) Assessment of selection of technologies, work items and operation of the investment project that may have adverse impacts on the environment; d) Natural conditions, socio-economic conditions, biodiversity; assessment of the current environmental conditions; identification of affected subjects, environmental sensitive factors in the project site; explanation about the suitability of the selected location for project execution; dd) Identification, assessment, and forecasting of primary environmental impacts, waste generated by stages of the project on the environment; scale and nature of waste; impacts on biodiversity, natural heritages, historical-cultural relics and other sensitive factors; impacts due to site clearance, relocation and resettlement (if any); identification and assessment of possible environmental emergencies of the project; e) Works and measures for collecting, storing and treating waste; g) Measures for minimizing other negative impacts of the investment project on the environment; environmental improvement and remediation plan (if any); biodiversity reimbursement plan (if any); environmental emergency prevention and response plan; h/The program on environmental management and supervision; i) Consultation results; k) Conclusion, recommendations and commitments of the project owner. 2. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@33: Consultation in environmental impact assessment 1. Subjects entitled to consultation include: a) Communities and individuals directly affected by investment projects; b) Agencies and organizations directly related to the investment project. 2. Responsibilities for consultation are prescribed as follows: a/Investment project owners shall consult with the entities specified in Clause 1 of this Article and are encouraged to consult with experts in the course of environmental impact assessment; b) The agency or organization mentioned in Point b Clause 1 of this Article shall respond to the project owner in writing within the prescribed time limit. If no response is given by the deadline, it is considered agreed with the consultation. 3. The contents of consultation in the process of environmental impact assessment include: a) Location of the investment project; b) Environmental impacts of the investment project; c) Measures to minimize adverse impacts on the environment; d) Environmental management and supervision program; environmental emergency prevention and response plan; dd) Other contents related to the investment project. 4. Consultations are conducted through publication on websites and in one or more of the following forms: a) Holding meetings for collecting opinions; b) Collection of written opinions. 5. Consultation results are important information for investment project owners to study and propose solutions to mitigate environmental impacts of investment projects and complete environmental impact assessment reports. Consultation results must be fully and truthfully received and expressed in terms of opinions and recommendations of consulted subjects and those interested in investment projects (if any ). If opinions and recommendations are not fully received, investment project owners shall give full and clear explanations. Investment project owners shall take responsibility before law for the contents and results of consultations in environmental impact assessment reports. 6. Consultations are not required for investment projects on the list of state secrets. 7. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@34: EVALUATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL IMPLEMENTATION REPORTS 1. A dossier of request for appraisal of an environmental impact assessment report comprises : a/A written request for appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report; b) The environmental impact assessment report; c) The feasibility study report or equivalent documents. 2. For construction investment projects subject to feasibility study reports appraised by specialized construction agencies under the construction law, investment project owners may submit dossiers of request for appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports together with dossiers of request for appraisal of feasibility study reports. The submission time shall be decided by investment project owners but must be before the conclusion on appraisal of feasibility study reports is made. 3. The appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports is provided for as follows: a) The assessing authority shall issue a decision on establishment of an assessment council composed of at least 07 members; send the decision on establishment of the assessment council together with documents specified in Point b and Point c Clause 1 of this Article to each member of the assessment council; b) At least one-third of the members of the Assessment Council must be experts. The expert being a member of the Assessment Council must have expertise in environment or other fields related to the investment project and have worked for at least 07 years if he/she holds a bachelor's degree or an equivalent degree, at least 03 years if he/she holds a master's degree or an equivalent degree, or at least 02 years if he/she holds a doctorate degree or an equivalent degree; c) The experts participating in the environmental impact assessment of the investment project must not participate in the environmental impact assessment report appraisal council of such project; d) In case the project involves discharge of wastewater into irrigation works or facilities, the assessment council must be joined by a representative of the regulatory authority in charge of management of that irrigation project; the assessment body must seek written opinions and obtain consent from that regulatory authority before approving the assessment result. The regulatory agency in charge of management of irrigation projects shall be responsible for assigning members to join the assessment council and giving their written opinions on approval of assessment results within the time limit for collection of opinions; in case of failure to give any written response by the deadline for collection of opinions, such approval shall be deemed to be agreed with contents of the environmental impact assessment report; dd) Members of the assessment council shall be responsible for studying the application for assessment, making a written assessment of the assessment contents as prescribed in Clause 7 of this Article and be legally responsible for their assessment; e) The appraising authority shall consider, assess and consolidate opinions of members of the appraisal council and relevant organizations (if any) as the basis for approving the result of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report. 4. When necessary, the appraisal agency shall conduct field surveys and collect opinions of agencies, organizations and experts for appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports. 5. During the appraisal, if wishing to modify or supplement the environmental impact assessment report, the appraisal agency shall notify such in writing to the project owner for modification or supplementation. 6. The time limit for appraisal of an environmental impact assessment report is counted from the date of receipt of a complete and valid dossier and is specified as follows: a) 45 days, applicable to group I projects mentioned in Clause 3 Article 28 of this Law; b) 30 days for group-II projects specified in Point c through e Clause 4 Article 28 of this Law; c/Within the time limit specified at Points a and b of this Clause, the appraisal agency shall notify in writing the appraisal result to the project owner. The time for the project owner to modify and supplement the environmental impact assessment report at the request of the appraisal agency and the time for considering and issuing an approval decision specified in Clause 9 of this Article are not counted in the appraisal time limit; d) The time limit for assessment prescribed in Point a and Point b of this Clause may be extended according to the Prime Minister's decision. 7. The contents of appraisal of an environmental impact assessment report include : a) Conformity with the national EPP, regional planning, provincial planning and regulations of law on environmental protection; b) The conformity of the environmental impact assessment method and other methods (if any); c) The conformity of the identification and determination of work items and the operation of the investment project that may have negative impacts on the environment; d) The conformity of the result of assessment of the current environmental and biodiversity conditions; identification of affected subjects, environmental sensitive factors in the project site; dd) The conformity of the result of identification, forecast of main impacts and wastes generated from the investment project on the environment; forecast of environmental emergencies; e) The conformity and feasibility of environmental protection works and measures; environmental remediation plan (if any); biodiversity reimbursement plan (if any); environmental emergency prevention and response plan of the investment project; g) The conformity of the environmental management and supervision program; the adequacy and feasibility of the commitment to protect the environment of the project owner. 8. The Prime Minister shall decide to organize the appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports of investment projects which are beyond the domestic appraisal capacity and need to be appraised by foreign consultants. Results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports by foreign consultants serve as a basis for competent state agencies defined in Article 35 of this Law to approve results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports. 9. Within 20 days after receiving an environmental impact assessment report which has been modified and supplemented at the request (if any) of the appraisal agency, the head of the appraisal agency shall issue a decision approving the result of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report. In case of disapproval, he/she shall issue a written reply to the investment project owner, clearly stating the reason. 10. The application for appraisal of EIA report, receipt, handling and notification of results of appraisal of EIA report shall be sent directly, by post or electronically through the online public service system at the request of the investor. 11. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall detail the organization and operation of appraisal councils; publicize a list of appraisal councils; forms of documents of dossiers of request for appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports, decisions approving results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports; and the time limit for collection of opinions is specified at Point d, Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@35: Competence to appraise environmental impact assessment reports 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall appraise environmental impact assessment reports of the following investment projects, except those specified in Clause 2 of this Article : a) Group-I investment projects prescribed in Clause 3 Article 28 of this Law; b) Group-II investment projects prescribed in Point c, d, dd and e Clause 4 Article 28 herein under the authority to decide or approve investment policies of the National Assembly or the Prime Minister; investment projects located in at least 02 provincial-level administrative units; investment projects located in sea areas of which administrative responsibilities have not yet been determined by provincial-level People's Committees; investment projects under the authority to issue licenses for mineral extraction, water resource extraction and use, sea dumping permits or sea area assignment decisions of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. 2. The Ministry of National Defense and the Ministry of Public Security shall appraise environmental impact assessment reports of investment projects classified as state secrets in terms of national defense and security. 3. Provincial-level People's Committees shall organize the appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports of investment projects in their localities, except those specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall coordinate with provincial-level People's Committees of localities where exist investment projects in appraising environmental impact assessment reports of investment projects falling within their investment policy-deciding or investment-deciding competence.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@36: Decision on approval for results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment report 1. The decision approving the results of appraisal of an environmental impact assessment report is one of the grounds for a competent agency to perform the following jobs : a/To grant and modify mining licenses for mining investment projects; b) Approve the exploration plan and field development plan for the oil and gas exploration and extraction investment project; c) Approve feasibility study reports of PPP projects; d) Conclusions on appraisal of feasibility study reports of construction investment projects; e/Grant of environmental permits; e) Issue sea dumping permit; decide sea area assignment; g) Investment decisions on investment projects other than those specified at Points a, b, c, d, e and f of this Clause. 2. Except for investment projects related to state secrets, appraisal agencies shall send decisions approving results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports to project owners and concerned agencies according to the following provisions: a) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall send the application to the People's Committee of the province where the project is located and other agencies as prescribed by relevant laws. The People's Committee of the province shall send the application to the provincial environmental protection authority, the People's Committee of the district, the People's Committee of the commune where the project is located, and the management board of the industrial park, export-processing zone, hi-tech zone, or economic zone of the province if the project is executed in a concentrated production, business, or service zone; b) The People's Committee of the province shall send the project in the concentrated production, business and service zones to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, provincial environmental protection authority, the People's Committee of the district, the People's Committee of the commune where the project is located, and the management board of the industrial park, export-processing zone, hi-tech zone, or economic zone of the province. 3. In case of change of the project owner, the new project owner shall continue to implement the decision on approval for the result of EIA report appraisal and notify the EIA report appraisal agency and provincial EPA authority.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@37: Responsibilities of investment project owners after the issuance of decisions approving results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports 1. Adjust and supplement the contents of the investment project and the environmental impact assessment report in accordance with the contents and requirements for environmental protection stated in the decision on approving the result of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report. 2. To fully comply with the contents of the decision approving the results of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report. 3. Send a written notification of the completion of the environmental protection works to the agency that has approved the result of the EIA report before putting the project into official operation if the project is not subject to environmental licenses. 4. During the preparation and implementation of an investment project before it is put into operation, if there is any change in the decision on approval for the result of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report, the project owner shall : a) Carry out environmental impact assessment of investment projects in case of any change in scale, capacity, production technology or other changes that cause adverse impacts on the environment; b) Submit reports to competent authorities for consideration and approval during the issuance of environmental licenses to projects that are required to obtain environmental licenses in case of changes in production technology, waste treatment technology, location of direct discharge of treated wastewater into water bodies other than the cases prescribed in Point a of this Clause; addition of business lines to focus production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; c) Self-assessment of environmental impacts, consider, decide and take legal responsibility for other changes not specified in Points a and b of this Clause; integrate in the report on proposal for issuance of environmental license (if any). 5. Disclose the approved EIA report and verification results as prescribed in Article 114 of this Law, except for information classified as state secrets and enterprises' secrets as prescribed by law. 6. Fulfill other requirements prescribed by regulations of law on environmental protection. 7. The Government shall elaborate Clause 4 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@38: Responsibilities of the agency appraising the environmental impact assessment report 1. To take responsibility for appraisal results and approve appraisal results of environmental impact assessment reports. 2. Publish on the web portal the decision on approval for the result of appraisal of the environmental impact assessment report, except for the information classified as state secrets and enterprises' secrets as prescribed by law. 3. To build and integrate the environmental impact assessment database into the national environmental database.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@39: Subjects required to have environmental permits 1. Group-I, group-II and group-III investment projects which generate wastewater, dust and exhaust gas discharged into the environment must be treated or hazardous waste must be managed under regulations on waste management upon official operation. 2. Investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters operating before the effective date of this Law must satisfy environmental criteria like those specified in Clause 1 of this Article. 3. Entities specified in Clause 1 of this Article that are subject to urgent public investment projects in accordance with regulations of the Law on Public Investment shall be exempted from environmental licenses.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@40: Contents of environmental licenses 1. The contents of the environmental permit include general information about the investment project, facilities, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; content of environmental permit; requirements on environmental protection; duration of environmental permit; other contents (if any). 2. Environmental permits shall cover the following contents : a) Sources of wastewater; maximum discharge rate; wastewater flow; pollutants and their limits by wastewater flow; locations and methods of wastewater discharge and receiving waters; b) Sources of emission; maximum discharge rate; discharge flow; pollutants and limit value of pollutants by discharge flow; positions and methods of discharge of emission; c) Sources and limit value of noise and vibration; d) Works, equipment and systems for hazardous waste treatment; codes of hazardous waste and permitted volume of treatment, number of hazardous waste transfer stations, operating areas for investment projects, facilities providing hazardous waste treatment services; dd) Type and quantity of scrap permitted for import for investment projects and facilities importing scrap from foreign countries for use as raw production materials. 3. Requirements on environmental protection include: a) There are works and measures to collect and treat wastewater, exhaust gases, reduce noise and vibration to meet requirements; in case of discharge of wastewater into irrigation works, environmental protection requirements must be satisfied with water sources of irrigation works; b) Having measures, systems, works, equipment for storage, transport, transit, preliminary processing, treatment meeting the requirements of technical process and management for investment projects, facilities performing services of hazardous waste treatment; c) Having warehouses and yards for storing scrap meeting the regulations; recycling equipment system; plan on impurity treatment; plan on re-export for investment projects, establishments importing scrap from foreign countries for use as raw production materials; d) Have plans for environmental management and supervision, plans for prevention and response to environmental emergencies; equipment and works serving prevention and response to environmental emergencies, and environmental monitoring; dd) Manage domestic solid waste, ordinary industrial solid waste and hazardous waste; improve and restore the environment; reimburse biodiversity as prescribed by law; e) Other requirements for environmental protection (if any). 4. Validity of environmental permits is prescribed as follows: a) 07 years, applicable to Group I projects; b) 07 years for the production, business and service establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters operating before the effective date of this Law with the environmental criteria as the group-I investment projects; c) 10 years, applicable to the entities other than those mentioned in Point a and Point b of this Clause; d) The validity period of an environmental license may be shorter than the period specified in Points a, b and c of this Clause at the request of the investor in the investment project, facility, investor in construction and commercial operation of infrastructure of the concentrated production, business and service zone or industrial cluster (hereinafter referred to as investor and facility owner). 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall issue the form of environmental permit.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@41: Competence to grant environmental licenses 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall grant environmental permits to the following subjects, except for the cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article: a/Subjects specified in Article 39 of this Law for which the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment has approved results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports; b) Entities prescribed in Article 39 of this Law that are located in at least 02 provincial administrative units or on the sea area of which administrative management responsibility is not yet determined by the People's Committee of the province; establishments importing scrap from abroad as production materials, establishments providing hazardous waste treatment services. 2. The Ministry of National Defense and the Ministry of Public Security shall issue environmental licenses to investment projects and establishments classified as state secrets regarding national defense and security. 3. Provincial-level People's Committees shall grant environmental permits to the following subjects, except for the cases specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article : a) Group-II projects prescribed in Article 39 of this Law; b) Group-III projects prescribed in Article 39 of this Law located in at least 02 district-level administrative units; c/Subjects specified in Clause 2, Article 39 of this Law for which the results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports have been approved by provincial-level People's Committees, ministries or ministerial-level agencies. 4. District-level People's Committees shall grant environmental permits to the entities defined in Article 39 of this Law, except the cases specified in Clauses 1,2 and 3 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@42: Bases and time of environmental permit issuance 1. Bases for granting environmental permits include: a) The application for environmental license prescribed in Clause 1 Article 43 of this Law; b) The environmental impact assessment report with the appraisal result approved by a competent authority (if any); c) National environmental protection planning, provincial planning, environmental zoning, environmental load-bearing capacity under decisions of competent state agencies, except for the case specified at Point e of this Clause; d) Environmental technical regulations; dd) The regulations of the law on environmental protection, water resources and other relevant regulations of law; e) At the time of issuance of the environmental license, if the national environmental protection planning, provincial planning, environmental zoning, and environmental load bearing capacity have not been issued by competent state agencies, the environmental license shall be issued according to Points a, b, d and dd of this Clause. 2. Time of issuance of environmental permits is prescribed as follows: a) Investment projects subject to environmental impact assessment must obtain environmental licenses before trial operation of waste treatment works, except for the case specified in Point c of this Clause; b) Investment projects that are not subject to environmental impact assessment must obtain environmental licenses before competent authorities issue documents specified in Points a, b, c, d and g Clause 1 Article 36 of this Law. In case a construction project is not subject to feasibility study report appraisal by a construction authority as prescribed by law on construction, an environmental license is required before a competent authority issues or adjusts a construction license; c) With regard to the investment projects specified in Clause 2 Article 39 of this Law that are undergoing trial operation of waste treatment works as prescribed by law before the effective date of this Law, the project owner may choose to continue the trial operation to obtain the environmental license after the trial operation of the waste treatment works is completed or prepare an application for the environmental license before the trial operation expires. The project owner is not required to carry out the trial operation of the waste treatment works but the result of trial operation must be reported and assessed as prescribed in Article 46 of this Law; d) Production, business and service establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters specified in Clause 2, Article 39 of this Law which have been officially put into operation before the effective date of this Law must have environmental licenses within 36 months after the effective date of this Law, except for cases where they have been granted by competent agencies certificates of completion of environmental protection works, certificates of environmental standard satisfaction, certificates of satisfaction of environmental protection conditions in import of scraps from foreign countries for use as production raw materials, licenses for treatment of hazardous wastes, permits for discharge of wastewater into water sources, permits for discharge of wastewater into irrigation works (hereinafter referred to as component environmental licenses ). Component environmental licenses may be used as environmental licenses until their validity duration expires, or may be used for 5 years after the effective date of this Law in case they are valid for an indefinite term. 3. In case an investment project or a production, business or service establishment, consolidated production, business or service zone or industrial cluster is implemented in different stages and has many works or work items, an environmental license may be granted for each stage, work or work item with waste generation. An environmental license granted later will incorporate contents of the environmental license granted earlier and remain valid. 4. Environmental permits are the basis for carrying out the following activities: a) Carry out inspection and supervision of environmental protection activities of investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters by competent state agencies; b) Fulfillment of environmental protection responsibilities of investors and facilities. 5. In case of changing name of investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters or owners of investment projects, establishments, the owners of investment projects, establishments shall continue to implement environmental licenses and notify the environmental licensing agencies for being granted for change of licenses. 6. From the effective date of environmental licenses, decisions approving results of appraisal of environmental impact assessment reports and component environmental licenses cease to be effective.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@43: Dossiers, order and procedures for environmental permit granting 1. An application for environmental license includes: a) An application form for environmental license; b) A report on proposal for environmental license; c) Other legal and technical documents of the investment project, facilities, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters. 2. The order and procedures for granting environmental permits are prescribed as follows: a) The investor or facility shall send an application for environmental license to the competent authority specified in Article 41 of this Law. The application shall be sent directly or by post or electronically through the online public services system; b) The agency competent to issue environmental licenses shall receive and check the completeness and validity of the dossier; publish the contents of the report on proposal for issue of environmental license, except for information of state secret and enterprise secret as prescribed by law; consult with the relevant agencies, organizations and individuals; carry out the physical inspection of information of investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; organize the appraisal and issue of environmental licenses. Procedures for receipt and handling of administrative procedures and notification of results shall be carried out in person, by post or electronically through the online public service system at the request of project owners and facilities; c) In case an investment project, establishment, concentrated production, business and service zone or industrial cluster discharge wastewater into an irrigation project, the environmental license-issuing agency shall collect written opinions and obtain the consent of the state agency managing such irrigation project before granting an environmental license; d) If the investment project or facility is located in the concentrated production, business and service zone or industrial cluster, the environmental licensing authority shall obtain a written opinion from the investor in construction and commercial operation of infrastructure of such concentrated production, business and service zone or industrial cluster before granting the environmental license. 3. The environmental permit shall be issued on the basis of assessment of the report on proposal for environmental permit. The competent authority of environmental permit issuance shall establish an assessment council and inspection team as prescribed by the Government. With regard to investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters that discharge wastewater into irrigation works, the composition of the council for assessment of the report on proposal for grant of environmental licenses, the inspection team must include the representative of the state agency in charge of such irrigation works. The regulatory agency in charge of management of irrigation projects shall be responsible for assigning members to join the assessment council, inspection team and giving their written opinions on issuance of the environmental license within the time limit for collection of opinions; in case of failure to give any written response by the deadline for collection of opinions, this is deemed as consent to issuance of the environmental license. 4. The time limit for granting environmental permits is counted from the date of receiving complete and valid dossiers and is prescribed as follows: a) Not exceeding 45 days for the environmental permit under the authority to issue the environmental permit of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, the Ministry of Defense and the Ministry of Public Security; b) Not exceeding 30 days for environmental licenses under the competence of provincial-level People's Committees, district-level People's Committees; c) The agency competent to issue environmental licenses may stipulate a shorter time limit for issuance of environmental licenses than the time limit specified at Points a and b of this Clause, suitable to the type, size and nature of investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters. 5. Investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters which are subject to environmental permits and perform radiation jobs shall, apart from complying with this Law, also comply with the law on atomic energy. 6. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@44: Renewal, adjustment, re-issuance, stripping of the right to use, withdrawal of environmental permits 1. Environmental permits shall be renewed in the cases specified in Clause 5, Article 42 of this Law without any change in other contents of the permits. 2. An environmental license may be considered for modification within its validity duration when falling into one of the following cases: a) The licensing contents specified in Clause 2 Article 40 of this Law are changed at the request of the investor or facility or as prescribed by law, except for the case specified in Point b Clause 3 of this Article; b) Investment projects, facilities that provide services of hazardous waste treatment or import scrap from foreign countries for use as raw production materials after the end of trial operation to be consistent with the actual operational capacity. 3. Environmental permits shall be re-granted in the following cases: a) The license expires; b) The investment project, facility, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters have one of changes in scale, capacity, production technology or other changes which increase adverse impacts on the environment compared with the environmental permit granted, except for the case where the investment project changes subject to environmental impact assessment. 4. To deprive the right to use environmental licenses when investment project owners or establishments commit acts of administrative violation in the domain of environmental protection to the extent that the right to use environmental licenses must be deprived under the law on handling of administrative violations. 5. An environmental license shall be revoked in the following cases: a) The license is issued ultra vires; b) The license contains contents contrary to law provisions. 6. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@45: Fee for environmental license assessment 1. Investors and facilities shall pay fees for assessment for issuance, re-issuance and adjustment of environmental licenses. 2. The Minister of Finance shall provide for the collection, transfer, management and use of fees for assessment for issuance, re-issuance and adjustment of environmental licenses within the competence of central regulatory agencies. 3. Provincial People's Councils shall provide for the collection, transfer, management and use of fees for assessment for issuance, re-issuance and adjustment of environmental licenses within the competence of provincial People's Committees and district-level People's Committees as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@46: Environmental protection works and trial operation of waste treatment works of investment projects after obtaining environmental licenses 1. Environmental protection works of an investment project include: a) Waste treatment works refer to works and equipment used for treatment of wastewater, dust, exhaust gases, solid waste and hazardous waste; b) Solid waste collection and storage works refer to works and equipment used for collecting and storing ordinary solid waste, medical solid waste and hazardous solid waste to meet requirements for classification, collection, storage, reuse, recycling and transport of solid waste to treatment, reuse or recycling facilities; c) Other environmental protection works. 2. After obtaining an environmental license, the owner of an investment project with a waste treatment work specified at Point a, Clause 1 of this Article shall conduct trial operation of the waste treatment work concurrently with the trial operation of the whole investment project or for each investment phase of the project (if any) or for an independent waste treatment work item of the project to assess its conformity with and satisfaction of environmental technical regulations. 3. During the trial operation of waste treatment works, the investor must comply with the requirements for environmental protection according to the environmental license and the law provisions on environmental protection. 4. For investment projects providing hazardous waste treatment services or importing scraps from foreign countries for use as production raw materials, 45 days before the end of trial operation, investment project owners shall send reports on trial operation results to agencies competent to grant environmental permits for their projects. Environmental permit-granting agencies shall examine and decide on the adjustment of types and volumes of hazardous wastes permitted for treatment or volumes of scraps permitted for import and handle violations (if any) in accordance with law. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@47: Rights and obligations of owners of investment projects and establishments licensed to operate in the environment 1. Owners of investment projects and establishments licensed for environmental protection have the following rights: a) Comply with the environmental licensing contents specified in the environmental license; b) Application for replacement, adjustment, re-issuance of environmental permit; c) Other rights as prescribed by law. 2. Owners of investment projects and establishments granted environmental permits have the following obligations: a) Comply with the requirements for environmental protection in the environmental license. In case of any change in the content of the issued license, the applicant must report to the licensing agency for consideration and settlement; b) Paying fees for assessment for issuance, re-issuance and adjustment of environmental licenses; c) Comply with regulations on trial operation of waste treatment works of investment projects as prescribed in Article 46 of this Law; d) Take responsibility for the accuracy and truthfulness of the application for environmental licenses; dd) Disclose the environmental license, except for information classified as state secrets and enterprises' secrets as prescribed by law; e) Provide relevant information at the request of environmental protection authorities during the inspection; g) Other obligations as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@48: Responsibilities of environmental permit issuing agency 1. To receive, examine, appraise and grant environmental licenses; to renew, adjust and re-grant environmental licenses at the request of investment project owners or establishments; to take responsibility for contents of environmental licenses; to manage and store environmental license dossiers and data; to suspend part of activities of investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones or industrial clusters which cause or may actually cause serious environmental consequences, and to withdraw environmental licenses. 2. Disclose the environmental license on the website, except for the information classified as state secrets and enterprises' secrets as prescribed by law. 3. Inspect the implementation of environmental protection contents and requirements by investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters in accordance with law. 4. Receive and handle proposals for environmental protection with respect to contents specified in environmental licenses; provide instructions for project owners on trial operation of waste treatment works and remedy environmental pollution and incidents (if any) during trial operation. 5. The environment licensing agency shall operate, update and integrate data on environment licenses into the environment information system and database. The reporting and sharing of information, data and data on environment licenses shall be carried out in a connected and online manner within the national environment information system and database.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@49: Environmental registration 1. Entities required to register for environment include: a) The investment project generates waste not subject to environmental license; b) Production, business and service establishments operating before the effective date of this Law and generating wastes not subject to environmental permits. 2. Entities specified in Clause 1 of this Article exempted from environmental registration include: a) Investment projects and facilities classified as state secrets regarding national defense and security; b) The investment project and the business establishment do not generate waste or generate waste in small amount, and are treated by on-site treatment works or managed by local authorities; c) Other entities. 3. Commune-level People's Committees shall receive in person, by post or electronically through the online public service system environmental registrations of the entities specified in Clause 1 of this Article. For investment projects and establishments located in 2 or more commune-level administrative units, investment project owners and establishments may select commune-level People's Committees for environmental registration. 4. Environmental registration contents include: a) General information about the investment project and facility; b) Type of production, business and service; technology, capacity, products; raw materials, fuel and chemicals used (if any); c) Type and volume of waste generated; d) Waste collection, management and treatment plan as prescribed; dd) Commitment to environmental protection. 5. In the course of operation, if there is any change in the registered contents of an investment project or establishment, the owner of such investment project or establishment shall re-register the environment before making such change. In case of change in scale and nature of investment projects and facilities subject to environmental impact assessment or environmental licenses, owners of investment projects and facilities shall comply with regulations on environmental impact assessment and environmental licenses under this Law. 6. Time of environmental registration is prescribed as follows: a) Investment projects specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article and subject to environmental impact assessment must apply for environmental registration before official operation; b) Investment projects specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article that are not subject to environmental impact assessment and must be registered before a competent authority issues a construction license (if required) or before discharging waste to the environment (if not required); c) Production, business and service establishments specified in point b clause 1 of this Article must register environment within 24 months from the effective date of this Law. 7. Responsibilities of People's Committees of communes : a) Receive environmental registration; b) Inspect and handle violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals applying for environmental registration as prescribed by law; c) Provide guidance and resolve petitions on environmental protection with respect to contents registered by organizations and individuals; d) Update environmental registration data to the national environmental information system and database. 8. The Government shall elaborate Point b and Point c Clause 2 of this Article. 9. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide the environmental registration form and guide the receipt of environmental registration.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@50: Environmental protection for economic zones 1. Economic zones must have environmental protection infrastructure, including : a) Solid waste collection and storage system; b) Rainwater collection and drainage system; c) Wastewater collection, drainage and treatment systems must ensure that treated wastewater meets environmental protection requirements; automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring systems, in case economic zones have centralized wastewater treatment systems, must be automatically and continuously monitored in accordance with this Law; d) The greenery area must ensure the percentage as prescribed by law on construction. 2. The Economic Zone Management Board must have a specialized environmental protection division and staff in charge of environmental protection who are trained in environment or a field suitable for their tasks. 3. The management board of economic zone shall assume the following responsibilities: a/Inspect and supervise the construction of environmental protection infrastructure in industrial production functional zones in economic zones in accordance with law; b) Cooperate with local regulatory authorities in charge of environmental protection in appraising environmental impact assessment reports, granting environmental permits, conducting inspections of environmental protection and performing other environmental protection tasks within economic zones in accordance with laws; c/To inspect environmental protection of production, business and service establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters in economic zones under plans approved by provincial-level People's Committees; d) Promptly detect violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals and propose actions against such violations in accordance with regulations of law; dd) Perform other environmental protection tasks authorized by the People's Committee of the province as prescribed by law; e) Report on environmental protection activities in economic zones in accordance with laws; g) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@51: Environmental protection for concentrated production, business and service zones 1. Concentrated production, business and service zones must have environmental protection infrastructure, including: a) Rainwater collection and drainage systems; concentrated wastewater collection, drainage and treatment systems must ensure that treated wastewater meets environmental protection requirements; b) Works and equipment for prevention and response to environmental emergencies with regard to wastewater as prescribed by law; c) Automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring system for centralized wastewater treatment systems as prescribed in this Law; d) The greenery area must ensure the percentage as prescribed by law on construction. 2. The management boards of industrial parks, export processing zones and hi-tech parks of provinces and centrally run cities must have a specialized section in charge of environmental protection and staff members in charge of environmental protection who have been trained in environmental disciplines or professional domains suitable to their jobs. 3.
