The management boards of industrial parks, export processing zones, and hi-tech zones of central-affiliated cities and provinces shall : a) Inspect and supervise the investment in construction of environmental protection infrastructure of concentrated production, business and service zones as prescribed by law; b) Cooperate with local environmental protection authorities in appraising environmental impact assessment reports, issuing environmental licenses, inspecting environmental protection and performing other environmental protection tasks of concentrations of producers, businesses and service providers in accordance with regulations of law; c/To inspect environmental protection of establishments in consolidated production, business and service zones in accordance with law; d) Promptly detect violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals and propose actions against such violations in accordance with regulations of law; dd) Report on environmental protection of the concentrated production, business and service zones as prescribed by law; e) Perform other environmental protection tasks authorized by the People's Committee of the province as prescribed by law; g) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law. 4. Investors in construction and commercial operation of infrastructure of concentrated production, business and service zones shall : a) Satisfy the requirements specified in Clause 1 of this Article; b) Functional areas, types of production, business and services are arranged in accordance with the requirements for environmental protection; c) Invest in rainwater collection and drainage systems separate from centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment systems; d) Collection and connection of wastewater from facilities in the concentrated production, business and service zones to the concentrated wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system; dd) Request the facilities that are discharging treated wastewater into the rainwater collection and drainage system to stop discharging treated wastewater into the rainwater collection and drainage system within 24 months from the effective date of this Law; e) Assign employees in charge of environmental protection who are trained in environment or relevant fields; g) Cooperate with regulatory agencies in charge of environmental protection, management boards of industrial parks, export processing zones, hi-tech zones, economic zones of provinces in environmental protection; cooperate in conducting inspections of facilities in concentrated production, business and service zones in accordance with regulations of law; h/To examine the realization of environmental protection commitments by investment project owners and establishments when registering investment in consolidated production, business and service zones; i) Promptly detect violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals and propose actions against such violations in accordance with regulations of law; k) Promulgate regulations on environmental protection of concentrated production, business and service zones in accordance with requirements on environmental protection as prescribed by law; l) Carry out environmental monitoring as prescribed by law; m) Prepare and send reports on environmental protection of the concentrated production, business and service zones to the provincial specialized environmental protection agencies, environmental licensing agencies and management boards of industrial parks, export processing zones, hi-tech parks and economic zones of central-affiliated cities and provinces as prescribed by law; n) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law. 5. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Support for investment in construction and operation of environmental protection infrastructure works in concentrated production, business and service zones invested by the State in the area as prescribed by law; b) Direct specialized agencies, management boards of industrial parks, export processing zones, hi-tech zones, economic zones of provinces and central-affiliated cities to implement regulations of law on environmental protection for concentrated production, business and service zones; c) Promulgate regulations on encouragement and organization of private sector involvement in investment in construction, trading and operation of environmental protection infrastructure in concentrated production, business and service zones; d) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law. 6. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@52: Environmental protection for industrial clusters 1. An industrial cluster must have environmental protection infrastructure as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 51 of this Law. 2. An operating industrial complex must meet the following requirements: a) The environmental protection infrastructure works specified in Clause 1 Article 51 of this Law are completed within 24 months from the effective date of this Law; b) The cases that are exempted from connection to the centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system must ensure that treated wastewater meets environmental protection requirements before being discharged into the environment; have plans for prevention and response to environmental emergencies with regard to wastewater and have automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring systems as prescribed by law. 3. Investors in construction and commercial operation of industrial cluster infrastructure shall : a) Satisfy the requirements specified in Clause 1 of this Article; b) Invest in construction, management and operation of environmental protection infrastructure facilities in the industrial cluster as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article; c) Refuse to receive or increase the capacity of the investment project generating wastewater in the industrial cluster without a centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system; d) Collection and connection of wastewater from facilities in the industrial cluster to the centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system; dd) Request the facilities that are discharging treated wastewater into the rainwater collection and drainage system to stop discharging treated wastewater into the rainwater collection and drainage system within 24 months from the effective date of this Law; e) Assign at least one person in charge of environmental protection who is trained in environment or a field suitable for his/her tasks; g) Cooperate with environmental protection authorities in organizing environmental protection activities; cooperate in conducting inspections of environmental protection of facilities in industrial clusters as prescribed by law; h) Inspect the fulfillment of environmental protection commitments by investors and facilities when registering investment in industrial clusters; i) Promptly detect violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals and propose actions against such violations in accordance with regulations of law; k) Promulgate regulations on environmental protection in industrial clusters in conformity with environmental protection requirements as prescribed by law; l) Prepare and send reports on environmental protection of the industrial cluster to the provincial environmental protection authority, environmental licensing authority and district-level People's Committee in accordance with regulations of law; m) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law. 4. The encouragement of private sector involvement, incentives and support for organizations and individuals to invest in construction and commercial operation of environmental protection infrastructure of industrial clusters shall comply with regulations of the Government and provincial People's Committees in the areas. 5. District-level People's Committees shall : a) Invest in construction, management and operation of environmental protection infrastructure facilities in an industrial cluster in case there is no investor in construction and commercial operation of industrial cluster infrastructure; b) Make a list of industrial clusters without centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment systems in the administrative division and send it to the provincial People's Committee; c) Other responsibilities as prescribed by law. 6. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Direct specialized agencies, district-level People's Committees and commune-level People's Committees to implement regulations of law on environmental protection in industrial clusters; b) Promulgate regulations on encouragement and private sector involvement in investment in construction, operation and commercial operation of environmental protection infrastructure works in industrial clusters; c) Issue the roadmap for relocation of residents (if any) from the industrial cluster.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@53: Environmental protection for production, business and service establishments 1. Production, business and service establishments shall have the following responsibilities: a) Collect and treat wastewater to meet environmental protection requirements. If an establishment operating in an industrial cluster, concentrated production, business or service zone, or in an urban area or residential area has a centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system, its owner shall connect the wastewater to such centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system in accordance with regulations of the investor in such centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system, except for the case where the establishment has been exempted from wastewater connection before the effective date of this Law; b) Establishments operating in industrial clusters, concentrated production, business or service zones that are discharging treated wastewater into rainwater collection and drainage systems shall comply with regulations in Point dd Clause 4 Article 51 and Point dd Clause 3 Article 52 of this Law; c) Collect, classify, store, reuse, recycle and treat waste in accordance with this Law; d) Minimize, collect and treat dust, exhaust and bad odors; ensure no leakage and dispersion of hazardous gas to the environment; control noise, vibration, light and heat radiation; dd) Ensure resources and equipment for environmental emergency prevention and response; e) Production, business and service establishments specified at Point b, Clause 2, Article 111 and Clause 2, Article 112 of this Law must arrange their staff in charge of environmental protection who have been trained in environment or suitable professional domains; must have an environmental management system up to the certified national standard TCVN ISO 14001 or international standard ISO 14001; g) Carry out monitoring of wastewater, dust and emission in accordance with regulations of this Law. 2. Production, business and service establishments and warehouses in the following cases must be located at a safe distance from residential areas : a) Having flammable, explosive substances; b) Having radioactive substances, radioactive waste or radiation equipment; c) Having substances harmful to humans and living organisms; d) There is a risk of dust, unpleasant odors, noise that negatively affect human health; e) Having risk of causing pollution of water sources. 3. Production, business and service establishments of household or individual scale that generate wastewater, emission must have works, equipment of on-site waste treatment meeting the environmental protection requirements or as prescribed by the provincial People's Committees. 4. The Government shall elaborate Clause 2 of this Article. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide technical guidance and assess the conformity of on-site waste treatment works and equipment meeting environmental protection requirements specified in Clause 3 of this Article. 6. Provincial-level People's Committees shall promulgate roadmaps for establishments specified in Clause 2 of this Article operating in their localities which fail to ensure environmental safety distances.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@54: Recycling responsibilities of producers and importers 1. Organizations and individuals producing and importing products and packaging with recycling value must recycle according to the rate and compulsory recycling specifications, except for products and packaging exported, temporarily imported, re-exported or produced, imported for research, study and testing purposes. 2. The entities mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article may choose to recycle products and packages in one of the following manners: a) Organize the recycling of products and packages; b) Make financial contributions to the Vietnam Environment Protection Fund to support the recycling of products and packaging. 3. The organizations and individuals specified in Clause 1 of this Article must register the recycling plan and report the annual recycling result to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, except for the case specified at Point b, Clause 2 of this Article. 4. The contribution and use of financial contributions for recycling of products and packages specified at Point b, Clause 2 of this Article must ensure the following principles : a) The level of financial contribution and the level of funding for recycling support is determined by the volume or unit of products, packaging; b) Financial contributions are used to support the recycling of products and packages specified in Clause 1 of this Article; c) The receipt and use of financial contributions must be transparent and serve the right purposes as prescribed by law. 5. The Government shall elaborate and provide a roadmap for implementation of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@55: Waste collection and treatment responsibilities of producers and importers 1. Organizations and individuals that produce or import products and packages containing toxic substances which are hardly recyclable or cause difficulties to the collection and disposal of these products and packages shall make financial contributions to support the activities specified in Clause 3 of this Article, except products exported, temporarily imported for re-export or produced or imported for research, study or experimentation purposes. 2. Organizations and individuals defined in Clause 1 of this Article shall make financial contributions to Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund; the financial contribution level shall be determined according to the volume or unit of product or package. 3. Activities supported by the Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund in service of waste treatment activities include: a) Collection, transport and treatment of daily-life solid waste generated from households and individuals; b) Research and development of technologies, techniques and initiatives for treatment of domestic solid waste; c) Collection, transport and treatment of pesticide packages. 4. The receipt and use of financial contributions must be public and transparent and for proper purposes as prescribed by law. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@56: Environmental protection in trade villages 1. Craft villages must have environmental protection plans, self-management organizations for environmental protection and environmental protection infrastructure. Environmental protection infrastructure of a craft village includes : a) Have a wastewater and rainwater collection system to meet the drainage needs of the trade village; b) The centralized wastewater collection, drainage and treatment system (if any) must ensure that treated wastewater meets environmental protection requirements; c) Have solid waste gathering points meeting technical requirements for environmental protection; solid waste treatment areas (if any) meeting regulations on solid waste management or having plans for transporting solid waste to solid waste treatment areas outside the province. 2. Manufacturing establishments and households in trade villages must develop and implement environmental protection measures in accordance with laws; implement measures to minimize noise, vibration, light, dust, thermal radiation, exhaust gas and wastewater, and deal with pollution on the spot; collect, classify, store and treat solid wastes in accordance with laws. 3. Establishments and households engaged in production of production lines not encouraged for development in craft villages shall comply with the provisions of Clause 2 of this Article and plans on relocation or change of production lines as prescribed by competent state agencies. 4. The People's Committees of communes shall : a) Formulate and implement the environmental protection plan for trade villages within their jurisdiction; b) Provide guidance on activities of self-management organizations for environmental protection in trade villages. 5. District-level People's Committees shall : a) Compile the budget demands for environmental protection activities in trade villages; b) Direct and implement the environmental protection models of handicraft villages; invest in the construction and operation of models of solid waste collection and treatment, on-site sewage treatment system to meet the environmental protection requirements invested by the State from the construction investment funds, environmental non-business expenditure sources and contributions of organizations and individuals as prescribed by law. 6. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Planning, building, renovating and developing trade villages and trade village industrial clusters in association with environmental protection; b) Allocate budget for environmental protection activities in trade villages; c) Direct and organize the assessment of the environmental pollution levels and the treatment of environmental pollution in handicraft villages in the areas; d) Direct the construction of wastewater collection and treatment systems; common solid waste and hazardous waste storage and treatment areas for trade villages; dd) Have plans for relocation of facilities causing serious environmental pollution, causing prolonged environmental pollution out of residential areas and trade villages. 7. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@57: Environmental protection in urban centers and residential areas 1. The environmental protection of urban centers and concentrated residential areas must adhere to the principle of sustainable development associated with the maintenance of natural, cultural and historical elements and the assurance of green space ratio, landscape and environmental sanitation requirements under planning. 2. Urban areas and residential areas must meet environmental protection requirements, including : a) Water supply and drainage networks, public sanitation facilities meeting environmental protection requirements; wastewater collection and treatment systems which are synchronous and conformable with approved plannings; in case urban centers and residential areas which have been formed before the effective date of this Law cannot arrange land areas for building wastewater collection and treatment systems, the provisions of Point c, Clause 5, Article 86 of this Law shall apply; b) Equipment, vehicles and places for at-the-source classification, collection and storage of daily-life solid waste must be suitable to the volume and types of waste generated from households and individuals in urban centers and concentrated residential areas; c) Having greenery, water surface and open space in urban areas and concentrated residential areas as prescribed by law. 3. Parks, flower gardens, green trees, water surface, public roads and natural ecosystems must be protected, preserved and embellished to meet the requirements on beauty and environmental protection and must not be encroached upon, leveled or used for improper purposes. 4. Residential areas and residential clusters must have temporary storage of daily-life solid waste to ensure no environmental pollution before being transported to the treatment location as prescribed. 5. Owners of urban center and residential area investment projects shall comply with environmental protection requirements specified in Clauses 1,2,3 and 4 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@58: Rural environmental protection 1. Requirements on rural environmental protection are prescribed as follows: a) Organizations, households and individuals engaged in handicraft and cottage industry production, agricultural production and processing activities must conform to the planning, comply with the law provisions on environmental protection, ensure not to affect the quality of surrounding environment; wastes must be collected, reused and treated to meet the requirements on environmental protection; b/Rural population clusters must have appropriate water drainage systems and wastewater treatment measures; waste gathering places must be rationally arranged; no raising or grazing of animals causing unsanitary conditions in public places; to encourage self-management activities in environmental protection; c) Landscape, trees, ponds, lakes, surface water ecosystems, water sources must be preserved, protected, restored and renovated; d) Waste generated in rural areas must be managed as prescribed by law; organic daily-life waste, waste from livestock production, processing and agricultural by-products must be recovered, reused or used as raw materials for production; dd) The quality of rural environment must be monitored and assessed; the polluted areas must be identified, zoned off, treated, renovated and restored and measures to improve and improve the environmental quality must be taken. 2. Responsibilities for environmental protection in rural areas are prescribed as follows: a) Commune-level People's Committees shall make statistics and manage domestic, agricultural and handicraft waste generated in their localities; organize activities of sanitation and improvement of rural landscapes; and prescribe environmental protection self-management activities in rural areas; b) District-level People's Committees shall manage production, business and service activities in accordance with regulations on environmental protection under approved planning; manage district-level waste collection and treatment; invest in and upgrade wastewater drainage and treatment systems, and solid waste collection and treatment systems in rural areas; monitor and assess environmental quality developments; zone off, treat, improve, restore and improve environmental quality in polluted spots and areas in rural areas; c) Provincial People's Committees shall direct and allocate resources for implementation of contents on rural environmental protection; direct and organize the treatment of wastes generated in rural areas; promulgate and guide the application of incentive and support mechanisms and policies for waste treatment, landscape construction and rural environmental protection; d/The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development in, guiding the implementation of contents and criteria on rural environmental protection, appropriate waste collection and treatment measures, monitoring environmental quality developments, remedy pollution, improve and restore the quality of rural environment; dd) The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide guidelines for collection and treatment of livestock waste and agricultural by-products for reuse; take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment in formulating and implementing programs, schemes, projects, mechanisms and policies on rural development associated with environmental protection and resilience to climate change; e) The Prime Minister shall promulgate criteria for environmental protection in rural construction and development.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@59: Environmental protection in public places 1. Agencies, organizations, households and individuals shall comply with regulations on environmental protection and sanitation in public places; classify and transfer garbage into each type of public garbage container or at the prescribed place of garbage gathering; and do not let livestock cause unsanitary conditions in public places. 2. Managers of parks, amusement parks, concentrations of businesses and service providers, markets, train stations, bus stations, wharves, ports, ferries and other public areas shall : a) Assign personnel to collect waste and clean the environment within their management; have personnel, teams or teams of environmental protection to inspect and supervise; b) Constructing and installing public sanitation facilities, on-site wastewater treatment facilities meeting environmental protection requirements; having means and equipment for waste collection, management and treatment meeting environmental protection requirements; c) Promulgate, post and organize the implementation of regulations on hygiene and environmental protection in public places under their management; d) Promptly detect violations against regulations on environmental protection committed by organizations and individuals and propose actions against such violations in accordance with regulations of law. 3. The agency in charge of appraising construction design and licensing the entities mentioned in Clause 2 of this Article in accordance with regulations of law on construction shall seek opinions from the environmental protection authority about on-site wastewater treatment works and equipment, temporary waste collection and storage equipment during the appraisal and licensing process in accordance with regulations of the Government.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@60: Environmental protection for households and individuals 1. Households and individuals shall have the following responsibilities: a) Minimize and classify domestic solid waste at source, collect and transport classified domestic waste to the prescribed places; b) Minimize, treat and discharge domestic wastewater at prescribed places; do not let domestic animals cause unsanitary conditions in residential areas; c) Not to emit exhaust gas, cause noise, vibration and other impacts, causing environmental pollution, adversely affecting the surrounding residential community; d) Pay costs of waste collection, transportation and treatment services in accordance with laws; dd) Participate in environmental protection activities in residential communities; e) Have sanitation facilities as prescribed. In case of lack of wastewater treatment facilities and equipment, when building or renovating and repairing separate houses in urban areas and residential areas, it is required to build and install on-site wastewater treatment facilities and equipment meeting the environmental protection requirements as prescribed. 2. Livestock farms of household scale must ensure hygiene, not cause noise pollution, odor emission; waste from livestock breeding must be collected and handled according to regulations and law on environmental protection and other relevant regulations and law. 3. The agencies appraising construction designs and licensing construction permits for construction works and houses of households and individuals in urban areas under the construction law shall appraise and license construction works and equipment for on-site wastewater treatment to meet environmental protection requirements.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@61: Environmental protection in agricultural production 1. Organizations and individuals that produce, import, trade in and use chemicals, plant protection drugs, veterinary drugs and fertilizers in agricultural production shall comply with the law on environmental protection and other relevant laws. 2. Chemicals, pesticides and veterinary medicines that are highly toxic, sustainable, spread and accumulate in the environment, and negatively affect the environment and human health must be registered, inventoried, controlled, and managed, assessed, and managed in accordance with regulations of law. 3. Expired fertilizers, products for adjusting livestock environment, pesticides, veterinary medicines, aquafeeds and treatment products for adjusting aquaculture environment shall be managed in accordance with relevant regulations of law. After being used, packages of fertilizers, animal feeds, aquafeeds, pesticides, veterinary medicines, products for adjusting aquaculture environment, products for treating livestock waste, mud and residual feed in aquaculture ponds shall be managed in accordance with regulations on waste management. Mud dredged from canals, ditches and irrigation works shall be collected, recycled and managed in accordance with regulations of law. Bodies of animals killed by epidemics shall be collected and treated in accordance with regulations of law on hazardous waste management and hygiene for disease prevention. 4. Agricultural by-products must be collected for production of commodities, raw materials, fuels, fertilizers and energy or treated under regulations; by-products from plants causing environmental pollution must not be burned outdoors. 5. The use of waste from animal husbandry for organic fertilizers, watering or other purposes must comply with the Government's regulations. 6. The State shall adopt policies to encourage the renewal of agricultural production models and methods towards sustainability, adaptation to climate change, water conservation, restriction on the use of inorganic fertilizers, chemical plant protection drugs and environmental treatment products in agriculture; develop environmentally friendly agricultural models. 7. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall direct and organize the management of sludge dredged from canals, ditches and irrigation works to meet environmental protection requirements.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@62: Environmental protection in health activities and control of the impact of environmental pollution on human health 1. Hospitals and other medical establishments must meet environmental protection requirements, including : a) Collect and treat wastewater meeting environmental protection requirements before discharging it into the environment; b) Classify solid wastes at source; collect, store, transport and treat solid wastes to meet environmental protection requirements. In case domestic solid wastes and ordinary solid wastes are mixed with infectious biomedical waste, they must be managed as infectious biomedical waste; c) Priority shall be given to selection of non-combustion technology which is environmentally friendly and meets environmental protection requirements in treatment of infectious biomedical waste; d) Infectious biomedical waste shall be disinfected to eliminate potentially infectious pathogens before being transferred to the centralized treatment facility; dd) There are plans and equipment for prevention and response to environmental emergencies caused by biomedical waste; e) Exhaust gases must be treated to meet environmental protection requirements; g) Construct and operate sanitation facilities, waste collection, storage and treatment systems as regulated. 2. Medical facilities using radioactive sources and radiological equipment must satisfy the requirements for atomic energy. 3. Pollutants directly affecting human health must be managed as follows: a) Identification, assessment, warning, prevention and control of pollutants likely to affect human health; diseases and human health directly related to pollutants; b) Control and treatment from the sources of pollution with regard to pollutants that affect human health and diseases determined to be caused directly by pollutants; c) Management, sharing and publishing of information about pollutants that directly affect human health. 4. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide detailed regulations on the transport and treatment of biomedical waste. 5. The Minister of Health shall provide guidelines for classification, collection, storage and management of biomedical waste within the precincts of medical establishments; determination, assessment, warning, monitoring and detection of symptoms and causes of diseases and human health issues directly related to pollutants; determination and announcement of limits of pollutants in the human body that may cause health effects; management, statistics, sharing and announcement of information about diseases related to pollutants; assessment of costs and economic losses caused by diseases and health issues related to environmental pollution; development, provision of guidelines and implementation of measures for monitoring and prevention of diseases and human health issues caused by pollutants; management, sharing, exchange and announcement of information about pollutants that cause health effects on human health. 6. Provincial-level People's Committees shall provide for the collection, transportation and treatment of medical solid waste suitable to local conditions; and take responsibility for managing pollutants related to diseases and human health in their localities.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@63: Environmental protection in burial and cremation 1. The burial/cremation area must be conformable with the planning; located at a distance that meets the requirements for environmental hygiene, landscape of residential areas and does not pollute the water sources and surrounding environment. The Government shall provide for environmental protection in burial and cremation activities in conformity with the characteristics of customs, practices, beliefs and religions. 2. The lying in state, embalming, transportation and burial of corpses and remains must satisfy environmental sanitation requirements. 3. Organizations and individuals providing burial and cremation services shall comply with regulations of law on environmental protection and prevention and control of infectious diseases. 4. The State encourages hygienic cremation and burial in cemeteries under planning; and abolishes bad practices in burial and cremation which cause environmental pollution. 5. The Minister of Health shall provide for burial and cremation of persons who die of dangerous epidemics.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@64: Environmental protection in construction activities 1. Construction planning must ensure environmental protection and climate change adaptation requirements. 2. The planning of urban centers and concentrated residential areas must be directed toward the development of ecological urban centers, energy conservation, use of renewable energy, and assurance of the ratio of greenery, water surface and landscape areas as prescribed by law. 3. The State encourages the reuse of waste from construction activities, use of non-baked materials and environment-friendly materials in construction. 4. When granting construction permits or appraising construction designs of investment projects in accordance with the construction law, works, work items, waste treatment equipment and environmental incident prevention and response works must comply with the law on environmental protection. 5. The construction, renovation, repair and dismantlement of construction works must satisfy the following environmental protection requirements : a) Take measures to prevent dust, heat, noise, vibration and light from spreading beyond permissible limits according to environmental technical regulations; b) The transport of materials and wastes in construction activities must be carried out by appropriate means, ensuring no leakage, drop and environmental pollution; c) Wastewater must be collected and treated to meet environmental protection requirements; d) Solid wastes and scrap that are still usable shall be recycled and reused as prescribed; soil, stone and solid waste from construction activities shall be reused as building materials and ground leveling as prescribed; dd) Soil and sludge generated from excavation, dredging of topsoil and digging of pile foundations shall be used to fill in planting land or appropriate land areas; e) Waste sludge generated from septic tanks and bridges must be managed according to regulations on management of ordinary industrial solid waste; g) Solid wastes and other types of waste must be collected, stored, transported to the treatment places in accordance with regulations on waste management. 6. Wastes from renovation and dismantlement of construction works of households and individuals in urban centers must be collected and transferred to establishments with the treatment function under regulations of provincial-level People's Committees, except the cases specified at Points d and e, Clause 5 of this Article. 7. Wastes discharged from the renovation or demolition of construction works of households and individuals in rural areas where waste collection and treatment systems are not available must be reused or discharged according to regulations of provincial-level People's Committees; wastes must not be discharged into roads, rivers, streams, canals and other surface water sources, thus affecting landscapes and the environment. 8. Provincial-level People's Committees shall provide for the collection, transportation and treatment of construction solid waste and planning of places for discharging waste from construction activities; sludge from septic tanks, bridge tunnels and sludge from water drainage systems. 9. The Minister of Construction shall formulate standards and technical regulations on design of solid waste collection systems suitable to the source-based solid waste sorting of commercial centers in combination with apartments; apartment buildings in combination with offices; and multi-story buildings with mixed functions.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@65: Environmental protection in transport activities 1. Transport vehicles must be inspected and certified by registration agencies as meeting environmental technical regulations in accordance with law and treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. 2. Vehicles transporting raw materials, materials and wastes must be covered and not dropped causing environmental pollution when participating in traffic. 3. Organizations and individuals transporting dangerous goods must satisfy all conditions and capacity on environmental protection as prescribed by law. 4. The transport of goods and materials likely to cause pollution and environmental incidents must be carried out with special-use equipment and means, ensuring no leakage or dispersion into the environment. 5. The construction of traffic works must take measures to limit and minimize impacts on the terrain, landscape, geology and natural heritages. 6. Provincial People's Committees shall regulate areas and locations for dumping and dumping of dredged materials from inland waterway and sea transportation systems; adopt solutions to divert traffic flows and control environmental pollution to limit air pollution in special-grade and grade-I urban areas. 7. The Government shall promulgate incentive policies, support and encourage the development of public transport vehicles, vehicles using renewable energy, low fuel consumption, low emission or no emission; road map for conversion and elimination of vehicles using fossil fuels and vehicles causing environmental pollution. 8. The Minister of Transport shall promulgate national technical regulations on technical safety and quality and environmental protection for means of transport in accordance with the law on transport, product and goods quality and other relevant laws; provide guidance and organize dredging operations within seaport waters and inland water areas in accordance with regulations in force.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@66: Environmental protection in cultural, sports and tourist activities 1. Organizations and individuals managing and operating relics, relics, tourist resorts, tourist attractions, tourist accommodation establishments, places of recreation, performance and competition in physical training and sports, and units organizing touting ceremonies shall comply with Clause 2, Article 59 of this Law. 2. Individuals who visit monuments, relics, tourist resorts, tourist attractions, tourist accommodation establishments, places of recreation, performance, competition, places of worship shall fulfill the following obligations : a) Comply with regulations on environmental hygiene and safety; b) Waste shall be disposed of at prescribed places; generation of plastic waste shall be restricted; c) Keep the forest reproductive resources; d) Not to infringe upon the environment landscape and species. 3. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism has the following responsibilities: a) Organize the implementation of regulations on environmental protection applied to tourist accommodation establishments and tourism services; develop eco-friendly tourist accommodation establishments and tourism services; b) Organize implementation of regulations on encouragement of minimization, reuse and recycling of plastic waste in cultural, sporting and tourist activities;
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@67: Environmental protection in mineral exploration, extraction and processing and petroleum activities 1. Organizations and individuals conducting mineral exploration, exploitation and processing must have plans to prevent and respond to environmental incidents and satisfy the following environmental protection, improvement and restoration requirements : a) Collect and treat wastewater as prescribed; b) Collect and treat solid waste in accordance with regulations on solid waste management; c) Take measures to prevent and limit the dispersion of dust, emission and other negative impacts on the surrounding environment; d) Have plans for environmental improvement and remediation and carry out environmental improvement and remediation in mineral extraction activities in accordance with regulations of this Law and the law on minerals; dd) Environmental protection deposits as prescribed in Article 137 of this Law. 2. The subjects of mineral exploitation must make plan on environmental renovation and restoration, including: a) Mineral extraction projects; b) The mineral extraction establishment has operated before the effective date of this Law but has not had the environmental improvement and remediation plan or has changed the contents of environmental improvement and remediation compared with the approved plan; c) The mineral extraction establishment operating before the effective date of this Law has its environmental improvement and remediation plan approved but its budget is not sufficient to implement it as prescribed by law. 3. Contents of the environmental improvement and remediation plan are specified as follows: a) Environmental remediation solutions; analysis, assessment and selection of best solutions for environmental remediation; b) List and quantity of environmental remediation works with respect to selected solutions; c) Implementation plan divided by each year, each stage of environmental renovation and restoration; environmental observation program during the environmental renovation and restoration; plan for inspection and certification of plan completion; d) The estimate of budget for environmental remediation for each environmental remediation work item; the deposits according to the roadmap. 4. Minerals with toxic properties must be stored and transported by specialized means and equipment, covered to ensure no leakage and dispersion to the environment. 5. The use of machinery and equipment that cause bad impacts on the environment and toxic chemicals in the exploration, extraction, mine closure and mineral processing must be assessed and declared in the application for environmental licenses. 6. Exploration, extraction, transport and processing of other minerals containing radioactive substances, toxic substances and explosives must comply with regulations of this Law, regulations of law on chemical safety, atomic energy and other relevant regulations of law. 7. The Government shall provide guidelines for formulation and assessment of environmental improvement and remediation plans in mineral extraction; specific requirements for environmental protection in trial operation, waste management and environmental monitoring for exploration, extraction and transport of oil and gas and relevant services at sea. 8. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall promulgate forms and technical instructions for implementation of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@68: Environmental protection for research and training institutions and laboratories 1. Research and training institutions and laboratories must comply with the following environmental protection requirements: 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide guidelines for the implementation of environmental protection regulations in the following cases : a) Collect and treat wastewater and exhaust gases to meet environmental protection requirements; b) Classify solid waste at source, collect and manage it in accordance with regulations of law on waste management; c) Treat and destroy samples, analytes and chemicals in accordance with environmental standards; d) Have plans and equipment for prevention and response to environmental emergencies; dd) Other requirements as prescribed by relevant law provisions. 2. Research and training institutions and laboratories that have radioactive sources, radiation equipment, nuclear material or equipment must satisfy the requirements specified by the law on atomic energy.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@69: Environmental protection in the management of persistent pollutants and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing persistent pollutants 1. Requirements for environmental protection in the management of persistent pollutants and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing persistent pollutants are specified as follows: a) Do not produce, export, import and use persistent organic pollutants and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing persistent organic pollutants in Annex A of Stockholm Convention with contents exceeding the permissible maximum limit as prescribed by law, except for persistent organic pollutants which have been registered for exemption as prescribed by Stockholm Convention; b) Control sources of POPs and publish information, label, assess conformity and inspect POPs and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing POPs as prescribed by law; c) POPs and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing POPs in excess of the permissible limits prescribed by law may be recycled or destroyed provided that the recycling and destruction does not lead to the recovery of these POPs for reuse and satisfy environmental protection requirements; d) POPs and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing POPs in excess of the permissible limit shall be stored, recalled, managed and treated to meet environmental protection requirements as regulated, except for cases where POPs have been recycled or destroyed as regulated in Point c of this Clause; dd) POPs and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing POPs must be reported by production, trading and service establishments on types and results of calculation of pollutants discharged into water, air and soil according to the list and transferred for handling for information management, environmental risk assessment and management in accordance with law; e) The areas where POPs are left in existence and polluted must be assessed, identified and warned of risks and proposed measures for safety management, environmental remediation and treatment. 2. Environmental protection responsibilities in the management of persistent pollutants and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing persistent pollutants are prescribed as follows: a) Organizations and individuals shall comply with the requirements specified in Clause 1 of this Article; b/The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with concerned ministries and ministerial-level agencies in, guiding and organizing the implementation of Clause 1 of this Article; integrate information on observation of POPs in national environmental status reports under the Stockholm Convention and other relevant treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party and law; c) Relevant Ministries, ministerial agencies and provincial People's Committees shall organize the implementation of environmental protection requirements for persistent pollutants and raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment containing persistent pollutants in the fields under their management in accordance with Stockholm Convention, other relevant international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory and regulations of law; d) The Government shall elaborate on environmental protection in management of persistent pollutants, raw materials, fuels, materials, products, commodities and equipment containing persistent pollutants in accordance with regulations of the Stockholm Convention and other relevant international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@70: Environmental protection in import, temporary import for re-export and transit of goods 1. Organizations and individuals shall not import the following machinery, equipment, vehicles, raw materials, scraps and goods: 1. The Ministry of Industry and Trade shall inspect the import of the following machinery, equipment, vehicles, raw materials, scraps and goods : a) Used machinery, equipment and vehicles used for demolition, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article; b/Machinery, equipment, means, goods, raw materials and discarded materials contaminated with radioactive, pathogenic germs or other toxins which have not yet been cleaned or cannot be cleaned. 2. The import and dismantlement of used ships must comply with environmental technical regulations. The Government shall specify subjects and conditions for import and dismantlement of used ships. 3. Temporary import, re-export and transit of goods likely to cause environmental pollution shall comply with regulations of law on foreign trade management.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@71: Environmental protection in import of scrap from foreign countries 1. Scrap imported into Vietnam must meet environmental technical regulations and be on the Prime Minister's list of scrap permitted for import as production raw materials. 2. Organizations and individuals are only permitted to import scrap from foreign countries as raw production materials for their production facilities and must meet the following environmental protection requirements: 1. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment in, guiding and inspecting the implementation of this Decree. a) Having production facilities with technology, recycling and reuse equipment, warehouses and yards dedicated to gathering scrap meeting the environmental protection requirements; having plan on treatment of impurities accompanied in line with imported scrap; b) Having environmental permits; c) To pay environmental protection deposit as prescribed in Article 137 of this Law before the time scraps are unloaded at port for cases of import through sea border gate or before the time of import into Vietnam for other cases; d) Having written commitment on re-export or treatment of scrap in case the imported scrap does not meet the requirements for environmental protection. 3. The Government shall elaborate Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@72: Waste management requirements 1. General requirements for management of domestic solid waste, hazardous waste and non-hazardous industrial solid waste are specified as follows: a) Waste must be managed during the generation, reduction, classification, collection, storage, transit, transport, reuse, recycling, treatment and destruction; b) The owner of hazardous waste, ordinary industrial solid waste discharge source shall reuse, recycle, treat and recover energy from waste or transfer to the facility with appropriate function and environmental license for treatment; c) The source owner of controlled industrial waste shall be responsible for delimiting hazardous waste or ordinary industrial solid waste through the collection and analysis of samples carried out by functional and qualified facilities as prescribed by law. After delimiting, industrial waste must be managed as prescribed by law; d) The waste meeting technical regulations and standards of raw materials, fuels and materials as prescribed by law on product and goods quality is managed as products and goods and is allowed to be used directly as raw materials, fuels and materials for production activities; dd) Organizations and individuals transporting daily-life solid waste, hazardous waste, ordinary industrial solid waste subject to treatment shall transport waste to the facilities with appropriate functions and environmental licenses or transfer it to other organizations and individuals for transportation to the facilities with appropriate functions and environmental licenses; e) The management of radioactive waste shall comply with the provisions of the law on atomic energy. 2. General requirements for wastewater management are specified as follows: a) Wastewater must be collected and treated in accordance with environmental standards before being discharged into receiving waters; b) Wastewater is encouraged to be reused when it meets the requirements for environmental protection and water use purposes; c) Wastewater containing hazardous environmental parameters exceeding the prescribed level must be managed under regulations on hazardous waste management; d) The discharge of treated wastewater into the environment must be managed in accordance with the law on environmental protection and the load capacity of the receiving environment. 3. Gas emissions must be collected and treated to meet environmental protection requirements. 4. Waste-generating organizations and individuals shall apply natural resource-and energy-saving solutions; use environmentally friendly raw materials, fuels and materials and renewable energies; apply cleaner production technologies and programs, environmental control and other measures to minimize waste generation; update information on the national environmental database when transferring hazardous and ordinary industrial solid wastes to establishments with appropriate environmental licenses. 5. The State shall adopt policies to socialize the collection, transportation, reuse, recycling, treatment and recovery of energy from waste treatment; apply advanced and environmentally friendly waste treatment technologies and best existing techniques in order to minimize and control arising secondary wastes and minimize the amount of solid waste to be buried; encourage co-treatment of wastes and use of wastes as raw materials, fuels and substitute materials. 6. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall promulgate the list of hazardous waste, industrial waste to be controlled and ordinary industrial solid waste; technical requirements on environmental protection for means of transporting daily-life solid waste, ordinary industrial solid waste and hazardous waste. 7. Provincial-level People's Committees shall manage waste in their localities; promulgate regulations on waste management and implement incentive and support policies for waste management activities in accordance with law. 8. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on prevention, reduction, classification, collection, transport, reuse, recycling and treatment of waste.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@73: Plastic waste minimization, reuse, recycling and treatment, pollution prevention of ocean plastic waste 1. Organizations and individuals shall be responsible for limiting use, reducing, classifying and disposing of waste which is disposable plastic products and plastic packaging which is not biodegradable as prescribed; not disposing plastic waste directly into water drainage systems, ponds, lakes, canals, rivers and oceans. 2. Plastic waste generated from activities of tourism and marine services, maritime economy, exploitation of oil and gas and marine mineral resources, aquaculture and fishing must be collected, stored and transferred to facilities with function of recycling and treatment. 3. Environmental friendly products, disposable plastic product substitutes and plastic packaging substitutes certified shall be eligible for incentives and supports as per the law. 4. Plastic waste must be collected and classified for reuse, recycling or treatment as per the law. Non-recyclable plastic waste must be transferred to facilities licensed to treat as per the law. Plastic waste generated from economic activities at sea must be collected for reuse, recycling or treatment and must not be discharged into the sea. 5. The State encourages reuse and recycling of plastic waste for production of goods, building materials and traffic works; encourages research and development of systems for collecting and treating plastic waste floating on sea and ocean; adopts policies to promote reuse and recycling of plastic waste. 6. Provincial People's Committees shall direct the collection and treatment of plastic waste in their provinces; disseminate and encourage the restriction on the use of non-biodegradable plastic packages and disposable plastic products; disseminate the harmful effects of the disposal of fishing gears and plastic waste on the ecosystem. 7. The Government shall provide the roadmap for restricting the production and import of disposable plastic products, packaging of non-biodegradable plastic products and products and goods containing microplastics.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@74: Environmental audit 1. Environmental audit means systematic and comprehensive examination and assessment of environmental management and pollution control effectiveness of production, business and service establishments. 2. Main contents of environmental audit for production, business and service facilities include: a) Use of energy, chemicals, raw materials and scrap imported from abroad as raw production materials; b/Control of pollution and management of wastes. 3. Production, business and service establishments are encouraged to conduct environmental audit by themselves. 4. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide technical guidance on environmental self-assessment by production, business and service establishments.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@75: Classification, storage and transfer of daily-life solid waste 1. Daily-life solid waste generated from households and individuals is classified according to the following principles: a) Recyclable solid waste; b) Food wastes; c) Other daily-life solid waste. 2. The provincial People's Committees shall decide the specific classification of daily-life solid waste specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article in their localities under the guidance of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment; have policies to encourage the separate classification of hazardous waste in daily-life solid waste generated from households and individuals. 3. Households and individuals in urban areas must store and store daily-life solid waste after classification as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article in packages for transfer as follows: a) Recyclable solid waste shall be transferred to the recycling organizations and individuals or the facilities that collect and transport domestic solid waste; b) Food wastes and other daily-life solid wastes must be stored, contained in packages as prescribed and transferred to the facilities with function of collection, transportation of daily-life solid wastes; food wastes may be used as organic fertilizers, animal feeds. 4. Households and individuals in rural areas that generate daily-life solid waste after classification as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article shall manage as follows: a) Encouraging the full utilization of food waste for organic fertilizer and animal feed production; b) Recyclable solid waste shall be transferred to the recycling organizations and individuals or the facilities that collect and transport domestic solid waste; c) Food waste not complying with the provisions of point a of this clause must be transferred to the facilities with function of collection and transportation of daily-life solid waste; d) Other daily-life solid waste must be stored, contained in packages as prescribed and transferred to the facilities with function of collection and transportation of daily-life solid waste. 5. Households and individuals in rural areas that generate daily-life solid waste are encouraged to classify, store and transfer daily-life solid waste under Clause 3 of this Article. 6. Classification, collection, transportation and treatment of cumbersome wastes shall comply with regulations of provincial-level People's Committees. 7. The Committees of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front, socio-political organizations at all levels shall encourage the residential communities, households and individuals to classify daily-life solid waste at source. The residential communities and socio-political organizations at the grassroots level shall supervise the classification of daily-life solid waste of households and individuals.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@76: Daily-life solid waste gathering points and transit stations 1. Daily-life solid waste gathering points and transit stations must have different areas for storing classified daily-life solid waste, ensuring that the classified waste types are not mixed with each other. 2. People's Committees at all levels shall arrange ground for gathering points and transit stations to meet technical requirements on environmental protection under regulations of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@77: Collection and transportation of daily-life solid waste 1. People's Committees at all levels shall select daily-life solid waste collection and transportation establishments through bidding under the bidding law; in case of failure to select through bidding, they shall perform the form of order placement or task assignment under law. 2. Daily-life solid waste collection and transportation establishments may refuse to collect and transport daily-life solid waste of households and individuals without classification or packing in accordance with regulations and notify competent agencies for inspection and handling in accordance with law, except cases where households and individuals use packings of other daily-life solid waste as prescribed at Point c, Clause 1, Article 75 of this Law. 3. Daily-life solid waste collection and transportation establishments shall coordinate with commune-level People's Committees, communities and representatives of residential areas in determining time, place, frequency and route of daily-life solid waste collection and publicize them. 4. Daily-life solid waste collection and transportation establishments must use equipment and means designed suitably for each type of daily-life solid waste classified, meeting technical requirements on environmental protection as prescribed by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment; the daily-life solid waste transportation must comply with routes and time as prescribed by provincial-level People's Committees. 5. Households and individuals shall be responsible for transporting the sorted MSW to the gathering point as regulated or transferring it to the MSW collection and transport establishment. 6. The investor, owner, management board of new urban areas, multi-story apartment buildings, office buildings must arrange equipment and works for daily-life solid waste storage in accordance with types of waste as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 75 of this Law; collect waste from households and individuals and transfer it to the daily-life solid waste collection and transportation facility. 7. Responsibilities of People's Committees of communes : a) Inspect the compliance with regulations of law on environmental protection in collection and transport of domestic solid waste; handle violations against regulations on management of domestic solid waste within their competence; consider and handle proposals and feedbacks of organizations, residential communities, households and individuals related to collection and transport of domestic solid waste; b) Take charge and cooperate with daily-life solid waste collection and transportation facilities, residential communities and socio-political organizations at the grassroots level in determining time, location, frequency and route of daily-life solid waste collection; c) Instruct households and individuals to transfer daily-life solid waste to the collection and transport facilities or to the gathering points as prescribed; instruct residential community to supervise and publicize cases of failing to comply with regulations on classification and collection of daily-life solid waste.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@78: Daily-life solid waste treatment 1. The State encourages and has incentive policies for organizations and individuals participating in investment and provision of daily-life solid waste treatment services; encourages the co-treatment of daily-life solid waste. 2. People's Committees at all levels shall select daily-life solid waste treatment facilities through bidding under the bidding law; in case of failing to select through bidding, they shall perform in the form of order placement or task assignment under law. 3. The MSW treatment service provider must satisfy environmental protection requirements prescribed in this Law. Investment in MSW treatment service providers that only serve a commune is not encouraged. 4. Daily-life solid waste must be treated by appropriate technology meeting environmental technical regulations. The Government shall provide for roadmaps to limit daily-life solid waste treatment by direct burial technology. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall promulgate criteria for domestic solid waste treatment technologies; provide guidance on domestic solid waste treatment models in urban areas and rural areas. 6. The People's Committees of provinces shall plan and allocate land for daily-life solid waste treatment areas, promptly allocate land for construction and operation of daily-life solid waste treatment areas in their provinces; allocate funding for construction and operation of daily-life solid waste collection, storage, transit, transport and treatment systems; public works, measures and equipment serving daily-life solid waste management in their provinces.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@79: Costs of collection, transportation and treatment of daily-life solid waste 1. The prices of MSW collection, transportation and treatment services applied to households and individuals shall be determined according to the following bases: a) Conformity with the law on prices; b) Based on the volume or volume of the classified waste; c) Solid wastes that can be recycled and hazardous wastes generated from households and individuals that have been classified shall not be charged collection, transport, and treatment services. 2. In case households and individuals fail to classify or classify improperly as prescribed in Points a and b Clause 1 Article 75 of this Law, they must pay the collection, transport and treatment service charges as for other daily-life solid waste. 3. Agencies, organizations, production, business and service establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters that have generated waste from daily-life activities, offices with small volume as prescribed by the Government may choose form of daily-life solid waste management like households and individuals specified in Article 75 of this Law or manage as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article. 4. Agencies, organizations, production, business and service establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones and industrial clusters that discharge large volumes of waste from daily-life activities and offices under the Government's regulations shall transfer such waste to waste recycling, reusing and treating establishments with appropriate functions or to collecting and transporting establishments with appropriate means and equipment for transportation to solid waste recycling, reusing and treating establishments with appropriate functions. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide guidance on pricing of MSW treatment services; provide economic and technical norms for MSW collection, transport and treatment; provide technical instructions on classification of MSW; and provide guidance on implementation of Clause 1 of this Article. 6. The People's Committees of provinces shall provide guidance on daily-life solid waste management of households and individuals in their provinces; impose prices of daily-life solid waste collection, transportation and treatment services; specify the forms and amounts of money that households and individuals must pay for daily-life solid waste collection, transportation and treatment based on the volume of classified wastes. 7. Regulations laid down in clause 1 of this Article and clause 1 of Article 75 herein must be implemented by December 31,2024 at the latest.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@80: Pollution treatment, environmental improvement of daily-life solid waste landfills 1. After being closed, domestic solid waste landfills and domestic solid waste landfills that are not hygienic must be treated for pollution and improved to meet the requirements for environmental protection. 2. Every investor or MSW landfill management facility shall : a) Immediately after the shutdown of the domestic solid waste landfill, the landscape of the area must be improved and measures for preventing environmental pollution must be taken; b) Monitor environmental developments at the domestic solid waste landfill from the closing date of the landfill and submit reports to the provincial environmental protection authority as prescribed; c) Complete the pollution treatment, environmental improvement, prepare dossier and hand over the premises to the competent state authorities after the end of operation. 3. The Government shall promulgate incentive policies and encourage organizations and individuals to invest in environmental treatment and improvement of daily-life solid waste landfills. 4. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide guidance on shutdown of domestic solid waste landfills. 5. The People's Committees of provinces shall provide resources and funding for environmental remediation of domestic solid waste landfills under the management of the State and domestic solid waste landfills within their provinces.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@81: Classification, storage and transportation of ordinary industrial solid waste 1. Ordinary industrial solid wastes are classified into the following groups: a) Group of ordinary industrial solid waste which is reused, recycled as raw materials for production; b) Group of ordinary industrial solid waste meeting technical standards, regulations and instructions used in production of building materials and leveling; c) Group of ordinary industrial solid waste to be treated. 2. Owners of production, business and service establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters and agencies and organizations that generate ordinary industrial solid wastes shall classify them at source under Clause 1 of this Article and store them to ensure no environmental pollution. Unclassified ordinary industrial solid wastes must be managed like wastes specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article. 3. Ordinary industrial solid wastes mixed with hazardous wastes which are unclassified or unclassifiable shall be managed under regulations on hazardous waste management. 4. Ordinary industrial solid waste must be stored separately by the classified type; not to mix hazardous waste with ordinary industrial solid waste; not to spread dust, leak wastewater into the environment; to store with equipment, tools, storage areas in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Natural Resources and Environment. 5. The transportation of ordinary industrial solid waste must meet the following requirements: a) Waste must be stored and contained in equipment and tools to ensure no drop, leak or dispersion to the environment during transportation, except for special waste with large volume that must be stored and contained directly by equipment and containers of means of transportation; b) Waste must be transported by type after it has been classified as prescribed; c) Means of transportation of ordinary industrial solid waste subject to treatment must have positioning equipment meeting technical requirements, operating according to routes and time specified by the provincial People's Committees.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@82: Conventional industrial solid waste treatment 1. Manufacturing and business establishments, service providers, concentrated manufacturing and business zones, industrial clusters, organizations that generate ordinary industrial solid waste must reuse, recycle, recover energy and treat ordinary industrial solid waste or transfer it to the following entities: a) Production facilities directly used as raw materials for production, production of building materials or leveling of ground are permitted to operate as prescribed by law; b) Production facilities with appropriate co-treatment functions; c) Ordinary industrial solid waste treatment facilities with appropriate functions; d) Ordinary industrial solid waste transport facilities that have signed transfer contracts with entities specified in Points a, b or c of this Clause. 2. Ordinary industrial solid waste treatment service providers must satisfy environmental protection requirements prescribed in this Law. 3. The owner of the facility providing ordinary industrial solid waste treatment services shall : a) Ensure that systems, means, equipment, storage and treatment of ordinary industrial solid waste including pre-processing, reuse, recycling, co-treatment, treatment and energy recovery of ordinary industrial solid waste meet technical requirements and management procedures as prescribed; b) Fulfill responsibilities of hazardous waste generators in case hazardous waste is generated from the facility providing ordinary industrial solid waste treatment services as regulated; c) Make periodic and irregular reports on generation and treatment of ordinary industrial solid waste at the request of competent state management agencies; d) Use the record of transfer of ordinary industrial solid waste to be treated for each time of transfer; make a log of operation of treatment systems, means and equipment including preliminary treatment, reuse, recycling, co-treatment and recovery of energy from ordinary industrial solid waste; a log of quantity of products recycled or recovered from ordinary industrial solid waste (if any). 4. Organizations and individuals that generate ordinary industrial solid waste to be treated may themselves recycle, treat, co-treat or recover energy when meeting the following requirements: a) The environmental protection works and equipment available in the premises of the facility that generates ordinary industrial solid wastes must be implemented and satisfy environmental protection requirements as prescribed; b) Be conformable with the decision on approval for the result of appraisal of EIA report and environmental license; c) Failing to invest in new incinerators and landfills to treat ordinary industrial solid waste, except for cases in accordance with the contents of solid waste management in the relevant plannings.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@83: Hazardous waste declaration, classification, collection, storage and transportation 1. The hazardous waste generators have the following responsibilities: a) Declaring volume, type of hazardous waste in dossier requesting for environmental license or content of environmental registration; b) Delimit, classify, collect and store hazardous wastes separately and ensure no environmental pollution; c) Re-use, recycle, treat, co-treat, recover energy themselves as prescribed by law or transfer hazardous waste to the facilities with appropriate environmental licenses for treatment. 2. The storage of hazardous waste must meet the following requirements: a) They must be stored separately according to the classified types; b) Not to let hazardous waste mixed with ordinary waste; c) Do not spread dust, leak liquid waste into the environment; d) The documents shall be retained for a certain period of time as prescribed by law. 3. Hazardous wastes, when being transported, must be stored and transported by appropriate specialized equipment and means to waste treatment facilities. Means of transporting hazardous wastes must be installed with positioning equipment; operate according to routes and time as prescribed by provincial-level People's Committees. 4. Entities permitted to transport hazardous wastes include: a) The hazardous waste generators have appropriate means and equipment meeting technical requirements, management process as prescribed by law on environmental protection; b) Establishments licensed to treat hazardous wastes suitable to the types of wastes to be transported. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide technical instructions and forms for declaration, classification, collection and storage of hazardous waste; technical instructions on means and equipment for storage, transport, prevention and response to incidents during the transport and treatment of hazardous waste; instructions on registration and cross-border transport of hazardous waste in accordance with Basel Convention on control of cross-border transport of hazardous waste and their destruction.

The provincial People's Committees shall organize the implementation of planning with contents on hazardous waste treatment; not limit the collection of hazardous waste generated in the area of other provincial administrative units for treatment at the facilities performing the hazardous waste treatment services in the area.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@85: Responsibilities of owners of hazardous waste treatment service facilities 1. Fully satisfying the requirements specified in Clause 3, Article 84 of this Law. 2. Collect, transport, receive and treat the quantity and types of hazardous waste in accordance with the contents of the environmental license issued. 3. Ensure that hazardous waste storage and treatment systems, means and equipment meet technical requirements and management procedures as regulated. 4.
