Fulfill responsibilities of hazardous waste generators for hazardous waste generated from the operation process that is not capable of treatment. 5. Register with the environmental licensing agency under its authority to be approved when having a need for associated transport of hazardous waste not included in its environmental license for the owner of other hazardous waste treatment service provider with appropriate functions as prescribed by the Government. 6. Prepare, use, store and manage hazardous waste documents, reports on hazardous waste management and records, documents and diaries related to hazardous waste management as prescribed. 7. Publicize and provide information about types and quantity of hazardous waste collected and treated, treatment methods; information about names and addresses of hazardous waste generators that are collected and treated and other environmental information that must be publicized and provided as prescribed in Article 114 of this Law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@86: Wastewater collection and treatment 1. New urban areas, residential areas; production, business and service establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters must have wastewater collection and treatment systems separate from rainwater drainage systems, except for special cases prescribed by the Government. 2. Management of wastewater in urban areas and residential areas is prescribed as follows: a) Domestic wastewater generated from organizations and households must be collected and connected to wastewater collection and treatment systems; b) Wastewater generated from production, business and service activities in urban areas must be collected and preliminarily treated before being connected to the urban wastewater collection and treatment system; the preliminarily treated wastewater must meet the regulations of urban areas, concentrated residential areas or the regulations of local authorities; c) Wastewater generated from production, business and service activities in urban areas without centralized wastewater treatment facilities must be collected and treated to meet environmental protection requirements before being discharged into receiving waters. 3. Wastewater from production, business and service activities shall be managed as follows: a) Wastewater of production, business and service establishments in concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters shall be collected and preliminarily treated before being connected to the system of industrial wastewater collection and treatment at the request of investors of concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters, ensuring that wastewater must be treated to meet the environmental protection requirements; b) Wastewater of production, business and service establishments located outside urban areas, residential areas, concentrated production, business and service areas, industrial clusters which cannot be connected to the wastewater collection and treatment system must be collected and treated to meet environmental protection requirements before being discharged into receiving waters. 4. Domestic wastewater generated from organizations and households in residential areas without concentration must be collected and treated on the spot to meet the environmental protection requirements before being discharged into receiving sources. 5. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Invest and encourage investment in the construction of wastewater collection and treatment systems in urban areas and residential areas within the State's investment responsibility in accordance with laws; b) Issue the roadmap for allocation of land, investment in or encouragement of investment in construction of wastewater collection and treatment systems in urban areas and residential areas in case wastewater collection and treatment systems are not available; c) Issue the roadmap and support policies for organizations and households in urban areas and residential areas to build works and install on-site wastewater treatment equipment to meet environmental protection requirements before discharging into receiving waters in case land for construction of wastewater collection and treatment systems in urban areas and residential areas which have been established before the effective date of this Law is not available; d) Issue the roadmap and policies on assistance in collection and treatment of domestic wastewater from organizations and households in residential areas without concentration. 6. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide guidance on on-site wastewater treatment technologies and techniques. 7. The Minister of Construction shall provide guidance on technical infrastructural constructions for collecting and draining wastewater in urban areas and residential areas specified in this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@87: Sewage treatment system 1. Wastewater treatment systems must meet the following requirements: a) The technology is suitable for the type and characteristics of wastewater to be treated; b) Capacity of water treatment system must be consistent with the maximum volume of generated wastewater; c) Wastewater treatment must meet environmental protection requirements; d) Operate the wastewater treatment works in accordance with technical procedures; dd) There is a plan for prevention and response to environmental emergencies with regard to the wastewater treatment system; the discharge point must have clear coordinates, signs and symbols that facilitate the inspection and supervision of discharge. 2. Waste sludge discharged from wastewater treatment systems must be managed in accordance with laws on solid waste management; waste sludge containing hazardous elements exceeding the prescribed limit must be managed in accordance with laws on hazardous waste management.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@88: Management and control of dust and gas emissions 1. Organizations and individuals engaged in production, business and service activities that emit dust and exhaust gases shall control and treat dust and exhaust gases in accordance with environmental technical regulations. Dust with hazardous elements exceeding the prescribed level shall be managed in accordance with regulations of law on hazardous waste management. 2. Vehicles, machinery, equipment and construction works that emit dust and exhaust gases must have exhaust filter, exhaust reduction device, shielding equipment or other measures to minimize dust in accordance with environmental technical regulations. 3. Relevant Ministries and ministerial agencies shall provide guidance on prevention, inspection, supervision, and treatment of dust and emission sources that cause air pollution.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@89: Management and control of noise, vibration, light, radiation, and bad smells 1. Organizations and individuals that cause noise, vibration, light and radiation shall control and treat noise, vibration, light and radiation in accordance with environmental and radiation technical regulations. 2. Organizations and individuals in residential areas that cause noises, vibration, light, radiation or unpleasant odors shall take measures to minimize such noise, vibration, radiation or unpleasant odors without adversely affecting residential communities. 3. Organizations and individuals managing roads with high traffic density causing noise, vibration, light and radiation must have measures to minimize and meet environmental technical regulations. 4. Production, import, transport, trading and use of firecrackers are prohibited. Production, import, transport, trading and use of fireworks shall comply with regulations of the Government.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@90: Climate change adaptation 1. Climate change adaptation means activities aiming to increase the resilience of natural and social systems, minimize negative impacts of climate change and take advantage of opportunities brought about by climate change. 2. Climate change adaptation contents include: a) Assessment of impacts, vulnerability, risks, losses and damage caused by climate change on sectors, areas and residential communities on the basis of climate change scenarios and socio-economic development forecasts; b) Implement climate change adaptation actions, natural disaster risk mitigation, community-based and ecosystem-based climate change adaptation models; respond to sea level rise and urban flooding; c) Develop and implement the system for monitoring and assessing climate change adaptation actions. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with ministries and ministerial-level agencies in : a) Organize the implementation of Point a and Point c Clause 2 of this Article; b) Submit the national climate change adaptation plan to the Prime Minister for promulgation and periodically review and update it every 5 years; the national climate change adaptation monitoring and assessment system; criteria for determining climate change adaptation projects and tasks within the competence of the Prime Minister; criteria for assessing climate risks; c) Provide guidance on assessment of impacts, vulnerability, risks, losses and damage caused by climate change; d) Formulate and organize the implementation of the national climate change adaptation plan; dd) Establish and implement the national climate change adaptation monitoring and assessment system. 4. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall : a) Implement the contents specified in Point b Clause 2 of this Article in accordance with this Law and other relevant regulations of law; organize assessment of impacts, vulnerability, risks, losses and damage caused by climate change; annually summarize and send reports to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment; b) Develop and organize the supervision and assessment of climate change adaptation actions at sectoral and local levels within the scope of management of the sector/field.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@91: GHG emission reduction 1. The main greenhouse gases are carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4) and nitrous oxide (N2O). The low-content but potentially high-level gases that cause greenhouse effect are hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), perfluorocarbons (PFCs), sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) and nitrogen trifluoride (NF3). 2. The contents of GHG emission reduction include: a) Implementing activities of greenhouse gas emission reduction and greenhouse gas absorption according to the roadmap and method of greenhouse gas emission reduction in accordance with the conditions of the country and international commitments; b) Making greenhouse gas inventory and measuring, reporting and assessing the reduction of greenhouse gas emission at the national, sectoral and local levels; c) Inspect the compliance with regulations on greenhouse gas inventory and GHG emission reduction, the implementation of cooperation mechanism and mode on GHG emission reduction; d) Developing and implementing the cooperation mechanism and mode on greenhouse gas emission reduction in accordance with the provisions of law and international agreements in which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member; dd) Organization and development of domestic carbon markets. 3. The Prime Minister shall promulgate the list of sectors and facilities emitting greenhouse gases required to inventory greenhouse gases, updated every 02 years on the basis of the proportion of greenhouse gas emission to the total national greenhouse gas emission; conditions and socio-economic development situation; fuel and energy consumption per unit of product and service for the production, business and service facilities. 4. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a) To formulate and submit to the Prime Minister for approval of list of fields and facilities emitting greenhouse gas required to implement greenhouse gas inventory; to promulgate the national system of greenhouse gas inventory; system of measurement, report, appraisal of greenhouse gas emission reduction; b) Prepare national greenhouse gas inventory reports every 02 years; c) Provide guidance on and organize the assessment of greenhouse gas inventory results and greenhouse gas emission reduction plans for the sectors and facilities required to carry out greenhouse gas inventory. 5. Ministries in charge of the fields that have to carry out greenhouse gas inventory shall : a) Carry out greenhouse gas inventories and send the results of greenhouse gas inventories to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment every 02 years before January 31 of the next reporting period for summarizing and reporting to the Prime Minister; b) Formulate and implement annual plans for reduction of greenhouse gas emission in the fields of energy, agriculture, land use and forestry, waste management and industrial processes; c) Provide guidance on procedures and technical regulations on measurement, reporting and assessment of greenhouse gas emission reduction within the scope of management of sectors and fields; d) Consolidate and report the annual results of GHG emission reduction under their management to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment before January 15 of the next reporting period for consolidation and reporting to the Prime Minister; dd) Provide guidance on selection and application of technological and management measures to reduce greenhouse gas emission in accordance with the scale and sectors under their management. 6. Provincial-level People's Committees shall provide information and data for national and sectoral greenhouse gas inventories and send them to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and related ministries and ministerial-level agencies; and examine the implementation of activities related to greenhouse gas emission reduction under their management. 7. Greenhouse gas emission facilities on the list of those required to carry out greenhouse gas inventory shall assume the following responsibilities: a) Carry out greenhouse gas inventories, establish and maintain the greenhouse gas emission database and send the greenhouse gas inventories every 02 years to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment before December 01 of the reporting period for summarizing and reporting to the Prime Minister; b) Developing and implementing annual GHG emission reduction plans; integrating GHG emission reduction activities with the quality management program, cleaner production program and environmental protection program of the facility; c) Annually, make reports on greenhouse gas emission reduction for implementation of greenhouse gas emission reduction plan of the facility under the measurement, reporting and appraisal system and send them to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and the Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial People's Committees concerned before December 31 of the reporting period. 8. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@92: Ozone Layer Protection 1. Protection of the ozone layer means activities of responding to climate change in order to prevent the ozone layer decline and limit harmful impacts of ultraviolet radiation from the Sun. 2. The protection of ozone layer covers the following contents: a) Manage production, export, import, consumption and elimination of ozone-depleting substances and greenhouse gas-effect substances which are controlled under the framework of the Ozone Layer Protection International Agreement to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; b) Collect, recycle, reuse or destroy ozone layer depleting substances and greenhouse gas-affecting substances under the control of international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory in equipment containing these substances when they are no longer in use; c) Develop and apply technologies and equipment using substances that do not degrade ozone layer and climate friendly substances. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a) Take charge and cooperate with relevant Ministries and ministerial agencies in requesting the Prime Minister to promulgate the National Plan for management and elimination of ozone-depleting substances and greenhouse gases that are controlled according to the international agreements on protection of ozone layer to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; b) Promulgate a list of ozone-depleting substances and controlled greenhouse gas-effect substances and instructions on their use in conformity with the roadmap for implementation of international agreements on protection of ozone layer to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; c) Take charge and cooperate with Ministries, ministerial agencies, and the People's Committees of provinces in managing, controlling, minimizing and eliminating the substances on the list mentioned in Point b of this Clause; organize the implementation of the National Plan for managing and eliminating ozone layer-depleting substances and greenhouse gas-damaging substances. 4. Ministries, ministerial agencies, People's Committees of provinces shall control the production, export, import, and sale of the substances in the list mentioned in Point b Clause 3 of this Article. Ministers and heads of ministerial agencies shall promulgate regulations on management and policies on assistance in technology conversion, elimination and reduction of the use of ozone layer-depleting substances and controlled greenhouse gas. 5. Manufacturers of equipment and products containing or using substances on the list specified at Point b, Clause 3 of this Article shall work out an appropriate roadmap for replacing or removing ozone layer-depleting substances and controlled greenhouse gas-effect substances under treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party on the protection of the ozone layer. 6. Establishments using equipment and products containing or using substances on the list specified at Point b, Clause 3 of this Article shall comply with regulations on collection, transportation, recycling, reuse and destruction under the guidance of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. 7. Producers, traders and service providers using substances on the list specified at Point b, Clause 3 of this Article that change ozone layer protection technologies are entitled to incentives and supports under this Law and the law on technology transfer. 8. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@93: Integration of climate change response contents into strategies and planning 1. The contents of integration of climate change response into the strategy and planning include: a) Climate change scenarios and impacts used for determining long-term objectives of the strategy and planning; b) Solutions for response to climate change integrated into the strategy and planning; c) Results of analysis and assessment of climate change response solutions used for determining socio-economic targets of the strategy and planning. 2. Strategy and planning specified in Article 25 of this Law must integrate contents of response to climate change as prescribed in this Law and other relevant law provisions.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@94: National Climate Change Database 1. The national climate change database includes the following information and data: a) Legislative documents, policies, strategies, planning, plans, standards, technical regulations, technical regulations, professional procedures, economic and technical norms on climate change and ozone layer protection; b) Impacts of climate change on natural resources, environment, ecosystem, living conditions and socio-economic activities; c) Greenhouse gas emission and socio-economic activities related to greenhouse gas emission; d) GHG emission reduction and climate change adaptation; dd) Protect ozone layer and manage ozone-depleting substances; e) Results of national climate assessment; g) Climate change scenarios over periods of time; h) Scientific research, development and transfer of technology for response to climate change and protection of ozone layer; i) Resources for response to climate change and protection of ozone layer; k) International cooperation in response to climate change and protection of ozone layer. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall organize the establishment, update and provide guidelines for the exploitation and use of the national climate change database. 3. Ministries, ministerial agencies and provincial People's Committees shall be responsible for conducting investigation, survey and collection of information and data specified in Clause 1 of this Article within their management and sending such investigation, survey and collection to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@95: National climate change response report 1. A national climate change response report shall contain the following information: a) Overview of developments and impacts of climate change; b) National greenhouse gas inventory results; c) Make efforts and effectively respond to climate change; d) Domestic and international resources for response to climate change; dd) Implementation of international commitments on climate change; e) Forecasting of impacts of climate change on economy, society and environment; g) Propose climate change response solutions. 2. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall annually make reports on response to climate change within the scope and fields under their management and send them to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall prepare a national climate change response report and submit it to the Government for reporting to the National Assembly every 5 years; provide guidance for Ministries, ministerial agencies and provincial People's Committees on preparing reports on climate change response.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@96: Implementing international commitments on climate change and ozone layer protection 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall have the following responsibilities: a) Play the leading role in organizing implementation of international commitments on climate change and ozone layer protection in accordance with regulations of international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; b) Formulate, update and implement nationally-decided contributions, biennial transparency reports and other national reports on climate change and ozone layer protection in accordance with international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; c) Formulate mechanisms and policies on mobilization and management of resources for implementation of nationally decided contributions and Vietnam's commitments to the world on climate change and ozone layer protection in accordance with international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory. 2. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall participate in the implementation of international commitments on climate change and ozone layer protection in accordance with treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party; and report on implementation results to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment for summarization and reporting under regulations.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@97: Environmental technical regulation system 1. Environmental technical regulations on the quality of surrounding environment include: a) Environmental technical regulations on soil and sediment quality; b) Environmental technical regulations on surface water, groundwater and sea water quality; c) Environmental technical regulations on air quality; d) Environmental technical regulations on light and radiation; dd) Environmental technical regulations on noise and vibration. 2. Environmental technical regulations on waste include: a) Environmental technical regulations on wastewater; b) Environmental technical regulations on emissions from production, business and service activities and emissions from means of transport. 3. Environmental technical regulations on waste management include: a) Environmental technical regulations on hazardous waste; b) Environmental technical regulations on solid waste landfills; c) Environmental technical regulations on on-site wastewater treatment works and equipment; d) Environmental technical regulations on waste incinerators; dd) Environmental technical regulations on co-treatment of waste; e) Other environmental technical regulations on waste treatment and recycling equipment. 4. Environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from abroad as raw production materials. 5. Environmental technical regulations on limits of persistent pollutants in raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment. 6. Other environmental technical regulations according to environmental protection requirements.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@98: Principles of formulation and application of environmental technical regulations on quality of surrounding environment; environmental technical regulations on limits of persistent pollutants in raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment 1. The formulation of environmental technical regulations on the quality of surrounding environment must ensure the following principles: a) Meet the objectives of protecting and improving the living environment to ensure human health, development of species and sustainable development of ecosystems; serve the environmental planning, zoning and assessment of environmental quality; b/To ensure their equivalence with developed countries and suitability to the natural and socio-economic conditions of the country and each region. 2. The application of environmental technical regulations on the quality of surrounding environment must ensure the following principles: a) Serve as a basis for classification and assessment of environmental quality at a location or an area; b) Serve as the basis for environmental zoning in conformity with management and use purposes; c) Serve as the basis for formulating the plan for environmental quality management, considering granting environmental permits to entities discharging waste into the environment, ensuring that the discharge of waste conforms to the purpose of environmental quality management in the planned, partitioned or classified areas. 3. Environmental technical regulations on limits of persistent pollutants in raw materials, fuels, materials, products, goods and equipment must ensure the objectives of protecting human health and preventing environmental pollution under treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@99: Principles of formulation and application of environmental technical regulations on waste, waste management and management of scrap imported from abroad as raw production materials 1. The formulation of environmental technical regulations on waste, waste management and management of scrap imported from abroad for use as raw production materials must ensure the following principles : a) Environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management must be conformable with the technical and technological level and socio-economic development of the country in each period; in harmony with regulations of countries in the region and the world; encourage production, business and service establishments to change and apply new technologies, the best existing techniques, clean technologies and environment-friendly technologies; b) Environmental technical regulations on waste must be suitable for receiving environmental zones and areas; formulated based on environmental zoning and planning; maintain the purposes of environmental quality management and environmental quality improvement; c) Environmental technical regulations on waste management must be conformable with purposes and requirements for collection, storage and treatment of each type of waste; d) Environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from abroad as raw production materials must ensure the remote prevention and prevent the misuse to bring waste into Vietnam; dd) Environmental technical regulations on waste, waste management and scrap management imported from abroad as production materials must be reviewed, updated and adjusted every 05 years or when necessary in a more stringent manner in case the environmental quality does not ensure the maintenance of environmental quality management purposes; e) Local environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management must be developed in a more stringent way than national environmental technical regulations. 2. The application of environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management must ensure the following principles: a) Environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management must be applied to control pollutants generated from production, business and service establishments; ensure no environmental pollution; b) Environmental technical regulations on waste must be applied according to the purpose of environmental quality management of receiving environment areas and zones, scale and discharge flow; c) New investment projects and expansion projects must meet the latest requirements specified in environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management; d) The operating business establishment must have a plan for implementation of the roadmap for application of environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management or relocation plan if it fails to meet the requirements; dd) In case of absence of national technical regulations on environment related to technologies and equipment generating waste, parameters of environmental quality or pollutants contained in waste, apply national standards for environmental protection of one of the countries in the group of developed industrial countries. 3. The application of environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from abroad for use as raw production materials must ensure the following principles: a) Environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from foreign countries for use as raw production materials shall be one of the grounds for customs clearance of imported batch of scrap. In case of failure to meet the requirements, it must be re-exported as prescribed by law; b) Environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from foreign countries used as raw production materials are applied to each batch of imported scrap registered for inspection, except for cases of exemption from inspection as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@100: Requirements for environmental technical regulations on quality of surrounding environment 1. Environmental technical regulations on the quality of surrounding environment must provide for the permissible limit values of environmental parameters suitable to the use purposes of the respective environmental components, including: a) The minimum value of environmental parameters to ensure the normal life and development of human and organisms; b) The maximum permissible value of environmental parameters in environmental components ensures not to cause adverse impacts on the normal life and development of human and organisms. 2. Environmental technical regulations on surrounding environment quality must provide instructions on standard methods of measurement, sampling and analysis to determine environmental parameters.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@101: Requirements for environmental technical regulations on waste, waste management and scrap imported as production materials 1. Environmental technical regulations on waste must specify the permissible limit value of pollutants contained in waste. The permissible limit value of pollutants contained in waste must be determined based on the toxicity of pollutants, the scale of discharge and environmental zoning. 2. Environmental technical regulations on waste management must specify technical and managerial requirements for collection, storage and treatment to ensure no environmental pollution. 3. Environmental technical regulations on management of scrap imported from foreign countries for use as raw production materials must provide for technical requirements, management and the maximum permissible percentage of impurities in imported scrap cargo. 4. Environmental technical regulations on waste and waste management must specify a roadmap for appropriate application. 5. Environmental technical regulations specified in this Article must contain instructions on standard sampling, measurement and analysis methods to determine technical indicators and specifications.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@102: Formulation, appraisal and promulgation of environmental technical regulations 1. The competence, order and procedures for formulation and promulgation of national and local environmental technical regulations comply with the law on standards and technical regulations. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a) Formulate and promulgate national environmental technical regulations; b) Take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Transport in requesting the Prime Minister to promulgate the roadmap for application of national technical regulations and standards on exhaust of road vehicles in Vietnam. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall promulgate standards, technical regulations or technical guidance on reuse, recycling and use of wastes as raw materials and materials for production, business and service activities under their management after obtaining opinions of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. 4. The Ministry of Science and Technology shall organize the appraisal of environmental technical regulations in accordance with the law on standards and technical regulations. 5. In case the surrounding environment quality fails to maintain the environmental quality protection objectives, provincial-level People's Committees shall promulgate local environmental technical regulations on waste within 2 years after the promulgation of national environmental technical regulations.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@103: Environmental standards 1. Environmental standards include standards on surrounding environment quality, environmental standards on waste management and other environmental standards. 2. All or part of environmental standards shall be compulsorily applied when they are cited in legal documents and environmental technical regulations. 3. The applicable grassroots environmental standards within the scope of management of the standard-publishing organizations.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@104: Formulation, appraisal and publication of environmental standards 1. The competence, order and procedures for formulation and appraisal of environmental standards comply with the law on standards and technical regulations. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall organize the formulation and request the appraisal of national environmental standards. 3. The Ministry of Science and Technology shall organize the appraisal and announcement of national environmental standards. 4. Agencies and organizations shall formulate and announce their own environmental standards in accordance with the law on standards and technical regulations.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@105: Best Available Techniques 1. Owners of investment projects and establishments engaged in production, business or service activities likely to cause environmental pollution shall study and apply the best existing techniques according to the roadmap prescribed by the Government; and supply information upon request to serve the elaboration of technical guidance on application of the best existing techniques. 2. Criteria for determining the best available technique include: a) Ability to reduce the amount of pollutants; b) Ability to increase the amount of recyclable waste; c) The cost of application and operation of the best existing technique; d/Energy saving capacity; dd) Proactive pollution prevention and control. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Science and Technology and concerned ministries and ministerial-level agencies in, elaborating and promulgating technical guidance on application of the best existing techniques or consider and recognize the best existing techniques applied in the group of developed industrial countries permitted for application in Vietnam; reviewing, updating and supplementing the list of the best existing techniques to ensure their conformity with the practical situation and level of scientific and technological development; guiding the application of the best existing techniques to each type of production, business and service likely to cause environmental pollution.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@106: General provisions on environmental monitoring 1. Environmental monitoring includes waste monitoring and environmental monitoring, which are carried out through automatic and continuous monitoring, periodic monitoring and monitoring at the request of competent state authorities. 2. The investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters that discharge waste to the environment must be monitored as prescribed in Article 111 and Article 112 of this Law, ensuring the compliance with environmental technical regulations. 3. Organizations and individuals are encouraged to participate in environmental observation and publicize information on environmental quality to communities in accordance with law. Organizations and individuals that conduct environmental observation and publicize information on environmental quality to communities shall take responsibility before law for the accuracy of information. 4. Environmental monitoring activities must ensure quality and control quality, provide accurate and reliable monitoring results. 5. Environmental monitoring equipment and instruments must be inspected and calibrated in accordance with laws on measurement.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@107: Environmental monitoring system 1. Environmental monitoring system includes: a) National environmental monitoring refers to a network of stations and locations for monitoring of the background and impact environment to serve the monitoring and provision of information about the quality of the background and impact environment in inter-regional, inter-provincial and cross-border areas; b) Provincial-level environmental monitoring refers to a network of stations and locations for monitoring of the background and impact environment to serve the monitoring and provision of information about the quality of the background and impact environment in areas within the province; c) Environmental monitoring serving management of sectors specified in Article 109 of this Law; d) Carry out environmental monitoring at investment projects, facilities, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; dd) Biodiversity monitoring in nature reserves. 2. Organizations participating in the environmental monitoring system include: a) State management agencies on environmental observation; b) Organize the sampling and measurement of environmental samples at the site; c) Environmental sample analysis laboratories; d) Organizing the inspection and calibration of environmental monitoring equipment; dd) Organize management and processing of data and making of reports on environmental monitoring results. 3. The environmental monitoring system must be planned in a synchronous and interconnected manner to form a uniform and comprehensive network nationwide. 4. National comprehensive planning for environmental monitoring is a planning with technical and specialized nature including the following main contents: a) Analysis and assessment of current conditions of the national environmental monitoring network; environmental analysis and laboratory system and environmental monitoring data management system; b) Viewpoints, objectives and selection of the national comprehensive planning for environmental monitoring in conformity with environmental zoning, environmental monitoring and warning orientations specified in the environmental protection planning; c) National environmental monitoring network including orientations for monitoring points, parameters and frequency of environmental components nationwide and automatic monitoring stations; orientations for development of environmental laboratories and analysis systems and environmental monitoring data management system; d) List of national environmental monitoring projects; dd) Orientations for connection between national environmental monitoring networks, databases and figures with provincial-level environmental monitoring networks, databases and figures and connection between environmental monitoring networks; e) Roadmap and resources for implementation of the planning.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@108: Subjects of environmental monitoring 1. Environmental components to be monitored include: a) Water environment includes surface water, underground water and sea water; b) Ambient air environment; c) Soil and sediment environment; d) Biodiversity; dd) Noise, vibration, radiation, light. 2. Waste sources, waste matters and pollutants to be monitored include: a) Sewage, exhaust gas; b) Industrial waste must be controlled to delimit hazardous waste as prescribed by law; c) Radioactivity; d) POPs are released and accumulated in the environment; e/Other pollutants.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@109: Environmental monitoring responsibilities 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall have the following responsibilities: a) Direct, provide guidance on and inspect the environmental monitoring nationwide; organize the implementation of the national environmental monitoring program including the inter-provincial, inter-provincial, inter-regional, cross-border environmental monitoring program and the environmental monitoring program in particular areas; carry out biodiversity monitoring in nature reserves; b) Formulate, appraise and submit the national comprehensive planning for environmental monitoring to the Prime Minister for approval as prescribed by the law on planning; c) Provide technical instructions on construction of national and provincial environmental monitoring systems; biodiversity monitoring systems. 2. The Ministry of Science and Technology shall organize the implementation of radiation monitoring programs, including programs on monitoring of radioactive elements in the environment. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall organize the implementation of environmental observation programs in service of agricultural management, including programs on observation of water, soil and sediments in service of irrigation, exploitation and aquaculture, agriculture, forestry and salt-making. 4. The Ministry of Health shall organize the implementation of the working environment observation program in the working area. 5. The Ministry of National Defense shall be involved in offshore and cross-border oceanic water and environmental monitoring activities. 6. Provincial People's Committees shall organize the implementation of environmental monitoring programs in their provinces and report annual environmental monitoring results to People's Councils at the same level and the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@110: Conditions for environmental monitoring activities 1. National environmental monitoring program, local environmental monitoring program, environmental monitoring program of business and service organizations as required by the law on environmental protection and other monitoring activities in service of state management on environmental protection as prescribed on environmental monitoring must be done by organizations certified eligible for environmental monitoring services. 2. Organizations meeting the requirements for environmental monitoring personnel, environmental monitoring equipment and technical conditions of laboratories and having the process and method of environmental monitoring shall be issued with the Certificate of eligibility for environmental monitoring services. The organizations issued with the Certificate must ensure the activities in accordance with the certified capacity and scope. 3. Entities and persons carrying out periodic, regular and continuous environmental monitoring activities in order to provide and publicize information about environmental quality to communities must meet technical requirements concerning environmental monitoring activities in accordance with laws. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@111: Wastewater monitoring 1. Entities required to carry out automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring include: a) Concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters discharge wastewater into the environment; b) Investment projects and establishments posing risks of causing environmental pollution with an average discharge of wastewater to the environment; c) Investment projects and establishments not in the type of risk of environmental pollution with a large discharge of sewage into the environment. 2. Entities required to carry out periodic wastewater monitoring include: a) Concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters discharge wastewater into the environment; b) Investment projects and establishments with large discharge of wastewater into the environment. 3. The automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring must comply with technical regulations on environmental monitoring. Data of the monitoring system shall be directly transmitted to the provincial environmental protection authority. 4. Periodic monitoring of wastewater must ensure the time, frequency and parameters as prescribed by law. Regarding the parameters monitored automatically and continuously, periodic monitoring is not required. 5. Provincial environmental protection authorities shall : a) Monitor data on automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring; assess results of automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring and compare them with the maximum permissible values of pollution parameters according to environmental technical regulations on wastewater; monitor and inspect the remedial works in case of interruption of monitoring data; detect monitoring parameters exceeding environmental technical regulations and propose remedial measures as prescribed; b) Consolidate and transmit data on automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring in the administrative division to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment as regulated. 6. Entities other than those specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article are encouraged to carry out wastewater monitoring to monitor and supervise their wastewater treatment systems and equipment. 7. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on entities required to carry out wastewater monitoring; parameters and schedule for automatic and continuous wastewater monitoring; period and frequency of periodic wastewater monitoring. 8. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall promulgate technical regulations on wastewater observation.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@112: Monitoring of dust and industrial emissions 1. Subject to automatic and continuous monitoring of industrial dust and emission include investment projects and facilities at risk of causing air pollution with large volume of dust and emission discharged into the environment. 2. Subject to periodic monitoring of industrial dust and emission include investment projects and facilities with large discharge of waste to the environment. 3. The automatic and continuous monitoring of industrial dust and emission must comply with technical regulations on environmental monitoring. Data of the monitoring system shall be directly transmitted to the provincial-level environmental protection agency. 4. Periodic monitoring of industrial dust and emission must ensure the time, frequency and parameters as prescribed by law. Periodic monitoring is not required for parameters that have been monitored automatically and continuously. 5. Provincial environmental protection authorities shall : a) Monitor data on automatic and continuous industrial emission monitoring; assess results of automatic and continuous industrial emission monitoring and compare them with the maximum permissible values of pollution parameters according to environmental technical regulations on emissions; monitor and inspect the remedial works in case of interruption of monitoring data; detect monitoring parameters exceeding the permissible limits according to environmental technical regulations and propose remedial measures as prescribed; b) Consolidate and transmit data on automatic and continuous monitoring of industrial emissions in the administrative division to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment as regulated. 6. Entities other than those specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article are encouraged to carry out dust and industrial emission monitoring to monitor and supervise their dust and emission treatment systems and equipment. 7. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on subjects of monitoring of industrial dust and emission; parameters and roadmap for automatic and continuous monitoring of industrial emissions; period and frequency of periodic monitoring of industrial dust and emission. 8. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall promulgate technical regulations on monitoring of industrial dust and emission.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@113: Environmental monitoring data management 1. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall manage the national environmental monitoring data; establish the environmental monitoring database in the national environmental information system and database; integrate the environmental monitoring data of the Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and localities, publish information on national environmental quality; provide professional instructions and technical assistance for management of environmental monitoring data of localities. 2. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall establish the environmental monitoring database within their competence and integrate it into the national environmental database. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall manage environmental monitoring data; establish local environmental monitoring database to ensure consistency and connection with the national environmental information system and database and publish information about local environmental quality on the basis of local environmental monitoring results. 4. Investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters shall manage waste monitoring data and publicize waste monitoring results as prescribed by law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@114: Environmental Information 1. Environmental information includes: a) Information about pollutants, discharge of pollutants into the environment, sources of pollution; environmental protection of investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; b) Information about solid waste, hazardous waste, wastewater, exhaust gas and other types of waste as prescribed by law; c) Information about the decision on approval for the result of appraisal and EIA report, except for trade secrets, business secrets, information classified as state secrets; contents of licensing, registration, certification; results of environmental protection inspection of investment projects, facilities, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters as prescribed; d) Information about statistical indicators of environment, environmental quality and environmental pollution; dd) Information about natural heritages, natural ecosystems, species and genetic resources; natural reserves and biodiversity conservation facilities; important wetlands. 2. The collection, storage and management of environmental information are provided as follows: a) The collected environmental information must be accurate, sufficient and timely; b/Investment project owners and establishments shall regularly collect, store and manage environmental information specified at Points a, b and c, Clause 1 of this Article; c) Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall collect, store and manage environmental information under their management as prescribed at Point d and dd, Clause 1 of this Article; d) People's Committees at all levels shall collect, store and manage environmental information in their localities and according to management decentralization; dd) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall collect and aggregate information on the national environment. 3. The supply and publicity of environmental information are provided as follows: a/The State encourages organizations and individuals to participate in the provision of environmental information; b) Ministries, ministerial-level agencies, provincial People's Committees shall provide environmental information under their responsibility for collection, storage and management to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment through the national environmental information system and database or report as prescribed by law; c) Owners of investment projects and facilities shall provide environmental information specified in Points a, b and c Clause 1 of this Article to environmental protection authorities via the national environmental database or report as prescribed by law; d) Agencies, organizations and individuals shall publicize environmental information as prescribed on their websites or in other forms, ensuring convenience for related subjects to receive information. The publicity of environmental information must comply with the provisions of this Law and other relevant laws. 4. The Government shall detail contents and management of environmental information; order, procedures, time and forms of provision and publicity of environmental information.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@115: Information systems, environment databases 1. Environmental information system is regulated as follows: a) The State shall adopt policies on investment in construction and operation of environmental information systems, aiming to develop digital platforms and digital economy in environment; b) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall be responsible for establishing, managing and utilizing the national environmental information system; providing instructions on the implementation of ministerial, sectoral and provincial environmental information systems; c) Ministries, ministerial-level agencies, provincial People's Committees shall be responsible for developing, managing and utilizing ministerial, sectoral and provincial environmental information systems, ensuring the synchronization with the national environmental information system. 2. Environmental databases are regulated as follows: a) Environmental database is a collection of environmental information that is developed, updated, stored and managed to meet the requirements for access, provision and use from central to local levels, serving state management of environmental protection and provision of public environmental services; b) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall establish and manage the national environmental database; instruct Ministries, ministerial agencies and provincial People's Committees to organize the deployment of their environmental databases; c) Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial People's Committees shall organize the deployment of their environment databases; ensure the integration, connection and connection with the national environment database. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@116: Online public environmental services 1. Online environmental public services include environmental public administrative services, environmental information provision services and other environmental public services as prescribed by law. 2. Provision of online environmental public services is prescribed as follows: a) Competent state management agencies shall provide online environmental public services in accordance with the Government's regulations, ensuring connection, convenience, simplicity and safety for agencies, organizations and individuals and serving state management of the environment; b) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and provincial People's Committees shall be responsible for developing, organizing and guiding the implementation of online environmental public services, ensuring the consistency, connection and connection as per the law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@117: Statistical indicators on environment 1. Statistical indicator on environment is a part of the Vietnam's statistical indicator system, aiming to measure and assess environmental protection activities for sustainable development, in conformity with the United Nations' system of sustainable development indicators. 2. Environmental statistical indicators include national environmental statistical indicators and environmental statistical indicators of the natural resources and environment sector, which are implemented in accordance with this Law and the statistics law. 3. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall organize the making of statistics on environmental indicators in their sectors, fields and localities; and annually report on environmental statistical indicators to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment. 4. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall formulate, guide and organize the implementation of environmental statistics; promulgate a set of environmental statistical indicators of the natural resources and environment sector.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@118: Environmental protection report 1. Annually, the report on environmental protection of the previous year shall comply with the following provisions: a) The district-level People's Committee shall report to the People's Council at the same level and the provincial People's Committee before January 31; b) The management board of industrial parks, export processing zones, hi-tech zones, economic zones shall report to the provincial People's Committees before January 31; c) The People's Committee of the province shall submit a report to the People's Council of the province and the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment before February 15; d) Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall send reports on their performance of environmental protection tasks to the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment before February 15; dd) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall prepare a report on environmental protection nationwide and submit it to the Government, which will report it to the National Assembly at its first session in the year. 2. Main contents of environmental protection report include: a) Current conditions and changes in soil, water and air quality; natural heritages and biodiversity; b) General socio-economic background and environmental impacts; c) Results of environmental protection activities, including control of pollution sources; management of solid waste and hazardous waste; management of soil, water and air quality; treatment of pollution and improvement of environmental quality; prevention and response to environmental incidents; protection of environment of natural heritages and biodiversity; d) Environmental monitoring and warning system; dd) Formulating policies and laws, settling administrative procedures, supervising, examining, inspecting, handling violations of law, settling environmental complaints and denunciations; e) Environmental protection conditions and resources; g) Results of implementation of statistical indicators on environment; h) General assessment; i) Environmental protection orientation, tasks and solutions in the coming time. 3. The reporting period of environmental protection is from January 01 to December 31 of the reporting year. 4. The environmental protection report shall be sent in paper or electronic form as prescribed by law. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall guide the elaboration of environmental protection reports; guide and organize the evaluation of environmental protection results of ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@119: Report on environmental protection in production, business and service activities 1. Investment project owners and establishments shall make and send environmental protection reports to competent state agencies in accordance with law. 2. Environmental protection reports include: a) Annual environmental protection reports. The reporting period begins on January 01 and ends on December 31 of the reporting year; b) Submit ad hoc reports on environmental protection at the request of competent authorities. 3. The main contents of the periodic environmental protection report include: a) Operation results of works and measures for environmental protection of waste; b) Results of environmental protection requirements remediation by inspection agencies and competent state agencies (if any); c) Results of periodic, automatic and continuous environmental monitoring and monitoring; d) Solid waste management and hazardous waste management; dd) Management of imported scrap (if any); e) Environmental monitoring services (if any); g) Other environmental protection results, activities and measures. 4. The environmental protection report shall be sent in paper or electronic form as prescribed by law. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall provide guidance on contents, forms, methods and time for sending reports on environmental protection in production, business and service provision.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@120: Environmental status report 1. Environmental quo status reports include overview reports on the current environment and topical reports on the current environment. 2. Responsibilities for making environmental status reports are prescribed as follows: a) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall make an overview report on the national environmental status every 05 years to serve the assessment of the implementation of the socio-economic development plan; make annual topical reports on the national environmental status; b) Provincial People's Committees shall make general reports on the current state of the local environment every 05 years; annually, make topical reports on the current state of the local environment under the guidance of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment; based on the urgent issues of the local environment, provincial People's Committees may decide to make more topical reports on the current state of the local environment. 3. Main contents of the environmental status report include: a) Overview on nature, economy, society; b) Environmental impacts; c) Current conditions and environmental quality developments; d) Environmental issues and reasons; dd) Environmental impacts on society and economy; e) Results of implementation of policies, laws and environmental protection activities; international cooperation in environmental protection; g) Environmental challenge forecast; h) Environmental protection orientation and solutions. 4. Form of environmental status report is provided as follows: a) The national environmental quo status report shall be submitted to the National Assembly at the session preceding the year-end session of the last year of the term; the provincial-level environmental quo status report shall be submitted to the People's Council at the year-end regular session of the last year of the term; b) Thematic reports on the national environmental status shall be published on the website of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment before the first meeting of the National Assembly of the following year; the local environmental status reports shall be published on the website of the provincial People's Committee before the first regular meeting of the provincial People's Council of the following year. 5. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall guide the making of environmental status reports; and guide the implementation and making of environmental status reports by ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@121: General provisions on prevention and response to environmental emergencies 1. The prevention and response to environmental emergencies must comply with the technical regulations and procedures for environmental safety. 2. Environmental emergency response shall be carried out under the motto of on-site command, on-site forces, on-site vehicles, supplies and on-site logistics. 3. Organizations and individuals causing environmental incidents or emergencies shall respond to environmental incidents or emergencies and pay environmental incident or emergency response expenses. 4. The head of the facility or locality where an environmental emergency occurs shall direct and organize the response to the environmental emergency. The response to the environmental emergency must be carried out under the assignment, decentralization, uniform command and close cooperation between the forces, vehicles and equipment participating in the response to the environmental emergency. 5. The State encourages and creates conditions for organizations and individuals to invest in the provision of environmental incident response services. 6. The prevention of environmental emergencies that occur due to leakage, overflow, or dispersion of waste (hereinafter referred to as waste emergencies) shall comply with regulations of this Law. The prevention of environmental emergencies that occur due to chemicals, radioactivity, oil spill, epidemics, and other causes shall comply with relevant regulations of law. 7. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on prevention and response to environmental emergencies.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@122: Environmental incident prevention responsibilities 1. The investor and facility owner shall perform the following tasks: 1. The investor and facility owner shall : a) Comply with requirements for plans, measures and equipment for prevention and response to environmental emergencies as prescribed by law; b) Carry out regular inspection and apply management and technical measures to eliminate and minimize the risk of environmental emergencies. 2. Provincial People's Committees shall have the following responsibilities: a) Investigating, making statistics and assessing the risk of environmental incidents that may occur in the area; b) Establish a database and publish information about sources of risk of environmental emergencies in the administrative division as prescribed by law; c) Build up and direct People's Committees of districts and communes to build up the capacity to prevent and warn the risk of environmental incidents in the areas. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall prevent environmental incidents under Point a, Clause 1, Article 127 of this Law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@123: Environmental emergency classification and stages of environmental emergency response 1. The classification of environmental emergencies shall be based on the scope of environmental pollution and degradation at the time of discovery of the emergency to identify the agency in charge of directing the response, including the following levels: a) Grassroots-level environmental emergencies refer to environmental emergencies that cause environmental pollution and degradation in production, business and service establishments; b) District-level environmental emergencies refer to environmental emergencies beyond the scope of an on-site emergency and have the scope of environmental pollution and degradation within the territory of a district-level administrative unit; c) Provincial-level environmental emergencies refer to those that exceed the scope of a district-level environmental emergency and cause environmental pollution and degradation within the territory of a provincial administrative unit; d) National environmental emergencies refer to environmental emergencies that cause environmental pollution and degradation in at least 02 provincial administrative divisions or cross-national environmental emergencies. 2. Response to environmental incidents covers the following stages: a) Prepare for environmental emergencies; b) Organize the response to environmental emergencies; c) Environmental remediation after environmental emergencies.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@124: Environmental emergency preparedness 1. The persons in charge of directing the response to environmental emergencies specified in Clause 4 Article 125 of this Law shall direct the formulation and approval for the environmental emergency response plan within their competence and responsibility; direct the organization of emergency drills according to the environmental emergency response plan approved by themselves. 2. The Ministry of National Defense shall take charge and cooperate with Ministries, ministerial agencies, Governmental agencies, and the People's Committees of provinces in providing guidance on building forces and providing resources and equipment for the National Search and Rescue Committee, the Command Centers for Natural Disaster Management of provinces and districts. 3. Owners of investment projects and establishments must have works, equipment and means for environmental incident response in accordance with law; build and train on-site forces for environmental incident response. 4. The issuance and implementation of environmental emergency response plans are prescribed as follows: a) The National Search and Rescue Committee shall issue and implement the national environmental emergency response plan; inspect the implementation of the environmental emergency response plan issued by the provincial Command Center for Natural Disaster Management; b) The provincial Command Center for Natural Disaster Management shall issue and implement the provincial environmental emergency response plan; inspect the implementation of the environmental emergency response plan issued by the district-level Command Center for Natural Disaster Management; c) The district-level commanding committee for natural disaster prevention and control and search and rescue shall issue and implement the district-level environmental emergency response plan; d) The investor and facility shall issue and implement their environmental emergency response plans. 5. Environmental emergency response plans must include emergency scenarios for corresponding response plans and must be publicized in accordance with law. 6. The integration and integration of environmental emergency response plans are prescribed as follows: a) Environmental emergency response plans specified in Points a, b and c Clause 4 of this Article may be integrated with civil defense plans or other emergency response plans; b) The environmental emergency response plan mentioned in Point d Clause 4 of this Article shall be integrated, integrated and approved with other emergency response plans. 7. Organizing the environmental emergency response drills as follows: a) The on-site emergency response drill shall be conducted at least every 02 years, unless otherwise prescribed by law; b) Environmental emergency drills at district, provincial and national levels shall be conducted according to the environmental emergency response plan approved by a competent authority; c) Environmental emergency response drills shall be participated by relevant agencies, organizations, forces, representatives of contact points of residential communities and surrounding facilities likely to be affected by the emergency.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@125: Environmental emergency response 1. Information about environmental emergencies must be promptly reported to the Command Center for Natural Disaster Management of the district and the People's Committee of the commune where the emergency occurs. 2. The district-level commanding committee for natural disaster prevention and control and search and rescue shall coordinate with the commune-level People's Committee of the place in which the incident occurs in directly verifying and organizing timely response to the incident and reporting it to the district-level People's Committee for announcement of environmental incidents or notification to competent authorities for organizing response as decentralized under Clause 1, Article 123 of this Law. 3. Environmental emergency response includes the following contents: a) Determination of causes of environmental emergencies; types, quantity and amount of pollutants released into the environment; b) Preliminary assessment of the scope, subjects and level of impact on soil, water, air, humans and organisms; c) Take measures to isolate, limit the scope, subjects and level of impact; urgently take measures to ensure safety for people, property, organisms and the environment; d) Recall, treat and eliminate pollutants or causes of pollution; dd) Notify and provide information about environmental emergencies to the community to prevent and avoid adverse impacts of environmental emergencies. 4. Responsibilities for environmental emergency response are prescribed as follows: a) The investor and facility owner shall organize the response to environmental emergencies within the facility; in case the response is beyond the capacity, promptly report the accident to the People's Committee of the commune where the accident occurs and the Command Center for Natural Disaster Management of the district for cooperation in response; b) Presidents of People's Committees and heads of district-level commanding committees for natural disaster prevention and control and search and rescue shall direct emergency response, mobilize forces, equipment and vehicles to respond to emergencies, appoint commanders and spokespersons about district-level environmental emergencies that occur in the administrative division; c) Presidents of the People's Committees and heads of provincial Command Centers for Natural Disaster Management shall direct emergency response, mobilize forces, equipment and vehicles to respond to emergencies, appoint commanders and spokespersons about provincial environmental emergencies that occur in the administrative division; d) The President of the National Search and Rescue Committee shall direct emergency response, mobilize forces, equipment and vehicles, appoint a commander and spokesperson on national environmental emergencies. 5. In case of beyond the response capacity, the person competent to direct the response to environmental incidents must report to the immediate superior. Agencies, organizations and individuals shall coordinate and support the response to environmental incidents upon request. 6. In case the scope of environmental pollution and degradation of an environmental incident extends beyond the scope of the establishment or administrative unit, the person competent to direct response to the environmental incident or emergency shall report it to his/her immediate superior for directing the response. 7. The persons in charge of directing the response to environmental incidents specified in Clause 4 of this Article shall decide to establish environmental incident response command centers and working teams to identify causes of environmental incidents when necessary. 8. The Ministry of Health and People's Committees at all levels shall assess the scope, subjects and level of impact of environmental incidents on human health and take measures to prevent and limit impacts.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@126: Environmental remediation after environmental incidents 1. Owners of investment projects and establishments causing environmental incidents shall conduct environmental rehabilitation after environmental incidents within their establishments. Commune-level People's Committees of localities where environmental incidents occur shall inspect and supervise environmental rehabilitation activities. 2. The environmental remediation after environmental emergencies at district, provincial and national levels shall be carried out as follows: a) The People's Committee of the district shall survey and assess the current environmental conditions, formulate, approve and direct the implementation of the environmental remediation plan in case of environmental emergencies at the district level; within 30 days from the date on which the stage of environmental emergency response is announced, the People's Committee of the district shall approve the environmental remediation plan; b) The People's Committee of the province shall survey and assess the current environmental conditions, formulate, approve and direct the implementation of the provincial environmental remediation plan in case of environmental emergencies; within 60 days from the date on which the stage of response to environmental emergencies is announced, the People's Committee of the province shall approve the environmental remediation plan; c) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall survey and assess the current environmental conditions, formulate, approve and direct the implementation of the national environmental remediation plan for environmental emergencies; within 90 days from the date on which the response to environmental emergencies is announced, the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall approve the environmental remediation plan. 3. Contents of an environmental remediation plan include: a) Description and assessment of the current environmental status after the incident, including the level, scope and nature of environmental pollution in each area; the current environmental status, premises and ecosystem before the environmental incident (if any); requirements for environmental treatment under environmental technical regulations on surrounding environmental quality, restoration of premises and restoration of some major characteristics of the ecosystem; b) Environmental remediation solutions; analysis, assessment and selection of best solutions for environmental remediation; c) List and quantity of environmental remediation works with respect to selected solutions; d) Implementation plan; division of implementation plan by each stage of environmental restoration; program of management, observation and supervision during the environmental restoration; plan for acceptance of environmental restoration result. 4.
