The inspection, supervision and commissioning of the environmental remediation plan mentioned in Clause 2 of this Article shall be carried out as follows: a) In case the entity causing environmental emergencies implement the approved plan on its own, the approving authority shall inspect and supervise the environmental remediation according to the approved plan; b) In case the plan-approving agency organizes the plan implementation, the organization or individual causing the incident has the right to participate in supervision, appraisal, inspection and acceptance for completion of environmental restoration. 5. The environmental remediation after environmental emergencies must satisfy environmental technical regulations on surrounding environment quality. 6. The agency approving the environmental remediation plan shall announce the end of the environmental remediation stage to the residential community, press agencies and media. 7. The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@127: Responsibilities of Ministries, ministerial agencies and specialized agencies for prevention and response to environmental emergencies 1. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies have the following responsibilities: a) Provide guidance, inspect and develop the capacity to prevent and warn the risk of environmental emergencies within the fields under their management; the preparedness for environmental emergencies and organize the response to environmental emergencies within the scope of their management as prescribed by law; b) Provide guidance on contents of the plan for response to environmental emergencies under state management; procedures and techniques for environmental emergency response and environmental emergency scenarios under their management as prescribed by law; c) Formulate and request the National Search and Rescue Committee to issue the national environmental emergency response plan within its management; d) Participate in response to national environmental emergencies under its management as assigned by the National Search and Rescue Committee. 2. Specialized agencies affiliated to People's Committees of provinces and districts shall, within the ambit of their assigned functions, tasks and powers, advise People's Committees of the same level and commanding committees for natural disaster prevention and control and search and rescue of the same level on formulating and promulgating plans on response to environmental incidents; and guide the preparation and organization of response to environmental incidents in their localities. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall : a) Formulate and request the Prime Minister to promulgate regulations on waste-related emergency response; provide technical instructions on waste-related emergency prevention and response; b) Participate in the national environmental emergency response as assigned by the National Search and Rescue Committee; c) Directing the implementation of environmental remediation after environmental incidents at national level; providing technical guidance on environmental remediation after environmental incidents. 4. Provincial-and district-level environmental protection agencies shall advise People's Committees of the same level on environmental rehabilitation after environmental incidents in their localities.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@128: Finance for environmental emergency response 1. Organizations and individuals causing environmental incidents or emergencies shall promptly and fully pay expenses for organizing environmental incident or mitigation activities; in case the State organizes environmental incident or mitigation activities, these organizations and individuals shall be responsible for paying expenses for organizing environmental incident or mitigation activities to the State in accordance with laws. 2. For environmental incidents of which the causes or organizations and individuals causing such incidents cannot be identified, expenses for organizing the response to environmental incidents and environmental rehabilitation shall be paid by the State. 3. Funding for environmental emergency response and environmental remediation prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article shall be provided by state budget and other funding sources as prescribed by law. 4. Labor, materials and means used and mobilized for environmental incident response shall be reimbursed and paid in accordance with law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@129: Publicity of information and participation of residential communities in environmental incident and emergency prevention and response 1. Organizations, individuals and residential communities likely to be affected by environmental incidents or emergencies must be informed of the incident risks and measures to respond to environmental incidents or emergencies of surrounding establishments; be informed, participated in and supervised activities of responding to environmental incidents or emergencies. 2. Investment project owners and establishments shall notify commune-level People's Committees of environmental incident and incident response measures for information to surrounding organizations, individuals and communities. 3. The time of starting and ending the stage of organizing response to environmental incidents and environmental rehabilitation must be publicized by competent agencies or persons on the mass media for organizations, individuals and communities to know, participate in and supervise. 4. The person in charge of directing the response to environmental emergencies and the spokesman for environmental emergencies shall provide and update environmental emergencies to media agencies, press agencies and residential communities in a timely manner. Information about environmental emergencies provided and announced by the person in charge of directing the response to environmental emergencies and the spokesman for environmental emergencies is official information. 5. Media and press agencies shall provide accurate, truthful, sufficient and timely information about environmental emergencies and response to environmental emergencies.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@130: Damages caused by environmental pollution and degradation and principles for determining the liability to compensate for environmental damage 1. Damages caused by environmental pollution and degradation include: a) Deterioration of environmental functions and usefulness; b) Damage to human life and health, property and lawful interests of organizations and individuals as a result of deterioration of environmental functions and utilities. 2. The identification of organizations and individuals causing environmental damage must be conducted in a timely, objective and fair manner. Organizations and individuals causing environmental damage shall pay compensation for all damage caused by themselves and concurrently pay all expenses for damage identification and carry out procedures for claiming compensation under regulations. 3. In case there are 2 or more organizations and individuals causing environmental damage, compensation for damage is provided as follows: - The compensation for environmental damage is paid by the organization/individual; a/The liability of each subject to pay compensation for environmental damage is determined based on the type of pollutants, the volume of emission and other factors; b/The liability to pay compensation for environmental damage and expenses for determining damage and carrying out procedures for claiming compensation for each object shall be determined in proportion to the ratio of damage to total environmental damage; in case involved parties or state management agencies in charge of environment cannot determine the ratio of liability, arbitration bodies or courts shall decide according to their competence. 4. Organizations and individuals that fully observe the law on environmental protection, have qualified waste treatment systems and can prove that they do not cause environmental damage are not required to pay compensation for environmental damage and expenses related to the determination of damage and the carrying out of procedures for claiming compensation.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@131: Liability to claim compensation and determine environmental damage 1. People's Committees at all levels, organizations and individuals that detect signs of environmental pollution or degradation shall notify compensation-liable agencies thereof and organize the collection and appraisal of data and proof for determining environmental damage caused by environmental pollution or degradation under Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Responsibilities to claim compensation and organize the collection and appraisal of data and proof for determining environmental damage caused by pollution or degradation are provided as follows: a/Commune-level People's Committees shall claim compensation for environmental damage caused in localities under their management. In this case, commune-level People's Committees shall request district-level People's Committees to collect and appraise data and proof for determining environmental damage caused by pollution or degradation; b) The People's Committees of districts shall claim compensation and collect and verify evidence to determine environmental damage caused by pollution or degradation in at least 02 communes; collect and verify evidence to determine environmental damage caused by pollution or degradation at the request of the People's Committees of communes; c) The People's Committee of the province shall claim compensation for damage and collect and verify evidence to determine environmental damage caused by the pollution or degradation in at least 02 districts; d) The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall claim compensation for damage and take charge and cooperate with the People's Committee of the province in collecting and appraising evidence to determine environmental damage caused by the pollution or degradation in at least 02 administrative divisions of provinces. 3. Organizations and individuals that suffer from loss of life or health of humans, property and lawful interests due to deterioration of environmental functions and utilities shall themselves or authorize state agencies, other organizations or individuals to determine damage and claim compensation for environmental damage in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@132: Determination of damage caused by environmental pollution and degradation 1. The determination of damage caused by deterioration of environmental functions and utilities covers the following contents: a) Determination of the scope, area and area of environmental pollution and degradation; b) Determination of the number of degraded environmental components, types of ecosystem and species damaged; c) Determination of damage level of each environmental component, ecosystem and species. 2. The damage caused by deterioration of environmental functions and utilities shall be determined independently or in coordination between the damage-causing party and the damage sufferer. When each party or all parties so request, the environmental protection agency shall guide the calculation of damage or witness the damage determination. 3. The determination of damage caused to human health and life, property and lawful interests of organizations and individuals due to the deterioration of environmental functions and utilities complies with law. 4. The Government shall provide guidance on determination of damage caused by environmental pollution and degradation.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@133: Settling environmental damage compensation 1. Compensation for environmental damage shall be settled through negotiation between the parties. In case of failure to negotiate, the parties may select to settle compensation for environmental damage in the following forms: a) Reconciliation; b/Settlement of disputes by arbitration; c) Dispute settlement by Court. 2. The settlement at the Court shall comply with the provisions on compensation for extra-contractual civil damage and the law on civil procedures, except for the provisions on the proof of causal relationship between the acts of violation of law and the damage occurred. The proof of causal relationship between the acts of violation of law on environment and the damage occurred is the responsibility of the organizations and individuals that commit acts of environmental pollution causing environmental pollution.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@134: Cost of environmental damage compensation 1. The compensation for environmental damage specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 130 of this Law shall be calculated according to the following contents: a/Expense for immediate and long-term damage caused by the deterioration of the environmental functions and utility; b) Costs of environmental remediation; c) Costs of reducing and eliminating sources of damage or organizing response to environmental emergencies; d/Expenses for determining damage and carrying out procedures for compensation for environmental damage; dd) Depending on specific conditions, the provisions of Points a, b, c and d of this Clause may be applied to calculate environmental damage costs as a basis for compensation and settlement of environmental damage compensation. 2. The compensation shall be paid directly by the organization/individual or transferred to Vietnam Environment Protection Fund or provincial-level environmental protection fund.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@135: Assessment of damage caused by deterioration of environmental function and usefulness 1. Assessment of damage caused by deterioration of environmental functions and utilities shall be conducted at the request of organizations and individuals suffering damage or agencies settling compensation for environmental damage. 2. Foundations for damage assessment include claims for compensation, information, figures, evidence and other foundations related to compensation and damage sufferers. 3. The damage assessment organization shall be selected by the damage assessment requester; in case of no agreement between the parties, the selection of a damage assessment organization shall be decided by the compensation-settling agency. 4. The Government shall provide guidance on assessment of damage caused by deterioration of environmental function and productivity.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@136: Policies on environmental protection tax and fees 1. Environmental protection tax is specified as follows: a) Environmental protection tax is imposed on products and goods that cause bad impacts on the environment or pollutants; b) The environmental protection tax is determined based on the level of adverse environmental impacts; c) The promulgation and implementation of regulations on environmental protection tax shall comply with regulations of law on taxation. 2. Environmental protection fees are prescribed as follows: a) Environmental protection fees are imposed for discharge of waste to the environment; mineral extraction or adverse environmental impacts; public services in the environmental protection sector in accordance with regulations of the Law on fees and charges; b) The environmental protection fee amount shall be determined on the basis of the volume and level of toxicity of pollutants discharged into the environment, characteristics of the receiving environment; level of adverse environmental impacts of mineral extraction activities; nature of public services in the environmental protection sector; c) The promulgation and implementation of regulations on environmental protection fees shall comply with regulations of law on fees and charges. 3. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall take charge of assessing the level of environmental pollution and greenhouse effect of wastes or products and goods that cause bad impacts on the environment when they are used to propose a specific list of subjects liable to environmental protection tax and charge, the bracket, tax rates and environmental protection charge rates for each subject liable to environmental protection tax and charge and the method of calculating environmental protection charge, then send it to the Ministry of Finance for summarization and reporting to competent agencies for consideration and decision.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@137: Environmental protection deposit 1. Environmental protection deposits are made to ensure that organizations and individuals are responsible for environmental remediation and handling of environmental pollution risks and risks arising from activities specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Organizations and individuals engaged in the following activities shall pay environmental protection deposits: a/The environmental protection fund is used for the following activities : a) Mineral extraction; b) Waste burial; c) Importing scrap from foreign countries for use as raw production materials. 3. Environmental protection deposits shall be made in cash, precious metals, gems or valuable papers in accordance with law. 4. Organizations and individuals shall make deposit as follows: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ a) Organizations and individuals engaging in activities prescribed in Point a and Point b Clause 2 of this Article shall pay deposits to Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund or provincial-level environmental protection funds; b) Organizations and individuals engaging in activities prescribed in Point c Clause 2 of this Article shall make deposits at Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund or provincial environmental protection funds or financial and credit institutions as prescribed by law. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article, deposit rates, forms of deposit, principles of application of deposit interest rates and refund of environmental protection deposit.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@138: Pay for natural ecosystem services 1. Payment for natural ecosystem services means the payment by users of natural ecosystem services to providers of environmental and landscape values created by natural ecosystems for the protection, maintenance and development of natural ecosystems. 2. Services of natural ecosystems to be paid for include: a) Forest environmental services of forest ecosystems in accordance with the law on forestry; b) Wetland ecosystem services for tourism, entertainment and aquaculture purposes; c) Marine ecosystem services for tourism, entertainment and aquaculture purposes; d) Service of rock mountain, cave and geological park ecosystems for tourism and entertainment business purposes; dd) Natural ecosystem services for carbon capture and storage, except for the case specified in Point a of this Clause. 3. Principles of payment for natural ecosystem services are provided as follows: a) Organizations and individuals using one or several natural ecosystem services must pay for the natural ecosystem services; b) Payment for natural ecosystem services shall be made in the form of direct payment or indirect payment through entrustment; c) The payments for natural ecosystem services shall be recorded to the prime cost of products and services of users of natural ecosystem services and must ensure the offsetting of costs for the protection, maintenance and development of natural ecosystems; d) Providers of natural ecosystem services must use the proceeds from payment for natural ecosystem services to protect, maintain and develop natural ecosystems. 4. Organizations and individuals shall pay for natural ecosystem services when they carry out the following activities : a) Exploitation and use of water surface and sea surface of ecosystem for aquaculture and water recreation services; b) Exploitation and use of landscape of ecosystem for tourism and entertainment services; c) Production and business with greenhouse gas emission must use services of carbon absorption and storage of ecosystem to reduce greenhouse gas emission. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@139: Organization and development of the carbon market 1. The domestic carbon market includes activities of exchange of greenhouse gas emission quotas and carbon credits obtained from the mechanism of exchange and offset of domestic and international carbon credits in accordance with the provisions of law and international agreements in which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member. 2. Greenhouse gas-emitting facilities must carry out the inventory of greenhouse gases in the list specified in Clause 3, Article 91 of this Law, are allocated the greenhouse gas emission quotas and have the right to exchange and trade in the domestic carbon market. 3. Bases for determining the greenhouse gas emission quotas include: a) National climate change strategy and other relevant development strategies and planning; b) Results of national greenhouse gas inventories, fields and facilities on the list specified in Clause 3, Article 91 of this Law; c) Roadmap and methods for GHG emission reduction in conformity with the country's conditions and international commitments. 4. Greenhouse gas-emitting facilities are only allowed to emit greenhouse gas within the allocated quotas; in case of having demand for emission exceeding the allocated quotas, they may buy quotas of other entities through the domestic carbon market. 5. Greenhouse gas emission facilities that reduce greenhouse gas emission or have not used up the allocated emission quotas may be resold to other entities in need through the domestic carbon market. 6. The greenhouse gas emission facilities participating in the mechanisms of exchange and offset of domestic and international carbon credits in accordance with the provisions of law and international agreements in which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member are allowed to exchange carbon credits on the domestic carbon market. 7. Greenhouse gas emission facilities participating in the domestic carbon market shall exchange, auction, borrow, pay, transfer carbon quotas and credits; implement mechanisms for exchange and offset of domestic and international carbon credits in accordance with regulations of law and international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory. 8. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall submit to the Prime Minister for approval the total greenhouse gas emission quotas by stage and annually. 9. The Ministry of Finance shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment and relevant ministries and ministerial-level agencies in, establishing the domestic carbon market. 10. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall allocate the greenhouse gas emission quotas to the subjects specified in Clause 2 of this Article; operate the domestic carbon market and participate in the world carbon market. 11. The Government shall detail this Article, the cost of allocation of greenhouse gas emission quotas, roadmap and time of deployment of the domestic carbon market in accordance with the socio-economic conditions of the country and the international agreements in which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a member.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@140: Insurance for liability to pay compensation for damage caused by environmental incidents 1. Insurance enterprises are encouraged to provide insurance for compensation liability for environmental incidents. 2. Based on the group of investment projects classified under Article 28 of this Law, the Government shall specify subjects to buy insurance for compensation liability for environmental incidents. 3. Entities other than those specified in Clause 2 of this Article are encouraged to buy insurance for compensation liability for environmental incidents.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@141: Incentives and supports for environmental protection 1. Incentives and supports for environmental protection are specified as follows: a) The State shall provide land and capital incentives and assistance; exemption and reduction of taxes and fees for environmental protection activities; price subsidies and freight subsidies for environmentally friendly products and other incentives and assistance for environmental protection activities as prescribed by law; b) Organizations and individuals that perform many environmental protection activities eligible for incentives and supports shall be entitled to incentives and supports corresponding to those activities; c) In case environmental protection activities are entitled to incentives and supports under this Law and other relevant laws, they will be entitled to incentives and supports under documents providing higher incentives and supports; d) The level and scope of incentives and assistance for environmental protection activities are adjusted to ensure the consistency with the policies on environmental protection from time to time. 2. Environmental protection investment activities eligible for incentives and supports include : a) Investment projects in the waste collection, treatment, recycling or reuse sector; b) Enterprises producing, supplying technologies, equipment, products and services in service of requirements on environmental protection, including technologies of waste treatment in combination with energy recovery; energy-saving technologies; services of concentrated daily-life sewage treatment; services of surrounding environment observation; public transport services using electric energy, renewable fuels; production of clean energy, renewable energy; production and supply of environmental observation equipment, on-spot daily-life sewage treatment equipment, environmentally friendly products and services are certified Vietnam Ecology Label. 3. Environmental protection activities other than business investment activities eligible for incentives and supports include : a) Renewing technologies, renovating and upgrading waste treatment works according to the roadmap prescribed by the law on environmental protection; b) Relocation of households from concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters or relocation of operating establishments to meet the safe distance on environment; c) Investment in natural capital development and protection of natural heritages. 4. Scientific research and technological development activities, technology transfer on environmental protection shall be enjoyed incentives and supports as prescribed by law on science, technology, technology transfer. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@142: Cyclic economics 1. Cyclic economy means an economic model in which designing, production, consumption and service activities aim to reduce the exploitation of raw materials and materials, prolong the product life cycle, limit waste generation and minimize adverse impacts on the environment. 2. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall integrate circular economy right from the stage of formulating development strategies, master plans, plans, programs and schemes; and waste management, reuse and recycling. 3. Production, business and service establishments shall establish management systems and apply measures to reduce the exploitation of natural resources, reduce wastes, raise the level of re-use and recycling of wastes right from the stage of project formulation, product and goods design to the stage of production and distribution. 4. The Government shall prescribe criteria, roadmap and mechanisms to encourage the implementation of circular economy suitable to the country's socio-economic conditions.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@143: Developing the environmental industry 1. Environmental industry refers to an economic sector in the system of economic sectors of Vietnam that provides technologies, equipment and products to meet environmental protection requirements. 2. The State shall make investment and adopt policies to support organizations and individuals in developing environmental industry, and implement the roadmap for opening environmental goods markets in accordance with international commitments. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@144: Environmental services development 1. Environmental services are the economic sectors providing services of measuring, controlling, limiting, preventing and reducing water, air and land environmental pollution and efficiently using natural resources; treating wastes and other pollutants; conserving biodiversity and other relevant services. 2. The State shall develop the environmental service market; promote the trade liberalization in environmental services according to the roadmap in accordance with international commitments; encourage organizations and individuals to invest in research and provision of environmental services. 3. Organizations and individuals are encouraged to provide environmental services in the following fields: a) Collection, transport, recycling and treatment of waste; b) Environmental monitoring, analysis and environmental impact assessment; c) Renovate and restore the environment and ecosystem in polluted and degraded areas; d) Provide consultancy and transfer of eco-friendly production technology, environmental technology, energy-saving technology, clean energy and renewable energy production; dd) Provide consultancy, training and information about environment, clean energy, renewable energy and energy efficiency; e) Environmental assessment of goods, machinery, equipment and technologies; g) Assessment of damage to environment and biodiversity; assessment of pollutants that directly affect human health; h/Other environmental protection services. 4. The price of environmental services shall comply with the provisions of the law on price. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@145: ENVIRONMENTAL PRODUCTS AND SERVICES 1. Environmentally friendly products and services are products and services created from environmentally friendly raw materials, materials, production and management technologies, reducing negative impacts on the environment during use and disposal, ensuring safety for the environment and human health and certified or recognized by competent agencies. 2. Vietnam Ecology label means label certified by competent agencies of Vietnam for environmentally friendly products, services. The observation, analysis, assessment of conformity to compare with criteria of Vietnam Ecology label for products, services must be performed by environmental observation organizations as prescribed by this Law and conformity assessment organizations as prescribed by law on quality of products, goods, law on measurement and other relevant law provisions. 3. Vietnam recognizes the environmentally friendly products and services certified by international organizations and countries signing mutual recognition agreements with Vietnam. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@146: Green Shopping 1. Green procurement means the procurement of environmentally friendly products and services certified Vietnam Ecology Label or recognized as prescribed by law. 2. Prioritizing the green procurement for investment projects and tasks using the state budget as prescribed by the Government.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@147: Exploitation, use and development of natural capital 1. Natural capital means natural resources, including land, water, forests, aquatic resources, minerals, fossil fuels, natural energy sources and natural ecosystem services. 2. The exploitation, use and development of natural capital shall comply with the following principles: a) Natural capital which is inventoried and assessed to serve socio-economic development as prescribed by law; b) The State shall prioritize the investment in maintaining and developing natural capital capable of regeneration and providing services for natural ecosystems; c) Natural capital shall be prioritized for reinvestment in maintenance and development of natural capital. 3. The State encourages organizations and individuals to exploit, use and bring into play their advantages, and invest in the maintenance and development of natural capital. 4. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall incorporate natural capital development investment in socio-economic development strategies, master plans, plans, programs, schemes and projects.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@148: Resources for environmental protection 1. The State shall allocate resources for the following environmental protection activities: a) Waste management and waste treatment; b) Environmental remediation; c) Constructing environmental protection technical infrastructure; equipment for environmental protection; environmental monitoring; d) Inspecting, examining and supervising environmental protection; dd) Preserve nature and biodiversity; protect environment of natural heritages; cope with climate change; e) Scientific research, development and transfer of environmental technologies; g) Communicating and raising awareness of environmental protection; providing environmental education; disseminating knowledge and propagating the law on environmental protection; h) Activities of international integration and international cooperation on environmental protection; i) Other state management activities on environmental protection as prescribed by law. 2. Resources for environmental protection activities specified in Clause 1 of this Article include: a) State budget for recurrent expenditure, development investment expenditure for environmental protection; b) Capital sources mobilized from private sector involvement in environmental protection. 3. State budget shall have separate spending items for environmental protection activities and be gradually increased in each period, suitable to budget capacity and environmental protection requirements and tasks. 4. Investment project owners and establishments shall ensure funds for the following environmental protection activities : a) Investing in innovating waste treatment technologies in accordance with laws; b) Invest in construction and operation of environmental protection works as prescribed by law; c) Implementation of environmental monitoring and supervision programs (if any); d) Implementation of the plan for prevention and response to environmental emergencies (if any); dd) Other environmental protection activities as prescribed by law. 5. Funds for environmental protection activities specified in Clause 4 of this Article must be listed, accounted and publicized on the accounting system of the facility and reported in accordance with law. 6. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall guide the statistics, monitoring and announcement of resources for environmental protection activities. 7. The Government shall elaborate Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@149: Green Credit 1. Green credit refers to the credit granted to the following investment projects: a) Effective use of natural resources; b) Response to climate change; c) Waste management; d) Pollution treatment, environmental quality improvement; dd) Restoration of natural ecosystems; f/Nature and biodiversity conservation; g) Generate other environmental benefits. 2. Lending activities of credit institutions and foreign bank branches in Vietnam for investment projects must comply with regulations on management of environmental risks in lending activities. 3. Credit institutions and branches of foreign banks in Vietnam are encouraged to provide concessional loans for the projects mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article. 4. The Governor of the State Bank shall provide guidance on management of environmental risks in credit extension activities of credit institutions and foreign bank branches in Vietnam. 5. The Government shall promulgate the roadmap for implementation and incentive mechanism for green credit extension.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@150: Green Bonds 1. Green bonds are bonds issued by the Government, local governments, and enterprises in accordance with regulations of law on bonds to raise funds for environmental protection activities and investment projects that provide environmental benefits. 2. The proceeds from the issuance of green bonds must be accounted and monitored in accordance with the law on bonds and used for environmental protection projects and environmental benefits investment projects, including : a) Renovating and upgrading environmental protection works; b) Change technology towards application of the best existing techniques; c) Applying circular economy, green economy, low carbon emission; d) Preventing and minimizing environmental pollution; dd) Environmental improvement and remediation after environmental incidents; e) Use natural resources and land resources effectively, save energy and develop renewable energy; g) Construction of multi-purpose and eco-friendly infrastructure; h) Effectively manage water sources and wastewater treatment; i) Adaptation to climate change, investment in development of natural capital; k) Other investment projects as prescribed. 3. The issuer of green bonds must provide information about environmental impact assessment, environmental licenses of investment projects and use of funds raised from issuance of green bonds for investors. 4. Issuing entities and investors purchasing green bonds are entitled to incentives as prescribed in this Law and other relevant law provisions. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@151: Environmental protection funds 1. Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund and provincial-level environmental protection funds are state financial institutions established at central, provincial and municipal levels to provide preferential loans, receive deposits, provide financial supports and contributions for environmental protection activities. The State encourages enterprises, organizations and individuals to set up environmental protection funds. 2. The authority to establish the environmental protection fund is specified as follows: a) The Prime Minister shall decide the establishment, organization and operation of Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund; b) The provincial People's Committee shall decide the establishment, organization and operation of provincial environmental protection funds; c) Organizations, enterprises and individuals establish the environmental protection fund and operate in accordance with regulations of law. 3. The Government shall provide for funding sources of Vietnam Environmental Protection Fund and provincial-level environmental protection funds.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@152: Scientific research, technological development, application and transfer of environmental protection technologies 1. Organizations and individuals investing in scientific research, technological development, application and transfer of environmental protection technologies shall enjoy the State's preferences and supports. 2. Scientific research, technological development, application and transfer of environmental protection technologies entitled to the State's preferences and supports include: a) Use natural resources efficiently, save energy, conserve nature, biodiversity and be environmentally friendly; b) Reuse, recycling of waste, treatment of waste, environmental improvement and remediation; c) Control and minimize environmental pollution; monitor and forecast environmental changes; d/Studying and formulating climate change response solutions.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@153: Education, training and fostering on environmental protection 1. Educational contents and programs of the national education system shall be integrated with knowledge and law on environmental protection. 2. The State prioritizes training and retraining of human resources for environmental protection; invests in training and retraining of leading and managerial cadres and civil servants and technical workers in environmental protection; and encourages organizations and individuals to participate in education on environmental protection and training and retraining of human resources for environmental protection. 3. The Minister of Education and Training shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Minister of Natural Resources and Environment in, defining contents and programs of education and training in environmental protection and development of human resources for environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@154: Disseminating knowledge and propagating the law on environmental protection 1. Communicating and disseminating knowledge and propagating the law on environmental protection must be carried out regularly and widely. 2. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with ministries, ministerial-level agencies, socio-political organizations, media agencies and press agencies in, disseminating knowledge and propagating the law on environmental protection. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, media agencies and press agencies in, disseminating knowledge and propagating the law on environmental protection in the domains under their management. 4. The provincial People's Committees shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the media agencies, press agencies in having responsibility for communication, dissemination of knowledge, propagation of law on environmental protection in their localities.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@155: Principles of international integration and cooperation in environmental protection 1. International integration and cooperation in environmental protection shall be carried out on the basis of equality, mutual benefit, strengthening of the aggregate strength and raising of the national position and prestige, respect for independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity, observance of each party's law, international law and commitments in treaties and international agreements related to the environment. 2. International treaties and agreements which are beneficial to the national, regional and global environmental protection and suitable to Vietnam's interests and capacity shall be considered for conclusion. 3. International environmental disputes shall be settled through peaceful measures, according to international practices, international laws and laws of concerned parties.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@156: Responsibilities in international integration and cooperation on environmental protection 1. The State encourages the active international integration on environmental protection, focusing on the areas of management and protection of environmental components, biodiversity conservation, green growth, sustainable development and response to climate change; ensures resources and fully performs the obligations committed in the international treaties and agreements related to the environment, meets the trend of international integration and supports the international economic integration. 2. The State encourages investment, cooperation and international support for state management, human resource training, sharing of environmental information and data, scientific research, transfer of advanced technologies, nature and biodiversity conservation and other environmental protection activities; response to and settlement of environmental incidents and environmental-related matters nationwide, globally and across borders. 3. Organizations and individuals shall proactively comply with internationally recognized environmental requirements, conditions and standards to raise competitiveness in international trade; prevent and limit negative impacts on the environment. 4. The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall act as the focal point in summarizing activities of international integration and cooperation on environmental protection. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees shall organize the implementation of international integration and cooperation on environmental protection within their management scope.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@157: Responsibilities and powers of the Vietnam Fatherland Front 1. The Vietnamese Fatherland Front, within the scope of its duties and powers, shall be responsible for propagating and mobilizing its members and the people to participate in environmental protection activities. 2. The Vietnamese Fatherland Front shall provide consultancy, criticize and supervise the implementation of policies and laws on environmental protection as prescribed by law. State management agencies at all levels shall enable the Vietnamese Fatherland Front to participate in environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@158: Responsibilities and powers of socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations and socio-professional organizations 1. Socio - political organizations, socio - political and professional organizations and socio - professional organizations shall have the following responsibilities: a) Comply with regulations of law on environmental protection; b) Participate in environmental protection activities. 2. Socio - political organizations, socio - political and professional organizations and socio - professional organizations shall have the following rights: a) Be provided with and request for provision of information on environmental protection as prescribed by law; b) Consulting the investment projects related to their functions, tasks, and entitlements; c) Provide environmental protection consultancy and criticism to regulatory authorities, project owners and relevant entities as prescribed by law; d) Participate in inspection of environmental protection at investment projects, facilities, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters in relation to their functions, tasks and powers; dd) Request competent authorities to take actions against violations against regulations of law on environmental protection. 3. The State management agencies in charge of environment at all levels shall have to create conditions for socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations and socio-professional organizations to exercise the rights prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article. 4. The Government shall elaborate Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@159: Rights and obligations of residential communities 1. Representatives of residential communities in areas affected by environmental impacts of investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones or industrial clusters may request project owners or establishments to provide environmental protection information through direct dialogues or written communication; organize field study of environmental protection work of investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones or industrial clusters; collect and provide information to competent agencies and take responsibility for the provided information. 2. Representatives of residential communities in the areas affected by environmental impacts of investment projects, establishments, consolidated production, business and service zones or industrial clusters may request concerned state management agencies to provide results of inspection, examination and handling of these investment projects or establishments, unless these information are state secrets or secrets of enterprises as prescribed by law. 3. Representatives of residential communities shall have the right to participate in the assessment of environmental protection results of investment projects, establishments, concentrated production, business and service zones, industrial clusters; take measures to protect rights and interests of residential communities as prescribed by law. 4. Project owners and establishments shall comply with requests of representatives of communities in accordance with law. 5. State management agencies on environment at all levels shall develop online systems to receive, process and respond to feedback and proposals of organizations, individuals and residential communities on environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@160: Inspection of environmental protection and environmental audit 1. Responsibilities for organizing and directing the examination and inspection of environmental protection are prescribed as follows: a) The Minister of Natural Resources and Environment shall organize the inspection of environmental protection nationwide; b) The Minister of National Defense shall organize the inspection of environmental protection of investment projects and facilities classified as national defense secrets; c) The Minister of Public Security shall organize the inspection of environmental protection of investment projects and facilities classified as state secrets on security; direct the police force to prevent and combat environmental crimes to inspect the implementation of the law on environmental protection; d) Presidents of provincial People's Committees shall organize the inspection of environmental protection in their provinces; direct the cooperation in inspection of environmental protection in the cases mentioned in Point a of this Clause or at the request of competent authorities; dd) Presidents of People's Committees of districts shall organize the inspection of environmental protection in their districts; direct the cooperation in inspection of environmental protection in the cases mentioned in Point d of this Clause or at the request of competent authorities; e) Presidents of People's Committees of communes shall organize inspection of environmental protection of households, individuals and entities within their competence in receiving environmental registration in the administrative division; direct the cooperation in inspection of environmental protection in the cases prescribed in Point dd of this Clause or at the request of competent agencies. 2. The competence, organization and operation of specialized environmental protection inspection comply with the law on inspection and specific regulations on environmental protection as follows : a) Regular inspection shall be conducted on the basis of functions and tasks of agencies assigned to perform specialized inspection functions; b) Irregular inspection shall be carried out as prescribed when detecting signs of violations against regulations on environmental protection; at the request of the settlement of complaints and denunciations, prevention and fighting against corruption or as assigned by the Minister of Natural Resources and Environment or the President of the People's Committee of the province. Irregular inspection shall not be announced in advance if necessary; c) Except for the irregular inspection as prescribed in this Law, the number of environmental protection inspection shall not exceed one time per year for an organization or individual; d) During the inspection, state management agencies for environmental protection at all levels shall transfer dossiers of cases with signs of environmental crimes to competent agencies for investigation and handling as prescribed by law; coordinate with the police force for prevention and combat of environmental crimes in inspecting the observance of law on environmental protection by organizations and individuals upon request. 3. Inspection of the observance of the law on environmental protection means inspection activities of competent state agencies against organizations and individuals, except for inspection to settle administrative procedures specified in this Law, which is conducted as follows: a) The unscheduled inspection of environmental protection authority shall be carried out when there are grounds for presuming that the organization/individual has signs of violations against regulations of law on environmental protection or decided by the Minister of Natural Resources and Environment or the President of the People's Committee of the province; b) The environmental crime prevention and fighting police force shall inspect organizations and individuals when detecting signs of commission of crimes or violations related to environmental crimes; when receiving denunciations, information and information about crimes, recommendations for prosecution or reports on violations related to environmental crimes and notify the environmental protection state management agencies at the same level for coordination; coordinate in inspecting the observance of the law on environmental protection in other cases of organizations and individuals under plans approved by the Minister of Natural Resources and Environment or provincial-level People's Committee chairpersons. Annually, send written notices of results of inspection and handling of violations of the law on environmental protection to the environmental protection state management agencies at the same level for summarization and monitoring. 4. Environmental protection examination and inspection activities must ensure no overlapping and no impact on normal production, business and service activities of organizations and individuals; and must be coordinated by state management agencies in charge of environmental protection, the environmental crime prevention and combat police force and other concerned agencies. 5. The State Audit Office of Vietnam shall carry out environmental audits in accordance with regulations of the Law on State Audit Office of Vietnam and other relevant regulations of law. 6. The Government shall elaborate Clauses 2,3 and 4 of this Article.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@161: Handling of violations 1. Any entity that violates the law on environmental protection, causes pollution, degradation, or environmental emergencies, or causes damage to the State, shall be responsible for remedying the pollution, restoring the environment, paying compensation for damage, and incur penalties in accordance with this Law and other relevant regulations of law. 2. Heads of agencies, organizations, cadres, civil servants, public employees and staffs in charge of environmental protection who abuse their positions and powers to cause troubles and harassment to organizations and individuals, cover up organizations and individuals that violate the law on environmental protection or show irresponsibility in causing environmental pollution or incidents shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability; if causing damage, they shall pay compensations therefor in accordance with law.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@162: Environmental disputes 1. Environmental disputes include: a) Disputes over the rights and responsibilities for environmental protection in the exploitation and use of environmental components; b) Disputes over the determination of causes of environmental pollution, degradation or incidents; c/Disputes over responsibilities for handling, remedying consequences and paying compensation for environmental damage. 2. Environmental disputes shall be settled in accordance with the civil law, this Law and other relevant laws. Disputes over compensation for environmental damage shall be settled in accordance with Article 133 of this Law and other relevant laws. 3. The time for calculating the statute of limitations for initiating environmental lawsuits is the date when organizations and individuals suffering damage have the right to request to know or must know the damage caused by environmental law violations committed by other organizations and individuals. 4. Environmental disputes in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in which one or all parties are foreign organizations or individuals shall be settled in accordance with the law of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, unless otherwise provided for by treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@163: Environmental complaints and denunciations 1. Organizations and individuals have the right to complain about violations of the law on environmental protection committed by agencies, organizations and individuals as prescribed by law. 2. Individuals have the right to denounce acts of violation of law on environmental protection to the competent agencies and persons as prescribed by law on denunciation.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@164: Contents of state management of environmental protection 1. Promulgate and organize the implementation of policies and laws; technical standards, regulations and instructions; strategies, planning, plans; programs, schemes and projects on environmental protection. 2. To appraise and approve appraisal results of environmental impact assessment reports; to grant, renew, modify, re-grant and revoke environmental permits; to conduct environmental registration; to grant, re-grant and revoke environmental certificates. 3. Control sources of pollution; manage waste and environmental quality; improve and restore the environment; protect the environment of natural heritages, conserve the nature and biodiversity; prevent and respond to environmental incidents. 4. Constructing and managing environmental monitoring system; organizing environmental monitoring. 5. Constructing and updating environmental information systems, databases and environmental reports. 6. To build and operate a system for monitoring and assessing climate change adaptation activities; a system for measuring, reporting and appraising GHG emission reduction. 7. Carry out greenhouse gas inventories; develop and update scenarios and databases on climate change, sea level rise and urban flooding; carry out national climate assessment; provide instructions on use of information and data on climate change and integration of climate change response contents into strategies and planning. 8. Organize the implementation of the domestic carbon market; implement the mechanism for exchange of international credits and commitments on greenhouse gas emission reduction. 9. Inspecting, examining, settling complaints and denunciations; handling violations of the law on environmental protection; determining damage and claiming compensation for environmental damage. 10. Environmental communication and education, raising of awareness about and awareness about environmental protection; training and retraining in environmental protection management. 11. Organizing scientific research, technological development, application and transfer of technologies, international integration and cooperation on environmental protection. 12. Allocate state budget funds for environmental protection tasks according to current budget decentralization; make statistics on, monitor and publicize sources of funds for environmental protection.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@165: The Government's responsibilities for state management of environmental protection 1. To perform the unified state management of environmental protection nationwide; to promulgate or submit to competent authorities for promulgation legal documents, mechanisms and policies on environmental protection. 2. To decide on policies on environmental protection, improvement and conservation; to direct the concentrated settlement and remedy of environmental pollution and degradation, and improvement of environmental quality in key areas; to control pollution, respond to and remedy environmental incidents; to develop clean energy, production and sustainable consumption; to develop the environmental industry and environmental services. 3. To consolidate the system of state management agencies in charge of environmental protection to meet management requirements; to assign and decentralize the state management of environmental protection; to allocate resources for environmental protection activities; to direct scientific and technological research and application; to integrate and enter into international cooperation on environmental protection. 4. Submit annual reports on environmental protection to the National Assembly.
Luật Bảo vệ môi trường@166: The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment's responsibilities for state management of environmental protection The Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment shall take responsibility before the Government for the unified state management of environmental protection and have the following responsibilities : 1. To assume the prime responsibility for elaborating, promulgating or submitting to competent authorities for promulgation, and organize the implementation of, legal documents on environmental protection; national environmental standards and technical regulations; environmental protection strategies, plannings, plans, programs, schemes and projects; 2. To give opinions on strategic environmental assessment contents; to organize the evaluation of environmental impact assessment reports; to grant, renew, adjust, re-grant and withdraw environmental permits; to grant, renew and re-grant environmental certificates according to its competence; 3. To direct, guide, inspect and organize the control of pollution sources; to manage waste and environmental quality; to improve and rehabilitate the environment; to protect the environment of natural heritages, to conserve the nature and biodiversity; to prevent and respond to environmental incidents according to law provisions; 4. To organize the building and management of the national environmental observation network; to approve and organize the implementation of environmental observation programs; to provide information and warnings on environmental pollution according to law provisions; 5. To organize the elaboration of environmental protection contents in regional plannings; to guide the elaboration of environmental protection contents in provincial plannings and special administrative-economic unit plannings; 6. To make statistics, build, maintain and operate environmental information and database systems and environmental reports according to law provisions; 7. To communicate, disseminate knowledge and propagate the legislation on environmental protection, educate in and raise the awareness of, environmental protection; to provide professional training and fostering in environmental protection management according to law provisions; 8. To propose policies on environmental protection tax and charges, issuance of green bonds and other economic instruments in order to mobilize and use resources for environmental protection according to law provisions; 9. To organize the formulation and implementation of a system for monitoring and evaluation of climate change adaptation activities at the national level; a system for measurement, reporting and appraisal of greenhouse gas emission reduction activities at the national level; 10. Carry out the national greenhouse gas inventory; establish and update the national database and climate change scenarios; provide instructions on the use of information and data on climate change and integrate the contents of response to climate change into the strategy and planning; 11. To sum up and propose the allocation of state budget estimates for environmental protection activities of ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees and guide the implementation thereof according to the law on state budget; to guide the making of statistics on, monitoring and publicization of sources of funds for environmental protection; 12. Luật Viên chức@1: Scope This Law provides for public employees; rights and obligations of public employees; recruitment, employment and management of public employees in public non-business units.
Luật Viên chức@2: Public officials Public employees are Vietnamese citizens who are recruited according to working positions, work at public non-business units under working contracts and receive salaries from salary funds of public non-business units in accordance with law.
Luật Viên chức@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Managerial public employees are those who are appointed to hold managerial posts for a definite term, take responsibility for administering and organizing the performance of one or several jobs in public non-business units but are other than civil servants and enjoy managerial position allowances. 2. Professional ethics are the standards of awareness and behavior in accordance with the characteristics of each field of professional activities stipulated by the competent agencies and organizations. 3. Code of conduct means standards of conduct of public employees in performing their tasks and in social relations, which are promulgated by competent state agencies and suitable to the particularities of work in each field of activity and publicized for people to supervise their observance. 4. Recruitment means the selection of persons with good qualities, qualifications and capabilities to work as public employees in public non-business units. 5. Working contract means a written agreement between a public employee or a person recruited to work as a public employee and the head of a public non-business unit on the working position, salary, preferential treatment and working conditions, rights and obligations of each party.
Luật Viên chức@4: Professional activities of public employees Professional activities of public employees means the performance of jobs or tasks requiring professional qualifications, capabilities and skills in public non-business units under this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Viên chức@5: Principles of professional activities of public employees 1. To observe law and take responsibility before law in the course of carrying out professional activities. 2. Devoted serving of the people. 3. Comply with professional procedures and regulations, professional ethics and code of conduct. 4. To submit to the inspection, examination and supervision by competent agencies and organizations and by people.
Luật Viên chức@6: Principles of public administration 1. Ensuring the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the unified management of the State. 2. Ensuring the right to initiative and heightening the responsibility of the heads of public non-business units. 3. Public employees shall be recruited, employed, managed and evaluated based on professional title criteria and working positions and working contracts. 4. To implement gender equality and the State's preferential policies toward talented public employees, ethnic minority people, people with meritorious services to the revolution, public employees working in mountainous, border, island, deep-lying, remote and ethnic minority areas, areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions, and other preferential policies toward public employees.
Luật Viên chức@7: Job position 1. Working position means a job or task associated with a corresponding professional title or managerial post, serving as a basis for determining the number of employees and structure of public employees for recruitment, employment and management of public employees in public non-business units. 2. The Government shall provide for principles and methods of determining job positions, competence, order and procedures for deciding on the number of job positions in public non-business units.
Luật Viên chức@8: Professional titles 1. Professional title means an appellation expressing the professional qualifications and capabilities of a public employee in each professional domain. 2. The Ministry of Home Affairs shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with related ministries and ministerial-level agencies in, prescribing a system of lists, criteria and codes of professional titles.
Luật Viên chức@9: Public service providers and organizational structure of public service providers 1. Public non-business units are organizations established by competent state agencies, political organizations or socio-political organizations in accordance with law, have the legal person status, provide public services and serve state management. 2. Public service providers include: a) Public service providers that are granted full autonomy in task performance, finance, organizational structure and personnel (hereinafter referred to as autonomous public service providers); b) Public service providers that have not been granted full autonomy in task performance, finance, organizational structure and personnel (hereinafter referred to as non-autonomous public service providers). 3. The Government shall elaborate criteria for classification of public service providers prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article for each field of operation based on their autonomy in task performance, finance, organizational structure, personnel and scope of operation. 4. Based on specific conditions and management requirements for each type of public non-business unit in each field, the Government shall stipulate the establishment, structure of functions, tasks and powers of the Management Board in the public non-business unit, the relationship between the Management Board and the head of the public non-business unit.
Luật Viên chức@10: Policies on building and development of public non-business units and public employees 1. The State shall focus on building a system of public non-business units to provide public services which the State is responsible for providing mainly to people in the domains of health, education, science and other domains which the non-public sector is unable to provide; ensure the provision of basic health and education services in mountainous, border, island, deep-lying, remote, ethnic minority areas and areas with particularly difficult socio-economic conditions. 2. The Government shall coordinate with competent agencies in directing the planning, organization and reorganization of the system of public non-business units along the direction of identifying domains restricted from development and domains prioritized for development, ensuring economical and efficient use and concentration of resources for raising the quality of non-business activities. Public non-business units shall not be organized to provide business services for profit generation. 3. Continue to renovate the operation mechanism of public service providers towards autonomy, self-responsibility and independent accounting; separate the state management of Ministries and ministerial agencies from the management of public service providers. 4. The State shall adopt policies to build and develop a contingent of public employees with professional ethics, qualifications and professional capabilities to meet increasing requirements of the public service provision sector; discover, attract, nurture, employ and properly treat talented persons to improve the quality of services provided to people.
Luật Viên chức@11: Rights of public employees to professional activities 1. To be protected by law in their professional activities. 2. To be trained and retrained to raise their political and professional qualifications. 3. To be provided with working equipment and conditions. 4. To be provided with information related to their assigned work or tasks. 5. To decide on professional matters related to their assigned work or tasks. 6. To refuse to perform jobs or tasks contrary to law. 7. To enjoy other rights in professional activities as provided for by law.
Luật Viên chức@12: Rights of public employees to wages and wage-related regimes 1. To be paid salary corresponding to their working positions, professional titles, managerial posts and results of performance of assigned jobs or tasks; to enjoy allowances and preferential policies in case they work in mountainous, border, island, deep-lying, remote, ethnic minority areas or areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions or in hazardous and dangerous occupations or occupations or special non-business domains. 2. Receive overtime pay, night work pay, business trip allowances and other benefits as prescribed by law and regulations of public service providers. 3. Receive bonuses and consideration for salary increase in accordance with regulations of law and regulations of public service providers.
Luật Viên chức@13: Employee's right to rest 1. To take annual leaves, public holidays and personal leaves under the labor law. Public employees who do not use or have not used up annual leave days due to work requirements may receive a sum of money for these days. 2. Public employees working in mountainous, border, island, deep-lying and remote areas or other special cases may aggregate the number of 2-year leave days for one time if so requested; if aggregating the number of 3-year leave days for one time, they must obtain the consent of the heads of their public non-business units. 3. For special non-business sectors, public employees may take leave and enjoy salaries under law. 4. To take unpaid leaves in case they have plausible reasons and obtain the consent of heads of their public non-business units.
Luật Viên chức@14: Rights of public employees to do business and work overtime 1. To carry out professional activities beyond the working duration stated in working contracts, unless otherwise provided for by law. 2. To sign seasonal or seasonal contracts with other agencies, organizations or units not banned by law but must fulfill their assigned tasks and obtain the consent of the heads of their public non-business units. 3. Contribute capital without participating in management and administration of limited liability companies, joint-stock companies, partnerships, cooperatives, private hospitals, private schools and private scientific research institutions, unless otherwise prescribed by specialized laws.
Luật Viên chức@15: Other rights of public employees Public employees shall be commended, honored, engaged in socio-economic activities; enjoy housing incentives; and be given conditions to study and conduct professional activities at home and abroad in accordance with law. Public employees who are injured or die while performing their assigned jobs or tasks shall be considered for entitlement to policies applicable to war invalids or for recognition as fallen heroes in accordance with law.
Luật Viên chức@16: General obligations of public employees 1. To observe the line, guidelines and policies of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the State's laws. 2. To have a healthy lifestyle, to be honest, necessary, thrifty, incorruptible, public-minded and impartial. 3. To have a sense of discipline and responsibility in professional activities; to strictly comply with working regulations and rules of public non-business units. 4. To protect state secrets; to preserve and protect public property, and efficiently and economically use assigned property. 5. To foster and foster professional ethics and observe code of conduct of public employees.
Luật Viên chức@17: Obligations of public employees in professional activities 1. To perform assigned work or tasks in a timely and quality manner. 2. To well coordinate with colleagues in performing their work or tasks. 3. To comply with the assignment of work by competent persons. 4. To regularly study to raise their professional qualifications and skills. 5. When serving the people, public employees shall comply with the following regulations: a) Show polite and respectful attitude towards the people; b) Have a spirit of cooperation and modest manners; c) Not being imperious, authoritarian, causing difficulties and troubles to people; d) Comply with regulations on professional ethics. 6. To take responsibility for the performance of professional activities. 7. To perform other obligations as provided for by law.
Luật Viên chức@18: Obligations of managers Managerial public employees shall perform the obligations specified in Articles 16 and 17 of this Law and the following obligations: 1. To direct and organize the performance of their units' tasks strictly according to their assigned responsibilities and competence; 2. Exercise democracy, maintain solidarity and professional ethics in the units assigned to manage and take charge; 3. To take responsibility or joint responsibility for professional activities of public employees under their management; 4. To build and develop human resources; to manage and efficiently use material and financial foundations in units assigned to them for management and management; 5. To organize the application of measures to prevent and combat corruption and practice thrift and combat waste in units they are assigned to manage and take charge of.
Luật Viên chức@19: What officials are not supposed to do 1. Shirking their responsibilities, shirking their assigned jobs or tasks; sowing factionalism, discord; quitting their jobs without permission; participating in strikes. 2. Using property of agencies, organizations, units and people in contravention of law. 3. Discriminating in any form against nationality, gender, social class, belief and religion. 4. Taking advantage of professional activities to propagate against the Party's line and policies and the State's laws or harm the fine customs and practices, cultural and spiritual life of people and society. 5. Hurting the honor, dignity and prestige of other persons while performing professional activities. 6. Other things public employees are prohibited from doing under the Anti-Corruption Law, the Law on Thrift Practice and Waste Combat and other relevant laws.
Luật Viên chức@20: Recruitment bases Recruitment of public employees must be based on job demands, working positions, criteria of professional titles and salary funds of public non-business units.
Luật Viên chức@21: Recruitment 1. Ensuring publicity, transparency, fairness, objectivity and legality. 2. Ensuring competitiveness. 3. Selecting proper persons who meet the requirements of working positions. 4. To heighten the responsibility of heads of public non-business units. 5. Give priority to talented people, people with meritorious services to the revolution and ethnic minority people.
Luật Viên chức@22: Conditions for application for admission 1. A person who fully satisfies the following conditions, regardless of his/her ethnicity, gender, social strata, belief or religion, may register for public employee recruitment: a) He/she holds Vietnamese nationality and resides in Vietnam; b) Applicants must be at least 18 years of age. Regarding cultural, artistic, physical training and sports activities, the application age may be lower than the prescribed age and must be approved in writing by the legal representative; c) Filing applications for recruitment; d) Having clear personal history; dd) Have qualifications, training certificates, practice certificates or skills suitable for the job position; f/Being physically fit for the performance of jobs or tasks; g) Meet other requirements of the working position determined by the public service provider but not in contravention of law. 2.
