The following persons may not register for public employee recruitment: a) He/she has lost or limited legal capacity; b) They are being examined for penal liability; serving criminal judgments or decisions of courts; being subject to administrative handling measures of being sent to medical treatment establishments, education establishments or reformatories.
Luật Viên chức@23: Recruitment Public employee recruitment shall be conducted through examination or selection.
Luật Viên chức@24: Organization of recruitment 1. For autonomous public non-business units, heads of these units shall recruit public employees and take responsibility for their decisions. For public non-business units which are not yet assigned the autonomy, competent agencies managing these units shall recruit public employees or decentralize the recruitment to heads of these units. 2. Based on recruitment results, heads of public non-business units shall sign working contracts with successful candidates for public employees. 3. The Government shall detail contents related to public employee recruitment specified in this Law.
Luật Viên chức@25: Types of employment contracts 1. A definite-term working contract is a contract in which the two parties determine the term and time of termination of the contract within a period of between full 12 months and 36 months. A definite-term working contract applies to persons who are recruited to work as public employees, except the cases specified at Points d and e, Clause 1, Article 58 of this Law. 2. Working contract with an indefinite term means a contract whereby the two parties neither define the term nor the time of termination of the contract. Working contracts with an indefinite term are applicable to cases in which working contracts with a definite term have been completed and cadres or civil servants are transformed into public employees under Points d and e, Clause 1, Article 58 of this Law.
Luật Viên chức@26: Contents and forms of a working contract 1. A working contract has the following principal contents : a) Names and addresses of the public service provider and its head; b/Full name, address and date of birth of the recruited person. If the recruited person is under 18 years of age, the full name, address and date of birth of the at-law representative of the recruited person are required; c) Job or task, job position and working place; d) Rights and obligations of the parties; e/Type of the contract, term and conditions for termination of the working contract; e) Salary, bonus and other benefits (if any); g) Working time and rest time; h) Probation regime (if any); i) Working conditions and issues related to labor protection; k) Social insurance, health insurance; k/Effect of the working contract; m) Other commitments associated with nature and characteristics of sectors, fields and particular conditions of public non-business units but not contrary to provisions of this Law and other provisions of relevant law. 2. A working contract shall be signed in writing between the head of a public non-business unit and the recruited public employee and made in three copies, one of which shall be handed to the public employee. 3. For the professional titles as prescribed by law appointed by the superior level of the head of the public non-business unit, before signing the working contract, it must be approved by that level.
Luật Viên chức@27: Probation Mode 1. A successful public employee must undergo probation, except for those who have performed professional operations suitable to the vacancy for at least 12 months. 2. The probation period is between 3 months and 12 months and must be stated in the working contract. 3. The Government shall detail the probation regime.
Luật Viên chức@28: Change of contents, renewal, suspension and termination of working contracts 1. In the course of performance of a working contract, if a party requests a change in the contents of the contract, it shall notify such to the other party at least 3 working days in advance. When it agrees, the parties shall modify and supplement relevant contents of the contract. During the time of reaching agreement, the parties shall still comply with the signed working contract. If they fail to reach agreement, they shall continue performing the signed working contract or agree to terminate the working contract. 2. For a definite-term working contract, 60 days before its expiration, the head of the public non-business unit shall, based on the unit's needs and the evaluation of the public employee's capacity to fulfill his/her tasks, decide to renew or terminate the working contract with the public employee. 3. The suspension and termination of employment contracts shall comply with regulations of law on labor. 4. When public employees move to work at other agencies, organizations or units, their working contracts shall be terminated and they are entitled to regimes and policies provided for by law. 5. When a public employee is appointed by a competent authority to hold a position which is prescribed by law to be civil servant at a public non-business unit or when there is a decision on his/her retirement, his/her working contract is automatically terminated.
Luật Viên chức@29: Unilateral termination of the employment contract 1. Public non-business units may unilaterally terminate working contracts with public employees in the following cases : a/He/she has been assessed as failing to fulfill his/her tasks for 2 consecutive years; b/Public employees who are dismissed under Point d, Clause 1, Article 52, and Clause 1, Article 57 of this Law; c/Public employees working under indefinite-term working contracts who fall sick and have received medical treatment for 12 consecutive months or public employees working under working contracts with definite-term working contracts who fall sick and have received medical treatment for 6 consecutive months but have not yet recovered their working capacity. When their health recovers, they may be considered for further signing of working contracts; d/The public non-business unit is forced to reduce its size due to natural disasters, fires or other force majeure circumstances under the Government's regulations, resulting in the loss of the working position it is holding; dd) The public service provider terminates its operation under a decision of a competent authority. 2. When unilaterally terminating working contracts, except the case specified at Point b, Clause 1 of this Article, heads of public non-business units shall notify public employees at least 45 days in advance, for working contracts with an indefinite term, or at least 30 days in advance, for working contracts with a definite term. For public employees recruited by agencies managing public non-business units, the unilateral termination of working contracts shall be decided by heads of public non-business units after obtaining written approval of agencies managing these units. 3. Heads of public non-business units may not unilaterally terminate working contracts with public employees in the following cases : a/Public employees who are sick or have an accident or are undergoing treatment for an occupational disease under decisions of medical treatment establishments, except the case specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article; b/Public employees who are on annual leave, leave for personal reasons or other cases permitted by heads of public non-business units; c/Female public employees who are pregnant, on maternity leave or nursing under-36-month children, except cases in which public non-business units terminate their operation. 4. Public employees working under working contracts with an indefinite term may unilaterally terminate their contracts but shall notify such in writing to heads of their public non-business units at least 45 days in advance; public employees who get sick or suffer accidents and have been receiving medical treatment for 6 consecutive months shall be notified at least 3 days in advance. 5. Public employees working under definite-term working contracts may unilaterally terminate their contracts in the following cases : a) Not being arranged in accordance with the working position, working place or not being ensured the working conditions agreed in the working contract; b) He/she is not paid sufficiently or on schedule as specified in the employment contract; c) Being abused or forced to work; d/They themselves or their families are in really difficult circumstances and cannot continue performing the contracts; e/The female public employee is pregnant and has to take leave as prescribed by the medical treatment establishment; e/Public employees who are sick or have an accident and have received medical treatment for 3 consecutive months but their working capacity has not yet recovered. 6. Public employees shall notify in writing the unilateral termination of their working contracts to heads of their public non-business units at least 3 days in advance, for the cases specified at Points a, b, c, e and f, Clause 5 of this Article, or at least 30 days in advance, for the cases specified at Point d, Clause 5 of this Article.
Luật Viên chức@30: Settlement of disputes over working contracts Disputes related to the conclusion, performance or termination of working contracts shall be settled in accordance with the labor law.
Luật Viên chức@31: Appointment and change of professional titles 1. Appointment of public employees to professional titles must adhere to the following principles : a) The candidate shall be appointed to the appropriate position; b) A person appointed to a professional title must fully meet the criteria of such professional title. 2. The change of professional titles of public employees shall be effected through examination or consideration on the principles of equality, publicity, transparency, objectivity and legality. 3. Public employees may register for examination or consideration for change of professional titles if their public non-business units so request and satisfy the conditions and criteria prescribed by law. 4. The Government shall specify the order and procedures for examination or consideration for appointment of public employees to professional titles, and assign and decentralize the organization of examination or consideration for appointment of public employees to professional titles. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies assigned to perform the state management of the fields of public employee activities shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Ministry of Home Affairs in, specifying criteria of professional titles and conditions for examination or consideration for change of professional titles of public employees.
Luật Viên chức@32: Changing Job Positions 1. When public non-business units have demands, public employees may be transferred to new working positions if they fully meet the professional criteria of such working positions. 2. The selection of public employees for vacant working positions shall be conducted by heads of public non-business units or competent agencies managing these units on the principles of equality, publicity, transparency, objectivity and legality. 3. When a person is transferred to a new working position, the modification of the working contract or change of professional title must comply with Clause 1, Article 28, and Article 31 of this Law.
Luật Viên chức@33: Article 10.-Regimes of training and fostering public employees 1. Training and retraining shall be provided for public employees before they are appointed to managerial posts or change professional titles or for the purpose of supplementing and updating knowledge and skills for professional activities. 2. Contents, programs, forms and durations of training and retraining of public employees must be based on criteria of managerial posts and professional titles, requirements on supplementation and updating of knowledge and skills for professional activities. 3. Forms of training and retraining of public employees include : a) Training and retraining based on managerial position standards; b) Refresher training according to professional title standards; c) Provide refresher courses to improve knowledge and skills serving professional activities. 4. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies assigned to perform the state management of the fields of public employee activities shall detail contents, programs, forms and durations of training and retraining public employees working in the sectors and fields under their management.
Luật Viên chức@34: Responsibilities for training and retraining public employees 1. Public non-business units shall elaborate and implement plans on training and retraining of public employees. 2. Public non-business units shall create conditions for public employees to participate in training and retraining. 3. Public employee training and retraining funds shall be allocated by public employees, financial sources of public non-business units and other sources.
Luật Viên chức@35: Responsibilities and interests of public employees in training and retraining 1. Public employees participating in training and retraining shall strictly observe training and retraining regulations and submit to the management of training and retraining institutions. 2. Public employees who are sent to training and retraining are entitled to salaries and allowances under law and regulations of public non-business units; the training and retraining duration is counted as a continuous working time and is considered for salary raise. 3. Public employees sent by public non-business units for training who unilaterally terminate their working contracts or arbitrarily leave their jobs shall pay training expenses under the Government's regulations.
Luật Viên chức@36: Secondment of officials 1. Secondment of public employees means sending public employees of a public non-business unit to work at another agency, organization or unit to meet task requirements for a given period. Heads of public non-business units or agencies competent to manage public non-business units shall decide on secondment of public employees. 2. The period of secondment must not exceed 3 years, except for a number of sectors and fields prescribed by the Government. 3. Secondees shall be assigned and managed by agencies, organizations or units they are seconded to. 4. During the secondment period, seconding public non-business units shall ensure salaries and other benefits of secondees. 5. Public employees seconded to mountainous, border, island, deep-lying, remote, ethnic minority and extremely disadvantaged areas are entitled to support policies under the Government's regulations. 6. Upon the expiration of the secondment period, public employees shall return to their former units for work. Heads of seconding public non-business units shall receive and arrange jobs for public employees who have passed the secondment period suitable to their professional qualifications and skills. 7. Secondment of female public employees who are pregnant or nursing under-36-month children is not allowed.
Luật Viên chức@37: Appointment of managerial public employees 1. Appointment of managerial public employees must be based on the needs of public non-business units, criteria and conditions of managerial posts and strictly according to the competence, order and procedures. 2. Based on specific conditions of public non-business units, public employees may hold managerial posts for 5 years at most. During the time of holding managerial posts, public employees are entitled to managerial post allowances and may participate in professional activities according to their appointed professional titles. 3. Upon the expiration of the term of office of a managerial public employee, the re-appointment must be considered or not. In case of non-re-appointment, the authority competent to appoint the public employee shall arrange him/her to a working position according to his/her working requirements and professional qualifications. 4. Managerial public employees who are arranged to other working positions or appointed to new managerial posts shall automatically stop holding their current managerial posts, except for cases of being assigned to hold concurrent posts. 5. The competence to appoint public employees to managerial posts shall be decided by heads of public non-business units or proposed to competent authorities for decision according to management decentralization. 6. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Viên chức@38: 1. To request the resignation of managerial public employees from their posts or to relieve from duty managerial public employees of their posts. 1. Managerial public employees may apply for resignation from managerial posts or be relieved of duty in one of the following cases: a/Having poor health; b) The organization is not qualified or reputable; c) As required by the task; d) For other reasons. 2. Managers who apply for permission to discontinue holding managerial posts but have not yet been permitted by heads of public non-business units or competent authorities to discontinue holding managerial posts shall continue performing their tasks and exercising their powers. 3. After being relieved from managerial posts or relieved from duty, managerial public employees shall be arranged by heads of public non-business units or competent authorities into working positions according to working requirements and their professional qualifications and skills. 4. The competence, order and procedures for considering and deciding on the application for relief from duty or relief from duty of managerial public employees comply with law.
Luật Viên chức@40: Grounds for evaluation of public employees The evaluation of public employees is based on the following grounds: 1. Commitments in the signed working contracts; 2. Regulations on professional ethics and rules of appointment of public employees.
Luật Viên chức@41: Contents of evaluation of public employees 1. Public employee evaluation shall be considered based on the following contents: a) The results of the performance of work or tasks under the signed working contract; b) Implementation of regulations on professional ethics; c) The sense of responsibility, attitude towards serving the people, cooperation with colleagues and compliance with code of conduct of public employees; d/The performance of other obligations by public employees. 2. The evaluation of managerial public employees shall be considered according to the contents specified in Clause 1 of this Article and the following contents: a) Capability of leading, managing, administering and organizing task performance; b) Operation results of the unit assigned for management and in charge. 3. Public employees shall be evaluated annually; upon the expiration of their probation period; before they are renewed for working contracts; before they are changed in working positions; before they are considered for commendation, disciplining, appointment, re-appointment, planning, training or retraining.
Luật Viên chức@42: Classification of public employees 1. Annually, based on evaluation contents, public employees are classified as follows: 1. Excellent accomplishment of tasks; 2. Good performance 3. Accomplishment of tasks : 4. Fail to fulfill their duties.
Luật Viên chức@43: Responsibility for evaluation of public employees 1. Heads of public non-business units shall organize the evaluation of public employees under their management. 2. Based on specific conditions, heads of public non-business units shall evaluate or assign or decentralize the evaluation of public employees under their management. Persons assigned to evaluate public employees shall take responsibility before heads of public non-business units for evaluation results. 3. Persons competent to appoint shall evaluate managerial public employees in public non-business units. 4. The Government shall detail the order and procedures for evaluation of public employees specified in this Article.
Luật Viên chức@44: Notification of assessment and categorization results of public employees 1. Contents of evaluation of public employees must be notified to public employees. 2. Public employee classification results shall be publicized in public non-business units. 3. If disagreeing with evaluation and classification results, public employees may lodge complaints with competent authorities.
Luật Viên chức@45: Severance regime 1. Upon termination of working contracts, public employees are entitled to severance allowances, job loss allowances or unemployment insurance benefits under the labor law and social insurance law, except the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Public employees are not entitled to job discontinuation allowances if falling into one of the following cases: a/He/she is dismissed; b/Unilaterally terminating the working contract in violation of Clauses 4,5 and 6, Article 29 of this Law; c/Terminating working contracts under Clause 5, Article 28 of this Law.
Luật Viên chức@46: Retirement 1. Public employees are entitled to retirement benefits under the labor law and social insurance law. 2. Six months before a public employee retires, his/her managing agency, organization or unit shall notify in writing the time of his/her retirement; three months before a public employee retires, his/her managing agency, organization or unit shall issue a decision on his/her retirement. 3. Public non-business units may sign seasonal or seasonal contracts with persons enjoying retirement regimes if they so wish and such persons so wish; during the contractual terms, in addition to contractual remuneration, such persons are entitled to a number of specific regimes and policies on management mechanisms to ensure conditions for professional activities prescribed by the Government.
Luật Viên chức@47: State management of public employees 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of public employees. 2. The Ministry of Home Affairs shall take responsibility before the Government for performing the state management of public employees and has the following tasks and powers : a/To elaborate and promulgate according to its competence or submit to competent agencies for promulgation legal documents on public employees; b/To assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with ministries and ministerial-level agencies in, formulating plannings and plans on building and development of the contingent of public employees and submitting them to competent authorities for decision; c) Take charge and cooperate with Ministries and ministerial agencies in promulgating lists, standards and codes of professional titles; d/To manage the making of statistics on public employees; to guide the compilation and management of public employee dossiers; to develop and operate the national database on public employees; dd/Inspect and examine the state management of public employees; f/Annually report to the Government on the contingent of public employees. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the state management of public employees. 4. Provincial-level People's Committees shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the state management of public employees.
Luật Viên chức@48: Employee Management 1. Contents of public employee management include: a) Formulating job positions; b/Recruitment of public employees; c/To sign working contracts; d) Appointment or change of professional titles; dd) Change of working position, secondment, termination of working contract, settlement of severance regime; f/To appoint and relieve from duty managerial public employees; to arrange, arrange and employ public employees according to work requirements; g/To evaluate, commend and discipline public employees; h/To implement the salary regime, preferential treatment policies and training and retraining regimes for public employees; i/To compile and manage public employee dossiers; to implement the regime of reporting on management of public employees under their management. 2. Autonomous public non-business units shall perform the management contents specified in Clause 1 of this Article. Heads of public non-business units shall report to their superiors on the management and employment of public employees in their units. 3. For public non-business units which have not yet been assigned the autonomy, agencies competent to manage these units shall manage public employees or decentralize the performance of management contents specified in Clause 1 of this Article to these units. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Viên chức@49: Complaints and settlement of complaints about decisions related to public employee management Complaints and settlement of complaints of public employees about decisions of heads of public non-business units or competent authorities related to the management of public employees comply with law.
Luật Viên chức@50: - The State Treasury's operation fund is not used to pay the State Treasury's fees. 1. Agencies competent to manage public non-business units shall inspect and examine the recruitment, employment and management of public employees in public non-business units assigned to them for management. 2. The Ministry of Home Affairs shall inspect the recruitment, employment and management of public employees in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall inspect the professional activities of public employees in the sectors and fields under their management.
Luật Viên chức@51: Reward 1. Public employees who record merits, achievements and contributions in work and professional activities shall be commended and honored in accordance with the law on emulation and commendation. 2. Public employees who are commended for special merits or achievements may be considered for wage raising ahead of time or extra-senior wage raising under the Government's regulations.
Luật Viên chức@52: Disciplinary Forms for Public Employees 1. Public employees who violate the provisions of law in the course of performing their jobs or tasks shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be subject to one of the following disciplinary forms : a) Reprimand; b) Warnings; c) Dismissal; d) Dismissal. 2. Public employees who are disciplined in any of the forms specified in Clause 1 of this Article may also be restricted from carrying out professional activities under relevant laws. 3. Demotion shall only be imposed on managerial public employees. 4. Disciplining decisions shall be filed in public employee files. 5. The Government shall provide for the application of disciplinary forms, order, procedures and competence to discipline public employees.
Luật Viên chức@53: Prescriptive periods and time limit for disciplining 1. The statute of limitations for disciplining is the time limit prescribed by this Law, upon the expiration of which a public employee commits a violation is not considered for disciplining. The statute of limitations for disciplining is 24 months from the time of committing the violation. 2. The time limit for disciplining a public employee is the period from the time of detecting his/her violation to the time of issuance of a disciplining decision by a competent authority. The time limit for disciplining is 2 months; in case the case has complicated circumstances that need time for inspection and examination for further verification, the time limit for disciplining may be prolonged but not exceeding 04 months. 3. Public employees who have been charged or prosecuted or decided to be brought to trial according to criminal procedures but later got decisions to suspend the investigation or the case but their acts show signs of disciplining shall be considered for disciplining; within 3 working days after the issuance of decisions to suspend the investigation or the case, decision issuers shall send these decisions and relevant documents to their managing units for consideration and disciplining.
Luật Viên chức@54: Suspended from work 1. Within the time limit for disciplining a public employee, the head of the public non-business unit shall decide to suspend the public employee from work if seeing that his/her continued working may cause difficulties to the consideration and disciplining of the public employee. The work suspension duration must not exceed 15 days, which may be prolonged in necessary cases but must not exceed 30 days. Past this time limit, if the public employee is not disciplined, he/she will be arranged to his/her old working position. 2. During the period of work suspension, public employees are entitled to salaries under the Government's regulations.
Luật Viên chức@55: Compensation and reimbursement liability 1. Public employees who lose or damage equipment or commit other acts of causing damage to property of public non-business units shall pay compensation for such damage. 2. Public employees who, while performing their assigned jobs or tasks, cause damage to other persons at their faults and have to pay compensations therefor, shall refund such damage to their public non-business units. The Government shall detail the determination of levels of reimbursement for public employees.
Luật Viên chức@56: Other regulations related to disciplinary actions against public employees 1. For public employees who are reprimanded, the salary raise duration may be prolonged for 3 months; for public employees who are cautioned, the salary raise duration may be prolonged for 6 months. For public employees who are dismissed, the salary raise duration may be prolonged for 12 months and at the same time, public non-business units shall arrange them to other appropriate working positions. 2. Public employees who are disciplined in the form of reprimand to demotion will not be planned, trained, retrained or appointed for 12 months after the disciplining decisions take effect. 3. Public employees who are being disciplined, investigated, prosecuted or tried may not be appointed, seconded, trained, retrained or retired or discontinued. 4. Managerial public employees who have been dismissed for corruption or convicted by a court for corrupt acts may not be appointed to managerial posts. 5. Public employees who are banned from practicing or restricted from professional activities for a given period under decisions of competent agencies, if not being disciplined with dismissal, public non-business units shall arrange them to other working positions not related to banned or restricted professional activities. 6. Public employees who are disciplined, suspended from work or have to pay compensations or refunds under decisions of public non-business units may lodge complaints, initiate lawsuits or request settlement according to the order prescribed by law if they find such cases unsatisfactory.
Luật Viên chức@57: Article 10.-Provisions on public employees who are examined for penal liability 1. Public employees who are sentenced to imprisonment by courts but are not entitled to suspended sentences or are convicted by courts for corrupt acts shall be forced to discontinue their jobs from the date the court judgments or decisions take legal effect. 2. Managerial public employees who are declared by courts to be guilty shall automatically cease holding managerial posts from the date the court judgments or decisions take legal effect.
Luật Viên chức@58: Transfer between public employees and cadres and civil servants 1. The conversion between public employees and cadres and civil servants is carried out as follows: a/Recruitment of public employees to work as civil servants must comply with the law on cadres and civil servants. Public employees who have worked for a public non-business unit for full 5 years or more may be considered for transformation into civil servants without examination; b/For a public employee who is accepted and appointed to a working position which is prescribed by law to be civil servant, the decision on acceptance and appointment is concurrently the recruitment decision; c/Public employees appointed to hold leading and managerial positions in public non-business units which are prescribed by law to be civil servants may be appointed to civil servant ranks corresponding to their working positions, enjoy salaries according to the salary mechanism applicable to public non-business units, retain their appointed professional titles and conduct professional activities under this Law and other relevant laws; d/Cadres and civil servants may be transferred to work as public employees in public non-business units when they satisfy the conditions specified in this Law; dd/Civil servants in the leading and managerial apparatuses of public non-business units who, upon the expiration of their appointment duration, are not re-appointed but continue working in these units may be transferred to public employees and arranged to work in accordance with their professional qualifications and skills; e/The process of contribution and working duration of public employees before they are transferred to work as cadres or civil servants and vice versa, which are considered when implementing contents related to training, retraining, commendation and other interests. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Viên chức@59: Transitional provisions 1. Public employees recruited before July 1,2003, have the rights, obligations and are managed like public employees working under working contracts with an indefinite term under this Law. Public non-business units shall complete procedures to ensure the interests, job stabilization regimes and policies, salary regimes and other interests they are enjoying. 2. Public employees recruited from July 1,2003, to the effective date of this Law may continue performing working contracts signed with public non-business units, have the rights and obligations and be managed under this Law. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Viên chức@60: Application of the Law on Public Employees to other subjects The Government shall provide for the application of the Law on Public Employees to persons working in non-business units of socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations, socio-professional organizations and public non-business units of state-owned one-member limited liability companies.
Luật Viên chức@61: Implementation effect This Law takes effect on January 1,2012.
Luật Viên chức@62: Implementation detailing and guidance The Government shall detail and guide articles and clauses of this Law as assigned; and guide other necessary contents of this Law to meet state management requirements. This Law was passed on November 15,2010, by the XIIth National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam at its 8th session. THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Phu Trong
Luật Cư trú@1: Scope This Law provides for the exercise of the right to freedom of residence by Vietnamese citizens in the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; residence registration and administration; rights, obligations and responsibilities of citizens, agencies and organizations regarding residence registration and administration.
Luật Cư trú@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Lawful domicile means a place used for living, under a citizen's ownership or use right, including houses, ships, boats and other vehicles which are capable of moving or other domiciles as prescribed by law. 2. Residence means a citizen's residence in a place in a commune-level administrative unit or a district-level administrative unit in a place where there is no commune-level administrative unit (below collectively referred to as commune-level administrative unit). 3. residence database means a specialized database that collects information about residence of citizens, is digitalized, stored and managed by information infrastructure, connected and shared with the National Population Database and other databases as prescribed by law. 4. residence registration authority means a residence authority that directly registers residence of citizens, including police authorities of communes, wards and towns; police authorities of districts, towns, provincial cities and cities affiliated to central-affiliated cities where there are no communes. 5. Residence registration means the performance of procedures for permanent residence registration, temporary residence registration, declaration of temporary absence, stay notification, declaration and modification of residence information. 6. Stay means a citizen's stay at a place other than his/her permanent or temporary residence for less than 30 days. 7. Temporary absence means a citizen's absence from his/her place of residence for a given period of time. 8. Permanent residence means a place where a citizen lives stably and permanently and has registered his/her permanent residence. 9. Temporary residence means a place where a citizen lives for a certain period of time outside his/her permanent residence and has registered his/her temporary residence. 10. Current place of residence means the permanent or temporary residence where citizens are regularly living; in case there is no permanent or temporary residence, the current place of residence is the place where citizens are actually living.
Luật Cư trú@3: Rules for residence and residence administration 1. Comply with the Constitution and law. 2. To ensure harmony between the lawful rights and interests of citizens, the interests of the State, communities and society; to combine the assurance of the right to freedom of residence and other fundamental rights of citizens and the State's responsibilities with the tasks of socio-economic construction and development, defense and security consolidation, social order and safety maintenance. 3. Residence registration procedures must be simple, convenient, timely, accurate, public, transparent and cause no troubles; residence administration must be strict and effective. 4. Residence information must be updated in the national population database and residence database in accordance with law; at a time, each citizen has only one permanent residence and may have one temporary residence. 5. All acts of violating the law on residence registration and administration must be detected and handled in a prompt and strict manner in accordance with law.
Luật Cư trú@4: Exercise of citizens' right to freedom of residence 1. Citizens shall exercise the right to freedom of residence in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 2. The exercise of citizens right to freedom of residence is restricted only in the following cases: a) Persons subject to prohibition from leaving their residence, temporary custody or detention imposed by competent procedural authorities and persons; persons sentenced to imprisonment without judgment enforcement decisions or with judgment enforcement decisions but on bail or granted suspension of sentence execution; persons sentenced to imprisonment under suspended sentence and undergoing probation; persons serving prison sentences, prohibition from residence, probation or non-custodial reform; parolees undergoing probation; b) Persons who are serving the measure of education at communes, wards, district towns, the measure of sending to compulsory education establishments, compulsory detoxification establishments, or reformatories; persons who must serve the measure of sending to compulsory education establishments, compulsory detoxification establishments, or reformatories but are being delayed execution or suspended execution; persons who are managed during the time of doing procedures for consideration and decision on application of measure sending to compulsory education establishments, compulsory detoxification establishments, or reformatories; c) Persons quarantined due to the risk of spreading the disease to the community; d) Locations and areas of quarantine for epidemic prevention and control purposes under decisions of competent entities; areas in which there is a state of emergency as per the law; locations where new permanent residence, temporary residence or household separation is prohibited under the provisions of this Law; dd) Other cases as prescribed by law. 3. The exercise of citizens' right to freedom of residence shall be restricted only in accordance with law. The contents and duration of restriction on the right to freedom of residence shall comply with legally effective judgments or decisions of courts, decisions of other competent state agencies or relevant laws.
Luật Cư trú@5: To ensure the exercise of citizens' right to freedom of residence and residence administration 1. The State shall adopt synchronous policies and measures to ensure the exercise of citizens' right to freedom of residence. 2. The State shall ensure budget, physical foundations and human resources and invest in the development of advanced and modern technologies for residence registration and administration activities.
Luật Cư trú@6: International cooperation on residence administration The Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall enter into international cooperation on residence administration in accordance with Vietnamese law and international law; and implement treaties on residence administration to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party.
Luật Cư trú@7: Prohibited acts regarding residence 1. Obstructing citizens from exercising their right to freedom of residence. 2. Misuse information on places of permanent or temporary residence to limit citizens' legitimate rights and interests. 3. Giving, brokering or taking bribes in residence registration and administration. 4. Failing to receive or delay receipt of residence registration dossiers, papers, documents and information or committing other harassing acts; failing to make or delaying the residence registration for citizens when their dossiers are eligible for residence registration; deregistering permanent residence or temporary residence in contravention of law. 5. Collecting, managing and using residence registration fees in contravention of law. 6. Set by themselves time limits, procedures, papers, documents and forms in contravention of law or falsify residence information, books and dossiers. 7. Deliberately granting or refusing to grant residence papers and documents in contravention of law. 8. Taking advantage of the exercise of the right to freedom of residence to infringe upon the interests of the State and lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals. 9. Forging residence papers, documents and data; using forged residence papers, documents and data; supplying untruthful information, papers and documents on residence; making false declaration of conditions, forging dossiers, papers and documents to be registered as permanent or temporary residence; purchasing, selling, renting, leasing, borrowing, lending, pledging, receiving as pledging or destroying residence papers and documents. 10. Organizing, inciting, instigating, dragging, enticing, helping or forcing other persons to violate the law on residence. 11. To permit the permanent or temporary residence registration when it is clear that the permanent or temporary residence registrant does not live in the place. 12. Agree to let another person register his/her permanent or temporary residence at his/her place of residence for self-seeking purposes or in fact he/she does not live at that place of residence. 13. Accessing, using, destroying, obstructing or disrupting activities, changing, deleting, spreading or illegally providing information in the residence database.
Luật Cư trú@8: Citizens' rights to residence 1. To select and decide on their places of residence and register their residence in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 2. Have personal information and information about households in the residence database kept confidential, except for the cases in which information is provided as prescribed by law. 3. To exploit their residence information in the national population database; to have their residence information certified by residence registration offices nationwide, regardless of their places of residence, when so requested. 4. Have their residence information updated and adjusted by the registration authority in the residence database upon change or request. 5. To be provided with information and documents related to the exercise of their right to freedom of residence when so requested. 6. To be protected by competent state agencies from the right to freedom of residence. 7. To lodge complaints and denunciations or initiate lawsuits against acts of violating the law on residence in accordance with law.
Luật Cư trú@9: Article 11.-Citizens' obligations to reside 1. Register their residence in accordance with this Law and other relevant regulations of law. 2. To fully, accurately and promptly provide information, papers and documents on their residence to competent agencies and persons and take responsibility for the provided information, papers and documents. 3. Pay residence registration fees in accordance with regulations of law on fees and charges.
Luật Cư trú@10: Rights and obligations of household heads and household members regarding residence 1. Persons who live together in a lawful place of residence and have family relations being paternal grandfathers, paternal grandmothers, maternal grandfathers, maternal grandmothers, fathers, mothers, spouses, children and blood siblings, grandchildren may register their permanent or temporary residence as household. 2. Persons other than those specified in Clause 1 of this Article who fully satisfy the conditions for registration of permanent residence or temporary residence in the same lawful place of residence under this Law may register their permanent residence or temporary residence in the same household. 3. Multiple households may register permanent or temporary residence at the same lawful place of residence. 4. Household head means a person with full civil act capacity who is nominated by household members. In case a household has no person with full civil act capacity, the household head is the person who is nominated by household members. In case household members cannot nominate a household head, the court shall decide on household head. In case there is only one household member, that person shall be the household head. 5. The household head has the rights and obligations to implement, facilitate and guide household members in implementing regulations on residence registration and administration and other contents prescribed in this Law; notify the residence registration authority of any household member falling into the cases specified in Clause 1 Article 24 and Clause 1 Article 29 of this Law. 6. Members of households have the rights and obligations to unify the nomination of household heads; and fully comply with regulations on residence registration and administration.
Luật Cư trú@11: Citizen's residence 1. A citizen's place of residence includes his/her permanent residence and temporary residence. 2. In case the place of permanent or temporary residence of a citizen cannot be determined, his/her place of residence is the current place of residence determined under Clause 1, Article 19 of this Law.
Luật Cư trú@12: Place of residence of minors 1. The place of residence of a minor is the place of residence of his/her father or mother. If his/her father or mother has different places of residence, the place of residence of the minor is the place of residence of his/her father or mother, with whom the minor regularly lives. In case the place of habitual living of the minor cannot be determined, the place of residence of the minor shall be agreed upon by his/her father or mother. In case his/her father or mother cannot reach agreement, the place of residence of the minor shall be decided by the court. 2. Minors may have places of residence other than those of their parents if they are so agreed by their parents or provided for by law.
Luật Cư trú@13: Place of residence of the ward 1. The place of residence of a ward is the place of residence of the guardian. 2. A ward may have a place of residence other than the place of residence of the guardian if so agreed by the guardian or provided for by law.
Luật Cư trú@14: - The residence of husband and wife. 1. The place of residence of a husband or wife is the place where they regularly live together. 2. Husband and wife may have different places of residence as agreed upon or provided by relevant laws.
Luật Cư trú@15: Article 10.-The places of residence of persons studying, working or working in the armed forces 1. The place of residence of officers, non-commissioned officers, soldiers, professional servicemen, defense workers and officials, students and trainees of People's Army schools is the place where their units are stationed, except for cases where officers, non-commissioned officers, soldiers, professional servicemen, defense workers and officials have other places of residence as prescribed by this Law. 2. The place of residence of professional officers, professional non-commissioned officers, technical officers, technical non-commissioned officers, pupils, students and trainees of People's Public Security schools, enlisted non-commissioned officers, enlisted soldiers and public security workers is the place where their units are stationed, except for cases in which professional officers, professional non-commissioned officers, technical officers, technical non-commissioned officers and public security workers have other places of residence as prescribed by this Law. 3. Conditions, dossiers and procedures for permanent residence registration and temporary residence registration at places where units are stationed, for persons defined in Clause 1 of this Article, shall be prescribed by the Minister of National Defense, for persons defined in Clause 2 of this Article, shall be prescribed by the Minister of Public Security.
Luật Cư trú@16: - The residence place of the person living or working on the ship, boat or other moving means. 1. The place of residence of a person living or working on a mobile ship, boat or other movable vehicle (below collectively referred to as vehicle) is the place where that vehicle is registered, except cases in which there are other places of residence as prescribed by this Law. For vehicles not subject to registration or with places of vehicle registration not coinciding with places of regular parking, the places of residence of persons living or working on the itinerant basis are places where such vehicles frequently park or park. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Cư trú@17: 2. Residence of folk religious and folk religious activists, children, persons with disabilities and helpless people in folk religious and religious establishments 1. The place of residence of a person involved in folk belief activities, a monk, a dignitary, sub-dignitary or another person involved in religious activities living in a folk religious establishment or religious establishment shall be the folk religious establishment or religious establishment, unless such person has another place of residence as prescribed in this Law. 2. The place of residence of children, persons with extremely severe disabilities, persons with severe disabilities and helpless people who are adopted and live in folk religious establishments or religious establishments is the folk religious establishment or religious establishment.
Luật Cư trú@18: Place of residence of persons receiving care and support 1. The place of residence of a person receiving care and support at a social support establishment is the social support establishment. 2. Place of residence of persons receiving care and nurture in community is place of residence of persons receiving care and nurture.
Luật Cư trú@19: Place of residence of persons without permanent residence or temporary residence 1. The place of residence of a person who has neither permanent residence nor temporary residence because he/she is ineligible for permanent residence registration or temporary residence registration is his/her current place of residence; if he/she has no specific place of residence, his/her current place of residence is the commune-level administrative unit in which he/she actually lives. A person who has no permanent residence or temporary residence shall declare information on his/her residence with the residence registration office of his/her current place of residence. 2. Residence registration agencies shall provide guidelines for declaration of residence information according to information fields in the national population database and residence database. 3. In case the persons mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article have no information in the National Population Database and the residence database, within 30 days from the date on which the declaration is received, the registration authority shall verify the information; in complicated cases, this time limit may be extended but must not exceed 60 days. 4. In case the persons specified in Clause 1 of this Article have their information available in the national population database and residence database, within 5 working days after receiving the declared information, the registration office shall check and verify it. 5. After verifying, the registration authority shall update information about the citizen's current residence and other information on the National Population Database and residence database and inform the declarant of such update. 6. In case of change to residence information, citizens shall re-declare with residence registration offices for review and adjustment of citizens' information in the national population database and residence database; and, when fully meeting the conditions prescribed by this Law, carry out procedures for permanent residence or temporary residence registration. 7. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Cư trú@20: Conditions for permanent residence registration 1. Citizens who have lawful domiciles under their ownership may register permanent residence in such lawful domiciles. 2. Citizens may register their permanent residence in lawful places of residence not under their ownership when so agreed by the heads of households and owners of such lawful places of residence in the following cases : a) Wives come to live with their husbands; husbands come to live with their wives; children come to live with their fathers, mothers; fathers, mothers come to live with their children; b/The elderly return to live with their siblings or grandchildren; persons with particularly serious disabilities, persons with serious disabilities, persons who have lost their working capacity, persons suffering from mental diseases or other diseases which deprive them of the capacity to perceive and control their acts return to live with their paternal or maternal grandparents, siblings, blood siblings, blood uncles, blood aunts, blood nephews, blood nieces, blood nephews, or guardians; c) Minors who are permitted by their parents or guardians or who have no parents and move in with paternal or maternal great-grandparents, paternal or maternal grandparents, blood siblings, blood uncles, blood aunts, maternal or paternal uncles; and those who move in with their guardians. 3. Except for the cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article, a citizen may register a lawful place of residence for lease, borrowing or stay when the following conditions are satisfied : a) The lawful domicile owner agrees to permit the permanent residence registration at the place of rent, borrowing or stay and the household head agrees if the permanent residence is registered in the same household; b) The minimum area of the house must be conformable with regulations of the People's Council of the province but must not be smaller than 08 m2 per person. 4. A citizen may register a folk religious establishment or religious establishment with housing as an auxiliary work as their permanent residence in one of the following cases: a) A religious activist is ordained, appointed, elected, selected or transferred to a religious establishment for religious activities; b) The representative of the folk religious establishment; c) Persons who are permitted by the representative (s) or the management of the folk religious establishment to register their permanent residence to directly manage and organize folk belief activities at the folk religious establishment; d) The representative or management board of the folk religious establishment, the head or representative of the religious establishment agrees to permit the registration of permanent residence to children, persons with extremely severe disabilities, persons with severe disabilities or helpless persons. 5. Persons receiving care and support may register their permanent residence at social support establishments with the consent of heads of these establishments, or register their permanent residence in care-taking and nurturing households with the consent of heads of households and owners of lawful domiciles. 6. Persons living or working on vehicles may register permanent residence in these vehicles when the following conditions are fully satisfied: a) Being the vehicle owner or permitted by the owner to register permanent residence; b) The vehicle is registered in accordance with regulations of law; if the vehicle is not subject to registration, it is required to have a certification of the People's Committee of the commune where the vehicle frequently parks that the vehicle is used for residential purposes; c) The commune-level People's Committee has certified that the vehicle has registered to park or park regularly in the locality in case the vehicle is not required to be registered or the place of vehicle registration is not the same as the place of regular parking or parking. 7. The registration of a minor's permanent residence must be approved by his/her parent or guardian, unless the place of residence of the minor is decided by the court. 8. Citizens may not register a new place of residence specified in Article 23 of this Law as their permanent residence, except the case specified at Point a, Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Cư trú@21: 2. Residence registration dossiers 1. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Clause 1 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information; b) Papers and documents proving the lawful domicile ownership. 2. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Clause 2 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information, which specifies permission for permanent residence registration of the household head, owner of legal residence or authorized person, unless a written permission has been obtained; b) Papers and documents proving personal relationships with household heads and members, unless such relationship has been recorded in the national population database and residence database; c) Papers and documents proving other conditions specified in Point b and Point c Clause 2 Article 20 of this Law. 3. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Clause 3 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information, which specifies consent to permanent residence registration from household heads, owners of lawful domiciles leased, lent or let for free-of-charge stay or authorized persons, unless written consent has been obtained; b) The contract for lease, lending or permission for stay or the notarized or certified document on the lending or permission for stay of the lawful place of residence as prescribed by law; c) Papers and documents proving the housing area is sufficient for permanent residence registration as prescribed. 4. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Points a, b, and c Clause 4 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information; for the persons specified in Point c Clause 4 Article 20 of this Law, the declaration must specify the permission for permanent residence registration from the representative or management board of the folk religious establishment, unless a written permission has been obtained; b) Documents proving that the person mentioned in Point a Clause 4 Article 20 of this Law is a monk, dignitary, sub-dignitary or another person is a religious activist and allowed to operate in the religious establishment in accordance with the legislation on folk belief and religion; documents proving that the person mentioned in Point b Clause 4 Article 20 of this Law is a representative of the folk religious establishment; c) A written certification of the communal People's Committee that the folk religious establishment or religious establishment has housing as an auxiliary work. 5. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Point d Clause 4 Article 20 of this Law consists of : a) Declaration of change to residence information, which specifies consent to permanent residence registration of the representative or management board of the folk religious establishment or the head or representative of the religious establishment, unless a written consent has been obtained; b) A written certification issued by the People's Committee of the commune that the applicant is one of the entities prescribed in Clause 2 Article 17 of this Law and that the folk religious establishment or religious establishment has housing as an auxiliary work. 6. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Clause 5 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information; for persons receiving care and nurturing from individuals or households, the declaration must specify permission for permanent residence registration of the head of the caregiving household, owner of the lawful place of residence of the caregiving household or individual or authorized person, unless a written permission has been obtained; b) The written request of the head of the social support establishment for the person who is cared for, nurtured and assisted by the social support establishment; c) Papers and documents certifying the care, nurture and assistance. 7. Application for permanent residence registration of the persons mentioned in Clause 6 Article 20 of this Law consists of: a) Declaration of change to residence information; if the applicant is not the vehicle owner, the declaration must specify the written permission for permanent residence registration of the vehicle owner or his/her authorized person, unless a written permission has been obtained; b) Vehicle registration certificate and certificate of technical safety and environmental protection of the vehicle or written certification of the communal People's Committee on the use of such vehicle for living purpose for vehicles not subject to registration and inspection; c) Written confirmation of the commune-level People's Committee on the vehicle's registered place of permanent parking or parking in case the vehicle is not required to register or the vehicle registration place is not coincident with the place of permanent parking or parking. 8. In case the permanent residence registrant specified in Clauses 1,2,3,4,5,6 and 7 of this Article is a minor, the declaration of change in residence information must clearly state the consent of his/her parent or guardian, unless he/she has obtained a written consent. 9. In case permanent residence registrants defined in Clauses 1,2,3,4,5,6 and 7 of this Article are overseas Vietnamese who still hold Vietnamese nationality, their permanent residence registration dossiers must comprise valid Vietnamese passports; in case of non-availability of valid Vietnamese passports, they must possess other papers and documents proving their Vietnamese nationality and written consent to permanent residence settlement from the Ministry of Public Security's immigration office. 10. The Government shall provide guidelines for documents proving legal residence and personal relationships mentioned in this Article.
Luật Cư trú@22: Procedures for permanent residence registration 1. A permanent residence registration applicant shall submit a permanent residence registration dossier to the residence registration office of the locality where he/she resides. 2. When receiving the application, the registration authority shall check it and issue a receipt note to the applicant; if the application is not satisfactory, instruct the applicant to complete it. 3. Within 07 working days from the receipt of the satisfactory application, the registration authority shall appraise and update information about the new permanent residence of the applicant on the residence database and notify the applicant of the update; in case of rejection, respond and provide explanation in writing. 4. A person who has registered his/her permanent residence but moves to another lawful place of residence and is eligible for permanent residence registration shall register his/her permanent residence at the new place of residence under this Law within 12 months after he/she is eligible for registration.
Luật Cư trú@23: Locations not eligible for new permanent residence registration 1. Places of residence located in places or areas where construction is prohibited or encroachment upon protection corridors of national defense and security, transport, irrigation, dikes, energy, technical infrastructure protection markers, ranked historical-cultural relics, areas where landslides, flash floods and pipe floods are warned and other works protection areas as prescribed by law. 2. Places of residence with the entire area of houses lying on illegally encroached or occupied land or places of residence built on land areas ineligible for construction under law. 3. Places of residence for which land recovery decisions have been issued and decisions approving compensation, support and resettlement plans have been issued by competent state agencies; places of residence being houses on which part or the whole of the house area is subject to disputes or complaints related to ownership or use rights which have not yet been settled under law. 4. Places of residence confiscated under decisions of competent state agencies; vehicles used as places of permanent residence with vehicle deregistration or without certificates of technical safety and environmental protection as prescribed by law. 5. Places of residence are houses which have been dismantled under decisions of competent state agencies.
Luật Cư trú@24: Permanent residence deregistration 1. Permanent residence registration of a person shall be cancelled in one of the following cases: a) Dies; is declared missing or dead by the court; b/They settle abroad; c) The decision on annulment of permanent residence registration prescribed in Article 35 of this Law is issued; d) Being absent from their permanent residence for 12 consecutive months or more without registering temporary residence at other places or declaring their temporary absence, except for cases of leaving abroad but not for settlement or cases of serving prison sentences, serving the measure of consignment to compulsory education establishments, compulsory detoxification establishments or reformatories; dd) The person has been permitted to renounce or denaturalize Vietnamese nationality or has the decision on naturalization of Vietnamese nationality annulled by a competent authority; e) Persons who have registered their permanent residence in the place of rent, borrowing or temporary stay but have terminated the rent, borrowing or temporary stay but have not registered their new permanent residence in the new place of residence after 12 months from the date of termination of the rent, borrowing or temporary stay, except for the case specified at Point h of this Clause; g) Persons who have registered their permanent residence in lawful domiciles but later transferred the ownership over such domiciles to other persons but, after 12 months from the date of ownership transfer, have not yet registered their permanent residence in new domiciles, except for cases where the new owners agree to continue leasing, lending, letting them stay and permitting the registration of permanent residence in such domiciles or cases prescribed at Point h of this Clause; h) Persons who have registered their permanent residence in the place of rent, borrowing or temporary stay but have terminated the rent, borrowing or temporary stay and have not been permitted to keep their permanent residence registration in such place by the lessor, lender or the person allowing temporary stay; persons who have registered their permanent residence in the place under their ownership but have transferred the ownership of such place to other persons and have not been permitted to keep their permanent residence registration in such place by the new owner; i) Persons who have registered their permanent residence at places of residence which have been dismantled or confiscated under decisions of competent state agencies or at means of transport for which vehicle registration has been deregistered under law. 2. The permanent residence registry shall have the power to annul permanent residence registration and must specify reasons and time of annulment in the residence database. 3. The Government shall specify dossiers and procedures for permanent residence deregistration.
Luật Cư trú@25: Household separation 1. A household member may split up a household to register the same lawful place of residence for permanent residence when the following conditions are satisfied: a) He/she has full legal capacity; in case multiple members register to split up the household to form a new household, at least one of them has full legal capacity; b) The separation is approved by the household head or owner of the lawful place of residence, unless the household member registering separation is a divorced spouse who is still entitled to use the lawful place of residence; c) The household's permanent residence is not mentioned in Article 23 of this Law. 2. A household separation dossier comprises a declaration of change in residence information, clearly stating the written approval of the household head or owner of the lawful place of residence for household separation, unless there is a written approval. In case of post-divorce household separation prescribed in Point b Clause 1 of this Article, the application for household separation includes the declaration of change to residence information, documents proving the divorce and the continued enjoyment of such lawful place of residence. 3. Procedures for household separation are as follows: a) The applicant for household separation shall submit the application specified in Clause 2 of this Article to the registration authority; b) Within 5 working days from the date on which a complete and valid application is received, the registration authority shall appraise and update information about the household related to the separation on the residence database and notify the applicant of such update; in case of rejection, respond and provide explanation in writing.
Luật Cư trú@26: Adjustment of residence information in residence database 1. Residence information of a citizen shall be adjusted in the following cases: a) Change of household head; b) Civil status information is changed compared to the information stored in the residence database; c/Change of the address of the place of residence in the residence database due to adjustment of the boundaries of the administrative unit, name of the administrative unit, name of the street, street quarter, village, hamlet or house numbering. 2. An application for adjustments to residence information specified in Point a and Point b Clause 1 of this Article includes: a) Declaration of change to residence information; b) Papers and documents proving the adjustment of information. 3. Procedures for adjusting residence information are as follows: a) In the case specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article, the household member shall submit the application specified in Clause 2 of this Article to the registration authority. Within 03 working days from the receipt of the satisfactory application, the registration authority shall revise information about the householder on the residence database and notify the household member of the revision; in case of rejection of the application, a written notice specifying reasons thereof shall be given to the applicant; b) With regard to the case specified in Point b Clause 1 of this Article, within 30 days from the date on which a decision on change of civil status information is issued by a competent authority, the person whose information is adjusted shall submit an application for adjustment of relevant information in the residence database specified in Clause 2 of this Article to the registration authority. Within 3 working days after receiving a complete and valid dossier, the residence registration office shall modify civil status information in the residence database and notify the registration applicant of the modification; in case of refusal, it shall issue a written reply clearly stating the reason; c) For the case specified in Point c Clause 1 of this Article, the registration authority shall adjust and update changes to information in the residence database.
Luật Cư trú@27: Conditions for temporary residence registration 1. Citizens who come to live in lawful places of residence outside the commune-level administrative units where they have registered their permanent residence for 30 days or more for working, studying or other purposes shall register their temporary residence. 2. The maximum duration of temporary residence is 02 years and may be extended several times. 3. Citizens may not register new temporary residence in places of residence specified in Article 23 of this Law.
Luật Cư trú@28: Article 10.-Dossiers and procedures for temporary residence registration and temporary residence extension 1. A temporary residence registration dossier comprises : a) Declaration of change to residence information; if the applicant is a minor, the declaration must specify the consent of his/her parent or guardian, unless a written consent has been obtained; b) Papers and documents proving the lawful domicile. 2. Temporary residents shall submit their applications to the registration authority of the area where they intend to temporarily reside. When receiving application for temporary residence registration, the registration authority shall check and issue a receipt note to the applicant; if the application is not satisfactory, instruct the applicant to complete it. Within 03 working days from the receipt of the satisfactory application, the registration authority shall appraise and update information about the new temporary residence and temporary residence period of the applicant on the residence database and notify the applicant of the update; in case of rejection, respond and provide explanation in writing. 3. Within 15 days before the end of the registered temporary residence duration, a citizen shall carry out procedures for temporary residence extension. Applications and procedures for extension of temporary residence shall comply with Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article. After verifying the application, the registration authority shall update information about the new temporary residence period of the applicant on the residence database and notify the applicant of the update; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given.
Luật Cư trú@29: Deletion of temporary residence registration 1. A person in one of the following cases shall have his/her temporary residence registration deregistered: a/The person is a citizen of a country or territory which is a foreign country or territory; a) Dies; is declared missing or dead by the court; b) The decision on annulment of temporary residence registration prescribed in Article 35 of this Law is issued; c) The person is absent from his/her temporary residence for 06 consecutive months or more without registering another place of residence; d) The person has been permitted to renounce or denaturalize Vietnamese nationality or has his/her decision on naturalization of Vietnamese nationality annulled by a competent authority; dd) They have registered their permanent residence at the temporary residence; e) Persons who have registered their temporary residence at the place of rent, borrowing or temporary stay but have terminated the rent, borrowing or temporary stay without registering their temporary residence at another place of residence; g) Persons who have registered their temporary residence in lawful domiciles but later transferred their ownership over such domiciles to other persons, except for cases where the new owners agree to continue living in such domiciles; h) The person registers temporary residence at the place of residence that has been dismantled or confiscated under a decision of a competent authority or at the vehicle whose registration is cancelled as prescribed by law. 2. The authority that has registered temporary residence has the power to cancel temporary residence registration and must specify reasons and time of such cancellation in the residence database. 3. The Government shall provide guidelines for application and procedures for temporary residence deregistration.
Luật Cư trú@30: Stay notice 1. When a person comes to stay, a household member or representative of a medical treatment establishment, tourist accommodation establishment or another establishment with the accommodation function shall notify the stay to the residence registration office; if the person comes to stay at the place of residence of an individual or household member who is absent from such place, such person shall notify the stay to the residence registration office. 2. Stay notifications may be made directly, by telephone, electronic devices or other means prescribed by the Minister of Public Security. 3. A stay notification must specify full name, identity card number or passport number of the person in stay; reason for stay; stay duration; and address of the stay. 4. Stay notification shall be made before 23: 00 hrs of the first day of stay; in case a person comes to stay after 23: 00 hrs, stay notification shall be made before 8: 00 hrs of the following day; in case a grandparent, parent, spouse, child, grandchild or sibling comes to stay many times, stay notification is required only once. 5. Stay notifications shall be recorded in stay receipt books.
Luật Cư trú@31: Temporary absence declaration 1.
