Citizens shall declare their temporary absence in the following cases: a) The suspect or defendant on bail, the person sentenced to imprisonment without judgment enforcement decision or with judgment enforcement decision but on bail, or the person whose sentence is suspended or suspended, the person sentenced to suspended sentence who is undergoing probation, the person serving mandatory supervision or non-custodial reform, the parolee who is undergoing probation, or the person whose sentence is suspended or suspended, leaves the commune-level administrative unit where he/she is residing for at least 01 day; b) The person serving the measure of education in a commune, ward or town, the person serving the measure of consignment to a compulsory education institution, a compulsory detoxification center or a reformatory is suspended from serving the measure, the person under his/her management while he/she is undergoing procedures for consideration of and decision on application of the measure of consignment to a compulsory education institution, a compulsory detoxification center or a reformatory is away from the commune-level administrative unit where he/she resides for 01 day or more; c) The citizen is in the military service age group or the person obliged to perform other obligations to the State and leaves the district-level administrative unit where he/she is residing for 03 consecutive months or more under the decision of a competent authority; d) The person does not fall into the cases specified in Points a, b and c of this Clause and leaves the commune-level administrative unit where he/she resides for 12 consecutive months or longer, except for the case in which he/she has registered his/her temporary residence at the new place of residence or has exited abroad. 2. Before leaving their places of residence, persons defined at Points a and b, Clause 1 of this Article shall declare their temporary absence at the residence registration offices of the localities where they reside; when declaring their temporary absence, they shall submit their temporary absence declaration requests and written consents of the agencies competent to supervise, manage and educate such persons. The registration authority shall provide instructions and inspect the information provided. Within 01 working day from the receipt of the request for temporary absence declaration, the registration authority shall issue a temporary absence declaration form to the applicant; in complicated cases, the time limit may be extended but must not exceed 02 working days. 3. Persons referred to in point c and d of clause 1 of this Article may declare their temporary absence directly at the registration agency where they reside or by telephone, electronically or by other means stipulated by the Minister of Public Security. In case a person referred to in point d of clause 1 of this Article is a minor, the person making such declaration shall be his/her parent or guardian. 4. Temporary absence declaration contents include full names, personal identification numbers or people's identity card numbers and passport numbers of temporary absence declarants; reasons for temporary absence; temporary absence duration; and addresses of places of destination. 5. The registration authority shall update information about temporary absence declared by citizens on the residence database and notify the declarant of such update upon request.
Luật Cư trú@32: Responsibilities for state management of residence 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of residence nationwide. 2. The Ministry of Public Security shall take responsibility before the Government for performing the state management of residence and have the following responsibilities : a/To elaborate and submit to the Government for promulgation or promulgate according to its competence legal documents on residence; b/To direct and organize the implementation of legal documents on residence; to organize residence registration and management nationwide, and update residence information in the national population database and residence database; c/To suspend or annul according to its competence or propose competent authorities to annul regulations on residence administration which are contrary to this Law; d) Issue, print and manage declarations of change to residence information and residence documents, forms and records; dd) Provide machinery, vehicles and equipment; arrange, train and improve officials in charge of residence management; e/To make state statistics on residence, review and conduct scientific research on residence administration, and organize the dissemination and education of the law on residence; g/To examine, inspect, settle complaints and denunciations and handle violations of the law on residence in accordance with law; h/To enter into international cooperation on residence administration. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the state management of residence as assigned by the Government. 4. People's Committees at all levels, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, have the following responsibilities: 1. To direct the implementation of the Government's Decree No. 109/2006/ND-CP of February 25,2006, on the management and use of forests and forest land; a/To organize the implementation of legal documents on residence in their localities; b/To direct the coordination among concerned local agencies in residence administration; c/To organize the propagation, dissemination and education of the law on residence; d/To examine, inspect, settle complaints and denunciations and handle violations of the law on residence in accordance with law.
Luật Cư trú@33: Responsibilities of the registration authority 1. Openly post administrative procedures; instruct agencies, organizations, individuals, and households to comply with regulations of law on residence; publish locations, phone numbers, or other methods for receiving stay notifications and temporary absence declaration. 2. Update information on citizens' residence in the national population database and residence database. 3. Certify information about residence, notify results of procedures for permanent residence registration, temporary residence registration, temporary residence extension, declaration of information, adjustment of information about residence, household separation, temporary absence declaration in writing, via electronic messages or other forms as prescribed by the Minister of Public Security. 4. Manage and store documents on residence registration and administration and keep information on residence registration confidential. 5. To settle citizens petitions, complaints and denunciations related to residence and residence administration according to their competence.
Luật Cư trú@34: Persons in charge of residence registration 1. Persons in charge of residence registration must be professionally trained and retrained in accordance with their assigned tasks. 2. When performing their tasks, persons in charge of residence registration must show serious, modest and gentle attitudes, words and gestures; receive and check relevant dossiers and documents and settle them within the time limit prescribed in this Law; if the dossiers are incomplete or invalid, they shall give detailed and complete guidance in writing and take responsibility before law for such guidance.
Luật Cư trú@35: Permanent residence registration or temporary residence registration cancellation In case a responsible agency or person registers permanent residence or temporary residence ultra vires, for improper persons or ineligible under this Law, the agency which has conducted the registration or the head of the immediate superior of the registering agency shall issue a decision to cancel such registration. The registering agency shall notify such in writing to the registrant, clearly stating the reason.
Luật Cư trú@36: Residence database 1. The residence database is developed to serve the state management of residence and is a national asset under the unified management of the Ministry of Public Security. 2. The residence database must ensure connection to the national population database and other databases as prescribed by law, meet database standards and technical regulations and standards on information technology. 3. Collection, storage, processing, protection, exploitation and use of residence data must meet the following requirements : a) Apply information technology to collect, store and process residence information adequately, promptly and accurately; ensure data safety in accordance with rules and format of database; b/To ensure safety of residence information and document storage devices; c) Protect cybersecurity and information security regarding residence on the computer network; ensure safety of information and documents stored in the residence database; prevent and control acts of attacking, intruding, stealing information, destroying or damaging residence data; d) Any access to the residence database to change residence information of citizens must be approved by the head of the registration authority or another competent authority; dd) Agencies, organizations and individuals are not allowed to illegally provide, exchange, copy and print information and documents from the residence database. 4. The Government shall elaborate the establishment, management and use of the residence database, information in the residence database and the provision and exchange of information and documents from the residence database for agencies, organizations and individuals.
Luật Cư trú@37: Amendments to and abrogation of certain articles of laws on residence management 1. Clause 1 Article 9 of the Law on Citizen Identification No. 59/2014/QH13 is amended as follows:1. Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@1: Scope This Law provides for the exercise of the right of citizens to access information, principles, processes and procedures for exercising the right of access to information, responsibilities and obligations of state regulatory authorities in assuring the right of citizens to access information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Information means information and data contained in existing documents, dossiers and materials, which exist in the form of written documents, printed documents, electronic documents, pictures, photos, drawings, tapes, discs, video recordings, audio recordings or other forms, which are created by state agencies. 2. Information generated by regulatory agencies means news and data generated during the process of performing functions, tasks and powers of regulatory agencies as prescribed by law, and signed, sealed or certified in writing by competent persons of such regulatory agencies. 3. Access to information means the reading, viewing, listening, recording, copying and photocopying of information. 4. Provision of information includes the state agencies' disclosure of information and provision of information at the request of citizens.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@3: Principles of ensuring the right of access to information 1. All citizens are equal and are not discriminated against in exercising their right of access to information. 2. Provided information must be accurate and complete. 3. The provision of information must be timely, transparent and convenient for citizens; in accordance with the order and procedures prescribed by law. 4. Restrictions on the right of access to information must be subject to laws where necessary for the purposes of national defense and security, social order and safety, social ethics and community health. 5. Exercise of citizens' right of access to information must not infringe national interests, legitimate rights and interests of other organizations or individuals. 6. The State shall enable the disabled and people living in border areas, islands, mountainous areas and areas with extremely difficult socio-economic conditions to exercise their right of access to information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@4: The entity exercising the right of access to information 1. Citizens shall exercise the right of access to information in accordance with this Law. 2. Legally incapacitated persons shall request information provision through their legal representatives. Persons with limited cognition and behavior control may request information from their guardians. 3. Persons under 18 years of age may request information provision through their at-law representatives, unless otherwise provided by the child law or another law.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@5: Accessible Citizen Information Citizens may have access to information of state agencies, except for information not allowed to access specified in Article 6 of this Law; and may have conditional access to information specified in Article 7 of this Law.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@6: Citizen information not accessible 1. Information classified as state secrets, including information with important contents in the fields of politics, national defense and security, external affairs, economics, science and technology and other fields as prescribed by law. When classified information is declassified, citizens may access it in accordance with regulations of this Law. 2. Information that, if being accessed, would harm the interests of the State, badly affect national defense and security, international relations, social order and safety, social ethics and community health; harm the lives, lives or property of other persons; information classified as work secrets; information on internal meetings of state agencies; documents drafted by state agencies for internal affairs.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@7: Accessible citizen information with a condition 1. Information relating to a trade secret may be accessed if it is so agreed by the owner of such trade secret. 2. Information relating to privacy and personal secrets shall be accessible with the consent of such persons; information relating to family secrets shall be accessible with the consent of family members. 3. During the performance of their functions, tasks and powers, heads of state agencies may decide to provide information relating to business secrets, privacy, personal secrets and family secrets when necessary for the public interests and community health in accordance with relevant laws without obtaining consent under Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@8: Rights and obligations of citizens to access information 1. Citizens have the following rights : a) Receive information sufficiently, accurately, and promptly; b) File complaints, file lawsuits or denunciations against violations against regulations on access to information. 2. Citizens have the following obligations : a) Comply with regulations of law on access to information; b) Not falsify the provided information; c) Not infringe the lawful rights and interests of other organizations or individuals when exercising the right of access to information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@9: Scope and responsibilities of information provision 1. State agencies shall provide information they have created, except the cases specified in Article 6 of this Law; for the cases specified in Article 7 of this Law, they shall provide information when all prescribed conditions are satisfied. Commune-level People's Committees shall provide information they have created and received for the purpose of directly performing their functions, tasks and powers, except the cases prescribed in Article 6 of this Law; and provide information in the cases prescribed in Article 7 of this Law when all prescribed conditions are satisfied. 2. State agencies shall directly organize the provision of information, except the following cases : a) The Office of the National Assembly shall provide information generated by the National Assembly, agencies of the National Assembly, agencies affiliated to Standing Committee of the National Assembly, National Election Commission and information they generate; b) The Office of the President shall provide information generated by the President and the information it generates; c/The Government Office shall provide information created by the Government or Prime Minister and information created by itself; d) Offices of National Assembly deputies' delegations shall provide information created by their delegations and information they have created; dd) Offices of provincial People's Councils shall be responsible for providing information generated by the People's Council, Standing Committee of the People's Council and agencies of the provincial People's Council and information generated by themselves; e) Offices of provincial People's Committees shall be responsible for providing information generated by provincial People's Committees and Chairpersons of provincial People's Committees and information they generate; g) Offices of district-level People's Councils and People's Committees shall provide information generated by People's Councils, Standing Committees of People's Councils, agencies of People's Councils, People's Committees and Chairpersons of district-level People's Committees and information they generate; h) People's Committees of communes shall provide citizens in their communes with information generated by themselves and their agencies, information received to perform their functions, tasks and powers; provide other citizens with this information directly related to their lawful rights and interests; i) The Minister of National Defense and the Minister of Public Security shall provide for the focal point for information provision in their organizational system.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@10: How to access information Citizens have access to information in the following ways: 1. Freedom of access to information disclosed by state agencies; 2. Request state agencies to provide information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@11: Prohibited acts 1. Deliberate provision of false or incomplete information, delay in provision of information; destruction of information; forging of information. 2. Intentional provision or use of information to oppose the Government of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, sabotage the unity policy or incite violence. 3. Intentional provision or use of information to offend honor, dignity or prestige, cause gender discrimination or property damage to individuals, agencies or organizations. 4. Obstructing, threatening or repressing information requesters or providers.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@12: Access to information costs 1. Citizens are provided with information free of charge, unless otherwise provided for by law. 2. The information requester shall pay the actual costs of printing, duplicating, photocopying and sending information. The Minister of Finance shall provide detailed regulations on this Clause.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@13: Supervision of assurance of the right of access to information 1. The National Assembly shall supervise the assurance of citizens' right of access to information. 2. The People's Council shall supervise the assurance of the right of access to information of citizens in the province; annually review reports on the exercise of the right of access to information of citizens in the province made by the People's Committee at the same administrative level. 3. The Vietnamese Fatherland Front and its members shall supervise the assurance of citizens' right of access to information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@14: Complaints, lawsuits and denunciations 1. The information requesters may lodge complaints or initiate lawsuits against state agencies or persons responsible for information supply defined in Article 9 of this Law. 2. Citizens have the right to denounce violations against the law on access to information. 3. Complaints, lawsuits and denunciations about access to information shall be settled in accordance with regulations of the Law on complaints and denunciations and the Law on administrative procedures.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@15: Handling of violations 1. Any person who commits violations against regulations on access to information shall, depending on the nature and severity of the violations, incur disciplinary actions, administrative penalties or criminal prosecution. 2. If the information provider commits any of the violations specified in Article 11 of this Law and causes damage, the state agency providing information shall pay compensation for damage and violators shall refund the damage in accordance with the law on state compensation liability. 3. Persons exercising the right of access to information who use provided information to adversely affect lawful rights and interests of agencies, organizations or other persons shall take responsibility under law.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@16: Application of the law on access to information This Law shall apply to the access to information of citizens. In case where other laws provide for the access to information which is not contrary to the provisions of Article 3 herein, the provisions of such laws shall prevail.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@17: Information must be made public 1. The following information must be widely publicized: a) Legislative documents; administrative documents that have general applicability; international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory, international agreements to which Vietnam is a signatory; administrative procedures and procedures for handling affairs of regulatory agencies; b) Disseminate and provide guidance on implementation of laws, policies and regulations on fields under the management of regulatory agencies; c) Draft legislative documents as per the law on promulgation of legislative documents; contents and results of the referendum and acceptance of the people's opinions on issues within the decision-making authority of state organs that need the people's opinions as per the law; schemes and draft schemes for establishment, dissolution, merging and splitting of administrative divisions, and adjustment to administrative boundaries; d) National and local socio-economic development strategies, programs, projects, schemes, plans and planning; sectoral and sectoral planning, methods and results of implementation thereof; annual working programs and plans of state regulatory authorities; dd) Information about state budget estimates; reports on enactment of state budget; state budget statements; estimates, enactment and statement of state budget of fundamental construction programs/projects funded by state budget; state budget procedures; e) Information on allocation, management and use of official development assistance and non-governmental aid as prescribed; information on management and use of social relief and subsidies; management and use of people's contributions and funds; g) Information about the list of public investment and public procurement projects and programs, management and use of public investment capital, status and results of implementation of public investment plans, programs and projects; information about bidding; information about land use planning and plans; land price; land expropriation; compensation, site clearance and resettlement plans related to local projects and works; h) Information about investment, management and utilization of state capital invested in enterprises; reports on assessment of business performance and rating of enterprises; reports on supervision of disclosure of financial information by enterprises and state agencies representing owners; information about organization and operation of state enterprises; i) Information about products, goods and services that have negative impacts on health and environment; conclusion about inspection and supervision related to environmental protection, community health, food safety and occupational safety; k) Information about functions, tasks, powers and organizational structure of affiliates and subordinate units; tasks and powers of officials and public employees directly involved in handling of affairs of the People; rules and regulations issued by state regulatory authorities; l) Periodical work reports; annual financial statements; statistical information on sectors and fields under their management; national database of sectors and fields; information on recruitment, employment and management of cadres, civil servants and public employees; information on lists and results of scientific programs and subjects; m) List of information to be disclosed as prescribed in Point b Clause 1 Article 34 of this Law; name, address, phone number, fax number, email address of the regulatory agency or the person in charge of receiving information request; n) Information related to public interests and community health; o) Information on taxes, fees and charges; p) Other information must be disclosed as prescribed by law. 2. Apart from the information specified in Clause 1 of this Article, state agencies shall, based on practical conditions, proactively publicize other information they have created or held.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@18: Form and time of information disclosure 1. Forms of information disclosure include: a) Posting on websites of regulatory agencies; b) Making public on means of mass media; c/Publishing on the Official Gazette; d) Posting it at the head office of state agencies and other locations; dd) Disclose information through citizen reception, press conferences, press releases and activities of spokespersons of state agencies as per the law; e) Other forms convenient for citizens determined by the agencies responsible for information disclosure. 2. In case the law provides for the form of disclosure of specific information, such provision shall apply. If the law does not specify the method of information disclosure, the state agency in charge of providing information may select one or some of the methods of information disclosure prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article to ensure that citizens can access information. 3. With regard to the disabled and people living in border areas, islands, mountainous areas and areas facing extreme socio-economic difficulties, in addition to the methods prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, state agencies shall determine the methods of information disclosure that suit citizens' ability and conditions to access information. 4. Time of disclosure of information in each field shall comply with relevant regulations of law; if the law does not provide for such time, within 05 working days from the day on which the information is created, the competent authority must disclose the information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@19: Disclosing information on portals and websites 1. In the information specified in Article 17 of this Law, the following information must be publicized on portals and websites: a) Legislative documents; international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory, international agreements to which Vietnam is a signatory; administrative procedures and procedures for handling affairs of regulatory agencies; b) Disseminate and provide guidance on implementation of laws, policies and regulations on fields under the management of regulatory agencies; c) National and local socio-economic development strategies, programs, projects, schemes, plans and planning; sectoral and sectoral planning, methods and results of implementation thereof; annual working programs and plans of state regulatory authorities; d) Information about the list of projects and programs and results of public investment and public procurement, management and use of public investment capital, and loan capital; dd) Information about functions, tasks, powers, organizational structure and organizational chart of affiliates and subordinate agencies; address, telephone number, fax number, email address of regulatory authorities and persons in charge of receiving information requests; e) Annual financial statements; statistical information about the fields under their management; information about the list and results of scientific programs and projects; g) List of information to be disclosed, which specifies the address, method, time and time limit for each type of information; h) Information deemed necessary for public interests and community health; i) Other information required by law to be posted on portals and websites. 2. Information shall be published on web portals and websites in provinces and centrally run cities according to information technology application plans of provincial-level People's Committees. 3. Regulatory agencies responsible for providing information as prescribed in this Law shall retain documents entered in the list and classify them in a manner that facilitates the assurance of citizens' right of access to information; ensure that information can be electronically stored, digitized within an appropriate period of time and open to all; and connect to nationwide electronic networks to enable easy access from various systems. 4. Web portals and websites of state agencies must be linked and integrated with those of their attached agencies for updating information and facilitating citizens in information search and exploitation. 5. Apart from the information specified in Clause 1 of this Article, state agencies shall, based on their practical conditions, take the initiative in publishing other information they have created on their websites and portals. 6. State agencies that have no web portals or websites shall, based on their practical conditions, publicize information specified in Clause 1 of this Article in other appropriate forms.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@20: Publicizing information on mass media 1. State agencies providing information shall fully, accurately and promptly provide mass media agencies with information which must be publicized by the mass media in accordance with law. 2. The publication or broadcasting of information in the press shall comply with the provisions of the press law. When publishing or broadcasting information, the mass media agencies must ensure the completeness, accuracy and timeliness of information.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@21: LIST OF PRODUCTS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS OF COMMUNICATIONS AND PROVISIONS 1. The disclosure of information by posting it on Official Gazette and publicly posted up shall comply with the provisions of law. 2. For information disclosed in the form of posting up, which has not yet been specified by law as to posting up locations and time limits, such information must be posted up at offices of state agencies or community-based places for at least 30 days.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@22: Handling public information that is inaccurate 1. If detecting that information they have created and publicized is inaccurate, agencies shall promptly correct and publicize corrected information. 2. If the information that is created by another agency is found inaccurate, the agency that discloses the information shall correct it and disclose the corrected information. 3. If the information that they create but is disclosed by another agency is found inaccurate, the agency that creates the information shall request the agency that disclosed the information to correct it and disclose the corrected information. 4. If a citizen believes that the disclosed information is inaccurate, he/she shall request the agency that has disclosed such information to verify the information. Within 15 days from the receipt of the request, the agency shall verify the information and respond to the citizen. If the disclosed information is found inaccurate, it shall correct the information and disclose the corrected information. 5. Inaccurate information is disclosed in any form, such form must be corrected.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@23: Information provided on request 1. Information that must be disclosed as prescribed in Article 17 of this Law but falls into the following cases: a) Information that has not been disclosed during the disclosure period; b) Information is published after the deadline; c) The information is being disclosed but the applicant cannot access it due to force majeure events. 2. Information relating to business secrets, private life, personal secrets and family secrets that is eligible for provision as prescribed in Article 7 of this Law. 3. Information related to the life, daily activities, production and business of the information requesters but not belonging to the types of information specified in Article 17 of this Law and Clause 2 of this Article. 4. Apart from the information specified in Clauses 1,2 and 3 of this Article, state agencies may, based on their tasks, powers, conditions and practical capacity, provide other information they have created or held.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@24: Form of request for information 1. Applicants may request information in the following forms: a) Directly or authorize another person to visit the premises of the regulatory agency to request information. The request receiver shall guide the requester to fill in the contents specified in Clause 2 of this Article in the information request form. If the information requester is illiterate or disabled and cannot write the request, the recipient of the information request shall assist the applicant in filling in the information request form; b) Send the enquiry form electronically, by post or fax to the information-providing agency. 2. The information request form must be made in Vietnamese and contain the following information: a) Full name; place of residence, address; ID number, citizen identification card or passport number of the applicant; fax number, telephone number, email address (if any); b) Requested information, which specifies name of the document, dossier or document; c) Methods of providing information; d) Reasons and purposes of the request for information. 3. In case of request for information specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 Article 7 of this Law, the written consent of relevant individuals and organizations must be enclosed. 4. The Government shall provide the form of the request form.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@25: Form of information provision on request 1. Requested information shall be provided in one of the following forms: a) Directly at the head office of the information-providing agency; b) Via electronic networks, postal services, fax. 2. The requested state agency shall provide information in the form requested by the requester, suitable to the nature of information requested to be provided and its capacity, unless otherwise provided by law.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@26: Receive information request 1. Regulatory authorities shall receive information requests and record them in the logbook. 2. In case the information request form is incomplete or unclear in terms of the contents prescribed in Clause 2 Article 24 of this Law, the information-providing agency shall instruct the applicant to complete the form. 3. If the requested information is not provided, the receiving authority shall instruct the applicant to contact the information provider.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@27: Resolving information requests Upon receiving a valid request for information, a state agency responsible for providing information shall notify the time, place and method of information provision; actual expenses for printing, duplicating, photocopying and sending information by post or fax (if any) and payment mode and time limit; and provide information according to the order and procedures specified in this Chapter.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@28: Deny Information Request 1. State agencies may refuse to provide information in the following cases : a) Information specified in Article 6 of this Law; information that fails to satisfy the conditions specified in Article 7 of this Law; b) Information is disclosed in accordance with Article 17 of this Law, except for the case specified in Clause 1 Article 23 of this Law; c) Requested information is not within the scope of their responsibility; d) The information has been provided twice to the applicant, unless the applicant has a good reason; dd) Requested information is beyond the capacity to provide or affects normal operation of the agency; e) The applicant fails to pay the actual costs of printing, duplicating, photocopying and sending information by post or fax. 2. In case of refusal to provide information, state agencies shall issue a written reply clearly stating the reason.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@29: Procedures for providing information directly at the head office of the information-providing agency 1. For simple and available information which can be provided immediately, information requesters may directly read, watch, listen to, take notes, duplicate or take photos of documents or request the immediate provision of copies or copies of documents. 2. For complicated information that is not available and needs to be gathered from the departments of the agency or information that needs opinions of other agencies, organizations and units, within 10 working days from the day on which the satisfactory request is received, the requested agency shall request the requester to come to the office to read, watch, listen, take notes, copy or photocopy documents or receive copies or photocopies of documents or send a written notification of refusal to provide information. If the requested agency needs more time to consider, search, gather, duplicate or settle the request for information, it may extend the time limit but not exceeding 10 working days and shall issue a written notice of such extension within the time limit for information provision.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@30: Procedures for providing information electronically 1. Information shall be provided electronically when all of the following conditions are satisfied: a) Requested information must be available in a file and transmitable via the electronic network; b) State agencies that are technically qualified to provide information electronically. 2. Information shall be provided electronically in the following manners: a) Send file attached to email; b) Provide one-time access codes; c) Provide instructions on the access address for downloading information. 3. For simple and available information which can be provided immediately, within 3 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall provide information. 4. For complicated information that is not available and needs to be gathered from the departments of the requested agency or information that needs opinions of other agencies, organizations or units, within 3 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall notify in writing the time limit for settling the request for information. Within 15 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall provide information or issue a written notice of refusal to provide information. If the requested agency needs more time to consider, search, gather, duplicate or settle the request for information, it may extend the time limit but not exceeding 15 days and shall issue a written notice of such extension within the time limit for information provision.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@31: Procedures for providing information by post or fax 1. For simple and available information which can be provided immediately, within 5 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall provide information. 2. For complicated information that is not available and needs to be gathered from the departments of the requested agency or information that needs opinions of other agencies, organizations or units, within 3 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall notify in writing the time limit for settling the request for information. Within 15 working days after receiving a valid request, the requested agency shall provide information or issue a written notice of refusal to provide information. If the requested agency needs more time to consider, search, gather, duplicate or settle the request for information, it may extend the time limit but not exceeding 15 days and shall issue a written notice of such extension within the time limit for information provision.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@32: Handling of incorrect requested information 1. In case of detecting inaccurate information provided by a state agency, within 5 working days after detecting such inaccurate information, such state agency shall correct such information and re-provide information, except the case specified in Clause 3 of this Article. 2. In case the applicant for information believes that the provided information is inaccurate, he/she may request the information-providing agency to provide accurate information. Within 15 days from the receipt of the request, the information-providing agency shall verify the accuracy of the information and respond to the requester. If the information provided is inaccurate, it shall correct and provide information again, except for the case specified in Clause 3 of this Article. 3. If the People's Committee of commune cannot determine the accuracy of the information it has, within 05 working days from the day on which the information is discovered or requested, the People's Committee of commune shall request the information-generating agency to consider. Within 15 days from the day on which the request is received, the information-generating agency shall determine the accuracy of the information and respond to the People's Committee of commune; if the information provided is inaccurate, the accurate information must be enclosed. Within 03 working days from the receipt of the response, the People's Committee of commune shall correct the information or notify the applicant.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@33: Measures to ensure the exercise of citizens' right of access to information 1. Provide training in enhancement of capacity and professional skills for persons tasked with providing information in ensuring citizens' right of access to information. 2. To operate portals and websites; to build and operate databases of information to be provided by responsible agencies under the Government's regulations. 3. To increase the provision of information through activities of spokespersons of state agencies and the mass media. 4. Identify units and individuals in charge of providing information. 5. Reasonably arrange places for receiving citizens to provide information in conformity with conditions of each agency. 6. To consolidate and strengthen the work of records, archives and statistics; to equip technical facilities, information technology and other necessary conditions so that requesters can directly read, watch, listen, take notes, duplicate and photocopy documents at the head offices of state agencies and via the electronic network.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@34: Responsibilities of information-providing agencies for ensuring the exercise of the right to access information 1. State agencies responsible for providing information specified in Article 9 of this Law shall : a) Disclose and provide information promptly, accurately, and adequately; correct or provide additional information if the provided information is found inaccurate or insufficient; b) Actively make, update and publish the List of information subject to mandatory disclosure and post it on portals and websites; regularly update and publish information on schedule and in the form specified in the List of information subject to mandatory disclosure; c) Maintain, store and update information databases, provide and ensure that information is systematic, complete, comprehensive, timely and easy to search; d) Ensure accuracy and adequacy of information. Transfer of information between data systems shall comply with regulations of law; dd) Provide technical instructions on methods and procedures for protecting information and information management systems; e) Review, classify, check and ensure confidentiality of information before providing it; g) Consider the benefits of information provision to disclose information or provide information on request to ensure public interests and community health; h) Promulgate and publish internal regulations on provision of information within their competence, including the following contents: identification of the contact point for provision of information; transfer of information of the generating unit to the contact point for provision of information; classification of provided and unprovided information; updating of information to be disclosed and provided upon request; procedures for processing of request for information between the contact point and the information database authority and relevant units; i) Review regulations of law on access to information related to their functions, tasks, and entitlements to promptly request competent authorities to make amendments to this Law; k) Handle complaints and denunciations, and take actions against violations against regulations on access to information as prescribed by law; l) Report to competent authorities on the assurance of citizens' right of access to information at their agencies upon request. 2. Heads of units assigned to act as focal points in providing information shall ensure the performance of their information provision tasks and promptly handle information providers under their management who commit acts of obstructing citizens' right to access information. 3. Persons assigned to provide information shall promptly and adequately provide information to citizens; and refrain from harassing, obstructing or causing difficulties to citizens while performing their tasks.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@35: Responsibilities of the Government, ministries, ministerial-level agencies, Governmental agencies and People's Committees at all levels for ensuring the exercise of the right of access to information 1. The Government shall perform the consistent state management of assurance of citizens' right of access to information and perform the following tasks and powers: a) Promulgate, within its competence, or request competent authorities to promulgate, amend and complete the law on access to information; b) Provide measures to enable the disabled and people living in border areas, islands, mountainous areas and areas with extremely difficult socio-economic conditions to exercise their right of access to information; c) Implement measures to disseminate and educate to raise awareness of rights and responsibilities of agencies, units, officials, public employees and citizens in exercising the right of access to information; d) Provide guidance on exercising the right of access to information for authorities, organizations, units and citizens; dd) Inspect the implementation of law and take actions against violations against regulations on access to information; e) Provide technical instructions on methods and procedures for information storage and information management system; g) Monitor, expedite and inspect the assurance of the citizens' right of access to information. 2. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and government-attached agencies shall, based on their assigned functions and tasks, perform the tasks specified at Points a, c, d, e and g, Clause 1 of this Article. 3. The Ministry of Information and Communications shall assist the Government in performing the tasks specified at Point e, Clause 1 of this Article. 4. The Ministry of Justice shall assist the Government in monitoring the implementation of this Law. 5. Provincial People's Committees shall perform state management in their provinces and adopt measures to ensure citizens' right of access to information under the Government's guidance. 6. State agencies shall, based on their practical conditions, create conditions for requesters to directly read, watch, listen, take notes, duplicate or photocopy documents at their offices; and equip information boards or other equipment for information disclosure.
Luật Tiếp cận thông tin@36: Application terms 1. Foreigners residing in Vietnam may request the provision of information directly related to their rights and obligations. Procedures for requesting information from foreigners residing in Vietnam are the same as those prescribed in Chapter III of this Law. 2. Citizens may request information through their organizations, mass organizations or enterprises in case many persons of these organizations, mass organizations or enterprises request the same information. The Government shall elaborate this Clause.
Luật Trồng trọt@1: Scope This Law provides for crop production activities; rights and obligations of organizations and individuals involved in crop production activities; state management of crop production.
Luật Trồng trọt@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Cultivation is an economic and technical branch in agriculture which is related to the cultivation of agricultural plants, ornamental plants and edible mushrooms for human purposes. 2. Crop production activities include activities related to plant varieties; fertilizers; cultivation; harvesting, preliminary processing, preservation, processing, trade and quality management of crop produce. 3. Crop cultivation refers to the process in which humans use natural resources, agricultural equipment and supplies and apply production processes to create different crop products. 4. Crop products mean the harvesting components of agricultural plants, ornamental plants and edible mushrooms. 5. Plant variety means a population of plants which can be distinguished from other plant populations through the expression of at least one trait and inheritance passed to the next generation; is morphologically identical and stable through propagation cycles; has cultivation and use value; and includes agricultural, pharmaceutical, ornamental plant and edible mushroom varieties. 6. Propagating materials mean plants or plant parts, edible mushrooms or edible mushroom parts which may develop into new individuals, for propagation or cultivation. 7. Major crop species refer to common plant species that are important to economic development and need to be strictly managed. 8. Annual plant means a plant that is sown, harvested and ends its production cycle within 01 year, including annual plants that are stored at their roots. 9. Perennial crop means a crop that is sown once, grows for many years and harvests once or more times. 10. Distinctness of a plant variety means the ability of a plant variety to clearly distinguish it from widely known plant varieties. 11. Uniformity of a plant variety means the same expression of a plant variety in terms of related traits, except for deviations within the permitted scope for some specific traits in the propagation process. 12. Stability of a plant variety means the stable expression of related characteristics as initially described, which is not changed after each propagation crop or after each propagation cycle in case of cycle-based propagation. 13. Plant variety testing means the monitoring and assessment of criteria for determining the distinctness, uniformity, stability, value of cultivation and use of plant varieties by a given method. 14. Controlled testing means the testing of plant varieties in artificial environments in order to ensure that plant varieties fully display their pest-resistant properties and adverse conditions. 15. Fertilizer testing means activities of monitoring and assessing criteria in order to determine the mode of use, environmental impacts, agronomic effects and economic effects of fertilizers. 16. Narrow field test means a test conducted on a field or small square with repeated tests according to national standards on test methods applicable to test subjects. 17. Wide field test means a test conducted on a field or a large umbrella area without repeated testing and arranged according to national standards on testing methods applicable to tested objects. 18. first-generation plant means the best plant selected and recognized from a plant variety population. 19. first-generation plant garden means a garden that is propagated from a first-generation plant or established by an organization or individual that is appraised and recognized. 20. Fertilizers mean products which function to supply nutrients or improve soil in order to increase productivity and quality of plants. 21. Fertilizer quality indicator refers to technical specifications in terms of characteristics, composition and contents reflecting the quality of fertilizers which are specified in respective technical regulations and standards that are announced for application. 22. Nutrient element in fertilizers means a chemical element necessary for the growth and development of plants.
Luật Trồng trọt@3: Principles of crop production activities 1. Develop production according to the value chain, in association with the market orientation, in accordance with the cultivation development strategy, planning and plans for use of land and other resources; facilitate the development of cooperation and production linkage, the construction of concentrated commodity production areas, production with contracts and production certified for quality; ensure food security; ensure the harmony between the interests of the State and those of organizations and individuals. 2. To efficiently, economically and sustainably use natural resources and infrastructure; to safely and effectively use agricultural supplies. 3. Comply with technical regulations and standards on soil and water quality, production process; ensure food safety, biosafety, disease resistance and environmental protection. 4. Promote regional advantages in association with conservation of specialty and indigenous plant varieties; protect sustainable farming systems, agricultural heritages, landscapes and culture in association with development of ecotourism and new rural development. 5. Proactively forecast, prevent and control natural disasters and pests; adapt to climate change. 6. Meet international integration requirements; comply with international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory.
Luật Trồng trọt@4: State policies on crop production activities 1. The State invests in the following activities: a) Release statistics, carry out surveys and establish databases of crop production activities; provide market information and forecast; formulate crop production development strategies; formulate technical standards and regulations on crop production activities; b) Building and upgrading facilities and equipment for public science and technology organizations to serve research into policies and basic research in crop production; c) Scientific and technological activities prescribed in Point a and Point b Clause 2 Article 6 of this Law; d) Provide training for agricultural extension personnel in areas facing socio-economic difficulties and extreme socio-economic difficulties. 2. In each period and depending on the state budget capacity, the State shall support the following activities : a) Cooperation in production, establishment of concentrated commodity production areas and organic farming areas; crop restructuring; farming on slopes, lowlands, alkaline soil, saline soil, sandy soil at the coast, soil at risk of desertification and degradation; development of raw material areas serving processing plants; management of planting areas and traceability; b) Scientific and technological activities prescribed in Point c Clause 2 Article 6 of this Law; c) Application of advanced quality management systems and certification of crop produce; d) Construction of infrastructure, analysis and assessment of initial production conditions in crop production, agrochemical and soil assessment in service of concentrated commodity production; construction of infrastructure for preservation and processing; production of organic fertilizers and bioproducts; organic farming; mechanization; national laboratories and international inter-laboratory testing; dd) Rice production according to planning; e) Production of super-prototypal varieties, prototypal varieties, parental varieties for production of F1 hybrid seeds, original varieties and new commercial varieties; restoration of specialty plant varieties and native plant varieties; maintenance of leading variety; protection and development of leading variety gardens; import of new varieties and transfer of plant variety copyright; g) Construction of wholesale markets for crop produce; branding, trade promotion and development of crop product consumption markets; h) Restoration of production in case of natural disasters or epidemics; i) Training of human resources; transfer of scientific and technical advances and agricultural extension in crop production. 3. The State encourages organizations and individuals to invest in activities specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article and the following activities : a) Cooperation and affiliation in research and development, business, provision of technical services, technology transfer and relevant activities in crop production; b) Private sector involvement in public crop production services; improvement of capability of conformity assessment activities; c) Agricultural insurance in crop production; d) Organic farming, farming combined with eco-tourism, landscape protection, culture and history in rural areas; dd) Use organic fertilizers.
Luật Trồng trọt@5: Crop development strategy 1. The crop production development strategy shall be formulated for a 10-year cycle with 20-year orientation; must be consistent with the socio-economic development strategy, relevant planning and proposal. 2. The crop production development strategy shall define the viewpoints, guiding principles, vision, objectives, tasks, solutions and organize the implementation of crop production development tasks across the nation. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall preside over and cooperate with Ministries, Ministry-level agencies and provincial People's Committees in formulating and submitting the crop production development strategy to the Prime Minister to seek his approval decision.
Luật Trồng trọt@6: Scientific and technological activities in farming 1. Scientific and technological activities in crop production shall be subject to provisions laid down herein, laws on science and technology, technology transfer. 2. Scientific and technological activities in crop production which are invested or supported by the State shall include: a) Research into farming policies and mechanisms; select and create high-quality plant varieties that are resistant to harmful organisms and adaptable to climate change; exploit beneficial organisms; develop organic fertilizers, bioproducts, farming techniques and environmental protection in crop production; conduct researches into soil science, crop nutrition and post-harvest technologies; b) Collect, store, preserve and utilize precious and rare plant genetic resources, specialty plant varieties and indigenous plant varieties; establish plant genetic banks; c) Research into development and application of high, advanced and new technologies in cultivation, storage and processing; organic cultivation and climate change adaptation.
Luật Trồng trọt@7: International cooperation on crop production 1. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall enter into international cooperation in crop production with other countries, territories and international organizations on the basis of equality, mutual benefit, respect for independence, sovereignty and laws of each party and international laws. 2. The following priority contents shall be given to international cooperation in crop production: a) Scientific research and technology transfer on plant varieties, agricultural materials, production process and technology, post-harvest technology, exchange of information and plant genetic resources; b) Training high-quality human resources for crop production activities; c) Investment cooperation, production association, forecast and development of crop product consumption markets; d) Establishing and mutually accrediting the quality certification system in crop production. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall preside over and cooperate with Ministries, Ministry-level agencies and provincial People's Committees in carrying out international cooperation in crop production.
Luật Trồng trọt@8: National crop production database 1. National crop production database is the crop production-related information system which is established consistently from central to local levels, and standardized for update, use and management by using information technology. 2. The national crop production database shall include the following contents: a) Database of legislative documents and regulatory documents related to crop production; b) Database of crop production, storage, processing and trade; c) Database of scientific research and technological development results, technical standards and regulations; data on soil nutrition and use of cultivation land; plant variety, fertilizer and irrigation data; d) Other crop production databases. 3. Organizations and individuals shall provide information, update and use the national crop production database in accordance with laws. 4. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall regulate provision of information, update, use and management of the national crop production database.
Luật Trồng trọt@9: Prohibited acts in crop production activities 1. Manufacturing, trading and importing plant varieties which have not yet obtained circulation recognition decisions or circulation self-declaration decisions, except for cases permitted by competent agencies. 2. Manufacturing, trading and importing fertilizers that have not been granted the decision on recognition of circulation in Vietnam, except for import of fertilizers prescribed in Clause 2 Article 44 of this Law and production of fertilizers for export under contracts with foreign organizations and individuals. 3. Manufacturing and trading plant varieties that fail to meet manufacturing and trading conditions; manufacturing and trading fertilizers without obtaining the certificate of conformance to fertilizer manufacturing and trading regulations. 4. Producing, trading in or importing plant varieties, fertilizers, other agricultural supplies and plant products which are counterfeit, expired or of unclear origin. 5. Providing information about plant varieties and fertilizers in a manner that is not consistent with the information approved by competent authorities or the information self-declared. 6. Illegally providing services of testing, testing and inspection of variety production fields, assessment and certification of quality of plant varieties, crop products and fertilizers. 7. Providing false or forged results of testing, testing and inspection of variety production fields, inspection, assessment and certification of quality, standard and regulation conformity of agricultural materials and crop products. 8. Illegally exporting plant varieties on the List of plant genetic resources banned from export. 9. Crop production causes harm to plants, domestic animals and human health; environmental pollution; degradation and depletion of land and water resources and biodiversity. 10. Illegally exploiting and using the topsoil of wet rice cultivation land for non-agricultural purposes.
Luật Trồng trọt@10: Research into selection, creation and transfer of plant genetic resources 1. Research into selection, creation and transfer of plant variety genetic resources shall be carried out in accordance with laws on science and technology, technology transfer and biodiversity. 2. Plant genetic resources shall be selected and created with priority according to the regulations in Point a and Point b Clause 2 Article 6 of this Law.
Luật Trồng trọt@11: Exploitation and use of plant genetic resources 1. Plant genetic resources include genetic resources from plant varieties which have been granted the decision on recognition of circulation or permission for self-declaration of circulation; plant varieties which have been widely available in production, specialty plant varieties, indigenous plant varieties and imported plant varieties which have not been granted the decision on recognition of circulation or permission for self-declaration of circulation. 2. The exploitation and use of plant variety genetic resources shall be subject to provisions laid down herein and laws on biodiversity.
Luật Trồng trọt@12: Conservation of plant genetic resources 1. Conservation of plant genetic resources shall include the following activities: a) Investigation, collection, storage and establishment of plant genetic resources banks; b) Deciphering genes, assessing agronomic and biological indicators and value of use of crop genetic resources; c) Establishing and sharing data, information and documentation systems and plant genetic resources. 2. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on the conservation of plant genetic resources and promulgate the list of plant genetic resources banned from export.
Luật Trồng trọt@13: General requirements for recognition of circulation and self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties 1. Plant varieties belonging to the main plant species shall be produced, traded, exported and imported only after obtaining the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties as prescribed in Article 15 herein or the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of plant varieties as prescribed in Article 16 herein, except for the case in which they are used for research, testing, exhibition or international exchange or production of hybrid seeds for export. 2. Plant varieties other than the main plant species shall be produced, traded, exported or imported only when organizations or individuals self-declare circulation of plant varieties in accordance with Article 17 herein, except for those used for research, testing, advertising, exhibition, international exchange and production of hybrid seeds for export. In case where organizations or individuals wish to apply for the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties, they must comply with regulations laid down in Article 15 herein, or in case of application for the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of plant varieties, they must comply with regulations laid down in Article 16 herein. 3. Vietnamese and foreign organizations and individuals that have representative offices or branches of companies operating in the field of plant varieties in Vietnam may register in their names for the grant of circulation recognition decisions or the circulation self-declaration of plant varieties. 4. The decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties shall be issued concurrently with the plant variety protection certificate when the organization or individual applying for recognition of circulation of plant varieties applies for and satisfies the conditions for protection of plant varieties in accordance with the law on intellectual property. 5. Plant varieties belonging to the main plant species must be tested by independent testing organizations recognized to be eligible (hereinafter referred to as plant variety testing organizations) before the issuance or extension of the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties, except for the plant varieties granted the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of plant varieties as prescribed in Article 16 of this Law. Ornamental plant varieties belonging to the main plant species shall not be subject to testing as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 18 of this Law. 6. In each period, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall promulgate, amend and supplement the list of major plant species.
Luật Trồng trọt@14: Name of the plant variety 1. The name of a plant variety shall not be accepted in the following cases: a) Only include digits; b) Violations against the national history, culture, ethics, and fine traditions and customs; c) The name is read or written in the same way as the name of a leader, national hero, famous person, food, drink, pharmaceutical; d) Using names of regulatory agencies, people's armed forces, political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations, socio-professional organizations as the whole or part of the proper name of a plant variety, unless otherwise approved by relevant agencies, organizations or units; dd) easily cause misunderstanding of characteristics and characteristics of the plant variety; e) easily cause misunderstanding of the identity of the author; g/Conforming with the name of the protected plant variety. 2. Organizations and individuals trading propagating materials of plant varieties must use the name of the variety obtaining the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties or permission for self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties. 3. When using the name of a plant variety in combination with a trademark, trade name or other similar indications to the name of a plant variety already recognized for circulation or announced for circulation for production or trading purposes, such name must be easily identifiable.
Luật Trồng trọt@15: Issue, re-issue, extend, suspend, restore and revoke the decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety 1. Requirements for issuance of the decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety shall include the followings: a) Having the name of the plant variety; b) The testing results are satisfactory; c) Testing results must meet national standards regarding value of cultivation and use; d) Samples of plant varieties are stored as prescribed in Article 20 of this Law; dd) The written announcement of information about plant varieties and production processes is prepared by the organization or individual applying for the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties. 2. The decision on recognition of circulation of an annual plant variety shall be valid for 10 years and the decision on recognition of circulation of a perennial plant variety shall be valid for 20 years and may be extended. 3. The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety shall be reissued in the following cases: a) The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety is lost or damaged; b) Information related to the decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety is changed or supplemented. 4. The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety may be extended if the following requirements are met: a) At the request of the organization/individual; b) The result of controlled testing prescribed in Point a Clause 2 Article 18 of this Law is conformable with national standards for value of cultivation and use. 5. The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety shall be suspended if that plant variety fails to maintain the uniformity or stability or the value of cultivation or use as at the date of grant of the decision on circulation of that plant variety. 6. The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety which has been suspended shall be restored if the organization or individual granted the decision on recognition of circulation of that plant variety is able to remedy the case specified in clause 5 of this Article. 7. The decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety shall be invalidated in the following cases: a) The application for recognition of circulation of a plant variety is fraudulent; b) The distinctness of the plant variety is not maintained as at the date of issuance of the decision on recognition of circulation of the plant variety; c) The case specified in Clause 5 of this Article cannot be rectified; d) The plant variety owner has been liable to administrative penalties for repeated violations against regulations on plant varieties; dd) Other violations which are required to be eliminated by law. 8. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over issuance, re-issuance, renewal, suspension, restoration and revocation of the decision on recognition of circulation of a plant variety.
Luật Trồng trọt@16: Issue of the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of a plant variety 1. Requirements for issuance of the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of a plant variety shall include the followings: a) They are specialty plant varieties, indigenous plant varieties or plant varieties that have been used for a long time in production and are proposed by local authorities; b) There is a description of the characteristics of the plant variety and its current use status; c) The specimens are kept as prescribed in Article 20 of this Law. 2. The regulations in Clauses 2,4,5 and 6 Article 15 of this Law shall not apply to the Decision on exceptional recognition of free sale prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article. 3. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over issuance, re-issuance and revocation of the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of a plant variety.
Luật Trồng trọt@17: Self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties 1. Conditions for self-declaration of circulation of a plant variety shall include the followings: a) Having the name of the plant variety; b) The plant variety has the value of cultivation and use that conforms to national standards with respect to the plant species that is self-declared to be in circulation; in case of absence of national standards, local standards shall be applied; c) Information about plant varieties and production processes compiled by organizations or individuals that self-declare circulation of plant varieties. 2. Organizations and individuals that self-declare circulation of plant varieties shall be responsible for the accuracy of the declared information. 3. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes and procedures for self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties.
Luật Trồng trọt@18: Contents of plant variety testing 1. Tests of distinctness, uniformity and stability of plant varieties. 2. Tests of the cultivation value and use value of plant varieties include: a) Controlled testing; b) Narrow field tests; c) Wide field tests.
Luật Trồng trọt@19: General requirements for plant variety testing 1. Plant variety tests referred to in Clause 1 and Point a Clause 2 Article 18 hereof shall be conducted only at 01 fixed location. 2. Plant variety tests referred to in point b and c of clause 2 of Article 18 herein shall be conducted in specific regions. Plant varieties tested in a region shall be granted the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties in that region. 3. Testing methods and plant variety testing zoning shall be regulated in the national standards on testing methods applied to plant species subject to testing. 4. Gardens of perennial plant varieties shall be established by organizations or individuals signing their names in applications for recognition of circulation in conformity with national standards on plant variety testing methods used for assessment of necessary criteria. 5. The narrow-area testing and wide-area testing are conducted simultaneously. 6. The sequencing method shall be used as a substitute for the difference test to test the varietal trueness. 7. Before testing genetically modified plant varieties, risk assessment must be carried out in accordance with the law on biodiversity.
Luật Trồng trọt@20: Storing plant variety samples 1. Samples of plant varieties used for registration of recognition of circulation of plant varieties must be stored during the testing and circulation of plant varieties (hereinafter referred to as stored samples) under the management of crop production authorities. 2. Plant variety samples shall be stored in one of the following manners: a) Storage of propagating materials; b) Retaining the plant variety genome sequencing data; c) Storage of propagating materials and sequencing of plant varieties. 3. The stored samples shall be used in the following cases: a) Making test varieties, control varieties, similar varieties and typical varieties in testing; b) Testing and inspecting the quality of plant varieties; c) Inspecting, examining and settling disputes over plant varieties. 4. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@21: Issue, re-issue and cancel the decision on recognition of plant variety testing organization 1. Requirements for issuance of the decision on recognition of a plant variety testing organization shall include the followings: a) The person in charge of the testing must obtain at least a bachelor's degree in plant, plant protection or biology; b) Have or rent appropriate locations, infrastructure and equipment to carry out testing according to national standards for testing of plant varieties applied to the tested plant species. 2. The decision on recognition of a plant variety testing organization shall be re-issued in the following cases: a) The property is lost or damaged; b) Information relating to the testing organization specified in the decision on recognition of the plant variety testing organization is changed or supplemented. 3. The decision on recognition of a plant variety testing organization shall be invalidated in the following cases: a) The decision on recognition of plant variety testing organization is erased or amended; b) The application for accreditation of a plant variety testing organization is found to be falsified documents or untruthful information; c) The testing organization commits violations against the decision on recognition of plant variety testing organization; d) The organization no longer satisfies one of the conditions prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article; dd) The organization/individual has been liable to administrative penalties for violations against regulations on plant variety testing but relapses into such violations. 4. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over issuance, re-issuance and revocation of the decision on recognition of plant variety testing organization.
Luật Trồng trọt@22: Conditions on plant variety producers and traders 1. Plant variety producers must meet the following requirements: a) The plant variety is available or the plant variety is authorized by the plant variety owner to be granted the decision on recognition of circulation or has been declared for circulation by the plant variety owner; b) Have or rent locations, infrastructure and equipment conformable with national standards for plant variety production methods; in case of absence of national standards, local standards shall be applied. 2. Plant variety traders must have legal transaction locations and ensure the traceability of plant variety batches. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@23: Plant variety production 1.
