Production of plant varieties shall be carried out by employing the method of sexual propagation and the method of clonal propagation according to national standards for production of plant varieties; in the absence of national standards, local standards shall be applied. 2. Plants or gardens providing materials for cloning and multiplex hybrid seeds for perennial fruit trees and industrial perennials must be granted decisions on recognition of first-generation plants or decisions on recognition of first-generation plant gardens under Article 24 of this Law.
Luật Trồng trọt@24: Issue, suspend, restore and cancel the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden 1. The decision on recognition of the first-generation plant shall be issued after the plant is selected according to national standards for quality of the first-generation plant. In case there is no national standard, the crop production authority shall issue the local standard for application. 2. A garden shall be granted the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden after it is assessed according to national standards for quality of the first-generation plant garden. In case there is no national standard, the crop production authority shall issue the local standard for application. 3. Quality of the first-generation plant or first-generation plant garden shall be managed according to national standards or internal standards for quality of the first-generation plant or first-generation plant garden specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article. 4. The decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden shall be suspended when the first-generation plant or the first-generation plant garden no longer satisfies national standards or internal standards for quality of the first-generation plant or the first-generation plant garden. 5. The decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden shall be restored to its effective date if the quality of the first-generation plant or the first-generation plant garden satisfies national standards or local standards for quality of the first-generation plant or the first-generation plant garden. 6. The decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden shall be revoked after it has been suspended in accordance with regulations laid down in Clause 4 of this Article but has not been restored in accordance with regulations laid down in Clause 5 of this Article. 7. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over issuance, suspension, restoration and revocation of the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant and the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden.
Luật Trồng trọt@25: General requirements for management of plant variety quality 1. Plant variety quality management includes management of variety quality and management of propagating materials in accordance with this Law and the law on product and goods quality. 2. The quality of plant varieties shall be managed according to national standards or local standards applied to specific plant species in accordance with regulations laid down in Point c Clause 1 Article 15 and Point b Clause 1 Article 17 hereof. 3. Quality of propagating materials shall be managed as follows: a) Plant propagating materials belonging to the main plant species are group-2 products and commodities in accordance with laws on product and commodity quality. The quality of plant propagating materials shall be managed on the basis of the national technical regulations on the quality of plant propagating materials and standards announced for application by plant breeders and importers; b) Plant propagating materials not belonging to the main plant species are group 1 products and commodities as per the legislation on product and commodity quality. The quality of plant propagating materials not belonging to the main plant species shall be managed on the basis of the quality standards of plant propagating materials announced for application by organizations and individuals.
Luật Trồng trọt@26: Seed field inspection, sampling of propagating materials 1. Seed field inspection shall be conducted by trained persons during the production of plant varieties according to national standards on methods of seedling inspection. 2. Sampling of propagating materials shall be carried out according to national standards on methods for sampling plant varieties by professional trainees. 3. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@27: Labeling and advertising of plant varieties 1. Labeling and advertising plant varieties shall comply with regulations of this Law, law on commerce and advertising. 2. The contents of labeling and advertising of plant varieties must conform to the information provided in the application for the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties, which is certified by the competent authority, or the contents of self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@28: Export of plant varieties 1. Plant varieties granted the decision on recognition of circulation or self-declaration of circulation and not included in the List of plant genetic resources banned from export may be exported and shall comply with regulations of law on commerce and foreign trade management. 2. Plant varieties and hybrid seeds of plant varieties which have not yet obtained circulation recognition decisions or circulation self-declaration and are not on the list of plant variety genetic resources banned from export may only be exported for research, testing, advertisement, exhibition or non-commercial exchange purposes and must obtain permission of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. 3. The Government shall provide for the application and procedures for licensing export of plant varieties specified in Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@29: Import of plant varieties 1. Plant varieties and parental seeds used for production of hybrid seeds of plant varieties which have obtained circulation recognition decisions or circulation self-declaration; parental seeds used for production of hybrid seeds for export shall be imported and imported in accordance with the law on commerce and foreign trade management. In case of import for trading purpose, there must be dossiers and documents meeting the provisions of Clause 1, Article 23 and Clause 1, Article 26 of this Law. 2. Plant varieties which have not yet obtained circulation recognition decisions or circulation self-declaration may be imported only for research, assay, advertisement, exhibition or international exchange and must be permitted by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. 3. Plant varieties imported for production and trading purposes must undergo state quality inspection conducted by crop production authorities affiliated to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development and meet quality requirements, except for the following cases: a) Parent seeds used for production of hybrid seeds of plant varieties; b) The plant variety has not been granted the decision on recognition of circulation or self-declaration of circulation and is imported as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article; c) Plant varieties temporarily imported, re-exported, transited or transferred from border to border gate; d) Plant varieties stored in bonded warehouses. 4. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide for the order and procedures for state inspection of the quality of imported plant varieties. 5. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes and procedures for grant of the permit for import of plant varieties.
Luật Trồng trọt@30: Rights and obligations of plant variety research, selection and breeding organizations and individuals 1. Plant variety research, selection and breeding organizations and individuals shall have the following rights: a) Invest in plant variety research, selection and breeding; investigate, assess, collect, store and utilize domestic or imported propagating materials serving plant variety research, selection and breeding; b) Be entitled to state support policies on investment in science and technology, specific policies for sectors and regions as per the law; c/To cooperate with domestic and foreign organizations and individuals in studying, selecting and creating cultivars of crop plants in accordance with law. 2. Plant variety research, selection and breeding organizations and individuals shall have the following obligations : a) Fulfill all obligations prescribed by laws on science and technology and other relevant laws; b/Registration for protection of rights to plant varieties before they are put into commercial operation or transferred in case of research into, selection, creation, discovery and development of plant varieties with state budget funds or state-managed projects; the transfer of plant varieties must comply with the law on technology transfer; c) Comply with regulations of the Law on Biodiversity and other relevant regulations of laws when conducting research, selection, creation, experiment and testing of genetically modified plant varieties.
Luật Trồng trọt@31: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals applying for the decision on recognition of circulation or self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties 1. Organizations and individuals applying for the decision on recognition of circulation or permission for self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties shall be entitled to circulation of plant varieties or authorize other organizations and individuals to circulate plant varieties. 2. The organization or individual that applies for the decision on recognition of circulation or the organization or individual authorized to recognize circulation of a plant variety shall fulfill the following obligations: a) Maintain the distinctness, uniformity, stability, value of cultivation and use of plant varieties during the circulation, except for the cases where the decision on recognition of privileged circulation of plant varieties is granted as prescribed in Article 16 herein; b) Compensate for damage caused by the circulation of plant varieties other than those already obtaining the decision on recognition of circulation; the circulation of fake varieties or varieties failing to meet national technical regulations on quality or national standards on quality or announced internal standards on quality; provision of false information about plant varieties and production processes certified by competent authorities. 3. Organizations and individuals that self-declare or are authorized to self-declare circulation of plant varieties shall be obliged to compensate for any loss or damage arising from circulation of plant varieties which are not the same as those already self-declared; circulation of fake varieties or varieties which fail to meet national technical regulations or national standards or internal standards already declared; provision of false information about plant varieties and production processes already declared.
Luật Trồng trọt@32: Rights and obligations of plant variety users 1. Plant variety users shall have the following rights: a) Receive information on plant varieties and instructions for use of plant varieties; b) Receive compensation for damage as prescribed by law; c) Petitions, complaints, denunciations and lawsuits against violations committed by organizations and individuals obtaining the decision on recognition of circulation or self-declaration of circulation of plant varieties. 2. Plant variety users shall have the following obligations: a) Comply with the production process announced by the organization or individual applying for the decision on recognition of circulation or self-declaration of circulation of the plant variety; b) Upon the occurrence of incidents or detection of adverse consequences caused by plant varieties, promptly notify plant variety suppliers and local administrations thereof for handling.
Luật Trồng trọt@33: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals applying for issuance of the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden 1. Organizations and individuals applying for issuance of the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden shall be entitled to use or authorize other organizations and individuals to use propagating materials for production and trading purposes. 2. Organizations and individuals applying for issuance of the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden shall assume the following obligations: a) Ensuring the quality of plant varieties as when they are recognized; b) Exploit propagating materials according to the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden; c) Pay fees as prescribed by law on fees and charges.
Luật Trồng trọt@34: Rights and obligations of plant variety testing organizations 1. Plant variety testing organizations shall have the following rights: a) Carry out plant variety testing on the basis of the contract signed with the requesting organization or individual; b) Receive payment for plant variety testing costs under the contract with the requesting organization or individual. 2. Plant variety testing organizations shall have the following obligations: a) Carry out tests in accordance with the decision on recognition of plant variety testing organization; b) Take legal responsibility for the testing results and retain the results as prescribed by the law on archives; c) Take responsibility for the confidentiality before the organizations and individuals that have plant varieties tested. 3. Plant variety testing organizations must refuse to carry out tests serving the purpose of granting the decision on recognition of circulation of plant varieties in the following cases: a) The variety is registered under the name of the testing organization for issuance of the decision on recognition of circulation; b) Plant varieties owned by joint venture entities and testing organizations when applying for certification of conformance to testing requirements; c) Plant varieties of companies in the same parent company, corporation or general company, including testing organizations; d/Seeds of units of the same non-business unit, including assay organizations.
Luật Trồng trọt@35: Rights and obligations of plant variety producers and traders 1. Plant variety producers and traders shall have the right to produce and trade plant varieties when they meet the requirements specified in Article 22 of this Law. 2. Plant variety production and trading organizations and individuals shall have the following obligations : a) Comply with Article 22 of this Law; b) Declare conformity with standards and regulations in accordance with laws; c) Recall and handle plant varieties failing to meet quality standards when they are circulated on the market; d) Pay compensation for damage as prescribed by law; dd) Provide documents proving the origin of propagating materials and documents on tracing the origin of plant variety batches; e) Label genetically modified plant varieties in accordance with laws.
Luật Trồng trọt@36: Requirements for recognition of fertilizers and classification of fertilizers 1. Fertilizers are goods subject to conditional business and must be granted the Decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam, except for organic fertilizers produced for non-commercial use, imported fertilizers specified in Clause 2, Article 44 of this Law; fertilizers produced for export under contracts with foreign organizations and individuals. 2. The decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam shall be valid for 05 years and may be extended. 3. Domestic or foreign organizations and individuals that have representative offices or branches of companies operating in the fertilizer sector in Vietnam may apply for recognition of fertilizer circulation. 4. Each organization or individual may apply for recognition of only one name of fertilizer for each composition formula and content of nutrients. 5. The Government shall provide for classification of fertilizers.
Luật Trồng trọt@37: Issue, re-issue and extend the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam 1. Requirements for issuance of the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam shall include the followings: a) Satisfy quality criteria according to national technical regulations on fertilizer quality; b) The testing result is conformable with national standards, except for the fertilizers prescribed in Clause 2 Article 39 of this Law. 2. The decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam shall be re-issued in the following cases: a) Information about the organization or individual specified in the decision on recognition of fertilizer circulation is changed or added; b) The decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation is lost or damaged; c) Change of the fertilizer's name under a decision of a competent authority or a court's judgment or decision in case of violation against the law on intellectual property. 3. The decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam shall be extended if the following requirements are satisfied: a) The inspection is requested by the applicant; b) Satisfy quality criteria according to national technical regulations on fertilizer quality; c) Report the production, export, import and use of fertilizers as prescribed. 4. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over issuance, re-issuance and renewal of the decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam.
Luật Trồng trọt@38: Article 1. To annul the Decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam 1. The decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam shall be revoked in the following cases: a) There is new scientific evidence of fertilizers posing high risks of adversely affecting human health and the environment; b) The documents are found to be falsified or the information provided is not consistent with the fertilizers recognized. 2. The decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam shall be cancelled as follows: a) In the case specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article, the fertilizer authority shall consolidate information and consider cancelling the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam. Organizations and individuals may produce and import such fertilizers for up to 06 months; may trade and use such fertilizers for up to 12 months from the effective date of the decision on cancellation of the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam; b) In the case specified in Point b Clause 1 of this Article, the fertilizer authority shall inspect and review applications and documents for recognition of fertilizers to consider cancelling the decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam. The fertilizer producer, importer, seller or user shall immediately terminate the production, import, trading and use of fertilizers from the effective date of the decision on cancellation of the decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam. 3. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority over revocation of the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam.
Luật Trồng trọt@39: Requirements for fertilizer testing 1. Fertilizers must be tested before being recognized for circulation, except for fertilizers specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Fertilizers which are not subject to testing include: a) Organic fertilizers used for fertilizing roots that are only natural organic substances and meet quality criteria according to national technical regulations; b) Single inorganic fertilizers used for fertilizing roots that only contain nitrogen (N) or phosphorus (P) or potassium (K) and meet quality criteria according to national technical regulations; c) Complex inorganic fertilizers used for fertilizing roots that contain only nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P) and potassium (K) nutrients linked by chemical bonds and meet quality criteria according to national technical regulations; d) Fertilizers recognized as technical advances by competent state management agencies. 3. Fertilizers shall be tested on both large scale and small scale; the large scale testing shall be conducted only after the narrow scale testing is completed. 4. Fertilizer testing shall be conducted according to national standards by accredited testing organizations. 5. The amount of fertilizer produced or imported for testing shall be determined according to the amount of fertilizer applied to each type of plant and the actual testing area according to national standards for fertilizer testing.
Luật Trồng trọt@40: Article 10. Conditions for recognition of fertilizer testing organizations 1. Fertilizer testing organizations must meet the following conditions: a) The person in charge of testing must obtain at least a bachelor's degree in crop science, plant protection, soil agro chemistry, soil science, agronomy, chemistry or biology and must attend training courses in fertilizer testing as regulated by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; b) The fertilizer testing organization must employ a sufficient number of personnel, excluding the person directly in charge of testing, who must hold at least a bachelor's degree in one of the disciplines referred to in Point a Clause 1 of this Article and must be trained in fertilizer testing under the instructions of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; c) Have adequate facilities and equipment according to national standards for fertilizer testing. 2. The Government shall regulate the minimum number of testing personnel of fertilizer testing organizations; documentation, processes, procedures and authority to issue and revoke the decision on recognition of fertilizer testing organizations.
Luật Trồng trọt@41: Conditions for production of fertilizers 1. Organizations and individuals producing fertilizers must have certificates of eligibility for fertilizer production. 2. Requirements for issuance of the certificate of eligibility for fertilizer production include : a) The production location and workshop area are suitable for the production scale; b) Having production lines, machinery and equipment suitable to the process of production of each type or form of fertilizer; c) Have a laboratory or a contract with a designated testing organization to assess quality criteria of fertilizers they produce; d) Have a quality management system which is conformable with standards on quality management promulgated by international standardization organizations; dd) Raw materials and finished products must be stored in separate areas; e) The person directly administering the production must obtain at least a bachelor's degree in crop science, plant protection, soil agro chemistry, soil science, agronomy, chemistry or biology. 3. The certificate of eligibility for fertilizer production is valid for 05 years and may be reissued. 4. The Government shall provide detailed guidance on conditions, application, procedures and power to issue, reissue and revoke certificates of eligibility for production of fertilizers.
Luật Trồng trọt@42: Conditions for fertilizer trading 1. Organizations and individuals trading fertilizers must have certificates of eligibility for trading of fertilizers; in case of trading fertilizers produced by themselves, they are not required to have certificates of eligibility for trading of fertilizers. 2. Requirements for issuance of the certificate of eligibility for fertilizer trading include : a) Having a legal and clear place of transaction; b) Have sufficient documents and papers for tracing of fertilizer origin as regulated; c) Persons directly trading fertilizers must be trained in fertilizers under the guidance of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, except for those who have obtained at least an associate degree in crop science, plant protection, soil agro chemistry, soil science, agronomy, chemistry or biology. 3. The Government shall provide detailed guidance on conditions, application, procedures, time limit and power to issue, reissue and revoke certificates of eligibility for fertilizer trading.
Luật Trồng trọt@43: Fertilizer export The export of fertilizers shall comply with regulations of law on commerce, foreign trade management or at the request of the importing country.
Luật Trồng trọt@44: Import of fertilizers 1. Organizations and individuals whose fertilizers have been issued with the Decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam may import or authorize the import of fertilizers specified in the Decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam without requiring the fertilizer import Permit. 2. Organizations and individuals importing fertilizers that have not been recognized for circulation in Vietnam must have fertilizer import permits in the following cases: a) Fertilizer for testing; b) Fertilizers used for sports fields, entertainment centers; c) Fertilizers used in foreign projects in Vietnam; d) Fertilizers used as gifts or samples; dd) Fertilizers at fairs and exhibitions; e) Fertilizers serving scientific research; g) Fertilizers used as raw materials for production of other fertilizers; h) Fertilizers temporarily imported for re-export, fertilizers in transit or transferred through Vietnam's border gates; fertilizers sent to bonded warehouses; fertilizers imported into export processing zones. 3. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and authority for grant of the fertilizer import license.
Luật Trồng trọt@46: State inspection of quality of imported fertilizers 1. Imported fertilizers must undergo state inspection of quality, except for the imported fertilizers prescribed in Points a, d, dd, e and h Clause 2 Article 44 of this Law. 2. State inspection of quality of imported fertilizers shall be carried out by fertilizer authorities affiliated to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. 3. The dossier of state inspection of imported fertilizer quality must be retained for 05 years from the date on which the notification of state inspection results is issued. 4. The Government shall regulate application documents, processes, procedures and contents of state inspection of quality of imported fertilizers.
Luật Trồng trọt@47: Name of fertilizer 1. The name of a fertilizer shall not be identical to the name of the fertilizer obtaining the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam. 2. Names of fertilizers must not cause misunderstanding about nature, utilities, composition and type of fertilizers. 3. Names of fertilizers must not violate historical, cultural, ethical traditions and fine customs of the nation; must be read or written in the same way as names of leaders, national heroes, celebrities, foods, beverages and pharmaceuticals. Names of regulatory authorities, people's armed forces, political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations and socio-professional organizations must not be used as the whole or part of proper names of fertilizers, unless they are approved by relevant agencies, organizations and units. 4. For mixed fertilizers, if the name of the component is used as the name or part of the name of the fertilizer, it must be placed in the order of name of type of fertilizer, composition, specific symbols, number of ingredient quantity in the name and other specific symbols (if any). Ingredients and numerical quantities of ingredients in the order of macronutrient elements such as nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), potassium (K), secondary nutrients, micronutrient elements, organic substances and other supplements (if any).
Luật Trồng trọt@48: Fertilizer labeling 1. Fertilizers must be labeled in accordance with regulations of law on goods labeling and contain the following information when being sold on the market: a) Fertilizer type; b) Fertilizer code; c) The phrase Lá phân bón (" Foliar fertilizers) must be specified for foliar fertilizers. 2. The label must contain information consistent with the decision on recognition of fertilizer in circulation in Vietnam.
Luật Trồng trọt@49: Fertilizer advertising 1. Organizations and individuals advertising fertilizers shall comply with regulations of law on advertising. 2. The Government shall provide for the application and procedures for and power to certify contents of advertisements for fertilizers.
Luật Trồng trọt@50: Rights and obligations of fertilizer producers 1. Fertilizer production organizations and individuals shall have the following rights : a) Manufacture fertilizers recognized for circulation in Vietnam; b) Manufacture fertilizers for export under contracts with foreign organizations and individuals; c) Advertise fertilizers in accordance with Article 49 of this Law; d) Trade fertilizers they produce. 2. Fertilizer production organizations and individuals shall have the following obligations : a) Maintain fulfillment of conditions for production of fertilizers prescribed in Article 41 of this Law during the production of fertilizers; b) Manufacture fertilizers in accordance with national technical regulations and applied standards; c) Comply with the contents of the Certificate of eligibility for fertilizer production; d) Test each batch of finished fertilizers before they are sold on the market. Retain test results according to the expiry date of the batch of fertilizers and preserve samples for 06 months from the sampling date; dd) Recall and handle fertilizers failing to meet quality standards and pay compensation for any loss or damage in accordance with laws; e) Comply with inspection of competent authorities; g) Provide training in and instructions for use of fertilizers; provide professional training for employees directly involved in fertilizer production; h) Submit annual reports on production, export and import of fertilizers to competent authorities or submit irregular reports upon request; i) Comply with regulations of law on fire prevention and fighting, chemicals, labor, environment and other relevant regulations of law.
Luật Trồng trọt@51: Rights and obligations of fertilizer traders 1. Fertilizer trading organizations and individuals shall have the following rights : a) Trade fertilizers recognized for circulation in Vietnam; b) Receive information and instructions on use of fertilizers and professional training in fertilizers. 2. Fertilizer trading organizations and individuals shall have the following obligations : a) Maintain fulfillment of conditions for trading of fertilizers prescribed in Article 42 of this Law during the trading of fertilizers; b) Storing fertilizers in dry places, not mixing with other goods affecting the quality of fertilizers; c) Inspect the origin of fertilizers, fertilizer labels, conformity marks and documents related to fertilizer quality; d) Comply with the inspection of competent authorities; dd) Provide legal documents to trace the fertilizer origin; e) Pay compensation for damage as prescribed by law; g) Provide instructions for use of fertilizers in accordance with the fertilizer label; h) Comply with regulations of law on fire prevention and fighting, chemicals, labor, environment and other relevant regulations of law.
Luật Trồng trọt@52: Rights and obligations of fertilizer testing organizations 1. Fertilizer testing organizations shall have the following rights: a) Carry out fertilizer testing under the contract with the applicant; b) Receive payment for testing costs under the contract with the applicant. 2. Fertilizer testing organizations shall have the following obligations : a) The conditions specified in Article 40 of this Law are satisfied; b) Conduct fertilizer tests in an objective and accurate manner; c) Comply with technical standards and procedures and testing requirements; d) Report testing results and take legal responsibility for testing results; dd) Keep the field diary, raw data, testing outline and testing result report for 05 years from the end of the testing; e) Facilitate the inspection and supervision of testing activities by competent authorities; g) Pay compensation for damage as prescribed by law; h) Send the fertilizer testing outline to the competent authority of the testing area before the testing is carried out; i) Submit annual or ad hoc reports on fertilizer testing to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development.
Luật Trồng trọt@53: Rights and obligations of fertilizer sample collectors 1. Fertilizer sampling persons shall have the following rights : a) Be provided with information related to the fertilizer sampling; b) Have been trained in sampling fertilizers. 2. Fertilizer sampling persons shall have the following obligations : a) Take samples in accordance with national standards for fertilizer sampling and ensure objectivity; b) Protect confidentiality of information and data related to sampling, except for cases where competent authorities request reports; c) Take legal responsibility for fertilizer sampling.
Luật Trồng trọt@54: Rights and obligations of fertilizer users 1. Fertilizer users shall have the following rights : a) Receive information and instructions for use of fertilizers; b) Request fertilizer trading facilities to provide instructions for use of fertilizers according to the fertilizer label; c) Receive compensation for damage as prescribed by law. 2. Fertilizer users shall have the following obligations : a) Use fertilizers according to instructions on labels; b) Use fertilizers in an effective and safe manner for humans, domestic animals, environment and food safety according to the principles of proper soil type, proper plants, proper amount, right time and proper method. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall develop and disseminate the set of documents guiding the use of fertilizers as prescribed at Point b, Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@55: Soil utilization and protection during arable farming 1. Local crop production authorities, when determining the crop structure, must base on the physical and chemical properties of soil, biological characteristics of plants and the level of scientific and technological development. 2. Land areas for wet rice cultivation, vegetable cultivation, perennial fruit trees, industrial perennials and ornamental trees shall be planned by provincial-level People's Committees for stable use in conformity with economic development orientations and periodically assessed in terms of land quality for application of measures to improve and sustainably use these land areas.
Luật Trồng trọt@56: Crop restructuring on paddy land 1. Crop restructuring on paddy land is regulated as follows: a) Correspond to the local land use planning, market demands, water source and climate conditions; b) Establish concentrated production zones for each crop in association with land consolidation, swap and production chain association; c) Ensure effective use of existing infrastructure; conformity with local planning and orientation for improvement of infrastructure serving agricultural production; d) Not to lose the necessary conditions for rice cultivation. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@57: Protection and use of topsoil of wet rice cultivation land 1. Topsoil of wet rice cultivation land shall be used only for agricultural purposes; protected and used effectively. 2. Organizations and individuals that build works on land converted from wet-rice farming land shall work out plans on use of the topsoil. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@58: Use of irrigation water 1. Local crop production authorities shall be responsible for determining crop structure and crop seasons in conformity with water resource conditions. 2. Organizations or individuals providing irrigation services must ensure that water quality conforms to technical standards and regulations. 3. Organizations and individuals shall be responsible for using irrigation water sources in an effective manner; applying advanced and economical cultivation methods; reusing water in accordance with laws on water resources, irrigation and other relevant laws.
Luật Trồng trọt@59: Use of beneficial organisms 1. Beneficial organisms used in crop cultivation activities shall include those playing the role of stabilizing and improving soil fertility, increasing plant resistance and growth capacity, preserving and processing crop produce and byproducts, preventing and controlling harmful organisms, pollinating crop plants and performing other beneficial purposes. 2. Organizations and individuals participating in crop cultivation activities must comply with legal regulations on environmental protection, biodiversity, plant protection and quarantine; apply advanced production processes to protect and promote the efficiency of beneficial organisms. 3. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall conduct investigation and assessment of useful organisms in order to take appropriate measures for protection and utilization; promulgate the list of useful organisms and their species used in crop cultivation.
Luật Trồng trọt@60: Agricultural equipment and supplies in cultivation 1. Crop cultivation equipment includes greenhouses, net houses, machinery and equipment used for production, irrigation, harvesting, preliminary processing, storage and processing. 2. Agricultural materials used in crop cultivation activities shall include: a) Plant varieties; b) Fertilizers; c) Plant protection drugs; d) Planting medium, soil cover, moisture-resistant materials; dd) Chemicals and biological products used in crop production activities other than those specified in point b and c of this clause. 3. The management of quality of agricultural equipment and supplies used in crop cultivation activities shall be subject to laws on technical standards and regulations, quality and products and commodities.
Luật Trồng trọt@61: Requirements for use of agricultural equipment and supplies in crop cultivation activities 1. Organizations and individuals involved in crop cultivation activities shall only be allowed to use agricultural supplies in crop cultivation activities which are permitted to be used and sold in accordance with laws; comply with instructions given by specialized agencies or agricultural supplies producers. 2. Organizations and individuals using agricultural materials in crop cultivation activities must meet requirements concerning environmental protection, community health, food safety and restriction on spread of harmful organisms. 3. Organizations and individuals using fertilizers shall comply with the principles specified in Point b Clause 2 Article 54 of this Law. 4. Organizations and individuals using plant protection drugs must comply with the provisions of law on plant protection and quarantine.
Luật Trồng trọt@62: Development of concentrated commodity production areas 1. Development of concentrated commodity production areas must be suitable to physical and chemical properties of soil, climate, water sources, biological characteristics of plants and regional advantages; ensure the building of raw-material zones in association with processing and markets. 2. Provincial-level People's Committees shall formulate plans and schemes on development of consolidated commodity production zones in line with the master plan.
Luật Trồng trọt@63: Production cooperation and affiliation 1. Develop forms of cooperation and association in concentrated production areas on the basis of contracts; facilitate the issuance of quality certificates and traceability; improve the efficiency of production and business, ensure the harmonious interests between the parties. 2. People's Committees at all levels shall : a) Facilitate and assist parties in negotiation, conclusion and implementation of commitments in the cooperation contract; b) Support for infrastructure construction, logistics services and product trade promotion for concentrated production areas. Article 64. Management and grant of codes of crop fields 1. cultivation zone code means an identification number of a crop cultivation zone in order to monitor and control production; control product quality; trace the origin of crop produce. 2. The State shall encourage, facilitate and adopt preferential policies to support organizations and individuals applying for the grant of codes of crop cultivation zones. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall formulate a roadmap and guide the grant of crop zone codes nationwide. 4. Provincial People's Committees shall organize the issuance of codes of crop cultivation zones within their remit according to the roadmap and instructions given by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development.
Luật Trồng trọt@65: Production process 1. Production process shall be issued for each plant species. 2. Production process shall be formulated on the basis of research results, technical advances and practical review in crop cultivation; shall be amended and supplemented upon receipt of new technical advances, and must be appropriate for production practices, scientific and technological development levels and user's capabilities.
Luật Trồng trọt@66: Application of high technology to farming 1. High technologies prioritized and encouraged for application in crop cultivation include: a) Biotechnology for plant variety selection and breeding; diagnosis and assessment of pests; development of products in biology and new materials; b) Technologies for economical irrigation and farming without land use; c) Greenhouse and net house production technology; d) Information technology applied to the estimation and forecast of harmful organisms; issuance of codes and management of crop cultivation zones; dd) Accurate agricultural techniques applied to soil science and plant nutrition; automatic control of fertilizer and irrigation regimes; semi-automatic and automatic technologies in production lines; analysis of quality of production environment and crop products. 2. High technologies specified in Points b and c Clause 1 of this Article shall be applied to disadvantaged farming areas, sandy coastal land and land at risk of desertification and degradation. 3. High technologies specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article shall be built with appropriate density and reduce greenhouse gas impacts.
Luật Trồng trọt@67: Mechanization in farming 1. Mechanization in crop cultivation activities must aim at synchronization and gradual modernization. 2. Investment in and renovation of infrastructure in rice fields must ensure conditions for mechanization. 3. Organizations and individuals, when making production plans, determining the crop structure and seasons, must ensure conditions for mechanization. 4. Crop production equipment and machinery must be selected in conformity with actual conditions of the crop field, scale, nature and level of crop cultivation.
Luật Trồng trọt@68: Development and protection of organic farming zones 1. Organic cultivation zones must be developed, protected and have appropriate infrastructure to ensure no chemical pollution from the outside. 2. Provincial People's Committees shall determine and publicly announce organic cultivation zones; promulgate regulations on cultivation in organic cultivation zones within their management.
Luật Trồng trọt@69: Requirements for organic farming 1. Organizations and individuals practicing organic farming must meet national standards for organic agriculture. In case of export of organic crop produce, the importing country's requirements shall be applied. 2. Plant varieties, fertilizers, pesticides and other supplies used in organic cultivation activities must conform to organic agriculture standards and relevant technical regulations, or must be produced from raw materials and methods conforming to organic agriculture standards. 3. Synthetic chemicals, plant growth stimulants and genetically modified plants shall not be used during the production, harvesting, preliminary processing, storage and processing. 4. Labeling of organic crop produce shall be subject to laws on commerce and other relevant laws. 5. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on organic cultivation.
Luật Trồng trọt@70: Climate change - adaptive farming 1. Apply appropriate measures to crop cultivation activities to adapt to climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. 2. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall have the following responsibilities: a) Determine appropriate solutions to adapt to climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emission during crop cultivation activities; b) Combine solutions for adapting to climate change and reducing greenhouse gas emission when developing and implementing strategies, programs, schemes and projects for crop development. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall organize the assessment of impacts of climate change, provide instructions for organizations and individuals on the application of measures to adapt to climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emission in crop production activities within their jurisdiction. 4. Encourage cultivation organizations and individuals to apply climate change adaptation measures and reduce greenhouse gas emission.
Luật Trồng trọt@71: Cultivation on slopes, lowlands, alkaline soil, saline soil, sandy soil at sea, soil at risk of desertification, desertification 1. The cultivation of crops on slopes, lowlands, alkaline soil, saline soil, sandy soil at the coast and soil at risk of desertification and degradation must comply with production processes to prevent erosion, landslide, soil sedimentation and degradation, and ensure sustainable development. 2. Organizations and individuals cultivating crops in the areas specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall be entitled to the policies specified in Article 4 herein and other policies prescribed in relevant laws. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall promulgate criteria for determination, management measures and production processes in sloping land, lowland, alkaline soil, saline soil, sandy soil at the coast and soil at risk of desertification and degradation. 4. Provincial People's Committees shall determine and announce areas and provide guidance on application of production processes on sloping land, lowland, alkaline soil, saline soil, sandy soil at the coast, and soil at risk of desertification.
Luật Trồng trọt@72: Environmental protection in farming 1. Cultivation organizations and individuals must meet the following requirements: a) Comply with regulations of law on environmental protection and other relevant regulations of law; b) Comply with instructions of specialized agencies when using agricultural materials in farming with risk of environmental pollution; c) Collect, treat and use crop byproducts in accordance with Article 76 herein. 2. Organizations and individuals must promptly inform commune-level People's Committees of any unusual signs of environmental pollution that may cause adverse impacts on crop cultivation activities.
Luật Trồng trọt@73: Rights of cultivation organizations and individuals 1. Organize production by themselves or cooperate with other organizations and individuals in production. 2. To enjoy the State's policies prescribed in Article 4 of this Law and other policies prescribed by relevant laws. 3. Receive support for production restoration in case of damage caused by natural disasters or epidemics under the Government's regulations. 4. Receive information about policies, laws, technical advances, technologies and crop product markets; receive training in crop production activities. 5. Register for the grant of codes of cultivation zones. 6. Receive notifications and warnings about climate, environment, epidemics and natural disasters. 7. To participate in agricultural insurance according to the Government's regulations.
Luật Trồng trọt@74: Obligations of cultivation organizations and individuals 1. Take responsibility for the food quality and safety of their crop produce; pay compensation for any loss or damage in accordance with laws. 2. Use land resources, water resources, useful organisms and infrastructure for the right purposes, in an economical, efficient and sustainable manner. Use agricultural materials in crop cultivation activities which are allowed to be sold under the instructions of specialized agencies or organizations or individuals producing agricultural materials. 3. Applying appropriate production processes to stabilize and improve soil fertility; limiting soil pollution and degradation and spread of harmful organisms. 4. Proactively prevent and tackle environmental pollution, prevent and control harmful organisms in accordance with regulations of the Law on environmental protection, plant protection and quarantine. Promptly inform commune-level People's Committees of environmental pollution and pest outbreaks. 5. Crop restructuring must conform to the local crop restructuring plan. 6. Fulfill all commitments specified in the agreement.
Luật Trồng trọt@75: Harvest, preliminary processing, preservation and processing of crop produce 1. Organizations and individuals harvesting, processing, preserving and processing crop produce must comply with provisions laid down herein and other relevant laws. 2. The harvest of crop produce must restrict losses, ensure quality and economic efficiency. 3. Crop produce used as input materials of a preliminarily processing or processing establishment must have their origin and ensure quality and safety. 4. Plant purchasing, storing and processing establishments must apply appropriate technical measures to preserve crop produce to ensure quality and safety. 5. Establishment of crop product storage and processing establishments associated with raw material production zones is encouraged.
Luật Trồng trọt@76: Collection, treatment and use of crop byproducts 1. Crop byproducts must be collected, treated and used in an appropriate manner, and must not cause environmental pollution and spread of harmful organisms. 2. The use of crop byproducts as raw materials for production of products and commodities is encouraged. 3. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide detailed regulations on collection, treatment and use of crop byproducts referred to in Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Trồng trọt@77: Market development and crop product trade 1. Development of markets and trade in crop produce shall be subject to laws on commerce, foreign trade management and provisions laid down in clause 2 and 3 of this Article. 2. Development of crop product markets shall include the followings: a) Forecasting of markets and orientations for development of crop produce over periods of time; b) Negotiating and opening markets; removing barriers to allow Vietnamese crop produce to be imported into other countries and territories; c) Construction of wholesale markets; trade promotion and building of brand names of crop products. 3. Organizations and individuals participating in development of crop product consumption markets; establishment of the linkage chain from production to consumption; establishment of raw material areas for processing, domestic trade and export shall be entitled to the policies specified in Article 4 herein and other policies prescribed in relevant laws.
Luật Trồng trọt@78: Import and export of crop produce 1. Importers of crop produce must have documents for tracing of origin, meet requirements concerning food quality, safety and disease resistance in accordance with Vietnamese laws. 2. Organizations and individuals exporting crop produce shall comply with the requirements of importing countries.
Luật Trồng trọt@79: Development of wholesale crop markets 1. Wholesale crop markets shall be located at concentrated production areas or places where crop produce are sold in large quantities. 2. Development of wholesale crop markets must be in line with the planning.
Luật Trồng trọt@80: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals harvesting, processing, preserving, processing and trading crop produce 1. Organizations and individuals harvesting, processing, preserving, processing and trading crop produce shall have the following rights: a) Receive support for connecting production, processing and trading chains of crop produce; b) Be entitled to policies prescribed in Article 4 of this Law and other policies prescribed by relevant laws. 2. Organizations and individuals preserving, processing and trading crop produce shall have the following obligations: a) Comply with regulations of this Law and other relevant regulations of law; b) Comply with the inspection of competent authorities.
Luật Trồng trọt@81: Quality management of crop produce 1. Plant products shall be subject to the quality management in accordance with laws on technical standards and regulations, product and goods quality. 2. Genetically modified crop produce used as food must be labeled in accordance with laws on food safety and other relevant laws.
Luật Trồng trọt@82: Responsibilities of the Government, Ministries and ministerial-level agencies 1. The Government shall perform the uniform state management of crop production activities throughout the nation. 2. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall act as the focal point to assist the Government in performing the state management of crop production activities throughout the country and shall assume the following responsibilities: a) Formulate strategies, schemes and plans; provide instructions on crop production activities; b) Promulgate within its competence or request competent authorities to promulgate and organize the implementation of policies, legislative documents, technical standards and regulations, production processes in crop production activities; c) Undertake the issuance, re-issuance, extension, suspension, restoration, revocation and revocation of decisions, permits and certificates in crop production activities within its jurisdiction and post them on the Ministry's portal; d) Build databases and information systems; make statistics and reports on crop production activities; dd) Organize scientific and technological research and application; carry out basic investigation, collect and manage information and materials, and enter into international cooperation in crop production activities; e) Provide professional training and refresher courses; disseminate and educate the law on crop production activities; g) Inspect, examine and settle complaints and denunciations, and take actions against violations against laws on crop production activities. 3. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within their jurisdiction, cooperate with the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development in performing the state management of crop production activities.
Luật Trồng trọt@83: Responsibilities of People's Committees at all levels 1. Within the ambit of their tasks and powers, provincial-level People's Committees shall : a) Issue, within their jurisdiction, or request competent authorities to issue, documents providing guidance on implementation of laws on crop production activities in their localities; b) Promulgate plans for crop restructuring in conformity with local conditions; c) Direct and manage crop production activities within their remit; provide instructions and promulgate production processes in conformity with local conditions; organize crop production activities; d) Organize dissemination and education of laws and provision of training in crop production activities; establish the database of crop production activities within their jurisdiction and update the national crop production database; dd) Undertake the issuance, re-issuance, extension, suspension, restoration, revocation and revocation of decisions, permits and certificates in crop production activities within its jurisdiction and post them on the portal of the provincial People's Committee; e) Direct the formulation of plans, organize the inspection, examination, settlement of complaints and denunciations, and handling of violations against the law on crop production activities within its jurisdiction. 2. District-level People's Committees and commune-level People's Committees, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, shall : a) Implement management measures and contents in crop production activities within their jurisdiction in accordance with laws; b) Perform state management of crop production activities as decentralized or authorized; c) Organize and carry out propagation, dissemination and education of laws on crop production activities in their localities.
Luật Trồng trọt@84: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2020. 2. The Ordinance on Plant Varieties No. 15/2004/PL-UBTVQH11 shall be repealed from the entry into force of this Law.
Luật Trồng trọt@85: Transitional provisions 1. The decision on recognition of new plant varieties issued under the Ordinance on Plant Varieties No. 15/2004/PL-UBTVQH11 shall be continued to be used for 10 years for annual plant varieties and 20 years for perennial plant varieties from the date of issue of the decision and may be extended in accordance with this Law. If the remaining period of the decision on recognition of a new plant variety is less than 03 years, or is 10 years or 20 years, respectively, for annual plant varieties, or 20 years or 20 years, respectively, for perennial plant varieties, by the effective date of this Law, it shall be continued to be used within 03 years from the effective date of this Law. 2. The decision on recognition of the first-generation plant or the decision on recognition of the first-generation plant garden issued under the Ordinance No. 15/2004/PL-UBTVQH11 on Plant Varieties shall continue to be used in accordance with this Law without any extension. 3. The decision on recognition of fertilizers in circulation in Vietnam, the fertilizer production license or the certificate of conformity with fertilizer production requirements which has been issued before the entry into force of this Law shall remain valid until its expiry date and may be extended or reissued in accordance with regulations laid down herein. The Certificate of conformity with fertilizer trading requirements which has been issued before the entry into force of this Law shall be equivalent to the Certificate of conformity with fertilizer trading requirements referred to herein. 4. National technical regulations and national standards in crop production activities which have been promulgated before the entry into force of this Law shall continue to be applied until they are repealed or replaced. 5. Results of basic tests of plant varieties which have been conducted before the entry into force of this Law shall have the same value as results of narrow tests prescribed herein. 6. Results of plant variety production tests conducted before the entry into force of this Law shall have the same value as results of wide-area tests prescribed herein. 7. Fertilizer testing results obtained before the effective date of this Law shall be used in accordance with this Law. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This Law is passed by the 14th National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in the 6th session on November 19,2018. Luật An ninh mạng@1: Scope This Law deals with protection of national security and social order and safety in cyberspace; responsibilities of relevant organizations and individuals.
Luật An ninh mạng@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Cybersecurity means assurance that activities in cyberspace do not threaten national security, social order and safety, lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals. 2. cybersecurity protection means the prevention, detection, prevention and response to cybersecurity violations. 3. cyberspace means a network of information technology infrastructure, including telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases; a place where people perform social acts without restriction on space and time. 4. national cyberspace means a cyberspace established, managed and controlled by the Government. 5. national cyberspace infrastructure means a system of facilities and techniques for creating, transmitting, collecting, processing, storing and exchanging information in the national cyberspace, including: a) Transmission system, including national transmission system, international transmission system, satellite system, transmission system of telecommunications service providers, Internet service providers and VAS services; b) Core services, including national information channeling and routing system, DNS, PKI/CA, Internet connection and access service provision system of telecommunications service providers, the Internet and VAS providers; c) Information technology services and applications, including online services; information technology applications with network connection serving management and administration of important agencies, organizations, economic and financial groups; national databases. Online services include e-government, e-commerce, websites, online forums, social networks, blogs; d) Information technology infrastructure of smart cities, Internet of Things, complex systems of real and virtual, cloud computing, big data systems, fast data systems and artificial intelligence systems. 6. International network portals mean places where the transmission and reception of network signals between Vietnam and other countries and territories take place. 7. cybercrime means an act of using cyberspace, information technology or electronic devices to commit a crime as prescribed in the Criminal Code. 8. cyberattack means the use of cyberspace, information technology or electronic devices to sabotage or disrupt telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases and electronic devices. 9. cyberterrorism means the use of cyberspace, information technology or electronic devices to commit acts of terrorism or terrorism financing. 10. cyber espionage means the act of intentionally passing warnings, access codes, passwords, firewalls, using the administration of another person or another method to appropriate or illegally collect information and information resources on telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases and electronic devices of an organization or individual. 11. digital account means information used for authentication, authentication and authorization of applications and services in cyberspace. 12. cybersecurity threat means a situation in cyberspace that shows signs of threatening national security, disrupting public order, threatening legitimate rights and interests of an organization or individual. 13. cybersecurity incident means a surprise event in cyberspace that violates national security, social order, and lawful rights and interests of an organization or individual. 14. cybersecurity emergency means an event that occurs in cyberspace when a violation against national security or social order or lawful rights and interests of an organization or individual is committed.
Luật An ninh mạng@3: State policies on cybersecurity 1. Cybersecurity protection shall be prioritized in national defense and security, socio-economic development, science and technology, and foreign affairs. 2. Develop a healthy cyberspace that does not harm national security, social order, lawful rights and interests of other organizations and individuals. 3. Prioritize resources for establishment of professional cybersecurity forces; improve capacity of cybersecurity forces and organizations and individuals involved in cybersecurity protection; prioritize investment in research and development of cybersecurity science and technology. 4. Encourage and enable organizations and individuals to participate in cybersecurity protection and cybersecurity response; research and develop cybersecurity protection technologies, products, services and applications; cooperate with competent authorities in cybersecurity protection. 5. Enhance international cooperation in cybersecurity.
Luật An ninh mạng@4: Cybersecurity protection principles 1. Comply with the Constitution and law; ensure the interests of the State, the lawful rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals. 2. Cybersecurity protection shall be put under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the State; the political system and the entire nation shall be mobilized; the cybersecurity force shall be put into play. 3. Ensure the connection between cybersecurity and national security information systems and socio-economic development, assurance of human rights and citizens' rights, and enable organizations and individuals to operate in cyberspace. 4. Proactively prevent, detect, prevent, fight and fail all activities using cyberspace that infringe national security, social order and safety, lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals; be ready to prevent cybersecurity threats. 5. Protect cybersecurity of national cyberspace infrastructure; take measures to protect national security information systems. 6. National security information systems shall be assessed and certified to meet cybersecurity requirements before being put into operation; regularly undergo cybersecurity inspection and supervision during use and promptly respond to and remedy cybersecurity incidents. 7. Every violation against the law on cybersecurity must be promptly and strictly handled.
Luật An ninh mạng@5: Cybersecurity protection measures 1. Cybersecurity protection measures include: a) Cybersecurity appraisal; b) Cybersecurity assessment; c) Cybersecurity inspection; d) Cybersecurity supervision; dd) Cybersecurity incident response and remediation; e) Cybersecurity protection; g) Using codes to protect cyberinformation; h) Block and request suspension of provision of cyber information; suspend the establishment, provision and use of telecommunications networks and the Internet, manufacture and use of radio transmitters and receivers as prescribed by law; i) Request for removal of illegal information or false information in cyberspace that threatens national security, social order and safety, or violates lawful rights and interests of other organizations and individuals; k) collecting electronic data related to violations against national security, social order, lawful rights and interests of other organizations and individuals in cyberspace; l) Block and restrict operations of information systems; suspend or request termination of operations of information systems, and revoke domain names in accordance with regulations of law; m) To institute legal proceedings, investigate, prosecute and adjudicate according to the provisions of the Criminal Procedure Code; n) Other measures as prescribed by the law on national security and the law on handling of administrative violations. 2. The Government shall provide guidelines for application of cybersecurity protection measures, except for those mentioned in Point m and Point n Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật An ninh mạng@6: National Cyber Security The State shall take measures for protecting national cyberspace; prevent and take actions against violations against national security, social order, and lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals in cyberspace.
Luật An ninh mạng@7: International cooperation on cybersecurity 1. International cooperation in cybersecurity is based on respect for each other's independence, sovereignty, and territorial integrity, non-interference in each other's internal affairs, equality, and mutual benefit. 2. International cooperation in cybersecurity includes the following contents: a) Cybersecurity research and analysis; b) Develop policies to promote cooperation between Vietnamese organizations and individuals and foreign organizations and individuals and international organizations involved in cybersecurity; c) Sharing information and experience; providing training, equipment and cybersecurity technology; d) Prevent and control cybercrime and cybersecurity violations; prevent cybersecurity threats; dd) Provide cybersecurity personnel counseling, training and development; e) Hold international cybersecurity conferences, seminars and forums; g) Conclusion and implementation of cybersecurity-related treaties and agreements; h) Execute international cooperation programs and projects on cybersecurity; i) Other international cooperation in cybersecurity. 3. The Ministry of Public Security is responsible to the Government for taking charge and cooperating in international cooperation in cybersecurity, except for international cooperation of the Ministry of National Defense. The Ministry of National Defense is responsible to the Government for international cooperation in cybersecurity within its competence. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs shall cooperate with the Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of National Defense in international cooperation in cybersecurity. The Government shall decide international cooperation in cybersecurity that involves multiple Ministries. 4. International cooperation in cybersecurity of other Ministries and local governments must be approved in writing by the Ministry of Public Security, except for international cooperation of the Ministry of National Defense.
Luật An ninh mạng@8: Prohibited cybersecurity practices 1. Using cyberspace to commit the following acts: a) Committing the violation prescribed in Clause 1 Article 18 of this Law; b) Organizing, operating, colluding, instigating, buying off, cheating, dragging, training and coaching persons who oppose the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; c) Distorting history, denying revolutionary achievements, undermining the great national unity, offending religions, discriminating in terms of gender and race; d) Providing false information causing confusion among the people, causing damage to socio-economic activities, causing difficulties to activities of state agencies or law enforcers, infringing upon the legitimate rights and interests of other agencies, organizations and individuals; dd) Prostitution, social evils, human trafficking; posting of pornographic or criminal information; destruction of national fine traditions and customs, social ethics and community health; f) Inciting, dragging or inciting other persons to commit crimes. 2. Conducting cyberattacks, cyberterrorism, cyber espionage or cybercrime; causing incidents, attacks, infiltration, seizure of control rights, falsification, interruption, stoppage, paralysis or sabotage of national security information systems. 3. Manufacturing or using tools, devices or software or committing acts of obstructing or disrupting the operation of telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems or electronic devices; spreading computer programs which harm the operation of telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems or electronic devices; illegally accessing telecommunications networks, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases or electronic devices of others. 4. Obstruct cybersecurity forces; illegally attack or disable cybersecurity measures. 5. Take advantage of cybersecurity protection activities to violate national sovereignty, interests, security, social order, lawful rights and interests of other organizations and individuals, or for profiteering. 6. Other acts in violation of this Law.
Luật An ninh mạng@9: Handling of violations of the law on cybersecurity Those who commit acts of violating the provisions of this Law shall, depending on the nature and seriousness of their violations, be disciplined, administratively handled or examined for penal liability; if causing damage, they must pay compensation therefor according to law provisions.
Luật An ninh mạng@10: National security information systems 1. National security information system means an information system that, when it is broken, accessed, hijacked, falsified, interrupted, frozen, attacked or sabotaged, will seriously violate cybersecurity. 2. National security information systems include: a) Military, security, diplomatic and cryptographic information systems; b) Information systems storing and processing state-secret information; c) Information systems serving storage and preservation of exhibits and documents of special importance; d) Information systems serving preservation of materials and substances that are extremely dangerous to humans and the environment; dd) Information systems serving the maintenance, manufacture and management of other facilities of special importance related to national security; e) Important information systems serving operation of central agencies and organizations; g) National information systems in the fields of energy, finance, banking, telecommunications, transport, natural resources and environment, chemicals, health, culture and press; h) Automatic control and surveillance systems at important works related to national security and targets of national security importance. 3. The Prime Minister shall promulgate and amend the list of national security information systems. 4. The Government shall provide for cooperation between the Ministry of Public Security, Ministry of National Defense, Ministry of Information and Communications, Government Cipher Committee and other ministries and regulatory bodies in appraising, assessing, inspecting, supervising, responding to and remedying incidents occurring to national security information systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@11: Cybersecurity appraisal for national security information systems 1. Cybersecurity appraisal means the consideration and assessment of cybersecurity contents as the basis for making decisions on the establishment or upgrade of information systems. 2. Cybersecurity appraisal shall be carried out by : a) Pre-feasibility study report, construction design documents of the project on investment in construction of information systems before approval; b) The scheme for upgrading information systems before approval. 3. Contents of cybersecurity appraisal of national security information systems include : a) Compliance with cybersecurity regulations and requirements in the design; b) Conformity with the cybersecurity protection plan, cybersecurity response and cybersecurity personnel. 4. The power to appraise cybersecurity of national security information systems is specified as follows: a) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security shall assess cybersecurity of national security information systems, except for the cases specified in Point b and Point c of this Clause; b) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of National Defense shall assess cybersecurity of military information systems; c) The Government Cipher Commission shall assess cybersecurity of its cryptography systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@12: Assessment of cybersecurity conditions of national security information systems 1. Assessment of cybersecurity means the assessment of cybersecurity of information systems before they are put into operation. 2. A national security information system must satisfy the following conditions on: a) Cybersecurity regulations, procedures and plans; personnel in charge of system operation and management; b) Ensure cybersecurity of equipment, hardware and software that are system components; c) Technical measures for surveillance and protection of cybersecurity; measures for protection of automatic control and surveillance systems, Internet of Things, virtual-real complex systems, cloud computing, big data systems, fast data systems and artificial intelligence systems; d) Physical security measures including special isolation, data leak prevention, information retrieval prevention, entry and exit control. 3. The power to assess cybersecurity of national security information systems is specified as follows: a) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security shall assess and certify cybersecurity of national security information systems, except for the cases specified in Point b and Point c of this Clause; b) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of National Defense shall assess and certify cybersecurity of military information systems; c) The Government Cipher Commission shall assess and certify cybersecurity of its cryptography systems. 4. National security information systems shall be put into operation after they are certified to be cybersecurity-qualified. 5. The Government shall elaborate Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật An ninh mạng@13: Cybersecurity inspection of national security information systems 1. cybersecurity inspection means the determination of cybersecurity of an information system, information system infrastructure or information stored, processed and transmitted in an information system in order to prevent, detect and handle cybersecurity threats and provide plans and measures for ensuring normal operation of the information system. 2. A national security information system shall undergo cybersecurity inspection in the following cases: a) When electronic devices and/or cyberinformation security services are used in the information system; b) There is any change in the current state of the information system; c) Annual inspection; d) Carry out ad hoc inspections upon occurrence of cybersecurity incidents or cybersecurity violations; upon request for cybersecurity management; upon expiration of the deadline for remediation of vulnerabilities recommended by professional cybersecurity forces. 3.
