Cybersecurity inspection shall be carried out against: a) Hardware systems, software systems and digital devices used in information systems; b) Cybersecurity regulations and measures; c) Information stored, processed and transmitted in the information system; d) Cybersecurity incident response and remediation plans of the information system administrator; dd) Measures for protection of state secrets and prevention of leakage and loss of state secrets through technical channels; e) Cybersecurity protection personnel. 4. Administrators of national security information systems shall carry out cybersecurity inspection of the information systems under their management in the cases specified in Points a, b and c Clause 2 of this Article; send written notification of inspection results to the professional cybersecurity force of the Ministry of Public Security or the Ministry of National Defense if the information systems are military. 5. Unscheduled cybersecurity inspection of national security information systems is specified as follows: a) At least 12 hours before the inspection, the cybersecurity force shall send a written notification to the information system administrator in case of a cybersecurity incident or cybersecurity violation; at least 72 hours in case of cybersecurity state management requirements or the deadline for remediation of vulnerabilities imposed by the cybersecurity force is over; b) Within 30 days from the end of the inspection, the cybersecurity force shall notify the inspection result and request the administrator of the compromised information system to take remedial measures at the request of the administrator; c) The professional cybersecurity force of the Ministry of Public Security shall carry out ad hoc cybersecurity inspection of national security information systems other than military information systems under the management of the Ministry of National Defense, cryptography systems of Government Cipher Commission and cryptography products provided by Government Cipher Commission to protect state-secret information. The professional cybersecurity force of the Ministry of National Defense shall carry out ad hoc cybersecurity inspection of military information systems. The Government Cipher Committee shall carry out ad hoc cybersecurity inspection of its cryptography systems and cryptography products provided by the Government Cipher Committee to protect state-secret information; d) Administrators of national security information systems shall cooperate with professional cybersecurity forces in carrying out ad hoc cybersecurity inspections. 6. The cybersecurity inspection result shall be kept confidential as prescribed by law.
Luật An ninh mạng@14: Cybersecurity monitoring of national security information systems 1. Cybersecurity supervision means collection and analysis of information to identify cybersecurity threats, cybersecurity incidents, vulnerabilities, malicious codes and malicious hardware for warning, remediation and handling. 2. Administrators of national security information systems shall take charge and cooperate with professional cybersecurity forces in regularly supervising cybersecurity of their systems; develop a mechanism for self-warning and receiving warnings about cybersecurity threats, cybersecurity incidents, vulnerabilities, malicious codes and malicious hardware, and develop emergency response and remediation plans. 3. Professional cybersecurity forces shall supervise cybersecurity of national security information systems under their management; warn and cooperate with administrators of information systems in remedying and dealing with cybersecurity threats, cybersecurity incidents, vulnerabilities, malicious codes and hardware of national security information systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@15: Response to cybersecurity incidents involving national security information systems 1. Cybersecurity incident response and remediation activities include the following activities: a) Detecting and identifying cybersecurity incidents; b) Protect the scene and collect evidence; c) Block and limit the scope of the cybersecurity incident and minimize damage caused by the cybersecurity incident; d) Identify targets, entities and scope of response; dd) Verification, analysis, assessment and classification of cybersecurity incidents; e) Implement the cybersecurity incident response and remediation plan; g) Verify the cause and trace the origin; h) Investigation and handling as prescribed by law. 2. Administrators of national security information systems shall develop plans for cybersecurity incident response and remediation for their systems; implement such plans when a cybersecurity incident occurs and promptly report it to a competent cybersecurity force. 3. Coordinating response and remediation of cybersecurity incidents occurring to national security information systems : a) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security shall coordinate response and remediation of cybersecurity incidents that occur to national security information systems, except for the cases specified in Point b and Point c of this Clause; participate in cybersecurity incident response and remediation of national security information systems upon request; notify the information system administrator of any cyberattacks or cybersecurity incidents; b) Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of National Defense shall coordinate response and remediation of cybersecurity incidents that occur to military information systems; c) The Government Cipher Commission shall take charge of coordinating response and remediation of cybersecurity incidents that occur to its cryptography systems. 4. Agencies, organizations and individuals shall participate in response to cybersecurity incidents that occur to national security information systems at the request of the coordinating authority.
Luật An ninh mạng@16: Preventing and handling cyberspace information that propagandizes against the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; incites riots, disrupts security, disrupts public order; humiliates and slanders; violates economic management order 1. Information in cyberspace that is meant to oppose the Socialist Republic of Vietnam includes: a) Distorting or defaming the people's administration; b) Psychological warfare, inciting wars of aggression, division, hatred between nations, religions and peoples of countries; c) Offends the nation, national flag, national emblem, national anthem, great man, leader, famous man, national hero. 2. Information in cyberspace that incites riots, disrupts security or public order includes: a) Calling, mobilizing, inciting, threatening, dividing, carrying out armed activities or using violence to oppose the people's administration; b) Calling, mobilizing, inciting, threatening, enticing large groups of people to cause disturbances, oppose the on-duty officers, obstruct activities of agencies and organizations causing insecurity of security and order. 3. Information in cyberspace that is dishonorful or slanders includes: a) Seriously infringing upon the honor, prestige and dignity of other persons; b) Fabricated or false information that infringes upon the honor, prestige, dignity or causes damage to the legitimate rights and interests of other agencies, organizations and individuals. 4. Information in cyberspace that violates economic management order includes: a) Fabricated or false information about products, goods, money, bonds, treasury bills, checks and other valuable papers; b) Fabricated or false information in the fields of finance, banking, e-commerce, electronic payment, currency trading, capital mobilization, multi-level marketing, securities. 5. Information in cyberspace is fabricated or false, causing confusion, socio-economic damage, difficulties for regulatory bodies or law enforcers, or infringing upon legitimate rights and interests of other organizations and individuals. 6. Administrators of information systems shall implement management and technical measures to prevent, detect, block and remove information mentioned in Clauses 1,2,3,4 and 5 of this Article on their systems at the request of professional cybersecurity forces. 7. Professional cybersecurity forces and competent authorities shall take the measures mentioned in Points h, i, and l Clause 1 Article 5 of this Law to process information in cyberspace mentioned in Clauses 1,2,3,4, and 5 of this Article. 8. Providers of services on telecommunications networks, the Internet, VAS and information system administrators shall cooperate with competent authorities in processing information in cyberspace mentioned in Clause 1 through 5 of this Article. 9. The organization or individual that creates, posts or disseminates the information mentioned in Clause 1 through 5 of this Article shall remove the information at the request of cybersecurity forces and take responsibility for such removal.
Luật An ninh mạng@17: Anti-cyber activities; protection of state-secret information, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy in cyberspace 1. Acts of cyber espionage; infringement upon state secrets, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy in cyberspace include: a) Appropriating, trading, seizing, intentionally disclosing information of state secrets, working secrets, business secrets, personal secrets, family secrets and private life affecting the honor, prestige, dignity, legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals; b) Deliberate deletion, damage, loss or change of state-secret information, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy information transmitted or stored in cyberspace; c) Deliberately changing, canceling or deactivating technical measures developed and applied to protect information classified as state secrets, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy; d) Posting state-secret information, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets or privacy information in cyberspace against the law; dd) Deliberately listening to, illegally recording conversations; e) Other acts of intentionally infringing upon state secrets, working secrets, business secrets, personal secrets, family secrets and privacy. 2. The administrator of an information system shall assume the following responsibilities: a) Carry out cybersecurity inspection to detect and remove malicious codes and hardware, fix vulnerabilities and holes; detect, prevent and handle illegal access or other cybersecurity threats; b) Implement management and technical measures to prevent, detect and stop cyber espionage, infringement upon state secrets, work secrets, business secrets, personal secrets, family secrets and privacy on the information system and promptly remove information related to such acts; c) Cooperate with and comply with requirements of professional cybersecurity forces for preventing and fighting cyber espionage, protecting state-secret information, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy on their systems. 3. Authorities in charge of drafting and storing state secrets shall protect state secrets which are prepared, stored on computers or other devices or exchanged in cyberspace in accordance with regulations of the Law on protection of state secrets. 4. The Ministry of Public Security has the following responsibilities, except for those specified in Clauses 5 and 6 of this Article : a) Carry out cybersecurity inspection of national security information systems to detect and remove malicious codes and hardware, fix vulnerabilities and holes; detect, prevent and handle illegal access; b) Carry out cybersecurity inspection of communications equipment, products and services, digital devices and electronic devices before they are used in national security information systems; c) Carry out surveillance of cybersecurity of national security information systems to detect and take actions against illegal collection of state-secret information; d) Discover and take actions against illegal posting, storage or exchange of state-secret information and documents in cyberspace; dd) Participate in research and production of products for storing and transmitting state-secret information and documents; products for encoding information in cyberspace within the ambit of assigned functions and tasks; e) Inspect the protection of state secrets in cyberspace by regulatory authorities and cybersecurity by administrators of national security information systems; g) Provide training in protection of state secrets in cyberspace, prevention and response to cyberattacks and cybersecurity protection for cybersecurity forces specified in Clause 2 Article 30 of this Law. 5. The Ministry of National Defense shall implement the contents specified in Points a, b, c, d, dd and e Clause 4 of this Article with regard to military information systems. 6. Government Cipher Commission shall organize the implementation of regulations of law on use of cryptography to protect state-secret information stored and exchanged in cyberspace.
Luật An ninh mạng@18: The following actions are prohibited from using cyberspace, information technology and electronic devices to violate regulations of law on national security and social order : 1. Use of cyberspace, information technology and electronic devices to violate regulations of law on national security and social order includes the following acts: a) Posting or spreading information in cyberspace that contains the information mentioned in Clause 1 through 5 Article 16, or the violations mentioned in Clause 1 Article 17 of this Law; b) Appropriating property; gambling on the Internet; stealing international telecommunications charges on the Internet; violating copyright and intellectual property in cyberspace; c) Forging websites of agencies, organizations or individuals; forging, circulating, stealing, illegally trading, collecting or exchanging information on credit cards and bank accounts of other persons; illegally issuing, providing or using payment instruments; d) Propagating, advertising, trading goods and services which are on the list of banned goods as prescribed by law; dd) Instructing others to commit violations against the law; e) Other acts of using cyberspace, information technology or electronic devices to violate regulations of law on national security and social order. 2. Professional cybersecurity forces shall prevent and control the use of cyberspace, information technology and electronic devices to violate regulations of law on national security and social order.
Luật An ninh mạng@19: Cyberattack prevention 1. Acts of cyberattack and acts related to cyberattack include: a) Spreading computer programs that cause harm to telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases, electronic devices; b) Obstructing, disrupting, paralyzing, interrupting or stalling the telecommunications network, the Internet, computer network, information system, information processing and control system, or illegally blocking the transmission of data; c) Infiltrating, damaging or appropriating data stored or transmitted via telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases or electronic devices; d) Infiltrating, creating or exploiting weaknesses, vulnerabilities and system services to appropriate information and gain illicit benefits; dd) Producing, trading, exchanging or giving tools, equipment or software that are capable of attacking telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases or electronic devices for illegal purposes; e) Other acts that affect normal operation of telecommunications networks, the Internet, computer networks, information systems, information processing and control systems, databases and electronic devices. 2. The administrator of an information system shall be responsible for applying technical measures to prevent and stop the acts specified in points a, b, c, d and e of clause 1 of this Article with respect to the information system under its management. 3. In case of a cyberattack that violates or threatens to violate national security, national interests or sovereignty, or causes serious damage to public order, the professional cybersecurity force shall take charge and cooperate with the information system administrator and relevant entities in determining the origin of the attack and collecting evidence; request providers of telecommunications, Internet and VAS services to filter information to prevent and eliminate cyberattacks and provide relevant information and documents promptly and adequately. 4. Responsibilities for prevention and response to cyberattacks are specified as follows: a) The Ministry of Public Security shall take charge and cooperate with relevant Ministries and agencies in preventing, detecting and taking actions against the violations mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article that infringe or threaten to infringe national sovereignty, interests and security, cause serious damage to social order and safety nationwide, except for the cases mentioned in Point b and Point c of this Clause; b) The Ministry of National Defense shall take charge and cooperate with relevant Ministries and agencies in preventing, detecting and taking actions against the violations specified in Clause 1 of this Article committed against military information systems; c/The Government Cipher Commission shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with concerned ministries and branches in, preventing, detecting and handling acts specified in Clause 1 of this Article with regard to its cipher information systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@20: Cyberterrorism prevention and control 1. Competent authorities shall take the measures specified in this Law, Article 29 of the Law on Cyberinformation Security and anti-terrorism laws to deal with cyberterrorism. 2. Administrators of information systems shall regularly review and inspect information systems under their management to eliminate cyberterrorism threats. 3. Upon detecting any sign of cyberterrorism, the organization or individual must promptly inform cybersecurity forces. The receiving authority shall receive all information about cyberterrorism and promptly inform the professional cybersecurity force. 4. The Ministry of Public Security shall take charge and cooperate with relevant ministries in anti-terrorism, neutralize sources of cyberterrorism, take actions against cyberterrorism and minimize the damage to information systems, except for the cases specified in Clause 5 and Clause 6 of this Article. 5. The Ministry of National Defense shall take charge and cooperate with relevant ministries in anti-terrorism and take actions against cyberterrorism against military information systems. 6. Government Cipher Commission shall take charge and cooperate with relevant ministries in anti-terrorism and adopt measures against cyberterrorism against its cryptography systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@21: Preventing and handling cyber security incidents 1. Cybersecurity emergencies include: a) Provoking information in cyberspace that might lead to violence, disruption of security or terrorism; b) The violation involves an attack on a national security information system; c) Large-scale and high-intensity attack on multiple information systems; d) Cyberattacks to destroy national security works or targets; dd) Cyberattacks that seriously violate national sovereignty, interests and security; cause extremely serious damage to social order and safety, lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals. 2. Responsibility to prevent cybersecurity emergencies: a) Professional cybersecurity forces shall cooperate with administrators of national security information systems in implementing technical and professional measures to prevent, detect and respond to cybersecurity emergencies; b) Telecommunications enterprises, Internet enterprises, information technology enterprises, enterprises providing services on telecommunications networks, the Internet, VAS services, and relevant organizations and individuals shall cooperate with professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security in preventing, detecting, and taking actions against cybersecurity emergencies. 3. Measures for response to cybersecurity emergencies include : a) Promptly implement the plan for emergency cybersecurity prevention and response, prevention, elimination or mitigation of damage caused by the cybersecurity emergency; b) Notify relevant organizations and individuals; c) Collect relevant information; monitor and supervise the cybersecurity emergency continuously; d) Analyze and assess information, forecast the possibility, scope of influence and level of damage caused by the cybersecurity emergency; dd) Suspending the provision of cyberinformation in specific areas or disconnecting international network portals; e) Provide forces and means for preventing and eliminating cybersecurity emergencies; g) Other measures as prescribed in the Law on National security. 4. The cybersecurity emergency shall be dealt with as follows: a) Promptly notify the cybersecurity force and take the measures mentioned in Point a and Point b Clause 3 of this Article when a cybersecurity emergency is found; b) The Prime Minister shall consider taking actions against or authorizing the Minister of Public Security to take actions against cybersecurity emergencies nationwide or locally or for a specific target. The Prime Minister shall consider deciding or authorizing the Minister of National Defense to consider deciding to take actions against cybersecurity emergencies that occur to military information systems and cryptography systems affiliated to VGCA; c) Professional cybersecurity forces shall take charge and cooperate with relevant organizations and individuals in taking the measures mentioned in Clause 3 of this Article to deal with cybersecurity emergencies; d) Relevant organizations and individuals shall cooperate with professional cybersecurity forces in taking measures for preventing and responding to cybersecurity emergencies.
Luật An ninh mạng@22: Cybersecurity protection 1. Cybersecurity protection is an organized activity carried out by professional cybersecurity forces in cyberspace to protect national security and ensure social order and safety. 2. Cybersecurity protection activities include the following activities: a) Grasp the situation related to the protection of national security; b) Prevent and control attacks and protect stable operation of national security information systems; c) Paralyzing or restricting the use of cyberspace to threaten national security or cause extremely serious damage to social order and safety; d) Deliberately attack and disable targets in cyberspace to protect national security and social order. 3. The Ministry of Public Security shall take charge and cooperate with relevant Ministries and agencies in cybersecurity protection.
Luật An ninh mạng@23: Cybersecurity protection in central and local regulatory bodies and political organizations 1. Cybersecurity protection activities shall include the following contents: a) Formulate and complete regulations on use of internal computer networks and Internet-connected computer networks; plans for assurance of cybersecurity of information systems; plans for response to cybersecurity incidents; b) Apply cybersecurity protection plans, measures and technologies to information systems and information and documents stored, compiled and transmitted on information systems under their management; c) Provide training in cybersecurity for officials, public employees and employees; improve cybersecurity protection capacity of cybersecurity forces; d) Protect cybersecurity during provision of public services in cyberspace, provision, exchange and collection of information with other organizations and individuals, internal and external information sharing or other activities prescribed by the Government; dd) Invest in and build infrastructure suitable for assurance of cybersecurity of information systems; e) Carry out cybersecurity inspection of information systems; prevent and take actions against violations against regulations of law on cybersecurity; respond to and rectify cybersecurity incidents. 2. Heads of organizations shall organize cybersecurity protection activities under their management.
Luật An ninh mạng@24: Carry out cybersecurity inspection of information systems of organizations not on the List of national security information systems 1. A cybersecurity inspection shall be carried out for information systems of organizations that are not on the List of national security information systems in the following cases: a) The violation against regulations of law on cybersecurity violates national security or causes serious damage to public order; b) The request is made by the administrator of the information system. 2. Cybersecurity inspection entities include: a) Hardware systems, software systems and digital devices used in information systems; b) Information stored, processed and transmitted in the information system; c) Measures for protection of state secrets and prevention of leakage and loss of state secrets through technical channels. 3. Administrators of information systems shall notify professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security of any violations against regulations of law on cybersecurity committed on their systems. 4. Professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security shall carry out cybersecurity inspection of information systems of organizations in the cases mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article. 5. At least 12 hours before the inspection, the cybersecurity force shall send a written notification to the information system administrator. Within 30 days from the end of the inspection, the cybersecurity force shall notify the inspection result and request the administrator of the compromised information system to take remedial measures at the request of the administrator. 6. The cybersecurity inspection result shall be kept confidential as prescribed by law. 7. The Government shall provide guidelines for cybersecurity inspection in this Article.
Luật An ninh mạng@25: Protection of cybersecurity of national cyberspace infrastructure and international portals 1. Ensure cybersecurity of national cyberspace infrastructure and international internet gateways in a manner that closely combines cybersecurity protection requirements with socio-economic development requirements; encourage international internet gateways in Vietnam; encourage organizations and individuals to invest in national cyberspace infrastructure. 2. Every organization and individual in charge of management and operation of national cyberspace infrastructure and international internet gateways shall : a) Protect cybersecurity under their management; facilitate the management, inspection, and fulfillment of cybersecurity requirements by competent authorities; b) Enable and take necessary technical measures to enable competent authorities to protect cybersecurity at their request.
Luật An ninh mạng@26: Ensuring information security in cyberspace 1. Websites, web portals or special websites on social networks of agencies, organizations and individuals may not provide, publish or transmit information with contents specified in Clauses 1,2,3,4 and 5, Article 16 of this Law and other information with contents infringing upon national security. 2. Domestic and foreign enterprises providing services on telecommunications networks, the Internet and VAS in Vietnam shall : a) Verify information when users register digital accounts; keep confidentiality of user's information and accounts; provide user information for professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security at their written request to serve investigation into cybersecurity violations; b) Preventing sharing of information and removing information mentioned in Clause 1 through 5 Article 16 of this Law on the information system of the organization within 24 hours from the time a cybersecurity force of the Ministry of Public Security or a competent authority of the Ministry of Information and Communications requests, and keeping a log of the system serving investigation and actions against violations against regulations of law on cybersecurity within the time limit imposed by the Government; c) Failing to provide or suspending the provision of telecommunications services, the Internet, and VAS services for the organization or individual that posts the information mentioned in Clause 1 through 5 Article 16 of this Law on cyberspace at the request of cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security or competent authorities of the Ministry of Information and Communications. 3. Domestic and foreign enterprises providing services on telecommunications networks, the Internet, VAS in Vietnam that collect, analyze, process data about personal information, relationship of service users, and data generated by service users in Vietnam must retain such data in Vietnam for a period prescribed by the Government. Foreign enterprises specified in this Clause must set up branches or representative offices in Vietnam. 4. The Government shall elaborate Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật An ninh mạng@27: Cybersecurity research and development 1. Cybersecurity research and development shall focus on the following contents: a) Develop software systems and cybersecurity equipment; b) Methods for verification of cybersecurity software and equipment that meet standards and minimize vulnerabilities and malicious software; c) Method of inspecting the provided hardware and software to ensure that they are properly functional; d) Methods for protecting state secrets, work secrets, business secrets, family secrets and privacy; ability to protect information in cyberspace; dd) Identify sources of information transmitted in cyberspace; e) Elimination of cybersecurity threats; g) Construction of cyberfield and cybersecurity testing environment; h) Technical initiatives for improvement of cybersecurity awareness and skills; i) Cybersecurity forecasting; k) Cybersecurity practice research and cybersecurity theory development. 2. Relevant organizations and individuals are entitled to cybersecurity research and development.
Luật An ninh mạng@28: Enhancing Cybersecurity Autonomy 1. The State encourages and facilitates organizations and individuals to improve their cybersecurity independence and capacity for manufacturing, inspecting, assessing and verifying digital devices, network services and network applications. 2. The Government shall take the following measures to improve cybersecurity independence of organizations and individuals: a) Promote the transfer, research, mastery and development of cybersecurity technologies, products, services and applications; b) Promote application of new and advanced cybersecurity technologies; c) Provide training, develop and employ cybersecurity personnel; d) Enhance business environment and improve competition conditions, assist enterprises in researching and producing cybersecurity products, services and applications.
Luật An ninh mạng@29: Protecting children in cyberspace 1. Children have the right to protection, access to information, participate in social activities, play and entertainment, keep personal secrets, privacy and other rights when participating in cyberspace. 2. Administrators of information systems, providers of services on telecommunications networks, the Internet, and VAS services shall control information on their systems or services so as to avoid harming children or infringing upon children's rights; prevent sharing and removal of information that harm children or infringe upon children's rights; promptly notify and cooperate with professional cybersecurity forces of the Ministry of Public Security in taking actions. 3. Agencies, organizations, and individuals participating in cyberspace shall cooperate with competent authorities in protecting children's rights in cyberspace and preventing information that harms children in accordance with this Law and regulations of law on children. 4. Agencies, organizations, parents, teachers, caregivers and other relevant individuals shall protect children's rights and protect children when they participate in cyberspace in accordance with regulations of law on children. 5. Professional cybersecurity forces and competent authorities shall take measures to prevent, detect, stop, and take actions against use of cyberspace that threatens children or violates children's rights.
Luật An ninh mạng@30: Cybersecurity Protection Force 1. Professional cybersecurity forces shall be deployed at the Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of National Defense. 2. Cybersecurity forces of ministries, People's Committees of provinces, organizations directly managing national security information systems. 3. Organizations and individuals mobilized to participate in cybersecurity protection.
Luật An ninh mạng@31: Ensure human resources for cybersecurity protection 1. Vietnamese citizens who have knowledge about cybersecurity, cyberinformation security and information technology are the primary resources for cybersecurity protection. 2. The State shall formulate programs and plans for development of cybersecurity personnel. 3. In case of cybersecurity emergency, cyberterrorism, cyberattack, cybersecurity incident or cybersecurity threat, cybersecurity personnel shall be mobilized by competent authorities. The power, responsibility, procedures for mobilizing cybersecurity personnel are specified in the Law on National Security, Law on National Defense, Law on People's Public Security and relevant laws.
Luật An ninh mạng@32: Recruitment, training and development of cybersecurity forces 1. Vietnamese citizens who are qualified in terms of moral qualities, health, cybersecurity, cyberinformation security, and information technology knowledge and wish to be recruited to cybersecurity forces. 2. Priority shall be given to training and development of high-quality cybersecurity forces. 3. Priority shall be given to development of cybersecurity training institutions that meet international standards; encourage cooperation in cybersecurity between the state and private sectors, both domestic and foreign countries.
Luật An ninh mạng@33: Cybersecurity training 1. Cybersecurity training shall be included in the national defense and security subjects in schools and the national defense and security training program in accordance with the Law on National Defense and Security Education. 2. The Ministry of Public Security shall take charge and cooperate with relevant Ministries and agencies in providing cybersecurity training for cybersecurity forces, officials, public employees and workers. The Ministry of National Defense and Government Cipher Commission shall provide cybersecurity training for entities under their management.
Luật An ninh mạng@34: Disseminate cybersecurity knowledge 1. The State shall introduce policies on dissemination of cybersecurity knowledge nationwide, encourage regulatory bodies to cooperate with private organizations and individuals in running cybersecurity education programs. 2. Ministries, agencies and organizations shall provide cybersecurity training for their officials, public employees and workers. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall disseminate cybersecurity knowledge and awareness among local organizations and individuals.
Luật An ninh mạng@35: Cybersecurity protection budget 1. Funding for cybersecurity protection of state authorities and political organizations shall be covered by state budget and included in annual state budget estimates. State funding shall be managed and used in accordance with regulations of law on state budget. 2. Funding for cybersecurity of information systems of organizations other than those mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article shall be covered by such organizations.
Luật An ninh mạng@36: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Public Security The Ministry of Public Security is responsible to the Government for state management of cybersecurity, except for the responsibilities of the Ministry of National Defense and Government Cipher Commission. 1. Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate legislative documents on cybersecurity and provide guidelines for implementation thereof; 2. Formulate and propose cybersecurity protection strategies, policies, plans and schemes; 3. Prevent and fight against the use of cyberspace for the purpose of infringing upon sovereignty, interests, national security, social order and safety, and cybercrime prevention and fighting; 4. Ensure information security in cyberspace; develop mechanisms for verification of information about registration of digital accounts; give warnings and share information about cybersecurity and cybersecurity threats; 5. Advise the Government and the Prime Minister on assignment and cooperation in implementing cybersecurity protection measures, prevention and response to cybersecurity violations in case state management is related to multiple ministries; 6. Organize the training in prevention and response to cyberattacks; training in response to and remediation of cybersecurity incidents that occur to national security information systems; 7. Carry out inspections, settle complaints and denunciations, and take actions against violations against regulations of law on cybersecurity.
Luật An ninh mạng@37: Responsibilities of the Ministry of National Defense The Ministry of National Defense is responsible to the Government for state management of cybersecurity within its competence and has the following tasks and powers: 1. Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate and provide guidelines for implementation of legislative documents on cybersecurity within its competence; 2. Formulate and propose cybersecurity protection strategies, policies, plans and schemes within its competence; 3. Prevent and fight against the use of cyberspace for the purpose of violating national security within its scope of management; 4. Cooperate with the Ministry of Public Security in organizing drills to prevent and respond to cyberattacks and cybersecurity incidents that occur to national security information systems, and carry out cybersecurity protection; 5. Carry out inspections, settle complaints and denunciations, and take actions against violations against regulations of law on cybersecurity within their competence.
Luật An ninh mạng@38: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Information and Communications 1. Cooperate with the Ministry of Public Security and the Ministry of National Defense in cybersecurity protection. 2. To coordinate with concerned agencies in propagating and refuting information with contents against the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam specified in Clause 1, Article 16 of this Law. 3. Request providers of telecommunications services, the Internet, VAS services, and information system administrators to remove information that violates cybersecurity laws from their services and information systems.
Luật An ninh mạng@39: Responsibilities of the Government Cipher Commission 1. Propose legislative documents, programs and plans for cybersecurity protection under the management of Government Cipher Committee to the Minister of National Defense or competent authorities for promulgation. 2. Protect cybersecurity of cryptography systems of VGCA and cryptography products provided by VGCA as prescribed in this Law. 3. Uniformly manage cryptography scientific research and technology; produce, use and provide cryptography products to protect state-secret information stored and exchanged in cyberspace.
Luật An ninh mạng@40: Responsibilities of ministries, branches and provincial-level People's Committees Within their competence, Ministries and provincial People's Committees shall protect cybersecurity of information and information systems under their management; cooperate with the Ministry of Public Security in state management of cybersecurity of Ministries, regulatory bodies, and local governments.
Luật An ninh mạng@41: Responsibilities of providers of online services 1. Every provider of cyberspace services in Vietnam has the responsibility to : a) Warn about cybersecurity failures during use of their services in cyberspace and provide instructions on prevention; b) Develop plans and solutions for rapid response to cybersecurity incidents, immediately deal with vulnerabilities, malicious codes, network attacks, network intrusion and other security risks; immediately implement emergency plans and appropriate response measures upon occurrence of cybersecurity incidents and report to professional cybersecurity forces as prescribed by this Law; c) Apply technical solutions and other necessary measures to ensure security during the collection of information, prevent leakage, damage or loss of data; immediately provide response solutions in case of leakage, damage or loss of user data, notify users and request professional cybersecurity forces to do so as prescribed in this Law; d) Cooperate with and enable professional cybersecurity forces to protect cybersecurity. 2. Providers of services on telecommunications networks, the Internet, and VAS in Vietnam shall comply with Clause 1 of this Article, Clause 2 and Clause 3 Article 26 of this Law.
Luật An ninh mạng@42: Responsibilities of organizations and individuals using cyberspace 1. Comply with regulations of law on cybersecurity. 2. Promptly provide information about cybersecurity, cybersecurity threats, and cybersecurity violations to competent authorities and cybersecurity forces. 3. Comply with cybersecurity protection requirements and instructions given by competent authorities; assist and enable responsible organizations and individuals to take cybersecurity measures.
Luật An ninh mạng@43: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2019. 2. If an information system is put on the List of national security information systems, its administrator shall ensure that all cybersecurity requirements are satisfied and the professional cybersecurity force shall assess cybersecurity requirements in accordance with Article 12 of this Law within 12 months from the effective date of this Law. The Prime Minister shall decide whether to grant extension but the extension must not exceed 12 months. 3. If an information system is added to the List of national security information systems, within 12 months from the day on which it is added, the administrator of such information system shall ensure that all cybersecurity requirements are satisfied and the professional cybersecurity force shall assess cybersecurity requirements in accordance with Article 12 of this Law. The Prime Minister shall decide whether to grant extension but not exceeding 12 months. This Law is passed by the 14th National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in the 5th session on June 12,2018. THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Thi Kim Ngan
Luật Chăn nuôi@1: Scope This Law provides for animal husbandry; rights and obligations of organizations and individuals in animal husbandry; state management of animal husbandry.
Luật Chăn nuôi@2: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Livestock production is an economic and technical industry that includes activities related to livestock breeds, animal feeds, livestock production conditions, livestock product processing and markets. 2. livestock raising means raising and breeding of domestic animals and other activities related to livestock and animal products serving food, traction, decoration or other human purposes. 3. household farming means a form of household farming. 4. farm-based animal husbandry means a form of concentrated animal husbandry in a separate area for animal husbandry production and trading. 5. Livestock includes cattle, poultry and other animals in livestock husbandry. 6. cattle refer to mammals with 4 legs domesticated and raised by humans. 7. poultry means a two-legged, feathered animal that is part of the winged group of animals domesticated and raised by humans. 8. other animals used in animal husbandry means animals other than cattle and poultry and those on the List of endangered, rare and precious species prioritized for protection, the List of endangered, rare and precious forest animals, ordinary forest animals, aquatic animals and the List of wild forest animals in the Appendix of CITES. 9. Livestock breed means a population of livestock of the same species, the same origin, with similar appearance and genetic structure, which is formed, consolidated and developed under human impacts; must have a quantity enough for propagation and inheritance of characteristics of breeds to the next generations. 10. line means a group of domestic animals in a breed, which have common characteristics of the breed but stable particular characteristics. 11. New livestock breeds and lines mean livestock breeds and lines created domestically for the first time or imported into Vietnam for the first time. 12. precious and rare livestock breed means a livestock breed that has special value in science, health and economy but its quantity is small or is in danger of extinction. 13. native livestock breed means a livestock breed that is formed and exists in a certain area of the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 14. Original breed means a prototypal or grandparental breed herd for pigs or poultry; a nucleus breed herd for other cattle breeds; a purebred herd for bees; or a prototype breed for silkworm. 15. Prototypal breed stock of pigs and poultry means a purebred breed stock or a stock selected for production of grandparental breed stock. 16. grandparental breed stock means a stock of livestock that is descended from a prototypal breed stock to produce a parental breed stock. 17. Parent breed stock of pigs and poultry means a stock of livestock breeds descended from grandparental stock for production of commercial stocks. 18. Nuclear breed stock means the best stock with clear origin and origin, which is raised and selected according to a certain process in order to achieve high genetic advances for production of breeding stock. 19. Multiplication flock means a flock created by a nuclear flock for production of commercial flocks or selected for addition to a nuclear flock. 20. Commercial herd means a herd of domestic animals born from a parental breed herd or a propagating herd. 21. Livestock gene source means live animals and their breeding products bearing genetic information, which are capable of creating or participating in creating new livestock breeds. 22. livestock genealogy means a record showing the blood relationship between a livestock individual and its ancestor. 23. livestock breed products include breed animals, sperms, embryos, breeding eggs, larvae and other genetic materials extracted from livestock. 24. livestock breed and line creation means the selection and cross-breeding or use of scientific methods and technical measures to create a new livestock breed and line. 25. Animal feed means a product which is eaten or drunk by livestock in fresh, raw or processed forms, including complete mixed feed, concentrated feed, complementary feed and traditional feed. 26. complete feed means a mixture of feed ingredients that are mixed and have sufficient nutrients to sustain life and production of livestock in each growth stage or production cycle without any feed other than water. 27. concentrated feed means a mixture of feed ingredients that contain nutrients higher than the needs of domestic animals and are used for blending with other ingredients to form a complete feed mixture. 28. Supplementary feed means a single ingredient or a mixture of feed ingredients added to a feed ration to balance necessary nutrients for livestock; maintain or improve characteristics of animal feed; improve livestock's health and characteristics of animal products. 29. Traditional feed means an agricultural, aquatic or processed product commonly used in husbandry, including paddy, rice, bran, maize, potato, cassava, alcohol, beer, cassava, pineapple, molasses, straw, grass, shrimp, crab, fish and other similar products. 30. Single material means a natural or synthetic single substance used as raw material for animal feed. 31. Commercial animal feed means a type of animal feed produced for exchange or trading on the market. 32. Main substance in animal feed means a substance that determines the use and nature of animal feed. 33. Animal products include meat, eggs, milk, honey, bee wax, silkworm cocoons, swallow's nests, bones, horns, claws, internal organs; unprocessed fur and skin and other products exploited from domestic animals.
Luật Chăn nuôi@3: Principles of animal husbandry 1. Develop animal husbandry according to the value chain, effectively utilize potentials and advantages of regions to meet domestic and export demands. 2. Apply science and technology to animal husbandry to improve productivity, quality, efficiency and competitiveness of animal husbandry; ensure food safety, epidemic safety, environmental protection and resilience to climate change. 3. Preserve, utilize and develop local livestock gene sources and rare and precious livestock gene sources in a proper manner; quickly acquire the world's genetic advances; combine modern animal husbandry with traditional animal husbandry; develop animal husbandry in conformity with ecological regions. 4. Private sector involvement in animal husbandry activities; ensure harmony between state interests and interests of organizations and individuals in animal husbandry development; ensure equality between organizations, individuals and economic sectors in animal husbandry. 5. Meet international integration requirements and comply with treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party.
Luật Chăn nuôi@4: State policies on animal husbandry 1. The State invests in the following activities: a) Make statistical reports, carry out basic investigations, establish animal husbandry database, assess animal husbandry potentials and animal husbandry activities on a 5-year and annual basis; formulate animal husbandry development strategies; forecast market and reserve animal products in conformity with each period; formulate technical standards and regulations on animal husbandry; b) Preservation of precious and rare livestock gene sources and local livestock breeds. 2. In each period and depending on the state budget capacity, the State shall support the following activities : a) Research and apply science and technology, especially high technology, advanced technology and new technology to create breakthrough products in animal husbandry; import and maintain original breeds; b) Establish disease-free and biosafety breeding areas; treat breeding environment; develop good breeding practice models; relocate breeding facilities out of cities, district-level towns, commune-level towns and residential areas where breeding is prohibited; c) Build infrastructure and equipment for scientific and technological research and training institutions; develop high-quality human resources, provide vocational training in animal husbandry, and promote husbandry agriculture, especially in remote, isolated, ethnic minority, disadvantaged and extremely disadvantaged areas; d) Develop national animal husbandry products, key animal husbandry products and organic animal husbandry products; establish national animal husbandry product brands; establish concentrated slaughterhouses, wholesale markets and auctioning facilities to advertise and sell animal breeds and animal products; carry out trade promotion and develop animal husbandry product outlets; dd) Subsidies for livestock breeding and livestock breed restoration after natural disasters and epidemics as per the law. 3. The State encourages organizations and individuals to invest in activities specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article and the following activities : a) Organize animal husbandry according to farm scale and value chain; promote the roles of enterprises, industry associations and cooperatives in building value chains of animal husbandry production; b) Investment in high technology, advanced technology and new technology in slaughtering, processing and preserving animal products, technology for treating animal waste for fertilizers and other purposes; c) Investing in livestock insurance; improving capacity of testing and assessing conformity in livestock husbandry.
Luật Chăn nuôi@5: Animal husbandry development strategy 1. The strategy for nationwide animal husbandry development shall be formulated according to the 10-year cycle with 20-year orientation and in conformity with the socio-economic development strategy and the strategy for development of agriculture and rural development sector. 2. The main contents of the animal husbandry development strategy shall include viewpoints, orientations, objectives, tasks, solutions, programs, schemes and implementation. 3. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall take charge and cooperate with Ministries, ministerial agencies and People's Committees of provinces in formulating and submitting animal husbandry development strategies to the Prime Minister for approval.
Luật Chăn nuôi@6: Scientific and technological activities in animal husbandry 1. Scientific and technological activities in animal husbandry shall be given priority by the State including: a) Conduct scientific and technological researches to serve the establishment and completion of animal husbandry regulations, policies and laws; b) Conduct basic research to orient the application, research on application and transfer of high technology, advanced technology and new technology, production according to value chain in livestock production with the aim of improving productivity, quality and food safety, environmental protection and adaptation to climate change. 2. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall cooperate with the Ministry of Science and Technology in proposing and placing orders for scientific and technological tasks in conformity with the animal husbandry development strategy in each period. 3. Provincial People's Committees shall propose and order scientific and technological tasks in animal husbandry in conformity with local socio-economic development strategies in each period. 4. Competent organizations and individuals may propose and perform scientific and technological tasks in animal husbandry in accordance with regulations of this Law, Law on Science and Technology and Law on Technology Transfer.
Luật Chăn nuôi@7: Application of technology in animal husbandry 1. High technology, advanced technology, new technology and hi-tech products shall be given priority and encouraged to apply in the fields of livestock breeds, animal feeds, livestock breeding conditions, livestock product processing and animal product market. 2. Organizations and individuals applying high, advanced and new technologies in animal husbandry shall be entitled to policies specified in Article 4 of this Law and other relevant law provisions.
Luật Chăn nuôi@8: Establishment of disease-free zones for livestock production 1. Disease-free zones for animal husbandry must satisfy the requirements of animal disease-free zones according to the provisions of the Vietnam's veterinary law and international regulations; be suitable to the conditions of ecological zones, regional advantages in association with product preservation, processing and consumption. 2. The establishment of disease-free zones must be based on the socio-economic development planning and plans, the schemes for development of disease-free zones approved by the People's Committees of provinces. 3. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide criteria for and recognize disease-free zones.
Luật Chăn nuôi@9: Production cooperation and affiliation in livestock production 1. Develop forms of value chain cooperation and affiliation in animal husbandry to ensure that products meet food quality and safety standards and market demands; improve production and business efficiency and ensure the harmony of interests between parties. 2. Organizations and individuals participating in cooperation and association in animal husbandry shall sign contracts and be entitled to policies specified in Article 4 of this Law and other relevant law provisions. 3. People's Committees at all levels shall : a) Provide favorable conditions and support for the parties to negotiate, sign and fulfill their commitments in the contract for association in production and sale of products; b) Support for infrastructure construction, logistics services and trade promotion of animal products.
Luật Chăn nuôi@10: International cooperation on animal husbandry 1. Negotiate, sign and implement international agreements and treaties on animal husbandry. 2. Provide training, conduct scientific researches, transfer technologies, exchange information and experience in animal husbandry. 3. Exchange precious and rare genetic resources; exchange of livestock breeds and animal feed plant varieties with high productivity and quality and adaptability to climate change. 4. Cooperate in developing and mutually accrediting the quality certification system in animal husbandry.
Luật Chăn nuôi@11: National animal husbandry database 1. National animal husbandry database is a system of information relating to animal husbandry, which is established consistently from central to local levels, standardized for update and management by information technology. 2. National animal husbandry database includes the following contents: a) Database of legislative documents related to animal husbandry; b) Database of livestock breeds, livestock gene sources, animal feeds and livestock waste treatment products; c) Database of animal husbandry facilities, animal product processing facilities and animal product markets; d) Database of disease-free zones for livestock production; dd) Other animal husbandry database. 3. Organizations and individuals shall provide information, update and use the national animal husbandry database as per law provisions. 4. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide guidelines for update, use and management of the national animal husbandry database.
Luật Chăn nuôi@12: Prohibited acts in animal husbandry 1. Breeding in areas where breeding is prohibited in cities, district-level towns, commune-level towns, residential areas; except for raising animals for decoration purpose or in laboratories without causing environmental pollution. 2. Using banned substances in animal husbandry. 3. Using antibiotics in animal feeds other than veterinary drugs permitted for circulation in Vietnam. 4. Use of antibiotics in animal feeds for the purpose of growth stimulation. 5. Destruction and appropriation of livestock gene sources. 6. Illegal export of precious and rare livestock gene sources. 7. Import of animal products using substances banned from animal husbandry. 8. Import, trade and process animal products from animals that die of diseases or unexplained death. 9. Illegally importing, raising, releasing or using genetically modified livestock or animal products thereof. 10. Using, introducing substances, objects or pumping water into livestock or products thereof for commercial fraud purpose. 11. Collude and commit fraud acts in testing, assay, inspection, quality announcement and certification of conformity in the animal husbandry sector. 12. Discharge livestock waste which has not been treated or has been treated improperly into waste receiving places as prescribed by law on environmental protection. 13. Fraudulently declaring husbandry activities for self-seeking purposes. 14. Obstructing, sabotaging and infringing upon lawful husbandry activities.
Luật Chăn nuôi@13: Management of livestock gene sources 1. Livestock gene sources shall be managed by the State. 2. Organizations and individuals shall be responsible for participating in management of livestock gene sources as prescribed in this Law and other relevant law provisions.
Luật Chăn nuôi@14: Collection, conservation, exploitation and development of livestock gene sources 1. Organizations and individuals collecting, conserving, extracting and developing livestock gene sources shall comply with regulations of this Law and other relevant law provisions. 2. Collection, conservation, use and development of livestock gene sources shall include the following activities: a) Investigation, survey and collection of livestock gene sources; b) Assessment of livestock gene sources according to biological criteria and use value; c) Establishment of database of livestock gene sources; d) Protection and maintenance of livestock gene sources; dd) Use of livestock gene sources assessed and determined for breeding and propagation of livestock. 3. Methods for conservation of livestock gene sources shall comply with regulations of law on biodiversity. 4. The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment, the Ministry of Science and Technology and relevant Ministries and ministerial agencies in requesting the Government to promulgate regulations on collection, conservation, use and development of livestock gene sources under the management of agriculture.
Luật Chăn nuôi@15: Exchange of rare and precious livestock gene sources 1. Organizations and individuals are allowed to exchange precious and rare livestock gene sources for research, selection and creation of new livestock breeds and lines and for production and trading purposes in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development. 2. International exchange of livestock gene sources included in the List of livestock breeds prohibited from export for scientific research, exhibition and advertisement purposes must be decided by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development upon the approval granted by the Prime Minister. 3. Organizations and individuals engaged in international exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources shall comply with regulations of this Law and law on veterinary medicine, food safety, environmental protection and biodiversity of Vietnam. 4. Exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources of Vietnam to a third party must be decided by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development with the approval of the Prime Minister. 5. When conducting international exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources for dissemination in production or creation of new breeds provided by Vietnamese organizations and individuals and under the copyright of Vietnam, Vietnamese organizations and individuals shall be entitled to the copyright according to the provisions of international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and the exchange countries are signatories.
Luật Chăn nuôi@16: Article 10. Procedures for exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources 1. Any organization/individual wishing to exchange precious and rare livestock gene sources shall submit 01 application to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. 2. An application for exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources includes : a) An application form for exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources; b) Profile of precious and rare livestock gene sources in need of exchange; c) Documents related to exchange of precious and rare livestock gene sources. 3. Within 03 working days from the receipt of the application, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall inspect it. If the application is unsatisfactory, a written request shall be made to the applicant for completion. Within 30 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural development shall consider appraising it and make a decision on the basis of approval of the Prime Minister. In case of rejection, explanation shall be provided. 4. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall provide the application form specified in Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Chăn nuôi@17: Genetically modified livestock and livestock cloning 1. Genetically modified livestock are livestock whose genetic structure is changed by genetic transfer technology. 2. The research, selection, creation, experimentation, production, trading, use, release, international exchange and other activities for genetically modified livestock shall comply with the provisions of law on biodiversity. 3. Livestock cloning means the use of cloning techniques from vegetative cells to create livestock. 4. Organizations and individuals may conduct research on livestock cloning in accordance with law.
Luật Chăn nuôi@18: Requirements for livestock breeds and products thereof sold on the market 1. Applied standards have been announced. 2. The quality of the product is conformable with the applied standards. 3. Satisfy quarantine requirements as prescribed in law on veterinary medicine.
Luật Chăn nuôi@19: List of livestock breeds subject to conservation and ban from export 1. The list of livestock breeds in need of conservation includes livestock breeds with small numbers or in danger of extinction. 2. The list of livestock breeds banned from export includes precious and rare livestock breeds which are Vietnam's advantages. 3. The Government shall promulgate the List of livestock breeds subject to conservation and the List of livestock breeds banned from export; provide for the procedures for promulgation and update of the List of livestock breeds subject to conservation and the List of livestock breeds banned from export.
Luật Chăn nuôi@20: Import of livestock breeds and products thereof 1. Imported livestock breeds and products thereof must be certified in writing by competent authorities or organizations authorized by competent authorities of exporting countries of their origin, quality and use purposes for propagation and breed creation. 2. The Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development shall consider and decide to inspect legislative documents, enforcement system and conditions for production of livestock breeds and products thereof in exporting countries in accordance with regulations of Vietnam law and international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory in the following cases: a) Assessment for mutual recognition; b) Livestock breeds and products thereof imported into Vietnam for the first time; c) Discovery of risks to quality and biosafety of livestock breeds and products thereof imported into Vietnam. 3. Imported livestock breeds and products thereof must have applied standards announced and undergo quarantine in accordance with regulations of law on veterinary medicine. 4. Organizations and individuals importing breeding males, sperms and embryos of cattle must comply with the following order and procedures: 1. Importing male breeders and sperms and embryos of cattle a) The importer shall submit 01 application to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development. The application shall be made in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development. Within 03 working days from the day on which the application is received, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall inspect it. If the application is unsatisfactory, a written request shall be made to the applicant for completion. Within 15 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural development shall make a written response. In case of rejection, explanation shall be provided; b) In case the importer imports sperms and embryos for the second time of the same breeder, only a written notification is required to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; c/In case an organization or individual imports male breeders for the second time of the same breed and production establishment, it/he/she is only required to notify such in writing to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development.
Luật Chăn nuôi@21: Export and international exchange of livestock breeds and products thereof 1. Documents and quality of livestock breeds and products thereof for export shall be conformable to requirements of organizations, individuals and importing countries and Vietnam's law provisions. 2. Export or international exchange of livestock breeds and products thereof on the List of livestock breeds banned from export for scientific research, exhibition and advertisement purposes must be decided by the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development with the approval of the Prime Minister according to the following procedures: a) The exporter shall submit 01 application to the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; the application shall be made in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development. Within 03 working days from the day on which the application is received, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development shall inspect it. If the application is unsatisfactory, a written request shall be made to the applicant for completion; b) Within 30 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural development shall make decision on the basis of approval of the Prime Minister. In case of rejection, explanation shall be provided.
Luật Chăn nuôi@22: Article 10. Conditions for production and trading of livestock breeds 1. Livestock breed means individual livestock used for breeding and multiplication. 2. Organizations and individuals producing livestock breeds must satisfy the following conditions: a/To produce livestock breeds for the first time; a) The conditions specified in Article 55 of this Law; b) Apply the appropriate quality management system and announce the standards applied to livestock breeds; c) Facilities that retain original breeds and create livestock breeds and lines must employ technicians who obtain at least bachelor's degrees in animal husbandry, veterinary medicine or biology; dd) Facilities that raise parental breed stocks of swine, poultry, breeding stock and production of livestock breeds must employ technicians who are trained in husbandry, veterinary medicine and biology; e/Having breed dossiers clearly stating the names, grades, origins, quantities and economic-technical criteria. 3. Organizations and individuals trading in livestock breeds must have written announcements of applied standards of production establishments and breed dossiers specified at Point e, Clause 2 of this Article.
