Hiến pháp@56: Agencies, organizations and individuals must practice thrift, combat wastefulness and prevent and combat corruption in socio-economic activities and state management.
Hiến pháp@57: 1. The State encourages and creates conditions for organizations and individuals to create jobs for laborers. 2. The State protects the legitimate rights and interests of employees and employers and creates conditions for the building of progressive, harmonious and stable industrial relations.
Hiến pháp@58: 1. The State and society shall invest in the development of the cause of protection and care for the people's health, implement all-people health insurance, adopt priority policies on healthcare for ethnic minority people, people in mountainous areas, islands and areas with particularly difficult socio-economic conditions. 2. The State, society and families shall protect and care for the health of mothers and children and implement family planning.
Hiến pháp@59: 1. The State and society honor, reward and implement preferential policies for people with meritorious services to the country. 2. The State creates equality in terms of opportunities for citizens to enjoy social welfare, develop the social security system, adopt policies to support the elderly, the disabled, the poor and other disadvantaged people. 3. The State shall adopt policies on housing development and create conditions for people to have their own places of residence.
Hiến pháp@60: 1. The State and society shall take care of building and developing an advanced Vietnamese culture deeply imbued with national identity and absorbing the quintessence of human culture. 2. The State and society shall develop literature and arts to meet the people's diverse and healthy spiritual needs; develop mass media to meet the people's information needs and serve the cause of national construction and defense. 3. The State and society create an environment for building prosperous, progressive and happy Vietnamese families; build Vietnamese people with good health, culture, patriotism, solidarity, sense of ownership and civic responsibility.
Hiến pháp@61: 1. Educational development is the top national policy aiming to raise people's intellectual standards, develop human resources and foster talents. 2. The State shall prioritize investment in and attract other investment sources for education; care for preschool education; ensure that primary education is compulsory and the State does not collect school fees; step by step universalize secondary education; develop tertiary education and vocational education; and implement policies on scholarships and reasonable school fees. 3. The State shall prioritize the educational development in mountainous regions, islands, ethnic minority regions and regions meeting with exceptional socio-economic difficulties; prioritize the employment and development of talents; create conditions for the disabled and poor to have general education and job training.
Hiến pháp@62: 1. Science and technology development is the top national policy and plays a key role in the cause of national socio-economic development. 2. The State shall give priority to investment and encourage organizations and individuals to invest in research, development, transfer and effective application of scientific and technological achievements; ensure the right to scientific and technological research; protect intellectual property rights. 3. The State creates conditions for people to participate in and enjoy benefits from scientific and technological activities.
Hiến pháp@63: 1. The State shall adopt policies on environmental protection; management and effective and sustainable use of natural resources; conservation of nature and biodiversity; and proactive prevention and control of natural disasters and response to climate change. 2. The State encourages all activities of environmental protection, development and use of new and renewable energies. 3. Organizations and individuals that cause environmental pollution, depletion of natural resources and biodiversity reduction shall be strictly handled and have to remedy and pay compensation for damage.
Hiến pháp@64: The defense of the socialist Fatherland of Vietnam is the cause of the entire people. The State shall consolidate and strengthen the all-people national defense and people's security, with the people's armed forces as the core; promote the country's integrated strength to firmly defend the Fatherland, contributing to the maintenance of peace in the region and the world. Agencies, organizations and citizens shall have to fulfill their defense and security tasks.
Hiến pháp@65: The people's armed forces shall be absolutely loyal to the Fatherland, the People, the Party and the State, and have the tasks of protecting the independence, sovereignty, unity and territorial integrity of the Fatherland, national security and social order and safety; protecting the People, the Party, the State and the socialist regime; and joining the entire people in building the country and performing international obligations.
Hiến pháp@66: The State shall build a revolutionary, regular, elite and incrementally modern People's Army with a rational standing force, a strong and widely-supported force and a strong and widespread militia and self-defense force, which shall act as the core in performing national defense tasks.
Hiến pháp@67: The State shall build the People's Public Security Force into a revolutionary, regular, elite and gradually modern force, acting as the core in performing the tasks of protecting the national security, maintaining social order and safety, and fighting, preventing and controlling crimes.
Hiến pháp@68: The State promotes the people's patriotism and revolutionary heroism, provides defense and security education for the entire people; develops defense and security industry; ensures the equipment of the people's armed forces, combines defense and security with economy, economy with defense and security; implements the rear policy of the army; ensures the material and spiritual life of cadres, soldiers, workers and employees in line with the nature of activities of the People's Army and the People's Public Security; builds a strong people's armed forces, constantly enhancing their capacity to defend the Fatherland.
Hiến pháp@69: The National Assembly is the highest representative body of the People and the highest organ of State power of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. The National Assembly exercises the constitutional and legislative powers, decides important matters of the country and exercises supreme supervision over the activities of the State.
Hiến pháp@70: The National Assembly has the following duties and powers: 1. To make and amend the Constitution; to make laws and amend laws; 2. To exercise the supreme right to supervise the observance of the Constitution, laws and resolutions of the National Assembly; to consider working reports of the State President, the National Assembly Standing Committee, the Government, the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Procuracy, the National Election Council, the State Audit and other agencies set up by the National Assembly; 3. To decide on the basic objectives, targets, policies and tasks of national socio-economic development; 4. To decide on basic policies on national finance and monetary affairs; to prescribe, amend or abolish taxes; to decide on the division of revenues and spending tasks between the central budget and local budgets; to decide on the safety limits of national debts, public debts and government debts; to decide on state budget estimates and central budget allocations, and approve the state budget settlement; 5. To decide on the State's ethnic and religious policies; 6. To prescribe the organization and operation of the National Assembly, the State President, the Government, the People's Courts, the People's Procuracies, the National Election Council, the State Audit, the local administrations and other agencies set up by the National Assembly; 7. To elect, relieve from duty and dismiss the President, Vice President, Chairperson of the National Assembly, Vice Chairperson of the National Assembly, members of the National Assembly Standing Committee, Chairperson of the Ethnic Council, Chairpersons of Committees of the National Assembly, the Prime Minister, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy, Chairperson of the National Election Council, the State Auditor General and heads of other agencies established by the National Assembly; to approve proposals on appointment, relief from duty and dismissal of Deputy Prime Ministers, Ministers and other members of the Government, judges of the Supreme People's Court; to approve lists of members of the National Defense and Security Council and the National Election Council. After being elected, the President, the Chairperson of the National Assembly, the Prime Minister and the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall swear their fealty to the Homeland, the People and the Constitution; 8. To cast votes of confidence on persons holding positions elected or ratified by the National Assembly; 9. To decide on the establishment or abolition of ministries and ministerial-level agencies of the Government; the establishment, dissolution, merger, division and adjustment of administrative boundaries of provinces, centrally run cities and special administrative-economic units; the establishment or abolition of other agencies in accordance with the Constitution and laws; 10. To annul documents of the State President, the National Assembly Standing Committee, the Government, the Prime Minister, the Supreme People's Court and/or the Supreme People's Procuracy, which are contrary to the Constitution, laws and/or resolutions of the National Assembly; 11. Rulings on general amnesty; 12. To prescribe ranks and grades in the people's armed forces, diplomatic ranks and grades as well as other State ranks and grades; to prescribe orders, medals and State honorable titles; 13. To decide on matters of war and peace; to prescribe the state of emergency and other special measures to ensure national defense and security; 14. Decide basic foreign policies; ratify and decide to accede to or terminate treaties on war, peace, national sovereignty, membership of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in international and regional organizations, treaties on human rights, fundamental rights and obligations of citizens and other treaties in contravention of laws and resolutions of the National Assembly; 15. To decide on the referendum.
Hiến pháp@71: 1. The term of each National Assembly is five years. 2. Sixty days before the expiry of the term of the National Assembly, the new National Assembly must be completely elected. 3. In special cases, if voted for by at least two-thirds of the total number of National Assembly deputies, the National Assembly may decide to shorten or extend its term at the proposal of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly. The extension of a term of a National Assembly must not exceed twelve months, except in case of war.
Hiến pháp@72: Article 1.-The National Assembly chairman presides over the National Assembly's meetings; signs for authentication the Constitution, laws and resolutions of the National Assembly; leads the work of the National Assembly Standing Committee; organizes the implementation of the National Assembly's external relations; maintains relations with the National Assembly deputies. The National Assembly Vice Chairmen shall assist the National Assembly Chairperson in performing tasks as assigned by the latter.
Hiến pháp@73: 1. The Standing Committee of the National Assembly is the standing body of the National Assembly. 2. The Standing Committee of the National Assembly is composed of the Chairperson, Vice Chairpersons and Members. 3. The number of members of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly shall be decided by the National Assembly. Members of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly may not concurrently act as members of the Government. 4. The Standing Committee of each National Assembly shall perform its tasks and exercise its powers until the National Assembly of the new legislature elects the Standing Committee of the National Assembly.
Hiến pháp@74: The Standing Committee of the National Assembly has the following tasks and powers: 1. To organize the preparation, convening and chairing of National Assembly sessions; 2. To issue ordinances on matters assigned by the National Assembly; to explain the Constitution, laws and ordinances; 3. To oversee the implementation of the Constitution, laws and resolutions of the National Assembly, ordinances and resolutions of the National Assembly Standing Committee; to oversee activities of the Government, the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Procuracy, the State Audit and other agencies set up by the National Assembly; 4. To suspend the implementation of documents of the Government, the Prime Minister, the Supreme People's Court and/or the Supreme People's Procuracy, which are contrary to the Constitution, laws and/or resolutions of the National Assembly and submit to the National Assembly for decision the annulment of such documents at its nearest session; to annul documents of the Government, the Prime Minister, the Supreme People's Court and/or the Supreme People's Procuracy, which are contrary to ordinances and/or resolutions of the National Assembly Standing Committee; 5. To direct, regulate and coordinate activities of the Ethnic Council and Committees of the National Assembly; to guide and ensure conditions for activities of National Assembly deputies; 6. To propose the National Assembly to elect, relieve from duty or dismiss the President, the Chairperson, Vice Chairpersons of the National Assembly, members of the National Assembly Standing Committee, the Chairperson of the Ethnic Council, Chairpersons of Committees of the National Assembly, the Chairperson of the National Election Council and the State Auditor General; 7. Supervise and provide instructions on operations of the People's Council; repeal resolutions of the People's Council of a province or centrally-affiliated city which are inconsistent with the Constitution, laws and documents of superior-level state organs; dissolve the People's Council of a province or centrally-affiliated city in the event that such People's Council causes serious harm to the People's interests; 8. Decide the establishment, dissolution, merging, splitting and modification of geographical borders of administrative units under provinces and centrally-run cities; 9. To decide on the declaration of the state of war in cases where the National Assembly cannot meet and report such to the National Assembly for decision at its nearest session; 10. To decide on general or partial mobilization; to declare and cancel state of emergency nationwide or in each locality; 11. To carry out external relations of the National Assembly; 12. To approve proposals on the appointment or relief from duty of ambassadors extraordinary and plenipotentiary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; 13. Hold a referendum as decided by the National Assembly.
Hiến pháp@75: 1. The Ethnic Council has a chairman, vice chairmen and members. The Ethnic Council chairman shall be elected by the National Assembly; vice chairmen and members shall be approved by the National Assembly Standing Committee. 2. The Nationality Council shall study and propose to the National Assembly on ethnic work; exercise the right to supervise the implementation of ethnic policies, programs and plans on socio-economic development in mountainous regions and regions inhabited by ethnic minority people. 3. The Chairperson of the Ethnic Council may be invited to attend the Government's meetings to discuss the implementation of the ethnic policy. When promulgating regulations on the implementation of the ethnic policy, the Government shall collect opinions of the Ethnic Council. 4. The Ethnic Council has other tasks and powers like a Committee of the National Assembly specified in Clause 2 of Article 76.
Hiến pháp@76: 1. A Committee of the National Assembly has a Chairman, Vice Chairmen and Members. The Chairman of the Committee shall be elected by the National Assembly; Vice Chairmen and Members of the Committee shall be approved by the Standing Committee of the National Assembly. 2. The Committee of the National Assembly shall verify bills, make recommendations on laws and other projects and report them as assigned by the National Assembly or the Standing Committee of the National Assembly; exercise the supervisory power within the ambit of its tasks and powers prescribed by law; and propose matters within the scope of its operation. 3. The establishment and dissolution of Committees of the National Assembly shall be decided by the National Assembly.
Hiến pháp@77: 1. The Nationality Council and Committees of National Assembly have the right to request members of the Government, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy, the State Auditor General and relevant individuals to report, explain or provide documents on necessary issues. The requested persons shall satisfy such request. 2. The State agencies shall have to study and answer the proposals of the Nationality Council and the Committees of the National Assembly.
Hiến pháp@78: When necessary, Congress establishes Provisional Committees to study and verify a project or investigate a given issue.
Hiến pháp@79: 1. A National Assembly deputy is a person representing the will and aspirations of the people in his/her constituency and of the whole country. 2. National Assembly deputies shall maintain close contact with voters and submit to their supervision; collect and honestly report on voters' opinions and aspirations to the National Assembly and concerned agencies and organizations; observe the regime of contacting and reporting to voters on activities of deputies and the National Assembly; answer voters' requests and proposals; monitor and urge the settlement of complaints and denunciations and guide and assist the exercise of the right to complain and denounce. 3. National Assembly deputies shall disseminate and mobilize the people to implement the Constitution and law.
Hiến pháp@80: 1. National Assembly deputies may interpellate the State President, the National Assembly chairman, the Prime Minister, ministers and other members of the Government, the chief judge of the Supreme People's Court, the chairman of the Supreme People's Procuracy and the State Auditor General. 2. Interpellated persons must give their answers before the National Assembly at the session or the meeting of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly in the recess of two National Assembly sessions; in case of necessity, the National Assembly or the Standing Committee of the National Assembly may permit written answers. 3. National Assembly deputies may request agencies, organizations and individuals to supply information and documents related to the tasks of such agencies, organizations and individuals. Heads of agencies, organizations or individuals shall answer questions raised by National Assembly deputies within the law-prescribed time limit.
Hiến pháp@81: Article 10.-National Assembly deputies must not be arrested, detained, detained or prosecuted without the consent of the National Assembly or during the time the National Assembly is not in session or without the consent of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly; in cases where National Assembly deputies are caught in the act of committing offenses and held in custody, the custody agencies must immediately report such to the National Assembly or the Standing Committee of the National Assembly for consideration and decision.
Hiến pháp@82: 1. National Assembly deputies shall perform all tasks of deputies and may act as members of the Ethnic Council or Committees of the National Assembly. 2. The National Assembly Standing Committee, the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Ministers, ministers, heads of ministerial-level agencies and other state agencies shall create conditions for National Assembly deputies to perform their tasks. 3. The State shall ensure funds for the operation of National Assembly deputies.
Hiến pháp@83: 1. The National Assembly shall hold public meetings. When necessary, at the proposal of the President, the Standing Committee of the National Assembly, the Prime Minister or at least one-third of the total number of National Assembly deputies, the National Assembly may decide to hold closed meetings. 2. The National Assembly shall hold two sessions a year. At the request of the President, the Standing Committee of the National Assembly, the Prime Minister or at least one-third of the total number of National Assembly deputies, the National Assembly shall hold an extraordinary session. The Standing Committee of the National Assembly shall convene a National Assembly session. 3. The first session of the new National Assembly shall be convened within sixty days after the election of deputies to the National Assembly, opened by the chairman of the previous National Assembly and chaired until the new National Assembly elects the chairman of the National Assembly.
Hiến pháp@84: 1. The State President, the National Assembly Standing Committee, the Ethnic Council, Committees of the National Assembly, the Government, the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Procuracy, the State Audit, the Vietnam Fatherland Front Central Committee and central agencies of member organizations of the Front may submit bills before the National Assembly and draft ordinances before the National Assembly Standing Committee. 2. National Assembly deputies may present bills, draft ordinances and bills or draft ordinances to the National Assembly and its Standing Committee.
Hiến pháp@85: 1. Laws and resolutions of the National Assembly must be voted for by more than half of the total number of National Assembly deputies; in case of formulating or amending the Constitution, deciding to shorten or prolong the term of the National Assembly, or dismissing National Assembly deputies, they must be voted for by at least two-thirds of the total number of National Assembly deputies. Ordinances and resolutions of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly must be voted for by more than half of its members. 2. Laws and ordinances must be promulgated within fifteen days after they are adopted, except for cases where the State President requests the revision of such ordinances.
Hiến pháp@86: The President is the head of State and represents the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in internal and external affairs.
Hiến pháp@87: The President of the State shall be elected by the National Assembly from among its members. The President shall be responsible and shall report his work to the National Assembly. The term of office of the President shall follow the term of the National Assembly. Upon the expiry of the term of the National Assembly, the President shall continue to perform his duties until the new National Assembly elects the President.
Hiến pháp@88: The President has the following duties and powers: 1. To announce the Constitution, laws and ordinances; to propose the National Assembly Standing Committee to revise the ordinances within ten days after they are adopted; if such ordinances are still voted for by the National Assembly Standing Committee but the State President still disagrees therewith, the State President shall submit them to the National Assembly for decision at its nearest session; 2. To propose the National Assembly to elect, relieve from duty or dismiss the State Vice-President and the Prime Minister; to base itself on the National Assembly's resolutions to appoint, relieve from duty or dismiss Deputy Prime Ministers, ministers and other members of the Government; 3. To propose the National Assembly to elect, relieve from duty or dismiss the chief judge of the Supreme People's Court and the chairman of the Supreme People's Procuracy; base itself on the National Assembly's resolutions to appoint, relieve from duty or dismiss judges of the Supreme People's Court; appoint, relieve from duty or dismiss deputy-chief judges of the Supreme People's Court, judges of other courts, deputy-directors and procurators of the Supreme People's Procuracy; decide on special amnesty; base itself on the National Assembly's resolutions to announce decisions on general amnesty; 4. To decide on the award of orders, medals, State prizes and State honorable titles; to decide on naturalization in Vietnam, renunciation of Vietnamese nationality, restoration of Vietnamese nationality or deprivation of Vietnamese nationality; 5. To command the people's armed forces, to hold the post of chairman of the National Defense and Security Council; to decide on the bestowal, promotion, demotion or deprivation of the general, admiral, deputy admiral or naval admiral ranks; to appoint, relieve from duty or dismiss the chief of the General Staff, the director of the General Political Department of the Vietnam People's Army; to base himself/herself on resolutions of the National Assembly or the National Assembly Standing Committee to announce or annul decisions declaring the state of war; to base himself/herself on resolutions of the National Assembly Standing Committee to order the general mobilization or partial mobilization, announce or abolish the state of emergency; in cases where the National Assembly Standing Committee cannot meet, to announce or abolish the state of emergency throughout the country or in each locality; 6. To receive ambassadors extraordinary and plenipotentiary of foreign countries; to base themselves on resolutions of the National Assembly Standing Committee to appoint and dismiss ambassadors extraordinary and plenipotentiary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; to bestow the rank and level of ambassadors; to decide on negotiation and signing of treaties in the name of the State; to submit to the National Assembly for ratification or decision on accession to or termination of treaties specified in Clause 14, Article 70; to decide on ratification, accession to or termination of other treaties in the name of the State.
Hiến pháp@89: 1. The National Defense and Security Council has a Chairperson, Vice Chairpersons and Members. The list of members of the National Defense and Security Council shall be submitted by the President to the National Assembly for approval. The National Defence and Security Council shall work on a collective basis and make decisions by a majority. 2. The National Defense and Security Council shall submit to the National Assembly for decision the state of war. In case the National Assembly cannot convene a meeting, it shall submit to the Standing Committee of the National Assembly for decision; mobilize all forces and capabilities of the country to defend the Homeland; perform special tasks and exercise special powers assigned by the National Assembly in case of war; and decide on the participation of people's armed forces in activities contributing to the defense of peace in the region and the world.
Hiến pháp@90: The State President has the right to attend meetings of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly and meetings of the Government. The State President has the right to request the Government to meet to discuss matters which the State President deems necessary for the performance of his tasks and the exercise of his powers.
Hiến pháp@91: The President shall issue orders and decisions to perform his duties and exercise his powers.
Hiến pháp@92: The Vice-President shall be elected by the National Assembly from among its deputies. The State Vice-President assists the State President in performing his/her tasks and may be authorized by the State President to perform a number of tasks on his/her behalf.
Hiến pháp@93: When the President is unable to work for a long time, the Vice President shall retain the power of President. In case of vacancy of the State President, the Vice-President shall retain the right to the State President until the National Assembly elects a new President.
Hiến pháp@94: The Government is the highest State administrative body of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, exercises the executive power and acts as the executive body of the National Assembly. The Government shall take responsibility before the National Assembly and report on its work to the National Assembly, the National Assembly Standing Committee and the President.
Hiến pháp@95: 1. The Government consists of the Prime Minister, Deputy Prime Ministers, Ministers and Heads of ministerial-level agencies. The structure and number of the Government's members shall be decided by the National Assembly. The Government shall work according to the collective regime and make decisions by majority. 2. The Prime Minister is the head of the Government, responsible to the National Assembly for the Government's activities and assigned tasks; and reporting on the Government's and the Prime Minister's work to the National Assembly, the National Assembly Standing Committee and the President. 3. A Deputy Prime Minister shall assist the Prime Minister in performing tasks assigned by the Prime Minister and take responsibility before the Prime Minister for his assigned tasks. When the Prime Minister is absent, a Deputy Prime Minister shall be authorized by the Prime Minister to lead the Government's work on behalf of the Prime Minister. 4. Ministers and heads of ministerial-level agencies shall take personal responsibility before the Prime Minister, the Government and the National Assembly for the sectors and fields under their charge, and together with other cabinet members take collective responsibility for the Government's activities.
Hiến pháp@96: The Government has the following tasks and powers: 1. Organize the implementation of the Constitution, laws and resolutions of the National Assembly, ordinances and resolutions of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly, orders and decisions of the President; 2. To propose and formulate policies for submission to the National Assembly and its Standing Committee for decision or decide according to its competence to perform the tasks and exercise the powers specified in this Article; to submit bills, state budget projects and other projects before the National Assembly; to submit draft ordinances before the National Assembly's Standing Committee; 3. Carry out the consistent management of economy, culture, society, education, healthcare, science, technology, environment, information, communications, external affairs, national defense and security, social order and safety; execute general or local mobilization orders, orders to declare emergency state and other necessary measures to protect the Homeland, life and property of the People; 4. To submit to the National Assembly for decision the establishment or abolition of ministries and ministerial-level agencies; the establishment, dissolution, merger, division or adjustment of administrative boundaries of provinces, centrally run cities and special administrative-economic units; to submit to the National Assembly Standing Committee for decision the establishment, dissolution, merger, division or adjustment of administrative boundaries of administrative units under provinces or centrally run cities; 5. To perform the unified management of the national administration; to manage cadres, civil servants, public employees and public duties in state agencies; to organize the inspection, examination and settlement of complaints and denunciations, and prevent and combat bureaucracy and corruption in the state apparatus; to lead the work of ministries, ministerial-level agencies, government-attached agencies and People's Committees at all levels; to guide and examine People's Councils in implementing documents of superior state agencies; to create conditions for People's Councils to perform tasks and exercise powers prescribed by law; 6. To protect the rights and interests of the State and society, human rights and civic rights; to ensure social order and safety; 7. To organize the negotiation and signing of international agreements in the name of the State under the State President's authorization; to decide the signing, accession to, approval or termination of international agreements in the name of the Government, except for international agreements to be submitted to the National Assembly for ratification as provided for in Clause 14, Article 70; to protect the interests of the State and legitimate interests of Vietnamese organizations and citizens in foreign countries; 8. Cooperate with the Central Committee of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front and central bodies of socio-political organizations in performing their duties and exercising their powers.
Hiến pháp@97: The Government's term shall coincide with the term of the National Assembly. Upon the expiry of the National Assembly's term, the Government shall continue performing its tasks till the new National Assembly establishes the Government.
Hiến pháp@98: The Prime Minister shall be elected by the National Assembly from among its deputies. The Prime Minister has the following tasks and powers : 1. To lead the work of the Government; to lead the formulation of policies and the organization of law enforcement; 2. To lead and take responsibility for the operation of the State administrative system from the central to local level, ensuring the unity and smoothness of the national administration; 3. To submit to the National Assembly for approval proposals on appointment, relief from duty and dismissal of Deputy Prime Ministers, Ministers and other Members of Government; appointment, relief from duty and dismissal of deputy ministers and holders of equivalent posts in ministries and ministerial-level agencies; and approval of the election, relief from duty and decision on transfer and dismissal of chairpersons and vice chairpersons of provincial-level People's Committees; 4. Suspend the implementation or annul documents of Ministers, Heads of Ministry-level agencies, People's Committees and Chairpersons of People's Committees of centrally-affiliated cities and provinces which are inconsistent with the Constitution, laws and documents of superior regulatory agencies; suspend the implementation of resolutions of People's Councils of centrally-affiliated cities and provinces which are inconsistent with the Constitution, laws and documents of superior regulatory agencies, and concurrently request the National Assembly Standing Committee to annul them; 5. To decide on and direct the negotiation of, and direct the signing of, and accession to, treaties falling under the tasks and powers of the Government; to organize the implementation of treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party; 6. To report to the People through the mass media on important issues falling under the settling competence of the Government and the Prime Minister.
Hiến pháp@99: 1. Ministers and heads of ministerial-level agencies are cabinet members and heads of ministries and ministerial-level agencies, leading the work of ministries and ministerial-level agencies; and responsible for state management of their assigned sectors and fields; and organizing and monitoring the implementation of laws related to sectors and fields nationwide. 2. Ministers and heads of ministerial-level agencies shall report on their work to the Government and Prime Minister; and report to the People on important issues under their management.
Hiến pháp@100: The Government, the Prime Minister, ministers and heads of ministerial-level agencies shall promulgate legal documents to perform their tasks and exercise their powers, inspect the implementation of such documents and handle unlawful documents according to law provisions.
Hiến pháp@101: The Chairman of the Vietnam Fatherland Front Central Committee and the heads of the central bodies of socio-political organizations shall be invited to attend the Government's meetings on relevant matters.
Hiến pháp@102: 1. People's courts are adjudicating bodies of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, exercising the judicial power. 2. People's courts include the Supreme People's Court and other courts prescribed by law. 3. People's courts have the tasks of protecting justice, human rights, civil rights, the socialist regime, the interests of the State, and the legitimate rights and interests of organizations and individuals.
Hiến pháp@103: 1. The first-instance trial conducted by a People's Court shall be participated by assessors, except for the case of adjudication according to simplified procedures. 2. Judges and lay assessors shall conduct trials independently and only abide by law; agencies, organizations and individuals are strictly prohibited from intervening in the trial by judges and lay assessors. 3. People's courts shall conduct trials publicly. In special cases where it is necessary to keep state secrets, fine national customs and practices, protect minors or keep private secrets at the legitimate request of involved parties, people's courts may conduct trials behind closed doors. 4. People's courts shall conduct trials collectively and make decisions by majority, except cases of trial according to summary procedures. 5. The principle of oral argument in adjudication is ensured. 6. The first-instance and appellate trial regimes shall be ensured. 7. The right of suspects and defendants to defend and the right to protect legitimate interests of involved parties shall be guaranteed.
Hiến pháp@104: 1. The Supreme People's Court is the highest adjudicating body of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. The Supreme People's Court shall supervise the adjudication of other Courts, except for cases prescribed by law. 3. The Supreme People's Court shall review adjudicating practices and ensure uniform application of law in adjudication.
Hiến pháp@105: 1. The term of office of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall coincide with the term of the National Assembly. The appointment, relief from duty, dismissal and term of office of Chief Justices of other courts shall be prescribed by law. 2. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall take responsibility for and report on his/her work to the National Assembly; when the National Assembly is in recess, he/she shall take responsibility for and report on his/her work to the National Assembly Standing Committee and the President. The regime of reporting on work of chief justices of other courts is prescribed by law. 3. The appointment, approval, relief from duty, dismissal and term of office of judges and the election and term of assessors shall be prescribed by law.
Hiến pháp@106: Article 10.-The judgments and decisions of the People's Courts which take legal effect must be respected by agencies, organizations and individuals; the concerned agencies, organizations and individuals must strictly abide by them.
Hiến pháp@107: 1. People's procuracies shall exercise the power to prosecute and supervise judicial activities. 2. The People's Procuracy includes the Supreme People's Procuracy and other procuracies prescribed by law. 3. People's procuracies have the tasks of protecting law, human rights, citizens' rights, the socialist regime, the interests of the State, the legitimate rights and interests of organizations and individuals, contributing to ensuring the strict and uniform observance of law.
Hiến pháp@108: 1. The term of office of the Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall coincide with the term of the National Assembly. The appointment, relief from duty, dismissal and term of office of the Chief Procurators of other procuracies and procurators shall be prescribed by law. 2. The Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall take responsibility for and report on his/her work to the National Assembly; when the National Assembly is in recess, he/she shall take responsibility for and report on his/her work to the National Assembly Standing Committee and the President. The reporting regime applicable to heads of other procuracies is provided for by law.
Hiến pháp@109: 1. The People's Procuracies shall be led by their directors. The directors of the subordinate People's Procuracies shall submit to the leadership of the directors of the superior People's Procuracies. The directors of the subordinate People's Procuracies shall submit to the unified leadership of the chairman of the Supreme People's Procuracy. 2. When exercising the power to prosecute and supervise judicial activities, procurators shall abide by law and submit to the direction of chief procurators of people's procuracies.
Hiến pháp@110: 1. Administrative units of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam are classified as follows: The country is divided into provinces and centrally run cities; Provinces shall be divided into districts, towns and provincial cities; centrally run cities shall be divided into urban districts, rural districts, towns and equivalent administrative units; A district is divided into communes and townships; a provincial town and city are divided into wards and communes; an urban district is divided into wards. The special administrative - economic unit is established by the National Assembly. 2. The establishment, dissolution, merging, splitting and modification of geographical borders of administrative divisions must be subject to the consultation of local people and conform to the order and procedures prescribed by laws.
Hiến pháp@111: 1. Local governments shall be organized in administrative units of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. The local government level shall be composed of the People's Council and the People's Committee which are organized in conformity with the characteristics of rural areas, urban areas, islands and special administrative-economic units as prescribed by law.
Hiến pháp@112: 1. Local governments shall organize and ensure the implementation of the Constitution and legislation in their localities; decide on local issues prescribed by law; and submit to the inspection and supervision of superior-level state organs. 2. Duties and powers of a local government shall be determined on the basis of the division of powers between central and local regulatory authorities and of each level of the local government. 3. In case of necessity, local governments shall be assigned to perform certain tasks of superior regulatory agencies provided that conditions for such performance are satisfied.
Hiến pháp@113: 1. The People's Council is the local authority that represents the will, aspirations and mastery of the People, is elected by the local People and is held accountable to the local People and superior regulatory agencies. 2. The People's Council shall decide local issues prescribed by law; supervise the compliance with the Constitution and laws of the province and the implementation of resolutions of the People's Council.
Hiến pháp@114: 1. The People's Committees at the local administration level elected by the People's Councils of the same level are executive bodies of the People's Councils and State administrative bodies in the localities, being answerable to the People's Councils and the superior State administrative bodies. 2. The People's Committees shall organize the implementation of the Constitution and laws in their respective localities; organize the implementation of resolutions of the People's Councils and perform tasks assigned by superior State agencies. Article 115. - 1. Delegates of the People's Council shall represent the will and aspirations of the local people; maintain close contact with the electorate, submit to the supervision of the electorate, comply with the regulations on contact, report to the electorate on their activities and those of the People's Council, respond to the requests and recommendations of the electorate; consider and expedite the settlement of complaints and denunciations. Delegates of the People's Council shall be responsible for encouraging the people to implement the Constitution, laws, policies of the State, resolutions of the People's Council, and encouraging the people to participate in the state management. 2. Delegates of the People's Council shall have the right to question the President of the People's Committee, other members of the People's Committee, the Chief Justice of the People's Court, the Head of the People's Procuracy and the Head of the agency under the People's Committee. Questioned persons must give their answers before the People's Council. Delegates of the People's Council shall have the right to make recommendations to state organs, organizations and units at localities. The head of these organs, organizations and units shall be responsible for receiving delegates, considering and resolving recommendations of delegates. Article 116. - 1. The People's Councils and People's Committees shall observe the regime of notifying the Vietnamese Fatherland Front and mass organizations of the local situation, listen to the opinions and proposals of these organizations on the building of administration and socio-economic development in the localities; coordinate with the Vietnamese Fatherland Front and mass organizations in mobilizing the People together with the State to perform the socio-economic, defense and security tasks in the localities. 2. The president of the Vietnam Fatherland Front Committee and the heads of the local socio-political organizations shall be invited to attend sessions of the People's Councils and to attend conferences of the People's Committees of the same level when relevant issues are discussed.
Hiến pháp@117: 1. National Election Commission is an agency established by the National Assembly, which is responsible for organizing election of deputies to the National Assembly; directing and providing guidance on election of deputies to the People's Councils. 2. National Election Commission shall be composed of the President, Vice Presidents and Members. 3. Organizational structure, specific tasks and powers of National Election Commission and number of members of National Election Commission shall be prescribed by law.
Hiến pháp@118: 1. State Audit Office of Vietnam is an agency established by the National Assembly, operates independently and only in accordance with law, and audits the management and use of finance and public property. 2. State Auditor General is the head of SAV elected by the National Assembly. The term of office of State Auditor General is prescribed by law. State Auditor General shall take responsibility and report audit results and work reports to the National Assembly; take responsibility and report on work reports to the Standing Committee of the National Assembly during the National Assembly's recess. 3. The organization, tasks, and entitlements of SAV shall comply with law.
Hiến pháp@119: 1. The Constitution is the fundamental law of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and has the highest legal effect. All other legal documents must conform to the Constitution. All violations of the Constitution shall be dealt with. 2. The National Assembly, agencies of the National Assembly, the President, the Government, People's Courts, People's Procuracies, other agencies of the State and the entire People shall protect the Constitution. The mechanism for protecting the Constitution is determined by law.
Hiến pháp@120: 1. The President, Standing Committee of the National Assembly, the Government or at least one-third of total number of National Assembly deputies are entitled to propose the formulation or amendment of the Constitution. The National Assembly shall decide the formulation or amendment of the Constitution when it is voted for by at least two-thirds of total number of National Assembly deputies. 2. The National Assembly shall establish a Constitution Drafting Committee. The composition, number of members, tasks and powers of the Constitution Drafting Committee shall be decided by the National Assembly at the proposal of the National Assembly Standing Committee. 3. The Committee for drafting the Constitution shall draft and collect opinions of the People and submit them to the National Assembly. 4. The Constitution shall be adopted when it is voted for by at least two-thirds of the total number of National Assembly deputies. The referendum on the Constitution shall be decided by the National Assembly. 5. The time limit for promulgation and effective date of the Constitution shall be decided by the National Assembly. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This Constitution was passed on November 28,2013, by the XIIIth National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam at its 6th session. - THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Sinh Hung
Luật Du lịch@1: Scope This Law provides for tourism resources, tourism product development and tourism activities; rights and obligations of tourists, tourism business organizations and individuals, other agencies, organizations and individuals, and residential communities involved in tourism-related activities; state management of tourism.
Luật Du lịch@2: Subjects of application 1. Vietnamese agencies, organizations and individuals conducting tourist activities in the Vietnamese territory and overseas. 2. Foreign organizations and individuals conducting tourist activities in the Vietnamese territory. 3. Tourism authorities, other authorities, organizations, individuals and residential communities involved in tourism activities.
Luật Du lịch@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Tourism means activities related to a person's trip outside his/her permanent residence place for not more than one consecutive year to meet his/her needs for sightseeing, convalescence, entertainment, exploration of tourist resources or for other lawful purposes. 2. Tourists are those who travel or travel in combination, except for those who go to school or work to earn incomes in their destination places. 3. Tourism activities mean activities of tourists, organizations and individuals doing tourism business and agencies, organizations, individuals and population communities related to tourism. 4. tourism resources refer to natural landscapes, natural elements and cultural values that form the basis for the formation of tourism products, tourist attractions and tourist attractions in order to meet tourism demands. Tourism resources include natural tourism resources and cultural tourism resources. 5. Tourist products mean a combination of services on the basis of exploiting the value of tourist resources to satisfy tourists' demands. 6. Tourist area means an area with advantages in tourism resources, which is planned and invested for development in order to meet diversified demands of tourists. Tourist areas include provincial-level tourist areas and national tourist areas. 7. Tourist attraction means a place where tourist resources are invested in and exploited for tourists. 8. tour program means a document showing a predetermined schedule, services and prices for a tourist's trip from the departure point to the end point of the trip. 9. tour operator business means the formulation, sale and implementation of a part or the whole tour program for tourists. 10. tour guiding means the provision of information, connection to services, provision of guidance and assistance for tourists to use services according to the tour program. 11. Tourist guides are those who are granted cards for tourist guiding practice. 12. Tourist accommodation establishment means a place providing services to meet tourists' accommodation needs. 13. Tourism promotion means market research, propagation, promotion and mobilization activities to seek and promote opportunities for development and attraction of tourists. 14. sustainable tourism development means tourism development that simultaneously meets socio-economic and environmental requirements, ensures harmony of interests of entities participating in tourism activities without harming the ability to meet future tourism demands. 15. Community tourism means a form of tourism developed on the basis of cultural values of communities, managed, operated and benefited by communities. 16. Eco-tourism means a form of tourism based on nature, associated with local cultural identities, with the participation of population communities, in combination with education on environmental protection. 17. cultural tourism means a form of tourism developed on the basis of utilizing cultural values, contributing to preserving and promoting traditional cultural values and celebrating new cultural values of mankind. 18. Tourist environment means the natural and social environment where tourist activities take place.
Luật Du lịch@4: Principles of tourism development 1. To develop tourism in a sustainable manner under strategies, master plans and plans with focuses and priorities. 2. To develop tourism in association with conservation and promotion of national cultural heritage values and natural resources, to tap local advantages and promote regional linkage. 3. Ensure national sovereignty, national defense and security, social order and safety, expand external relations and international integration, and promote the image of Vietnam and its people. 4. Ensure national interests, community interests, lawful rights and interests of tourists, organizations and individuals doing tourism business. 5. To develop both domestic and international tourism; to respect and treat tourists equally.
Luật Du lịch@5: Tourism development policies 1. The State shall adopt policies to mobilize all resources for tourism development in order to ensure that tourism will become the spearhead industry of the country. 2. Organizations and individuals doing tourism business shall enjoy the highest level of investment incentives and supports when the State promulgates and applies policies on investment incentives and supports. 3. The State shall prioritize the allocation of funds for the following activities : a) Investigation, assessment, protection, improvement and development of tourism resource values; b) Formulating tourism planning; c) Tourism promotion, building of national and local tourism trademarks; d/Building infrastructure in service of tourism development. 4. The State shall adopt policies to encourage and support the following activities : a) Invest in development of high-quality tourism infrastructure and services; b) Research and orientate development of tourism products; c) Training and development of tourism human resources; d) Investment in development of new tourism products that have positive effects on the environment and attract the participation of residential communities; investment in development of sea and island tourism products, eco-tourism, community-based tourism, cultural tourism and other particular tourism products; dd) Application of modern science and technology to tourism management and development; e) Tourism development in areas with tourism potential; employment of tourism human resources in localities; g) Investment in the formation of large tourism service complexes; duty-free shops and shopping centers serving tourists. 5. The State shall adopt policies to facilitate travel, residence, exit and entry procedures, customs, value-added tax refund and ensure other lawful rights and interests of tourists.
Luật Du lịch@6: Participation of residential communities in tourism development 1. The community has the right to participate in and enjoy lawful benefits from tourism activities; has the responsibility to protect tourism resources and local cultural identity; maintain security, social order and safety and protect the environment. 2. The community shall be given conditions to invest in tourism development, restore and promote the types of folklore and arts, traditional crafts, and produce local goods serving tourists, contributing to improving the material and spiritual life of local people.
Luật Du lịch@7: Tourism socio-professional organizations 1. Socio-professional organizations in tourism shall be established and operate in accordance with the law on associations. 2. Socio-professional organizations in tourism shall have the following responsibilities: a) Comply with law and protect lawful rights and interests of members; b) Participate in formulating, disseminating, educating and supervising the implementation of regulations of law and policies on tourism; c) Participate in tourism promotion, provide training in tourism; assess, provide consultancy and assess professional standards and service quality for enterprises and employees in tourism industry; create a healthy business environment for members; mobilize social resources to carry out tourism activities as prescribed by law; d) Organize the implementation of rules of professional ethics, encourage members doing tourism business to ensure service quality; e/Detecting and proposing competent state agencies to handle violations of the law on tourism and environmental protection.
Luật Du lịch@8: Protection of the tourist environment 1. The tourist environment must be protected, embellished and developed toward green, clean, beautiful, security, safety, health and civilization. 2. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, promulgate regulations to protect, embellish and develop the tourist environment. 3. Local administrations at all levels shall take measures to protect, embellish and develop the tourist environment suitable to local practical conditions. 4. Organizations and individuals doing tourist business shall have to collect and treat wastes discharged from their business activities; overcome negative impacts caused by their activities on the environment; take measures to prevent and combat social evils in their business activities. 5. Tourists, residential communities and other organizations and individuals shall protect and preserve landscapes, the environment, cultural identities, customs and practices of the nation; and behave in a civilized and polite manner in order to raise the image of the country, people and tourism of Vietnam.
Luật Du lịch@9: Prohibited acts in tourism 1. Cause harm to national sovereignty and interests, national defense and security, social order and safety, cultural traditions, ethics and fine customs and practices of the nation. 2. Taking advantage of tourist activities to illegally take people from Vietnam abroad or vice versa. 3. Damage tourism resources and environment. 4. Discrimination against tourists, illegal profit from tourists; competition for tourists, entice tourists to buy goods and services. 5. Running a tourism business without satisfying business conditions, having no business license or maintaining business conditions during its operation as prescribed in this Law and other relevant regulations of law. 6. Using the license for tour operator business of another tour operator enterprise or allowing another organization or individual to use the license for tour operator business of the enterprise for business. 7. Providing tour guiding when failing to fully meet the conditions for such practice. 8. Advertise the types and classes of tourist accommodation establishments which have been recognized by competent authorities; advertise the types and classes of tourist accommodation establishments which have not been recognized by competent authorities. 9. Other prohibited acts prescribed by other relevant laws.
Luật Du lịch@10: Types of tourists 1. Tourists include domestic tourists, inbound tourists and outbound tourists. 2. Domestic tourists mean Vietnamese citizens and foreigners residing in Vietnam who travel within the Vietnamese territory. 3. International tourists to Vietnam mean foreigners and overseas Vietnamese who enter Vietnam for tourism. 4. Guest to foreign countries means Vietnamese citizens and foreigners residing in Vietnam who travel abroad.
Luật Du lịch@11: Rights of tourists 1. To use tourist services provided by tourist business organizations and individuals or to travel by themselves. 2. To request organizations and individuals doing tourism business to supply information on tourist programs, services and destinations under the signed contracts. 3. To be provided with favorable conditions for exit, entry, transit, customs, stay and residence and travel in the Vietnamese territory in accordance with law and treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. 4. Have their legitimate rights and interests secured under the contract signed with the organization or individual doing tourism business or providing tourism services. 5. Receive equal treatment; be guaranteed safety of life, health and property when using tourism services; have their honor and dignity respected; and be rescued in case of emergency. 6. To lodge complaints and denunciations about or initiate lawsuits against acts of violating the tourist legislation. 7. To propose to organizations and individuals managing tourist resorts, tourist sites, tourist service-providing establishments and competent State agencies matters related to tourist activities. 8. To be compensated for damage according to law provisions.
Luật Du lịch@12: Article 11. Obligations of tourists 1. Comply with the laws of Vietnam and the host country or territory; behave in a civilized manner, respect local customs, practices and cultural identities, protect and preserve tourism resources and environment; do not harm national image and cultural traditions of Vietnam. 2. Comply with the regulations of the tourist resorts, tourist attractions, tourist service providers. 3. To pay service charges under contracts, charges, fees and other revenues as prescribed by law. 4. To pay compensation for damage in accordance with the civil law.
Luật Du lịch@13: Ensuring safety for tourists 1. The competent authority shall, within the scope of its duties and powers, take measures to ensure security, social order and safety in the tourist resort or tourist attraction. 2. The manager of the tourist resort or tourist attraction shall take measures to prevent risks and organize a section to protect, rescue and salvage tourists. 3. Organizations and individuals doing tourism business shall warn tourists of danger; promptly inform and guide tourists in case of emergency; take necessary measures and cooperate with relevant agencies, organizations and individuals in rescuing tourists.
Luật Du lịch@14: Settlement of complaints from tourists 1. Organizations and individuals doing tourism business and managing tourist resorts and tourist spots shall organize the receipt and timely settlement of petitions of tourists under their management. 2. People's Committees at all levels shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, receive and settle complaints of tourists in their localities. 3. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall, within the ambit of its tasks and powers, receive and settle or coordinate with competent state agencies in settling complaints of tourists.
Luật Du lịch@15: Types of tourism resources 1. Natural tourism resources include natural landscapes, geological, geomorphological, climatic, hydrological, ecological and other natural elements which may be used for tourism purposes. 2. Cultural tourism resources include historical-cultural relics, revolutionary, archaeological and architectural relics; traditional cultural values, festivals, folk art and other cultural values; works of creative human labor which may be used for tourist purposes.
Luật Du lịch@16: Tourism resource survey 1. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall take charge and cooperate with the People's Committee of the province and relevant regulatory bodies in surveying, assessing and classifying tourism resources as the basis for formulating tourism planning; managing, using and promoting the value of tourism resources and developing tourism products. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Du lịch@17: Responsibilities for management, protection and exploitation of tourism resources 1. The State shall adopt policies to manage, protect, embellish, rationally exploit and promote the value of tourism resources nationwide for sustainable tourism development. 2. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall take charge and cooperate with Ministries, ministerial agencies and provincial People's Committees in management, protection, improvement, reasonable exploitation and promotion of tourism resources. 3. Agencies, organizations, individuals and population communities managing tourist resources shall protect, invest in and embellish tourist resources, create favorable conditions for tourists to visit and enjoy the value of tourist resources; coordinate with competent state management agencies in charge of tourism in protecting and exploiting tourist resources for other economic purposes. 4. Tourists, organizations and individuals doing tourism business and population communities shall protect tourism resources.
Luật Du lịch@18: Building and developing tourism products 1. Organizations and individuals are entitled to create, develop and trade in tourism products to meet tourists' demands and in accordance with regulations of law. 2. The Government shall adopt policies to support the development of key tourist products for each region and nationwide in each period, meeting the market demand on the basis of assessing and classifying tourist resources. 3. The Government shall provide for measures to ensure safety for tourists with respect to tourism products that may threaten tourists' health and life.
Luật Du lịch@19: Community tourism development 1. Individuals and households developing community-based tourism are entitled to incentives and incentives to provide accommodation and food services; guide tourists to visit and experience culture and lifestyle in the community; produce goods and traditional handicrafts and other services for tourists. 2. The People's Committee of the province shall conduct research and survey to select locations with potential for community tourism development; adopt policies on provision of necessary initial equipment and training in knowledge and skills for tourists to individuals and households in the community providing tourism services; and support the promotion of community tourism products. 3. The People's Committee of the commune where community-based tourism is developed shall propagate, disseminate and raise the community's awareness; take charge of formulating the community's commitment to preserve cultural identity, protect the environment and behave civilizedly towards tourists. 4. Organizations and individuals developing community-based tourism shall respect culture and lifestyle and share benefits from tourism activities with the community.
Luật Du lịch@20: Principles of formulating tourism planning 1. Being compatible with the national socio-economic development, defense and security strategies and plannings; the tourism development strategy and other plannings already approved by competent State bodies in each period. 2. To rationally and effectively exploit and use tourism resources and preserve historical-cultural relics and natural heritages toward sustainable development in association with environmental protection and response to climate change. 3. Ensure connectivity between localities in the region and between regions nationwide; make the most of existing infrastructure; make the best use of potentials and advantages of each region and locality to develop tourism products. 4. To minimize negative impacts of tourism development on the socio-economic development and environment. 5. Ensure the participation of organizations, residential communities and individuals in the formulation of planning; harmonize the interests of the State and the interests of the community, and the interests of the region and the local government. 6. Ensure scientificity and application of modern technologies during formulation of planning; satisfy standards and regulations and meet requirements for socio-economic development and international integration of the country.
Luật Du lịch@21: Contents of tourism planning 1. Determining the position, role and advantages of tourism in national, regional and local socio-economic development. 2. Analysis and assessment of potentials and current conditions of tourism resources and environment, tourism market; possibilities for attracting investment and resources for tourism development. 3. Viewpoints and objectives for tourism development; forecast of targets and justification of tourism development plans. 4. Orientations for organization of tourism space and tourism technical infrastructure system. 5. Orientations for development of tourism products and tourism markets. 6. Orientations for investment in tourism development; list of areas and projects given priority and investment capital. 7. To set orientations for protecting tourist resources and environment in accordance with law. 8. Propose policies and solutions for management and development of tourism according to the planning.
Luật Du lịch@22: Formulation, management and implementation of tourism planning 1. The formulation of tourism planning must comply with the principles and contents of formulation of tourism planning specified in Articles 20 and 21 of this Law and other relevant regulations of law. 2. The Government shall provide for the formulation, management and implementation of tourism planning.
Luật Du lịch@23: Conditions for recognition of tourist attractions 1. Conditions for recognition of a tourist attraction include : a) Tourism resources and boundaries are determined; b) Having necessary infrastructure and services to ensure tourist services; c) The center must conform to requirements concerning security, social order and safety, and environmental protection in accordance with laws. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Du lịch@24: Application and procedures for recognition of tourist attractions 1. An application for recognition of a tourist attraction includes : a) An application form for recognition of the tourist attraction according to the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A description of the conditions for recognition of the tourist attraction prescribed in Clause 1 Article 23 of this Law. 2. Procedures for and power to request recognition of a tourist attraction are specified as follows: a) The tourist attraction is recognized as a tourist attraction by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a) The owner or manager of the tourist attraction shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority affiliated to the People's Committee of the province (hereinafter referred to as tourism authority of the province) of the area where the tourist attraction is located; b) Within 20 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the tourism authority of the province shall appraise it and submit it to the People's Committee of the province; c) Within 10 days from the day on which the appraisal result is received, the People's Committee of the province shall decide to recognize the tourist attraction; in case of refusal, a written response stating reasons thereof must be given. 3. The People's Committee of the province shall revoke the decision on recognition of a tourist attraction if it no longer satisfies the conditions specified in Clause 1 Article 23 of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@25: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals managing tourist attractions 1. The manager of a tourist attraction has the following rights: a) Investment, exploitation and protection of tourism resources; b) Promulgate regulations; provide services for tourists; c) Provide tour guide services; provide for and manage the employment of tour guides within its management; d) Collect fees as prescribed by law. 2. The manager of a tourist attraction has the following obligations : a) The conditions specified in Clause 1 Article 23 of this Law are satisfied; b) Provide favorable conditions for tourists to visit the tourist attraction; c) Manage and supervise tourism services within its scope of management; d) Ensure safety for tourists, social order and safety, and environmental protection at tourist attractions; dd) Receive and promptly handle complaints of tourists within their management.
Luật Du lịch@26: Conditions for recognition of a tourist resort 1. Conditions for recognition of a provincial-level tourism area include: 1. Conditions for recognition of a provincial-level tourism area include : a) Tourism resources with advantages in natural landscapes or cultural values and boundaries; b) Having infrastructure, material and technical foundations and services meeting tourists accommodation, food and drink demands and other demands; c) Having connection with the national traffic and telecommunication infrastructure system; d) The center must conform to requirements concerning security, social order and safety, and environmental protection in accordance with laws. 2. Conditions for recognition of a national tourism area include: a) The national tourism area is recognized as a national tourism area by the competent authority; a) Have diverse and particularly attractive tourism resources with advantages in natural landscapes or cultural values and definite boundaries; b) The tourist attraction is on the list of areas with potential for development of national tourism areas approved by a competent authority; c) Having high-quality infrastructure, technical facilities and services, meeting tourists' accommodation, food and other demands; d) The conditions specified in Point c and Point d Clause 1 of this Article. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Du lịch@27: Application and procedures for recognition of a provincial tourism area 1. An application for recognition of a provincial tourism area includes : a) An application form for recognition of a provincial tourism area using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A description of eligibility to be recognized as a provincial tourism area as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 26 of this Law. 2. Procedures for recognition of a provincial tourism area are specified as follows: a) The provincial tourism area is established according to the regulations on tourism area management and management; a) The People's Committee of the district or the tourism area management body shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority of the province where the tourism area is located; b) Within 45 days from the receipt of the satisfactory application, the tourism authority of the province shall appraise it and submit it to the People's Committee of the province; c) Within 15 days from the day on which the appraisal result is received, the People's Committee of the province shall decide to recognize the provincial tourism area; in case of refusal, a written response stating reasons thereof must be given. 3. For a tourism area located in 02 or more district-level administrative units, the tourism authority of the province shall prepare an application for recognition of the provincial tourism area. The People's Committee of the province shall establish an appraisal council and issue a decision on recognition of the provincial tourism area. 4. The People's Committee of the province shall revoke the decision on recognition of the provincial tourism area in case the tourism area no longer satisfies the conditions specified in Clause 1 Article 26 of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@28: Application and procedures for recognition of a national tourism area 1. An application for recognition of a national tourism area includes : a) An application form for recognition of a national tourism area using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A description of eligibility to be recognized as a national tourism area as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 26 of this Law. 2. Procedures for recognition of a national tourism area are specified as follows: a) The national tourism area is recognized as a national tourism area by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a) The People's Committee of the province shall submit 01 application to the Vietnam National Administration of Tourism; b) Within 45 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Vietnam National Administration of Tourism shall appraise it and submit it to the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; c) Within 15 days from the day on which the appraisal result is received, the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall decide to recognize and cooperate with the People's Committee of the province in announcing the national tourism area; in case of refusal, a written response stating reasons thereof must be given. 3. For a tourist resort located in two or more provincial-level administrative units, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall compile a dossier of request for recognition of a national tourist resort and submit it to the Prime Minister for recognition. 4. The person competent to recognize a national tourism area shall revoke the decision on recognition in case the tourist area no longer satisfies the conditions specified in Clause 2, Article 26 of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@29: Tourism management 1. The management of a tourist resort covers the following contents: a) Manage planning and investment and development; b) Manage tourism business activities and tour guides; c) Manage investment, exploitation and protection of tourism resources; d) Ensure safety for tourists; ensure social order and safety, and protect the environment in the tourist resort; dd) Set up a system of signboards, signboards, and information points for tourists; e) Other contents as prescribed by law. 2. The Government shall provide for the management model of national tourism areas; the provincial People's Committee shall provide for the provincial tourism area management model.
Luật Du lịch@30: Scope of travel services 1. Provision of domestic tours for domestic tourists. 2. Provision of international tours for inbound tourists and outbound tourists. 3. International travel service providers may provide international and domestic tours, except for the cases specified in Clause 4 of this Article. 4. Foreign-invested enterprises may only provide international tours for inbound tourists, unless otherwise prescribed by international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory.
Luật Du lịch@31: Conditions for provision of tour 1.
