Conditions for provision of domestic tours : a) Being an enterprise established under the provisions of the law on enterprises; b) Deposit domestic tours at banks; c) The person in charge of provision of tour must obtain at least an associate degree in travel; if the person in charge of provision of tour holds an associate degree or higher in another major, he/she must obtain a certificate of training in domestic tour operation. 2. Conditions for provision of international tours : a) Being an enterprise established under the provisions of the law on enterprises; b) Deposit international travel services at banks; c) The person in charge of provision of travel services must obtain at least a college's degree in travel; if the person holds a college's degree in another major, he/she must obtain a certificate of training in international tour operation. 3. Enterprises that satisfy the business conditions specified in Clause 1 of this Article shall be issued with the license for provision of domestic tours; enterprises that satisfy the business conditions specified in Clause 2 of this Article shall be issued with the license for provision of international tours. The fees for assessment of issuance of the license for provision of international tours and the license for provision of domestic tours shall comply with regulations of law on fees and charges. 4. The Government shall elaborate the deposit for provision of tour specified in Point b Clause 1 and Point b Clause 2 of this Article. 5. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall elaborate the person in charge of provision of tour; contents of training, examination and issuance of certificates of training in domestic tour operation and international tour operation.
Luật Du lịch@32: Application and procedures for issuance of the license for provision of domestic tours 1. An application for the license for provision of domestic tours includes : a) An application form for issuance of the license for provision of domestic tours using the form provided by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A certified true copy of the Certificate of Enterprise registration; c) The certificate of deposit for tour operator business; d) A certified true copy of the decision on appointment or employment contract between the travel service provider and the person in charge of provision of travel services; dd) Certified true copy of qualifications of the person in charge of provision of tour specified in Point c Clause 1 Article 31 of this Law. 2. Procedures for issuance of the license for provision of domestic tours : a) The enterprise applying for the license for provision of domestic tours shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority of the province where the enterprise's headquarters is located; b) Within 10 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the tourism authority of the province shall appraise it and issue the license for provision of domestic tours to the enterprise; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. 3. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide the form of the license for provision of domestic tours.
Luật Du lịch@33: Application and procedures for issuance of the license for provision of international tours 1. An application for issuance of the license for provision of international tours includes : a) An application form for issuance of the license for provision of international tours according to the form provided by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A certified true copy of the Certificate of Enterprise registration or the Investment registration certificate issued by a competent authority; c) The certificate of deposit for tour operator business; d) Certified true copy of qualifications of the person in charge of provision of tour specified in Point c Clause 2 Article 31 of this Law; dd) A certified true copy of the decision on appointment or employment contract between the travel service provider and the person in charge of provision of travel services. 2. Procedures for issuance of the license for provision of international tours : a) The enterprise applying for the license for provision of international tours shall submit 01 application to the Vietnam National Administration of Tourism; b) Within 10 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the General Department of Tourism shall appraise it and issue the license for provision of international tours to the enterprise and notify the tourism authority of the province where the enterprise is located; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. 3. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide the form of the license for provision of international tours.
Luật Du lịch@34: Reissuance of the license for provision of tour 1. The provider shall apply for reissuance of the license for provision of tour in case it is lost or damaged. 2. Procedures for reissuance of the license for provision of tour are specified as follows: a) The license for provision of tour is issued in accordance with regulations of law on travel and travel documents; a) The provider shall submit an application form for reissuance of the license for provision of tour using the form provided by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism to the licensing authority; b) Within 05 working days from the receipt of the application form, the licensing authority shall reissue the license for provision of tour to the enterprise; in case of refusal, a written response stating reasons thereof must be given. The General Department of Tourism shall notify the tourism authority of the province where the enterprise is located when reissuing the license for provision of international tours.
Luật Du lịch@35: Reissuance of the license for provision of tour 1. An enterprise shall apply for replacement of the license for provision of tour in the following cases: a) Change of the Certificate of Enterprise registration or Certificate of investment registration; b) Change of scope of provision of international tours. 2. An application for replacement of the license for provision of tour includes: a) An application for replacement of the license for provision of tour includes : a) An application form for replacement of the license for provision of tour using the form provided by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) The license for tour operator business of the enterprise; c) A certified true copy of the enterprise registration certificate or investment registration certificate in the case specified in Point a Clause 1 of this Article; a certificate of deposit for provision of tour in conformity with the scope of business in the case specified in Point b Clause 1 of this Article. 3. Procedures for replacement of the license for provision of tour are specified as follows: a) The license for provision of tour is issued by the Ministry of Education and Training; a) The enterprise shall submit 01 application to the licensing authority; b) Within 05 working days from the receipt of the satisfactory application, the licensing authority shall replace the license for provision of tour for the enterprise; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. The General Department of Tourism shall notify the tourism authority of the province where the enterprise is located of the renewal of the license for provision of international tours.
Luật Du lịch@36: Revoking the license for provision of tour 1. The license for provision of tour shall be revoked in the following cases: a) The tour operator terminates its tour operator business, is dissolved or goes bankrupt; b) Failure to satisfy one of the conditions for provision of tour specified in Clause 1 or Clause 2 Article 31 of this Law; c) Failure to renew the license for provision of tour as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 35 of this Law; d) Cause harm to national sovereignty, interests, national defense and security; e) Taking advantage of tourist activities to illegally take people from Vietnam abroad or vice versa; e) Letting other organizations and individuals use the license for tour operator business of the enterprise for business; g) Failing to fulfill obligations prescribed in Point i Clause 1 Article 37 of this Law, causing serious damage to tourists' lives, health and property; h) Forging the application for issuance, replacement or reissuance of the license for provision of tour. 2. An enterprise whose license for tour operator business is revoked as prescribed in Point b and Point c Clause 1 of this Article may only apply for a license for tour operator business after 06 months from the effective date of the decision on license revocation. An enterprise whose license for tour operator business is revoked as prescribed in Point d, dd, e, g and h Clause 1 of this Article may only apply for a license for tour operator business after 12 months from the effective date of the decision on license revocation. 3. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide for procedures for revoking the license for provision of tour.
Luật Du lịch@37: Rights and obligations of tour operator 1. A domestic travel service provider has the following rights and obligations: a) To elaborate, advertise, sell and organize the provision of tourist services and tourist programs for tourists according to the business scope prescribed in the permits; b) Maintain fulfillment of conditions for provision of tour specified in Clause 1 Article 31 of this Law; publish the name of the provider and license number on the signboard of the provider's head office, branch or transaction office, in the travel contract, on advertising publications and in electronic transactions; c) Notify the replacement of the person in charge of provision of tour and send the application for replacement of the person in charge of provision of tour to the licensing authority within 15 days from the date of replacement; d) Provide tourists with information about tourism programs, services and destinations; dd) Buy insurance for tourists during the tour program, unless they have insurance for the entire tour program; e) Employ tour guides to guide tourists under travel contracts; take responsibility for tour guides' activities during the tour; g) Observe, disseminate and guide tourists to comply with laws and regulations of tourist destinations; behave in a civilized manner, respect cultural identity, customs and practices of Vietnam and tourist destinations; cooperate with competent authorities in promptly taking actions against violations of law committed by tourists during their participation in tour programs; h) Comply with regulations on reporting, statistics, accounting and retention of documents as prescribed by law; i) Take measures to ensure the safety of tourists' lives, health and property; promptly inform competent authorities of accidents and risks to tourists and take remedial measures; k) Manage tourists according to the tour program agreed with tourists. 2. An international travel service provider that serves inbound tourists has the following rights and obligations: a) Rights and obligations specified in Points a, c, d, dd, e, g, h, i and k Clause 1 of this Article; b) Maintain fulfillment of conditions for provision of tour specified in Clause 2 Article 31 of this Law; publish the name of the provider and license number on the signboard of the provider's head office, branch or transaction office, in the travel contract, on advertising publications and in electronic transactions; c) Assist tourists in completing entry, exit, transit and customs procedures. 3. An international travel service provider that serves outbound tourists has the following rights and obligations : a) The rights and obligations specified in Points a, c, d, dd, g, h, i and k Clause 1, Points b and c Clause 2 of this Article; b) Employ international tour guides to take tourists abroad under travel contracts; take responsibility for activities of tour guides during the time they take tourists abroad.
Luật Du lịch@38: Foreign-invested enterprises providing tours 1. Foreign investors may contribute capital with Vietnamese partners to establish tour enterprises in accordance with Vietnam's law and international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory. 2. Conditions, application, procedures and power to issue, reissue, replace and revoke the license for provision of tour applied to foreign-invested enterprises are specified in Articles 31,33,34,35 and 36 of this Law. 3. Foreign-invested enterprises providing tours have the rights and obligations specified in Clause 2 Article 37 of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@39: Travel contract 1. Travel contract means an agreement on the implementation of a tour program between a travel service provider and an enterprise, a tourist or a tourist's representative. 2. Travel contracts must be made in writing. 3. A travel contract must contain the following details: a) The quantity, quality, prices, time and method of provision of services in the tour; b) Contract value and payment method; c) Disclaimer in force majeure events; d) Conditions and financial liability related to the contract modification, supplementation or cancellation; dd) Provisions on insurance for tourists.
Luật Du lịch@40: Travel agency business 1. Travel agency business means the sale of tour programs of tour service enterprises to tourists for commissions by organizations and individuals. 2. The travel agent must apply for business registration at a competent authority and enter into an agency agreement with a travel service provider. 3. In case tourists buy tours through travel agencies, travel contracts shall be concluded between tourists and the principal travel service provider; the contract must indicate the name and address of the travel agency.
Luật Du lịch@41: Travel agency contract 1. A travel agency contract shall be made in writing between the principal being a travel service provider and the agent being a travel agent. 2. A travel agency contract must contain the following details: a/Names and addresses of the principal and the agent; b) Tour programs, tour program selling prices given to agents, commission rates, and payment time; c) Rights and responsibilities of parties; d) Effective period of the agent contract.
Luật Du lịch@42: Responsibilities of travel principals 1. Inspect and supervise the performance of the contract by the travel agent. 2. Organize the implementation of tour programs sold by travel agencies; take responsibility to tourists for tour programs assigned to travel agencies. 3. Provide travel agencies with information related to the tour program.
Luật Du lịch@43: Responsibilities of travel agencies 1. Notify the tourism authority of the time of commencement of business activities, business location and information about the travel agency. 2. Sell the tour program according to the contents and at the prices specified in the agency agreement; do not organize the tour program. 3. To compile and keep dossiers on tourist programs already sold to tourists according to law provisions. 4. Display the travel agency signboard at a noticeable position at the agency's office.
Luật Du lịch@44: Vietnam-based representative offices of foreign tour enterprises 1. The establishment of a representative office in Vietnam of a foreign travel service provider shall comply with regulations of law on commerce. 2. The tourism authority of the province shall receive and verify applications, issue, reissue, adjust, renew and revoke the license to establish a representative office in Vietnam of the foreign travel service provider.
Luật Du lịch@45: Tourist transport business 1. Tourist transport business means the provision of air, sea, inland waterway, railway and road transport services exclusively for tourists under tourist programs, in tourist resorts and tourist sites. 2. The organizations and individuals mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article must satisfy transport business conditions; technical regulations and environmental protection regulations of vehicles; conditions on vehicle operators, service staff, equipment and service quality of each type of vehicles as prescribed by law. 3. The Minister of Transport shall specify conditions on vehicle operators, service staff, equipment and service quality on tourist transport vehicles after consulting the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
Luật Du lịch@46: Issue of badges for means of tourist transport 1. A tourist transport vehicle shall be issued with a badge if it satisfies the conditions specified in Clause 2 Article 45 of this Law. 2. Means of tourist transport with signboards may transport passengers under contracts and be given priority in arranging places for anchorage, parking, pick-up and drop-off of tourists at airports, ports, railway stations, bus stations, in tourist resorts, near tourist sites, tourist accommodation establishments and may operate without restriction on time on traffic routes leading to tourist attractions, tourist accommodation establishments, tourist service provision points according to regulations of local administrations. 3. The Government shall provide for procedures for issuance of badges for means of tourist transport.
Luật Du lịch@47: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals doing tourist transport business 1. Transport tourists under contracts with tour operators and tourists according to appropriate routes. 2. Buy insurance for tourists by means of transport. 3. To ensure the prescribed standards and conditions throughout the process of operation and use of transport means. 4. Tourist transport signboards must be stuck at noticeable places on transport means.
Luật Du lịch@48: Types of tourist accommodation establishments 1. Hotels. 2. Tourist villas. 3. Tourist apartments. 4. Cruise ships. 5. Tourist guest houses. 6. Houses with rooms for lease to tourists. 7. Tourist camping grounds. 8. Other tourist accommodation establishments.
Luật Du lịch@49: Conditions for tourist accommodation service business 1. Conditions for tourist accommodation service business include : a) Having business registration as prescribed by law; b) The facility must satisfy requirements for security, order, fire safety, environmental protection and food safety as prescribed by law; c) Meet the minimum conditions for infrastructure and services for tourists. 2. The Government shall elaborate Point c Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Du lịch@50: Classification of tourist accommodation establishments 1. Organizations and individuals providing tourist accommodation services may voluntarily register for rating of tourist accommodation establishments with competent state agencies. 2. Hotels, tourist villas, tourist apartments and tourist ships shall be ranked according to national standards on ranking of tourist accommodation establishments. A tourist accommodation establishment shall be ranked at one, two, three, four and five stars. 3. The competence to evaluate and recognize the grades of tourist accommodation establishments is prescribed as follows: a) The Vietnam National Administration of Tourism shall assess and recognize 4-star and 5-star tourist accommodation establishments; b) The tourism authority of the province shall assess and recognize 01-star, 02-star and 03-star tourist accommodation establishments. 4. An application for rating of a tourist accommodation establishment includes: a) An application form for rating of the tourist accommodation establishment using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) The written self-assessment of the tourist accommodation establishment's quality according to the national standards for rating tourist accommodation establishments; c) The list of managers and employees of the tourist accommodation establishment; d) Certified true copies of qualifications, certificates and certificates of completion of training courses in tourism and certificates of working time in tourism of managers and heads of departments of the tourist accommodation establishment. 5. Procedures for rating of a tourist accommodation establishment are specified as follows: a) The tourist accommodation establishment shall submit 01 application to the competent authority specified in Clause 3 of this Article. If the application is unsatisfactory, within 03 working days from the day on which it is received, the competent authority shall send a written request for amendments to the application; b) Within 30 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the competent authority shall take charge and cooperate with the socio-professional organization for tourism in appraising the application and issuing a decision on recognition of the rating of the tourist accommodation establishment; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. 6. The decision on rating of a tourist accommodation establishment is valid for 05 years. After the expiry of the decision, the tourist accommodation service provider that wishes to re-grade the tourist accommodation establishment shall comply with Clauses 4,5 and 7 of this Article. 7. The fees for rating of tourist accommodation establishments shall comply with regulations of law on fees and charges. 8. The signboard of rating a tourist accommodation establishment shall be stuck at the main entrance of the tourist accommodation establishment. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide the specimen of the rating plate.
Luật Du lịch@51: Announcement and inspection of quality of tourist accommodation establishments 1. The Vietnam National Administration of Tourism shall announce the list of rated tourist accommodation establishments within its competence; guide and inspect the rating of tourist accommodation establishments by provincial-level tourism authorities; and organize the inspection of quality of tourist accommodation establishments nationwide. 2. The tourism authority of the province shall publish the list of rated tourist accommodation establishments within its power; carry out quality inspection of tourist accommodation establishments in the province.
Luật Du lịch@52: Revoking the decision on rating or change of rating of tourist accommodation establishment 1. The competent authority that has the power to classify a tourist accommodation establishment shall revoke the decision on class recognition if the tourist accommodation establishment fails to maintain the quality of the recognized standard. 2. In case of changes in technical facilities and services, the tourist accommodation establishment-operating organization or individual shall request a competent authority to re-assess the rating of the tourist accommodation establishment. The application and procedures for rating of the tourist accommodation establishment shall comply with Clauses 4,5,6 and 7 Article 50 of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@53: Rights and obligations of organizations and individuals providing tourist accommodation services 1. The tourist accommodation service provider has the rights to : a) Refuse to admit tourists who commit violations against the law or internal regulations of the tourist accommodation establishment or when the tourist accommodation establishment is no longer capable of meeting the tourists' demands; b) Cancel the contract for provision of services with tourists who commit violations against law and regulations of the tourist accommodation establishment. 2. Organizations and individuals providing tourist accommodation services have the following obligations : a) Maintain fulfillment of conditions for provision of tourist accommodation services prescribed in Clause 1 Article 49 of this Law; b) Openly post the selling prices of goods and services, and the regulations of the tourist accommodation establishment; c) Pay compensation for damage caused to tourists in accordance with the civil law; d) Notify the tourism authority of the province where the tourist accommodation establishment is located in writing of any change in name, scale, address or legal representative of the tourist accommodation establishment; dd) Only use the word sao or star images to advertise the rating of the tourist accommodation establishment after it is recognized by a competent authority; e) Comply with regulations on reporting, statistics and accounting as prescribed by law. 3. A rated tourist accommodation establishment has the following rights and obligations : a) Rights and obligations specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article; b) Display the signboard recognizing the rating of the tourist accommodation establishment and advertise the tourist accommodation establishment according to the rating; c) Maintain the quality of the tourist accommodation establishment according to the recognized category and class.
Luật Du lịch@54: Other types of tourism services 1. Food and drink services. 2. Shopping services. 3. Sports services. 4. Recreation and entertainment services. 5. Health care services. 6. Other related services for tourists.
Luật Du lịch@55: Development of other tourism services The State encourages organizations and individuals to carry out the following activities: 1. Invest in and build restaurant chains, food courts and food festivals in order to conserve and promote traditional food values and acquire the world's food quintessence; 2. Investing in and building shopping streets, shopping centers, chains of shops trading in goods, souvenirs, handicrafts and fine-art articles of domestic origin, duty-free shops; organizing annual sales promotion programs; 3. To invest in developing tourist services in association with sport on the basis of tourist resources and Vietnam's terrain advantages; to organize sport events to attract tourists; 4. To formulate and organize traditional and contemporary art performance programs; to connect the system of museums and theaters with tourist activities; to exploit folk games and traditional festivals attractive to tourists; to build theme parks and entertainment centers; 5. Providing medical, healthcare and beauty care services on the basis of tapping the traditional medicine and modern medicine values; 6. Provide other relevant services at the request of tourists and in accordance with regulations of law.
Luật Du lịch@56: Recognition of other tourism service business establishments meeting standards of tourist service provision 1. Organizations and individuals providing other tourism services may voluntarily register for recognition of other tourism service provision establishments meeting tourist service standards with competent state agencies. 2. An application for accreditation includes: a) An application form according to the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) A description of satisfaction of standards for tourist services. 3. Procedures and authority to grant recognition are as follows: a) The organization or individual providing other tourism services shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority of the province where the business location is located; b) Within 20 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the tourism authority of the province shall appraise and recognize the tourism establishment; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. 4. The fees for assessment and recognition of other tourism service business establishments meeting standards for tourist service provision shall comply with the law provisions on fees and charges. 5. The decision on recognition of a provider of other tourism services qualified for provision of services for tourists is valid for 03 years. After the expiry of the decision, the provider of other tourism services that wishes to apply for re-recognition of the provider of other tourism services qualified for provision of services for tourists shall comply with Clauses 2,3 and 4 of this Article. 6. The tourism authority of the province shall inspect the quality of other tourism service providers recognized to be qualified for provision of services for tourists in the province; revoke the decision on recognition of a provider of other tourism services that fails to meet standards for provision of services for tourists as prescribed by law. 7. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall promulgate standards and specimen of signboards of satisfaction of tourist service standards for other tourism service providers.
Luật Du lịch@57: Rights and obligations of other tourism service providers recognized to be qualified for provision of services for tourists 1. To be included in the national tourism promotion database. 2. To be given priority in participating in tourism promotion activities organized by central and local state management agencies in charge of tourism. 3. Display signboards of satisfaction of tourist service standards and use this title for advertisement and attraction of tourists. 4. To ensure business conditions and standards of tourist service under this Law and other relevant laws throughout the business process.
Luật Du lịch@58: Tourist guides, tourist guide's cards 1. Tour guides include international tour guides, domestic tour guides and on-site tour guides. 2. The scope of professional practice by tour guides is prescribed as follows: a) An international tour guide may guide domestic tourists and international tourists to Vietnam nationwide and take them abroad; b) Domestic tour guides may guide domestic tourists who are Vietnamese citizens nationwide; c) On-site tour guides may guide tourists within tourist resorts or tourist spots. 3. Conditions for a tour guide to practice tourism activities include: a) Having tourist guide's cards; b) Having labor contracts with tour business enterprises, tour guiding service providing enterprises or being members of the socio-professional organizations on tour guiding for international tour guides and domestic tour guides; c) Have a tour guide contract with a tour operator or a written assignment of tour guide according to the tour program; for on-site tour guides, the assignment of tour guide of the tourist attraction or tourist attraction manager is required. 4. A tour guide card includes international tour guide card, domestic tour guide card and on-site tour guide card. An international tour guide card and a domestic tour guide card are valid for 5 years. 5. The fees for assessment and issuance of the tour guide card shall comply with regulations of law on fees and charges.
Luật Du lịch@59: Conditions for issuance of tour guide card 1. Conditions for issuance of the domestic tour guide card include: a) Having Vietnamese nationality and permanently residing in Vietnam; b) Having full legal capacity; c) Not suffering from infectious diseases, not using narcotic substances; d) Having graduated from an intermediate or higher-level school in tour guiding; in case of graduating from an intermediate or higher-level school in another discipline, they must have a certificate of training in domestic tour guiding. 2. Conditions for issuance of international tour guide cards include: a) The conditions specified in Points a, b and c Clause 1 of this Article; b) Have at least a college degree in tour guiding; in case of having at least a college degree in another major, a certificate of training in international tour guiding is required; c) Being fluent in the foreign language registered for practice. 3. Conditions for issuance of on-site tour guide cards include: a) The conditions specified in Points a, b and c Clause 1 of this Article; b) Pass the on-site tour guiding examination organized by a tourism authority of the province. 4. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide guidelines for templates of cards, training, examination and issuance of certificates of tour guiding; contents of on-site tour guiding tests; standards for foreign language proficiency.
Luật Du lịch@60: Application and procedures for issuance of international tour guide cards and domestic tour guide cards 1. An application for issuance of an international tour guide card or domestic tour guide card includes : a) An application form for issuance of the tour guide card using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b/A curriculum vitae certified by the commune-level People's Committee of the place of residence; c) Certified true copies of qualifications in accordance with Point d Clause 1 or Point b and Point c Clause 2 Article 59 of this Law; d) Health certificate issued by a competent health facility within 06 months before the application is submitted; dd) 02 color photos of 3x4 cm size. 2. Procedures for and power to issue international tour guide cards and domestic tour guide cards are specified as follows: a) The applicant for the tour guide card shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority of the province; b) Within 15 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the tourism authority of the province shall issue the tour guide card to the applicant; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given.
Luật Du lịch@61: Application and procedures for issuance of on-site tour guide card 1. An application for issuance of on-site tour guide card includes : a) An application form for issuance of the tour guide card using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) The documents specified in Points b, d and dd Clause 1 Article 60 of this Law. 2. Procedures for issuance of on-site tour guide cards are specified as follows: a) The tourist guide's card is issued to a person who is a tourist guide on the site; a) The tourism authority of the province shall announce the plan for on-site tour guiding examination on an annual basis; b) The applicant for the on-site tour guide card shall submit 01 application to the tourism authority of the province; c) The tourism authority of the province shall organize an on-site tour guide examination and issue the on-site tour guide card to the person who passes the professional examination within 10 days from the day on which the examination result is available.
Luật Du lịch@62: Reissuance of tour guide card 1. An international tour guide or a domestic tour guide shall apply for replacement of the tour guide card when it expires. 2. An application for replacement of the tour guide card includes : a) An application form for replacement of the tour guide card using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) The documents specified in Points b, d and dd Clause 1 Article 60 of this Law; c) A certified true copy of the certificate of completion of the refresher course for tour guides issued by a competent authority; d) The issued tour guide card. 3. Procedures for replacement of tour guide cards are as follows: a) The tour guide card is issued by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a) The person applying for replacement of the tour guide card shall submit 01 application to the issuing authority; b) Within 10 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the issuing authority shall replace the tour guide card with another one; in case of rejection, a written response specifying reasons thereof shall be given. 4. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide guidelines for knowledge update courses and certificates of knowledge update courses for international tour guides and domestic tour guides.
Luật Du lịch@63: Reissuance of tour guide card 1. A tour guide card shall be reissued in case of loss, damage or change of information on the card. The validity period of the reissued tour guide card is the same as the remaining validity period of the issued card. 2. An application for reissuance of the tour guide card includes : a) An application form for reissuance of the tour guide card using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) 02 color photos of 3x4 cm size; c) A certified true copy of the document related to the changes in case of reissuance of the tour guide card due to changes in information on the tour guide card. 3. Procedures for reissuance of tour guide cards are as follows: a) The tour guide card is issued by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a) The applicant for reissuance of the tour guide card shall submit 01 application to the issuing authority; b) Within 10 days from the day on which the valid application is received, the issuing authority shall reissue the tour guide card to the applicant; if the application is rejected, a written response containing the explanation shall be made.
Luật Du lịch@64: Revoking the tour guide card 1. A tour guide card shall be revoked in case the tour guide commits one of the following acts: a) Cause harm to national sovereignty, interests, national defense and security; b) Lending tour guide cards to other individuals for tour practice; c) Failure to satisfy the conditions for tour guiding practice and issuance of tour guide cards prescribed in this Law; d) Forge the application for issuance, replacement or reissuance of tour guide badge. 2. The competent authority that issues the tour guide card shall decide to revoke the tour guide card and publish it on the tour guide management website of VNAT and the revoking authority. 3. A tour guide whose card is revoked may apply for a tour guide card only after 12 months from the date of revocation.
Luật Du lịch@65: Rights and obligations of tour guides 1. A tour guide has the following rights: a/To join socio-professional organizations in tourist guiding; b) Receive wages and other remuneration under the contract; c) Participate in training courses in tour guiding knowledge, professional skills; d) In case of emergency or force majeure, change the tour program, adjust the standards and services of tourists. 2. A tour guide has the following obligations : a) Guide tourists according to their assigned tasks or tour guiding contracts; b) Comply with and guide tourists to comply with the laws of Vietnam, the law of the tourist destination and the rules of the tourist destination; respect the customs and practices of the localities; c) Provide tourists with information about tour programs, services, legitimate rights and interests of tourists; d) Guide tourists according to the tour program, show civilized, enthusiastic and caring attitude towards tourists; request the person in charge of tour operator to change the tour program at the request of tourists; dd) Provide assistance in ensuring safety of tourists' lives, health and property; e) Participate in refresher courses prescribed in Clause 4 Article 62 of this Law; g) Wear the tour guide badge while guiding tourists; h) International tour guides and domestic tour guides must bring the assignment papers of the tour program-organizing enterprise and the tour program in Vietnamese while they are practicing. In case of guiding international tourists, tour guides must bring the tour program in Vietnamese and foreign languages.
Luật Du lịch@66: Responsibilities for managing tour guides 1. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall inspect the issuance of tour guide cards, provision of training in tour guiding and tour guiding nationwide. 2. The tourism authority of the province shall inspect the provision of tour guiding training and tourism guiding services in the province. 3. The travel service provider and tour guide service provider shall : a) Inspect and supervise the tour guide's adherence to law and the contract signed with the enterprise; b) Provide training in tour guiding knowledge, skills and professional knowledge.
Luật Du lịch@67: Tourism promotion content 1. To promote and introduce the Vietnamese land and people, cultural heritages, historical-cultural relics, scenic places, human creative works and national cultural identities in order to attract tourists. 2. Develop national, regional, local and corporate tourism brands; conduct research into tourism markets, develop and advertise tourism products that are appropriate to tourists' tastes. 3. To conduct propaganda to raise social awareness about tourism, contributing to ensuring a security, safety, health and civilized tourist environment and promoting the national tradition of hospitality. 4. To mobilize, seek opportunities and concentrate resources on investment in the development of tourism infrastructure and physical and technical foundations; to diversify and raise the quality of tourism services.
Luật Du lịch@68: Tourism promotion activities 1. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall formulate and organize the implementation of national tourism promotion strategies, plans and programs; coordinate inter-regional and inter-provincial tourism promotion activities. 2. Ministries, ministerial-level agencies and People's Committees at all levels shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, formulate and implement tourism promotion plans and programs in their respective domains and localities in conformity with national tourism promotion strategies, plans and programs. 3. Socio-professional organizations in tourism, enterprises, relevant organizations and individuals shall proactively formulate and organize the implementation of domestic and foreign tourism promotion plans and programs in conformity with the national tourism promotion strategy, plan and program, and establish overseas tourism promotion offices. Expenses for tourism promotion activities of enterprises shall be accounted as their expenses.
Luật Du lịch@69: Establishment of Vietnam-based representative offices of foreign tourism agencies and international and regional tourism organizations 1. Foreign tourist agencies, international and regional tourist organizations may set up their representative offices in Vietnam. 2. A dossier of request for establishment of a representative office must be consularly legalized, comprising : a) An application form for establishment of the representative office using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) Decide the establishment of foreign tourism agencies, international and regional tourism organizations; c) The decision on establishment of representative office of the foreign tourism authority, international and regional tourism organization; d) Decision on appointment of the head of the representative office. 3. The order and procedures for setting up a Vietnam-based representative office are prescribed as follows: a) The head of the representative office shall submit 01 application to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) Within 30 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall appraise it and submit it to the Prime Minister for consideration; c. Within 05 working days from the date on which the opinion from the Prime Minister is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sport and Tourism shall send a written notification to the head of the representative office.
Luật Du lịch@70: ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE TOURIST DEVELOPMENT FUND 1. Tourism development support fund is an off-budget state financial fund with the legal person status, its own seal and account, and is set up and has its organization and operation charter approved by the Prime Minister. 2. The Tourism Development Assistance Fund shall be exempt from taxes and other State budget remittances according to law provisions. 3. The Tourism Development Assistance Fund is formed from the following sources : a) Charter capital allocated by the State budget; b) State budget shall annually supplement part of the fees for sightseeing, issuance of visas and documents related to entry and exit of Vietnam to foreigners; c) Legal and voluntary funding and contributions of domestic and foreign enterprises, organizations and individuals; d) Other legal revenues as prescribed by law. 4. The Government shall elaborate Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Du lịch@71: Purpose of Tourism Development Assistance Fund 1. To promote tourism at home and abroad. 2. Support market research and development of tourism products. 3. Provide assistance in training and development of tourism human resources. 4. To support tourism communication activities in communities.
Luật Du lịch@72: Principles of operation of the Tourism Development Assistance Fund 1. Not for profit; preserve charter capital and self-finance management expenses. 2. To conduct revenues, expenditures, final settlement, publicity of finance, assets and accounting work according to law provisions. 3. To submit to the examination, inspection and audit by the finance state management agency and the state audit of financial activities of the Tourism Development Assistance Fund. 4. Ensuring publicity, transparency, thrift, efficiency, proper use and compliance with law. 5. The previous year's fund balance of the Tourism Development Assistance Fund shall be carried forward to the subsequent year for further use.
Luật Du lịch@73: The Government's responsibilities for state management of tourism 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of tourism. 2. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall act as the focal point to assist the Government in performing the state management of tourism and has the following tasks and powers : a) Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate and organize the implementation of legislative documents on tourism; tourism development strategies, planning, plans and policies; list of potential locations for development of national tourism areas; b) Coordinating and linking inter-country, inter-regional and inter-provincial tourism activities; c) Formulate national standards and national technical regulations on tourism; establish tourism management database; d/To coordinate with concerned agencies and socio-professional organizations in tourism in disseminating and educating about the law on tourism; dd) Organize and manage training for tourism human resources; research and apply science and technology in tourism; provide guidelines for e-transactions in tourism; e) Carry out investigation and assessment of tourism resources; g) Promote international cooperation in tourism; tourism promotion activities at home and abroad; h) Manage and organize the issuance and revocation of licenses, tour guide cards and other certificates of tourism activities; i) Private sector involvement in investment in and development of tourism products, tourism promotion, training and improvement of tourism human resources; j/To examine, inspect, settle complaints and denunciations and handle violations of the tourist legislation.
Luật Du lịch@74: Responsibilities of ministries and ministerial-level agencies for state management of tourism 1. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, coordinate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism in performing the state management of tourism. 2. The Ministry of Planning and Investment shall take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and relevant regulatory bodies in promulgating or proposing the promulgation of policies on investment incentives and assistance in tourism; mobilizing resources and attracting investment in tourism development; integrating tourism development contents into socio-economic development strategies, programs, planning and plans. 3. The Ministry of Finance shall take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and relevant regulatory bodies in promulgating or proposing the promulgation of policies on finance, taxation and customs to facilitate tourism development; ensure financial resources for national tourism promotion. 4. The Ministry of Industry and Trade shall take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and relevant regulatory bodies in promulgating or proposing policies on encouraging production and supply of high-quality goods, souvenirs, handicrafts and services for tourism development, building duty-free shops serving tourists in some key tourist areas; and integrating tourism promotion into trade promotion. 5. The Ministry of Foreign Affairs shall take charge and cooperate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism and relevant regulatory bodies in propagating and promoting the image of Vietnam and its people; advising on policies on visas serving tourism development.
Luật Du lịch@75: Responsibilities of People's Committees at all levels for state management of tourism 1. Provincial People's Committees, within the scope of their duties and powers, shall perform state management of tourism in their provinces; concretize tourism development strategies, planning, plans and policies in conformity with local conditions. 2. People's Committees at all levels have the following tasks and powers : a) Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate incentive policies and investment attraction policies to develop tourism potentials and advantages of their provinces; support community-based tourism development; b) Manage tourism resources, tourist resorts, tourist attractions, tourism business activities and tour guides within their areas; c) Ensure security, social order, safety, environment and food safety in tourist resorts, tourist attractions and places where many tourists are gathered; d) Disseminate information and raise people's awareness to ensure a friendly, healthy and civilized tourism environment; dd) Arrange parking lots for vehicles that have been issued with tourist transport vehicle signboards to access tourist attractions and tourist accommodation establishments; review and install signboards and guide boards to enter tourist resorts and tourist attractions; e) Receive and handle complaints of tourists; g) Perform other tasks prescribed in this Law.
Luật Du lịch@76: Amendments to the list of fees and charges enclosed with the Law on fees and charges No. 97/2015/QH13 Section 3.1 and Section 3.2 of Part VII - Fees in the field of culture, sports and tourism on the List of fees and charges enclosed with the Law on Fees and Charges No. 97/2015/QH13 are amended as follows: 3.1 Fee for assessment and recognition of the rating of a tourist accommodation establishment or another tourism service provider qualified for provision of services for tourists. The Ministry of Finance 3.2 Fee for assessment for issuance of the license for provision of international tours and the license for provision of domestic tours The Ministry of Finance
Luật Du lịch@77: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2018. 2. The Law on Tourism No. 44/2005/QH11 shall be annulled from the effective date of this Law.
Luật Du lịch@78: Transitional provisions 1. Enterprises that have been issued with the license for provision of international tours before the effective date of this Law are not required to apply for replacement of the license but must ensure fulfillment of business conditions prescribed in this Law within 12 months from the effective date of this Law. 2. The domestic travel service provider shall apply for the license for provision of domestic tours within 12 months from the effective date of this Law. After the aforesaid period, the provider shall not provide domestic tours without a license. 3. International tour guides and domestic tour guides who have been granted tourist guide's cards before the effective date of this Law may continue their professional practice until the expiry of the cards. 4. Tourist accommodation establishments which have been recognized as a tourist accommodation establishment under decisions of competent state agencies before the effective date of this Law may continue using the recognized class until the expiry of the time limit stated in the decisions. This Law is passed by the 14th National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in the 3rd session on June 19,2017. THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Thi Kim Ngan
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@1: The scope of application and tasks of the Law on Administrative Procedures The Law on Administrative Procedures provides for basic principles in administrative procedures; tasks, powers and responsibilities of procedure-conducting agencies and persons; rights and obligations of procedure participants and related agencies, organizations and individuals; order and procedures for initiating lawsuits, settling administrative cases, executing administrative judgments and settling complaints and denunciations in administrative procedures. The Law on Administrative Procedures contributes to the protection of justice, human rights, citizens' rights, the socialist regime, the interests of the State, the legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals; educates people to strictly observe law; ensures the stability, smoothness and effectiveness of the national administration.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@2: Article 1.-Subjects of application and effect of the Law on Administrative Procedures 1. The Law on Administrative Procedures applies to all administrative procedural activities in the territory, including the mainland, islands, sea areas and airspace of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. The Law on Administrative Procedures applies to administrative procedural activities conducted overseas by representative missions of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 3. The Law on Administrative Procedures applies to the settlement of administrative cases involving foreign elements; in case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party otherwise provides, the provisions of that treaty prevail. 4. For foreign agencies, organizations and individuals and international organizations entitled to diplomatic privileges and immunities or consular privileges and immunities under Vietnamese law or treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party, the contents of administrative cases related to these agencies, organizations and individuals shall be settled through diplomatic channels.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Administrative decision means a document issued by a state administrative agency, agency or organization assigned to perform state administrative management or a competent person in that agency or organization, on a specific matter in administrative management activities, and applicable once to one or several specific subjects. 2. Administrative decision to be sued means a decision specified in Clause 1 of this Article which gives rise to, changes, limits or terminates the lawful rights and interests of an agency, organization or individual or contains contents giving rise to obligations or affecting the lawful rights and interests of such agency, organization or individual. 3. Administrative act means an act committed by a state administrative agency or a competent person in a state administrative agency or an agency or organization assigned to perform state administrative management, which performs or does not perform tasks or official duties in accordance with law. 4. Administrative act to be sued means an act specified in Clause 3 of this Article which affects the exercise of the rights and legitimate interests of an agency, organization or individual. 5. Disciplinary decision on dismissal means a written decision of the head of an agency or organization to apply the disciplinary form of dismissal to civil servants under his/her management. 6. Internal administrative decisions and administrative acts of agencies and organizations mean decisions and acts directing and administering the performance of tasks and implementation of working plans; management, organization of personnel, funds and assigned assets; examination and inspection of the performance of tasks, public duties, policies and laws by cadres, civil servants, public employees, laborers and units under the management of agencies and organizations. 7. involved parties include the petitioner, the defendant and the person with related interests and obligations. 8. Plaintiff means an agency, organization or individual that initiates an administrative lawsuit against an administrative decision or act, a disciplinary decision on dismissal, a decision on settlement of a complaint about a decision on handling of a competition case; a list of voters to elect deputies to the National Assembly, a list of voters to elect deputies to the People's Council or a list of voters to conduct a referendum (below collectively referred to as voter list). 9. Defendant means an agency, organization or individual that has issued an administrative decision, committed an administrative act, issued a disciplinary decision on dismissal, issued a decision on settlement of a complaint about a decision on handling of a competition case or a voter list against which a lawsuit is instituted. 10. Person with related interests and obligations means an agency, organization or individual that neither initiates a lawsuit nor is sued but the settlement of an administrative case is related to their interests and obligations, so that they or other involved parties propose by themselves and are accepted by a People's Court (below referred to as court) or are brought by the court to participate in procedures in the capacity as person with related interests and obligations. 11. regulatory bodies and organizations include regulatory bodies, political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations, socio-professional organizations, economic organizations, public service providers, people's armed forces and other organizations established and operated in accordance with regulations of law. 12. Complicated case means a case involving the rights and interests of many persons; involving contradictory documents and/or evidences which need time for examination, verification, evaluation or consultation with professional agencies; involving foreign parties who are staying abroad or Vietnamese who are residing, studying or working abroad. 13. objective hindrance means a hindrance caused by an objective circumstance that prevents a person with rights and obligations from knowing that his/her legitimate rights and interests are infringed upon or from exercising his/her rights or performing his/her obligations. 14. Force majeure event means an event which occurs objectively, is unpredictable and irremediable despite all necessary measures and possibilities have been applied.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@4: Compliance with law in administrative procedures All administrative procedural activities of procedure-conducting agencies, procedure-conducting persons, procedure participants and concerned agencies, organizations and individuals must comply with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@5: The right to request the Court to protect legitimate rights and interests Agencies, organizations and individuals may institute administrative cases to request courts to protect their rights and legitimate interests in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@6: - To consider and handle legal documents, administrative documents and relevant administrative acts in administrative cases. 1. In the course of settling administrative cases, courts may examine the legality of administrative documents or administrative acts related to the sued administrative decisions or acts and propose competent agencies, organizations or persons to re-examine those administrative documents or acts and reply to courts in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws. 2. The Courts may request competent agencies and individuals to consider, amend, supplement or annul legislative documents if such documents are found to be contrary to the Constitution, laws or legislative documents of superior regulatory agencies as prescribed in this Law and other relevant law provisions to ensure the lawful rights and interests of the agencies, organizations and individuals. The competent agencies and individuals shall respond to the Courts on the results of handling the legislative documents being requested as prescribed by law as the basis for the Courts to resolve the cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@7: Settlement of compensation issues in administrative cases 1. The petitioner and persons with related interests and obligations in administrative cases may concurrently claim compensation for damage caused by administrative decisions, administrative acts, disciplinary decisions on dismissal, decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases or voter lists. The litigator and persons with related interests and obligations that file compensation claims are obliged to provide documents and evidence. When necessary, the court may verify and collect documents and evidence to ensure the accuracy of the settlement of the case. When settling claims for damage compensation in administrative cases, the provisions of law on state compensation liability and the civil procedure law shall apply to the settlement. 2. In case an administrative case involves a claim for compensation for damage but the court has no conditions to prove it, the court may separate the claim for compensation for subsequent settlement from another civil case under the civil procedure law. In case the court settles the part of compensation claim together with the administrative case but the part of the judgment on compensation is appealed or protested against or is quashed by the appellate, cassation or reopening court for first-instance trial or re-opening, the part of compensation decision in these cases is part of the administrative case. The procedures for settling the part of compensation decision that is appealed or protested against or quashed for first-instance trial or re-opening shall comply with the provisions of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@8: The right of the petitioner to decide and self-determine Agencies, organizations and individuals may decide to institute administrative lawsuits. Courts shall accept administrative cases for settlement only when the litigators lodge their lawsuits. In the course of settling administrative cases, the litigators may change, supplement or withdraw their lawsuit petitions and exercise their other procedural rights under this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@9: Provision of documents, evidence and proof in administrative procedures 1. Involved parties have the rights and obligations to proactively collect and hand over materials and evidences to courts and prove that their claims are well grounded and lawful. Individuals initiating lawsuits or filing petitions to protect the legitimate rights and interests of other persons have the rights and obligations to collect and supply documents, evidence and proof like the involved parties. 2. Courts shall assist involved parties in collecting documents and evidence and conducting the collection and verification of evidence; request agencies, organizations and individuals to provide documents and evidence for courts or involved parties in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@10: The obligation to provide documents and evidence of competent agencies, organizations and individuals Agencies, organizations and individuals shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, fully and promptly provide documents and evidence they are keeping and managing to involved parties, courts and people's procuracies (below referred to as procuracies) under this Law when so requested and take responsibility before law for the provision of such documents and evidence. In case of failure to provide such documents and evidence, they shall notify such in writing to involved parties, courts and procuracies and clearly state the reason.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@11: - To ensure the first-instance and appellate trial regime. 1. The first-instance and appellate trial regimes shall be ensured, except for the trial of administrative cases involving lawsuits against voter list petitions. First-instance judgments and decisions of courts may be appealed or protested against in accordance with this Law. First-instance judgments/decisions of Courts which are not appealed against according to appellate procedures within the time limit prescribed by this Law shall take legal effect. If first-instance judgments/decisions of Courts are appealed against, the cases must be settled according to appellate procedures. Appellate judgments/decisions of Courts shall take legal effect. 2. The Court's sentences and rulings in effect, if found to be violated or to have new facts as per this Law, shall be reviewed according to cassation or reopening procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@12: People's jurors participating in adjudication of administrative cases 1. The first-instance trial of administrative cases shall be participated by people's jurors, except cases of trial according to summary procedures prescribed in this Law. 2. When voting on the decision to resolve the case, the people's jurors are equal in power to the judges.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@13: Article 16.-Judges and people's jurors shall conduct trials independently and obey only the law. 1. Judges and people's jurors shall conduct trials independently and only abide by law. 2. Agencies, organizations and individuals are strictly forbidden to interfere in the adjudication by judges and people's jurors in any forms.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@14: To ensure impartiality and objectivity in administrative procedures 1. The Chief Justices of Courts, Judges, People's Jurors, Ombudspersons, Court clerks, Procuracy chairmen, procurators, examiners, interpreters, expert-witnesses and members of valuation councils may not conduct or participate in legal proceedings if there are grounds to believe that they may not be impartial or objective while performing their tasks and exercising their powers. 2. The assignment of procedure-conducting persons must ensure that they are impartial and objective while performing their tasks and exercising their powers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@15: Collective trials by courts Courts shall conduct collective trials of administrative cases and make decisions by majority, except cases of trial according to summary procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@16: The Court shall conduct the trial in a timely, fair and public manner. 1. Courts shall adjudicate in time within the time limit prescribed by this Law, ensuring fairness. 2. Courts shall conduct trials publicly. In special cases where it is necessary to keep state secrets, fine national customs and practices, protect minors or keep professional secrets, business secrets or personal secrets at the legitimate request of involved parties, courts may conduct trials behind closed doors.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@17: - Equality in rights and obligations in administrative procedures 1. In administrative procedures, all persons are equal before law, regardless of their ethnicity, gender, belief, religion, social strata, educational level, occupation and social status. 2. All agencies, organizations and individuals are equal in exercising their rights and performing their obligations in administrative procedures before courts. 3. Courts shall create conditions for agencies, organizations and individuals to exercise their rights and perform their obligations.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@18: Ensuring the adversarial in trial 1. Courts shall ensure that involved parties and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests exercise the right to oral argument in first-instance, appellate, cassation or reopening trial according to the provisions of this Law. 2. Involved parties and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests may collect, hand over and provide documents and evidence from the time the court accepts an administrative case and shall notify each other of the handed documents and evidence; present, reply to, state their viewpoints and arguments on, the assessment of evidence and applicable laws to protect their claims, rights and legitimate interests or reject other persons' claims in accordance with this Law. 3. During the trial, all materials and evidences must be examined in a sufficient, objective, comprehensive and public manner, except for cases in which such disclosure is prohibited under this Law. The court shall administer the oral argument, ask for unclear issues and, based on the oral argument results, issue judgments and decisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@19: Ensuring the right to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the involved parties 1. Involved parties may defend by themselves or ask lawyers or other persons who fully meet the conditions prescribed by this Law to defend their legitimate rights and interests. 2. Courts shall ensure involved parties to exercise the right to protect their legitimate rights and interests. 3. The State shall ensure legal aid for legally-aided persons in accordance with the Law on Legal Aid so that they exercise the right to protect their legitimate rights and interests before courts. 4. No one may restrict the right to protect the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties in administrative procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@20: Dialogue in administrative procedures Courts shall conduct dialogues and create favorable conditions for involved parties to have dialogues on the resolution of cases in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@21: Spoken and written language used in administrative procedures The spoken and written language used in administrative procedures is Vietnamese. Administrative procedure participants may use the spoken and written language of their ethnic groups; in this case, interpreters are required. Administrative procedure participants being hearing or speaking persons or seeing persons with disabilities may use languages, signs and letters reserved exclusively for the disabled. In this case, there must be persons who can hear or speak in languages, signs and letters reserved exclusively for the disabled for translation.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@22: Responsibilities of presiding agencies and presiding officers 1. Presiding authorities and persons must respect the people and be subject to the people's supervision. 2. Courts have the tasks of protecting justice, human rights, citizens' rights, the socialist regime, the interests of the State, and the legitimate rights and interests of organizations and individuals. Article 1.-The procuracies have the tasks of protecting law, human rights, citizens' rights, the socialist regime, the interests of the State, the legitimate rights and interests of organizations and individuals, contributing to ensuring the strict and uniform observance of law. 3. Procedure-conducting agencies and persons shall keep state secrets and work secrets in accordance with law; preserve national fine customs and practices, protect minors, keep professional secrets, business secrets and personal secrets at the legitimate request of involved parties. 4. Presiding authorities and persons shall be held liable for their performance of their duties and powers. Presiding officers committing violations against the law shall be disciplined or face criminal prosecution, depending on nature and severity of the violations. 5. If procedure-conducting persons, while performing their tasks and exercising their powers, commit law-breaking acts, causing damage to agencies, organizations or individuals, the agencies where such persons commit such law-breaking acts shall have to pay compensation to the victims according to the law provisions on the State's compensation liability.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@23: To ensure the effect of court judgments and decisions 1. Legally effective judgments and decisions of courts must be enforced and respected by agencies, organizations and individuals. Related agencies, organizations and individuals shall strictly execute them. 2. Within the ambit of their tasks and powers, courts, agencies and organizations assigned tasks related to the enforcement of court judgments and rulings shall strictly enforce these judgments and rulings and take responsibility before law for the performance of these tasks.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@24: Director of Hearings The Supreme People's Court shall supervise the adjudication by courts; superior people's courts shall supervise the adjudication by people's courts of provinces and centrally run cities (below collectively referred to as provincial-level courts) and people's courts of rural districts, urban districts, towns, provincial cities and centrally run cities (below collectively referred to as district-level courts) within their territorial jurisdiction to ensure the uniform application of law in adjudication.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@25: Control of law observance in administrative procedures 1. The procuracy shall supervise the law observance in administrative procedures in order to ensure the timely and lawful settlement of administrative cases. 2. The procuracy shall supervise administrative cases from the time of acceptance to the time of completion of the settlement of the cases; participate in court hearings and meetings; supervise the observance of law in the enforcement of court judgments and rulings; and exercise the rights to request, recommend and protest in accordance with law. 3. For administrative decisions or administrative acts related to the legitimate rights and interests of minors, persons losing their civil act capacity, persons with restricted civil act capacity or persons with limited cognition or behavior control, if there is no person to initiate lawsuits against them, the procuracies shall propose the commune-level People's Committees of the localities where such persons reside to appoint guardians to initiate administrative lawsuits to protect the legitimate rights and interests of such persons.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@26: The Courts' responsibility to transfer documents and papers 1. Courts shall deliver, transfer and notify judgments, decisions, summonses, invitations and other papers of courts in accordance with this Law. 2. Commune-level People's Committees or related agencies, organizations and individuals shall transfer court judgments, decisions, summons, invitations and other papers at the request of courts and notify the results of such transfer to courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@27: Participation of agencies, organizations and individuals in administrative procedures Agencies, organizations and individuals have the rights and obligations to participate in administrative procedures under this Law, contributing to the timely and lawful settlement of administrative cases at courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@28: To ensure the right to lodge complaints and denunciations in administrative procedures Agencies, organizations and individuals may lodge complaints; individuals may denounce illegal acts and decisions of procedure-conducting agencies or persons or of any agencies, organizations or individuals in administrative procedures. Article 16.-Competent agencies, organizations and individuals must receive, consider and settle complaints and denunciations in time and in accordance with law; and notify in writing the settlement results to the complainants and denouncers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@29: Court fees, charges and procedural costs Court costs, fees and procedural expenses comply with this Law and the law on court costs and fees.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@30: Lawsuits falling under courts' jurisdiction 1. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts, except for the following decisions and acts: a) Administrative decisions and administrative acts classified as state secrets in the fields of national defense, security and diplomacy as prescribed by law; b) Decisions and acts of the Court in the application of administrative handling measures and handling of acts of obstructing procedural activities; c) Internal administrative decisions and administrative acts of agencies and organizations. 2. Lawsuits against disciplinary decisions on dismissal of civil servants holding the post of general director or equivalent or lower posts. 3. Lawsuits against decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases. 4. Lawsuits against voter lists.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@31: Jurisdiction of district-level courts District-level courts shall settle according to first-instance procedures the following lawsuits : 1. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of state administrative agencies of district or lower levels within the same administrative boundaries with courts or of competent persons in these state administrative agencies, except administrative decisions or administrative acts of district-level People's Committees or district-level People's Committee chairpersons; 2. Lawsuits against disciplinary decisions on dismissal of civil servants under the management of agencies or organizations of district or lower levels within the same administrative boundaries with courts, issued by heads of agencies or organizations of district or lower levels; 3. Lawsuits against voter lists made by voter list-making agencies within the same administrative boundaries with courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@32: Jurisdiction of provincial-level courts Provincial-level courts shall settle according to first-instance procedures the following lawsuits : 1. Lawsuits over administrative decisions or administrative acts of ministries, ministerial-level agencies, government-attached agencies, the State President Office, the National Assembly Office, the State Audit, the Supreme People's Court or the Supreme People's Procuracy, or administrative decisions or administrative acts of competent persons in these agencies, which are filed by plaintiffs whose places of residence, workplaces or offices are located within the same administrative boundaries with the courts; in case plaintiffs have no places of residence, workplaces or offices in the Vietnamese territory, the courts of the localities where competent agencies or persons issue administrative decisions or commit administrative acts are located have jurisdiction to settle these lawsuits; 2. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of agencies of one of the state agencies specified in Clause 1 of this Article and administrative decisions or administrative acts of competent persons in these agencies, which are filed by plaintiffs whose places of residence, workplaces or offices are located within the same administrative boundaries with courts; in case plaintiffs have no places of residence, workplaces or offices in the Vietnamese territory, courts of the localities where competent agencies or persons issue administrative decisions or commit administrative acts are competent to settle these lawsuits; 3. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of provincial-level state agencies within the same administrative boundaries with courts and of competent persons in these state agencies; 4. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of district-level People's Committees or chairpersons of district-level People's Committees within the same administrative boundaries with courts; 5.
