Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of overseas representative missions of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam or competent persons in these missions, which are filed by plaintiffs whose places of residence are located within the same administrative boundaries with the courts; in case plaintiffs have no places of residence in Vietnam, the competent courts are the People's Courts of Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City; 6. Lawsuits against disciplinary decisions on dismissal issued by heads of provincial-level agencies or organizations or by ministries or central branches, which are filed by plaintiffs whose working places were in the same administrative boundaries with the courts; 7. Lawsuits against decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases, which are filed by plaintiffs whose places of residence, workplaces or offices are located within the same administrative boundaries with courts; 8. In case of necessity, provincial-level courts may take up administrative cases for settlement which fall within the jurisdiction of district-level courts under Article 31 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@33: Determination of competence in case of both complaint and lawsuit petition 1. In case the plaintiff files a petition to institute an administrative case at a competent court and concurrently lodges a complaint with a person competent to settle complaints, the court shall request the plaintiff to select a settling agency and notify such in writing to the court. If the litigator cannot make a document himself/herself, the court shall request the court to make a record on selection of the handling agency. The court shall handle the case as follows: a) If the petitioner chooses the Court, the Court shall accept the case for settlement according to the general procedures and notify the person competent to settle complaints and request the person competent to settle complaints to transfer the entire dossier of complaint settlement to the Court; b/In case the plaintiff selects a person competent to settle his/her complaint for settlement, the court shall, pursuant to Point f, Clause 1, Article 123 of this Law, return the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents to the plaintiff. If past the time limit for settlement of a complaint, the complaint remains unsettled or has been settled but the complainant disagrees with the settlement of the complaint and files a petition for institution of an administrative case, the court shall consider and accept the case according to general procedures. 2. In case many persons have initiated administrative lawsuits at competent courts and concurrently lodged complaints with persons competent to settle complaints and all of these persons have chosen either of the two competent agencies to settle their complaints, the settling competence complies with Clause 1 of this Article. 3. In case many persons have initiated administrative lawsuits at competent courts and concurrently lodged written complaints with persons competent to settle complaints, including those who have chosen courts to settle their complaints and others to select persons competent to settle complaints, or in case some persons only initiate administrative lawsuits at competent courts and others only lodge complaints with persons competent to settle complaints, the settling competence shall be determined as follows : a) In case the interests and obligations of the litigator and the complainant are independent from each other, the settlement of the litigator's claim shall fall within the jurisdiction of the court while the settlement of the complainant's complaint shall fall within the jurisdiction of the person competent to settle complaints; b) If the rights and obligations of the litigator and the complainant are not independent from each other, the Court shall accept the case for settlement according to general procedures and notify the person competent to settle complaints and request the transfer of the entire complaint settlement dossier to the Court. 4. In case the plaintiff does not choose a settlement agency, the court shall return the lawsuit petition to the plaintiff.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@34: Transfer of cases to other Courts, settlement of disputes over jurisdiction 1. In the course of settling an administrative case according to first-instance procedures, if the court determines that such case is not an administrative case but a civil case and the settlement of this case falls under its jurisdiction, it shall settle such case according to general procedures prescribed by the civil procedure law and concurrently notify such to involved parties and the same-level procuracy. 2. Before a decision to bring a case to trial according to first-instance procedures is issued, if there are grounds to believe that the settlement of the case falls under the jurisdiction of another court, the judge assigned to settle the administrative case shall issue a decision to transfer the case file to a competent court and delete it from the case acceptance book, and concurrently notify such to involved parties and the same-level procuracy. 3. After the decision to bring a case to trial according to first-instance procedures is issued, if there are grounds to believe that the settlement of an administrative case falls under the jurisdiction of another court, the court shall open a court hearing for the trial panel to issue a decision to terminate the trial and transfer the case file to a competent court. 4. When conducting appellate trial of administrative cases, if the cases specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article are determined, appellate courts shall annul first-instance judgments or rulings and transfer case files to courts competent to conduct first-instance trial for first-instance retrial of the cases in accordance with law. 5. When conducting cassation or reopening trial of administrative cases, if the cases specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article are determined, the cassation or reopening trial courts shall annul legally effective judgments or rulings and transfer case files to courts competent to conduct first-instance trial for first-instance re-settlement of the cases in accordance with law. 6. Involved parties may file complaints and procuracies of the same level may file recommendations on decisions specified in Clauses 2 and 3 of this Article within 3 working days after receiving such decisions. Within 3 working days after receiving complaints or recommendations, chief judges of courts which have issued decisions to transfer administrative cases shall settle these complaints or recommendations. Decisions of chief judges of courts are final and shall be immediately sent to involved parties filing complaints or procuracies filing recommendations. 7. Chief justices of provincial-level courts shall settle disputes over jurisdiction to settle administrative cases between district-level courts in the same province or centrally run city. Chief justices of superior people's courts shall settle disputes over jurisdiction to settle administrative cases between district-level courts of different provinces and centrally run cities; and between provincial-level courts within the territorial jurisdiction of superior people's courts. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall settle disputes over jurisdiction between district-level courts of different provinces and centrally run cities and provincial-level courts which fall under the territorial jurisdiction of different superior people's courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@35: Merging or separating administrative cases 1. A court may combine two or more cases which it has separately accepted into one case for settlement in an administrative case when fully meeting the following conditions : a/Separate cases with only one plaintiff against many administrative decisions or administrative acts, which are issued and executed by the same agency or organization or by a competent person in such agency or organization and closely linked to each other, or separate cases with many plaintiffs against the same administrative decision or administrative act; b/The merging of two or more administrative cases into one administrative case must ensure the speedy, effective and thorough trial and must not violate the trial preparation time limit. 2. A court may separate a case involving different claims into two or more administrative cases for settlement in case the administrative decision being initiated involves many litigators whose interests and obligations are unrelated to each other. 3. When merging or separating cases specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, the courts which have accepted the cases shall issue decisions and immediately send them to involved parties and procuracies of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@36: Procedure-conducting agencies and persons 1. Administrative procedure-conducting agencies include: a) Courts; b) The procuracy. 2. Administrative procedure-conducting persons include: a) Chief Justices, judges, people's jurors, verifiers, Court clerks; b) The procuracy chairpersons, procurators and examiners.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@37: Article 10. Tasks and powers of chief justices of courts 1. The chief justice of a court has the following duties and powers : a/To organize the settlement of administrative cases falling under their jurisdiction; to ensure the principle that judges and people's jurors adjudicate independently and obey only law; b/To decide to assign judges to settle administrative cases and people's jurors to participate in trial panels for administrative cases; to assign ombudspersons and court clerks to conduct procedures for administrative cases on the principles specified in Article 14 of this Law; c) Decide to replace judges, people's jurors and court clerks before the opening of the Court session; d) Decide to replace expert witnesses and/or interpreters before the Court session opens; e/To issue decisions and conduct administrative procedures; e) To protest according to cassation or reopening procedures against legally effective judgments or decisions of courts or propose competent chief judges to consider and protest according to cassation or reopening procedures against legally effective judgments or decisions of courts; g) Settle complaints and denunciations in accordance with this Law; h/To propose agencies or individuals that have administrative documents or administrative acts related to the administrative decisions or administrative acts against which lawsuits are instituted to consider amending, supplementing or annulling documents or terminate such acts if detecting signs of contravening law; i) Request competent authorities and individuals to consider amending or annulling legislative documents if they are suspected of contravening the Constitution, laws or legislative documents promulgated by superior regulatory agencies as prescribed in this Law; j/To handle acts of obstructing administrative procedures in accordance with law; l) Perform other tasks and powers as prescribed in this Law. 2. When the chief justice is absent, a deputy chief justice authorized by the chief justice shall perform the chief justice's tasks and powers, except the right to make protests specified at Point f, Clause 1 of this Article. The deputy chief justice shall take responsibility before the chief justice for the performance of the authorized tasks and powers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@38: Article 17.-Tasks and powers of judges When assigned by the chief judge of the court, the judge has the following tasks and powers : 1. Handling of the lawsuit petitions; 2. To compile dossiers of administrative cases; 3. To verify and collect documents and evidence; to hold court hearings and meetings to settle administrative cases in accordance with this Law; 4. To decide on the application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures; 5. Decisions to terminate or suspend, or to continue settling, administrative cases; 6. To explain and guide the involved parties so that they can exercise their right to request legal aid according to the provisions of legislation on legal aid; 7. Hold meetings to inspect the handover, access and disclosure of evidences and hold dialogues in accordance with this Law; 8. To decide to bring administrative cases to trial; 9. To summon persons to attend Court sessions or meetings; 10. To request agencies, organizations and individuals to supply documents and evidence or verify and collect documents and evidence in accordance with this Law; 11. To preside over or participate in the trial panel for administrative cases; to vote on matters falling under the trial panel's jurisdiction; 12. To examine the legality of administrative documents and administrative acts related to the sued administrative decisions or administrative acts and propose the court presidents to propose competent agencies or individuals to examine such administrative documents and administrative acts according to law provisions; 13. To detect and propose the Chief Justice of the Court to propose competent agencies to consider, amend, supplement or annul legal documents which show signs of contravening the Constitution, laws or legal documents of superior state agencies in accordance with this Law; 14. To handle acts of obstructing administrative procedures according to law provisions; 15. Perform other tasks and powers as prescribed in this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@39: Article 10.-Tasks and powers of the people's jurors When assigned by the chief judges of courts, the people's jurors shall have the following tasks and powers : 1. To study case files; 2. To request chief judges or judges assigned to settle administrative cases to issue necessary decisions falling under their competence; 3. To join the Council for trial of administrative cases; 4. To conduct procedural activities and be equal in powers to judges when voting on matters falling under the trial panel's jurisdiction.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@40: Duties and powers of the enforcement inspector When assigned by the chief judge of the court, an ombudsperson has the following tasks and powers : 1. To verify dossiers of administrative cases in which legally effective court judgments or decisions need to be reviewed according to cassation or reopening procedures; 2. To make conclusions on the verification and report verification results and propose plans on settlement of administrative cases to court presidents; 3. To collect documents and evidences according to the provisions of this Law; 4. To perform other tasks and exercise other powers in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@41: Article 10. Tasks and powers of court clerks When assigned, the Court clerks shall have the following tasks and powers: 1. To prepare necessary professional work before the opening of Court sessions; 2. To disseminate the internal rules of the Court session; 3. To check and report to the trial panels on the lists of persons summoned to court sessions; 4. To make minutes of the Court session, minutes of the meeting, minutes of the taking of testimonies of procedure participants; 5. To perform other tasks and exercise other powers in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@42: Article 10. Duties and powers of the head of the procuracy 1. When supervising the law observance in administrative procedures, the procuracy chairperson has the following tasks and powers : a/To organize and direct the supervision of law observance in administrative procedures; b/To decide to assign procurators to supervise law observance in administrative procedures, participate in court hearings and meetings to settle administrative cases in accordance with this Law and notify the court thereof; to assign examiners to conduct procedures for administrative cases on the principles specified in Article 14 of this Law; c/To decide on the replacement of procurators and/or examiners; d/To protest according to appellate, cassation or reopening procedures against court judgments or decisions in accordance with this Law; dd) Make requests and proposals as prescribed in this Law; e) Settle complaints and denunciations in accordance with this Law; g) Perform other tasks and powers as prescribed in this Law. 2. When the chief procurator is absent, a deputy chief procurator shall be authorized by the chief procurator to perform his/her tasks and powers, except the right to make an appeal specified at Point d, Clause 1 of this Article. The deputy chief procurator shall take responsibility before the chief procurator for the performance of his/her authorized tasks and powers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@43: Article 10. Tasks and powers of procurators When assigned by the procuracy director to supervise law observance in administrative procedures, a procurator has the following tasks and powers : 1. To supervise the return of lawsuit petitions; 2. To supervise the acceptance and settlement of cases; 3. To study case files; to verify and collect documents and evidences according to the provisions of Clause 6, Article 84 of this Law; 4. To participate in court hearings and meetings and present the procuracies' opinions on the resolution of cases according to the provisions of this Law; 5. To supervise court judgments and decisions; 6. To request or recommend courts to conduct procedural activities in accordance with this Law; 7. To propose the directors of competent procuracies to protest against court judgments or decisions which are contrary to law; 8. To supervise procedural activities of procedure participants; to request or recommend competent agencies or organizations to strictly handle procedure participants who commit law violations; 9. To perform other tasks and exercise other powers in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@44: Tasks and powers of inspectors When assigned, the inspectors shall have the following tasks and powers : 1. To study case files and report on results to procurators; 2. To compile dossiers on the supervision of administrative cases as assigned by procurators or directors of procuracies; 3. To assist procurators in supervising the law observance in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@45: Cases in which a proceeding officer must be refused or replaced The proceeding officers must refuse to conduct the procedures or be replaced if they fall into one of the following cases: 1. They are concurrently involved parties, representatives or relatives of involved parties; 2. They have participated in the capacity as defense counsels of the legitimate rights and interests of involved parties, witnesses, experts or interpreters in the same case; 3. They have participated in the issuance of administrative decisions or are related to administrative acts against which lawsuits are instituted; 4. They have participated in the issuance of decisions on settlement of complaints about administrative decisions or acts against which lawsuits are instituted; 5. They have participated in the issuance of disciplinary decisions on dismissal of civil servants or decisions on settlement of complaints about disciplinary decisions on dismissal of civil servants against which lawsuits are instituted; 6. They have participated in the issuance of decisions on handling of competition cases or decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases against which lawsuits are instituted; 7. Having participated in the drawing up of lists of voters against whom lawsuits are instituted; 8. There are other clear grounds that they may not be impartial while on duty.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@46: Cases where Judges or People's Jurors must refuse to conduct legal proceedings or are replaced Judges and people's jurors must refuse to conduct procedures or be replaced if falling into one of the following cases: 1. They fall into one of the cases prescribed in Article 45 of this Law; 2. They are members of the same trial panel and are relatives of each other; in this case, only one person may conduct procedures; 3. They have participated in the settlement of such administrative cases according to first-instance, appellate, cassation or reopening procedures and issued first-instance judgments, appellate judgments or decisions, cassation or reopening decisions and decisions to terminate the settlement of cases, decisions to recognize the successful dialogue results, except for members of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court or Judicial Committees of superior people's courts who are allowed to participate in the adjudication of such cases according to cassation or reopening procedures; 4. They have acted as procedure-conducting persons in the same case in the capacity as ombudspersons, court clerks, procurators or examiners.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@47: Cases in which Court clerks and/or examiners must refuse to conduct procedures or are replaced Court clerks and examiners shall refuse to conduct procedures or be replaced in one of the following cases : 1. They fall into one of the cases prescribed in Article 45 of this Law; 2. They have acted as procedure-conducting persons in the same case in the capacity as judge, people's juror, ombudsperson, court clerk, procurator or inspector; 3. They are relatives of one of other procedure-conducting persons in the same case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@48: Procedures for refusing to conduct procedures or requesting change of judges, people's jurors, ombudspersons or court clerks 1. The refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of Judges, People's Jurors, Ombudspersons or Court clerks before the opening of Court sessions must be made in writing, clearly stating the reasons and grounds for the refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of procedure-conducting persons. 2. The refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of persons defined in Clause 1 of this Article at Court sessions must be recorded in the Court session minutes.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@49: Decisions on replacement of Judges, People's Jurors, Ombudspersons and Court Clerks 1. Before the opening of a Court session, the replacement of Judges, People's Jurors, Ombudspersons and Court clerks shall be decided by the Chief Justices of Courts. In case the replaced judge is the court president, the case shall be settled as follows: a/The replaced judge is the president of the court; a/Judges being chief justices of district-level courts as decided by chief justices of provincial-level courts; b/Judges being chief justices of provincial-level courts shall be decided by chief justices of superior people's courts with territorial jurisdiction over such provincial-level courts; c/Judges being chief justices of superior people's courts as decided by the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court. 2. In Court sessions, the replacement of Judges, People's Jurors and Court clerks shall be decided by the trial panels after listening to opinions of the persons requested to be replaced. The trial panels shall discuss in the deliberation rooms and make decisions by majority. In cases where it is necessary to replace Judges, People's Jurors and Court clerks but there is no alternate person to replace them immediately, the trial panels shall issue decisions to postpone the Court sessions. The court presidents shall decide to appoint Judges, People's Jurors and Court clerks to replace the replaced persons; if the to be-replaced persons are the court presidents, the deciding competence shall comply with the provisions of Clause 1 of this Article. 3. Within 05 working days from the day on which the Court session is postponed, the Court president shall appoint another person to replace the Court president.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@50: Cases in which procurators or checkers must refuse to conduct legal proceedings or are replaced Procurators and checkers must refuse to conduct legal proceedings or be replaced if they fall into one of the following cases: 1. They fall into one of the cases prescribed in Article 45 of this Law; 2. They have acted as procedure-conducting persons in the same case in the capacity as judges, people's jurors, verifiers, court clerks, procurators or examiners in the same case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@51: Procedures for refusing to conduct legal proceedings or requesting the replacement of procurators or examiners 1. The refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of procurators before the opening of Court sessions must be made in writing, clearly stating the reasons and grounds therefor. The refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of inspectors must be made in writing, clearly stating the reasons and grounds therefor. 2. The refusal to conduct the procedures or the request for replacement of procurators in Court sessions must be recorded in the Court session minutes.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@52: - To decide on the replacement of procurators and/or examiners 1. Before the opening of a Court session, the replacement of procurators shall be decided by the chairperson of the procuracy of the same level. If the to be-replaced procurators are chairpersons of procuracies, the replacement shall be decided by chairpersons of immediate superior procuracies. The replacement of examiners shall be decided by the heads of the procuracies of the same level. 2. In Court sessions, the replacement of procurators shall be decided by the trial panels after listening to the opinions of the persons requested to be replaced. The trial panels shall discuss matters in the deliberation rooms and make decisions by majority. If the procurator must be replaced, the trial panel shall issue a decision to postpone the court hearing. The appointment of a procurator to replace the replaced procurator shall be decided by the chairman of the procuracy of the same level. If the replaced procurator is the chairman of the procuracy, the replacement shall be decided by the chairman of the immediate superior procuracy. 3. Within 03 working days from the day on which the Court session is postponed, the head of the procuracy shall appoint another person to replace the Court session and notify the Court in writing.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@53: Participants in legal proceedings Administrative procedure participants include involved parties, representatives of involved parties, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties, witnesses, experts and interpreters.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@54: Competence in administrative procedures and competence in administrative procedures of involved parties 1. Administrative procedure law capacity means the ability to have rights and obligations in administrative procedures prescribed by law. All agencies, organizations and individuals have the same administrative procedure law capacity in requesting courts to protect their rights and legitimate interests. 2. Administrative procedure act capacity means the ability to exercise by itself rights and perform obligations in administrative procedures or authorize a representative to participate in administrative procedures. 3. The involved parties being persons aged full 18 years or older shall have full administrative procedure act capacity, except for persons who have lost their civil act capacity or otherwise provided for by law. For persons with limited civil act capacity or persons with limited cognition or behavior control, their administrative procedural act capacity shall be determined under court decisions. 4. Involved parties being minors, persons losing civil act capacity, persons with restricted civil act capacity or persons with limited cognition or act control may exercise their rights and perform their obligations in administrative procedures through their at-law representatives. 5. Involved parties being agencies or organizations shall exercise their rights and perform their obligations in administrative procedures through their at-law representatives.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@55: Rights and obligations of involved parties The involved parties shall have equal rights and obligations when participating in the procedures, including: 1. To respect courts and strictly observe the court's internal rules; 2. To pay court cost advances, court costs, fees and other procedural expenses according to law provisions; 3. To retain, change, supplement or withdraw their requests; 4. To provide fully and accurately their addresses of residence and head-offices; in the course of settling cases, if there is any change in their addresses, residence places or head-offices, to promptly notify such to other involved parties and the court; 5. To supply documents, evidences and proofs to protect their legitimate rights and interests; 6. To request agencies, organizations and individuals that are keeping or managing documents and evidences to supply such documents and evidences to them for submission to courts; 7. To request courts to verify and collect documents and evidence of cases which they cannot do by themselves; to request courts to compel other involved parties to produce documents and evidence they are keeping or managing; to request courts to issue decisions to compel agencies, organizations or individuals that are keeping or managing evidence to supply evidence; to request courts to summon witnesses and request assessment and valuation of assets; 8. To know, take notes and copy documents and evidence produced by other involved parties or collected by courts, except documents and evidence not publicized under Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law; 9. To submit copies of lawsuit petitions and documents and evidence to courts for sending to other involved parties or their lawful representatives, except documents and evidence not to be publicized under Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law; 10. To request courts to decide on the application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures; 11. To request courts to hold meetings to examine the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidence, to hold dialogues and participate in meetings in the course of settling cases by courts; 12. To receive valid notices for the performance of their rights and obligations; 13. To protect by themselves, ask lawyers or other persons to protect their legitimate rights and interests; 14. To request the replacement of procedure-conducting persons or procedure participants; 15. To participate in court hearings and meetings; 16. To be present under court summonses and abide by court decisions in the course of settling cases; 17. To request courts to bring persons with related interests and obligations to participate in procedures; 18. To request courts to suspend the resolution of cases; 19. To raise questions to other persons on matters related to the cases or propose to courts matters to be questioned on other persons; to confront each other or witnesses; 20. To argue at court sessions, to make arguments on the evaluation of evidences and applicable laws; 21. To be provided with extracts of court judgments or decisions; 22. To appeal against or complain about court judgments or decisions; 23. To request competent persons to protest according to cassation or reopening procedures against legally effective court judgments or decisions; 24. To strictly abide by legally effective court judgments or decisions; 25. To use the rights of involved parties in a good faith manner, not to abuse them to obstruct procedural activities of courts and other involved parties; 26. Other rights and obligations as prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@56: Rights and obligations of litigators The litigators shall have the following rights and obligations: 1. The rights and obligations prescribed in Article 55 of this Law; 2. To change the contents of lawsuit petitions, if the statute of limitations for lawsuit initiation still exists; to withdraw part or whole of lawsuit petitions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@57: Rights and obligations of defendants The defendant has the following rights and obligations: 1. The rights and obligations prescribed in Article 55 of this Law; 2. To be notified by the court of the defendant's circumstances; 3. To prove the correctness and legality of administrative decisions or administrative acts against which lawsuits are instituted; 4. Amend or annul administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal, decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases or voter lists against which lawsuits are instituted; stop or remedy administrative acts against which lawsuits are instituted.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@58: Rights and obligations of persons with related interests and obligations 1. Persons with related interests and obligations may make independent claims and participate in procedures with the plaintiff or the defendant. 2. Persons with related interests and obligations that make independent claims have the rights and obligations of litigators specified in Article 56 of this Law. 3. Persons with related interests and obligations, if participating in procedures with the plaintiff or having only interests, have the rights and obligations prescribed in Article 55 of this Law. 4. Persons with related interests and obligations who participate in procedures on the side of the defendant or have only obligations have the rights and obligations specified in Clauses 1 and 2, Article 57 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@59: Inheriting administrative procedural rights and obligations 1. In case the plaintiff being an individual has died and his/her rights and obligations are inherited, his/her heir shall participate in the procedures. 2. In case the plaintiff is an agency or organization which is consolidated, merged, divided, split or dissolved, the agency, organization or individual that inherits the rights and obligations of the former shall exercise the procedural rights and perform the procedural obligations of that agency or organization. 3. In case the defendant is a competent person in an agency or organization which is consolidated, merged, divided, split or dissolved, the person who takes over his/her rights and obligations shall participate in the procedures. In case the defendant is a competent person in an agency or organization whose title no longer exists, the head of such agency or organization shall exercise the rights and perform the obligations of the defendant. 4. In case the defendant is an agency or organization which is consolidated, merged, divided or split up, the agency or organization inheriting the rights and obligations of the former shall exercise the procedural rights and perform the procedural obligations of that agency or organization. In case the defendant is a dissolved agency or organization without an heir, the superior agency or organization shall exercise the rights and perform the obligations of the defendant. 5. In case of merger, division, separation, dissolution or adjustment of administrative boundaries within an administrative unit in which the subject matter of the administrative decision is changed, the agency, organization or individual that has issued the administrative decision shall participate in the procedures in the capacity as the defendant at the court of the place in which the agency, organization or individual has issued the administrative decision against which the lawsuit is filed. The agency receiving the subject matter of the administrative decision against which the lawsuit is filed shall participate in the procedures in the capacity as a person with related interests and obligations. 6. The inheritance of procedural rights and obligations may be accepted by courts at any stage in the course of settling administrative cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@60: Representative 1. Representatives in administrative procedures include at-law representatives and authorized representatives. 2. The representative at law in administrative procedures may be one of the following persons, unless he/she has his/her representation rights restricted under law: a/Parents, for minor children; b) Guardians of ward; c) Persons appointed by Courts to be legally incapacitated persons; persons with limited cognition and behavior control; d) Heads of agencies and organizations who are appointed or elected in accordance with law; dd) Other persons as prescribed by law. 3. Authorized representatives in administrative procedures must have full civil act capacity and be authorized in writing by involved parties or their representatives at law. In case a household, cooperative group or another organization without legal entity participates in administrative procedures, its members may authorize one of them or another person to act as their representative to participate in administrative procedures. In case the defendant is an agency or organization or its head, the defendant may authorize only his/her deputy to act as his/her representative. The authorized representative shall participate in the settlement of the whole case and fully exercise the rights and perform the obligations of the defendant under this Law. 4. At-law representatives or authorized representatives in administrative procedures terminate their representation in accordance with the Civil Code. 5. At-law representatives in administrative procedures shall exercise administrative procedural rights and perform administrative procedural obligations of involved parties they represent. Authorized representatives in administrative procedures shall exercise the rights and perform the administrative procedural obligations of the authorizers. Authorized persons may not re-authorize to third parties. 6. The following persons may not act as representatives: a) If they are involved parties in the same case with the represented persons and their legitimate rights and interests are contrary to those of the represented persons; b/If they are acting as representatives in administrative procedures for other involved parties whose legitimate rights and interests are contrary to those of the represented persons in the same case. 7. Cadres and civil servants in courts, procuracies, inspectorates and judgment enforcement agencies; civil servants, officers and non-commissioned officers in the public security force may not act as representatives in administrative procedures, unless they participate in procedures in the capacity as representatives of their agencies or as at-law representatives.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@61: Defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests 1. Defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests are persons participating in procedures to protect the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests. 2. The following persons may act as defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests when so requested by the involved parties and are allowed by courts to carry out procedures for registration of defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests : a) Lawyers shall participate in legal proceedings in accordance with the law on lawyers; b) Legal aid professionals or persons participating in legal aid services in accordance with laws on legal aid services; c) Vietnamese citizens who have full legal capacity, have legal knowledge, have not been convicted or have been convicted but have had their criminal records expunged, are not subject to administrative handling measures, are not officials and public employees in the Court, Procuracy, Inspection, Judgment Enforcement Agency; are officials, officers and non-commissioned officers in the Public Security Force. 3. Defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests may protect the legitimate rights and interests of many involved parties in the same case, provided that the legitimate rights and interests of these persons are not opposite each other. Many defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests may jointly protect the legitimate rights and interests of one involved party in the case. 4. When requesting the Court to carry out procedures for registration of defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties, the requesters shall produce the following papers: a/The written request for registration of defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties; a/The lawyers must produce papers prescribed in Clause 2, Article 27 of the Law on Lawyers; b) Legal aid professionals or persons participating in legal aid services must present documents appointing legal aid-providing persons of legal aid-providing organizations and legal aid professional's cards or lawyer's cards; c/Vietnamese citizens who fully meet the conditions prescribed at Point c, Clause 2 of this Article shall produce the involved parties' written requests and personal identification papers. 5. After checking papers and finding that the applicant fully satisfies the conditions for acting as defense counsel of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests specified in Clauses 2,3 and 4 of this Article, within 3 working days after receiving the request, the court shall record the defense counsel of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests in the register and give certification in the written request for defense counsel of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests. In case of refusal, the court shall notify such in writing to the applicant, clearly stating the reason. 6. Defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests have the following rights and obligations : a/To participate in legal proceedings from the time of initiating lawsuits or at any stage in the administrative legal proceedings; b) To collect documents and evidences and supply them to courts, study case files and take notes and make photocopies of necessary documents in case files in order to protect the legitimate rights and interests of involved parties, except for documents and evidences which must not be publicized under Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law; c) Attend the Court session or meeting or, if not, send the written defense of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests to the Court for consideration; d) To request on behalf of involved parties to change procedure-conducting persons or other procedure participants according to the provisions of this Law; dd) To assist involved parties in legal matters related to the protection of their legitimate rights and interests; to receive on behalf of involved parties procedural papers and documents which the Courts have sent or notified, if so authorized by involved parties, and to transfer them to involved parties; f/The rights and obligations prescribed in Clauses 1,6,9,16,19 and 20, Article 55 of this Law; g) Other rights and obligations as prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@62: Witness 1. Witnesses are persons who know details related to the contents of the cases and are requested by involved parties and summoned by courts to participate in procedures. Persons who have lost their civil act capacity cannot act as witnesses. 2. Witnesses have the following rights and obligations : a) Provide all information, documents and items they have acquired related to the resolution of the case; b) Honestly declare details they know related to the resolution of the cases; c) To take responsibility before law for their declarations, to pay compensation for damage caused to the involved parties or other persons by their untruthful declarations; d) Present himself/herself at the Court and the Court session under the Court's subpoena if the witness testifier's testimony is to be taken at the Court or the Court session; if the witness testifier does not show up for the Court session without plausible reasons and his/her absence obstructs the trial, the trial panel may issue a decision to escort the witness testifier to the Court session; dd) To make commitments before courts to exercise their rights and perform their obligations, except for cases where witnesses are minors; f/To refuse to make declarations if their declarations are related to State secrets, professional secrets, business secrets or personal secrets or such declarations badly or adversely affect the involved parties being their relatives; g) Take leave during the time the Court submits or takes statements; h) Receive payment for relevant costs as prescribed by law; i) Request the Court that has summoned them and competent authorities to protect their lives, health, honor, dignity, property, and other legitimate rights and interests when participating in the procedures; k) Complain about procedural actions, denounce violations against the law committed by presiding agencies and presiding officers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@63: Examiner 1. Expert-witnesses are persons who have necessary knowledge and experiences as prescribed by law on the fields where exist objects to be expertised, are selected under agreement between involved parties or solicited by courts to expertise such objects at the request of one or all involved parties. 2. Expert-witnesses shall have the following rights and obligations : a/To read documents in case files related to the expertised objects; to request courts to supply documents necessary for the expertising; b) To ask participants in legal proceedings questions about matters related to the expertised objects; c/To be present under court summonses and answer questions related to the assessment; d/To notify in writing the court of the impossibility to conduct expertise because the matters to be expertised fall beyond their professional capability; or the documents supplied for the expertise are insufficient or unusable; dd) To preserve the received documents and return them to the court together with expertising conclusions or with notices on impossibility to conduct expertising; e) Not to collect documents being the objects of expertise by themselves, to contact other procedure participants if such contact affects the expertise results; not to disclose secrets of information they know when conducting expertise or not to notify the expertise results to other persons, except for the persons who have decided to solicit expertise; g/To independently make assessment conclusions; to make assessment conclusions honestly and groundedly; h) Receive payment for expenses as prescribed by law; i) To make commitments before courts to exercise their rights and perform their obligations. 3. Expert-witnesses must refuse or be replaced in the following cases: a) They are concurrently involved parties, representatives or relatives of involved parties; b) They have participated in the procedures in the capacity as defense counsels of the legitimate rights and interests of involved parties, witnesses or interpreters in the same cases; c/Having conducted assessment of the same object to be assessed in the same case; d) They have conducted procedures in the same case in the capacity as judge, people's juror, ombudsperson, court clerk, procurator or inspector; e/There are other clear grounds to believe that they may not be impartial while performing their tasks.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@64: Interpreter 1. Interpreters are persons capable of translating another language into Vietnamese and vice versa in case procedure participants cannot use Vietnamese. Interpreters shall be selected by an involved party or agreed upon by involved parties and accepted by courts or requested by courts to interpret. The literate persons of the disabled who see or hear, speak in language and sign of the disabled who hear and speak are also considered as interpreters. In case only the representative or relative of a person with vision impairment or hearing impairment or a person with speech impairment knows his/her language and sign, such representative or relative may be accepted by the court to act as an interpreter for such person. 2. Interpreters have the following rights and obligations : a) Appear as per the Court's subpoena; b) To interpret truthfully, objectively and properly; c) To request procedure-conducting persons and procedure participants to additionally explain the speeches which need to be interpreted; d) Not to contact other procedure participants if such contact affects the truthfulness, objectivity and truthfulness of their interpretation; dd) Receive payments for costs in accordance with laws; e) To make commitments before courts to exercise their rights and perform their obligations. 3. Interpreters must refuse to interpret or be replaced in the following cases: a) They are concurrently involved parties, representatives or relatives of involved parties; b) They have participated in the procedures in the capacity as defense counsels of the legitimate rights and interests of involved parties, witnesses or expert-witnesses in the same cases; c) They have conducted procedures in the same case in the capacity as judge, people's juror, ombudsperson, court clerk, procurator or inspector; d) There are other clear grounds that they may not be impartial while performing their tasks.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@65: Procedures for rejecting expert witnesses or interpreters or requesting replacement of expert witnesses or interpreters 1. Before the opening of a Court session, the refusal of expert-witnesses or interpreters or the request for replacement of expert-witnesses or interpreters must be made in writing, clearly stating the reasons therefor; the replacement of expert-witnesses or interpreters shall be decided by the chief judges of the Courts. 2. At the Court session, the refusal of expert-witnesses or interpreters or the request for replacement of expert-witnesses or interpreters must be recorded in the minutes of the Court session; the replacement of expert-witnesses or interpreters shall be decided by the trial panels after listening to the opinions of the persons requested to be replaced.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@66: The right to request the application of provisional emergency measures 1. In the course of settling a case, involved parties and their representatives may request the court currently settling the case to apply one or more interim urgent measures specified in Article 68 of this Law to temporarily settle urgent requests of involved parties, protect evidence and preserve the current state to avoid irremediable damage and ensure the settlement of the case or judgment enforcement. 2. In case of emergency circumstances, it is necessary to immediately protect evidences and prevent possible serious consequences, agencies, organizations and individuals may file petitions to request competent courts to issue decisions to apply provisional urgent measures specified in Article 68 of this Law concurrently with filing petitions to initiate lawsuits at those courts. 3. The requester for application of provisional urgent measures is not required to apply security measures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@67: Competence to decide on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures 1. The application, change or cancellation of provisional emergency measures before the opening of a Court session shall be considered and decided by a judge. 2. The application, change or cancellation of provisional emergency measures in Court sessions shall be considered and decided by the trial panels.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@68: Temporary emergency measures 1. Suspension of execution of administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal or decisions on handling of competition cases. 2. Suspension of administrative acts. 3. Prohibiting or forcing the performance of certain acts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@69: Suspension of execution of administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal or decisions on handling of competition cases The suspension of execution of administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal or decisions on handling of competition cases shall apply if in the course of settling cases there are grounds to believe that the execution of such decisions will lead to irremediable serious consequences.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@70: Suspension of administrative acts The suspension of the administrative acts shall apply if there are grounds to believe that the continued performance of administrative acts will lead to irremediable serious consequences.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@71: Prohibition or compulsion of certain acts Prohibiting or forcing the performance of certain acts shall apply if in the course of settling cases there are grounds to believe that involved parties have committed or failed to commit certain acts, thus affecting the settlement of cases or the legitimate rights and interests of other persons involved in cases being settled by courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@72: Responsibilities for requesting and applying provisional emergency measures 1. Involved parties that request courts to issue decisions to apply provisional urgent measures shall take responsibility before law for their requests. If causing damage, they shall pay compensations therefor in accordance with law. 2. If the Courts apply provisional emergency measures at variance with the involved parties' requests, thus causing damage to the persons subject to the application of provisional emergency measures or to the third persons, the Courts shall have to pay compensation therefor. 3. If the Courts apply provisional emergency measures not within the prescribed time limit or fail to apply such measures without plausible reasons, thus causing damage to the petitioners, the Courts must pay compensation therefor. 4. The compensation for damage specified in Clauses 2 and 3 of this Article complies with the Law on State Compensation Liability.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@73: Procedures for application of provisional emergency measures 1. The person requesting the court to apply a provisional urgent measure shall file an application with the competent court enclosed with documents and evidence to prove the necessity to apply such provisional urgent measure. 2. A written request for application of provisional urgent measures must contain the following principal details: a) Date of writing the application; b) Name, address; telephone number, fax number, e-mail address (if any) of the requester for application of provisional emergency measures; c) Name, address; phone number, fax number, e-mail address (if any) of the person requested to be applied the provisional emergency measures; d) Summary of the administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about the decision on handling of competition case or administrative act against which a lawsuit is instituted; dd) Reasons for application of provisional emergency measures; e) Provisional emergency measures to be applied and specific requirements. 3. For a request for application of provisional urgent measures specified in Clause 1, Article 66 of this Law, the judge assigned to settle the case shall consider and settle it. Within 48 hours after receiving the request, the judge shall issue a decision to apply provisional urgent measures. In case of rejection of the request, the judge shall notify such in writing to the requester and the procuracy of the same level, clearly stating the reason. If the trial panel receives a petition for application of provisional urgent measures at a court hearing, it shall consider and issue a decision to immediately apply such measures. In case of rejection of the petition, the trial panel shall notify such to the petitioner and record the rejection in the court hearing minutes. 4. For a request for application of provisional urgent measures specified in Clause 2, Article 66 of this Law, after receiving the request together with the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents and evidence, the court president shall immediately appoint a judge to accept and settle the request. Within 48 hours after receiving the request, the judge shall consider and issue a decision to apply provisional urgent measures; if refusing to accept the request, the judge shall notify such in writing to the requester and the procuracy of the same level, clearly stating the reason.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@74: Change or cancellation of provisional emergency measures 1. At the request of involved parties, the Courts shall consider and decide to change the provisional emergency measures being applied when they deem that such measures are no longer appropriate and they need to be changed by other provisional emergency measures. 2. The Court shall issue a decision to cancel the applied provisional emergency measures in one of the following cases: a) The requester for application of interim injunctive relief requests cancellation of the applied interim injunctive relief; b) The grounds for application of provisional emergency measures no longer exist; c) The case has been settled by a legally effective court judgment or decision; d) The Court returns the lawsuit petition as prescribed in this Law; dd) The case is terminated as prescribed in Article 143 of this Law. 3. Procedures for changing or canceling provisional urgent measures comply with Article 73 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@75: Article 13. Effect of decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures 1. Decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures take immediate effect. 2. The Courts must immediately issue or send decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional emergency measures to involved parties, the procuracies of the same level and the civil judgment-executing bodies of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@76: Complaints and proposals on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures 1. Involved parties may file complaints and procuracies may file petitions with chief justices of courts currently settling cases about decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures or the non-issuance of such decisions by judges. The time limit for filing complaints or petitions is 3 working days after receiving decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures or notices of judges on non-issuance of decisions on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures. 2. At the Court session, the involved parties may lodge complaints and the procuracies may propose the trial panels to apply, change or cancel provisional emergency measures or not to apply, change or cancel provisional emergency measures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@77: Settlement of complaints and recommendations on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures 1. The chief judge of the court shall consider and settle complaints and recommendations specified in Clause 1 Article 76 of this Law within 03 working days from the day on which such complaints and recommendations are received. 2. The decision on settlement of a complaint or recommendation of the chief justice of a court is final and must be immediately issued or sent to involved parties, the same-level procuracy and civil judgment enforcement agency. 3. The settlement of complaints and petitions in Court sessions shall fall under the jurisdiction of the trial panels. The trial panels' decisions on settlement of complaints and petitions shall be the final ones.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@78: Burden of proof in administrative procedures 1. The petitioner is obliged to provide a copy of administrative decision or disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case, copy of decision on complaint settlement (if any) and provide other evidence to protect his/her legitimate rights and interests; in case of failure to provide, he/she must specify the reasons. 2. Defendants are obliged to provide courts with complaint settlement dossiers (if any) and copies of documents and materials on which administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal or decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases or administrative acts are based. 3. Persons with related interests and obligations are obliged to provide evidence to protect their legitimate rights and interests.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@79: Facts and facts are not proof. 1. The following facts and events are not required to be proved: a) Clear facts and facts that are known to all and recognized by the Court; b) Details and facts specified in the legally effective court judgment or decision; c) Details and facts that have been written in the document and legally notarized or authenticated; in case of suspicion of the authenticity of details and facts in this document, the Judge may request the agencies, organizations and individuals that provided or submitted the document to present the original document. 2. If an involved party acknowledges or does not object to details, facts, documents or documents given by the other involved party, the latter shall not have to prove them. For involved parties having representatives to participate in procedures, the representatives' acknowledgement or non-objection shall be regarded as the involved parties' acknowledgement if such acknowledgement does not exceed the scope of representation.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@80: Evidence Evidence in an administrative case means factual things which are handed over or presented to the court by involved parties, agencies, organizations or individuals in the course of legal proceedings or collected by the court according to the order and procedures prescribed by this Law and used by the court as a basis for determining objective details of the case and for determining that the involved parties' claims or protests are well grounded and lawful.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@81: Sources of evidence Evidence is obtained from the following sources: 1. Readable, audible or visible materials, electronic data; 2. Exhibits; 3. Involved parties' testimonies; 4. Testimonies of witnesses; 5. Expertising conclusions; 6. The record on the on-site appraisal results; 7. Property valuation and price appraisal results; 8. Written certification of legal events and acts, made by functional persons; 9. Notarized or authenticated documents; 10. Other sources as prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@82: Identification of evidence 1. Readable documents shall be regarded as evidence if they are originals or lawfully notarized or certified copies or supplied or certified by competent agencies or organizations. 2. Audible and visible documents shall be regarded as evidence if they are presented together with written presentations of their owners on the origin of such documents if they have recorded audio or video recordings by themselves or written certifications of the origin of such documents by the persons who have supplied such documents to the presenters or documents on matters related to such audio or video recordings. 3. Electronic data messages may be expressed in the form of exchange of electronic data, electronic documents, e-mail, telegraph, fax and other similar forms in accordance with the law on e-transactions. 4. Exhibits to be regarded as evidence must be original exhibits related to the case. 5. Testimonies of involved parties and witnesses shall be regarded as evidence if they are recorded in writing, audio tapes and disks, video tapes and disks or other audio and visual archival devices specified in Clause 2 of this Article or oral statements made at court hearings. 6. Expertising conclusions shall be regarded as evidences if such expertise is conducted according to the procedures prescribed by law. 7. The record of on-site appraisal results shall be regarded as evidence if the appraisal is conducted according to procedures prescribed by law. 8. Property valuation and price appraisal results shall be regarded as evidence if the valuation and price appraisal are conducted according to the procedures prescribed by law. 9. Written certification of legal events or acts made on spot by functional persons shall be regarded as evidence if such certification is made according to procedures prescribed by law. 10. Other sources as prescribed by law which are determined as evidence.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@83: Submission of documents and evidence 1. In the course of settling administrative cases, involved parties have the right and obligation to hand over materials and evidence to courts. If involved parties fail to hand over or hand over insufficient materials and evidence requested by courts without plausible reasons, courts shall settle the cases based on materials and evidence handed over by involved parties and collected by courts under Clause 2, Article 84 of this Law. 2. The handover of materials and evidences by involved parties to courts must be recorded in writing. Such a record must clearly state the appellations, forms, contents and characteristics of materials and evidences; number of copies and pages of materials and evidences and time of receipt; signatures or fingerprints of the handers, signatures of the recipients and seals of courts. A record must be made in two copies, one to be filed in the administrative case file and the other to be handed to the involved parties handing over materials and evidences. 3. The involved parties that hand over materials and evidences in ethnic minority or foreign languages to Courts must enclose their lawfully notarized or authenticated Vietnamese translations. 4. The time limit for handing over materials and evidences shall be fixed by the Judge assigned to settle the case but must not exceed the time limit for trial preparation according to first-instance procedures specified in Article 130 of this Law. 5. If the materials and evidences that have been submitted do not provide sufficient grounds for the settlement of the case, the Judge shall request the involved parties to provide additional materials and evidences. 6. If involved parties cannot collect materials and evidences by themselves and request or deem it necessary, the Courts may verify and collect materials and evidences by themselves or entrust the verification and collection of materials and evidences to clarify the circumstances of the cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@84: Verification, collection of documents and evidence 1. The involved parties may collect evidences by themselves by the following measures: a) Collect readable, audible and visible documents, electronic data messages; b) Gather exhibits; c) Identify the witness and obtain his/her certification; d) To request agencies, organizations and individuals to permit the duplication or supply of documents related to the settlement of cases, which are being kept and managed by such agencies, organizations and individuals; dd) Request the People's Committee of commune to authenticate the signatures of witnesses; e) To request the Courts to collect materials and evidences if the involved parties cannot collect materials and evidences; g) Request the Court to issue a decision to solicit expert examination and valuation of property; h) Request other entities to perform other tasks as prescribed by law. 2. In the cases prescribed by this Law, judges may take one or several of the following measures to collect materials and evidences: a) Taking testimonies of involved parties or witnesses; b) The confrontation among the involved parties, between the involved parties and witnesses; c) On-site inspection and assessment; d/To solicit expert opinions; dd) Decide property valuation; e) Entrust the collection and verification of documents and evidences; g) To request agencies, organizations and individuals to supply readable, audible or visible documents or other exhibits related to the settlement of cases; h) Other measures prescribed in this Law. 3. When taking the measures specified at Points c, d, e, f and g, Clause 2 of this Article, judges shall issue decisions clearly stating the reasons and requests of courts. 4. During the cassation or reopening process, the enforcement inspector may take the measures for collecting evidence specified in Point a and Point g Clause 2 of this Article. When the ombudspersons take the measures specified at Point g, Clause 2 of this Article, the courts shall issue decisions clearly stating the reasons for and the requests of the courts. 5. Within 03 working days from the day on which the documents and evidence are collected, the Court must notify the involved parties to exercise their rights and obligations. 6. The procuracy has the right to request the Court to verify and collect materials and evidences during the settlement of the case. In case of protesting against the Court's judgment or decision according to appellate, cassation or reopening procedures, the procuracy may verify and collect materials and evidences to ensure the protest.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@85: Taking testimonies of involved parties 1. The Judges shall take testimonies of involved parties only when the involved parties have not yet made their testimonies or the contents of their testimonies are incomplete or unclear. The involved parties must write their testimonies by themselves and sign their names thereon. Where the involved parties cannot write their testimonies by themselves, the Judges shall take testimonies of the involved parties. The taking of testimonies of the involved parties shall only focus on details which the involved parties have not fully or clearly declared. The Judges themselves or the Court clerks shall record the testimonies of the involved parties in the minutes. The Judges shall take testimonies of the involved parties at the Court offices, or the testimonies of the involved parties may be taken outside the Court offices in case of necessity. 2. The record of the involved parties' testimonies must be read or heard and signed or fingerprinted by the testifiers. The involved parties may request amendments and/or supplements to be inscribed in the record of testimonies and signed or fingerprinted for certification. The record must bear signatures of the testimony taker and the record maker and the court seal. If the record is made in separate pages, each page must bear the signature and seal on the adjoining edges of the pages. If the record of involved parties' testimonies is made outside the court office, witnesses or certification of the commune-level People's Committee or police office or the agency or organization where the record is made are required. If involved parties are illiterate, witnesses selected by them are required. 3. The taking of testimonies of involved parties who are under eighteen years of age, persons with restricted civil act capacity or persons with limited cognition or behavior control must be conducted in the presence of their representatives at law or persons managing and looking after such persons.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@86: Taking witness testimonies 1. At the request of involved parties or when deeming it necessary, judges shall take testimonies of witnesses. 2. The procedures for taking witnesses' testimonies shall be carried out like those for taking involved parties' testimonies under Article 85 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@87: Confrontation 1. At the request of involved parties or when seeing that there is contradiction in testimonies of involved parties or witnesses, judges shall conduct confrontations among involved parties, between involved parties and witnesses or among witnesses. 2. Confrontation must be recorded in writing, signed or fingerprinted by participants in the confrontation.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@88: On-site inspection and assessment 1. The judge shall conduct on-site examination in the presence of representatives of the People's Committee of commune, police office of commune, ward or town or the agency or organization where the subject matter is examined; and shall notify the on-site examination in advance so that the involved parties know and witness such examination. 2. On-site inspection and assessment must be recorded in writing. Such a record must clearly state the inspection and assessment results and describe the site, and bear the signatures of the person conducting the inspection and assessment and signatures or fingerprints of involved parties if they are present, representatives of the commune-level People's Committee, police office or agency or organization where exists the to-be-inspected and-appraised object and other persons invited to participate in the inspection and assessment. Such a record must be signed and stamped for certification by representatives of the commune-level People's Committee, police office or agency or organization where exists the to-be-inspected and-appraised object. 3. All acts of obstructing on-site examination and appraisal are strictly prohibited. 4. The judge may request the People's Committee of commune or police office of commune where the on-site inspection/appraisal is carried out to provide assistance in case of obstruction of the on-site inspection/appraisal.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@89: EXAMINATION OR REQUEST FOR EXAMINATION 1. Involved parties may request courts to solicit expertise or request expertise by themselves after they have requested courts to solicit expertise but the courts refuse their requests. The right to request expertise by themselves shall be exercised before the courts issue decisions to bring the cases to first-instance trial. 2. At the request of involved parties or when deeming it necessary, judges shall issue decisions to solicit expert opinions. Such decisions must clearly state the names and addresses of expert-witnesses, subjects to be expertised, matters to be expertised and specific requests for expert-witnesses' conclusions. 3. If the expertising conclusions are deemed unclear, at the request of involved parties or when it is deemed necessary, the Courts shall request the expert-witnesses to explain the expertising conclusions and summon the expert-witnesses to Court sessions to directly present relevant contents. 4. At the request of involved parties or when deeming it necessary, courts shall issue additional assessment decisions in case assessment conclusions are unclear or incomplete or when new matters related to details of cases with assessment conclusions have arisen. 5. The re-assessment shall be conducted in case there are grounds to believe that the first assessment conclusion is inaccurate or violates law or in special cases under decisions of the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court in accordance with the Law on Judicial Assessment.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@90: APPROVAL FOR ASSESSMENT OF FACILITY INFORMATION 1. If the evidence is denounced to be forgery, the person who provides such evidence may withdraw it; if not, the denouncer may request a court or the court may decide to solicit expert examination under Article 89 of this Law. 2. If the forgery of evidence shows criminal signs, the court shall transfer the case to a competent investigation agency for consideration in accordance with the criminal procedure law. 3. The person who gives evidences concluded as forgery must compensate for damage as prescribed by law if such forgery causes damage to other persons and must bear the cost of expertise if the Court decides to solicit expertise.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@91: Valuation and valuation of assets 1. Involved parties may provide property prices; reach agreement on the valuation of property and provide such prices to courts. 2. The involved parties may agree to select price appraisal organizations to conduct asset price appraisal and provide price appraisal results to courts. The asset price appraisal shall comply with the law provisions on asset price appraisal. 3. The court shall issue a decision on property valuation and set up a valuation council in one of the following cases : a) At the request of one or all involved parties; b) The involved parties offer different property prices or fail to reach agreement on property prices; c) The persons concerned do not agree to select the asset price appraisal organization; d) The petitioner agrees with the valuation organization to valuate the property at a price higher than the market price where the property is valued at the time of valuation in order to make illicit profits from the property of the State or the defendant agrees with the valuation organization to valuate the property at a price lower than the market price in order to evade the liability to pay compensation for the damage sufferer or there are grounds to believe that the valuation organization has committed law violation upon valuation. 4. The order and procedures for establishing a valuation council are as follows: a/A valuation council set up by a court is composed of a representative of the finance agency as its chairman and representatives of concerned professional agencies as its members. Persons who have conducted procedures in the case and persons defined in Article 45 of this Law may not join the valuation council. The Valuation Council shall conduct valuation only when all its members are present. When necessary, representatives of the commune-level People's Committee of the locality where exists the to-be-valued asset may be invited to witness the valuation. Involved parties shall be notified in advance of the time and place of valuation and may attend and give their opinions on the valuation. The valuation council may decide on the price of the to-be-valued asset; b) The finance authority and relevant specialized agencies shall appoint their persons to participate in the valuation council and enable them to perform their duties. Persons appointed as members of the valuation council shall participate in valuation. If the finance authority or specialized agency does not appoint a person to participate in the valuation council, the court shall request a competent authority to direct the finance authority or specialized agency to comply with the request of the court. If the person appointed to participate in the valuation council fails to participate without legitimate reasons, the court shall request the head of the agency that appointed such person to consider his/her responsibility, appoint another person to participate in the valuation council and notify the court for continuing the valuation; c) The valuation must be recorded in writing, clearly stating the opinions of each member and the involved parties if they attend. The valuation council's decisions must be voted for by more than half of its members. The valuation council's members, involved parties and witnesses shall sign the record. 5. The revaluation of property shall be conducted when there are grounds to believe that the results of the first valuation are inaccurate or inconsistent with the market price of the locality where exists the property at the time of settlement of the administrative case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@92: Fiduciary duties to collect documents and evidences 1. In the course of settling an administrative case, the court may issue a decision to entrust another court or competent agency specified in Clause 4 of this Article to take testimonies of involved parties and witnesses, examine and appraise the case on the spot, valuate property or apply other measures to collect documents and evidence and verify details of the administrative case. 2.
