The entrustment decision must clearly state the names and addresses of the plaintiff, the defendant and specific entrusted jobs for collection of documents and evidence. 3. The court that receives the entrustment decision shall perform the specific tasks entrusted within 30 days after receiving the entrustment decision and notify in writing the result to the court that has issued the entrustment decision. In case of failure to perform the entrusted tasks, it shall notify such in writing, clearly stating the reason to the court that has issued the entrustment decision. 4. In case the collection of materials and evidences must be conducted overseas, the Courts shall carry out the entrustment procedures through competent agencies of Vietnam or competent agencies of foreign countries which and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam are contracting parties to treaties on this matter or on the principle of reciprocity, which must not contravene Vietnamese law and conform to international law and practices. 5. If the fiduciary duties cannot be performed in accordance with Clause 3 and Clause 4 of this Article or the fiduciary duties have been performed but no response has been received, the Court shall settle the case on the basis of evidences included in the case file.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@93: Request agencies, organizations and individuals to provide documents and evidence 1. Involved parties may request agencies, organizations and individuals to supply documents and evidence. When requesting agencies, organizations and individuals to supply documents and evidence, involved parties shall make written requests clearly stating documents and evidence to be supplied, reasons for requesting the supply of documents and evidence; full names and addresses of individuals, names and addresses of agencies or organizations managing and keeping documents and evidence to be supplied. Agencies, organizations and individuals shall provide documents and evidence to involved parties within 15 days after receiving requests. In case of failure to provide documents and evidence, they shall issue written replies clearly stating the reason to requesters. 2. In case involved parties cannot collect evidence by themselves after taking necessary measures, they may request courts to issue decisions to request agencies, organizations and individuals that are keeping or managing documents and evidence to provide them or collect documents and evidence to ensure the settlement of administrative cases. The involved parties requesting the Courts to collect materials/evidences must make applications clearly stating the matters to be proved; the evidences to be collected; the reasons why they cannot collect them by themselves; full names and addresses of individuals, agencies or organizations that are managing or keeping the materials/evidences to be collected. 3. At the request of involved parties or when finding it necessary, courts shall request agencies, organizations and individuals that are managing or keeping documents and evidence to supply them. Agencies, organizations and individuals that are managing and keeping materials and evidences shall provide sufficient materials and evidences at the request of the Court within 15 days from the day on which the request is received. If the requested agencies, organizations and individuals fail to provide sufficient materials and evidences after this time limit, they must provide explanation in writing to the Court. Agencies, organizations and individuals that fail to comply with the request without legitimate reasons may be handled in accordance with this Law and relevant laws. The handling of responsibilities of agencies, organizations and individuals is not the reason for exemption from the obligation to provide materials and evidences to the Court. 4. In case the procuracy requests the provision of documents and evidences, agencies, organizations and individuals shall comply with Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@94: Preservation of documents and evidence 1. The court shall take responsibility for the preservation of materials and evidences that have been submitted to the court. 2. If materials/evidences cannot be handed over at Courts, the persons who are keeping such materials/evidences shall preserve them. 3. If it is necessary to hand over materials and evidences to the third party for preservation, the judge shall issue a decision and make a record on the handover of materials and evidences to such party for preservation. The preservation undertaker shall sign the record, enjoy remuneration and take responsibility for the preservation of materials and evidences according to law provisions. 4. Destruction of documents and evidence is strictly prohibited.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@95: Evaluation of Evidence 1. The assessment of evidences must be objective, comprehensive, complete and accurate. 2. Courts must assess each evidence, the relevance of evidence and affirm the legality, relevance and proving value of each evidence.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@96: Disclosure and use of evidence 1. All evidences shall be disclosed and used publicly as usual, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Courts shall not disclose evidences related to state secrets, fine national traditions and customs, professional secrets, business secrets or personal secrets at the legitimate request of involved parties but shall notify involved parties of evidences which must not be disclosed. 3. Procedure-conducting persons and procedure participants shall keep secret evidences falling into the cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@97: Protection of Evidence 1. In case evidence is being destroyed or in danger of being destroyed or it is difficult to collect evidence in the future, involved parties may file applications requesting courts to decide on application of necessary measures to preserve evidence. Courts may decide to apply one or several of the measures of sealing, seizure, photographing, audio-recording, video-recording, restoration, examination, making of records and other measures. 2. If a witness is threatened, controlled or bribed to refuse to provide evidence or provide untruthful evidence, the court is entitled to force the person who threatens, controls or bribes to stop the act. If the act shows criminal signs, the court shall request the procuracy to consider criminal liability.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@98: Right to access and exchange documents and evidence 1. Involved parties may know, take notes, photocopy and exchange documents and evidence submitted to Courts by other involved parties or collected by Courts, except for documents and evidence specified in Clause 2 Article 96 of this Law. 2. When involved parties hand over materials and evidences to Courts, within 5 working days, they must notify other involved parties of their handover of materials and evidences to Courts so that other involved parties contact the Courts to exercise the right to access materials and evidences prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article. 3. Within 5 working days after the court collects materials and evidence, the court shall notify involved parties thereof for exercising the right to access materials and evidence specified in Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@99: The obligation to issue, deliver or notify procedural documents Courts, procuracies and civil judgment enforcement agencies shall issue, send or notify procedural documents to involved parties, other procedure participants and related agencies, organizations and individuals in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@100: Procedural documents to be issued, delivered or notified 1. Announcements, notices, summonses and invitations in administrative procedures. 2. Judgments and decisions of courts. 3. The appeal decisions of the procuracies; documents of the civil judgment-executing bodies. 4. Other procedural documents which, as required by law, must be issued, sent or notified.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@101: Persons issuing, sending or notifying procedural documents 1. Procedure-conducting persons and persons of procedural document-issuing agencies who are tasked to issue, send or notify procedural documents. 2. Persons with the document delivery function. 3. The commune-level People's Committees of the localities where procedure participants reside or the agencies or organizations where procedure participants work when so requested by courts, procuracies or civil judgment enforcement agencies. 4. The involved parties, their representatives or defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests in the cases prescribed by this Law. 5. Employees of postal service organizations. 6. Other persons as prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@102: Methods of issuance, delivery or notification of procedural documents 1. Issuance, sending or notification shall be made in person or by post or by a third party authorized to issue, send or notify. 2. Issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents by electronic means at the request of involved parties or other participants in legal proceedings in accordance with regulations of the Law on electronic transactions. 3. Public posting. 4. Announcement on mass media. 5. Issuance, sending or notification by other modes specified in Article 303 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@103: The validity of the issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents 1. The issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents which are carried out in accordance with this Law shall be considered valid. 2. Persons obliged to issue, send or notify procedural documents shall comply with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@104: Procedures for issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents Persons issuing, sending or notifying procedural documents shall directly hand over relevant procedural documents to persons to whom they are issued, sent or notified. Persons to whom procedural documents are issued, sent or notified or authorized to issue, send or notify procedural documents shall sign in minutes or books of delivery and receipt of procedural documents. The time for calculation of procedural time limit is the date they are issued, sent or notified of procedural documents.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@105: Procedures for issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents by electronic means The issuance, sending or notification by electronic means must comply with the law on e-transactions. The Supreme People's Court shall provide guidance on the implementation of this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@106: Procedures for direct issuance, sending or notification to individuals 1. For individuals, procedural documents must be handed over directly to those who are provided with, delivered or notified of such documents. 2. In case persons to whom procedural documents are provided, delivered or notified have moved to new places of residence and notified the court of their change of places of residence, procedural documents must be provided, delivered or notified according to their new places of residence. 3. In cases where the persons to whom procedural documents are issued, sent or notified refuse to receive such documents, the issuers, senders or notifiers must make records thereon, clearly stating the reasons therefor, with certification by street population group leaders, village or hamlet chiefs (hereinafter referred collectively to as street population group leaders) or representatives of commune/ward/township police offices of such persons' refusal to receive procedural documents. 4. In case the persons to whom the procedural documents are provided, delivered or notified are absent, the issuers, senders or notifiers shall hand over the documents to their relatives who have full civil act capacity in the same places of residence or street population group leaders for signing for receipt and requesting these persons to commit to hand over the documents to the persons to whom the documents are provided, delivered or notified. In case the persons to whom the procedural documents are issued, sent or notified are absent and the time of their return or their addresses are unknown, the issuers, senders or notifiers shall make records on the failure to issue, send or notify them, with certification by street population group leaders or representatives of commune/ward/township police offices; and at the same time, carry out procedures for posting up documents to be sent as provided for in Article 108 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@107: Procedures for direct issuance, sending or notification to agencies and organizations In cases where the persons to whom procedural documents are issued, sent or notified are agencies or organizations, the procedural documents must be handed directly to the at-law representatives or the persons responsible for receiving the documents of such agencies or organizations and must be signed for receipt by these persons. In cases where the agencies or organizations to which procedural documents are issued, sent or notified have their representatives to participate in the procedures or appoint their representatives to receive the procedural documents, these persons shall sign for receipt of such procedural documents. The date of signing for receipt is the date of issuance, sending or notification.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@108: Procedures for public posting 1. Public posting of procedural documents is carried out in case of failure to issue, send or notify procedural documents directly as prescribed in Article 106 and Article 107 of this Law. 2. The public posting of procedural documents shall be conducted by courts directly or by persons with the document-delivering function or commune-level People's Committees of localities where involved parties reside according to the following procedures: a/The court shall directly post up or authorize a person with the document-delivering function to post up procedural documents; a/Posting originals at the offices of courts or commune-level People's Committees of localities where individuals reside or last reside or where agencies or organizations to be granted, sent or notified are headquartered or last headquartered; b/Posting copies at places of residence or last residence of individuals, places of headquarters or last headquarters of agencies or organizations to which procedural documents are issued, sent or notified; c) Make a record of the public posting procedure, specifying the date of posting. 3. The time limit for public posting of procedural documents is 15 days from the date of posting.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@109: Procedures for announcement on mass media 1. The announcement on the mass media shall be made only when it is so provided for by law or there are grounds to believe that the public posting does not ensure that persons to whom documents need to be issued, sent or notified receive information on documents to be issued, sent or notified. 2. The announcement on the mass media may be effected if so requested by other involved parties. In this case, the involved parties requesting the announcement shall bear the expenses for announcement on the mass media. 3. The announcement on the mass media must be published on the court's web portal (if any ), on one of central dailies for three consecutive issues and broadcast on the central radio or television station three times for 3 consecutive days.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@110: Notification of results of issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents In case persons issuing, sending or notifying procedural documents are not procedure-conducting persons or persons of procedure document-issuing agencies, they shall promptly notify in writing the results of the issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents to courts or procedure document-issuing agencies.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@111: Discovery and proposal for amendment, supplementation or annulment of legal documents 1. In the course of settling an administrative case, if detecting that a legal document related to the settlement of the administrative case shows signs of contravening the Constitution, laws or legal documents of superior state agencies, the court shall : a) If the decision to bring the case to trial has not been issued, the Chief Justice of the Court that is handling the case shall make a recommendation within his/her power or request a competent person specified in Article 112 of this Law to make such recommendation; b) If a decision to bring the case to trial has been issued or the case is being considered according to cassation or reopening procedures, the trial panel shall request the chief judge of the court currently handling the case to make a recommendation or request a competent person defined in Article 112 of this Law to make a recommendation. 2. A written proposal or proposal to a competent person to propose the amendment, supplementation or annulment of a legal document must contain the following principal details : a) Name of the Court making the written recommendation or request; b) Summary of the case and legal issues raised to resolve the case; c) Name, number and date of the proposed amendments, supplements or abrogation of the legislative document related to the case resolution; d) Analysis of regulations of legislative documents in contravention of the Constitution, laws and legislative documents of superior regulatory agencies; dd) The Court's proposal for amendment, supplementation or annulment of such legislative document. 3. Enclosed with the written proposal or proposal of the competent person is the legislative document proposed to be amended, supplemented or annulled.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@112: Competence to propose amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents 1. The Chief Justice of district-level Courts shall have the right to propose amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents of state agencies of district or lower levels; to propose the Chief Justices of provincial-level Courts to propose amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents of provincial-level state agencies; to report to the Chief Justices of provincial-level Courts for proposing the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court to propose amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents of central state agencies. 2. Chief justices of provincial-level courts and chief justices of superior people's courts may propose amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents of state agencies of provincial or lower levels; and propose the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court to amend, supplement or annul legal documents of central state agencies. 3. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall propose on his/her own or at the proposal of the Chief Justice of the court specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article amendments, supplements or annulment of legal documents of central state agencies. 4. If the trial panel discovers that a legislative document in a court session is in contravention of the Constitution, laws or legislative documents of superior regulatory agencies, the trial panel shall report to the chief justice of the court as prescribed in Clauses 1,2 and 3 of this Article in writing to exercise its right to make recommendations. In this case, the trial panel shall have the right to halt the trial as prescribed in Point d Clause 1 Article 187 of this Law to seek opinions from the chief justice of the court or suspend the case upon the written recommendation of the chief justice of the competent court as prescribed in Point e Clause 1 Article 141 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@113: Responsibilities for handling proposals on amendment, supplementation or annulment of legal documents Within 10 days after receiving a written request specified in Article 111 of this Law, the chief judge of the court competent to make a recommendation shall consider and handle it as follows: 1. If the request is well-grounded, to send a written proposal to a competent state agency for amendment, supplementation or annulment of the legal document and notify such to the requesting court for issuance of a decision to suspend the case settlement; 2. If the request is groundless, the Court shall send a written response to the requesting Court for further settlement of the case in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@114: Responsibilities for implementing proposals for amendment, supplementation or annulment of legal documents Agencies receiving the request for amendment, supplementation or annulment of legal documents of courts shall settle as follows : 1. Within 30 days after receiving the written recommendation of the chief justice of the court specified in Article 112 of this Law regarding a legislative document detailing or guiding the implementation of the Constitution, laws or legal documents of a superior state agency, the agency that has promulgated such document shall consider and reply in writing to the recommending court. Past this time limit, if receiving no reply, the court shall apply a document of higher legal effect to settle the case; 2. In case of proposing amendments to or annulment of laws and resolutions of the National Assembly, ordinances and resolutions of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly, regulations of law shall apply.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@115: Right to initiate a lawsuit 1. Agencies, organizations and individuals may initiate lawsuits against administrative decisions, administrative acts or disciplinary decisions on dismissal in case they disagree with such decisions or acts or have lodged complaints with persons competent to settle them but their complaints remain unsettled past the time limit for settlement as prescribed by law or have been settled but they disagree with the settlement of complaints about such decisions or acts. 2. Organizations and individuals may initiate lawsuits against decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases in case they disagree with such decisions. 3. Individuals may initiate lawsuits about voter list cases in case they have lodged complaints with competent agencies for settlement but past the time limit for settlement as prescribed by law their complaints have not been settled or have been settled but they disagree with the settlement of such complaints.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@116: Prescriptive periods for initiating legal action 1. The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits is the time limit within which agencies, organizations and individuals may initiate lawsuits to request courts to settle administrative cases to protect their infringed legitimate rights and interests; upon the expiration of such time limit, they will lose the right to initiate lawsuits. 2. The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits in each case is prescribed as follows: a/One year after receiving or being aware of an administrative decision, administrative act or disciplinary decision on dismissal; b) 30 days from the date on which the decision on settlement of complaint against settlement decision is received; c) The time limit for complaint settlement is 05 days before the polling day from the day on which the notification of complaint settlement result is received from the electoral register authority or the time limit for complaint settlement expires without receiving the notification of complaint settlement result from the electoral register authority. 3. In case involved parties lodge complaints in accordance with law to state agencies or persons competent to settle complaints, the statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits is specified as follows: a) 01 year from the date of receipt or knowledge of the first or second complaint settlement decision; b) 01 year from the deadline for settling a complaint as prescribed by law but the competent authority or person fails to settle the complaint and does not respond to the complainant in writing. 4. In case a force majeure event or another objective obstacle prevents the plaintiff from initiating a lawsuit within the time limit specified at Points a and b, Clause 2 of this Article, the duration in which such force majeure event or another objective obstacle occurs shall not be included in the statute of limitations for lawsuit initiation. 5. The Civil Code's provisions on the method of determining time limits and statute of limitations applicable to administrative procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@117: Procedures for initiating lawsuits 1. When instituting an administrative case, an agency, organization or individual shall make a lawsuit petition under Article 118 of this Law. 2. Individuals with full administrative procedure act capacity may prepare petitions for lawsuits on their own or with other persons' help. Names and addresses of individuals must be indicated in the section name and address of lawsuit initiators in petitions; at the end of petitions, individuals must sign or press their fingerprints. 3. For individuals being minors, legally incapacitated persons, persons with restricted civil act capacity or persons with limited cognition or behavior control, their lawful representatives may make petitions for initiating lawsuits by themselves or ask other persons to do so. At the section name and address of the petitioner in the petition, the full name and address of the lawful representative of that individual must be written; at the end of the petition, that lawful representative must sign or press his/her finger-print. 4. Individuals specified in clauses 2 and 3 of this Article who are illiterate, ill-visible, unable to make petitions by themselves, unable to sign or fingerprint themselves may ask others to make petitions for them and must have persons with full administrative procedure act capacity to witness and sign for certification in petitions. 5. For agencies or organizations being litigators, their lawful representatives may make petitions by themselves or ask other persons to do so. At the section name and address of the litigator, the name and address of the agency or organization and full name and position of the lawful representative of such agency or organization must be written. At the end of the petition, the lawful representative of such agency or organization must sign and affix the seal of such agency or organization. For lawsuit initiating organizations being enterprises, the use of seals complies with the Law on Enterprises.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@118: APPLICATION FOR ACCOUNTING 1. A lawsuit petition must contain the following principal details: a) Date of making the application; b/The court requested to settle the administrative case; c) Names, addresses, telephone numbers, fax numbers and e-mail addresses (if any) of the plaintiff, defendant and persons with related interests and obligations; d) Contents of the administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case, content of settlement of complaint about electoral registers or summary of development of administrative acts; dd) Contents of the decision on complaint settlement (if any); f/To request the court to settle the case; g) The commitment not to concurrently lodge a complaint with the person competent to settle complaints. 2. The petitions must be enclosed with documents and evidences to prove that the plaintiffs' legitimate rights and interests are infringed upon. In cases where the plaintiffs cannot fully submit documents and evidences together with the petitions for objective reasons, they must submit the existing documents and evidences to prove that the plaintiffs' legitimate rights and interests are infringed upon. The plaintiffs must supplement other documents and evidences by themselves or at the request of the courts in the course of settling the cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@119: Filing of a Petition to the Court The litigators shall send their lawsuit petitions and enclosed documents and evidences to courts competent to settle cases by one of the following modes: 1. Directly at the court; 2. Sending by post; 3. Online via the Court's website (if any).
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@120: DETERMINATION OF DATE OF ACCOUNTING ACCOUNTS 1. In case the plaintiff directly files a petition at a competent court, the date of initiation of a lawsuit is the date of filing the petition. 2. In case the litigator files the petition online, the date of initiation of lawsuit is the date of sending the petition. 3. If the petitioner sends the petition to the Court by post, the date of initiation of lawsuit is the date stamped by the postal service organization where the petition is sent. In case of unable to determine the date by the postal service organization, the date of initiation of lawsuit is the date the involved party sends the petition at the postal service organization. The involved party must prove the date of sending the petition at the postal service organization; in case the involved party cannot prove, the date of initiation of lawsuit is the date the Court receives the petition sent by the postal service organization. 4. In case of transferring a case to another court under Clause 1, Article 34, and Clause 3, Article 165 of this Law, the date of initiation of a lawsuit is the date of sending the lawsuit petition to the court which has accepted the case but not according to its competence and is determined under Clauses 1,2 and 3 of this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@121: Receive and consider petitions 1. The Court shall receive the petition directly filed by the litigator at the petition receiving division of the Court or sent by post and record it in the petition register. In case of online receipt, the Court shall print out the physical petition and record it in the petition register. The receipt of lawsuit petitions shall be recorded in petition registers and announced on the courts' e-portals (if any). When receiving the petition directly, the Court shall immediately issue a receipt to the petitioner. In case of receiving the petition online, the Court shall reply the petitioner by email. In case of receiving the petition by post, within 02 working days from the date of receipt, the Court shall send a notice of receipt to the petitioner. 2. Within 3 working days after receiving a lawsuit petition, the court president shall assign a judge to examine the petition. 3. Within 3 working days after being assigned, the judge shall examine the lawsuit petition and make one of the following decisions: a) To request amendments and/or supplements to the lawsuit petitions; b) Carry out the acceptance of the case according to normal procedures or simplified procedures if the case satisfies all conditions specified in Clause 1, Article 246 of this Law; c) To transfer the lawsuit petitions to competent courts and notify the litigators thereof if the cases fall under the settling jurisdiction of other courts; d/To return the lawsuit petition to the plaintiff, if falling into one of the cases specified in Clause 1, Article 123 of this Law. 4. The results of petition processing by the Judge specified in Clause 3 of this Article must be notified to the petitioner, noted in the petition receipt book and announced on the Court's web portal (if any).
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@122: Requests for amendment and supplementation of lawsuit petitions 1. After receiving the lawsuit petition, if seeing that the petition does not contain all the details specified in Clause 1, Article 118 of this Law, the judge shall notify in writing the plaintiff of matters which need to be amended and supplemented within 10 days after the plaintiff receives the court's notice. 2. The time for amending and supplementing a lawsuit petition is not included in the statute of limitations for lawsuit initiation. 3. In case the plaintiff has modified or supplemented his/her lawsuit petition under Clause 1, Article 118 of this Law, the judge shall continue the acceptance of the case; if he/she fails to modify or supplement the lawsuit petition at the request of the judge, the judge shall return the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents and evidence to the plaintiff.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@123: Return of the petition 1. The Judge shall return the petition in the following cases: a) The litigators have no right to initiate lawsuits; b/The plaintiff has no full administrative procedure act capacity; c) The lawsuit is initiated when one of the conditions for initiating lawsuits is not satisfied; d) The case has been settled by a legally effective court judgment or decision; dd) The case does not fall within the jurisdiction of the Court; f/The plaintiff chooses to settle the case according to complaint settlement procedures in the case specified in Article 33 of this Law; g) The lawsuit petition does not contain all the contents specified in Clause 1, Article 118 of this Law and is not amended or supplemented by the litigator according to the provisions of Article 122 of this Law; h) Upon the expiration of the notified time limit specified in Clause 1, Article 125 of this Law, the litigator fails to produce the receipt of court cost advance to the court, unless the litigator is exempted from paying the court cost advance or is not required to pay the court cost advance or he/she has a plausible reason. 2. When returning the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents and evidence to the litigator, the judge shall issue a document clearly stating the reason for returning the lawsuit petition. The document on return of the lawsuit petition shall be immediately sent to the same-level procuracy. The lawsuit petitions and documents as well as evidences returned by the Judges to the litigators must be duplicated and archived at courts, which shall serve as basis for settling complaints and petitions when so requested.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@124: Complaints, petitions and settlement of complaints and petitions about the return of lawsuit petitions 1. Within 7 days after receiving the written return of the lawsuit petition, the litigator may lodge a complaint or the procuracy may make a recommendation to the court which has returned the lawsuit petition. 2. Immediately after receiving a complaint or recommendation about the return of a lawsuit petition, the court president shall assign a judge to consider and settle the complaint or recommendation. 3. Within 5 working days after being assigned, the judge shall open a meeting to consider and settle the complaint or proposal. The meeting shall be attended by representatives of the procuracy of the same level and complainants. In case the plaintiff or procurator is absent, the judge shall still hold the meeting. 4. Based on documents and evidence related to the return of lawsuit petitions, opinions of representatives of procuracies and complainants at meetings, judges shall issue one of the following decisions: a) To maintain the return of lawsuit petitions and notify the litigators and procuracies of the same level thereof; b) Receive the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents and evidences to accept the case. 5. Within 7 days after receiving the judge's decision to reply a complaint or recommendation on the return of the lawsuit petition, the plaintiff may lodge a complaint or the procuracy may propose the chief judge of the immediate superior court to consider and settle the case. 6. Within 10 days after receiving a complaint or recommendation about the return of a lawsuit petition, the chief judge of the immediate superior court shall issue one of the following decisions: a) To uphold the return of lawsuit petitions; b) To request the first-instance Courts to receive back the lawsuit petitions and accompanying documents and/or evidences in order to proceed with the acceptance of the cases. The decision on settlement of a complaint or recommendation of the chief judge of the immediate superior court is final. This decision must be immediately sent to the plaintiff, the same-level procuracy, the procuracy which has filed the complaint or recommendation and the court which has issued the decision to return the lawsuit petition.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@125: Accepting the case 1. After receiving the lawsuit petition and enclosed documents and evidence, if deeming that the case falls under the jurisdiction of the court, the judge shall notify the plaintiff thereof for him/her to pay the court cost advance; in case the plaintiff is exempt from paying the court cost advance or is not required to pay the court cost advance, the judge shall notify the plaintiff of the acceptance of the case. Within 10 days after receiving the notice of payment of court cost advance, the litigator shall pay the court cost advance and submit the receipt to the court. 2. The judge shall accept the case on the date the litigator submits the receipt of court cost advance. In case the litigator is exempted from paying the court cost advance or is not required to pay the court cost advance, the date of acceptance of the case is the date the judge notifies the litigator of acceptance. The acceptance of the case must be recorded in the acceptance book. 3. In case the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article expires but the litigator submits to the court a receipt of court cost advance, the case shall be settled as follows: a) If the lawsuit petition has not been returned, the Judge shall accept the case; b) Where the petitions have been returned and the litigators can prove that they have paid the court fee advances on time, but due to force majeure events or objective obstacles, they have not submitted the receipts of court fee advances to the Courts on time, the Judges shall request them to return the petitions, enclosed documents and/or evidences and proceed with the case acceptance; in this case, the date of lawsuit initiation shall be the date of filing the first lawsuit petitions; c) In case after the Judge returns the petition, the petitioner pays the court fee and submits the receipt of court fee to the Court, if not due to unforeseen events or objective obstacles, the Judge shall require the petitioner to return the petition and accompanied documents and evidence to handle the case; in this case, the date of lawsuit is the date of re-submission of petition. 4. Past the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article, if the litigator fails to submit to the court the receipt of court cost advance, the court shall notify him/her of its refusal to accept the case, stating that he/she has not paid the court cost advance. In this case, the litigator may re-submit a lawsuit petition if the statute of limitations for lawsuit initiation still remains. 5. After the judge accepts the case, if the court receives an independent petition of a person with related interests and obligations under Article 129 of this Law for settlement in the same administrative case, the date of acceptance of the case is determined as follows: a) Where the persons with related interests and obligations are exempted from or not required to pay the court fee advance, the date of acceptance of the case is the date the Court receives the independent request of the persons with related interests and obligations and the accompanying documents and evidences; b) Where the persons with related interests and obligations must pay the court fee advance, the date of acceptance of the case is the date the persons with related interests and obligations submit the receipt of court fee advance to the Court; c) In case there are many persons with related interests and obligations making independent claims, the date of acceptance of the case is the date the Court receives the last independent request, if they are all eligible for exemption or not required to pay the court cost advance or the date the last person submits to the Court the receipt of court cost advance, if they are required to pay the court cost advance. 6. Upon receiving the receipt of court fee advance from the involved parties, the courts must issue to them the written certification of receipt of court fee advance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@126: Notification of acceptance of the case 1. Within 03 working days from the day on which the case is accepted, the Judge accepting the case must send a written notification to the defendants, persons with interests and duties related to the settlement of the case and the procuracy of the same level of the acceptance of the case by the Court and publish it on the Court's website (if any). 2. The written notice must contain the following principal details: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- a) Date of making the written notice; b) Name and address of the Court that has accepted the case; c/Names and addresses of the plaintiff and defendant; d) Specific issues that the litigator requests the court to resolve; dd) The case is accepted according to normal procedures or simplified procedures; e) List of documents and evidences submitted together with the petition by the petitioner; g) The time limit for the defendant and persons with related interests and obligations to submit their written opinions on the plaintiff's claims and enclosed documents and evidence or independent claims (if any) to the court; h) Legal consequences of the defendants and/or persons with relevant interests and duties failing to submit to Courts their written opinions on the petitioner's claims.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@127: Appointment of Judges to resolve cases 1. On the basis of the report on acceptance of the case of the Judge assigned to accept the case, the Chief Justice of the Court shall decide to assign the Judge to resolve the case in accordance with the principles of impartiality, objectivity and randomness. 2. Within 3 working days after admitting a case, the court president shall decide to assign a judge to settle the case. For complicated cases which may require prolonged settlement, the chief judges of courts shall assign alternate judges to ensure the adjudication within the time limit prescribed in this Law. 3. During the resolution of a case, if the assigned judge cannot continue performing his/her duties, the chief judge of the court shall assign another judge to continue performing his/her duties. In case there is no alternate judge in the trial, the case shall be retried from the beginning and the involved parties and the procuracy of the same level shall be notified thereof.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@128: Rights and obligations of the notified persons 1. Within 10 days after receiving the notice, the defendant and persons with related interests and obligations shall submit to the court their written opinions on the plaintiff's claim and enclosed documents and evidence or independent claims (if any). In case of necessity to extend the time limit, the notified person shall send to the court an application for extension, clearly stating the reason. If the application for extension is grounded, the court shall extend the time limit once for not more than 7 days. 2. In case the defendant and persons with related interests and obligations have received the notice but fail to submit their written opinions within the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article without a plausible reason, the court shall continue settling the case in accordance with this Law. 3. Defendants and persons with related interests and obligations may request courts to permit the taking of notes and copying of lawsuit petitions and documents and evidence enclosed with them (if any ), except documents and evidence specified in Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law. 4. The procuracy, in 10 days upon receiving such notice, shall assign procurators and alternate procurators (if any) to perform duties and inform the Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@129: The right to request independently of persons with related interests and obligations 1. In case persons with related interests and obligations do not participate in procedures with the plaintiff or the defendant, they may make independent claims when the following conditions are met : a) The resolution of the case is related to their interests and obligations; b) Their independent claims are related to the cases being settled; c) Their independent claims are settled in the same case, thus making the resolution of the case more accurate and quicker. 2. Persons with related interests and obligations may make independent claims up to the time of opening meetings to examine the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidence and hold dialogues. Procedures for filing independent claims comply with this Law on procedures for initiating lawsuits by plaintiffs.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@130: Time limit for trial preparation The time limit for preparation for trial of cases, except for cases to be tried according to simplified procedures, cases involving foreign elements and lawsuits over voter lists, is prescribed as follows : 1.04 months from the date of acceptance of the case in the case specified in Point a Clause 2 Article 116 of this Law; 2.02 months from the date of acceptance of the case, for the case specified at Point b, Clause 2, Article 116 of this Law; 3. For complicated cases or cases with objective obstacles, the court presidents may decide to extend the trial preparation time limit once, which, however, must not exceed 2 months, for cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article, or 1 month, for cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article; 4. In case of decisions to suspend the resolution of cases, the time limit for trial preparation shall be recounted from the date the Courts' decisions to resume the resolution of the cases take legal effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@131: Article 10. Tasks and powers of judges in the stage of trial preparation 1. To compile case files. 2. To request involved parties to additionally submit documents, evidence and written opinions on the litigators' claims to courts; to request litigators to submit copies of documents and evidence for courts to send them to involved parties. 3. Verify and collect documents and evidence in accordance with this Law. 4. To decide on the application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures. 5. Hold meetings to inspect the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidences and hold dialogues in accordance with this Law, except for cases according to simplified procedures and lawsuits against voter lists. 6. Make one of the following decisions: a) To bring the cases to trial; b) Suspend the settlement of the case; c) Suspend the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@132: DOSSIER OF ADMINISTRATIVE CASES 1. Administrative case files include written requests and documents and evidence of involved parties and other procedure participants; documents and evidence collected by courts related to the cases; procedural documents of courts and procuracies on the settlement of administrative cases. 2. Papers and documents in administrative case files must be numbered and arranged in the order of date and must be archived, managed and used in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@133: Submission of documents and evidence 1. The time limit for handing over documents and evidence is specified in Clause 4, Article 83 of this Law. 2. If the involved parties submit materials and evidences requested by the Courts after the decisions to bring the cases to trial according to first-instance procedures are issued, they must prove the reasons for the late submission of materials and evidences. For materials and evidences not requested by the Courts to be submitted or materials and evidences that the involved parties cannot know about during the settlement of the cases according to first-instance procedures, the involved parties may submit and present them at the first-instance Court sessions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@134: The principle of dialogue 1. During the preparation for first-instance trial, the Court shall hold dialogue to enable involved parties to reach an agreement on the settlement of the case, except for the cases in which dialogue is not available, lawsuits against the electoral register, and cases to be tried according to summary procedures prescribed in Articles 135,198 and 246 of this Law. 2. Dialogue must be conducted on the following principles : a) Ensuring publicity, democracy and respect for the involved parties' opinions; b/Not to force involved parties to settle administrative cases against their will; c) The contents and results of successful dialogue between involved parties are not contrary to law and social ethics.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@135: Administrative cases that can not be addressed by dialogue 1. The petitioner, the defendant, the person with related interests and obligations have been duly summoned twice but still intentionally absent. 2. The involved parties cannot participate in the dialogue for plausible reasons. 3. Involved parties agree to request no dialogue.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@136: Notification of the meeting on checking the handover, access and disclosure of evidences and dialogue 1. Before conducting a meeting to examine the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidence and dialogues between involved parties, the judge shall notify involved parties, their lawful representatives and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests of the time and venue of the meeting and its contents. 2. In case an administrative case cannot be conducted under Article 135 of this Law, the judge shall conduct a meeting to examine the handover, access to and disclosure of evidence without conducting a dialogue.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@137: Participants in the meeting 1. Participants in a meeting include: a) The Judge presiding over the meeting; b) The meeting clerk shall take the minutes; c) The involved parties or their lawful representatives; d) Defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests (if any); dd) Interpreters (if any). 2. When necessary, judges may request concerned agencies, organizations and individuals to attend meetings. 3. In cases where many involved parties are involved, but one of them is absent, but the present involved parties still agree to hold the meetings and such meetings do not affect the rights and obligations of the absent involved parties, the Judges shall hold the meetings among the present involved parties; if the involved parties request the postponement of the meetings in order to have all involved parties present in the cases, the Judges must postpone the meetings and notify in writing the postponement of the meetings and re-opening of the meetings to the involved parties.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@138: Procedures for meetings for checking the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidences and dialogues 1. Before opening a meeting, the meeting clerk shall report to the judge on the presence or absence of the participants in the meeting notified by the court. The presiding judge shall re-check the presence and identity cards of participants and notify involved parties of their rights and obligations under this Law. 2. When examining the handover, access to and disclosure of evidences, the Judges shall disclose documents and evidences in the case files and ask the involved parties about the following matters : a) The claims and scope of lawsuit initiation, amendment, supplementation, replacement or withdrawal of the claims; independent claims; agreed and unconcurred issues to be resolved by the Court; b) The handover of materials and evidences to the Courts and the sending of materials and evidences to other involved parties; c) The addition of materials and evidences, the request for collection of materials and evidences by the Court, the summoning of other involved parties, witnesses and other participants in the Court session; d) Other matters which the involved parties deem necessary. 3. After the involved parties have made their presentations, the Judges shall consider their opinions and settle their proposals prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article; in cases where the involved parties are absent, the courts shall notify the results of the meetings to them. 4. After the inspection of handover, access and disclosure of evidence specified in Clause 2 of this Article is completed, the judge shall carry out dialogue procedures as follows: a) The Judge shall inform the involved parties of the regulations of law related to the settlement of the case so that the parties relate to their rights and obligations, analyze the legal consequences of the dialogue so that they voluntarily agree with each other on the settlement of the case; b) The litigator shall additionally present the lawsuit claim, grounds for defending the lawsuit claim and propose the litigator's viewpoints on the resolution of the case (if any); c/The defendant shall additionally present his/her opinions on the plaintiff's claims, grounds for issuance of the administrative decision or performance of the administrative act against which the lawsuit is instituted, and propose solutions to the case (if any); d) Persons with interests and duties related to the case shall provide additional explanation and propose opinions on the settlement of tontine-related parts (if any); dd) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties or other participants in the dialogue session (if any) shall give their opinions; e) The Judge shall request the involved parties to provide relevant legislative documents and administrative documents on a case-by-case basis to assess the legitimacy of the administrative decisions and/or administrative acts against which lawsuits are initiated, and inspect the legal effect of such documents. The Judge may analyze the contents of relevant legislative documents and administrative documents to enable the involved parties to correctly perceive them so that they can select and decide the settlement of the cases; g) After the involved parties fully present their opinions, the judge shall identify matters which the parties have agreed upon and matters which have not yet agreed upon and request the involved parties to additionally present unclear or unaligned contents; h) The judge shall make conclusion on issues agreed upon by the involved parties and issues not yet agreed upon. 5. The secretary of the meeting shall record the meeting's proceedings of the checking of the handover, access and disclosure of evidences and dialogue.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@139: Minutes of the meeting on checking the handover, access and disclosure of evidences; minutes of dialogue 1. The minutes of the meeting on checking the handover, access and disclosure of evidences must contain the following information: a/Date of the session; b/Place of the meeting; c) Participants in the meeting; d) Opinions of involved parties or their lawful representatives and defense counsels of their rights and interests on the contents specified in Clause 2, Article 138 of this Law; dd) Other contents; f/The judge's conclusion on acceptance or non-acceptance of the involved parties' proposals. 2. The dialogue record must contain the following details: a) The contents specified in Points a, b and c Clause 1 of this Article; b) Opinions of involved parties or their lawful representatives, defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests; c) The contents have been agreed upon by the involved parties or disagreed upon. 3. In case of non-conference prescribed in Article 135 of this Law, a record shall be made as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article. 4. The minutes must bear signatures or fingerprints of all participants in the meeting, signatures of the minutes recording secretary and the presiding judge. Participants in the meeting may read the minutes immediately after the meeting ends and request amendments and supplements to be written in the minutes and signed or fingerprinted for certification.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@140: Process dialogue results 1. If through dialogue the litigator still keeps the petition for lawsuit, the defendant keeps the decision or act against which the lawsuit is filed, the person with related interests and obligations who has independent claims still keeps their claims, the Judge shall conduct procedures to open the trial of the case. 2. If through dialogue the litigator voluntarily withdraws his/her petition, the Judge shall make a record on such voluntary withdrawal and issue a decision to terminate the resolution of the case with respect to the litigator's claim. The litigator may re-institute the case if the statute of limitations for initiating the lawsuit has not yet expired. 3. In case the litigant commits through dialogue to amend, replace or annul the decision against which the lawsuit is initiated or terminate the administrative violation against which the lawsuit is initiated and the litigator commits to withdraw the lawsuit petition, the Court shall make a record on the commitment of the litigant. Within 07 days from the day on which the record is made, the litigant must send the new administrative decision or notice of termination of the administrative violation against which the lawsuit is initiated to the Court and the litigant must send the court the document on withdrawal of the lawsuit petition. If one of the litigants fails to fulfill his/her commitment by the end of this time limit, the Judge shall initiate a trial for the case. If the Courts receive new administrative decisions or documents on withdrawal of lawsuit petitions, the Courts must notify other involved parties thereof. Within 07 days after receiving the Courts' notices, if the involved parties do not have any objection, the Judges shall issue decisions to recognize the successful dialogue results, suspend the case resolution and immediately send them to the involved parties and the procuracies of the same level. These decisions shall take immediate effect and must not be appealed or protested according to appellate procedures; in cases where there are grounds to believe that the contents agreed upon and committed by the parties are mistaken, deceived, threatened or contrary to law or social ethics, the Court's decisions may be reviewed according to cassation procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@141: Suspension of the settlement of the case 1. The Court shall decide to suspend the settlement of a case in one of the following cases: a) The involved parties being individuals have died or agencies or organizations have been dissolved or declared bankrupt without any individuals, agencies or organizations inheriting their procedural rights and obligations; b) The involved parties being persons who have lost their civil act capacity or are minors but their representatives at law have not yet been identified; c) The time limit for trial preparation has expired but one of the involved parties cannot be present for plausible reasons, except for cases where the trial can be conducted in the absence of involved parties; d) It is necessary to wait for the results of settlement of other agencies or other relevant cases; dd) The additional or re-assessment results; the results of the judicial entrustment or entrustment of evidence collection or the provision of documents and evidences by agencies or organizations at the request of the Court must be waited for to resolve the case; e) The results of handling of legislative documents related to the case resolution that show signs of contravening the Constitution, laws or legislative documents of superior regulatory agencies and the Court has sent written requests to competent authorities for amendments, supplements or annulment of such documents are needed. 2. The decision to suspend the case settlement may be appealed against according to appellate procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@142: Consequences of the suspension of case resolution 1. The court shall not delete the name of the case suspended from settlement in the case acceptance book but only note in the case acceptance book the number and date of the decision to suspend the settlement of such case for monitoring. 2. When the reasons for suspension specified in Article 141 of this Law no longer exist, the Court shall issue a decision to continue the case resolution and cancel the decision on suspension of the case resolution. 3. Court fee and charge advances paid by involved parties shall be handled when courts continue settling cases. 4. During the suspension of the case resolution, the Judge assigned to resolve the case shall still be responsible for the resolution of the case. After obtaining a decision to suspend the settlement of a case under Clause 1, Article 141 of this Law, the judge assigned to settle the case shall monitor and urge agencies, organizations and individuals to remedy the reason for suspension of the case in the shortest time so as to promptly bring the case to settlement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@143: Termination of case resolution 1. The Court shall decide to terminate the resolution of a case in the following cases: a) The petitioner is an individual who has died and his/her rights and obligations are not inherited; the agency or organization has been dissolved or declared bankrupt without any agency, organization or individual to inherit the procedural rights and obligations; b) The petitioner withdraws his/her petition in case there is no independent request of the person with related interests and obligations. In case there is an independent request of the person with related interests and obligations but the person with related interests and obligations still keeps his/her independent request, the Court shall issue a decision to terminate the settlement of case for the request of the petitioner who has withdrawn it; c) The litigator withdraws the lawsuit petition, the person with related interests and obligations withdraws the independent claim; d) The petitioner fails to advance the property valuation expense and other procedural expenses as prescribed by law. In case persons with related interests and obligations make independent claims but fail to pay advance on property valuation expense and other procedural expenses under this Law, courts shall terminate the settlement of their independent claims; dd) The petitioner is absent after being duly summoned twice, unless he/she requests the Court to conduct trial in his/her absence or there is force majeure event or objective obstacles; e) The defendant cancels the administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case or terminates the administrative act against which the lawsuit is filed and the petitioner agrees to withdraw the petition, the person with related interests and obligations having independent claims agrees to withdraw the request; g) The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits has expired; h) The cases prescribed in Clause 1 Article 123 of this Law that the Court has accepted. 2. When issuing a decision to terminate the resolution of a case, the court shall return the lawsuit petition, documents and evidence to involved parties if so requested. 3. The decision to terminate the resolution of a case may be appealed against according to appellate procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@144: Consequences of the suspension of case resolution 1. When a decision to terminate the resolution of a case is issued, involved parties may not initiate a lawsuit to request the court to re-settle that case, provided that the lawsuit is not different from the case in terms of the plaintiff, defendant and the disputed legal relation, except for cases subject to termination under Points b, c and f, Clause 1, Article 123, Points b and e, Clause 1, Article 143 of this Law and other cases prescribed by law. 2. Court fee and charge advances paid by involved parties shall be handled under the law on court fees and charges.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@145: Competence to issue decisions on suspension, continued or termination of the resolution of cases 1. Judges assigned to settle cases are competent to issue decisions to suspend, continue or terminate the settlement of such cases. 2. Within 3 working days after the judge issues one of the decisions specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the court shall send such decision to involved parties and the same-level procuracy.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@146: Decision to bring the case to trial 1. A decision to bring a case to trial must contain the following principal details: a) Date and location of the Court session; b) The trial is conducted publicly or behind closed doors; c) Name and address of the participants in the procedures; d/Contents of the lawsuit; dd) Full names of the Judge, People's Juror, Court clerk, Procurator; alternate Judge, People's Juror, Court clerk, Procurator (if any). 2. The decision to bring a case to trial must be sent to the involved parties and the procuracy of the same level immediately after it is issued.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@147: Send the file to the procuracy The Court must send the case file together with the decision to bring the case to trial to the equivalent Procuracy for study. Within 15 days after receiving the case file, the Procuracy must return it to the Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@148: General requirements for first-instance Court sessions The first-instance Court sessions must be conducted at the time and at the venues inscribed in the decisions to bring the cases to trial or in the notices on re-opening the Court sessions in cases where the Court sessions must be postponed.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@149: Time limit for opening the trial Within 20 days after the decision to bring the case to trial is issued, the court shall open a court hearing. In case of plausible reasons, the time limit for opening a court hearing may be prolonged but must not exceed 30 days.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@150: Place of the trial The Court session shall be held at the Court's premises or outside the Court's premises provided that the solemnity and format of the courtroom are ensured as prescribed in Article 151 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@151: Form of courtroom arrangement 1. The national emblem of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall be hung in the center above the court room and above the seat of the trial panel. 2. The courtroom must have areas exclusively reserved for the trial panel, procurators, Court clerks, involved parties, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties, other procedure participants and court participants.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@152: Oral, direct trial 1. The oral trial must be conducted in the court room. 2. The trial panel shall directly ascertain circumstances of the case in court by asking and listening to the presentation and direct argument about facts and evidences of the case by the plaintiff, defendant, persons with interests and duties related to the case, lawful representatives, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties and other procedure participants, agencies and organizations invited to attend the court hearing and listening to the procurator's opinions of the procuracy.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@153: Courtroom rules 1. When entering the courtroom, all people must undergo security check by the force responsible for protecting the court session. 2. It is strictly prohibited to bring weapons, ammunitions, explosives, inflammables, toxins, radioactive substances, articles banned from circulation, leaflets, slogans and other documents and articles affecting the solemnity of Court sessions into the courtrooms, except for exhibits of cases in service of the adjudicating work or weapons and supporting tools brought along by competent persons to protect Court sessions. 3. Participants in Court sessions at the request of the Courts must present the subpoenas, invitations and other relevant documents to the Court reporter at the secretary's desk at least 15 minutes before the opening of the Court session and sit at the right positions in the courtroom as instructed by the Court reporter; in case of late arrival, the subpoenas, invitations and other relevant documents must be presented to the Court reporter through the security staff of the Court session. 4. Journalists attending the Court session to report on the developments of the Court session must obey the direction of the presiding Judge of the Court session to the operational area. Journalists must record the speech and images of the trial panel with the consent of the presiding Judge of the Court session. The recording of speech and images of involved parties and other procedure participants must be agreed by them. 5. All participants in the Court session must wear formal clothes; respect the trial panel, maintain order and obey the presiding judge's commands. 6. Do not wear hats, hats or colored glasses in the courtroom, unless there are plausible reasons and the presiding judge grants an approval; do not use cell phones in the courtroom; do not smoke, eat or drink in the courtroom or commit other acts that affect the sanctity of the courtroom. 7. Participants in the Court session at the request of the Court must be present at the Court session throughout the trial of the case, unless they are permitted by the presiding Judges to leave the courtrooms for plausible reasons. Persons under sixteen years of age must not enter the courtroom, except when they are summoned by courts to attend court hearings. 8. All people in the courtroom must stand up when the Trial panel enters the courtroom and pronounces the judgment, unless otherwise permitted by the presiding judge. 9. Only those who are permitted by the Trial panel shall be allowed to ask questions, answer or make statements. The person who asks, answers or makes statements must stand up, unless he/she is permitted by the presiding judge to sit for health reasons.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@154: Members of the first-instance Trial Panels The first-instance trial panel is composed of one judge and two people's jurors, except the case specified in Clause 1, Article 249 of this Law. The first-instance trial panel may be composed of two judges and three people's jurors in the following cases : 1. Lawsuits against administrative decisions or administrative acts of provincial-level People's Committees or presidents of provincial-level People's Committees, which involve many subjects; 2. Complicated cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@155: Presence of members of the trial panel and Court clerks 1. A Court session shall be conducted only when all members of the trial panel and the court clerk are present. 2. If a Judge or People's Juror is absent or cannot continue to participate in the trial but an alternate Judge or People's Juror participates in the Court session from the beginning, such persons may replace the absent members of the Trial panel to participate in the trial. 3. If there is no alternate Judge or People's Juror to replace the member of the Trial Panel as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article, the Court session shall be postponed. 4. If the Court reporter is absent or unable to continue to participate in the Court session without a replacement, the Court session must be postponed.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@156: The presence of procurators 1. The procurators assigned by the chairpersons of the procuracies of the same level shall have the duty to participate in the Court sessions; if they are absent, the trial panels shall still conduct the trials. 2. If a procurator is replaced at the Court session or cannot continue to participate in the trial, but there is an alternate procurator, such procurator may continue to participate in the trial if he/she has been present at the Court session from the beginning.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@157: Presence of involved parties, representatives and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests 1. When the Court sends the first summons, involved parties or their representatives and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests must be present at the Court session; if any of them is absent, the trial panel shall postpone the Court session, unless such person files a written request for trial in his/her absence. The Court shall notify the involved parties, their representatives and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests of the postponement of the Court session. 2. If the Court sends the second summons, involved parties or their representatives and defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests must be present at the Court session; if they are absent not due to force majeure events or objective obstacles, they shall be handled as follows : a) For the petitioner or his/her legal representative without his/her representative participating in the trial, he/she shall be deemed to waive the lawsuit initiation and the Court shall issue a decision to terminate the settlement of case for his/her lawsuit petition, unless he/she requests the trial in his/her absence. The petitioner has the right to initiate another lawsuit, if the statute of limitations for lawsuit initiation is still not yet expired; b) If the defendant and/or persons with related interests and obligations do not file independent claims and have no representatives to participate in the court session, the court shall conduct trial in their absence; c) If a person with related interests and obligations files an independent claim without a representative attending the Court session, he/she shall be deemed to waive his/her independent claim and the Court shall issue a decision to terminate the resolution of such person's independent claim, unless such person files a written request for trial in his/her absence. The person with related interests and obligations files an independent claim may initiate a lawsuit again for such independent claim if the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit has not yet expired; d) The court shall still conduct trial in their absence against the defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@158: Trial in absence of involved parties from court hearings The Court shall still conduct trial of the case in the following cases: 1. The plaintiff, the defendant, persons with related interests and obligations and their representatives, who are absent from the court hearing, file a written request for trial in their absence; 2. The plaintiff, the defendant or persons with related interests and obligations are absent from the court hearing but their representatives attend the court hearing; 3. The cases specified at Points b and d, Clause 2, Article 157 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@159: The presence of witnesses 1. Witnesses shall be obliged to attend Court sessions under the Court's subpoenas to present details of the cases they know. In case witnesses are absent but have previously given testimonies directly to Courts or sent their testimonies to Courts, the presiding Judges shall announce such testimonies. 2. If witnesses are absent, the Trial Panels shall decide to postpone the Court sessions or continue the trials. If witnesses are absent from Court sessions without plausible reasons and their absence obstructs the trial, they may be escorted to Court sessions under decisions of the Trial Panels.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@160: Presence of an expert 1. Expert witnesses shall be obliged to attend Court sessions upon the Court's subpoenas to clarify matters related to the expert examinations and expert conclusions. 2. If the expert-witnesses are absent, the trial panels shall decide to postpone the Court sessions or continue the trial.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@161: Presence of interpreters 1. Interpreters are obliged to attend Court sessions under court subpoenas. 2. If the interpreter is absent without any replacement, the Trial panel shall decide to postpone the Court session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@162: Postponing the trial 1. Cases in which a Court session must be postponed : a) The cases specified in Clause 3 and Clause 4 Article 155, Clause 1 Article 157, Clause 2 Article 161 of this Law; b) The members of the Trial panel, Court reporter or interpreter are replaced without any replacement; c) The re-assessment is required as prescribed in Article 170 of this Law. 2. Cases of postponement of Court sessions are specified in Clause 2, Article 159 and Clause 2, Article 160 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@163: Time limit, decision and authority to adjourn the Court session 1. The time limit for postponing a first-instance Court session shall not exceed 30 days from the date on which the trial panel issues a decision to postpone the Court session, except for the case trial conducted according to simplified procedures, the postponement time limit shall be 15 days. 2. A decision to postpone a Court session must contain the following principal details: a) Date of issuance; b) Name of the Court and full names of procedure-conducting persons; c) The case is brought to trial; d) Reasons for the postponement of the Court session; dd) Time and location of the re-opening of the Court session. 3. The presiding judge must sign the decision to adjourn the Court session on behalf of the Trial panel. If the presiding judge is absent, the court president shall issue a decision to adjourn the Court session. The decision to adjourn the Court session shall be immediately notified to procedure participants. For absent persons, the court shall immediately send such decision to them and concurrently to the same-level procuracy. 4. If the Court cannot resume the Court session on the same time and at the same place as stated in the decision to halt the trial, the Court must immediately inform procedure participants and the equivalent Procuracy of the time and place of resumption of the Court session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@164: Procedures for issuing Court judgments and decisions in Court sessions 1. Judgments must be discussed and adopted by the trial panels at the deliberation rooms. 2. Decisions on replacement of procedure-conducting persons, expert-witnesses, interpreters, case transfer, suspension or termination of the settlement of cases, postponement of Court sessions must be discussed and adopted at the deliberation rooms and must be made in writing. 3. Decisions on other matters shall be discussed and passed by the trial panels in the courtrooms, which are not required to be made in writing but must be recorded in the minutes of the Court sessions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@165: Temporary suspension or suspension of the settlement of the case in court 1. At the Court session, if there is one of the cases specified at Points a, b, c, d and e, Clause 1, Article 141 of this Law, the trial panel shall issue a decision to suspend the settlement of the case. 2. At the Court session, if there is one of the cases specified in Clause 1, Article 143 of this Law, the trial panel shall issue a decision to terminate the resolution of the case. 3.
