In case involved parties produce new administrative decisions which are related to the lawsuits and do not fall under the jurisdiction of the courts currently conducting first-instance trials of the cases, trial panels shall terminate the trial and transfer case files to competent courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@166: Minutes of the Court session 1. The minutes of the Court session must fully contain the following details: a) The contents specified in Clause 1 Article 146 of this Law; b) All developments in the Court session from the beginning to the end of the Court session; c) Questions, answers and statements given in court; d) Other contents must be recorded in the Court's minutes as per this Law. 2. Apart from recording the Court's minutes, the Court may record the Court's proceedings on sound or video. 3. After the end of the Court session, the trial panel shall check the minutes. The presiding judge and the court clerk shall sign the minutes. 4. Procurators and procedure participants may read the minutes of the Court session, request the inclusion of amendments and/or supplements in the minutes of the Court session and sign for certification.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@167: Preparing for the opening of the trial Prior to the opening of a trial, the Court reporter shall perform the following tasks: 1. To announce the internal rules of the Court session; 2. To check and determine the presence or absence of the participants in the Court sessions under the Court's subpoenas; if any person is absent, the reasons therefor must be clarified; 3. To maintain order in the court room; 4. To request all people in the court room to stand up when the trial panel enters the court room.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@168: Trial in absentia of all participants in legal proceedings 1. The Courts shall base themselves on documents and evidences in the dossiers to conduct trials in the absence of involved parties or procedure participants according to the provisions of this Law when the following conditions are fully met : a) The plaintiff or his/her lawful representative files a written request for trial in his/her absence; b/The defendant, persons with related interests and obligations; the lawful representative of the defendant or persons with related interests and obligations files a written request for trial in his/her absence or is absent though he/she has been duly summoned twice; c/The defense counsel of the rights and legitimate interests of the plaintiff, the defendant or persons with related interests and obligations files a written request for trial in his/her absence or is absent though has been duly summoned twice. 2. The presiding judge shall announce reasons for the absence of involved parties or their applications for trial in their absence. 3. The presiding judge shall briefly announce the case and documents and evidences in the case file. The trial panel shall discuss matters to be settled in the case. 4. Procurators shall present opinions of procuracies. 5. The trial panel shall conduct deliberation and pronounce judgments in accordance with this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@169: Opening of the Court 1. The presiding judge shall open the trial and read out the decision to bring the case to trial. 2. The Court reporter shall report to the trial Panel on the presence or absence of the participants in the Court session under the subpoena or notice of the Court and the reasons for absence. 3. The presiding judge shall re-check the presence of the Courtroom participants according to the Court's subpoenas or notices and check the identity cards of involved parties. 4. The presiding judge shall publicize rights and duties of involved parties and other participants in legal proceedings. 5. The presiding judge shall introduce full names of members of the Trial panel, Court reporter, procurators, expert witnesses and interpreters. 6. The presiding judge shall ask persons entitled to request replacement of procedure-conducting persons and interpreters if they request replacement of any persons; and ask persons entitled to assess whether expert witnesses violate Clause 3, Article 63 of this Law. 7. The presiding judge shall request witnesses to undertake to give truthful statements, and take legal responsibility for false statements, unless witnesses are minors. 8. The presiding judge shall request expert witnesses and interpreters to commit to provide accurate expert examination results and to interpret the contents to be interpreted.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@170: Handling of requests for replacement of procedure-conducting persons, expert-witnesses or interpreters If there is a request for replacement of procedure-conducting persons, expert-witnesses or interpreters at the Court session, the trial panel shall consider and decide to accept or reject the request in accordance with this Law. In case of rejection, it shall clearly state the reason and record it in the court record. If opinions on expert-witnesses violate one of the provisions of Clause 3, Article 63 of this Law, the trial panels must consider them; if having grounds, they shall decide to conduct the re-expertise according to law provisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@171: Ensuring the objectivity of witnesses 1. Before witnesses are questioned about matters they know related to the settlement of the case, the presiding judge may decide necessary measures to prevent witnesses from hearing each other's testimonies or contacting related persons. 2. If the testimonies of involved parties and witnesses are interrelated, the presiding Judges may decide to separate involved parties from witnesses before questioning witnesses.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@172: Inquiring the involved parties about the change, supplementation or withdrawal of their claims 1. The presiding judge shall ask the litigator about the change, addition or withdrawal of part or the whole of the lawsuit petition. 2. The presiding judge shall ask the person with related interests and duties if he/she has any of the following : an independent request for change, addition, withdrawal of part or the whole of an independent request.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@173: Consideration of change, addition or withdrawal of request 1. The trial panels shall accept the change or supplementation of the involved parties' claims if such change or supplementation does not exceed the scope of the lawsuit claims or the initial independent claims. 2. If the involved parties voluntarily withdraw part or whole of their claims, the trial panels shall accept and stop the trial for the withdrawn part or whole of their claims.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@174: Change of legal status In case the plaintiff withdraws the whole lawsuit claim but the person with related interests and obligations still keeps his/her independent claim, such person shall become the plaintiff.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@175: Contents and methods of oral argument in court 1. Oral argument at Court sessions includes presentation of evidences, questions, answers, answers and statements of viewpoints and arguments on assessment of evidences, details of the cases, legal relations in dispute and applicable laws to settle the involved parties' claims in the cases. 2. The oral argument in Court sessions shall be conducted under the direction of the Presiding Judges. 3. The presiding judge shall not restrict the duration of oral argument and shall facilitate oral argument participants to present all opinions but may interrupt opinions irrelevant to the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@176: The presentation of the involved parties 1. If involved parties still maintain their claims and viewpoints and disagree with each other on the settlement of the case, the trial panel shall summarize the contents of the involved parties' claims, announce conclusions at the meeting to examine the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidence and dialogue, matters to be debated, and request involved parties to present unclear or contradictory matters in the following order : a) Defense counsels of the plaintiff's legitimate rights and interests shall present unclear or contradictory matters and evidence to prove that the plaintiff's claims are well-grounded and lawful. The plaintiff may give additional opinions. In case an agency or organization initiates a lawsuit, its representative shall present unclear or contradictory matters and evidence to prove that the lawsuit claim is well-grounded and lawful; b/The defense counsel of the rights and legitimate interests of the defendant presents the defendant's opinions on the plaintiff's claims; the defendant's claims and proposals and evidence to prove that such claims are well grounded and lawful. The defendant may give additional opinions; c/The defense counsel of the rights and legitimate interests of persons with related interests and obligations presents the latter's opinions on the claims and proposals of the plaintiff and the defendant; independent claims and proposals of persons with related interests and obligations and evidence to prove that such proposals are well grounded and lawful. Persons with related interests and obligations may give additional opinions. 2. In case the plaintiff, the defendant or the person with related interests and obligations have no defense counsels of his/her rights and legitimate interests, he/she shall present his/her claim or proposal and evidence to prove that such claim or proposal is well grounded and lawful. 3. At the Court session, involved parties and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests may only supplement evidences as provided for in Clause 2, Article 133 of this Law to prove their claims and proposals.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@177: Order and principles of questioning in court 1. After hearing the presentations of involved parties and defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties as provided for in Article 176 of this Law, under the direction of the presiding Judges, the order of inquiry of each person shall be as follows: a/The plaintiff and the defense counsel of his/her rights and legitimate interests first ask, then the defendant, the defense counsel of his/her rights and legitimate interests, then the person with related interests and obligations and the defense counsel of his/her rights and legitimate interests; b) Other participants in legal proceedings; c) Presiding judges, people's jurors; d) Procurators participating in the Court session. 2. The questions must be clear, serious, not repeated, not misusing the questioning and answering to infringe upon the honor and dignity of procedure participants.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@178: Ask the litigator 1. In case many persons initiate lawsuits, each of them must be questioned separately. 2. The plaintiff shall be questioned only about matters presented by the plaintiff and defense counsels of the plaintiff's rights and legitimate interests which are unclear, inconsistent or contradictory to their previous testimonies, or contradictory to the presentations of the defendant, persons with related interests and obligations and defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of these persons. 3. The plaintiff may himself/herself give answers or the defense counsel of his/her rights and legitimate interests may give answers on his/her behalf and then the plaintiff shall give additional answers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@179: Ask the Defendant 1. In case there are many defendants, each defendant must be questioned separately. 2. The defendant shall be questioned only about matters presented by the defendant and defense counsels of the defendant's rights and legitimate interests which are unclear, inconsistent or contradictory to their previous testimonies, or contradictory to the presentations of the plaintiff, persons with related interests and obligations and defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of these persons. 3. The defendant may answer by himself/herself or the defense counsel of his/her rights and legitimate interests shall answer on his/her behalf and then the defendant shall give additional answers.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@180: Inquiring persons with related interests and obligations 1. In case there are many persons with related interests and obligations, each person must be questioned separately. 2. Persons with related interests and obligations shall be questioned only about matters presented by these persons or their defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests which are unclear, inconsistent or contradictory to their previous testimonies or contradictory to the presentations of the plaintiffs, the defendants or defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of these persons. 3. Persons with related interests and obligations may reply by themselves or the defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests shall reply on their behalf and then the persons with related interests and obligations shall reply in addition.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@181: Ask the Witness 1. In case there are many witnesses, each person must be questioned separately. 2. Before questioning witnesses, the presiding Judges must ask clearly about the relationships between them and the involved parties in the cases; if witnesses are minors, the presiding Judges may request the parents, guardians or teachers to help them in the inquiries. 3. The presiding judge shall request witnesses to present facts of the case they know. After witnesses have presented, only additional questions shall be asked about matters they have presented which are unclear, incomplete or contradictory, inconsistent with their previous testimonies, contradictory to the presentations of involved parties or defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties. 4. After finishing the presentation, the witnesses shall stay in the court room so that they may be further questioned. 5. If it is necessary to ensure the safety of witnesses and their relatives, the trial panels shall decide not to disclose information on the personal identification of witnesses and not to let the courtroom participants see them. 6. The involved parties and defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests shall question the witnesses after obtaining the consent of the presiding Judges.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@182: Disclosure of case documents 1. The trial panel shall disclose documents of the case in the following cases: a) Participants in legal proceedings are absent from the Court session but have given testimonies during the preparation for trial; b) Testimonies given by participants in legal proceedings in court are contradictory to previous testimonies; c) The trial panel finds it necessary or at the request of involved parties, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties, other procedure participants or procurators. 2. In special cases where it is necessary to keep state secrets, preserve fine national customs and practices, keep professional secrets, business secrets or personal secrets or to protect minors at the request of involved parties, the trial panels shall not disclose documents in the case files.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@183: - Listening to audio tapes and/or discs, watching video tapes and/or discs, other audio and/or video storage devices. At the request of involved parties, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties, other procedure participants or procurators or when deeming it necessary, trial panels may allow audio tapes and disks to be listened to, video tapes and disks and other audio and visual storage devices to be viewed at court hearings, except the case specified in Clause 2, Article 182 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@184: Evidence review 1. Exhibits, photos or written records of exhibits shall be presented for consideration in Court sessions. 2. The trial panel may, together with involved parties, come to examine on spot evidences which cannot be brought to court, if deeming it necessary.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@185: Ask the Expert-Counselor 1. The presiding judge shall request the expert witness to present his/her findings on the matters to be expert-examined. During the presentation, the expert witness shall be entitled to explain the findings and grounds for making such findings. 2. Procurators and procedure participants present at the court hearing may give comments on expertising conclusions and may ask about matters which remain unclear or contradictory in expertising conclusions or contradictory to other evidences of the case. 3. If the expert-witnesses are absent from the Court sessions, the Presiding Judges shall announce the expertising conclusions. 4. When procedure participants disagree with expertising conclusions announced at court sessions and request additional expertise or re-expertise; if deeming that the additional expertise or re-expertise is unnecessary, the trial panels shall continue the court sessions; if deeming that the additional expertise or re-expertise is necessary for the settlement of cases, the trial panels shall decide on additional expertise or re-expertise and halt the court sessions to wait for additional expertise or re-expertise results.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@186: Closing the Case When considering that details of the case have been fully examined, the presiding judge shall ask procurators, involved parties, defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties and other participants in legal proceedings whether they wish to inquire about any further matters. If there are any persons requesting such questioning and such requests are deemed well-grounded, the presiding judge shall decide to continue the questioning.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@187: Trial suspension 1. During the process of adjudication, the trial panel may suspend the Court session when there is one of the following grounds: a) Due to health conditions or force majeure events or other objective obstacles, the proceeding officers cannot continue the Court sessions, except for the case of replacement of the proceeding officers; b) Due to health conditions or force majeure events or other objective obstacles, the procedure participants cannot continue to participate in the Court sessions, except for cases where the procedure participants request the trial in their absence; c) The case cannot be settled without additional verification or collection of documents and evidences and cannot be carried out at the Court session if the case needs to be verified or additional collection of documents and evidences; d) It is necessary to report to the Chief Justice of the competent court to request amendments to or annulment of legislative documents as prescribed in Article 111 of this Law; dd) Involved parties request the Court to suspend the Court session for them to dialogue themselves; e) The result of additional or re-assessment is not available as prescribed in Clause 4 Article 185 of this Law. 2. The halt to the trial must be recorded in the minutes of the Court session. The halt to the trial shall not exceed 30 days from the date on which the Trial panel decides to halt the trial. The trial panel shall resume the trial if the reasons for the halt no longer exist. Upon the expiry of such time limit, if the reasons for the halt to the trial have not been overcome, the Trial panel shall issue a decision to halt the settlement of the case and notify procedure participants and the equivalent Procuracy in writing of the time for resuming the trial.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@188: Argumenting order 1. After the questioning session, the oral arguments in Court sessions shall be conducted as follows: a) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of litigators shall make presentations. Litigators may give additional opinions. In case agencies or organizations initiate lawsuits, their representatives shall present their opinions; b/The defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of the defendant shall argue or reply. The defendant may give additional opinions; c) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of persons with related interests and duties shall make presentations. Persons with related interests and duties may give additional opinions; d) The involved parties answer questions under the direction of the presiding Judges; dd) When necessary, the trial panel may request involved parties to additionally argue about specific matters to serve as a basis for settling the case. 2. In case the plaintiff, the defendant or persons with related interests and obligations have no defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests, they shall present their arguments by themselves. 3. If one of the involved parties, defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests and other participants in legal proceedings is absent, the presiding judge of the Court session shall announce their testimonies and documents on defense of the involved parties' rights and legitimate interests, on which basis the involved parties present at the Court session shall argue and respond.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@189: Make statements during arguments and responses When giving statements on assessment of evidences and expressing their opinions on the resolution of cases, the participants in arguments must base on documents and evidences collected and examined and verified at the Court sessions as well as the results of the inquiries at the Court sessions. The participants in arguments shall have the right to respond to the opinions of other persons.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@190: Procurator's Remarks After procedure participants have finished their arguments and replies, procurators shall state their opinions on the observance of the procedural law by judges, people's jurors, court clerks and procedure participants in the course of settling cases from the time of acceptance of the cases to the time before the trial panels deliberate the cases and state their opinions on the settlement of the cases. Immediately after the end of the Court session, the procurators must send the written opinions to the Court for filing in the case files.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@191: Deliberation 1. After the argument is finished, the trial panel shall enter the deliberation room to deliberate the case. 2. Only members of the Trial panel shall have the right to hear the case. During the hearing, members of the Trial panel shall resolve all matters of the case by majority voting on each matter. People's Jurors shall vote first and the Judge shall vote last. If the Trial panel is composed of 05 members, the Presiding Judge shall be the last one to vote. The minority may present their opinions in writing which shall be included in the case file. 3. During deliberation, the trial panel shall base on documents and evidences examined and considered in court, results of oral arguments in court, opinions of procurators, relevant regulations of law, study and application of administrative precedents (if any) to decide on the following issues: a/The legality and grounds on the form and contents of the administrative decision or the performance of the administrative act against which a lawsuit is instituted; b) The legality of the competence, order and procedures for promulgation of administrative decisions or the performance of administrative acts; c) Prescriptive periods and time limits for issuance of administrative decisions or performance of administrative acts; d/The relationship between the administrative decision or act and the legitimate rights and interests of the plaintiff and related persons; dd) The legality and grounds of relevant administrative documents (if any); e) Compensation for damage and other issues (if any). 4. Deliberation must be recorded in minutes the opinions discussed and decisions of the trial panels. The deliberation minutes must be signed by members of the trial panels at the deliberation rooms before the judgments are pronounced. 5. If a case involves complicated facts and the deliberation requires more time, the trial panel may decide to extend the deliberation time but for not more than 05 working days from the end of the oral argument in court. The trial panels must notify persons present at the Court sessions and procedure participants who are absent from the Court sessions of the date, time and venue of judgment pronouncement; if the trial panels have already made the notification but some procedure participants are absent, the trial panels shall still conduct the judgment pronouncement according to the provisions of Article 195 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@192: Back to asking and arguing. Through argument or deliberation, if deeming that details of the cases have not yet been considered, the interrogation has not yet been adequate or evidences need to be further examined, the trial panels shall decide to resume the questioning and argument.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@193: The Trial Panels shall have the jurisdiction to : 1. The trial panel shall examine the legality of administrative decisions, administrative acts, disciplinary decisions on dismissal, decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases, lists of voters against whom lawsuits are instituted, decisions on settlement of complaints and relevant legal documents. 2. The trial panel shall be entitled to decide: a/Reject lawsuit petitions, if they are groundless; b/To accept part or the whole of the lawsuit petition, declare cancellation of part or the whole of the unlawful administrative decision and relevant complaint settlement decision (if any); to force the state agency or competent person in the state agency to perform his/her tasks or official duties in accordance with law; and at the same time propose measures to handle the cancelled unlawful administrative decision; c/Accept part or the whole of the lawsuit petition, declare the administrative act unlawful, cancel part or the whole of the relevant complaint settlement decision (if any); force a state agency or competent person in the state agency to terminate the illegal administrative act; d) Accept the petition for initiation of lawsuits, pronounce cancellation of unlawful disciplinary decisions on dismissal; compel the heads of agencies or organizations to perform their tasks or public duties in accordance with law; dd) Accept part or all of the lawsuit petitions, pronounce cancellation of part or all of the decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases; compel competent authorities or persons that have issued decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases to re-settle the cases in accordance with the Competition Law; f/To accept part or the whole of the lawsuit claims; to force the voter list-making agencies to amend and supplement the voter list according to law provisions; g) Enforced compensation for damage or restoration of lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals that are infringed upon by the unlawful decision on or administrative act, disciplinary decision on dismissal or decision on handling of competition case; h) Request competent authorities and heads of competent authorities to consider responsibilities of competent authorities and competent persons of competent authorities. 3. In case of necessity to request competent agencies or persons to consider and handle administrative documents related to administrative decisions or acts against which lawsuits are instituted under Clause 1, Article 6 of this Law, trial panels shall report such to chief judges of courts currently settling those cases for requesting competent agencies or persons in writing to consider and handle those administrative documents. In this case, trial panels may suspend the court hearing to wait for settlement results of competent agencies or persons. Within 30 days after receiving court rulings, competent agencies or persons shall issue written replies on the handling results to courts for use as a basis for the settlement of cases. Past this time limit, if receiving no written replies of competent agencies or persons, trial panels may apply documents of superior state management agencies to make decisions under Clause 2 of this Article. 4. If detecting that legal documents related to the settlement of administrative cases show signs of contravening the Constitution, laws or legal documents of superior state agencies, trial panels shall suspend the court hearing under Article 112 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@194: First-instance judgments 1. Courts shall issue judgments in the name of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. A judgment shall include a preamble, a content of the case and judgment and a decision of the court, specifically as follows: a) The introduction section must clearly state the name of the first-instance court; the serial number and date of acceptance of the case; the serial number of the judgment and the date of judgment pronouncement; full names of members of the trial panel, the court clerk, procurator, expert-witness and interpreter; names and addresses of the plaintiff, defendant, persons with related interests and obligations; the lawsuit-organizing agency or organization; lawful representatives and defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties; the object of lawsuit; serial number and date of the decision to bring the case to trial; public or closed trial; time and place of trial; b) The part on the case contents and the judgment of the Court must be inscribed with the lawsuit petitions of the litigators, the agencies and/or organizations; the independent proposals and petitions of the persons with related interests and obligations. The Court shall, according to the results of oral argument and evidences examined in the Court session, analyze, assess and make full and objective judgments on details of the case, legal grounds and precedents (if any) which the Court applies to accept or reject petitions and proposals of involved parties and defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties and settle other relevant matters; c) The decision section must clearly state legal grounds and decisions of the trial panel on each issue to be settled in the case, on the application of provisional urgent measures, on court costs, procedural expenses and the right to appeal against the judgment; in case of a decision to be executed immediately, such decision must be clearly stated. 3. When retrying a case in which a judgment/decision has been partially or wholly annulled according to cassation/reopening decisions, the Court shall settle the property and obligations that have been executed according to the effective judgment/decision but annulled and specify such in the judgment.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@195: Proclamation The trial panel pronounces the judgment in the presence of involved parties. In case involved parties are present at the court hearing but are absent when pronouncing the judgment or as prescribed in Clause 5, Article 191 of this Law, the trial panel still pronounces the judgment. In case of closed trial prescribed in Clause 2, Article 16 of this Law, the trial panel shall pronounce the introduction and the ruling of the judgment publicly. When the judgment is pronounced, all people in the court room must stand up, except for special cases with the consent of the presiding judge. The presiding judge or another member of the trial panel shall pronounce the judgment and may give further explanations about the judgment execution and the right to appeal. If any involved party does not know Vietnamese, the interpreter shall, after pronouncing the judgment, have to translate the whole judgment into the language he/she knows.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@196: Issuing and sending judgment extracts, judgments 1. Within 03 working days from the end of the Court session, the involved parties shall be provided with judgment extracts by the Court. 2. Within 7 days after pronouncing a judgment, the court shall issue or send the judgment to involved parties and the same-level procuracy. 3. Within 30 days after the expiration of the appeal or protest time limit, if no appeal or protest is filed, the court shall issue or send the legally effective judgment to involved parties, the same-level procuracy, the same-level civil judgment enforcement agency and the immediate superior agency of the defendant. 4. The first-instance Courts' legally effective judgments shall be posted on their websites (if any ), except for judgments containing information specified in Clause 2 Article 96 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@197: Amendment to the Court's judgments/decisions 1. After a court judgment or ruling is issued, it shall not be modified or supplemented, unless it is detected to have obvious spelling or data errors caused by mistake or miscalculation. The modified or supplemented document must be immediately sent by the court to involved parties and the same-level procuracy. In case the legally effective judgment or ruling is still effective, it shall also be sent to the same-level civil judgment enforcement agency and the immediate superior agency of the defendant. 2. The amendment of the judgments/decisions prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article shall be made by the Presiding judge in cooperation with members of the Trial panel or the meeting chairperson. If one of the members of the Trial panel or the meeting chairperson cannot make the amendment, the amendment shall be made by the Chief Justice of the Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@198: Receive the petition and accept the case Immediately after receiving the petition for the electoral register, the Chief Justice of the Court shall assign a Judge to accept the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@199: Time limit for settlement of the case 1. Within 02 days from the day on which the case is accepted, the Judge assigned to accept the case must make one of the following decisions: a) Decide to bring the case to trial; b) Dismiss the case and return the lawsuit petition. 2. After issuing a decision to bring a case to trial, the court shall promptly send such decision to involved parties and the same-level procuracy. 3. Within 02 days from the day on which the decision to bring the case to trial is issued, the Court shall open a trial.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@200: Presence of involved parties and representatives of procuracies The involved parties and procurators of the procuracies of the same level must be present at the Court sessions; if they are absent, the trial panels shall still proceed with the trial of the cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@201: Other provisions of this Law shall apply. Other provisions of this Law apply to the settlement of administrative cases with regard to lawsuits over voter lists in cases not provided for in this Chapter, except for the provisions on postponement of court hearings and sending of case files to procuracies for study before the opening of court hearings and the provisions on appellate, cassation or reopening procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@202: Effect of the Court's judgment/decision on case termination 1. Judgments or decisions to terminate cases of settlement of lawsuits over voter lists take immediate effect. Involved parties have no right to appeal and procuracies have no right to protest. 2. The Court must immediately send the judgment/decision to terminate the case to the involved parties and the procuracy of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@203: The nature of appellate trial Appellate trial means the re-trial by an appellate court of a case in which a first-instance court's judgment or ruling which has not yet taken legal effect is appealed or protested against.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@204: Persons entitled to appeal The involved parties or their lawful representatives may appeal against the first-instance courts' judgments or decisions to suspend or terminate the resolution of cases in order to request the appellate Courts to re-settle the cases according to appellate procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@205: Appeal 1. When exercising the right to appeal, the appellant must file an appeal. An appeal must contain the following principal details: a) Date of making the appeal; b) Name, address, phone number, fax number, e-mail address (if any) of the appellant; c) Appealed sections of parts or the whole first-instance court's judgments or decisions which have not yet taken legal effect; d) Reasons for the appeal and the appellant's request; dd) Signature or fingerprint of the appellant. 2. An appellant being an individual with full administrative procedure act capacity may himself/herself make an appeal. The appellant's name and address section in the appeal petition must indicate the full name and address of the appellant; and at the end of the appeal petition, the appellant must sign or fingerprint. 3. If the appellant prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article does not file an appeal himself/herself, he/she may authorize another person to file an appeal on his/her behalf. The full name and address of the appellant's authorized representative filing the appeal; full name and address of the appellant and the letter of authorization must be written in the section for name and address of the appellant in the application; and at the end of the application, the authorized representative must sign or press his/her finger-print on the application form. 4. The legal representative of the involved party being an agency or organization may make an appeal by himself/herself. The name and address of the appellant in the application must be written with the name and address of the involved party being agency or organization; the full name and position of the legal representative of the involved party being agency or organization; and at the end of the appeal, the legal representative must sign and affix the seal of such agency or organization. If the appellant is an enterprise, the use of seal shall comply with the provisions of the Enterprise Law. If the legal representative of the involved party being an agency or organization authorizes another person to represent the appellant, the full name and address of the appellant's authorized representative in the appellant's name and address; the name and address of the involved party being the authorizing agency or organization; the full name and position of the legal representative of the involved party being such agency or organization and the letter of authorization must be written in the section at the end of the appeal petition. At the same time, the authorized representative must sign or press his/her finger-print on the appellant's name. 5. The legal representatives of involved parties being minors or persons losing their civil act capacity may themselves make appeal applications. At the section name and address of the appellant in the application, the full name and address of the legal representatives; the full name and address of the involved parties being minors or persons losing their civil act capacity must be written; and at the end of the appeal applications, the appellants must sign or fingerprint. If the litigant's legal representative authorizes another person to represent him/her in the appeal, the full name and address of the appellant in the appellant's name and the letter of authorization must be written; full name and address of the legal representative of the appellant; full name and address of the involved party being a minor or a legally incapacitated person; and at the end of the appeal form, the authorized representative must sign or fingerprint. 6. The authorization prescribed in Clauses 3,4 and 5 of this Article must be made in writing and notarized or lawfully certified, except for cases where such authorization documents are made at courts in the witness of judges or persons assigned by court chief judges. Such authorization documents must contain contents on the involved parties' authorization of their authorized representatives to appeal judgments or decisions of first-instance courts to suspend or terminate the resolution of cases. 7. The appeal petition must be sent to the first-instance court which has rendered the judgment or ruling which is appealed against. Enclosed with the appeal petition shall be additional documents and evidence (if any) to prove that his/her appeal is well grounded and lawful. If the appeal petition is filed with an appellate court, that court shall forward it to the first-instance court for carrying out necessary procedures under Article 216 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@206: Time limit for appeal 1. The time limit for appeal against a first-instance court's judgment is 15 days from the date of judgment pronouncement. For involved parties who are absent from the court hearing or absent when the judgment is pronounced for plausible reasons, the time limit for appeal shall be counted from the date the judgment is handed to them or publicly posted up. If involved parties have participated in the Court sessions but are absent when the Courts pronounce the judgments without plausible reasons, the time limit for appeal shall be counted from the date of judgment pronouncement. 2. The time limit for appeal against a first-instance Court's decision to suspend or terminate the resolution of a case is 07 days from the day on which the appellant receives such decision or from the day on which such decision is posted up at the head office of the People's Committee of commune where he/she resides or is headquartered in case the appellant is an agency or organization. 3. If the appeal petition is filed by post, the date of appeal shall be determined according to the date on which the postal service provider of the sending post affixes its seal on the envelope. If the appellant is held in custody or detention, the date of appeal shall be the date of filing the appeal as certified by the competent person of the custody house or detention camp.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@207: Examination of appeal applications 1. After receiving the appeal applications, the first-instance Courts must check the validity of the appeal applications according to the provisions of Article 205 of this Law. 2. If the appeal petition is overdue, the first-instance Court shall request the appellant to present the reasons and materials and evidences (if any) to prove that the reasons for late submission of the appeal petition are justifiable. 3. If the appeal petition is not conformable with Article 205 of this Law, the first-instance Court shall request the appellant to re-submit the appeal petition or make amendments within 05 working days from the day on which the request of the Court is received. 4. The Court shall return the appeal application in the following cases: a) The appellant has no right to appeal; b) The appellant fails to re-make the appeal petition or fails to amend or supplement the appeal petition despite the request of the Court as prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article; c) The cases specified in Clause 2 Article 209 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@208: Overdue appeals and consideration of overdue appeals 1. An appeal filed beyond the time limit specified in Article 206 of this Law is an overdue appeal. After receiving the overdue appeal, the first-instance court shall send the appeal and the appellant's explanation of the reason for late filing of the appeal and documents and evidence (if any) to the appellate court. 2. Within 10 days after receiving the overdue appeal applications and accompanying documents and/or evidences transferred by the first-instance Courts, the appellate Courts shall set up Councils composed of 3 Judges to consider the overdue appeals. The meetings to consider the overdue appeals shall be attended by procurators of the procuracies of the same level and the overdue appellants. In cases where the procurators or the overdue appellants are absent, the courts shall still hold the meetings. 3. The late appeal review panel shall, based on documents and evidence related to the late appeal, opinions of the involved parties filing the overdue appeal, representatives of the procuracy at the meeting, decide by majority on whether or not to accept the late appeal and clearly state the reason for such acceptance or rejection in its decision. The appellate court shall send the decision to the late appellant, the procuracy of the same level and the first-instance court. If the appellate court accepts the late appeal, it shall request the first-instance court to carry out procedures specified in Articles 209,210 and 216 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@209: Notice of payment of appellate court cost advance 1. After accepting a valid appeal petition, the first-instance court shall notify such to the appellant for payment of the appellate court cost advance in accordance with law, if he/she does not fall into the case of exemption from or not required to pay the appellate court cost advance. 2. Within 10 days after receiving the court's notice of payment of appellate court cost advances, the appellant shall pay the court cost advances and submit to the first-instance court the receipt of court cost advance. Past this time limit, if the appellant fails to pay the appellate court cost advances, he/she shall be regarded as having waived his/her appeal. Upon receiving the court fee advance receipt from the appellant, the court shall issue to him/her a written certification of receipt of the court fee advance. If after 10 days after receiving the court's notice of payment of appellate court cost advances, the appellant submits to the court the receipt of the appellate court cost advance without clearly stating the reason, the first-instance court shall request the appellant to, within 3 working days after receiving the court's request, present in writing the reason for late submission of the receipt of the appellate court cost advance to the first-instance court for inclusion in the case file. This case shall be handled according to overdue appeal consideration procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@210: Notice of appeal 1. When sending case files and appeal applications to appellate courts, first-instance courts shall immediately notify in writing the procuracies of the same level and involved parties related to the appeals of the appeals. 2. The involved parties notified of the appeal may send to the appellate Courts written opinions on the appealed contents. Such written opinions shall be included in the case files.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@211: Procuracy protests The head of the procuracy of the same level and immediate superior level may protest against the first-instance court's judgment or ruling on suspension or termination of the settlement of a case in order to request the appellate court to re-settle the case according to appellate procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@212: The Procuracy's appeal decision 1. The procuracy's appeal decisions must be made in writing and contain the following principal details: a) Date of issuance and number of the appeal decision; b) Name of the procuracy that issues the appeal decision; c) Appealed sections of parts or the whole first-instance court's judgments or decisions which have not yet taken legal effect; d) Reasons and grounds for the appeal and the procuracy's request; dd) Full name of the person signing the appeal decision and seal of the procuracy issuing the appeal decision. 2. The appeal decisions must be immediately sent to the first-instance Courts which have rendered the judgments/decisions being appealed for the first-instance Courts to carry out the procedures prescribed in Article 216 of this Law. Enclosed with the appeal decisions are additional documents and evidences (if any) to prove that the procuracies' appeals are well grounded and lawful.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@213: Time limit for appeal 1. The time limit for filing protests against the first-instance court's judgments is 15 days for the same-level procuracy and 30 days for the immediate superior procuracy, counting from the date of judgment pronouncement. 2. The time limit for the appeal against the first-instance Court's decision to suspend or terminate the resolution of the case is 07 days, for the appeal against the immediate superior Procuracy is 10 days, from the day on which the Procuracy at the same level receives such decision. 3. When the Court receives the appeal decision of the Procuracy but such decision has expired as prescribed in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article, the first-instance Court shall request the Procuracy to explain in writing and clearly state the reasons.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@214: Notice of protest 1. The procuracy that issues the appeal decision must immediately send the appeal decision to the involved parties related to the appeal. 2. The person notified of the protest shall be entitled to send a written opinion on the protested content to the appellate court. Such written opinion shall be included in the case file.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@215: Consequences of the appeal 1. Parts of the first-instance Court's judgments/decisions that are appealed against shall not be enforced, unless they are enforced immediately as prescribed by law. 2. Judgments/decisions or parts thereof of first-instance Courts which are not appealed against shall take legal effect from the date on which the appeal time limit expires.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@216: Send case files and appeals or protests The first-instance court shall send the case file, appeal or protest and enclosed documents and evidence to the appellate court within 5 working days after the expiration of the protest time limit and upon the expiration of the appeal time limit, the appellant shall submit to the first-instance court the receipt of the appellate court cost advance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@217: Accepting the case for appellate trial 1. Immediately after receiving the case file, appeal petition, appeal decision and accompanying documents and evidences, the appellate court shall record them in the acceptance book. Within 03 working days from the day on which the case is accepted, the Court shall notify the involved parties and the procuracy of the same level in writing of the acceptance of the case and post it on the Court's website (if any). 2. The Chief Justice of the appellate Court shall establish an appellate trial panel and assign a Judge to preside over the Court session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@218: Amendment, supplementation or withdrawal of appeals or protests 1. If the time limit for appeal prescribed in Article 206 of this Law has not expired, the appellant may modify or supplement the appeal without being limited by the scope of the initial appeal. If the time limit for appeal prescribed in Article 213 of this Law has not expired, the procuracy that has filed the appeal may modify or supplement the appeal without limitation on the scope of the initial appeal. 2. Before the start of the appellate Court sessions or at the appellate Court sessions, the appellants may modify and/or supplement their appeals and the procuracies that have issued the protest decisions may modify and/or supplement their protests, but such modification and/or supplementation must not go beyond the scope of the original appeals or protests, if the appeal or protest time limit has expired. 3. Before the start of the appellate Court sessions or at the appellate Court sessions, the appellants may withdraw their appeals, the procuracies that have issued the protest decisions or the immediate superior procuracies may withdraw their protests. The appellate Courts shall terminate the appellate trial over parts of the cases where the appellants have withdrawn their appeals or the procuracies have withdrawn their protests. The termination of appellate trial before the opening of the Court session shall be decided by the Presiding Judge of the Court session, and the termination of the trial in Court session shall be decided by the trial panel. 4. The amendment, supplementation or withdrawal of an appeal before the opening of a court hearing must be made in writing and sent to the appellate court. The appellate court shall notify involved parties of the amendment, supplementation or withdrawal of the appeal or protest; and notify the same-level procuracy of the amendment, supplementation or withdrawal of the appeal of involved parties. The change, supplementation or withdrawal of appeals in Court sessions must be recorded in the minutes of the Court sessions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@219: New evidence 1. Before the opening of appellate Court sessions or at appellate Court sessions, the appellants, the protesting procuracies, persons with interests and obligations related to the appeals or protests, defense counsels of the involved parties' legitimate rights and interests may add new evidences. 2. The appellate court shall verify newly added evidence itself or at the request of involved parties. The court may entrust the verification of evidence under Article 92 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@220: Scope of appellate trial The appellate Courts shall only review parts of the first-instance Courts' judgments/decisions which are appealed against or related to the appealed contents.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@221: The time limit for preparation for appellate trial Except for cases to be adjudicated according to simplified procedures or cases involving foreign elements, the time limit for appellate trial preparation is specified as follows: 1. The Judge assigned to preside over the trial, in 60 days upon the admission of the case, must make one of the following decisions: a) To suspend the appellate trial over the cases; b) Terminate the appellate trial over the case; c) To bring the cases to appellate trial. 2. For complicated cases or due to objective obstacles, the chief judges of the appellate courts may decide to prolong the trial preparation time limit prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, which, however, must not exceed 30 days. 3. Within 30 days after the date of issuance of a decision to bring the case to trial, the court shall open an appellate court hearing. This time limit, if having a plausible reason, is 60 days. 4. The decision to bring a case to appellate trial must be sent to the equivalent Procuracy and persons related to the appeal or protest. 5. In case of decisions to suspend the appellate trial over cases, the time limit for appellate trial preparation shall be re-counted from the date the courts' decisions to resume the resolution of the cases take legal effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@222: Members of the appellate trial panel An appellate trial panel is composed of 3 judges, except the case specified in Clause 1, Article 253 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@223: The presence of members of the appellate trial panel and the Court reporter 1. A Court session shall be conducted only when all members of the trial panel and the Court reporter are present. 2. If a Judge is absent or unable to continue to participate in the trial but an alternate Judge is present at the Court session from the beginning, such alternate Judge shall be replaced by the absent Judge or unable to continue to participate in the trial. 3. If there is no alternate Judge to replace the members of the Trial Panel as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article, the Court session shall be postponed. 4. If the Court reporter is absent or unable to continue to participate in the Court session without a replacement, the Court session must be postponed.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@224: The presence of procurators 1. Procurators assigned by the chairperson of the procuracy of the same level shall participate in court hearings. The trial panel shall decide to postpone court hearings when procurators are absent in case procuracies lodge protests. 2. If the procurator is absent or unable to continue participating in the Court session but an alternate procurator is present at the Court session from the beginning, such alternate procurator shall be entitled to replace the absent procurator to participate in the Court session for adjudication of the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@225: Presence of involved parties, defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests, expert-witnesses, interpreters and witnesses 1. When the first-time Court sends a valid summons, the appellant, persons with interests and duties related to the appeal or protest and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests must be present; if any of them is absent, the trial panel shall postpone the court hearing. The Court shall notify the appellant, persons with interests and duties related to the appeal or protest and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests of the postponement of the Court session. 2. The Court that has duly summoned the second time, the appellant, persons with interests and duties related to the appeal, protest and defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests must be present at the Court session. If the appellant is absent not due to force majeure events or objective obstacles, he/she shall be handled as follows : a) If the appellant does not have a representative to attend the trial, he/she shall be deemed to waive his/her appeal and the Court shall issue a decision to terminate the appellate trial over the judgment/decision or part of the first-instance Court's judgment/decision appealed against by the absent appellant; b) The court shall conduct trial in their absence against persons with interests and duties related to the appeal or protest, defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties. 3. The presence of witnesses, experts and interpreters in appellate Court sessions shall comply with the provisions of Articles 159,160 and 161 of this Law. 4. If procedure participants file applications requesting courts to conduct trials in their absence, courts shall conduct appellate court hearings to conduct trials in their absence.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@226: In case the appellate trial panel is not required to open a trial or summon involved parties : 1. The appellate trial panel is not required to open a Court session in the following cases: a) Consider the overdue appeal; b/Cases specified in Clause 2, Article 209 of this Law; to consider appeals or protests regarding court cost; c) Consider appeals against decisions of first-instance Courts. 2. In the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the trial panel is not required to summon involved parties, except for the case of considering overdue appeals specified in Clause 2, Article 208 of this Law or where they need to be heard. If the summoned persons are absent, the court shall still hold the session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@227: Submission of materials and evidences at appellate Courts 1. Involved parties may additionally supply documents and evidence in the stage of appellate trial preparation in the following cases : a) Materials and evidences requested by the first-instance Courts but the involved parties cannot submit them for plausible reasons; b) Materials and evidences that the first-instance Courts do not request involved parties to submit or involved parties cannot know about in the course of settling cases according to first-instance procedures. 2. Procedures for handing over materials and evidences shall comply with the provisions of Article 83 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@228: Suspension of appellate trial of cases 1. The appellate Courts shall issue decisions to suspend the appellate trial over the cases, the consequences of the suspension of the appellate trial over the cases and the resumption of the appellate trial over the cases shall comply with the provisions of Articles 141 and 142 of this Law. 2. The decision to suspend the appellate trial of a case shall come into force as follows : Go ahead. 3. The decision on temporary suspension must be immediately sent to the involved parties and the procuracy of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@229: Termination of appellate trial of cases 1. The appellate Courts shall issue decisions to terminate the appellate trial of cases in the following cases : a) The cases specified in Point a Clause 1 Article 143 of this Law; b) The appellate court has accepted the case file in case of return of the appeal application as per this Law; c) The appellant withdraws the whole appeal or the procuracy withdraws the whole appeal; d) The appellant has been duly summoned twice but still a) The Judge is absent, unless he/she requests the Court to conduct trial in his/her absence or there is force majeure event or objective obstacles; e/Other cases prescribed by law. 2. If the appellant withdraws the whole appeal or the procuracy withdraws the whole appeal before the appellate Court issues a decision to bring the case to appellate trial, the Judge assigned to preside over the trial shall issue a decision to terminate the appellate trial; if the appellant withdraws the whole appeal or the procuracy withdraws the whole appeal after the appellate Court issues a decision to bring the case to appellate trial, the appellate Trial panel shall issue a decision to terminate the appellate trial. In these cases, the first-instance judgments/decisions shall take legal effect from the day on which the appellate Courts issue decisions to terminate the appellate trial. 3. If the appellant withdraws part of the appeal or the procuracy withdraws part of the protest, the appellate trial panel shall consider the appellant's or procuracy's withdrawal of part of the appeal and decide to terminate the trial of such part in the appellate judgment. 4. If the trial panel suspends the appellate trial as per Section 2 of this Article and finds that the first-instance Court's judgments and rulings fall into one of the cases as defined in Section 1, Article 255 of this Law, it must petition the Chief Justice of the competent Court to consider according to cassation procedures. 5. The suspension decisions must be immediately sent to the involved parties and the procuracies of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@230: Decision on application, change or cancellation of provisional urgent measures In the course of settling cases, appellate courts may decide to apply, change or cancel provisional urgent measures under Chapter V of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@231: Transfer of case files to the Procuracy 1. The appellate Court must transfer the case file and the decision to bring the case to trial to the procuracy of the same level. 2. The time limit for the procuracy of the same level to study the case file is 15 days from the day on which the case file is received. Upon the expiry of such time limit, the procuracy shall return the case file to the Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@232: Postponement of appellate trial 1. Cases in which a Court session must be postponed : a) The cases specified in Clause 2 Article 161, Clause 3 and Clause 4 Article 223, Clause 1 Article 225 of this Law; b) The Trial panel members, procurators, Court clerks and/or interpreters are replaced without any replacement; c/The expert-witness is replaced; d) Evidences need to be verified or collected but cannot be collected immediately in Court sessions. 2. Cases of postponement of Court sessions are specified in Clause 2, Article 159 and Clause 2, Article 160 of this Law. 3. The time limit for postponing the appellate Court session and the decision to postpone the appellate Court session shall comply with the provisions of Article 163 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@233: Appellate Trial Procedures 1. Preparation for the opening of the Court session, procedures for starting the appellate Court session, procedures for disclosure of documents, examination of exhibits at the appellate Court session, deliberation and pronouncement of judgments, amendment and supplementation of appellate judgments shall be carried out in the same manner as first-instance trial procedures prescribed in this Law. 2. After the end of the procedures for starting the appellate Court sessions, a member of the appellate trial panels shall announce the contents of the cases, the first-instance judgments and the appealed or protested contents. 3. The presiding judge shall ask about the following matters: a) To ask the litigators whether or not they withdraw their lawsuit petitions; b) Ask the appellant and procurator whether they wish to amend, supplement or withdraw the appeal; c) Whether the involved parties can reach agreement on the resolution of the cases. 4. If the appellant withdraws part of the appeal or the procurator withdraws part of the protest, the Court shall accept such withdrawal. If the appellant or the procurator adds new contents not falling within the scope of the initial appeal or protest, the Court shall not consider such contents. 5. The presiding judge shall ask involved parties and procurators about the amendment, supplementation or withdrawal of appeals in Court sessions as follows : a) To ask the litigators whether or not they withdraw their lawsuit petitions; b) Ask the appellant and procurator whether or not the appeal or protest is amended or withdrawn. 6. If the procuracy protests, the procurator shall state the procuracy's protesting opinions on the first-instance judgment's rulings being protested against.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@234: The litigator withdraws his/her lawsuit petition before the opening of the appellate trial or at the appellate trial. 1. Before the opening of or at the appellate Court sessions, if the litigators withdraw their lawsuit petitions, the appellate trial panels must ask the defendants whether they agree or not and, depending on each case, settle as follows : a) If the defendant disagrees, the withdrawal of the lawsuit petition of the plaintiff shall not be accepted; b) The involved parties agree, then accept the withdrawal of lawsuit petitions of the litigators. The appellate trial panels shall issue decisions to annul the first-instance judgments and stop the resolution of the cases. In this case, the involved parties shall still have to bear the first-instance court fees under decisions of the first-instance courts and half of the appellate court fees as provided for by law. 2. In case the appellate trial panel issues a decision to terminate the settlement of the case, the plaintiff may re-institute the case according to the procedures prescribed by this Law if the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit has not yet expired.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@235: The defendant shall amend or cancel the administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case, stop or remedy the administrative act against which the lawsuit is instituted. 1. In case the defendant amends or annuls an administrative decision, a disciplinary decision on dismissal or a decision on settlement of a complaint about a decision on handling of a competition case or stops or redresses an administrative act against which a lawsuit is instituted which is related to the rights and obligations of an agency, organization or individual and the plaintiff agrees to withdraw the lawsuit petition and the person with related interests and obligations making an independent claim agrees to withdraw the claim, the appellate trial panel shall annul the first-instance judgment or decision and terminate the case settlement. The judgment decision must clearly state the commitment of the involved party to ensure the enforcement of the administrative judgment. 2. In case the defendant amends or annuls an administrative decision, a disciplinary decision on dismissal or a decision on settlement of a complaint about a decision on handling of a competition case or stops or redresses an administrative act against which a lawsuit is instituted but the amendment or annulment of such administrative decision, the stopping or redressing of such administrative act is related to the rights and obligations of another agency, organization or individual and he/she has not participated in procedures at first-instance level, then : a) If the petitioner withdraws his/her petition and the person with related interests and obligations having independent request withdraws his/her request, the appellate trial Panel shall cancel the judgment or decision of first instance and stop the settlement of case. In this case, the organ, organization or individual with the rights and obligations related to the modification or cancellation of administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal, decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case or stop or remedy the administrative act against which the lawsuit is initiated has the right to initiate the administrative case under the general procedures; b) If the petitioner does not withdraw his/her petition and the person with related interests and obligations having independent claims does not withdraw his/her request, the appellate trial Panel shall annul the judgment or decision of the first instance for re-trial of first instance. In this case, the first instance Court must bring the organ, organization or individual with their rights and obligations related to the amendment or cancellation of administrative decision, disciplinary decision on dismissal or decision on settlement of complaint about decision on handling of competition case or stop or remedy the administrative act against which the lawsuit is initiated to participate in the proceedings in the capacity as the person with related interests and obligations.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@236: Contents and methods of oral argument in appellate Court sessions Contents and methods of oral argument in appellate Court sessions shall comply with Article 175 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@237: Presentations of involved parties and procurators at appellate Court sessions 1. If an involved party still keeps the appeal or the procuracy still keeps the protest, the presentation at the appellate Court session shall be conducted as follows: a) The defense counsels of the legitimate rights and interests of the appellants shall present the appealed contents and grounds therefor. The appellants may give additional opinions. In case all involved parties appeal, the presentation shall be made in the order of defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of the appellant and the plaintiff; defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of the appellant and the defendant; defense counsels of the rights and legitimate interests of the appellant and the person with related interests and obligations; b) If only the procuracy protests, the procurator shall present the appealed contents and grounds for the protests. If there is an appeal and an appeal, the involved parties shall present the appealed contents and grounds for the appeal first, then the procurator shall present the appealed contents and grounds for the protests; c) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of other involved parties involved in the appeal or protest present their opinions on the appealed or protested contents. Involved parties may give additional opinions. 2. In cases where the involved parties have no defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests, they shall present their opinions on the appealed or protested contents and their proposals. 3. At appellate Court sessions, involved parties and procurators may produce additional documents and evidence.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@238: Pausing the appellate trial The postponement of appellate Court sessions shall comply with the provisions of Article 187 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@239: Arguments in appellate court 1. At appellate Court sessions, involved parties and defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests may only argue about matters falling within the scope of appellate trial and have been questioned at the appellate Court sessions. 2. The order of making statements during an argument is as follows: a) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of appellants shall make presentations. The appellants may give additional opinions; b) Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties shall argue and respond. Involved parties may give additional opinions; c) The involved parties answer questions under the direction of the presiding Judges; d) When necessary, the trial panel may request involved parties to additionally argue about specific matters to serve as a basis for settling the case. 3. The order of argument against protests of procuracies is as follows: a) Defense counsels of litigants' legitimate rights and interests shall state the legitimacy and availability of the procuracy's appeals. Litigants are entitled to provide additional opinions; b/The procurator shall present his/her opinions on matters raised by the defense counsel of the rights and legitimate interests of involved parties or involved parties. 4. In cases where the involved parties have no defense counsels of their legitimate rights and interests, they shall argue by themselves. 5. If one of the involved parties and other participants in the procedures is absent, the presiding Judges must announce their testimonies so that the involved parties present at the Court sessions can argue and reply.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@240: The procurator's statement at the appellate court hearing After procedure participants finish their arguments and replies, procurators shall present the procuracies opinions on law observance in the course of settling administrative cases at the appellate stage. Immediately after the end of the Court session, the procurators must send the written opinions to the Court for filing in the case files.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@241: The appellate trial panel's jurisdiction 1. To reject the appeal or protest and uphold the first-instance judgment's rulings. 2. To modify part or the whole of the first-instance judgment if the first-instance court makes unlawful decisions in the following cases : a) The proof and collection of evidence have been fully carried out in accordance with Chapter VI of this Law; b) The proof and collection of evidences have not been fully carried out at the first-instance level but have been fully supplemented at the appellate Court sessions. 3. To repeal first-instance judgments and transfer case files to first-instance courts for retrial in case of serious procedural violations or in case important new evidence must be collected but appellate courts cannot immediately supplement such evidence. 4. To cancel first-instance judgments and terminate the resolution of cases if in the course of first-instance trial, there is one of the cases specified in Clause 1, Article 143 of this Law. 5. To terminate the appellate trial, if the appellate trial of the case requires the presence of the appellant and he/she is absent though he/she has been duly summoned twice. In this case, the first-instance judgment takes legal effect. 6. In case of necessity to request competent agencies or persons to consider and handle administrative documents specified in Clause 1, Article 6 of this Law, trial panels may suspend court hearings to wait for settlement results of competent agencies or persons and report such to court presidents for requesting competent agencies or persons in writing to consider and handle those administrative documents. Within 30 days after receiving court documents, competent agencies or persons shall issue written replies on the handling results to courts for use as a basis for settling cases. Past this time limit, if receiving no written replies of competent agencies or persons, trial panels may apply documents of superior state management agencies to settle cases. 7. If detecting that legal documents related to the settlement of administrative cases show signs of contravening the Constitution, laws or legal documents of superior state agencies, trial panels shall request chief judges of courts currently settling these cases to make recommendations or request competent persons defined in Article 112 of this Law to make recommendations. In this case, trial panels shall suspend the court hearing to seek opinions of chief judges of courts or suspend the settlement of cases upon receiving written recommendations of chief judges of competent courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@242: Appellate judgments 1. The appellate trial panels shall issue appellate judgments in the name of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. An appellate judgment shall include: a) Introduction; b) The case contents, appeals and judgments; c) The decision section. 3. The introduction section must clearly state the name of the appellate court; the serial number and date of acceptance of the case; the serial number of the judgment and the date of judgment pronouncement; full names of members of the trial panel, the court clerk, procurator, expert-witness and interpreter; names and addresses of the plaintiff, defendant, persons with related interests and obligations, agency or organization initiating the lawsuit; lawful representatives and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests; appellant and protesting procuracy; public or closed trial; time and place of trial. 4. The section on the case contents, appeals and judgments must summarize the contents of the cases and decisions of the first-instance courts; the appealed contents. The Court shall, according to the results of oral argument and evidences examined in the Court session, analyze, assess and make judgments on the appeal, details of the case, the settlement and trial of the first-instance Court, legal grounds and precedents (if any) which the Court applies to accept or reject the appeal and settle other relevant matters. 5. The decision section must clearly state legal grounds and the trial panel's decisions on each issue to be settled in the case, on the application of provisional urgent measures, on first-instance and appellate court costs and procedural expenses (if any). 6. When retrying a case in which a judgment/decision has been partially or wholly annulled according to cassation/reopening decisions, the Court shall settle the property and obligations that have been executed according to the effective judgment/decision but annulled. 7. An appellate judgment takes legal effect on the date of judgment pronouncement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@243: Appellate procedures for first-instance courts' decisions which are appealed or protested against 1. The appellate Court must hold a meeting and issue a decision to settle the appeal within 15 days from the day on which the appeal is received. 2. A member of the appellate trial panel who considers the appealed or protested decision shall briefly present the appealed or protested first-instance decision, the appealed or protested contents and enclosed documents and evidence (if any). 3. The appellant shall be invited to attend the meeting to present his/her opinions on the appeal. If he/she is absent, the trial panel shall still hold the meeting. 4. The procurator of the procuracy of the same level shall attend the appellate meeting and present opinions on the settlement of the appeal or protest before the appellate trial panel issues a decision. The trial panel shall decide to postpone the meeting when the procurator is absent in case the procuracy makes a protest. 5.
