When considering the first-instance Court's rulings being appealed against, the appellate Trial panel shall have the power to: a) Uphold the first-instance Court's rulings; b) Amend the first-instance Court's rulings; c) Repeal the first-instance Court's rulings and transfer case files to the first-instance Court for further actions. 6. The appellate decisions shall take legal effect as from the date of their issuance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@244: Sending of appellate judgments and decisions 1. Within 30 days after issuing an appellate judgment or ruling, the appellate court shall send it to involved parties, the procuracy and court which has settled the case at first-instance level, the same-level procuracy, the competent civil judgment enforcement agency and the immediate superior agency of the defendant. 2. The appellate judgments shall be posted on the Courts' websites (if any ), except for the judgments containing information specified in Clause 2 Article 96 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@245: Scope of application of summary procedure 1. Summary procedures in administrative procedures mean procedures for settling administrative cases when conditions prescribed in this Law are satisfied in order to shorten the time and procedures compared with those for settling ordinary administrative cases while still ensuring lawful settlement of the cases. 2. Courts shall apply the provisions of this Chapter and other provisions of this Law which are not contrary to the provisions of this Chapter to settle cases according to simplified procedures. 3. In case other laws provide for administrative lawsuits to be applied summary procedures, this Law shall apply.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@246: Conditions for application of summary procedure 1. A case shall be settled according to simplified procedures when all of the following conditions are satisfied: a) The case has simple details, documents and evidences are sufficient and clear, ensuring sufficient grounds for settling the case and the Court does not have to collect documents and evidences; b) All involved parties have clear addresses of their residence places and head-offices; c) There is no involved party residing in a foreign country, unless the involved party residing in a foreign country has reached an agreement with the involved party residing in Vietnam to request the court to settle the case according to simplified procedures. 2. During the process of settling a case according to simplified procedures, the court shall issue a decision to transfer the case to other procedures if it falls into one of the following cases : a) New facts arise but the involved parties do not agree and it is necessary to verify, collect more documents and evidences or to conduct expertise; b) The property must be valued if the involved parties fail to reach agreement on the price; c) It is necessary to apply temporary emergency measures; d) There are persons with related interests and obligations; dd) Independent requirements arise; e) There are involved parties residing overseas who need to perform the judicial entrustment, except for the case specified at Point c, Clause 1 of this Article. 3. In case of transfer of cases for settlement according to common procedures, the time limit for preparation for trial of the cases shall be re-counted from the date of issuance of decisions to transfer the cases for settlement according to common procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@247: Decision to bring the case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures 1. Within 30 days after the date of acceptance of a case as prescribed in Article 125 of this Law, the judge assigned to settle the case shall issue a decision to bring the case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures and open a trial within 10 days after the date of issuance of such decision. 2. A decision to bring a case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures must contain the following principal details : a) Date of issuance; b) Name of the Court issuing the decision; c) The case is brought for resolution according to simplified procedures; d) Names, addresses; fax numbers, e-mails (if any) of the litigator, defendant, person with related interests and obligations; dd) Full names of the Judge, Court reporter and procurator; full names of alternate Judge and procurator (if any); e) Date and place of the trial; g) Public or closed trial; h) Full names of the persons summoned to the Court session. 3. The decision to bring a case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures must be sent to involved parties and the same-level procuracy together with the case file immediately after it is issued. Within 3 working days after receiving the case file, the procuracy shall study and return it to the court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@248: Complaints, petitions and settlement of complaints and petitions about decisions to bring cases to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures 1. Within 03 working days from the day on which the decision to bring the case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures is received, involved parties may file complaints and the procuracy of the same level may file recommendations to the Chief Justice of the Court that has issued such decision. 2. Within 03 working days from the receipt of the complaint or petition for the decision to bring the case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures, the Chief Justice of the Court shall make one of the following decisions: a) Uphold the decision to bring the case to trial for resolution according to simplified procedures; b) To cancel the decision to bring the case to settlement according to simplified procedures and transfer the case to settlement according to normal procedures. 3. The decision on settlement of a complaint or recommendation of the chief justice of a court is final and must be immediately sent to involved parties and the same-level procuracy.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@249: Summary procedure hearing 1. The first-instance trial of administrative cases according to simplified procedures shall be conducted by one judge. 2. The Judge shall conduct the opening procedures of the Court session as prescribed in the Article 169 of this Law 3. After the opening of the Court session, the Judge shall conduct the dialogue, unless the dialogue cannot be conducted as prescribed in Article 135 of this Law. If the involved parties reach an agreement on the resolution of the case, the Judge shall make a record of successful dialogue and issue a decision to recognize the successful dialogue result as prescribed in Article 140 of this Law. If the involved parties fail to reach an agreement on the resolution of the case, the Judge shall conduct the trial. The presentation, argument, response and proposition of viewpoints on the settlement of cases shall comply with the provisions of Section 3, Chapter XI of this Law. 4. If new facts as defined in Section 2, Article 246 of this Law arise in the Court's proceedings, rendering the case ineligible for summary procedure, the Judge shall consider and decide to move the case to the ordinary procedures and the time limit for trial preparation shall be recalculated as per Section 3, Article 246 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@250: Effect of judgments and decisions according to simplified procedures 1. The first-instance judgments/decisions of Courts according to simplified procedures may be appealed against to request the appellate Courts to re-settle according to appellate simplified procedures. 2. Judgments/decisions made according to simplified procedures may be appealed against according to cassation/reopening procedures as prescribed in this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@251: Time limit for appeal against judgments/decisions under simplified procedures 1. The time limit for appeal against a first-instance Court's judgments/decisions according to simplified procedures shall be 07 days from the day on which the judgments are pronounced. If involved parties are absent from the Court session, the time limit for appeal shall be counted from the day on which the judgments/decisions are handed over to them or posted up. 2. The time limit for filing protests against first-instance courts' judgments or rulings according to simplified procedures by the same-level procuracy or immediate superior procuracy is 7 days and 10 days respectively after receiving such judgments or rulings.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@252: The time limit for preparation for appellate trial 1. Within 30 days after admitting a case, the appellate court shall, on a case-by-case basis, issue one of the following decisions : a) To suspend the appellate trial over the cases; b) Terminate the appellate trial over the case; c) To bring the cases to appellate trial. 2. A decision to bring a case to appellate trial must contain the details specified in Clause 2, Article 247 of this Law. 3. The decision to bring a case to appellate trial must be sent to persons related to the appeal and the procuracy of the same level together with the case file. Within 05 working days from the day on which the case file is received, the procuracy shall study and return the case file to the Court. If the Court issues a decision to transfer the case to the usual procedures as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 246 of this Law, the time limit for preparation for the trial shall be calculated as prescribed in Clause 3 Article 246 of this Law. 4. If a decision to suspend the appellate trial over a case is issued, the time limit for preparation for the appellate trial shall be re-counted from the date on which the decision to annul or suspend the case of the Court takes legal effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@253: Appellate procedures for judgments or decisions of first-instance courts which are settled according to simplified procedures and are appealed or protested against 1. The appellate trial of administrative cases according to simplified procedures shall be conducted by one judge. Within 15 days after the issuance of a decision to bring the case to trial, the judge shall open an appellate trial. 2. The trial must be attended by involved parties and procurators of the procuracies of the same level. In case procurators are absent, the trial panels shall still conduct the trials, except for cases where the procuracies lodge appellate protests. If the involved parties are absent without plausible reasons after having been duly summoned or have filed applications for trial in their absence, the Judges shall still conduct the Court sessions. 3. The Judge shall present the summary of the first-instance judgments/decisions being appealed against, the contents of the appeals and enclosed documents/evidences (if any). 4. Defense counsels of legitimate rights and interests of involved parties shall present and involved parties shall give additional opinions on the appealed contents, argue, reply and propose their opinions on the resolution of the cases. 5. After finishing the argument and response, the procurator shall present the procuracy's opinions on the observance of law in the course of settling administrative cases at the appellate stage. 6. When considering the first-instance Court's judgments/decisions being appealed against, the Judges shall have the following rights: a) Uphold the judgments/decisions of the first-instance Courts; b) Amend the first-instance Court's judgments/decisions; c) Repeal the judgments/decisions of the first-instance Courts and transfer the case files to the first-instance Courts for re-settlement of the cases according to simplified procedures or according to common procedures if the conditions for settlement according to simplified procedures are no longer satisfied; d) To repeal the first-instance judgments and terminate the resolution of the cases; dd) Terminate the appellate trial and uphold the first-instance court's judgments. 7. Appellate judgments and decisions shall take legal effect as from the date of their issuance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@254: The nature of cassation Cassation means the review of a Court's legally effective judgments or rulings which are protested against according to cassation procedures when there are grounds specified in Article 255 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@255: Grounds and conditions for protest according to cassation procedures 1. A legally effective court judgment or ruling shall be protested against according to cassation procedures when there is one of the following grounds : a) The conclusion in the judgment/decision is not conformable with the objective details of the case, thus causing damage to the legitimate rights and interests of the involved parties; b) There is a serious violation of the procedures, which prevents the involved parties from exercising their procedural rights and obligations, thus causing their legitimate rights and interests to not be protected strictly according to law provisions; c) There are mistakes in the application of law leading to the issuance of improper judgments and decisions causing damage to the legitimate rights and interests of the involved parties, public interests, State interests, the legitimate rights and interests of the third persons. 2. Persons competent to lodge protests specified in Article 260 of this Law shall lodge protests against legally effective court judgments or decisions when there is one of the grounds specified in Clause 1 of this Article and there is a petition of the requester as specified in Articles 257 and 258 of this Law, except for cases of infringing upon public interests, the State's interests or the lawful rights and interests of a third party, petition is not required.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@256: A judgment or ruling which has taken legal effect and needs to be reviewed according to cassation procedures is detected. 1. Within 01 year from the effective date of the Court's judgments/decisions, if one of the grounds specified in Clause 1 Article 255 of this Law is found, involved parties may request in writing the persons competent to appeal specified in Article 260 of this Law to consider making a protest according to cassation procedures. 2. In case a court, procuracy or another agency, organization or individual detects any of the grounds specified in Clause 1, Article 255 of this Law, it shall notify such in writing to persons competent to protest specified in Article 260 of this Law. 3. The president of the provincial Court shall recommend the president of the Collegial People's Court or the President of the Supreme People's Court, the president of the Collegial People's Court shall recommend the President of the Supreme People's Court to consider making a protest according to cassation procedures against the legally effective court judgment or decision if one of the grounds specified in Clause 1, Article 255 of this Law is detected.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@257: A written request for review of a legally effective court judgment or ruling according to cassation procedures 1. An application form must contain the following information: a) Date of making the application; b) Name and address of the applicant; c) Name of the legally effective court judgment or decision requested to be reviewed according to cassation procedures; d) Reasons and grounds for the request and request of the requester; dd) Signature or fingerprint of the petitioner if the petitioner is an individual; if the petitioner is an organization, the legal representative of such organization must sign and append a seal at the end of the application. If the petitioner is an enterprise, the use of seal shall comply with the Law on Enterprises. 2. The petitioner must send the petition together with the effective judgment or decision of the Court; documents and evidences (if any) to prove that his/her petition is well grounded. 3. The written request and materials and evidences shall be sent to the person competent to protest according to cassation procedures specified in Article 260 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@258: Procedures for receiving and examining petitions, notices and recommendations for consideration of legally effective court judgments or decisions according to cassation procedures 1. Courts or procuracies shall receive petitions filed directly by involved parties at courts or procuracies or sent by post and shall record them in petition registers and issue written certification of receipt of the petitions to involved parties. The date of sending of a petition is the date the involved party files the petition at the court or procuracy or the date stamped by the sending post office. Upon receiving notices or recommendations of agencies, organizations or individuals specified in Clauses 2 and 3, Article 256 of this Law, courts or procuracies shall record them in acceptance books for settlement. 2. The Court or Procuracy shall accept the application when it has sufficient contents and enclosed documents specified in Article 257 of this Law. The Court or Procuracy may request involved parties to supplement contents of the application and documents in case such contents are incomplete. If involved parties fail to comply with the request for supplementation, the Court or Procuracy shall notify in writing the return of the application to involved parties and record the request in the application receipt book. 3. Persons competent to appeal according to cassation procedures shall assign persons responsible for studying written petitions, notices, petitions and case files and report them to persons competent to appeal for consideration and decision. In case of non-application, they shall notify such in writing to involved parties, agencies, organizations and individuals that have sent notices or petitions. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall assign judges of the Supreme People's Court and the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall assign procurators of the Supreme People's Procuracy to study petitions, notices, petitions and case files and report them to the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court or the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy for consideration and decision on protest. In case of non-protest, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court or the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall, by themselves or authorize judges of the Supreme People's Court or procurators of the Supreme People's Procuracy, notify in writing involved parties, agencies, organizations and individuals that have sent notices or petitions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@259: Supplementation and verification of documents and evidences in cassation procedures 1. Involved parties may supply documents and evidence to competent courts or procuracies for review according to cassation procedures if such documents and evidence have not yet been requested by first-instance courts or appellate courts to be supplied by involved parties or have been requested to be supplied but involved parties cannot supply them for plausible reasons or for documents and evidence which they cannot know in the course of settling cases. 2. In the course of settling applications for cassation review, courts or procuracies may request applicants to supplement documents and evidence or examine and verify necessary documents and evidence by themselves.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@260: Persons competent to appeal according to cassation procedures 1. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court and the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall have the power to appeal according to cassation procedures against legally effective judgments/decisions of Collegial People's Courts; legally effective judgments/decisions of other Courts when deemed necessary, except for decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court. 2. Chief Justices of Collegial People's Courts and chairpersons of Collegial People's Procuracies have the power to protest according to cassation procedures against legally effective judgments/decisions of provincial-level Courts or district-level Courts within the territorial jurisdiction.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@261: Postponement or suspension of execution of legally effective judgments or decisions 1. Persons competent to protest against legally effective judgments or decisions of courts may postpone the execution of judgments or decisions for consideration of protests according to cassation procedures. The postponement duration must not exceed 3 months. Regarding a decision on civil part of an administrative judgment/decision of a court, the person competent to appeal may request the civil judgment enforcement agency to postpone the judgment enforcement as prescribed by law on civil judgment enforcement. 2. Persons who have protested according to cassation procedures against legally effective judgments or decisions may decide to suspend the enforcement of such judgments or decisions until cassation decisions are issued.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@262: Decision to appeal according to cassation procedures A decision to protest according to cassation procedures must contain the following principal details: 1. The serial number and date of the protest decision; 2. Position of the person issuing the appeal decision; 3. The serial number and date of the legally effective judgment or ruling protested against; 4. Rulings of the legally effective judgment or ruling protested against; 5. Remarks and analysis of violations and mistakes of the legally effective judgment or ruling protested against; 6. Legal grounds for making the appeal decision; 7. Decisions to protest part or the whole of legally effective judgments or decisions; 8. Name of the Court competent to conduct cassation review of such case; 9. The request of the protestor.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@263: Time limit for protest according to cassation procedures 1. Persons competent to appeal according to cassation procedures may lodge protests within 3 years after the court judgments or rulings take legal effect. 2. The time limit for protesting against civil parts of administrative judgments or decisions of courts complies with the civil procedure law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@264: Sending of decisions to protest according to cassation procedures 1. The decision to protest according to cassation procedures must be immediately sent to the Court that has rendered the legally effective judgment/decision being protested against, involved parties, competent civil judgment enforcement agencies and other persons having interests and obligations related to the protested contents. 2. If the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court or the Chief Justice of the Collegial People's Court protests, the appeal decisions and case files must be immediately sent to the procuracies of the same level. Within 15 days after receiving the case files, the procuracies shall study and transfer the case files to the courts competent to conduct cassation procedures. 3. In case the Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the Chief Procurator of the Superior People's Procuracy protests, the appeal decisions must be immediately sent to the Courts competent to cassation review. 4. If the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court protests the effective judgments/decisions of other Courts as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 260 of this Law, such Courts shall be entitled to assign the Collegial People's Courts to conduct the trials according to cassation procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@265: Amendment, supplementation and withdrawal of protests 1. Persons who have protested according to cassation procedures may modify or supplement their protest decisions if the protest time limit specified in Article 263 of this Law has not yet expired. 2. Before or during the Court session, the appellant shall have the right to withdraw his/her appeal. The withdrawal of appeal before the Court session must be made in writing and sent as prescribed in Article 264 of this Law. The withdrawal of appeal in Court session must be recorded in the minutes of the Court session and the Cassation Review Panel shall issue a decision to terminate the cassation trial.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@266: The jurisdiction to conduct cassation 1. The Judicial Committee of a Collegial People's Court shall review according to cassation procedures legally effective judgments or decisions of provincial-level or district-level courts within its territorial jurisdiction which are protested against as follows : a) The Committee of Judges of Collegial People's Courts shall conduct cassation trials by trial panels composed of 03 Judges against legally effective judgments/decisions of provincial-level Courts or district-level Courts which are appealed against according to cassation procedures; b) The whole Committee of Judges of the Collegial People's Court shall conduct the cassation review of the effective court judgments/decisions prescribed in Point a Clause 1 of this Article but complicated or the judgments/decisions which have been tried according to cassation procedures by the Committee of Judges of the Collegial People's Court through a trial panel composed of 03 Judges but the consensus on the resolution of the case has not been reached. 2. The Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall review according to cassation procedures legally effective judgments and rulings of superior people's courts which are protested against as follows : a) The Justices' Council of the Supreme People's Court shall conduct trial according to cassation procedures with a trial panel composed of 5 judges against judgments/decisions of Collegial People's Courts which are appealed against according to cassation procedures; b) The entire Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall conduct the cassation review of the effective sentences and rulings as defined in Point a of this Section but of complicated nature or the sentences and rulings, which have been tried according to cassation procedures by the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court through a trial panel composed of 05 Judges, but have not reached a consensus upon the vote for the decision on the settlement of the case. 3. Complicated cases specified at Point b, Clause 1 and Point b, Clause 2 of this Article are those falling into one of the following cases : a) The provisions of law on matters to be settled in the case are unclear, not yet guided for uniform application; b) There are many opinions about the assessment of evidence and application of law; c) The settlement of the case is related to public interests, interests of the State, protection of human rights and citizens' rights which are of special public interest. 4. The chief justice of a superior people's court shall consider and decide to hold cassation hearings in the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article. The chief justice of the Supreme People's Court shall consider and decide to hold cassation hearings in the cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 5. In case legally effective judgments or rulings on the same administrative case fall under the cassation jurisdiction of superior people's courts and the Supreme People's Court, the Supreme People's Court may conduct cassation of the whole case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@267: Participants in the cassation trial 1. The cassation review Court session must be participated by the procuracy of the same level. 2. The Court, when deemed necessary, shall summon involved parties, their lawful representatives, defense counsels of their rights and interests and other participants in legal proceedings related to the appeal to the cassation review Court session. If they are absent from the Court session, the cassation review trial panel shall still conduct the Court session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@268: The time limit for opening a cassation review trial The court empowered to conduct cassation review shall, in 60 days upon receiving the appeal and case file, open the trial.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@269: Preparation for the trial of cassation The court president shall assign a Judge to prepare an oral presentation of the case at the Court session. The oral presentation shall summarize the case, judgments and decisions of the Courts at all levels, and the contents of the protests. The oral presentation must be sent to members of the Cassation Review Panel at least 07 days before the opening date of the Cassation Review Court session.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@270: Procedures for cassation hearings 1. After the presiding judge opens the Court session, a member of the Cassation Review Panels shall present the brief contents of the cases, the process of adjudicating the cases, the decisions of the legally effective judgments/decisions being appealed against, grounds and judgments of the appeals and petitions of the appellants. In cases where the procuracies appeal, representatives of the procuracies shall present the appealed contents. 2. Involved parties, their lawful representatives, defense counsels of their rights and interests and other participants in legal proceedings shall be summoned by the Court to the cassation review Court session to present their opinions on matters requested by the cassation review trial panel. If they are absent but present their opinions in writing, the cassation review trial panel shall announce their opinions. 3. The representative of the procuracy shall present opinions on the decision to appeal and the resolution of the case. Immediately after the end of the Court session, the procurators must send the written opinions to the Court for filing in the case files. 4. Members of the Cassation Review Panels shall present their opinions and discuss. The Cassation Review Panels shall deliberate and vote on the resolution of the cases and announce the contents of the decisions on the resolution of the cases at the Court sessions. The deliberation must comply with the principles prescribed in Article 191 of this Law. 5. If the Committee of Judges of a Collegial People's Court conducts a trial as prescribed in Point a Clause 1 Article 266 of this Law, the decision of the trial panel must be voted for by all members of the panel. In the case prescribed in Point b Clause 1 Article 266 of this Law, the trial of the entire Committee of Justices of Collegial People's Court shall be participated by at least two thirds of its members; decisions of the Committee of Justices must be voted for by more than half of its members. 6. If the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court conducts a trial according to Point a, Clause 2, Article 266 of this Law, its rulings must be voted for by all Council members. In the case prescribed in Point b Clause 2 Article 266 of this Law, the trial of the whole of the Council of Justices of the Supreme People's Court must be participated by at least two thirds of its members; decisions of the Council of Justices must be voted for by more than half of its members.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@271: Scope of cassation 1. The Cassation Review Panels shall only consider the parts of legally effective judgments/decisions being protested against or related to the consideration of the protested contents. 2. The Cassation Review Panels shall be entitled to consider the parts of the legally effective judgments or decisions, which are not protested against or are not related to the protested contents, if such parts infringe upon the public interests, the State's interests, the legitimate rights and interests of the third parties other than the involved parties in the cases.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@272: The jurisdiction of the Judicial panel of cassation 1. To reject the protests and uphold the legally effective judgments or decisions. 2. To repeal legally effective judgments or decisions being protested against and uphold lawful judgments or decisions of subordinate courts which have been repealed or amended. 3. To repeal legally effective judgments or decisions being protested against for first-instance or appellate retrial. 4. To repeal the judgment or ruling of the court which has settled the case and terminate the settlement of the case. 5. Amend part or the whole of the Court's sentences and rulings in effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@273: To repeal legally effective judgments or decisions being protested against and uphold lawful judgments or decisions of subordinate courts which have been annulled or amended. The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to annul legally effective judgments/decisions being protested against and uphold the judgments/decisions of the subordinate courts which have tried judgments/decisions lawfully but have been partially or wholly annulled or amended by legally effective judgments/decisions being protested against. If the Court's judgments/decisions have been partially or wholly enforced, the Cassation Review Panels must settle the consequences of the judgment enforcement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@274: Repealing the effective sentences and rulings protested against for retrial according to first-instance or appellate procedures The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to annul legally effective judgments or decisions being protested against for retrial according to first-instance or appellate procedures in the following cases : 1. The collection of evidences and proof have not yet fully or improperly complied with the provisions of Chapter VI of this Law; 2. The conclusions in the judgments or decisions are incompatible with the objective details of the cases or there are serious errors in the application of law; 3. The composition of the first-instance or appellate trial panel fails to comply with this Law or there is another serious procedural violation.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@275: Repealing the judgment/decision of the Court that has settled the case and suspending the settlement of the case The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to annul judgments/decisions of the Courts which have settled the cases and terminate the resolution of the cases if one of the cases prescribed in Clause 1, Article 143 of this Law occurs during the first-instance or appellate trials. The cassation-level courts shall return the case files to the Courts which have conducted the first-instance trials for returning the lawsuit petitions together with accompanying documents and/or evidences to the litigators, if so requested. If the Court's judgments/decisions have been partially or wholly enforced, the Cassation Review Panels must settle the consequences of the judgment enforcement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@276: Amendments to part or the whole of the Court's sentences and rulings in effect 1. The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to partially or wholly revise legally effective judgments/decisions when the following conditions are fully met: 1. The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to partially or wholly revise legally effective judgments/decisions when the following conditions are fully met: 1. The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to partially or wholly revise legally effective judgments/decisions when the following conditions are fully met: 2. The Court Panels shall issue decisions to partially or wholly revise legally effective judgments/decisions; a) Documents and evidences in case files are sufficient and clear; there are sufficient grounds to clarify details in the cases; b) The amendment of the judgment/decision being appealed does not affect the rights and obligations of other agencies, organizations and individuals. 2. If a court judgment/decision has been partially or wholly enforced, the Cassation Review Panels must settle the consequences of the judgment enforcement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@277: Cassation decisions 1. The Cassation Review Panels shall issue decisions to conduct the cassation procedures in the name of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam. 2. A cassation review decision must contain the following details: a) Date and location of the Court session; b) Full names of members of the Cassation Review Panels. If the Cassation Review Panels are the Judicial Committees of Collegial People's Courts or the Judicial Councils of the Supreme People's Courts, full names and positions of the presiding Judges and the number of members participating in the trials must be specified; c) Full names of Court clerks and procurators participating in the Court session; d) Name of the case brought by the Panel for cassation review trial; e/Names and addresses of involved parties in the case; e) Summary of the case, the decision of the legally effective judgment/decision being appealed against; g) The decision to appeal and reasons for the appeal; h) Judgments of the Cassation Review Panels, which must analyze the grounds for accepting or not accepting the protests; arguments of the Cassation Review Panels on legal matters raised and settled in the cases (if any); i) Points, clauses and articles of the Law on Administrative Procedures on which the Cassation Review Panels base to issue decisions; k) The decisions of the Cassation Review Panels. 3. A decision of the Cassation Review Panel of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court must contain arguments to clarify the provisions of law that are still interpreted in different ways; to analyze and explain legal issues and events and indicate the reasons and handling guidelines and applicable legal norms (if any).
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@278: Effect of cassation decisions The cassation review decisions shall take legal effect as from the date the cassation review trial panels issue them.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@279: Sending of cassation decisions Within 05 working days from the day on which the cassation review decision is issued, the trial panel shall send it to the following authorities and entities: 1. The involved parties; 2. The court which has issued the legally effective judgment/decision is protested against, annulled or amended; 3. The procuracies of the same level and the procuracies competent to supervise judgment execution; 4. The competent civil judgment-executing bodies; 5. The immediate superior agency of the defendant. 6. Cassation decisions shall be published by the cassation-level courts on their e-portals (if any ), except for court decisions containing information specified in Clause 2, Article 96 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@280: The nature of reopening Reopening means the review of legally effective judgments or decisions which are protested against because of newly discovered details which may substantially change the contents of the judgments or decisions and which the courts or involved parties did not know when the courts rendered such judgments or decisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@281: Grounds for protest according to reopening procedures A legally effective judgment or ruling shall be protested against according to reopening procedures when there is one of the following grounds : 1. Important details of the case have been discovered but the Court or involved parties could not know them in the course of settling the case; 2. There are grounds to prove that the expertising persons' conclusions, the interpreters' interpretations are untrue or the evidences are forged; 3. Judges, people's jurors or procurators deliberately falsify case files or intentionally make unlawful conclusions; 4. The judgment/decision of the Court or decision of a regulatory agency on which the Court based itself to settle the case has been annulled.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@282: Report and verify newly discovered facts 1. When detecting new details of a case, involved parties or other agencies, organizations and individuals may request in writing persons competent to protest defined in Article 283 of this Law to consider making protests according to reopening procedures. 2. In case of discovering new facts of the case, the procuracy or court shall notify such in writing to persons competent to lodge protests specified in Article 283 of this Law. 3. If new details of the case are discovered, the Chief Justice of the provincial Court shall request the Chief Justice of the Collegial People's Court or the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Chief Justice of the Collegial People's Court shall request the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court to consider making a protest according to reopening procedures.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@283: Persons competent to appeal according to reopening procedures 1. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court and the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall have the power to appeal according to reopening procedures against effective judgments/decisions of Collegial People's Courts; effective judgments/decisions of other Courts when deemed necessary, except for decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court. 2. Chief Justices of Collegial People's Courts and chairpersons of Collegial People's Procuracies have the power to appeal according to reopening procedures against legally effective judgments/decisions of provincial-level Courts or district-level Courts within the territorial jurisdiction. 3. Persons who have protested against legally effective judgments or decisions may decide to suspend the enforcement of such judgments or decisions until reopening decisions are issued.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@284: Time limit for protest according to reopening procedures The time limit for making a protest according to reopening procedures is one year counting from the date a person competent to protest acquires grounds for making a protest according to reopening procedures specified in Article 281 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@285: The competence of the reopening trial Panels 1. To reject the protests and uphold the legally effective judgments or decisions. 2. To cancel legally effective judgments or decisions for first-instance retrial according to the procedures prescribed by this Law. 3. To repeal the judgment or ruling of the court which has tried the case and terminate the resolution of the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@286: Application of the provisions of the cassation procedures Other provisions on reopening jurisdiction and procedures comply with the provisions on cassation procedures in this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@287: Requests, recommendations and proposals for reviewing decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court 1. A decision of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court, when there are grounds to determine that there is a serious law violation or a new important detail which may substantially change its contents and is not known by the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court or involved parties upon its issuance, shall be reviewed in one of the following cases : a) The meeting is requested by Standing Committee of the National Assembly; b) The case is requested by the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee; c) The case is proposed by the Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy; d) The case is requested by the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court. 2. At the request of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall report such to the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court for reviewing its rulings. 3. In case of detecting violations or new important details at the proposal of the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee or the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy or at the proposal of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall report such to the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court for consideration. If the recommendations of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly, the recommendations of the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the requests of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court are concurred with, the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall issue decisions to assign the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court to study case files and report them to the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court for consideration and decision. If the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court disagrees with the recommendations/requests, it shall send a written notice clearly stating the reason. 4. The meeting of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court to consider recommendations/requests prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article must be attended by the Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@288: Sending documents, case files and notices related to procedures for reviewing decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court After receiving a request of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly or a proposal of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly or after the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court makes a written request for reviewing the decision of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 287 of this Law, the Supreme People's Court shall send to the Supreme People's Procuracy copies of such request, proposal or proposal enclosed with the case file for the Supreme People's Procuracy to study and prepare statements at the meeting for considering the proposal or proposal as prescribed in Article 291 of this Law. Within 15 days after receiving the case file, the Supreme People's Procuracy shall return it to the Supreme People's Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@289: Time limit for opening and announcement of opening of a meeting for considering proposals and recommendations 1. Within 30 days after receiving a proposal of the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee or the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall open a meeting to consider the proposal of the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee or the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the proposal of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court under Clause 3, Article 287 of this Law. 2. The Supreme People's Court shall notify in writing the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy of the time of opening a meeting to consider recommendations/requests prescribed in Clause 3 Article 287 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@290: Participants in meetings of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court to consider recommendations and proposals 1. The Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall attend meetings of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court to consider recommendations of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly, recommendations of the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy or proposals of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court as prescribed in Clause 4, Article 287 of this Law. 2. Representatives of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly shall be invited to attend meetings of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court to consider recommendations of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@291: Procedures for conducting a meeting of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court to consider petitions and requests 1. The Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall, on his/her own or assign a member of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court, present a brief description of the case and its settlement process. 2. Representatives of the Judicial Committee of the National Assembly, the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy and the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court who make recommendations or requests for reviewing decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court shall present the following issues: a) Contents and grounds of the petition; b) Analyze and assess facts of the case, old evidences and additional evidences (if any) to clarify serious violations of law in decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court or new important facts that may substantially change the contents of decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court. 3. In case of considering recommendations of the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee or proposals of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall state his/her viewpoints and reasons for his/her agreement or disagreement with such recommendations or proposals. Opinions of the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy must be expressed in writing and signed by the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy and sent to the Supreme People's Court within 5 working days after the end of the meeting. 4. The Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall discuss and vote by majority on the agreement or disagreement with the petition or request for reviewing its decision. 5. If the recommendations of the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee, the recommendations of the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy or the proposals of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court are unanimously accepted, the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall decide to hold a meeting to review its decisions and concurrently assign the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court to study the dossiers and report them to the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court for consideration and decision at the meeting to review its decisions. 6. In case of disagreement with the recommendations/requests, the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall send a written notification to the agencies/individuals prescribed in Article 292 of this Law and provide explanation. 7. All developments at the meeting for considering the petition or proposal and decisions adopted at the meeting must be recorded in the minutes of the meeting and filed in the petition or proposal consideration dossier.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@292: Announcement of the results of the meeting to consider the recommendations/requests for reviewing the decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court Within 05 working days from the end of the meeting to consider the recommendations/requests for reviewing the decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court, the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall send the head of the Supreme People's Procuracy and the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee a written notification of its agreement or disagreement with the recommendations/requests for reviewing the decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@293: Study of case files 1. At the request of the Standing Committee of the National Assembly or under a decision of the Council of Justices of the Supreme People's Court as prescribed in Clause 5, Article 291 of this Law, the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court shall organize the study of case files, verification and collection of documents and evidence when necessary. 2. The study of case files, verification and collection of documents and evidences must clarify whether or not there are serious violations of law or new important details which may substantially change the contents of decisions of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@294: To open a meeting to review a decision of the Judges' Council of the Supreme People's Court 1. Within 04 months from the receipt of the request of Standing Committee of the National Assembly as prescribed in Clause 2 Article 287 of this Law or from the issuance of the decision of the Council of Justices of the Supreme People's Court as prescribed in Clause 5 Article 291 of this Law, the Council of Justices of the Supreme People's Court shall hold a meeting with the participation of all Justices of the Supreme People's Court to review the decision of the Council of Justices of the Supreme People's Court. 2. The Supreme People's Court shall send to the Supreme People's Procuracy a written notice of the time of opening a meeting to review a decision of the Judges' Council of the Supreme People's Court, enclosed with the case file. Within 15 days after receiving the case file, the Supreme People's Procuracy shall return it to the Supreme People's Court.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@295: The Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy attending the meeting to review decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court 1. The Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall attend meetings to review decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court under Clause 4, Article 287 of this Law and state his/her opinions on whether or not there are serious violations of law or new important details substantially changing the contents of decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court and opinions on the settlement of cases. 2. Opinions of the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy must be expressed in writing, bear the signature of the Chairperson of the Supreme People's Procuracy, and must be sent to the Supreme People's Court within 05 working days from the end of the meeting.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@296: Competence to review decisions of the Judicial Council of the Supreme People's Court 1. After hearing the report of the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court, opinions of the Procurator General of the Supreme People's Procuracy and related agencies, organizations and individuals invited to attend the meeting (if any ), the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court shall issue a decision to annul a decision of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court which has committed a serious violation of law or has a new important detail which substantially changes the content of its decision; annul an effective judgment or ruling of a subordinate court which has committed a serious violation of law or has a new important detail which substantially changes the content of its judgment or ruling, and, on a case-by-case basis, decide as follows : a/Reject lawsuit petitions, if they are groundless; b) Accept part or all of the lawsuit petitions, pronounce cancellation of part or all of the unlawful administrative decisions; force the State agencies or competent persons in the State agencies to perform their tasks or public duties according to law provisions; c/Accept part or the whole of the lawsuit petition, declare the administrative act unlawful; force a state agency or competent person in such state agency to terminate the illegal administrative act; d) Accept the petition for initiation of lawsuits, pronounce cancellation of unlawful disciplinary decisions on dismissal; compel the heads of agencies or organizations to perform their tasks or public duties in accordance with law; dd) Accept part or all of the lawsuit petitions, pronounce cancellation of part or all of the decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases; compel competent authorities or persons that have issued decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases to re-settle the cases in accordance with the Competition Law; e) Determine the compensation liability in the cases specified in Points b, c, d and dd Clause 1 of this Article, compel the compensation, restore the lawful rights and interests of organizations and individuals, public interests, State interests, the lawful rights and interests of the third parties that are infringed upon by the administrative decisions, administrative acts, disciplinary decisions on dismissal, decisions on handling of competition cases against the law; determine the compensation liability of the Supreme People's Court that has made a decision on serious violation of law that is cancelled due to unintentional or intentional fault and causes damage to the involved parties or determine the liability to reimburse the value of property as prescribed by law; g) Request competent authorities and heads of competent authorities to consider responsibilities of regulatory authorities and competent persons of regulatory authorities in case of intentional violations of law that cause serious consequences to organizations and individuals. 2. Rulings of the Justices' Council of the Supreme People's Court must be approved by at least three-fourths of its members.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@297: Announcement of the results of the meeting of the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court to review its rulings Within 30 days after the Judges' Council of the Supreme People's Court issues a decision specified in Clause 1, Article 296 of this Law, the Supreme People's Court shall send such decision to the National Assembly Standing Committee, the National Assembly's Judiciary Committee, the Supreme People's Procuracy, the court which has settled the case and involved parties.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@298: Rules of application 1. This Chapter provides procedures for settling administrative cases involving foreign elements. In case this Chapter contains no provisions, other relevant provisions of this Law may apply to the settlement. 2. Administrative cases involving foreign elements are administrative cases falling into one of the following cases: a) The involved parties are foreigners, foreign agencies and/or organizations, branches and/or representative offices of foreign agencies and/or organizations, international organizations, representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam; b) The involved parties are Vietnamese citizens residing overseas; c) The establishment, change or termination of such administrative legal relations occur in foreign countries; d) The property is related to overseas assets.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@299: Procedural rights and obligations of foreign agencies, organizations and individuals, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations and representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam 1. Foreigners, foreign agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations and representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam may initiate lawsuits at Vietnamese courts to request the review of administrative decisions or administrative acts when they have grounds to believe that such decisions or acts are unlawful and infringe upon their legitimate rights and interests. 2. When participating in administrative procedures, foreign agencies, organizations and individuals, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations and representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam have the same procedural rights and obligations as Vietnamese citizens, agencies and organizations. 3. The Vietnamese State may apply the principle of reciprocity to restrict corresponding administrative procedural rights of foreigners, foreign agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations or representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam for which courts of those countries have restricted administrative procedural rights of Vietnamese citizens, Vietnamese agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of Vietnamese agencies and organizations in foreign countries.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@300: Article 16.-The administrative procedure legislation capacity and administrative procedure act capacity of foreigners 1. Administrative procedure law capacity and administrative procedure act capacity of foreigners shall be determined as follows: a) The foreigner's nationality is governed by the law of the country of which he/she holds nationality. If the foreigner is a stateless person, the law of the country where he/she resides shall apply. If the stateless person permanently resides in Vietnam, the Vietnamese law shall apply; b) In accordance with the law of the country where the foreigner holds nationality and resides in one of the countries of which he/she holds nationality if he/she holds multiple foreign nationalities. In case a foreigner has multiple nationalities and resides in a country which does not share his/her nationality, the law of the country where he/she has the longest nationality duration shall apply; c) In accordance with Vietnamese law if the foreigner has multiple nationalities and one of them is Vietnamese nationality or the foreigner has permanent residence card or temporary residence card in Vietnam. 2. Foreigners may be recognized as having administrative procedural act capacity at Vietnamese courts, if they do not have administrative procedural act capacity under foreign laws but have administrative procedural act capacity under Vietnamese laws.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@301: Administrative procedure-related legal capacity of foreign agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations and Vietnam-based representative offices of international organizations 1. Administrative procedure-legal capacity of foreign agencies and organizations shall be determined under the law of the country in which these agencies and organizations are established. The administrative procedure-related legal capacity of a branch or representative office of a foreign agency or organization in Vietnam shall be determined under Vietnamese law. 2. Administrative procedure-legal capacity of international organizations or their representative agencies shall be determined on the basis of treaties serving as a basis for the establishment of these organizations, operation regulations of these organizations or treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam and these international organizations are contracting parties. In case an international organization declares to waive its privileges or immunities, its administrative procedure law capacity shall be determined in accordance with Vietnamese law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@302: Protection of the legitimate rights and interests of involved parties being foreigners, foreign agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations or representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam Involved parties being foreigners, foreign agencies and organizations, branches and representative offices of foreign agencies and organizations, international organizations or representative offices of international organizations in Vietnam participating in procedures at Vietnamese courts may ask lawyers to protect their rights and legitimate interests in accordance with Vietnamese law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@303: Methods of delivery and notification of procedural documents of Courts to overseas involved parties 1. Courts shall deliver or notify procedural documents of courts by any of the following modes: a) The inspection is carried out by the method specified in the international treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; b) Diplomatically, for involved parties residing in countries which have not yet been co-signatories to treaties, with the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; c) By post to addresses of involved parties residing abroad provided that the law of such countries agrees with this mode of delivery; d) By post to the representative offices of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in foreign countries for delivery to the involved parties being Vietnamese citizens in foreign countries; dd) Foreign agencies and organizations that have representative offices and branches in Vietnam may carry out the document delivery through their representative offices and branches in Vietnam as prescribed in this Law; f/Posting by post to the at-law representatives or authorized representatives in Vietnam of the involved parties in foreign countries. 2. Methods of document delivery specified in Point a and Point b Clause 1 of this Article shall comply with regulations of law on mutual legal assistance. 3. If the methods of delivery specified in Clause 1 of this Article are not effective, the Court shall publicly post up at the head office of the overseas representative mission of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, the Court currently handling the case or at the last residence of the involved parties in Vietnam within 30 days and post it on the web portal of the Court (if any) or the web portal of the overseas representative mission of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; if necessary, the Court may post it on the central radio or television channel for foreigners three times in 03 consecutive days.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@304: Notification of acceptance of the case, date of opening of the meeting or trial 1. The Court must send a notice of acceptance of the case, which specifies the time and location of the meeting to check the handover of, access to and disclosure of evidences and dialogue (hereinafter referred to as meeting ), re-opening the meeting, opening the Court session and re-opening the Court session in the notice of acceptance of the case to the overseas involved parties. 2. The time limit for opening a meeting or a Court session shall be determined as follows: a) The meeting must be opened at least 04 months and 06 months from the date on which the notice of acceptance of the case is issued. The date of reopening the meeting (if any) shall be determined at least 30 days after the opening date. b) The Court session must be opened at least 06 months and 08 months from the date on which the notice of acceptance of the case is issued. The date of reopening the Court session (if any) shall be fixed at least 30 days after the date of opening the Court session, except for the case specified in Clause 4 Article 305 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@305: Handling of results of delivery of procedural documents of Courts to overseas involved parties Upon receiving the results of the delivery and the results of the collection of evidences in foreign countries, depending on each specific case, the Courts shall handle as follows: 1. A meeting shall not be opened after receiving the results of the document delivery by one of the methods specified in Clause 1, Article 303 of this Law and involved parties have provided sufficient testimonies, documents and evidence and the administrative case is not subject to dialogue as specified in Article 135 of this Law. 2. The meeting shall be postponed if the Court has received the notification of the completion of the delivery but the involved parties still fail to receive the testimonies, materials and evidences on the opening date and they do not request to be absent from the meeting. If the involved parties in foreign countries are still absent on the re-opening date, the Court shall determine this case as the case of failure to conduct the dialogue. 3. The Court shall postpone the Court session in the following cases: a) Overseas involved parties file written requests for postponement of the first Court session; b) Overseas involved parties are absent from the first Court session, unless they apply for trial in their absence. 4. If the Court does not receive the written notice of the result of delivery as well as the testimonies, materials and evidences of the involved parties in foreign countries and by the date of opening the Court session, the involved parties in foreign countries are absent and do not file any written request for the Court to conduct trial in their absence, the Court shall postpone the Court session. Immediately after the postponement of the Court session, the Court shall request in writing the Ministry of Justice or the representative agencies of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in foreign countries to notify the delivery of procedural documents of the Court to the overseas involved parties in case the Court performs the delivery through these agencies by one of the modes specified at Points a, b and d, Clause 1, Article 303 of this Law. Within 30 days after receiving the court's document, the overseas representative mission of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall notify the court of the result of delivery of procedural documents to overseas involved parties. Within 10 days after receiving the court's written request, the Ministry of Justice shall request in writing a competent foreign agency to give a reply on the result of the performance of the judicial request. Within 5 working days after receiving a document sent by a competent foreign agency, the Ministry of Justice shall reply the court. Past the time limit of 3 months after transferring the court's document to a competent foreign agency, if receiving no reply, the Ministry of Justice shall notify such to the court for use as a ground for settling the case. 5. The Court shall conduct trial in the absence of overseas involved parties in the following cases: a) The Courts have received the results of the delivery by one of the modes of delivery specified in Clause 1, Article 303 of this Law, the involved parties have provided sufficient testimonies, documents and evidences and the involved parties request the Courts to conduct trial in their absence; b) The Court has not received the notification of the competent authority as prescribed in Clause 4 of this Article of the result of delivery to the overseas involved parties; c) The court has taken the measures specified in Clause 3 Article 303 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@306: Recognition of papers and documents made, issued or certified by foreign competent agencies or sent by individuals residing abroad to Vietnamese Courts by post 1. Vietnamese Courts shall recognize papers and documents made, issued or certified by competent foreign agencies or organizations in the following cases : a/Notarized or certified Vietnamese papers, documents and translations which have been consularly legalized; b) Papers and documents are exempted from consular legalization as prescribed by Vietnamese law or international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory. 2. Vietnamese courts shall recognize papers and documents made by individuals residing abroad in the following cases : a) Papers and documents made in foreign languages and translated into Vietnamese lawfully notarized or certified according to Vietnamese law; b) Papers and documents made in foreign countries, which are notarized or certified under foreign laws and consularly legalized; c) Papers and documents made in Vietnamese by Vietnamese citizens living abroad with signatures of the persons who make such papers and documents and have been authenticated according to the provisions of Vietnamese law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@307: Time limit for appeal against a court judgment or ruling adjudicating an administrative case involving foreign elements 1. Involved parties present in Vietnam may appeal against court judgments or rulings within the time limit specified in Article 206 of this Law. 2. If involved parties residing overseas are not present at the Court session, the time limit for appeal against the Court's judgments/decisions shall be 30 days from the date on which such judgments/decisions are duly delivered or from the date on which such judgments/decisions are duly posted up as per the law. 3. In case the Court conducts the trial in the absence of overseas involved parties as prescribed in Point b Clause 5 Article 305 of this Law, the time limit for appeal shall be 12 months from the day on which the judgment is pronounced.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@308: Service and notification of procedural documents and handling of results of service and notification of procedural documents of appellate Courts to overseas involved parties Appellate Courts shall effect the delivery and notification of procedural documents and handle the results thereof to overseas involved parties under Articles 303,304 and 305 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@309: Court judgments and decisions on administrative cases to be executed 1. The first-instance Court's judgments/decisions or parts thereof that are not appealed against according to appellate procedures have taken legal effect. 2. Judgments and decisions of appellate courts. 3. Cassation or reopening decisions of courts. 4. Decisions made according to special procedures by the Council of Judges of the Supreme People's Court as prescribed in Article 296 of this Law. 5. Decisions on application of provisional emergency measures of courts, despite complaints or protests.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@310: Interpretation of Court judgments and rulings 1. Judgment creditors, judgment debtors, persons with interests and obligations related to the enforcement of court judgments or decisions and civil judgment enforcement agencies may request in writing courts which have issued judgments or decisions specified in Clauses 1,2,3 and 4, Article 309 of this Law to explain unclear points in judgments or decisions for enforcement. 2. The Judge as the presiding Judge of the Court session shall be responsible for explaining the Court's judgments/decisions. If such Judge is no longer the Judge of the Court, the Chief Justice of such Court shall be responsible for explaining the Court's judgments/decisions. 3. The interpretation of a Court's judgments/decisions must be based on such judgments/decisions, minutes of the Court session, meeting and minutes of deliberation. 4. Within 15 days after receiving a written request, the court shall give a written explanation and send it to the agency, organization or individual that has been granted or sent the judgment or ruling under this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@311: Execution of court judgments and rulings 1. The execution of court judgments or decisions on administrative cases specified in Article 309 of this Law shall be conducted as follows: a) In case the court's judgment or decision on rejection of the petition for initiation of lawsuits against administrative decisions, disciplinary decisions on dismissal, decisions on settlement of complaints about decisions on handling of competition cases or voter lists is accepted, involved parties shall continue to implement these decisions in accordance with law; b) If the court judgment/decision has cancelled all or part of the administrative decision/decision on settlement of complaint against settlement decision, such decision/decision shall be invalidated. The involved parties shall enforce the judgment/decision based on their rights and obligations specified in the court judgment/decision; c/If the court judgment or ruling has annulled the disciplinary decision on dismissal, the annulled disciplinary decision is no longer effective. The head of the agency or organization that has issued the disciplinary decision on dismissal shall execute the court judgment or ruling; d) If the judgment/decision of the Court has declared that the administrative act has been committed against the law, the judgment debtor must suspend such administrative act from the day on which such judgment/decision is received; dd) If the judgment/decision of the Court declares that the act of failure to perform duties is illegal, the judgment debtor shall perform his/her duties as prescribed by law from the day on which the judgment/decision is received; e) If the judgment/decision of the Court forces the electoral registers to amend the electoral registers, the judgment debtor must immediately amend the electoral registers upon receiving the judgment/decision of the Court; g) If the Court issues a decision on application of provisional emergency measures, the person subject to such measures must execute them as soon as receiving the decision; h) Decisions on property part in the Court's judgments and decisions shall be enforced according to the law provisions on enforcement of civil judgments. 2. The time limit for voluntary judgment execution shall be determined as follows: a) The judgment debtor must immediately execute the judgment/decision prescribed in Point e and Point g Clause 1 of this Article from the day on which such judgment/decision is received; b) The judgment debtor must execute the court judgment/decision prescribed in Points a, b, c, d and dd Clause 1 of this Article within 30 days from the day on which such court judgment/decision is received. The agency that has to enforce the court judgment or ruling shall notify in writing the judgment enforcement result specified in this Clause to the court which conducted the first-instance trial and the civil judgment enforcement agency of the same level with the court which conducted the first-instance trial of such case. 3. Past the time limit specified in Clause 2 of this Article, if the judgment debtor fails to execute the judgment, the judgment creditor may file a written request with the court which has conducted the first-instance trial for issuance of a decision to force the execution of the court judgment or ruling under Clause 1, Article 312 of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@312: Requests and decisions on enforcement of court judgments or decisions 1. Within 01 year from the expiration of the time limit specified in Point b Clause 2 Article 311 of this Law, if the judgment debtor fails to voluntarily execute the judgment, the judgment creditor may send an application enclosed with copies of the court judgment/decision and other relevant documents to the court that conducted the first-instance trial for issuance of a decision to enforce the court judgment/decision. If the judgment enforcement requester can prove that due to objective obstacles or force majeure events, he/she cannot request judgment enforcement within the prescribed time limit, the period during which objective obstacles or force majeure events occur shall not be included in the time limit for requesting judgment enforcement. 2. Within 5 working days after receiving a written request of the judgment creditor, the court which has conducted the first-instance trial shall issue a decision to force the execution of the administrative judgment. The decision on forced execution shall be sent to the judgment debtor, judgment creditor, head of the immediate superior agency of the judgment debtor and the same-level procuracy. The head of the immediate superior agency of the judgment debtor shall examine, urge and handle the judgment debtor in accordance with law. The decision on forced execution shall also be sent to the civil judgment enforcement agency of the court which has conducted the first-instance trial for monitoring the execution of the administrative judgment under the court's decision. 3. The Government shall specify the time limit, order and procedures for execution of administrative judgments and handling of persons who fail to execute court judgments or decisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@313: State management of execution of administrative judgments 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of the execution of administrative judgments nationwide; coordinate with the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuracy in performing the state management of the execution of administrative judgments; and annually report on the execution of administrative judgments to the National Assembly. 2.
