The Ministry of Justice shall take responsibility before the Government for performing the state management of administrative judgment execution and has the following tasks and powers : a/To promulgate or submit to competent agencies for promulgation legal documents on execution of administrative judgments; b/To ensure payrolls, physical foundations and equipment for the state management of administrative judgment enforcement; c/To guide, direct and professionally foster the management of administrative judgment execution; to disseminate and educate about the law on execution of administrative judgments; d/To examine, inspect and settle complaints and denunciations about administrative judgment execution management; e/To report to the Government on the execution of administrative judgments; f/To elaborate and organize the implementation of plans on statistics, monitoring and review of the execution of administrative judgments.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@314: Handling of violations in the execution of administrative judgments 1. Agencies, organizations and individuals obliged to execute judgments which intentionally fail to execute court judgments or decisions or court decisions on forced judgment execution shall, depending on each specific case, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability in accordance with law. 2. Those who abuse their positions and powers to intentionally obstruct the judgment execution shall, depending on each specific case, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability according to law provisions; if causing damage, they must pay compensation therefor according to law provisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@315: Oversight of the enforcement of court judgments and rulings The procuracy shall supervise the observance of law by involved parties, agencies, organizations and individuals related to the enforcement of court judgments and rulings, ensuring the timely, sufficient and lawful enforcement of judgments and rulings. The procuracy may propose agencies, organizations and individuals obliged to execute administrative judgments and immediate superior agencies or organizations of agencies or organizations obliged to execute court judgments or rulings to take measures to strictly execute court judgments or rulings.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@316: Handling of violations against the internal rules of Court sessions 1. Persons who violate the internal rules of Court sessions as prescribed in Article 153 of this Law shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be administratively sanctioned under the presiding Judges' decisions according to law provisions. 2. The presiding judge is entitled to issue a decision to compel the violator mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article to leave the courtroom. The police office or person in charge of order protection shall enforce the presiding judge's decision to compel the violator to leave the courtroom or to detain the person causing disorder in court. 3. If a person violates the internal rules of the Court session to the extent that he/she is liable to criminal prosecution, the Court shall have the right to institute criminal proceedings in accordance with the law on criminal procedures. 4. The provisions of this Article shall also apply to persons who commit acts of violation at court sessions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@317: Handling of acts of infringing upon the prestige of courts, honor, dignity and health of procedure-conducting persons or other persons performing tasks at the request of courts Persons who commit acts of infringing upon the prestige of courts, the honor and dignity of procedure-conducting persons or other persons performing tasks at the request of courts shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@318: Handling of acts of obstructing the verification and collection of evidences by courts Those who commit one of the following acts shall, depending on the nature and seriousness of their violations, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability according to law provisions: 1. Forging or destroying important evidence, thus obstructing the settlement of cases by courts; 2. Refusing to give testimonies, giving false testimonies or supplying untruthful documents when giving testimonies; 3. Refusing to make expertising conclusions or refusing to supply documents without plausible reasons, making untruthful expertising conclusions; 4. Deceiving, threatening, forcing, buying off or using force to prevent witnesses from giving testimonies or compelling other persons to give false testimonies; 5. Deceiving, threatening, forcing, buying off or using force to prevent expert-witnesses from performing their tasks or forcing expert-witnesses to make conclusions untruthful to objective truths; 6. Deceiving, threatening, forcing, buying off or using force to prevent interpreters from performing their tasks or compelling interpreters to render untruthful, biased or untrue versions; 7. Obstructing procedure-conducting persons from conducting on-site examination and appraisal, making decisions on valuation, decisions to solicit expert opinions or verifying or collecting other evidences in accordance with this Law; 8. Intentionally translating false information; 9. Failing to appoint persons to participate in the valuation council at the request of the court without a plausible reason; failing to participate in performing the tasks of the valuation council without a plausible reason.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@319: Handling of acts of intentionally failing to show up under court summonses 1. Witnesses, interpreters and expert-witnesses who have been duly summoned by courts but deliberately decline to come to courts or to be present at court hearings or meetings without plausible reasons and their absence obstructs the collection and verification of evidence or the settlement of cases shall be administratively sanctioned in accordance with law. 2. In the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the Court may issue a decision to escort the witness to the Court session, except for the case where the witness is a minor. The decision to escort the witness must specify the time and location of the decision; full name and position of the decision maker; full name, date of birth and place of residence of the witness; time and location where the witness must be present. 3. Police offices shall execute court decisions to escort witnesses. Executors of decisions to escort witnesses shall read and explain such decisions to persons subject to escort and make records of the escort.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@320: Handling of acts of interfering in the settlement of cases Any person who, by his/her influence, exerts any act of affecting judges or members of trial panels in any form in order to cause the handling of cases to be objective and unlawful shall, depending on the nature and severity of his/her violation, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@321: Responsibilities of Courts and procuracies in case Courts institute criminal cases 1. If the Court instigates a criminal case as per Section 3, Article 316 of this Law, the Court, in 15 days upon issuing the decision to press charges, must forward such decision and evidences to the competent Procuracy to prove the criminal acts. 2. The procuracy shall consider and handle cases in accordance with the Criminal Procedure Code.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@322: Handling of acts of obstructing the delivery, receipt, issuance, sending or notification of procedural documents of courts Those who commit one of the following acts shall, depending on the nature and seriousness of their violations, be disciplined, administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability according to law provisions: 1. Failing to issue, deliver, deliver or notify procedural documents of courts at the request of courts without plausible reasons; 2. To destroy procedural documents of courts which they are assigned to issue, deliver or notify at the request of courts; 3. Forging results of the delivery or notification of procedural documents of courts they are assigned to deliver or notify; 4. Obstructing the issuance, delivery, receipt, delivery or notification of procedural documents of courts.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@323: Handling of acts of obstructing representatives of agencies, organizations and individuals from participating in procedures at the request of courts Persons who threaten, assault or abuse their dependence to obstruct representatives of agencies, organizations or individuals from attending Court sessions or meetings convened by courts shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@324: Handling of acts of providing untruthful information to obstruct the settlement of cases by courts Those who commit acts of providing untruthful information in order to obstruct courts in settling cases shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be administratively sanctioned or examined for penal liability in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@325: Handling of acts of agencies, organizations and individuals failing to execute court decisions on supply of materials and evidences to courts 1. Agencies, organizations and individuals that fail to execute court decisions on the supply of materials and evidences which they are managing or keeping shall be administratively sanctioned according to law. 2. Individuals and heads of agencies and organizations specified in Clause 1 of this Article, depending on the severity of their violations, may be disciplined or examined for penal liability in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@326: Forms of sanction, competence, order, procedures and sanction The sanctioning forms, competence, order and procedures for sanctioning administrative violations for acts of obstructing administrative procedural activities shall comply with the provisions of the Law on Handling of Administrative Violations and other relevant law provisions.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@327: Decisions and acts in administrative procedures which may be complained about 1. Agencies, organizations and individuals may complain about administrative procedure decisions or acts of administrative procedure-conducting agencies or persons when having grounds to believe that such decisions or acts are unlawful and infringe upon their legitimate rights and interests. 2. For first-instance, appellate, cassation or reopening judgments or decisions of courts, if being appealed or protested against, and other procedural decisions issued by administrative procedure-conducting persons, if being complained or petitioned, they shall not be settled under the provisions of this Chapter but shall be settled under the provisions of relevant chapters of this Law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@328: Rights and obligations of complainants 1. Complainants shall have the following rights: a) Lodge the complaint on his/her own or through his/her lawful representative; b) Lodge complaints at any stage of the case resolution process; c/To withdraw his/her complaint at any stage of the settlement process. a/To lodge complaints; d/To receive written replies on the acceptance of complaints for settlement; to receive complaint settlement decisions; dd) Have their legitimate rights and interests restored and receive compensation for damage as prescribed by law. 2. Complainants shall have the following obligations: a/To lodge complaints with the right persons competent to settle them; b/To honestly present the case, provide information and documents to the complaint settler; to take responsibility before law for the presented contents and the provision of such information and documents; c) Not to abuse the right to complain to obstruct the court's procedural activities; d) Comply with decisions and acts of proceeding officers against which they are complaining during the complaining period; dd) Comply with the effective decision on complaint settlement.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@329: Rights and obligations of the complained persons 1. The complained persons shall have the following rights : a) Be informed of the grounds for complaint of the complainant; provide evidence of the legality of the procedural decision or act against which complaints may be filed; b) Receive decisions on settlement of complaints about their procedural decisions and acts. 2. The complained persons shall have the following obligations : a/To explain his/her complained decision or act in administrative procedures; to provide relevant information and documents at the request of competent agencies, organizations or persons; b/To abide by legally effective complaint settlement decisions; c/To pay compensations for damage, reimburse or remedy consequences caused by their illegal decisions or acts in administrative procedures in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@330: Statute of limitations for filing complaints The statute of limitations for lodging complaints is 10 days after the complainants receive or know about procedural decisions or acts which they deem law-breaking. In case of force majeure events or objective obstacles, if the complainant fails to exercise his/her right to complain within the time limit specified in this Article, the duration of such force majeure events or objective obstacles shall not be counted into the statute of limitations for complaint.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@331: Form of complaint Complaints must be made in writing. A written complaint must clearly state the date, full name and address of the complainant; contents and reasons for complaint, and the complainant's request, and bear the signature or fingerprint of the complainant.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@332: Competence to settle complaints about procedural persons' decisions and acts 1. Complaints against decisions/acts of proceeding officers being judges, deputy chief justices, verifiers, court clerks and people's jurors shall be settled by the Chief Justices of the Courts that are handling the administrative cases. Complaints against procedural decisions and actions of the Chief Justices of Courts shall be settled by the Chief Justices of the immediate superior Courts. 2. Complaints against decisions/acts of proceeding officers being procurators, deputy heads of procuracies or inspectors shall be settled by heads of procuracies. Complaints against procedural decisions and actions of the head of the procuracy shall be settled by the head of the immediate superior procuracy. 3. Complaints against first-time complaint handling decisions of the Chief Justices of Courts or the Chairpersons of the procuracies prescribed in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article shall be settled by the Chief Justices of the immediate superior Courts or the Chairpersons of the immediate superior procuracies.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@333: Time limit for settling complaints The time limit for settling first-time complaints is 15 days after the courts or procuracies receive the complaints. In case of necessity, for complicated cases or matters, the time limit for settling complaints may be prolonged but must not exceed 15 days after the expiration of the time limit for settling complaints.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@334: Contents of the first-time complaint settlement decision 1. The first complaint settler must issue a written decision on complaint settlement. A decision on complaint settlement must contain the following details: a) Date of issuance; b) Names and addresses of the complainant and the complained person; c) Complained matters; d) Result of verification of complaint contents; dd) Legal grounds for complaint settlement; e) Contents of the decision on complaint settlement. 2. First-time complaint settlement decisions must be sent to complainants and related agencies, organizations and individuals; in case they are decisions of court presidents, they must also be sent to procuracies of the same level.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@335: Procedures for second complaint settlement 1. Within 05 working days from the day on which the first decision on complaint settlement is received, if the complainant disagrees with such decision or the complaint remains unsettled after the time limit specified in Article 333 of this Law, the complainant is entitled to file a complaint to the person competent to settle second-time complaints. 2. The complaint must be enclosed with a copy of the first-time complaint settlement decision and enclosed documents. 3. A second-time complaint settlement decision must contain the following details: a/The written certification of the agency competent to settle complaints; a) The contents specified in Points a, b, c, d and dd Clause 1 Article 334 of this Law; b) Results of the first complaint settler's complaint settlement; c) Conclusions on each specific matter in the complaint content of the complainant and the settlement of the second complaint settler. 4. Second-time complaint settlement decisions must be sent to complainants and related agencies, organizations and individuals; in case they are decisions of court presidents, they must also be sent to procuracies of the same level. 5. Second-time complaint settlement decisions take effect.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@336: Settlement of complaints about assessment activities in administrative procedures Complaints about assessment activities in administrative procedures shall be settled under the law on judicial assessment and other relevant laws.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@337: Article 16.-The persons entitled to denounce Individuals shall have the right to denounce to competent agencies, organizations and individuals acts of law violation committed by persons competent to conduct legal proceedings, which cause damage or threaten to cause damage to public interests, the State's interests, legitimate rights and interests of agencies, organizations and individuals.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@338: Rights and obligations of denouncers 1. Denouncers have the following rights: a/To file written denunciations or directly denounce to competent agencies, organizations or persons; b) Request the confidentiality of their full names, addresses and autographs; c/To request notification of denunciation settlement results; d) Request competent entities to protect against intimidation, retaliation or revenge. 2. Denouncers have the following obligations : a) To honestly present the denunciation contents; b) To clearly state their full names and addresses; c) Take legal responsibility for false denunciations.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@339: Rights and obligations of denounced persons 1. Denounced persons shall have the following rights: a) Be informed of denunciation contents; b) Provide evidence to prove that the denunciation is false. the truth; c/To have his/her infringed lawful rights and interests restored; to have his/her honor restored; to receive compensation for damage caused by his/her untruthful denunciation; d) Request competent organizations and individuals to take actions against the denouncer. 2. Denounced persons have the following obligations : a) Explain the denounced acts; provide relevant information and documents at the request of competent authorities and entities; b) Comply with the handling decisions of competent agencies, organizations and individuals; c/To pay compensations for damage, refund or remedy consequences caused by their illegal administrative procedural acts in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@340: Competence and time limit for settling denunciations 1. Denunciations of violations committed by persons competent to institute legal proceedings under the jurisdiction of any competent agency shall be settled by the head of such agency. In case the denounced party is the chief judge, deputy chief judge of the court, chief procurator or deputy chief procurator of the procuracy, the chief judge of the immediate superior court or chief procurator of the immediate superior procuracy shall settle the denunciation. The time limit for settling a denunciation is 60 days after receiving it; for a complicated case, this time limit may be longer but must not exceed 90 days. 2. Denunciations about illegal acts showing criminal signs shall be settled under the Criminal Procedure Code.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@341: Procedures for settling denunciations The procedures for settling denunciations shall comply with the provisions of the legislation on denunciations.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@342: Responsibilities of persons competent to settle complaints and denunciations 1. Competent agencies, organizations and individuals shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, receive and settle cases in a timely and lawful manner; strictly handle violators; apply necessary measures to prevent possible damage; ensure strict execution of settlement decisions and take responsibility before law for their decisions. 2. Persons competent to settle complaints and denunciations who fail to settle them or show irresponsibility in settling them or settle them in contravention of law shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be disciplined or examined for penal liability; if causing damage, they shall pay compensations therefor in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@343: To supervise the law observance in the settlement of complaints and denunciations in administrative procedures The procuracy shall supervise the law observance in the settlement of complaints and denunciations in administrative procedures in accordance with law. The procuracy may request or recommend the same-level court, lower-level court, and responsible agencies, organizations and individuals to ensure that the settlement of complaints and denunciations is grounded and lawful. The Chief Procurator of the Supreme People's Procuracy shall preside over and cooperate with the Chief Justice of the Supreme People's Court in elaborating this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@344: Court fee advances, court fees and charges 1. Court fee advances include first-instance court fee advances and appellate court fee advances. 2. Court costs include first-instance and appellate court costs. 3. Fees include fees for issuance of copies of judgments, decisions and other papers of courts and other fees prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@345: Handling of collected court cost and court fee advances 1. All collected court costs and fees must be fully and promptly remitted into the state budget at state treasuries. 2. Court fee advances shall be paid to competent judgment enforcement agencies for deposit into custody accounts opened at state treasuries and shall be withdrawn for judgment enforcement under court decisions. 3. The persons who have paid the court fee advances, right after the court judgments or decisions take effect, the collected advance amounts must be remitted into the State budget. In case the person who has paid the court fee advance is refunded part or the whole of the paid amount under the court judgment or decision, the judgment enforcement agency that has collected the court fee advance shall carry out procedures to refund the money to such person. 4. In case the settlement of an administrative case is suspended, the paid court cost advance shall be handled when the case resumes.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@346: Article 10. Collection and payment of court cost advances, court costs and fees The collection of court cost advances and court costs, the payment of court cost advances and the collection of court fees comply with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@347: The obligation to pay court cost advances Plaintiffs and persons with related interests and obligations that make independent claims in administrative cases shall pay first-instance court cost advances, and appellants according to appellate procedures shall pay appellate court cost advances, unless they are exempt from or do not have to pay court cost advances.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@348: The obligation to pay first-instance court fees 1. Involved parties shall bear first-instance court costs if their petitions are not accepted by courts, except cases in which they are exempt from court costs or are not required to bear first-instance court costs. 2. Before opening a court hearing, if the involved parties have successfully held a dialogue on the settlement of the case, they shall bear only 50% of the first-instance court cost level specified in Clause 1 of this Article. 3. In cases where involved parties are exempt from the first-instance court fees, other involved parties shall still have to pay the first-instance court fees they have to bear as provided for in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article. 4. Where the case is suspended from settlement, the obligation to pay the first-instance court cost shall be decided when the case is continued to be settled as provided for in this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@349: The obligation to bear appellate court costs 1. Appealing involved parties shall pay appellate court costs if appellate courts uphold first-instance judgments or rulings they have protested against, unless they are exempt from or do not have to pay appellate court costs. 2. In case the appellate court amends the appealed first-instance judgment or ruling, the appellant is not required to pay the appellate court cost. The appellate court shall re-determine the obligation to pay first-instance court cost under Article 348 of this Law. 3. In case the appellate court quashes the first-instance judgment or ruling which is appealed for retrial according to first-instance procedures, the appellant is not required to pay the appellate court cost. The obligation to pay the court cost shall be re-determined upon the first-instance re-settlement of the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@350: The obligation to pay fees The obligation to pay fees shall be determined depending on each specific job and prescribed by law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@351: Specific provisions on court costs and fees Pursuant to the Law on Charges and Fees and this Law, the National Assembly Standing Committee shall specify court costs and fees; court cost and fee rates applicable to each type of case; cases eligible for exemption from, reduction of, or exemption from, court costs and other specific matters related to court costs and fees.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@352: Overseas request for judicial assistance expense advance, request for judicial assistance expense 1. Overseas request for judicial assistance expense advance means an amount temporarily calculated by a court to pay for the request for judicial assistance when collecting and providing evidence, delivering papers, dossiers and documents, summoning witnesses and experts and making requests for mutual legal assistance related to the settlement of administrative cases. 2. Legal mandate expense means a necessary and reasonable sum of money to be paid for the performance of legal mandate in accordance with Vietnamese law and the law of the country requested to make legal mandate.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@353: The obligation to pay overseas request for judicial assistance expense advances The litigator, appellant according to appellate procedures or other involved parties in a case shall pay an advance on overseas request for judicial assistance expense when their request gives rise to the overseas request for judicial assistance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@354: The obligation to bear overseas request for judicial assistance expense Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided by law, the obligation to bear overseas request for judicial assistance expense is determined as follows: 1. Involved parties shall bear overseas request for judicial assistance expense if their request for settlement of the case is not accepted by the court; 2. In case of termination of the resolution of a case specified at Point c, Clause 1, Article 143, or Clause 1, Article 234, of this Law, the plaintiff shall bear overseas request for judicial assistance expense. In case of termination of appellate trial prescribed in Point a Clause 2 Article 225, Point c Clause 1 Article 229 of this Law, the appellant according to appellate procedures must bear the overseas request for judicial assistance expense; 3. In other cases of termination of settlement of cases prescribed in this Law, requesters shall bear overseas request for judicial assistance expense.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@355: Handling of overseas request for judicial assistance expense advances 1. If the person who has paid the request for judicial assistance expense advance is not liable to the request for judicial assistance expense, the person who is liable to the request for judicial assistance expense under the court's decision shall refund the advance to the person who has paid it. 2. If the person who has advanced the request for judicial assistance expense must bear the request for judicial assistance expense, if the advanced amount is not sufficient to cover the actual request for judicial assistance expense, he/she must pay the deficit; if the advanced amount is more than the actual request for judicial assistance expense, he/she shall be refunded the surplus amount under the court's decision.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@356: On-site inspection/appraisal expense advance and on-site inspection/appraisal expense 1. On-site inspection/appraisal expense advance means an amount of money temporarily calculated by the court for conducting on-site inspection/appraisal. 2. On-site inspection/appraisal expense means a necessary and reasonable sum of money to be paid for the on-site inspection/appraisal work, based on the provisions of law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@357: The obligation to pay on-site inspection/appraisal expense advances 1. Persons requesting courts to conduct on-site examination and appraisal must pay on-site examination and appraisal expense advances at the request of courts. 2. If the Court deems it necessary and decides to conduct on-site inspection/appraisal, the petitioner or the appellant according to appellate procedures must pay the on-site inspection/appraisal expense advance.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@358: The obligation to bear on-site inspection/appraisal expense Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided by law, the obligation to bear on-site inspection/appraisal expense shall be determined as follows: 1. Involved parties shall bear on-site examination and appraisal expenses if their requests are not accepted by courts; 2. In case of termination of the resolution of a case specified at Point c, Clause 1, Article 143, or Clause 1, Article 234, of this Law, involved parties shall bear on-site examination and appraisal expenses. In case of termination of the appellate trial prescribed at Point a, Clause 2, Article 225, and Point c, Clause 1, Article 229 of this Law, the appellant according to appellate procedures shall bear on-site examination and appraisal expenses; 3. For other cases of termination of settlement of cases under this Law, the persons requesting the examination and appraisal must bear the on-site examination and appraisal expenses.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@359: Handling of on-site inspection/appraisal expense advances 1. If the person who has paid the on-site inspection/appraisal expense advance is not required to bear the on-site inspection/appraisal expense, the person who has to bear the on-site inspection/appraisal expense under the court's decision must return it to the person who has paid the on-site inspection/appraisal expense advance. 2. In case the person who has advanced on-site inspection/appraisal expense must bear the on-site inspection/appraisal expense, if the advanced amount is not enough for the actual on-site inspection/appraisal expense, he/she must pay the deficit amount; if the advanced amount is larger than the actual on-site inspection/appraisal expense, he/she shall be refunded the surplus amount under the court's decision.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@360: Assessment expense advance, assessment expense 1. Expertise expense advance means an amount of money temporarily calculated by an expert witness for conducting expertise under a court decision or at the request of involved parties. 2. Assessment expense means a necessary and reasonable sum of money to be paid for the assessment and calculated by an assessor in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@361: The obligation to pay advance on assessment expense Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided for by law, the obligation to pay advance on assessment expense is determined as follows: 1. Persons requesting courts to solicit assessment shall pay advance on assessment expense. In case involved parties request the court to request assessment of the same object, each party shall pay half of the assessment expense advance; 2. In case the court deems it necessary and decides to solicit expert examination, the plaintiff or the appellant according to appellate procedures shall pay advance on expert examination expense; 3. If involved parties or appellants have requested courts to solicit assessment but are not accepted and request assessment-conducting organizations or individuals to conduct assessment themselves, advance on assessment expense shall be paid in accordance with the Law on Judicial Assessment.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@362: The obligation to bear assessment expense Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided for by law, the obligation to bear assessment expense is determined as follows: 1. The petitioners for expert examination by courts must bear the expertising expenses if the expertising results prove that their petitions are groundless. Where the expertising results prove that their petitions are partly grounded, they must pay the expertising expenses for the part of their petitions which have been proved groundless; 2. The persons who refuse to accept the expertise requests of other involved parties in the cases must pay expertise expenses if the expertise results prove that the expertise requesters' requests are well grounded. Where the expertise results prove that the expertise requests are partially grounded, the persons who refuse to accept the expertise requests must bear the expertise expenses corresponding to the requested parts which have been proved well grounded; 3. In case of termination of the settlement of a case under Point c, Clause 1, Article 143, or Clause 1, Article 234, of this Law, the plaintiff shall bear assessment expense. In case of termination of the appellate trial according to Point a, Clause 2, Article 225, or Point c, Clause 1, Article 229, of this Law, the appellant according to appellate procedures shall bear the assessment expense; 4. In case a person himself/herself requests assessment under Clause 3, Article 361 of this Law, if assessment results prove that his/her request is well-grounded, the losing party shall bear assessment expense. In case assessment results prove that his/her assessment request is partially grounded, he/she shall pay assessment expense for his/her requested part which has been proved groundless; 5. For other cases of termination of settlement of cases under this Law, assessment requesters shall bear assessment expenses.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@363: Handling of paid advance on assessment expense 1 If the person who has advanced assessment expense is not required to bear the assessment expense, the person who is obliged to bear the assessment expense under a court's decision shall refund it to the person who has advanced it. 2. In case the person who has advanced assessment expense must bear the assessment expense, if the advanced amount is not enough for the actual assessment expense, he/she must pay the deficit; if the advanced amount is larger than the actual assessment expense, he/she shall be refunded the surplus amount under a court decision.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@364: Property valuation expense advance, property valuation expense 1. Property valuation expense advance means an amount temporarily calculated by a valuation council for conducting valuation under a court decision. 2. Property valuation expense means a necessary and reasonable sum of money to be paid for property valuation and calculated by the valuation council in accordance with law.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@365: The obligation to pay advance on property valuation expense Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided for by law, the obligation to bear property valuation expenses is determined as follows: 1. The person requesting valuation must pay an advance on valuation expense; 2. In case involved parties cannot reach agreement on prices and jointly request the court to value property, each party shall pay half of the advance on property valuation expense. In case there are many involved parties, all parties shall jointly pay advance on property valuation expense at the level decided by the court; 3. For the case specified in Clause 3, Article 91 of this Law, the plaintiff or the appellant shall pay advance on property valuation expense.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@366: Obligation to bear property valuation or price appraisal expenses Unless otherwise agreed by involved parties or provided by law, the obligation to bear property valuation or price appraisal expenses shall be determined as follows: 1. Involved parties shall bear property valuation expenses if their petitions are not accepted by courts; 2. In case the court issues a decision on valuation prescribed in Point d Clause 3 Article 91 of this Law, the following regulations shall apply to the case in which the court issues a decision on valuation : a) Involved parties must bear the property valuation expense specified in Clause 1 of this Article if the valuation result proves that the property valuation decision of the court is well-grounded; b) The court shall pay valuation expense if the valuation result proves that the court's valuation decision is groundless. 3. In case of termination of the case settlement under Point c, Clause 1, Article 143, or Clause 1, Article 234 of this Law and the valuation council has conducted valuation, the plaintiff shall bear valuation expenses. In case of termination of appellate trial as prescribed in Point a Clause 2 Article 225, Point c Clause 1 Article 229 of this Law and the Valuation Council has conducted the valuation, the appellant according to appellate procedures must bear the property valuation expense; 4. In other cases of termination of settlement of cases under this Law and the valuation council has conducted valuation, the valuation requester shall bear valuation expenses. 5. The obligation to bear the property valuation expense of involved parties shall be performed as the obligation to bear the property valuation expense specified in Clauses 1,3 and 4 of this Article.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@367: Handling of advance on property valuation expense 1. In case the person who has advanced property valuation expense is not liable to such expense, the person who is liable to such expense under a court decision shall refund such advance to the person who has advanced such expense. 2. In case the person who has advanced property valuation expense must bear such expense, if the advanced amount is not enough to cover the actual valuation expense, he/she shall pay the deficit; if the advanced amount is larger than the actual valuation expense, he/she shall be refunded the surplus amount.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@368: Witness expenses 1. Reasonable and actual expenses for witnesses shall be borne by involved parties. 2. The person requesting the court to summon witnesses shall bear witness expenses if his/her testimony is true but not true to the request of the requester. If his/her testimony is true and true to the request of the requester, such expenses shall be borne by the involved parties making requests independent from the requester.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@369: Costs for interpreters and lawyers 1. Expenses for interpreters mean sums of money payable to interpreters in the course of settling administrative cases as agreed upon between involved parties and interpreters or prescribed by law. 2. Expenses for lawyers mean sums of money payable to lawyers as agreed upon between involved parties and lawyers within the scope prescribed by law-practicing organizations and as prescribed by law. 3. Expenses for interpreters and lawyers shall be borne by the requesters, except otherwise agreed upon by the involved parties. 4. In case the court requests an interpreter, the court shall pay the expense for such interpreter.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@370: Specific provisions on other procedural expenses Pursuant to this Law, the Standing Committee of National Assembly shall specify the costs of overseas request for judicial assistance, on-site inspection and assessment, property assessment and valuation, costs of witness and interpreter, other procedural costs prescribed by other laws and the exemption and reduction of procedural costs during the settlement of the case.
Luật Tố tụng hành chính@371: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from July 01,2016, except for the following provisions of this Law which are related to the Civil Code No. 91/2015/QH13 and come into force from January 01,2017: a) Regulations on persons with limited cognition and behavior control; b) Provisions related to legal entities being representatives or guardians; c) Regulations on households, artels, and organizations without legal status. 2. The Law on Administrative Procedures No. 64/2010/QH12 shall be annulled from the effective date of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@1: Scope This Law provides for the marriage and family regime; legal standards for conduct among family members; and responsibilities of individuals, organizations, the State and society in the building and consolidation of the marriage and family regime.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@2: The fundamentals of marriage and family 1. Voluntary, progressive, monogamous and equal husband and wife marriage. 2. Marriage between Vietnamese citizens of different ethnic groups or religions, between religious people and non-religious people, between people with beliefs and people without beliefs, and between Vietnamese citizens and foreigners shall be respected and protected by law. 3. To build prosperous, progressive and happy families; family members have the obligation to respect, care for, care for and help one another; to refrain from discriminating between their children. 4. The State, society and families shall protect and support children, the elderly and the disabled to exercise their marriage and family rights; assist mothers in properly performing their noble functions; and implement family planning. 5. To inherit and promote the Vietnamese nation's fine cultural traditions and ethics regarding marriage and family.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Marriage means the relationship between husband and wife after marriage. 2. Family means a group of persons who are bound together by marriage, blood ties or nurturing relations, giving rise to the rights and obligations between them under the provisions of this Law. 3. Marriage and family regime means all law provisions on marriage and divorce; rights and obligations between husband and wife, between parents and children, and among other family members; support; identification of parents and children; marriage and family relations involving foreign elements and other matters related to marriage and family. 4. Marriage and family practice means a code of conduct with clear contents on the rights and obligations of the parties in the marriage and family relations, which is repeated for a long time and widely recognized in a region, a region or a community. 5. Marriage means the establishment of husband and wife relation between a man and a woman under this Law on marriage conditions and marriage registration. 6. Illegal marriage means a man and woman who have registered their marriage at a competent state agency but either or both of them violate the marriage conditions specified in Article 8 of this Law. 7. Cohabitation as husband and wife means the organization of a man's and woman's life together and the mutual consideration of each other as husband and wife. 8. Underage marriage means the marriage when either or both parties are under the marriage age prescribed at Point a, Clause 1, Article 8 of this Law. 9. Forcing marriage or divorce means threatening, intimidating spiritually, persecuting, ill-treating, demanding property or other acts to force another person to marry or divorce against his/her will. 10. Obstruction of marriage or divorce means threatening, mentally intimidating, persecuting, ill-treating, demanding property or other acts to obstruct the marriage of persons eligible for marriage under the provisions of this Law or forcing other persons to maintain their marriage relations against their will. 11. Sham marriage means taking advantage of marriage to exit, enter, reside or take Vietnamese or foreign nationality; enjoy the State's preferential treatment regime or achieve other purposes other than the family building purpose. 12. Demanding property in marriage means making excessive material demands and considering such as conditions for marriage in order to obstruct the voluntary marriage of men and women. 13. Marriage period means the duration of existence of the husband and wife relation, counting from the date of marriage registration to the date of marriage termination. 14. Divorce means the termination of the husband and wife relation under a legally effective judgment or decision of a court. 15. Sham divorce means taking advantage of a divorce to shirk property obligations, violate population policies and law or to achieve other purposes without aiming to terminate the marriage. 16. Family members include spouse; natural parents, adoptive parents, stepfather, stepmother, parent-in-law; natural children, adopted children, stepchildren of spouse, daughter-in-law, son-in-law; siblings of the same parents, half-sisters, half-sisters, brothers-in-law, sisters-in-law of the same parents, half-sisters, half-sisters; paternal grandparents, maternal grandparents; paternal grandchildren, maternal grandchildren; aunts, uncles, nieces, nephews, nieces, nephews. 17. Direct bloodline means a person who has a blood relation in which one person gives birth to another person in succession. 18. Relatives within three generations mean persons of the same origin, including parents, being the first generation; siblings of the same parents, of the same half-brother, of the same half-brother, being the second generation; siblings of uncles, aunts, uncles, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts, aunts 19. Relatives mean persons who have marriage and/or nurturing relationships, persons who share the same direct bloodline and relatives within three generations. 20. Essential needs mean ordinary needs for food, clothing, accommodation, study, medical examination and treatment and other ordinary needs which are indispensable for the life of each person or family. 21. Giving birth with assisted reproductive technology means giving birth through artificial insemination or in vitro fertilization. 22. Altruistic gestational surrogacy means a woman's voluntary non-commercial gestational surrogacy to a couple whose wife cannot conceive and give birth even with assisted reproductive technology by taking the wife's ovum and the husband's sperm for in vitro fertilization, then implanting them in the uterus of the woman who voluntarily carries the pregnancy for her to conceive and give birth. 23. Commercial gestational surrogacy means a woman's pregnancy for another person by applying reproduction-supporting techniques in order to enjoy economic benefits or other benefits. 24. Support means a person's obligation to contribute money or other property to meet essential needs of a person who does not live with him/her but has a marriage, blood or nurturing relation, in case such person is a minor or an adult who has no working capacity and no property to support himself/herself or a person meeting with difficulties and túng thiếu under this Law. 25. Marriage and family relations involving foreign elements means marriage and family relations in which at least one party is a foreigner or an overseas Vietnamese; marriage and family relations between Vietnamese citizens on which the bases for establishing, changing or terminating such relations comply with foreign laws, which arise overseas or assets related to such relations are located overseas.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@4: The State's and society's responsibilities for marriage and family 1. The State shall adopt policies and measures to protect marriage and family, create conditions for men and women to establish voluntary, progressive, monogamous and equal husband and wife marriage; build prosperous, progressive and happy families and fully perform their functions; intensify the propagation, dissemination and education of the marriage and family legislation; mobilize people to eliminate backward customs and practices regarding marriage and family, promote fine traditions, customs and practices that express the identities of each nationality. 2. The Government shall perform the unified state management of marriage and family. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall perform the state management of marriage and family as assigned by the Government. People's Committees at all levels and other agencies shall perform the state management of marriage and family in accordance with law. 3. Agencies and organizations shall educate and mobilize cadres, civil servants, public employees, laborers and their members as well as all citizens to build cultured families; promptly mediate family conflicts and protect the legitimate rights and interests of family members. Schools shall coordinate with families in educating, propagating and disseminating the marriage and family law to young generations.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@5: Protection of marriage and family 1. Marriage and family relations established and performed under this Law shall be respected and protected by law. 2. The following acts are prohibited: a) Sham marriage or sham divorce; b) Underage marriage, forced marriage, deception of marriage, obstruction of marriage; c) A married person marries or lives together as husband and wife with another person, or a single person marries or lives together as husband and wife with a married person; d) Marriages or cohabitation as husband and wife between persons of direct bloodlines; between relatives within three generations; between adoptive parents and adopted children; between former adoptive parents and adopted children, between fathers-in-law and daughters-in-law, mothers-in-law and sons-in-law, between stepfathers and stepchildren, stepmothers and stepchildren; e/The property claim in marriage; f/Forcing a divorce, deceiving a divorce or obstructing a divorce; g) Carrying out commercial childbirth by assisted reproductive technology, commercial surrogacy, sex selection, asexual reproduction; h) Domestic violence; i) Taking advantage of the exercise of marriage and family rights to traffic in people, exploit labor, sexually abuse or commit other acts for self-seeking purposes. 3. All acts of violating the marriage and family legislation must be strictly handled in strict accordance with law. Agencies, organizations and individuals may request courts or other competent agencies to apply measures to promptly prevent and handle persons who commit acts of violating the marriage and family law. 4. The honor, dignity, prestige, privacy and other privacy rights of the parties shall be respected and protected in the course of settling the marriage and family-related cases.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@6: Application of the Civil Code and other relevant laws The provisions of the Civil Code and other laws related to marriage and family relations shall apply to marriage and family relations in cases where this Law does not prescribe them.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@7: Marriage and family practices 1. In cases where it is not provided for by law and the parties have no agreement, fine customs which reflect the identity of each nationality, are not contrary to the principles prescribed in Article 2 and do not violate the prohibitions of this Law shall apply. 2. The Government shall elaborate Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@8: Marriage conditions 1. A man and a woman wishing to marry each other must satisfy the following conditions : a) Being full 20 years or older for men, full 18 years or older for women; b/The marriage is voluntarily decided by men and women; c) Not losing civil act capacity; d/The marriage does not fall into any of the cases banned from marriage specified at Points a, b, c and d, Clause 2, Article 5 of this Law. 2. The State shall not recognize marriages between persons of the same sex.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@9: Marriage registration 1. Marriages must be registered and performed by competent state agencies under the provisions of this Law and the law on civil status. A marriage which is not registered under this Clause is invalid. 2. Divorced husband and wife wishing to re-establish their husband and wife relation shall register their marriage.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@10: Article 16.-Persons entitled to request the annulment of illegal marriages 1. Persons who are forced or deceived into marriage may, according to the civil procedure law, request by themselves or propose individuals or organizations defined in Clause 2 of this Article to request courts to annul illegal marriages due to their violations specified at Point b, Clause 1, Article 8 of this Law. 2. The following individuals, agencies and organizations, as prescribed by the civil procedure law, may request a court to annul their illegal marriages due to their violations of the provisions of Points a, c and d, Clause 1, Article 8 of this Law: a) The wife or husband of a married person who marries another person; the father, mother, child, guardian or other legal representative of the person who illegally marries; b/The family state management agency; c) State management agencies for children; d/Women's Unions. 3. Other individuals, agencies and organizations, when detecting illegal marriages, may request agencies and organizations defined at Points b, c and d, Clause 2 of this Article to request courts to annul illegal marriages.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@11: Handling of illegal marriages 1. The handling of illegal marriages shall be carried out by courts in accordance with this Law and the civil procedure law. 2. In case at the time the court settles a request for annulment of an illegal marriage, both partners have fully satisfied the marriage conditions specified in Article 8 of this Law and both request recognition of their marriage relation, the court shall recognize that marriage relation. In this case, the marriage relation shall be established from the time both partners fully satisfy the marriage conditions specified in this Law. 3. The court's decision on annulment of illegal marriage or recognition of marriage relation must be sent to the agency which has registered the marriage for recording in the civil status book; the two parties to the illegal marriage; and concerned individuals, agencies and organizations in accordance with the civil procedure law. 4. The Supreme People's Court shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Supreme People's Procuracy and the Ministry of Justice in, guiding this Article.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@12: Legal consequences of illegal marriage annulment 1. When an illegal marriage is annulled, the two marriage partners shall terminate their husband and wife relationship. 2. The rights and obligations of parents and children shall be settled according to the provisions on rights and obligations of parents and children upon divorce. 3. Property relations, obligations and contracts between the parties shall be settled according to the provisions of Article 16 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@13: Handling of marriage registration ultra vires In case the marriage registration is carried out ultra vires, upon request, a competent state agency shall revoke or cancel the marriage certificate in accordance with the civil status law and request the two parties to re-register their marriage at a competent state agency. In this case, the marriage relation shall be established on the date of previous marriage registration.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@14: Addressing the consequences of men and women living together as husband and wife without marriage registration 1. A man and a woman who are eligible to get married under this Law and live together as husband and wife without marriage registration shall not give rise to rights and obligations between husband and wife. The rights and obligations toward children, property, obligations and contracts between the parties shall be settled under Articles 15 and 16 of this Law. 2. In cases where a man and a woman live together as husband and wife as provided for in Clause 1 of this Article but later register their marriage according to law provisions, the marriage relation shall be established as from the time of marriage registration.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@15: Rights and obligations of parents and children in case men and women live together as husband and wife without marriage registration Rights and obligations between men and women living together as husband and wife and their children shall be settled under this Law on rights and obligations of parents and children.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@16: Settling property relations, obligations and contracts of men and women living together as husband and wife without marriage registration 1. Property relations, obligations and contracts between men and women who live together as husband and wife without marriage registration shall be settled according to agreement between the parties; in case of no agreement, the case shall be settled according to the provisions of the Civil Code and other relevant provisions of law. 2. The settlement of property relations must ensure the legitimate rights and interests of women and children; housework and other related jobs to maintain common life are regarded as income-generating labor.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@17: - The equality of rights and obligations between husband and wife. Husband and wife are equal, have equal rights and obligations in all aspects of their family, in the exercise of citizens' rights and performance of citizens' obligations prescribed in the Constitution, this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@18: Protection of personal rights and obligations of husband and wife Personal rights and obligations of husband and wife prescribed in this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws shall be respected and protected.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@19: THE TRUTH OF PARENTS 1. Husband and wife have the obligations to love, be faithful to, respect, care for, care for and assist one another; share and perform family affairs together. 2. Husband and wife are obliged to live together, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife or due to requirements of their professions, work, study, participation in political, economic, cultural and social activities and other plausible reasons.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@20: Choice of husband and wife residence The choice of residence of husband and wife shall be agreed upon by husband and wife without being bound by customs, practices or administrative boundaries.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@21: Respect for the honor, dignity and prestige of husband and wife Husband and wife have the obligation to respect, preserve and protect each other's honor, dignity and prestige.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@22: Respect for the right of husband and wife to freedom of religion and belief Husband and wife have the obligation to respect each other's freedom of belief and religion.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@23: Rights and obligations to study, work and participate in political, economic, cultural and social activities Husband and wife have the right and obligation to create conditions for and assist one another in selecting professions; to study and raise their educational level and professional qualifications; to participate in political, economic, cultural and social activities.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@24: Bases for establishing representation between husband and wife 1. Representation between husband and wife in the establishment, performance or termination of transactions shall be determined under this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws. 2. Husband and wife may authorize each other to establish, perform and terminate transactions which, under the provisions of this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws, must be agreed upon by both husband and wife. 3. Husband and wife shall represent each other when one of them loses his/her civil act capacity while the other is eligible to act as a guardian or when one of them has his/her civil act capacity restricted while the other is designated by a court to act as his/her at-law representative, except for cases in which, as prescribed by law, such spouse shall exercise related rights and perform related obligations by himself/herself. In case either spouse loses his/her civil act capacity and the other requests a court to settle his/her divorce, the court shall, based on the Civil Code's provisions on guardianship, appoint another person to represent the person losing his/her civil act capacity to settle the divorce.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@25: Representation between husband and wife in business relations 1. In case a husband and wife jointly conduct business, the spouse directly involved in the business relation is the lawful representative of each other in that business relation, unless otherwise agreed by the husband and wife before they entered into the business relation or otherwise provided for by this Law and relevant laws. 2. In case husband and wife put common property into business, Article 36 of this Law shall apply.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@26: Representation between husband and wife in case only the name of husband or wife is indicated in the ownership or use right certificate for common property 1. The representation between husband and wife in the establishment, performance and termination of transactions related to common property with ownership certificates or property use right certificates inscribed only in the name of husband or wife complies with Articles 24 and 25 of this Law. 2. In case a spouse named in the property ownership or use right certificate establishes, makes and terminates by himself/herself a transaction with a third party in contravention of this Law's provisions on representation between husband and wife, such transaction is invalid, unless the interests of a bona fide third party are protected under law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@27: Joint responsibilities of husband and wife 1. Husband and wife shall take joint liability for transactions performed by either party under Clause 1, Article 30 or other transactions in accordance with the provisions on representation in Articles 24,25 and 26 of this Law. 2. Husband and wife shall take joint responsibility for the obligations specified in Article 37 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@28: Application of the matrimonial property regime 1. Husband and wife have the right to choose to apply the statutory or agreed property regime. The statutory matrimonial property regime complies with Articles 33 thru 46 and Articles 59 thru 64 of this Law. The agreed matrimonial property regime complies with Articles 47, 48, 49, 50 and 59 of this Law. 2. The provisions of Articles 29,30,31 and 32 of this Law shall apply regardless of the property regime selected by husband and wife. 3. The Government shall detail the matrimonial property regime.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@29: General principles of the matrimonial property regime 1. Husband and wife are equal in their rights and obligations in the creation, possession, use and disposition of common property; regardless of the labor in the family and the income-generating labor. 2. Husband and wife have the obligation to ensure conditions to meet their family's essential needs. 3. If the performance of property rights and obligations of husband and wife infringes upon the lawful rights and interests of husband, wife, family and other persons, compensation must be paid.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@30: Rights and obligations of husband and wife to meet the family's essential needs 1. Husband and wife have the rights and obligations to conduct transactions to meet their families' essential needs. 2. In case husband and wife have no common property or their common property is insufficient to meet their family's essential needs, they are obliged to contribute their separate property according to each other's economic capability.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@31: Transactions involving the home as the sole residence of husband and wife The establishment, performance and termination of transactions related to the house being the sole residence of husband and wife must be agreed upon by the husband and wife. In case the house is under the private ownership of a spouse, the owner may establish, perform or terminate transactions related to such property but must ensure residence for husband and wife.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@32: Transactions with third parties in good faith related to bank accounts, securities accounts and other movable assets which, as prescribed by law, are not subject to ownership or use right registration 1. In transactions with bona fide third parties, the spouse who is the person named in the bank account or securities account shall be regarded as the person entitled to establish and conduct transactions related to such asset. 2. In transactions with bona fide third parties, the spouse who is possessing a movable asset which is not required by law to be registered for ownership rights shall be regarded as the person having the right to establish and conduct transactions related to such asset in case the Civil Code provides for protection of bona fide third parties.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@33: Common property of husband and wife 1. Common property of husband and wife includes property created by husband and wife, incomes generated from labor, production and business activities, yields and profits arising from separate property and other lawful incomes during the marriage period, except the case specified in Clause 1, Article 40 of this Law; property jointly inherited or donated by husband and wife and other property agreed upon by husband and wife as common property. Land use rights acquired by husband and wife after their marriage are common property of husband and wife, except cases where the husband or wife is separately inherited, given to him/her or acquired through transactions with separate property. 2. Common property of husband and wife is under joint ownership by consolidation and used to ensure the family's needs and perform common obligations of husband and wife. 3. In cases where there are no grounds to prove that the property in dispute between husband and wife is the separate property of each party, such property shall be considered common property.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@34: Registration of ownership rights and use rights with respect to multiple ownership property 1. In case a property under common ownership of husband and wife requires registration of ownership or use rights as prescribed by law, the ownership or use right certificate must be inscribed with the names of both husband and wife, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife. 2. In cases where the property ownership right certificates or the property use right certificates only state the names of one spouse, the transactions related to such property shall comply with the provisions in Article 26 of this Law; if there is any dispute over such property, it shall be settled according to the provisions in Clause 3, Article 33 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@35: Possession, use and disposition of common property 1. The possession, use and disposition of common property shall be agreed upon by husband and wife. 2. The disposition of common property must be agreed in writing by husband and wife in the following cases: a) Real estate; b) Movable property for which the ownership must be registered as prescribed by law; c/Assets which are the main source of income of the family.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@36: Common property put to business Where husband and wife have an agreement on the use of common property by one party for business activities, such person may conduct transactions related to such common property by himself/herself. Such agreement must be made in writing.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@37: Common property obligations of husband and wife Husband and wife have the following common property obligations: 1. Obligations arising from transactions established under the agreement between husband and wife, obligations to pay compensation for damage which, as prescribed by law, must be borne by husband and wife; 2. Obligations performed by a spouse to meet the family's essential needs; 3. Obligations arising from the possession, use and disposition of common property; 4. Obligations arising from the use of separate property for the maintenance and development of common property or for the generation of the family's principal income source; 5. The obligation to pay compensation for damage caused by their children, which, according to the provisions of the Civil Code, must be compensated by their parents; 6. Other obligations as prescribed by relevant laws.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@38: Division of common property during marriage 1. During the marriage period, husband and wife may reach agreement on division of part or the whole of their common property, except the case specified in Article 42 of this Law. If they fail to reach agreement, they may request a court to settle it. 2. The agreement on division of common property must be made in writing. This agreement shall be notarized at the request of husband and wife or in accordance with law. 3. When so requested by husband and wife, the court shall settle the division of common property of husband and wife under Article 59 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@39: Effective date of the division of common property during the marriage period 1. The effective time of the division of common property of husband and wife is the time agreed by husband and wife and stated in the document; if the document does not state the effective time, the effective time is counted from the date of making the document. 2. In case divided property requires that transactions related to such property comply with a certain form as prescribed by law, the division of common property of husband and wife takes effect from the time the agreement complies with the form prescribed by law. 3. In case a court divides the common property of husband and wife, the division of common property shall take effect on the date the court judgment or ruling takes legal effect. 4. Property rights and obligations between husband and wife and a third party arising before the effective time of the division of common property remain legally valid, unless otherwise agreed by the parties.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@40: Consequences of common property division during marriage 1. In case of division of common property of husband and wife, the divided property portion, yields and profits arising from separate property of each party after the division of common property shall be separate property of husband and wife, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife. The undivided remaining property portion remains common property of husband and wife. 2. The husband and wife agreement specified in Clause 1 of this Article must not change property rights and obligations previously established between husband and wife and a third party.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@41: Termination of effect of division of common property during the marriage period 1. After dividing common property during the marriage period, husband and wife may reach agreement on termination of the effect of the division of common property. The form of agreement complies with Clause 2, Article 38 of this Law. 2. From the effective date of the husband and wife agreement specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the determination of common property and separate property of husband and wife must comply with Articles 33 and 43 of this Law. The property portions divided to husband and wife remain under their private ownership, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife. 3. Property rights and obligations arising before the time of termination of the effect of the common property division remain valid, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 4. In case the division of common property during the marriage period is carried out under an effective court judgment or decision, the agreement on termination of the effect of the division of common property must be recognized by the court.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@42: Mutual property division during marriage is invalidated The division of common property during the marriage period shall be invalidated in one of the following cases: 1. Serious impacts on the family's interests; the legitimate rights and interests of minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves; 2. To shirk the performance of the following obligations : a/The obligation to nurture and support the child; b) The obligation to pay compensation; c) The payment obligation when the Court declares bankruptcy; d) The obligation to pay debts to individuals and/or organizations; dd) Tax liability or other financial liability to the State; e) Other property obligations prescribed in this Law, the Civil Code and relevant laws.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@43: Personal property of husband and wife 1. Separate property of husband and wife includes property which each of them has before marriage; property inherited or given separately during the marriage period; property divided to husband and wife under Articles 38,39 and 40 of this Law; property in service of essential needs of husband and wife and other property which, as prescribed by law, is under the ownership of husband and wife. 2. Property formed from separate property of husband and wife is also separate property of husband and wife. Yields and profits arising from separate property during the marriage period comply with Clause 1, Article 33 and Clause 1, Article 40 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@44: Possession, use and disposition of private property 1. Husband and wife have the right to possess, use and dispose of their separate property; to merge or not to merge separate property into common property. 2. Where a spouse cannot manage his/her own property by himself/herself and does not authorize another person to manage it, the other spouse has the right to manage such property. The property management must ensure the interests of the property owner. 3. Each person's separate property obligations shall be paid from his/her own property. 4. Where husband and wife have their own property and the yields and profits therefrom constitute the family's sole source of livelihood, the disposition of such property must be consented by the husband and wife.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@45: Personal property obligations of husband and wife Husband and wife have the following property obligations : 1. Obligations of each spouse before marriage; 2. Obligations arising from the possession, use and disposition of separate property, except for the cases where obligations arise in the preservation, maintenance and repair of separate property of husband and wife as provided for in Clause 4, Article 44 or Clause 4, Article 37 of this Law; 3. Obligations arising from transactions established and performed by one party not for the family's needs; 4. Obligations arising from law violations committed by husband and wife.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@46: Merger of separate property of husband and wife into common property 1. The integration of separate property of husband and wife into common property shall be as agreed by husband and wife. 2. If a transaction related to a property is required by law to be in a certain form, the agreement must ensure that form. 3. Obligations related to separate property merged into common property shall be performed with common property, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife or provided by law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@47: Agreement on establishment of the matrimonial property regime In case the two marriage partners choose the agreed property regime, this agreement must be made before the marriage in a notarized or certified document. The agreed matrimonial property regime shall be established on the date of marriage registration.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@48: Basic contents of an agreement on the matrimonial property regime 1. The agreement on property regime shall contain at least : a/Assets determined as common property or separate property of husband and wife; b/Rights and obligations of husband and wife toward common property, separate property and related transactions; property to ensure the family's essential needs; c) Conditions, procedures and principles for division of property upon termination of the property regime; d) Other relevant contents. 2. In case of any matters arising from the implementation of the agreed property regime which have not yet been agreed upon by husband and wife or have been agreed upon in an unclear manner, Articles 29,30,31 and 32 of this Law and relevant provisions of the statutory property regime shall apply.
