Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@49: Amendments to the agreement on matrimonial property regime 1. Husband and wife have the right to modify and supplement their agreement on the property regime. 2. The form of amendment to the agreement on property policy shall comply with Article 47 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@50: Invalidation of the agreement on the matrimonial property regime 1. An agreement on the matrimonial property regime shall be declared invalid by a court in one of the following cases : a) Failing to comply with the effective conditions of the transaction specified in the Civil Code and other relevant laws; b) Violating one of the provisions in Articles 29, 30, 31 and 32 of this Law; c) The agreement's contents seriously violate the rights to support, inheritance and other lawful rights and interests of parents, children and other family members. 2. The Supreme People's Court shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Supreme People's Procuracy and the Ministry of Justice in, guiding Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@51: Right to request divorce settlement 1. Husband and wife or both of them may request a court to settle their divorce. 2. Parents and other relatives may request a court to settle a divorce when one spouse, who, due to mental or other diseases, is unable to perceive or control his/her acts and is concurrently a victim of domestic violence caused by his/her spouse, seriously affecting his/her life, health and spirit. 3. A husband has no right to request a divorce in case his wife is pregnant, gives birth to a child or is raising a child under 12 months of age.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@52: Encouraging grassroots reconciliation The State and society encourage grassroots-level conciliation when husband and wife request a divorce. The conciliation must comply with the law on grassroots conciliation.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@53: Acceptance of divorce petitions 1. Courts shall accept divorce petitions in accordance with the civil procedure law. 2. In case a marriage is not registered but a divorce is requested, the court shall accept the case and declare non-recognition of the husband and wife relation under Clause 1, Article 14 of this Law; if there are requests for children and property, they shall be settled under Articles 15 and 16 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@54: Conciliation at court After accepting a divorce petition, the court shall conduct conciliation in accordance with the civil procedure law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@55: Divorce by consent In case both husband and wife request a divorce, if deeming that the two parties really voluntarily divorce and have agreed on the division of property, the care for, raising, care for and education of their children on the basis of ensuring the legitimate interests of the wife and children, the court shall recognize the voluntary divorce; if they fail to reach agreement or reach agreement but fail to ensure the legitimate interests of the wife and children, the court shall settle the divorce.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@56: Divorce at the request of one party 1. When a spouse files a divorce request and the conciliation at court fails, the court shall permit the divorce if there are grounds to believe that the spouse commits domestic violence or seriously violates the rights and obligations of the husband and wife, thus seriously aggravating the marriage, preventing the couple from continuing their common life and achieving no purpose of the marriage. 2. In case the wife or husband of a person declared missing by a court files a divorce, the court shall permit the divorce. 3. In case of divorce request specified in Clause 2, Article 51 of this Law, the court shall permit the divorce if there are grounds for the husband or wife committing domestic violence acts, seriously affecting the life, health and spirit of the other.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@57: Time of termination of marriage and responsibility to send divorce judgments or decisions 1. The marriage relation shall terminate from the date the court's divorce judgment or decision takes legal effect. 2. The court which has settled a divorce shall send the legally effective divorce judgment or decision to the agency which has registered the marriage for recording in the civil status book; the two divorcees; and other individuals, agencies and organizations in accordance with the Civil Procedure Code and other relevant laws.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@58: Rights and obligations of parents and children after divorce The care for, raising and education of children after divorce shall comply with the provisions of Articles 81,82,83 and 84 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@59: Principles for settling the husband's and wife's property upon divorce 1. In case the matrimonial property regime is prescribed by law, the settlement of property shall be agreed upon by the involved parties. If they fail to reach agreement, at the request of the husband, wife or husband and wife, the court shall settle the case under Clauses 2,3,4 and 5 of this Article and Articles 60,61,62,63 and 64 of this Law. In case the matrimonial property regime is agreed upon, the settlement of property upon divorce shall comply with such agreement; if the agreement is incomplete or unclear, the corresponding provisions of Clauses 2,3,4 and 5 of this Article and Articles 60,61,62,63 and 64 of this Law shall apply. 2. Common property of husband and wife shall be divided in half, taking into account the following elements: a/The circumstances of the family and husband and wife; b/The husband's contributions to the creation, maintenance and development of the common property. The husband's and wife's labor in the family shall be regarded as income-generating labor; c) Protect legitimate interests of each party in production, business and occupation so that the parties have conditions to continue their income-generating labor; d/The fault of each party in the violation of husband's and wife's rights and obligations. 3. Common property of husband and wife shall be divided in kind; if it is impossible to divide property in kind, it shall be divided according to its value; the party that receives property in kind with a value larger than his/her/its portion of the property he/she is entitled to shall pay the difference to the other party. 4. Separate property of husband and wife shall come under the ownership of such person, except for cases where separate property has been merged into common property under the provisions of this Law. In case of merger or mixing of separate property with common property and the husband and wife request the division of the property, they shall be paid for the value of their property contributed to such property, unless otherwise agreed by the husband and wife. 5. To protect the legitimate rights and interests of their wives, minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves. 6. The Supreme People's Court shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Supreme People's Procuracy and the Ministry of Justice in, guiding this Article.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@60: Settling property rights and obligations of husband and wife toward a third party upon divorce 1. The property rights and obligations of husband and wife toward a third party remain valid after divorce, unless otherwise agreed by husband and wife and the third party. 2. Disputes over property rights and obligations shall be settled under Articles 27,37 and 45 of this Law and the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@61: Division of property in case husband and wife live with their family 1. In case a husband and wife live together with their family and get a divorce, if their property in the common property of the family is unidentifiable, the husband or wife may be divided part of the common property of the family on the basis of their contributions to the creation, maintenance and development of the common property as well as to the common life of the family. The division of part of the common property shall be agreed upon by husband and wife with the family; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request a court to settle it. 2. In case husband and wife live with their family and their property in the common property of the family can be determined in portions, upon divorce, their property portions shall be deducted from such common property for division under Article 59 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@62: Division of the husband's and wife's land use rights upon divorce 1. The land use right is a separate property of a party which, upon divorce, still belongs to that party. 2. The division of land use rights being common property of husband and wife upon divorce shall be effected as follows : a/For agricultural land under annual crops or aquaculture, if both parties have the demand and conditions for direct use of land, the land use rights shall be divided as agreed upon by the parties. If they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request a court to settle the case under Article 59 of this Law. Where only one party has the demand and conditions for directly using land, such party may continue using the land but must pay to the other party the land use right value they are entitled to; b/In case husband and wife share the right to use agricultural land for annual crops or aquaculture with their household, upon divorce, their land use rights shall be separated and divided under Point a of this Clause; c/For agricultural land under perennial trees, forest land for afforestation, residential land, the division shall comply with the provisions of Article 59 of this Law; d) Other types of land shall be allocated in accordance with regulations of law on land. 3. In cases where husband and wife live with their family and have no land use right in common with the household, upon their divorce, the interests of the party having no land use right and not continuing to live with the family shall be settled according to the provisions of Article 61 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@63: Right of a spouse to reside in divorce Houses under the private ownership of husband and wife which have been put to common use shall still be under the private ownership of such husband and wife upon divorce; in case husband and wife meet with accommodation difficulties, they may reside in these houses for 6 months after their marriage relation terminates, unless otherwise agreed by the parties.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@64: Division of common property of husband and wife for business A spouse doing business related to common property may receive such property and shall pay the other the value of the property to which he/she is entitled, unless otherwise provided by the business law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@65: Time of termination of marriage The marriage shall terminate from the time the spouse dies. In case a court declares that a spouse is deceased, the time of termination of the marriage shall be determined based on the date of death stated in the court judgment or ruling.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@66: Handling of matrimonial property in case one spouse dies or is declared dead by a court 1. When a spouse dies or is declared dead by a court, the living spouse shall manage the common property of husband and wife, unless another person is designated in the testament to manage the estate or the heirs agree to appoint another person to manage the estate. 2. When there is a request for division of an estate, common property of husband and wife shall be divided in half, unless the husband and wife have agreed on the property regime. The property portion of a spouse who dies or is declared dead by a court shall be divided in accordance with the inheritance law. 3. In case the division of an estate seriously affects the life of a living spouse and the family, the living spouse may request a court to restrict the division of the estate under the Civil Code. 4. The property of husband and wife used in business activities shall be settled according to the provisions of Clauses 1,2 and 3 of this Article, except otherwise provided for by the business law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@67: Personal and property relations when a spouse returns from a death sentence 1. When a court issues a decision to annul a person's declaration of death but his/her spouse has not yet married another person, the marriage relation shall be restored from the time of marriage. In case a court issues a decision permitting a divorce under Clause 2, Article 56 of this Law, such decision remains legally effective. In case his/her spouse has married another person, the marriage relation established later takes legal effect. 2. The property relations of the persons who are declared dead and return to their wives or husbands shall be settled as follows: a/In case the marriage is restored, the property relations shall be restored from the time the court's decision annulling the declaration of husband or wife to be dead takes effect. The property acquired by a spouse from the time the court's decision declaring the husband or wife to be dead takes effect until the decision annulling the declaration of husband or wife to be dead takes effect shall be his/her personal property; b/In case the marriage is not restored, the property acquired before the effective date of the court's decision declaring the spouse dead but not yet divided shall be settled like property division upon divorce.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@68: Protection of rights and obligations of parents and children 1. The rights and obligations of parents and children as provided for in this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws shall be respected and protected. 2. Children born regardless of their parents' marital status have the same rights and obligations toward their parents as provided for in this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws. 3. Adopted children and adoptive parents have the rights and obligations of parents and children prescribed in this Law, the Adoption Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws. 4. All agreements between parents and children related to personal and property relations must not affect the legitimate rights and interests of minor children, adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves, or parents who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@69: Obligations and rights of parents 1. To love and respect their children's opinions; to take care of their study and education so that they can develop physically, intellectually and morally to become dutiful children of their families and citizens useful for the society. 2. To look after, nurture, care for and protect the legitimate rights and interests of minor children and adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves. 3. Guardians of or representatives as per the Civil Code of minor children and adult children with lost capacity for civil acts. 4. Do not discriminate against their children on the basis of gender or marital status of their parents; do not abuse the labor of their minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity; do not incite or force their children to work against law or social ethics.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@70: Rights and obligations of children 1. To be loved and respected by their parents, to exercise their lawful rights and interests regarding their personal identity and property in accordance with law; to be educated and to develop physically, intellectually and morally in a healthy manner. 2. To love, respect, be grateful, dutiful and take care of their parents, and preserve the honor and fine traditions of their families. 3. Minor children and adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves may live with their parents and be looked after, nurtured and cared for by their parents. A minor child may work in a family work suitable to his/her age and not in contravention of the law on child protection, care and education. 4. Adult children have the right to choose their professions, places of residence, study, improve their educational level, professional skills; participate in political, economic, cultural and social activities according to their desires and abilities. When living with their parents, children are obliged to participate in family affairs, labor, production and generate income to ensure the family's common life; contribute income to meeting the family's needs in conformity with their abilities. 5. To enjoy property rights commensurate with their contributions to the family's property.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@71: Rights and obligations to care for and nurture 1. Parents have equal obligations and rights to jointly care for and raise their minor children and adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves. 2. Children have the obligations and rights to care for and raise their parents, especially when their parents lose their civil act capacity, are sick, are old and weak, or are disabled; in case a family has many children, all children must jointly care for and raise their parents.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@72: Duties and rights to educate children 1. Parents have the obligations and rights to educate their children, care for and create conditions for their study. Parents create conditions for their children to live in a warm and harmonious family environment; set good examples for their children in all aspects; closely coordinate with schools, agencies and organizations in educating their children. 2. Parents shall guide their children in selecting professions; respect their children's rights to select professions and participate in political, economic, cultural and social activities. 3. Parents may request the concerned agencies and organizations to assist them in educating their children when they meet with difficulties which they cannot solve by themselves.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@73: Represents you 1. Parents are at-law representatives of minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity, unless the children have other persons acting as guardians or at-law representatives. 2. A parent may conduct transactions by himself/herself to meet the essential needs of his/her minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves. 3. Transactions related to real estate or movable assets with registered ownership or use rights or assets put into business of minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity must be agreed upon by their parents. 4. Parents shall take joint responsibility for conducting transactions related to their children's property specified in Clauses 2 and 3 of this Article and the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@74: Pay for the damage you caused. Parents shall pay compensations for damage caused by their minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity under the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@75: The right to own property 1. Children have the right to have their own property. A child's own property includes property inherited or given separately, incomes from his/her labor, yields and profits arising from his/her own property and other lawful incomes. Property formed from a child's own property is also his/her own property. 2. Children aged full 15 years or older living with their parents shall have the obligation to take care of their family's common life and contribute to meeting the family's essential needs if they earn incomes therefrom. 3. Adult children are obliged to contribute incomes to meeting their families' needs under Clause 4, Article 70 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@76: Manage your own property 1. Children aged full 15 years or older may manage their own property by themselves or ask their parents to manage them. 2. Personal property of children under 15 years of age or children who have lost their civil act capacity shall be managed by their parents. Parents may authorize other persons to manage their children's personal property. Personal property of children managed by their parents or other persons shall be returned to their children when they are full 15 years or older or when they have fully restored their civil act capacity, unless otherwise agreed by parents and children. 3. Parents shall not manage their children's personal property in cases where their children are under the guardianship of other persons according to the provisions of the Civil Code; the persons who donate or leave their inherited property under testaments to their children have appointed other persons to manage such property or other cases prescribed by law. 4. In case parents are managing the personal property of their minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity and their children are assigned to other guardians, their personal property shall be returned to their guardians for management under the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@77: Disposition of property of minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity 1. Parents or guardians who manage their children's personal property aged under 15 may dispose of such property in the interests of their children; if the children are full 9 years or older, their wishes must be considered. 2. Children aged between full 15 years and under 18 years have the right to dispose of their own property, except for cases where the property is immoveable property, movable property with ownership or use right registration, or where the property is used for business purposes, the written consent of their parents or guardians is required. 3. In case an adult child has lost his/her civil act capacity, his/her personal property shall be disposed of by his/her guardian.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@78: Rights and obligations of adoptive parents and adopted children 1. Adoptive parents and adopted children have rights and obligations of parents and children specified in this Law from the time the adoption relation is established under the Adoption Law. In case of termination of child adoption under court decisions, the rights and obligations of adoptive parents towards their adopted children shall terminate from the date the court decisions take legal effect. 2. Rights and obligations of natural parents and children who have been adopted by other persons shall comply with provisions of Law on Adoption. 3. Rights and obligations between natural parents and natural children shall be restored from the time the adoption relationship terminates. In case natural parents no longer have or are ineligible to rear their minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves, courts shall settle the termination of adoption and appoint guardians for their children in accordance with the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@79: Rights and obligations of stepfathers, stepmothers and stepchildren of spouse 1. Stepfathers and stepmothers have the rights and obligations to look after, raise, care for and educate other parties' stepchildren living with them under Articles 69,71 and 72 of this Law. 2. Stepchildren have the rights and obligations to care for and support their stepfathers and stepmothers living together under Articles 70 and 71 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@80: Rights and obligations of daughter-in-law, son-in-law, parent-in-law and parent-in-law In cases where a daughter-in-law or son-in-law lives with his/her parents-in-law, the parties shall have the rights and obligations to respect, care for, care for and help one another as provided for in Articles 69,70,71 and 72 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@81: Looking after, caring, nurturing and educating children after divorce 1. After divorce, parents still have the rights and obligations to look after, care for, raise and educate their minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves under the provisions of this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws. 2. Husband and wife shall reach agreement on the person directly raising their children, obligations and rights of each party toward their children after divorce. In case they fail to reach agreement, the court shall decide to assign the children to one party directly raising them on the basis of the children's interests in all aspects; if the children are full 7 years or older, their aspirations must be considered. 3. A child under 36 months of age shall be directly raised by his/her mother, unless the mother is ineligible to directly look after, care for, raise and educate the child or otherwise agreed by the parents in accordance with the interests of the child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@82: Obligations and rights of parents who do not directly raise their children after divorce 1. Parents who do not directly raise their children have the obligation to respect the children's right to live with the persons who directly raise them. 2. Parents who do not directly raise their children have the obligation to support their children. 3. After divorce, the person who does not directly raise the child has the right and obligation to visit and look after the child without any hindrance. If a parent who does not directly rear a child abuses the visit to obstruct or badly affect the care for, nurture and education of the child, the person directly raising the child may request a court to restrict such person's right to visit the child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@83: Obligations and rights of the parent directly raising a child towards the person who does not directly raise the child after divorce 1. Parents who directly rear their children may request persons who do not directly rear their children to perform the obligations prescribed in Article 82 of this Law; request persons who do not directly rear their children and family members to respect their right to rear their children. 2. Parents directly raising children and family members must not obstruct the persons who do not directly raise children in visiting, caring for, nurturing and educating their children.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@84: Change of the direct parent after divorce 1. In case of request of parents or individuals or organizations specified in Clause 5 of this Article, courts may decide on change of child custodians. 2. The change of the child custodian shall be settled on one of the following grounds : a) The parents have an agreement on change of the person directly raising the child in accordance with the child's interests; b/The person directly raising the child no longer has sufficient conditions to directly look after, care for, raise and educate the child. 3. The change of the person directly raising a child must be based on the aspirations of the child aged full 7 years or older. 4. In case both parents are considered ineligible to directly raise their children, courts shall decide to hand over their children to guardians under the Civil Code. 5. In cases where there are grounds prescribed at Point b, Clause 2 of this Article, on the basis of the children's interests, the following individuals, agencies and organizations may request the change of the persons directly raising children : a) Relatives; b/The family state management agency; c) State management agencies for children; d/Women's Unions.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@85: Restrictions on rights of parents towards their minor children 1. A parent has his/her rights toward a minor child restricted in the following cases : a) He/she is convicted of one of the crimes of deliberately infringing upon the life, health, dignity or honor of his/her child or commits serious violations against the obligation to look after, care for, raise and educate his/her child; b) Dispersing the children's property; c) Having a debauching lifestyle; d) Inciting or forcing children to do things contrary to law or social ethics. 2. On a case-by-case basis, the court may itself or at the request of individuals, agencies or organizations specified in Article 86 of this Law issue a decision to prevent a parent from looking after, caring for and educating a child or managing his/her own property or acting as his/her representative at law for between 1 and 5 years. The court may consider shortening this time limit.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@86: Article 16. Persons entitled to request a court to restrict fathers' or mothers' rights toward their minor children 1. Parents or guardians of minor children may, as prescribed by the civil procedure law, request a court to restrict the rights of their parents toward their minor children. 2. The following individuals, agencies and organizations have the right, as prescribed by the civil procedure legislation, to request courts to restrict fathers' and/or mothers' rights toward their minor children: a) Relatives; b/The family state management agency; c) State management agencies for children; d/Women's Unions. 3. When detecting a parent committing the violation specified in Clause 1, Article 85 of this Law, another individual, agency or organization may request the agency or organization specified at Points b, c and d, Clause 2 of this Article to request a court to restrict the parent's rights toward his/her minor child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@87: Legal consequences of parental restriction on rights toward minor children 1. In case a parent has his/her rights toward a minor child restricted by a court, the other parent shall exercise the right to look after, nurture, care for and educate the child, manage the child's personal property and act as the child's representative at law. 2. The care for, education and management of minor children's personal property shall be assigned to guardians under the Civil Code and this Law in the following cases : a) Both parents have their rights toward their minor children restricted by the court; b/One parent has no restriction on rights toward his/her minor child but is ineligible to exercise rights and perform obligations toward his/her child; c/One parent has his/her rights toward a minor child restricted and the other parent of the minor child has not yet been identified. 3. Parents who have their rights toward their minor children restricted by courts shall still have to perform the obligation to support their children.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@88: Identification of parent 1. Children born during the marriage period or conceived by the wife during the marriage period are common children of husband and wife. Children born within 300 days after the marriage termination shall be considered children conceived by the wife during the marriage period. Children are born before the marriage registration date and recognized by their parents as common children of husband and wife. 2. In case a parent does not recognize a child, he/she must have evidence and such recognition must be determined by a court.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@89: Child Identification 1. A person who is not recognized as the father or mother of a person may request a court to identify that person as his/her child. 2. A person recognized as a parent may request a court to determine that such person is not his/her child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@90: Recognition of fathers and mothers 1. Children have the right to recognize their fathers and/or mothers, even in cases where the fathers and/or mothers have died. 2. Adult children shall recognize their fathers without the consent of their mothers; they shall recognize their mothers without the consent of their fathers.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@91: Child recognition 1. Parents have the right to recognize their children, even in cases where they have died. 2. Where a married person acknowledges a child, the child recognition need not be consented by the other person.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@92: Identification of parent or child in case of death request In case of a request for identification of parent or child, if the petitioner dies, his/her relatives may request a court to identify the parent or child for the deceased petitioner.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@93: Identification of parents in case of childbirth by assisted reproductive technology 1. In case a wife gives birth to a child with assisted reproductive technology, the determination of parents complies with Article 88 of this Law. 2. In cases where a single woman gives birth to a child by assisted reproductive technology, she shall be the mother of the child. 3. The childbirth by reproduction-supporting techniques shall not give rise to the father-child and child relationship between sperm, ovum or embryo donors and the born children. 4. The identification of parents in case of altruistic gestational surrogacy must comply with Article 94 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@94: Identification of parents in case of altruistic gestational surrogacy A child born in case of altruistic gestational surrogacy is the common child of the husband and wife who ask for gestational surrogacy from the time of birth.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@95: Conditions for altruistic gestational surrogacy 1. The altruistic gestational surrogacy must be performed on the basis of voluntariness of the parties and recorded in writing. 2. Husband and wife have the right to ask for gestational surrogacy when they fully meet the following conditions : a/There is a competent health organization's certification that the wife cannot get pregnant or give birth even when assisted reproductive technology is applied; b/The couple have no common children; c) Have received medical, legal and psychological counseling. 3. A gestational surrogacy requester must fully meet the following conditions: a/Being a relative of the same line of the wife or husband asking for gestational surrogacy; b/Having given birth once and being allowed to perform gestational surrogacy only once; c/Being of an appropriate age and having the gestational surrogacy possibility certified by a competent health organization; d/In case the gestational surrogate is married, the written consent of the husband is required; dd) Have received medical, legal and psychological counseling. 4. The altruistic gestational surrogacy must not contravene the law on giving birth with assisted reproductive technology. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@96: Agreement on humanitarian surrogacy 1. An agreement on altruistic gestational surrogacy between a gestational surrogacy requesting couple (below referred to as gestational surrogacy requesting party) and a gestational surrogate couple (below referred to as gestational surrogate) must contain the following principal details: a/To provide sufficient information on the gestational surrogacy requesting party and gestational surrogacy-carrying party under the relevant conditions specified in Article 95 of this Law; b) The commitment to exercise the rights and fulfill the obligations specified in Article 97 and Article 98 of this Law; c/The settlement of consequences in case of obstetric accidents; support for the gestational surrogate to ensure reproductive health during pregnancy and childbirth, the adoption of the gestational surrogacy requesting party's child, the rights and obligations of the two parties toward the child in case the child has not yet been delivered to the gestational surrogacy requesting party, and other related rights and obligations; d) Civil liability in case one or both parties violate the agreement. 2. An agreement on gestational surrogacy must be made in writing and notarized. In case the husband and wife of a gestational surrogacy requesting party authorize each other or the husband and wife of a gestational surrogacy authorize each other to reach agreement, such authorization must be made in writing and notarized. The authorization of a third party is not legally valid. In case an agreement on gestational surrogacy between the gestational carrier party and gestational surrogacy requesting party is made together with the agreement between them and a medical establishment providing assisted reproductive technology, this agreement must be certified by a competent person of this medical establishment.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@97: Rights and obligations of the altruistic gestational surrogacy party 1. A gestational surrogate and her husband have the rights and obligations like parents in taking care of reproductive health and caring for and nurturing their child until the time of delivering the child to the gestational surrogacy requesting party; and shall deliver the child to the gestational surrogacy requesting party. 2. A gestational surrogate must comply with the Ministry of Health's regulations on examination and screening procedures for detecting and treating fetal abnormalities and defects. 3. A gestational surrogate is entitled to the maternity regime under the labor and social insurance laws until the time of delivery of the child to the gestational surrogacy requesting party. If the maternity leave period from the date of birth to the time of delivery of the child is less than 60 days, the gestational surrogate is still entitled to the maternity regime until the full 60 days. The childbirth due to gestational surrogacy is not included in the number of children under the population and family planning policies. 4. A gestational surrogacy requesting party may request the gestational surrogacy requesting party to provide reproductive health support and care. In case for his/her life or health or the development of the fetus, the gestational surrogate may decide on the number of fetuses and whether or not to continue the pregnancy in accordance with the law on reproductive health care and giving birth with assisted reproductive technology. 5. In case the gestational surrogacy requesting party refuses to receive the child, the gestational carrier party may request a court to force the gestational surrogacy requesting party to receive the child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@98: Rights and obligations of the altruistic gestational surrogacy requesting party 1. The gestational surrogacy requesting party is obliged to pay actual expenses to ensure reproductive health care under the Ministry of Health's regulations. 2. Rights and obligations of the altruistic gestational surrogacy requesting party toward the child arise from the time the child is born. The gestational surrogacy requesting mother is entitled to the maternity regime under the labor and social insurance laws from the time of receiving the child until the child reaches full 6 months of age. 3. A gestational surrogacy requesting party may not refuse to receive a child. In case the gestational surrogacy requesting party delays the receipt of a child or breaches the child-rearing and-care obligations, it shall pay support money to the child under this Law and be handled under relevant laws. If causing damage to the gestational surrogacy requesting party, it shall pay compensation. In case the gestational surrogacy requesting party dies, the child may inherit his/her inheritance under the law on his/her inheritance. 4. Rights and obligations of children born through gestational surrogacy and other members of the family of the gestational surrogacy requesting party comply with this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws. 5. In case the gestational surrogacy requesting party refuses to deliver the child, the gestational surrogacy requesting party may request a court to force the gestational surrogacy requesting party to deliver the child.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@99: Settlement of disputes related to childbirth by assisted reproductive technology, altruistic gestational surrogacy 1. Courts are competent to settle disputes over childbirth by assisted reproductive technology or gestational surrogacy. 2. In case both spouses of the gestational surrogacy requesting party die or lose their civil act capacity before delivering the child, the gestational carrier party may adopt the child; if the gestational carrier party does not adopt the child, the guardianship and support for the child comply with this Law and the Civil Code.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@100: Handling of violations related to childbirth by assisted reproductive technology and surrogacy Parties in relation to giving birth with assisted reproductive technology or gestational surrogacy who violate the conditions, rights and obligations specified in this Law shall, depending on the nature and severity of their violations, be handled according to civil, administrative and criminal liabilities.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@101: Competence to settle the identification of fathers, mothers or children 1. Civil status registration agencies are competent to identify parents and children in accordance with the civil status law in case there is no dispute. 2. Courts shall have the jurisdiction to settle the identification of fathers, mothers or children in cases where there is a dispute or the persons requested to be identified as fathers, mothers or children have died and in cases prescribed in Article 92 of this Law. Court decisions on determination of fathers, mothers or children must be sent to civil status registration agencies for recording in accordance with the civil status law; parties in parent and child determination relations; and concerned individuals, agencies and organizations in accordance with the civil procedure law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@102: Persons entitled to request identification of parents or children 1. An adult parent or child who has not lost his/her civil act capacity may request the civil status registration agency to identify his/her child or parent in the case specified in Clause 1, Article 101 of this Law. 2. Parents and children, as prescribed by the civil procedure law, may request a court to identify their children or parents in the cases specified in Clause 2, Article 101 of this Law. 3. The following individuals, agencies and organizations, as prescribed by the civil procedure law, may request courts to identify fathers and/or mothers for minor children or adult children who have lost their civil act capacity; to identify children for minor or incapacitated parents in the cases specified in Clause 2, Article 101 of this Law: a) Parents, children, guardians; b/The family state management agency; c) State management agencies for children; d/Women's Unions.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@103: Rights and obligations among other family members 1. Family members have the rights and obligations to care for, care for, assist and respect one another. Lawful personal and property rights and interests of family members provided in this Law, the Civil Code and other relevant laws are protected by law. 2. In case of cohabitation, family members are obliged to participate in family work, income-generating labor; contribute labor, money or other property to maintain the family's life suitable to their practical capabilities. 3. The State shall adopt policies to create conditions for generations in families to care for, care for and assist one another in order to preserve and promote the fine traditions of Vietnamese families; encourage individuals and organizations in the society to join in preserving and promoting the fine traditions of Vietnamese families.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@104: Rights and obligations of paternal grandparents, maternal grandparents and grandchildren 1. Paternal and maternal grandparents have the rights and obligations to look after, care for and educate their grandchildren, lead exemplary lives and set good examples for their children and grandchildren; in case their grandchildren are minor or adult and have lost their civil act capacity or have no working capacity and no property to support themselves and have no nurturing persons as prescribed in Article 105 of this Law, paternal and maternal grandparents are obliged to nurture their grandchildren. 2. Grandchildren have the obligation to respect, care for and support their paternal grandparents and maternal grandparents; where their paternal grandparents and maternal grandparents have no children to raise them, their adult grandchildren have the obligation to raise them.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@105: Siblings' rights and obligations Siblings have the right and obligation to love, care for and assist one another; the right and obligation to raise one another in cases where they no longer have parents or their parents have no conditions to look after, raise, care for and educate their children.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@106: Rights and obligations of aunts, uncles and nieces and nephews Aunts, uncles and nieces, nephews have the right and obligation to love, care for and assist one another; have the right and obligation to raise one another in cases where the persons in need of nurturing no longer have parents, children and the persons defined in Articles 104 and 105 of this Law or have their parents, children and the persons defined in Articles 104 and 105 of this Law, but these persons have no conditions to fulfill the nurturing obligation.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@107: Alimony 1. The supporting obligation is performed between fathers, mothers and children; between siblings; between paternal grandparents, maternal grandparents and grandchildren; between aunts, uncles and grandchildren; between husband and wife as prescribed by this Law. The supporting obligation cannot be replaced with another obligation and cannot be transferred to another person. 2. In case the person with supporting obligation shirks his/her obligation, at the request of the individual, agency or organization specified in Article 119 of this Law, the court shall force him/her to perform the supporting obligation under this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@108: One man feeds many. In cases where a person has the obligation to support many people, the supporting person and the supported people shall reach agreement on the support mode and level suitable to the actual incomes and capabilities of the supporting person and the essential needs of the supported people; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request the Court to settle it.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@109: Multiple support for one person or for multiple people In case many persons are obliged to support one or many persons, these persons shall reach agreement on the contribution mode and level suitable to their actual incomes and capabilities and essential needs of the supported person; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request a court to settle it.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@110: The supporting obligation of parents towards their children Parents are obliged to support their minor children and adult children who have no working capacity and no property to support themselves in cases where they do not live with their children or live with their children but violate the child-rearing obligation.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@111: Children's supporting obligation towards their parents Adult children who do not live with their parents are obliged to support their parents in cases where their parents have no working capacity and no property to support themselves.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@112: The supporting obligation between brothers, sisters In cases where their parents no longer exist or their parents have no working capacity and no property to support their children, adult siblings who do not live together with their younger siblings shall have the obligation to support their minor siblings who have no property to support themselves or adult siblings who have no working capacity and no property to support themselves; adult siblings who do not live together with their elder siblings shall have the obligation to support their elder siblings who have no working capacity and no property to support themselves.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@113: The supporting obligation between paternal grandparents, maternal grandparents and grandchildren 1. Paternal and maternal grandparents who do not live with their grandchildren are obliged to support their grandchildren in cases where they are minor or adult and have no working capacity, no property to support themselves and no one to support them as provided for in Article 112 of this Law. 2. Grandchildren who do not live with their paternal grandparents or maternal grandparents are obliged to support their paternal grandparents or maternal grandparents in case they have no working capacity, no property to support themselves and no one else to support them under this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@114: Alimony between aunts, uncles and nieces and nephews 1. Aunts, uncles who do not live with their grandchildren are obliged to support their grandchildren in cases where they are minor or adult and have no working capacity and no property to support themselves and have no one else to support them as provided for by this Law. 2. Adult grandchildren who do not live with their aunts, uncles are obliged to support their aunts, uncles in cases where the persons in need of support have no working capacity and no property to support themselves without other persons to support them according to the provisions of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@115: The supporting obligation between husband and wife upon divorce Upon divorce, if the needy party requests the support with plausible reasons, the other party shall have the obligation to support according to his/her capability.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@116: Level of support 1. The support level shall be agreed upon between the person with supporting obligation and the supported person or his/her guardian on the basis of the actual income and capability of the person with supporting obligation and the essential needs of the supported person; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request the court to settle it. 2. When there are plausible reasons, the support level may change. The change of the support level shall be agreed upon by the parties; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request the court to settle it.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@117: Feeding Mode The alimony may be paid monthly, quarterly, semi-annually, annually or once. The parties may agree to change the mode of support or suspend the support in cases where the person with supporting obligation falls into economic difficulty and is unable to perform his/her supporting obligation; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may request the court to settle it.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@118: Termination of alimony The supporting obligation shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The supported persons have become adults and have working capacity or property to support themselves; 2. The supported persons are adopted; 3. The supporting person has directly nurtured the supported person; 4. The supporting person or the supported person dies; 5. The supported party has married after divorce; 6. Other cases as prescribed by law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@119: Persons entitled to request the performance of supporting obligation 1. The supported person, his/her parent or guardian, as prescribed by the civil procedure law, may request a court to force the person who fails to voluntarily perform the supporting obligation to perform such obligation. 2. The following individuals, agencies and organizations, as prescribed by the civil procedure legislation, may request courts to force the persons who fail to voluntarily perform the supporting obligation to perform such obligation: a) Relatives; b/The family state management agency; c) State management agencies for children; d/Women's Unions. 3. Other individuals, agencies and organizations, when detecting acts of shirking the performance of the supporting obligation, may request agencies and organizations defined at Points b, c and d, Clause 2 of this Article to request courts to force persons who fail to voluntarily perform the supporting obligation to perform such obligation.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@120: Encouraging the assistance of organizations and individuals The State and society encourage organizations and individuals to provide financial or other property support for families and individuals in exceptionally difficult and needy circumstances.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@121: Protection of the legitimate rights and interests of the parties in marriage and family relations involving foreign elements 1. In the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, marriage and family relations involving foreign elements shall be respected and protected in accordance with Vietnamese law and treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. 2. In their marriage and family relations with Vietnamese citizens, foreigners in Vietnam shall have the same rights and obligations as Vietnamese citizens, except otherwise provided for by Vietnamese law. 3. The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall protect the legitimate rights and interests of Vietnamese citizens in foreign countries in marriage and family relations in accordance with Vietnamese law, laws of host countries and international laws and practices. 4. The Government shall detail the settlement of marriage and family relations involving foreign elements in order to ensure the legitimate rights and interests of the parties and ensure the implementation of the provisions of Clause 2, Article 5 of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@122: Application of law to marriage and family relations involving foreign elements 1. The provisions of the marriage and family legislation of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall apply to marriage and family relations involving foreign elements, except otherwise provided for by this Law. In case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party contains provisions different from those of this Law, the provisions of that treaty prevail. 2. In cases where this Law and other legal documents of Vietnam make references to the application of foreign laws, such foreign laws shall apply, provided that such application does not contravene the basic principles prescribed in Article 2 of this Law. In cases where foreign laws revert to Vietnamese laws, the Vietnamese legislation on marriage and family shall apply. 3. In case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party contains references to the application of foreign laws, foreign laws shall apply.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@123: Competence to settle cases of marriage and family involving foreign elements 1. The competence to register civil status related to marriage and family relations involving foreign elements complies with the civil status law. 2. The competence to settle marriage and family cases involving foreign elements at courts must comply with the Civil Procedure Code. 3. District-level People's Courts of localities where Vietnamese citizens reside shall annul illegal marriages, settle divorce cases and disputes over the rights and obligations of husband and wife, parents and children, recognition of fathers, mothers or children, child adoption and guardianship between Vietnamese citizens residing in border areas and citizens of neighboring countries who are residing in areas bordering on Vietnam in accordance with this Law and other provisions of Vietnamese law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@124: Consular legalization of marriage and family papers and documents Papers made, issued or certified by competent foreign agencies for use in settling marriage and family cases and matters must be consularly legalized, except cases of exemption from consular legalization under treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party or on the principle of reciprocity.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@125: Recognition and notes of judgments and decisions of foreign courts and competent foreign agencies on marriage and family 1. The recognition of judgments or decisions on marriage and family of foreign courts which are requested to be enforced in Vietnam complies with the Civil Procedure Code. 2. The Government shall provide for the recording in the civil status book of marriage and family-related matters under foreign courts' judgments or decisions which are not requested to be enforced in Vietnam or not requested to be recognized in Vietnam; and marriage and family-related decisions of other competent foreign agencies.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@126: Foreign-involved marriage 1. In the marriage between Vietnamese citizens and foreigners, each party must abide by his/her country's law on marriage conditions; if the marriage is conducted at competent Vietnamese State bodies, the foreigners shall also have to abide by the provisions of this Law on marriage conditions. 2. Marriages between foreigners permanently residing in Vietnam at competent Vietnamese agencies must comply with the provisions of this Law on marriage conditions.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@127: Divorce involving foreign elements 1. Divorce between a Vietnamese citizen and a foreigner or between foreigners permanently residing in Vietnam shall be settled at a competent Vietnamese agency in accordance with this Law. 2. Where the party is a Vietnamese citizen who does not permanently reside in Vietnam at the time of requesting the divorce, the divorce shall be settled according to the laws of the country where the husband and wife permanently reside together; if they do not have a place of permanent residence, the settlement shall comply with the Vietnamese laws. 3. The settlement of property being immovable property in foreign countries upon divorce shall comply with the laws of the countries where exist such immovable property.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@128: Identification of parents and children involving foreign elements 1. Vietnamese civil status registration agencies are competent to settle the determination of fathers, mothers or children without disputes between Vietnamese citizens and foreigners, between Vietnamese citizens with at least one party residing abroad, or between foreigners with at least one party permanently residing in Vietnam in accordance with the civil status law. 2. Competent Vietnamese courts shall settle the identification of parents and children involving foreign elements in the cases specified in Clause 2, Article 88, Article 89, Article 90, Clauses 1 and 5, Article 97, Clauses 3 and 5, Article 98, and Article 99 of this Law; and in other cases involving disputes.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@129: The supporting obligation involving foreign elements 1. The supporting obligation must comply with the law of the country where the support requesters reside. Where the support requesters have no residence places in Vietnam, the law of the country where the support requesters are citizens shall apply. 2. The agencies competent to settle the support requests of the persons defined in Clause 1 of this Article are the agencies of the countries where the support requesters reside.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@130: To apply the matrimonial property regime as agreed upon; to settle consequences of the cohabitation of men and women as husband and wife without marriage registration involving foreign elements. In case of request for settlement of the application of the agreed matrimonial property regime; or of the male and female relationship living together as husband and wife without marriage registration involving foreign elements, competent Vietnamese agencies shall apply the provisions of this Law and other relevant laws of Vietnam for settlement.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@131: Transitional provisions 1. Marriage and family relations established before the effective date of this Law shall be settled under the marriage and family law applicable at the time of establishment. 2. Marriage-and family-related cases and matters which have been accepted by courts before the effective date of this Law but not yet settled shall comply with the procedures prescribed by this Law. 3. This Law shall not be applied to appeal according to cassation or reopening procedures against cases or matters which have been settled by courts in accordance with the marriage and family law before the effective date of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@132: Implementation effect This Law takes effect on January 1,2015. The Law on Marriage and Family No. 22/2000/QH10 ceases to be effective on the effective date of this Law.
Luật Hôn nhân và gia đình@133: Implementation detailing and guidance The Government shall detail articles and clauses of this Law as assigned. The Supreme People's Court shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Supreme People's Procuracy and the Ministry of Justice in, guiding the implementation of articles and clauses of this Law as assigned. This Law was passed on June 19,2014, by the XIIIth National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam at its 7th session. - PRESIDENT (Signed) Nguyen Sinh Hung
Bộ luật dân sự@1: Scope This Code provides for legal status and legal standards for conduct of natural and juridical persons; personal and property rights and obligations of natural and juridical persons in relationships established on the basis of equality, free will, property independence and self-responsibility (hereinafter referred to as civil relationships).
Bộ luật dân sự@2: Recognition, respect, protection and guarantee of civil rights 1. In the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, civil rights shall be recognized, respected, protected and guaranteed in accordance with the Constitution and law. 2. Civil rights may be restricted in accordance with law only in necessary cases for the reasons of national defense and security, social order and safety, social ethics and community health.
Bộ luật dân sự@3: Basic principles of civil law 1. All individuals and juridical persons are equal, are not entitled to any discrimination; are equally protected by law in terms of personal and property rights. 2. Each natural or juridical person establishes, exercises or terminates his/her civil rights and obligations on the basis of free and voluntary commitment and agreement. Every commitment and agreement that does not violate the prohibition of the law and social ethics shall be effective for the parties and must be respected by other entities. 3. Each natural or juridical person must establish, exercise and terminate his/her civil rights and obligations in a good faith and truthfulness. 4. The establishment, exercise and termination of civil rights and obligations must not infringe upon national interests, public interests, and lawful rights and interests of other persons. 5. Each natural or juridical person shall be responsible for his/her failure to perform or improper performance of civil obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@4: Application of the Civil Code 1. This Code is the common law governing civil relations. 2. Other relevant laws regulating civil relations in specific fields must not contravene basic principles of civil law specified in Article 3 of this Code. 3. In cases where other relevant laws do not prescribe or prescribe but violate Clause 2 of this Article, the provisions of this Code shall apply. 4. Where there is any discrepancy between the provisions of this Code and the treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a party on the same issue, the provisions of the treaty shall prevail.
Bộ luật dân sự@5: Apply the custom 1. Practices mean rules of conduct with clear contents to define rights and obligations of individuals and legal persons in specific civil relations, which are formed and repeated many times in a long period of time, recognized and widely applied in a region, region, ethnic group, population community or a civil field. 2. Where the parties have no agreement and the law does not prescribe, the custom may apply but the custom applied must not contravene the basic principles of civil law prescribed in Article 3 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@6: Application of similar legislation 1. In case a relation arises within the scope of application of a civil law which the parties have not agreed upon, provided for by law or applied custom, the provisions of the law governing similar civil relations shall apply. 2. Where the similar law provisions prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article cannot be applied, the basic principles of civil legislation prescribed in Article 3 of this Code, precedents and justice shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@7: State policies on civil relations 1. The establishment, exercise and termination of civil rights and obligations must ensure the preservation of national identity, respect and promotion of fine customs, practices and traditions, solidarity, mutual affection and mutual love, each person for the community, the community for each person and fine ethical values of the nations living together in the Vietnamese country. 2. In civil relations, conciliation between the parties in accordance with the provisions of law is encouraged.
Bộ luật dân sự@8: Bases for establishing civil rights Civil rights are established on the following grounds: 1. Contract; 2. Unilateral legal acts; 3. Decisions of courts or other competent agencies as prescribed by law; 4. Results of labor, production and business; results of creation of objects of intellectual property rights; 5. Possession of property; 6. Using property or gaining benefits therefrom without law grounds; 7. Suffering from damage caused by illegal acts; 8. Performing acts without authorization; 9. Other bases prescribed by law
Bộ luật dân sự@9: Exercise of civil rights 1. Each natural person or juridical person shall exercise his/her civil rights at his/her will in accordance with Article 3 and Article 10 of this Code. 2. The non-exercise of civil rights by a natural or juridical person shall not be the basis for termination of such rights, unless otherwise prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@10: Restriction on the exercise of civil rights 1. Each natural person and juridical person must not abuse his/her civil rights to cause damage to other persons, to violate his/her obligations or to perform other purposes against the law. 2. In case an individual or juridical person fails to comply with Clause 1 of this Article, the court or another competent authority shall, according to the nature and consequences of the violation, fail to protect part or all of his/her rights, compel compensation for damage caused and may impose other sanctions as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@11: Methods of protecting civil rights When the civil rights of an individual or a juridical person are infringed upon, such subject may defend themselves in accordance with this Code and relevant laws or request competent agencies or organizations to: 1. To recognize, respect, protect and ensure their civil rights; 2. Forcible termination of acts of infringement; 3. Forcible public apology and correction; 4. Forced performance of obligations; 5. Forced compensation for damage; 6. Cancellation of illegal particular decisions of competent agencies, organizations or persons; 7. Other requirements as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@12: Self-Protection of Civil Rights The self-protection of civil rights must conform to the nature and extent of infringements upon such civil rights and must not contravene the fundamental principles of civil law specified in Article 3 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@13: Compensation for damage Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by law, natural persons or juridical persons with infringed civil rights shall be compensated for all damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@14: Protection of civil rights through competent authorities 1. Courts and other competent agencies shall respect and protect civil rights of individuals and legal entities. In case civil rights are infringed upon or disputed, the protection of such rights shall comply with the procedural law at courts or arbitration. The protection of civil rights according to administrative procedures shall be effected in cases prescribed by law. Decisions on settlement of cases according to administrative procedures may be reviewed at courts. 2. Courts must not refuse to settle civil cases or matters for the reason that there are no applicable law provisions; in this case, the provisions of Articles 5 and 6 of this Code shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@15: Annul illegal particular decisions of competent authorities and persons When settling a request for protection of civil rights, the court or another competent agency may cancel an illegal particular decision of a competent agency, organization or person. Where an individual decision is annulled, the infringed civil rights shall be restored and may be protected by the methods specified in Article 11 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@16: Legal personality of individual 1. The civil legal capacity of an individual means his/her capacity to have civil rights and civil obligations. 2. All individuals have the same civil legal capacity. 3. The civil legal capacity of an individual begins at the time of his/her birth and ends at the time of his/her death.
Bộ luật dân sự@17: Contents of civil legal capacity of individuals 1. Personal rights not associated with property and personal rights associated with property. 2. Ownership, inheritance and other property-related rights. 3. The right to enter into civil relations and obligations arising from such relations.
Bộ luật dân sự@18: No restriction on the civil legal capacity of individuals The civil legal capacity of an individual shall not be restricted, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@19: Legal capacity of individual The civil act capacity of an individual means the ability of an individual to establish and perform civil rights and obligations through his/her acts.
Bộ luật dân sự@20: Adults 1. Adult means a person aged full eighteen years or older. 2. The adult has full legal capacity, except for the cases prescribed in Articles 22,23 and 24 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@21: Minors 1. Minors are persons who are under eighteen years of age. 2. Civil transactions of persons aged under six years shall be established and performed by their representatives at law. 3. A person aged between full six years and under fifteen years shall enter into and perform a civil transaction with the consent of his/her at-law representative, except for civil transactions to meet his/her daily-life needs suitable to his/her age. 4. Persons aged between full fifteen and under eighteen years shall themselves establish and perform civil transactions, except for civil transactions related to real estate, movable property subject to registration, and other civil transactions as prescribed by law, which must be agreed upon by their representatives at law.
Bộ luật dân sự@22: - Loss of civil act capacity. 1. When a person is unable to perceive or control his/her acts due to mental illness or another disease, at the request of the person with related rights and interests or concerned agencies or organizations, the court shall issue a decision to declare such person as a legally incapacitated person on the basis of the conclusion of the forensic psychiatric assessment. When the grounds for declaring a person losing his/her civil act capacity no longer exist, at the request of such person or of the person with related rights and interests or of concerned agencies or organizations, the court shall issue a decision to annul the decision declaring the person losing his/her civil act capacity. 2. A legally-acting representative shall enter into and perform civil transactions of a legally incapacitated person.
Bộ luật dân sự@23: Persons with cognitive and behavioral limitations 1. If an adult is incapable of cognition or behavior control due to his/her physical or mental condition but not to the extent of losing his/her civil act capacity, the court shall, at the request of such adult, persons with related rights and interests or concerned agencies or organizations, and based on the conclusion of a forensic psychiatric assessment, issue a decision to declare such adult as having limited cognition or behavior control and appoint a guardian and determine the rights and obligations of the guardian. 2. When grounds for declaring a person with limited cognition or behavior control no longer exist, at the request of such person or a person with related rights and interests or a concerned agency or organization, the court shall issue a decision to annul the decision declaring such person with limited cognition or behavior control.
Bộ luật dân sự@24: Limited legal capacity 1. For a drug addict or a person addicted to other stimulants, who leads to the destruction of his/her family's property, at the request of a person with related rights and interests or a concerned agency or organization, a court may issue a decision to declare him/her as having restricted civil act capacity. The Court shall decide the legal representative of the person with limited legal capacity and the scope of representation. 2. The establishment and performance of civil transactions related to property of persons who are declared restricted in civil act capacity by courts must be consented by their at-law representatives, except for transactions to serve daily-life needs or otherwise provided for by relevant laws. 3. When the grounds for declaring a person to have limited civil act capacity no longer exist, at the request of such person or of the person with related rights and interests or of concerned agencies or organizations, the court shall issue a decision to annul the decision declaring the person to have limited civil act capacity.
Bộ luật dân sự@25: Personal rights 1. Personal rights prescribed in this Code are civil rights attached to each individual and cannot be transferred to other persons, unless otherwise provided by relevant laws. 2. The establishment and performance of civil relations related to the personal rights of a minor, a legally incapacitated person or a person with limited cognition and behavior control must be agreed by his/her legal representative in accordance with this Code, relevant laws or court decisions. The establishment and performance of civil relations related to the personal rights of persons declared missing or deceased must be consented by their spouses or adult children; in case there are no such persons, consents of the parents of persons declared missing or deceased must be obtained, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@26: Right to a last name 1. An individual has the right to have his/her full name (including middle name, if any ). The full name of a person shall be determined according to his/her birth name. 2. A natural person's family name shall be determined as the family name of his/her biological father or mother as agreed upon by his/her parents; if there is no agreement, the child's family name shall be determined according to customary practice. If the biological father has not been identified yet, the child's family name shall be determined according to the family name of his/her biological mother. If an abandoned child whose natural parents are unidentified is adopted, his/her family name shall be determined according to the family name of his/her adoptive father or adoptive mother as agreed by the adoptive parents. If there is only an adoptive father or an adoptive mother, the family name of the child shall be determined according to the family name of such person. For an abandoned child whose natural parents are unidentified and has not yet been adopted, his/her family name shall be determined at the request of the head of the nurturing establishment or the request of the person requesting birth registration for the child, if the child is being temporarily raised by such person. Natural parents defined in this Code are fathers and mothers determined based on the birth event; gestational surrogacy requesters and gestational surrogates born under the Law on Marriage and Family. 3. The naming shall be restricted in cases where it infringes upon the legitimate rights and interests of other persons or contravenes the basic principles of civil legislation prescribed in Article 3 of this Code. The name of a Vietnamese citizen must be in Vietnamese or another ethnic language of Vietnam; it is not allowed to give a name in numbers or in a single letter other than letters. 4. Individuals shall establish and perform civil rights and obligations by their full names. 5. The use of alias and pen names must not cause damage to the legitimate rights and interests of other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@27: The Right to Change Relatives 1. An individual may request a competent state agency to recognize the change of his/her family name in the following cases: a) Changing the family name of a natural child from the family name of the father to the family name of the mother or vice versa; b) Changing the adopted child's family name from the family name of the natural father or mother to the family name of the adoptive father or adoptive mother at the request of the adoptive father or mother; c) The adopted child stops being adopted and this person or his/her natural father or mother requests to take back his/her family name according to the family name of his/her natural father or mother; d) Changing the family name of a child at the request of the natural father or mother or the child when determining the father or mother for the child; e) Changing the family names of the lost persons who have found out their blood origins; f/To change the family name of his/her spouse according to the family name of his/her spouse in the marriage and family relations involving foreign elements in accordance with the law of the country of which the foreign spouse is a citizen or to reclaim the family name before the change; g) Changing the family name of a child when the father or mother changes his/her family name; h) Other cases prescribed by law on civil status affairs. 2. The change of family names of persons aged full nine years or older must be consented by such persons. 3. The change of a person's last name does not change or terminate civil rights and obligations established under the old last name.
Bộ luật dân sự@28: Renaming Rights 1.
