An individual may request a competent state agency to recognize the change of his/her name in the following cases: a) At the request of the person whose name is used, which causes confusion, affects the family feeling, honor, legitimate rights and interests of such person; b) At the request of the adoptive father or mother for the change of the adopted child's name or when the adopted child stops being adopted and this person or his/her natural father or mother requests to take back the name which his/her natural father or mother has given; c) At the request of the natural father, mother or child when determining the father or mother for the child; d) Change of the name of the lost person who has found out the origin of his/her bloodline; e/Changing the names of spouses in the marriage and family relations involving foreign elements in accordance with the laws of the countries of which the foreign spouses are citizens or reclaiming their names before the change; e) Change of name of a person who has been sex reassigned or changed; g) Other cases prescribed by law on civil status affairs. 2. The change of names of persons aged full nine years or older must be consented by such persons. 3. Change of an individual's name shall not change or terminate civil rights and obligations established under the former name.
Bộ luật dân sự@29: The right to determine and re-determine ethnicity 1. Individuals shall have the right to determine or re-determine their ethnicity. 2. An individual, when born, shall be identified with his/her birth father's or birth mother's ethnicity. In case his/her birth father or mother belongs to two different ethnic groups, the child's ethnicity shall be identified with that of his/her birth father or mother as agreed upon by his/her birth father or mother; in case of no agreement, the child's ethnicity shall be identified with customary practice; in case of different customary practices, the child's ethnicity shall be identified with that of a less-populated ethnic group. In case an abandoned child whose natural parents are unidentified is adopted, his/her ethnicity shall be determined according to the ethnicity of his/her adoptive father or mother as agreed by his/her adoptive parents. In case there is only an adoptive father or mother, the ethnicity of the child shall be determined according to that person's ethnicity. In case an abandoned child whose natural parents are unidentified and has not been adopted, his/her ethnicity shall be determined at the request of the head of the nurturing establishment or the person temporarily nurturing the child at the time of birth registration. 3. An individual may request a competent state agency to re-determine his/her ethnicity in the following cases : a/Re-determination based on the ethnicity of the natural father or mother in case the natural father or mother belongs to two different ethnic groups; b) Re-identification according to the ethnicity of the natural father or mother in case the adopted child has identified his/her natural father or mother. 4. The ethnicity re-determination for persons aged between full fifteen years and under eighteen years must be consented by such persons. 5. It is forbidden to take advantage of the ethnicity re-determination for the purpose of self-seeking or division, harming the unity of Vietnamese nationalities.
Bộ luật dân sự@30: Right to birth and death 1. An individual is entitled to have his/her birth registered from birth. 2. A death must be declared. 3. A child who dies after twenty four hours of life must have his/her birth and death declared; if he/she dies after less than twenty four hours of life, birth and death declaration is not required, unless his/her natural parents so request. 4. Birth and death declaration shall be prescribed by the civil status legislation.
Bộ luật dân sự@31: Rights to nationality 1. Individuals have the right to nationality. 2. The determination, change, naturalization, relinquishment and restoration of Vietnamese nationality shall be prescribed by the Law on Vietnamese Nationality. 3. The rights of stateless persons residing and living on the Vietnamese territory shall be guaranteed according to law.
Bộ luật dân sự@32: Rights of individuals to images 1. Individuals have the right to their images. The use of an individual's image must be approved by the person. If the use of another person's image for commercial purposes, the owner of such image must be paid, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 2. The use of images in the following cases does not require consent of the image owners or their representatives at law: a) Images used for national interests, national interests, public interests; b/Images are used in public activities, including conferences, seminars, sport competition, art performance and other public activities without harming the honor, dignity and prestige of the persons having the images. 3. If the use of images violates the provisions of this Article, the persons having images have the right to request the Court to issue decisions to force the violators, relevant agencies, organizations and individuals to revoke, destroy and terminate the use of images, pay compensation for damage and apply other handling measures as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@33: Right to life, right to life, health and body safety 1. Every individual has the right to life, the inviolability of life and body, the right to health protection by law. No one is illegally deprived of his/her life. 2. When detecting a person who has an accident or disease threatening his/her life, the person who has detected the case shall, or request another person, agency or organization with necessary conditions, immediately take him/her to the nearest medical examination and treatment establishment; the medical examination and treatment establishment shall provide medical examination and treatment in accordance with the law on medical examination and treatment. 3. The anesthesia, surgery, removal, transplantation of human tissues and organs; application of new medical examination and treatment techniques and methods on human bodies; medical, pharmaceutical or scientific experimentation or any other form of experimentation on human bodies must be consented by such persons and conducted by competent organizations. If the test subjects are minors, legally incapacitated persons, persons with limited cognition or behavior control or unconscious patients, they must obtain the consent of their parents, spouses, adult children or guardians; in case of threat to the patient's life without waiting for the opinions of the above-mentioned persons, there must be decisions of competent persons of the medical examination and treatment establishments. 4. An autopsy shall be carried out in one of the following cases: a) The death is consented by such person; b) The death is consented by the parents, spouse, adult children or guardians if such persons have no opinions before the death; c) The case is decided by the head of the health facility or a competent authority as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@34: The right to protection of honor, dignity and prestige 1. Honor, dignity and prestige of an individual are inviolable and protected by law. 2. Individuals may request courts to reject information which adversely affects their honor, dignity and prestige. The protection of honor, dignity and prestige may be effected after the death of an individual at the request of his/her spouse or adult child; in case there are no such persons, the protection may be effected at the request of the deceased's father or mother, unless otherwise provided for by relevant laws. 3. Information that adversely affects the honor, dignity and prestige of an individual and is published on any mass media must be removed or corrected by such mass media. If such information is stored by an agency, organization or individual, it must be cancelled. 4. In case it is impossible to identify the person who has provided the information which adversely affects his/her honor, dignity and prestige, the person to be informed may request a court to declare such information untrue. 5. An individual whose information adversely affects his/her honor, dignity or prestige, apart from the right to request rejection of such information, may request the person giving such information to publicly apologize, correct and pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@35: The right to donate and receive human tissues and organs and to donate and collect cadavers 1. Individuals may donate their tissues and organs while alive or donate their tissues and organs or their cadavers after death for the purpose of treating diseases for other persons or conducting medical, pharmaceutical and other scientific researches. 2. Individuals may receive tissues and organs of other people for their medical treatment. Medical examination and treatment establishments and legal entities competent to conduct scientific research may receive human organs and carcasses for medical treatment, medical or pharmaceutical experimentation and other scientific researches. 3. The donation and removal of human tissues and organs and donation and recovery of cadavers must comply with the conditions and comply with this Code, the Law on donation, removal and transplantation of human tissues and organs and donation and recovery of cadavers and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@36: The right to redefine gender 1. Individuals may re-assess their gender identity. The sex reassignment of a person is performed in case the sex of that person is congenital defect or not yet accurately defined and requires medical intervention to clearly define the sex. 2. Sex reassignment shall be carried out in accordance with law. 3. Individuals who have undergone sex reassignment shall have the rights and obligations to register civil status changes in accordance with the civil status law; and have the personal rights relevant to the sex reassigned in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@37: Sex Reassignment Sex reassignment shall be carried out in accordance with law. A transgender individual has the right and obligation to register civil status change in accordance with the civil status law; and has personal rights relevant to the transsexual gender as prescribed in this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@38: Right to privacy, personal secrets, family secrets 1. The private life, personal secrets and family secrets are inviolable and protected by law. 2. The collection, retention, use and disclosure of information relating to private life and personal secrets must be approved by such persons; the collection, retention, use and disclosure of information relating to family secrets must be approved by family members, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 3. Letters, telephone, telegraph, electronic databases and other forms of exchange of private information of individuals shall be secured and confidential. The opening, control and seizure of mails, telephone numbers, telegraphs, electronic databases and other forms of private information exchange by other persons shall be conducted only in cases prescribed by law. 4. The contracting parties may not disclose information on each other's private life, personal secrets or family secrets they have learned in the course of contract formulation and performance, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@39: Personal rights in marriage and family 1. Individuals have the right to marry, divorce, the right to equality of husband and wife, the right to identify fathers, mothers or children, the right to be adopted, the right to adopt children and other personal rights in marriage, parent-child relations and relations between family members. Children born regardless of their parents' marital status have the same rights and obligations towards their parents. 2. Individuals shall exercise personal rights in marriage and family in accordance with this Code, the Law on marriage and family and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@40: Place of residence of individual 1. Place of residence of an individual is the place where he/she regularly lives. 2. In case the place of residence of an individual cannot be determined under Clause 1 of this Article, his/her place of residence is the place where he/she is living. 3. In case one party in a civil relation changes its place of residence in association with the exercise of rights and performance of obligations, it shall notify the other party of the new place of residence.
Bộ luật dân sự@41: Place of residence of minors 1. The place of residence of a minor is the place of residence of his/her father or mother; if his/her father or mother has different places of residence, the place of residence of a minor is the place of residence of his/her father or mother, with whom he/she regularly lives. 2. Minors may have places of residence other than those of their parents if they are so agreed by their parents or provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@42: Place of residence of the ward 1. The place of residence of a ward is the place of residence of the guardian. 2. A ward may have a place of residence other than the place of residence of the guardian if so agreed by the guardian or provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@43: - The residence of husband and wife. 1. The place of residence of a husband or wife is the place where they regularly live together. 2. Husband and wife may have different places of residence if so agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@44: Military residence 1. The place of residence of a military service member is the place where his/her unit is stationed. 2. The place of residence of an army officer, professional serviceman or national defense worker or official is the place where his/her unit is stationed, except for cases where he/she has a place of residence as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 40 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@45: Place of residence of the person who performs the itinerant occupation The place of residence of a person performing an itinerant occupation on a ship, boat or other means of itinerant practice is the place where such ship, boat or means are registered, except where he/she has a place of residence as prescribed in Clause 1, Article 40 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@46: Guardianship 1. Guardianship means an act whereby an individual or a juridical person, as defined by law, appointed by the commune-level People's Committee, appointed by a Court or as defined in Clause 2 Article 48 of this Code (hereinafter referred to as guardian) takes care of and protects the legitimate rights and interests of a minor, a legally incapacitated person or a person with limited cognition and behavior control (hereinafter referred to as ward). 2. In case of guardianship of a person with limited cognition or behavior control, such guardianship must be consented by such person if such person is capable of expressing his/her will at the time of request. 3. Guardianship must be registered at competent state agencies in accordance with the civil status law. If the guardian does not register the guardianship, he/she shall still perform his/her obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@47: Guardian 1. The ward includes: a) Minors who have lost their parents or whose parents are unidentifiable; b) Minors whose parents are both incapacitated; parents have limited cognition and behavior control; parents have limited legal capacity; parents are declared by the Court to have limited rights to their children; parents have no conditions to care for and educate their children and request guardians; c) Persons who have lost their civil act capacity; d) Persons with limited cognition and behavior control. 2. A person may have only one guardian, except when both parents are guardians of their children or both grandparents are guardians of their grandchildren.
Bộ luật dân sự@48: Guardian 1. Any natural or juridical person who satisfies all conditions prescribed in this Code may act as a guardian. 2. Where a person with full civil act capacity chooses a guardian for him/her, when he/she is in the state of need of guardianship, the selected natural or juridical person shall act as the guardian if he/she agrees. The selection of a guardian must be made in writing and notarized or certified. 3. An individual or juridical person may act as a guardian for many persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@49: Requirements for individuals to act as guardians Individuals who fully meet the following conditions may act as guardians: 1. Having full civil act capacity; 2. Having good moral qualities and necessary conditions for exercising the rights and performing the obligations of a guardian; 3. Not being persons being examined for penal liability or persons sentenced but not yet entitled to criminal record remission for one of the crimes of intentionally infringing upon the lives, health, honor, dignity and/or property of other persons; 4. Not being a person who is declared by a court to have his/her rights toward his/her minor child restricted.
Bộ luật dân sự@50: Article 12. Conditions for a juridical person to act as a guardian A juridical person who fully satisfies the following conditions may act as a guardian: 1. Having civil legal capacity suitable to the guardianship; 2. Having necessary conditions for exercising the rights and performing the obligations of a guardian.
Bộ luật dân sự@51: Supervision of guardianship 1. Kindred of a ward may agree to appoint a guardian among their kindred or select another natural or juridical person to act as a guardian. The appointment and selection of guardianship supervisors must be consented by such supervisors. In case of supervision of guardianship related to the management of property of a ward, the supervisor shall register such supervision at the commune-level People's Committee of the place in which the ward resides. Relatives of a ward are spouses, parents or children of the ward; if there is none of these persons, relatives of the ward are grandparents, siblings of the ward; if there is none of these persons, relatives of the ward are blood uncles, blood uncles, blood aunts of the ward. 2. If there is no relative of the ward or such relatives fail to appoint or select a person to supervise the guardianship as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the commune-level People's Committee of the place in which the guardian resides shall appoint an individual or a legal person to supervise the guardianship. In case of a dispute over the appointment or selection of a person to supervise the guardianship, the court shall make decision. 3. The guardianship supervisor must have full civil act capacity, for individuals, or civil legal capacity suitable to the supervision, for legal persons; and have necessary conditions for supervision. 4. The guardianship supervisor shall have the following rights and obligations: a) Monitor and inspect guardianship performance; b) Consider and give written opinions on the establishment and performance of civil transactions prescribed in Article 59 of this Code; c) Request competent guardianship authorities to consider changing or terminating guardianship and supervising guardianship.
Bộ luật dân sự@52: Natural guardians of minors The natural guardian of a minor specified at Points a and b, Clause 1, Article 47 of this Code shall be determined in the following order: 1. A full brother or sister being the eldest is the guardian; if the eldest is ineligible to act as a guardian, the next full brother or sister shall act as a guardian, unless otherwise agreed upon as a guardian; 2. In case there is no guardian specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the paternal grandfather, grandmother, maternal grandfather or grandmother is the guardian or these persons agree to appoint one or some of them as guardians; 3. In case there is no guardian specified in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article, a natural uncle, natural uncle or natural aunt shall act as the guardian.
Bộ luật dân sự@53: Natural guardians of legally incapacitated persons Where there is no guardian as prescribed in Clause 2, Article 48 of this Code, the natural guardian of the legally incapacitated person shall be determined as follows: 1. If the wife is a legally incapacitated person, the husband shall be the guardian; if the husband is a legally incapacitated person, the wife shall be the guardian; 2. Where both parents lose their civil act capacity or one of them loses his/her civil act capacity while the other does not fully meet the conditions to act as a guardian, the eldest child shall be the guardian; if the eldest child does not fully meet the conditions to act as a guardian, the next eldest child who fully meets the conditions to act as a guardian shall be the guardian; 3. In case an adult who has lost his/her civil act capacity has no spouse or child or his/her spouse or child is ineligible to act as a guardian, his/her parent shall act as a guardian.
Bộ luật dân sự@54: Appointment of guardians 1. Where a minor or a person who has lost his/her civil act capacity has no guardian as provided for in Articles 52 and 53 of this Code, the commune-level People's Committee of the place where the ward resides shall have to appoint a guardian. In case there is a dispute between guardians prescribed in Article 52 and Article 53 of this Code over a guardian or a dispute over the appointment of a guardian, the court shall appoint a guardian. In case of appointment of guardians for a minor aged full six years or older, his/her wishes must be considered. 2. The appointment of a guardian must be consented by the person appointed as the guardian. 3. The appointment of a guardian must be made in writing, clearly stating the reason for the appointment, the specific rights and obligations of the guardian and the status of the ward's property. 4. Except for the cases prescribed in Clause 2 Article 48 of this Code, the guardian of a person with limited cognition and behavior control shall be appointed by the Court among the guardians prescribed in Article 53 of this Code. If there is no guardian as prescribed, the Court shall appoint a guardian or request a juridical person to perform the guardianship.
Bộ luật dân sự@55: Obligations of guardians with respect to a ward under fifteen years of age 1. To care for and educate the ward. 2. Represent the ward in civil transactions, unless the law provides that a person under fifteen years of age may enter into and perform civil transactions by himself/herself. 3. Manage property of the ward. 4. Protect legitimate rights and interests of the ward.
Bộ luật dân sự@56: Obligations of a guardian towards a ward aged between full fifteen years and under eighteen years 1. Represent the ward in civil transactions, unless the law provides that a person aged between full fifteen years and under eighteen years may enter into and perform civil transactions by himself/herself. 2. Manage property of the ward, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 3. Protect legitimate rights and interests of the ward.
Bộ luật dân sự@57: Obligations of guardians with respect to a ward who has lost his/her civil act capacity or has limited cognition or behavior control 1. The guardian of a legally incapacitated person has the following obligations : a) Take care of and ensure the treatment of the ward; b/To represent the ward in civil transactions; c) Manage property of the ward; d) Protect legitimate rights and interests of the ward. 2. The guardian of a person with limited cognition and behavior control has obligations under a court ruling among the obligations specified in Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@58: Rights of guardians 1. The guardian of a minor or a legally incapacitated person has the following rights: a) Use the property of the ward to take care of and pay for the needs of the ward; b) Receive payment of reasonable expenses for management of the ward's property; c) Represent the ward in the establishment and performance of civil transactions and exercise other rights as prescribed by law to protect the lawful rights and interests of the ward. 2. The guardian of a person with limited cognition and behavior control has the rights under a court ruling among the rights specified in Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@59: Management of the property of the ward 1. The guardian of a minor or a legally incapacitated person shall manage the property of the ward as if it were his/her own property; and may enter into civil transactions related to the property of the ward for the benefit of the ward. The sale, exchange, lease, lending, lending, pledge, mortgage, deposit and other civil transactions of the wards' property of great value must be consented by the guardianship supervisor. A guardian must not donate the property of a ward to another person. Any civil transaction between a guardian and a ward which is related to the property of a ward shall be invalid, unless such transaction is made for the benefit of the ward and with the consent of the guardianship supervisor. 2. The guardian of a person with limited cognition and behavior control may manage the property of the ward under a court decision within the scope specified in Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@60: Change of guardians 1. A guardian may be changed in the following cases: a) The guardian no longer satisfies the conditions prescribed in Articles 49 and 50 of this Code; b) The guardian being an individual dies or is declared by the court to have limited legal capacity, have limited cognition or behavior control, lose legal capacity or is missing; the guardian juridical person ceases to exist; c) The guardian seriously violates the guardianship obligation; d) The guardian requests to be changed and another person accepts as the guardian. 2. In case of natural change of guardians, the persons defined in Articles 52 and 53 of this Code shall be natural guardians; if there is no natural guardian, the appointment of guardians shall comply with the provisions of Article 54 of this Code. 3. Procedures for change of guardians shall comply with regulations of law on civil status affairs.
Bộ luật dân sự@61: Transfer of guardianship 1. When changing a guardian, within 15 days after the replacement of a new guardian is made, the person who has performed the guardianship shall transfer the guardianship to his/her replacement. 2. The transfer of guardianship must be made in writing, clearly stating the reason for transfer and the status of the ward's property and other related matters at the time of transfer. The agency that has appointed the guardian or guardianship supervisor shall witness the transfer of guardianship. 3. In case of replacement of a guardian as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 60 of this Code, the agency appointing the guardian shall make a record, clearly stating the status of the ward's property and other related matters of the ward, rights and obligations arising in the course of guardianship, and transfer them to the new guardian to the witness of the guardianship supervisor.
Bộ luật dân sự@62: Termination of guardianship 1. A guardianship shall terminate in any of the following cases: a) The ward has full legal capacity; b) The ward dies; c) The parents of the ward who is a minor and has satisfied all conditions for exercising their rights and performing their obligations; d/The ward is adopted. 2. Procedures for termination of guardianship shall comply with regulations of law on civil status affairs.
Bộ luật dân sự@63: Consequences of termination of guardianship 1. Where the ward has full legal capacity, the guardian shall, within 15 days from the date on which the guardianship ends, settle the property with the ward and transfer rights and obligations arising from civil transactions for the interests of the ward to the ward. 2. In case a ward dies, within 3 months after terminating the guardianship, the guardian shall settle the property with the heir or hand over the property to the manager of the ward's estate, transfer rights and obligations arising from civil transactions in the interests of the ward to the heir of the ward; past this time limit, if the heir is still unidentifiable, the guardian shall continue managing the ward's property until the property is settled under the inheritance law and notify such to the commune-level People's Committee of the place in which the ward resides. 3. In case of termination of guardianship as prescribed in Point c and Point d Clause 1 Article 62 of this Code, the guardian shall, within 15 days from the date of termination of guardianship, settle the property and transfer rights and obligations arising from civil transactions for the benefit of the ward to the ward's parent (s). 4. The payment of property and the transfer of rights and obligations prescribed in this Article shall be made in writing under the supervision of guardianship supervisors.
Bộ luật dân sự@64: Requests for notice on search of persons absent from their residence places and management of their property When a person is absent for 06 consecutive months or more, persons with related rights and interests may request the court to issue a notice on search of the person absent from his/her place of residence in accordance with the civil procedure law and may request the court to apply measures to manage the property of the absent person as provided for in Article 65 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@65: Management of property of persons absent from their residence places 1. At the request of persons with related rights and interests, the Courts shall hand over the properties of persons absent from their residence places to the following persons for management : a/For property already authorized for management by absent persons, the authorized persons shall continue managing them; b) The common property shall be managed by the other co-owner; c) The spouse shall keep managing the property under his/her management; if the spouse dies or loses his/her civil act capacity, has limited cognition and behavior control or has limited civil act capacity, his/her adult children or parents shall manage the property. 2. In case there are no persons specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the court shall appoint one of the relatives of the absent person to manage the property; if there is no relative, the court shall appoint another person to manage the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@66: Article 11.-Obligations of the persons managing the property of persons absent from their residence places 1. Preserve and preserve the property of the absent person as if it were his/her own property. 2. Immediately sell the property that is crop or other products in danger of damage. 3. To fulfill the obligation to support and pay due debts and other financial obligations of absent persons with their property under court decisions. 4. To return the property to the absent person when he/she returns and notify such to the court; if causing damage due to his/her fault in the management of the property, to pay compensation therefor.
Bộ luật dân sự@67: Rights of persons managing property of persons absent from their residence places 1. Manage property of absent persons. 2. Deducting part of the property of the absent person for the performance of the obligation to support, the obligation to pay due debts and other financial obligations of the absent person. 3. To be paid with necessary expenses for the management of the absent persons' property.
Bộ luật dân sự@68: Missing declaration 1. When a person is missing for 2 consecutive years or more, though all measures of notification and search have been applied in accordance with the civil procedure law, there is no reliable information on whether such person is alive or dead, a court may, at the request of a person with related rights and interests, declare such person missing. The 2-year time limit shall be counted from the date of receiving the last information on such person; if the date of the last information cannot be determined, this time limit shall be counted from the first day of the month following the month of the last information; if the date and month of the last information cannot be determined, this time limit shall be counted from the first day of the year following the year of the last information. 2. In case the wife or husband of a person declared missing applies for a divorce, the court shall permit the divorce in accordance with the marriage and family law. 3. A court's decision declaring a person missing must be sent to the commune-level People's Committee of the last place of residence of the person declared missing for making notes under the civil status law.
Bộ luật dân sự@69: Management of property of persons declared missing The current managers of the property of persons absent from their residence places defined in Article 65 of this Code shall continue managing such persons' property when such persons are declared missing by courts and have the rights and obligations prescribed in Articles 66 and 67 of this Code. In case the court settles divorce for the wife or husband of the person declared missing, the property of the missing person shall be handed over to his/her adult child or parent for management; if there is no such person, the property shall be handed over to his/her relative for management; if there is no relative, the court shall appoint another person to manage the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@70: Rescind of the decision to declare missing 1. When a person who is declared missing returns or when there is reliable information that such person is still alive, the court shall, at the request of such person or of persons with related rights and interests, issue a decision to annul the decision declaring such person missing. 2. A person declared missing shall be entitled to receive back the property transferred by the property manager after having paid the management costs. 3. In cases where the wife or husband of the person declared missing has been divorced, even if the person declared missing returns or there is reliable information that such person is still alive, the decision to permit the divorce shall still take legal effect. 4. The decision of the court to annul the decision declaring a person missing must be sent to the commune-level People's Committee of the place of residence of the person declared missing for recording in accordance with the civil status law.
Bộ luật dân sự@71: Death declaration 1. Persons with related rights and interests may request a court to issue a decision declaring a person dead in the following cases: a) After 03 years from the effective date of the Court's decision declaring the missing, there is no reliable information that the person is still alive; b) The person is absent from the war for 05 years from the end of the war without any reliable information that he/she is alive; c/He/she has an accident, catastrophe or natural disaster which, after 2 years from the date of termination, has not yet given reliable information that he/she is alive, unless otherwise provided for by law; d) The person has been missing for at least 05 consecutive years without reliable information that he/she is still alive; this period of time shall be calculated as prescribed in Clause 1 Article 68 of this Code. 2. Based on the cases specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the court shall determine the date of death of the person declared dead. 3. A court's decision declaring a person dead must be sent to the commune-level People's Committee of the place of residence of the person declared dead for making notes under the civil status law.
Bộ luật dân sự@72: Personal and property relations of persons declared dead by courts 1. When a court's decision declaring a person dead takes legal effect, his/her marriage, family and other personal relations shall be settled as for the deceased. 2. The property relation of a person declared dead by a court shall be settled as for a dead person; his/her property shall be settled in accordance with the law on inheritance.
Bộ luật dân sự@73: Rescind of death declaration 1. When a person who has been declared dead returns or when there is reliable information that such person is still alive, the court shall, at the request of such person or of persons with related rights and interests, issue a decision to annul the decision declaring such person dead. 2. Personal relations of persons who are declared dead shall be restored when courts issue decisions to annul decisions declaring such persons dead, except the following cases : a) If the wife or husband of the person who is declared dead has been permitted by the Court to have a divorce as provided for in Clause 2, Article 68 of this Code, the decision on permitting the divorce shall still be legally effective; b/If the wife or husband of the person declared dead has married another person, such marriage remains legally effective. 3. A person who is declared dead but still alive has the right to request the persons who have inherited the property to return the property and the value of the property. Where the heirs of the persons who are declared dead know that such persons are alive and deliberately conceal them for the purpose of inheriting the property, such persons must return all the received properties, including yields and/or profits; if causing damage, they must pay compensation therefor. 4. Property relations between husband and wife shall be settled in accordance with this Code and the Law on Marriage and Family. 5. A court's decision annulling a decision declaring a person dead must be sent to the commune-level People's Committee of the place of residence of the person declared dead for making notes under the civil status law.
Bộ luật dân sự@74: Legal persons 1. An organization shall be recognized as a juridical person when it satisfies all the following conditions: a) It is established in accordance with this Code and relevant laws; b) The organizational structure is conformable with Article 83 of this Labor Code; c) Having property independent from other individuals and legal entities and taking self-responsibility with their property; d/To independently participate in legal relations in their own name. 2. Every natural person and juridical person has the right to establish a juridical person, unless otherwise prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@75: Commercial juridical person 1. Commercial juridical person means a juridical person whose primary purpose is to seek profits and distribute profits to its members. 2. Commercial juridical persons include enterprises and other economic organizations. 3. The establishment, operation and termination of a corporate legal entity shall comply with regulations of this Code, the Law on enterprises and other relevant regulations of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@76: Non-commercial juridical persons 1. A non-commercial juridical person is a juridical person whose primary purpose is not profit seeking; if it has profit, it must not be distributed to its members. 2. Non-commercial juridical persons include regulatory agencies, people's armed forces, political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations, socio-professional organizations, social funds, charity funds, social enterprises and other non-commercial organizations. 3. The establishment, operation and termination of non-commercial juridical persons shall comply with this Code, laws on state apparatus organization and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@77: Charter of juridical person 1. A juridical person must have a charter if it is prescribed by law. 2. The charter of a juridical person shall contain the following principal contents: a) Name of the juridical person; b) The purpose and scope of operation of the juridical person; c) Head office; branches, representative offices, if any; d) Charter capital, if any; dd) Legal representative of the juridical person; f/Organizational structure; modes of nomination, election, appointment, relief from duty, dismissal, tasks and powers of the titles of the executive agencies and other agencies; g) Conditions for becoming or no longer being a member of the juridical person, if the juridical person has members; h) Rights and obligations of members, if the juridical person has members; i) Procedures for approving decisions of the juridical person; rules for settling internal disputes; k) Procedures for amending and supplementing the charter; l) Conditions for consolidation, merger, full or partial division, conversion or dissolution of the juridical person.
Bộ luật dân sự@78: Name of legal entity 1. Legal entities must have Vietnamese names. 2. The name of a juridical person must clearly indicate the type of organization of the juridical person and distinguish it from other juridical persons in the same field of operation. 3. A juridical person must use its name in civil transactions. 4. The name of the juridical person is recognized and protected by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@79: Head office of legal entity 1. The head office of a juridical person is the place where the executive office of the juridical person is located. In case of change of the head office, the legal entity must publicly announce it. 2. The contact address of a juridical person is the address of its head office. The juridical person may choose another place as its contact address.
Bộ luật dân sự@80: Nationality of the juridical person Legal entities established under Vietnamese law are Vietnamese legal entities.
Bộ luật dân sự@81: Property of juridical persons Property of a juridical person includes capital contributed by its owner, founder and members and other property on which its ownership is established in accordance with this Law and relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@82: Establishment and registration of juridical persons 1. Legal entities established on the initiative of individuals or legal entities or under decisions of competent state agencies. 2. Registration of juridical persons includes registration of establishment, registration of changes and other registration as per the law. 3. The registration of juridical persons must be publicly announced.
Bộ luật dân sự@83: Organizational structure of a juridical person 1. A juridical person must have an executive body. The organization, duties and powers of the executive body of a juridical person shall be specified in the charter of the juridical person or in the decision on establishment of the juridical person. 2. A juridical person has another agency as decided by the juridical person or as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@84: Branches and representative offices of juridical persons 1. Branches and representative offices are dependent units of legal entities other than legal entities. 2. A branch shall perform all or part of the functions of a juridical person. 3. A representative office shall be responsible for representing within the scope assigned by the juridical person and protecting its interests. 4. The establishment and termination of a branch or representative office of a juridical person must be registered in accordance with law and publicly announced. 5. The head of a branch or representative office shall perform tasks authorized by the legal entity within the scope and duration of authorization. 6. Legal entities have civil rights and obligations arising from civil transactions established and performed by their branches or representative offices.
Bộ luật dân sự@85: Representative of juridical person The representative of a juridical person may be the legal representative or authorized representative. The representative of a juridical person must comply with regulations on representation in Chapter IX of this Part.
Bộ luật dân sự@86: Legal personality of a juridical person 1. The civil legal capacity of a juridical person means the juridical person's capacity to have civil rights and obligations. The civil legal capacity of a juridical person shall not be restricted, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws. 2. The legal personality of a juridical person shall arise from the time when it is established or permitted to be established by a competent authority; if the juridical person is required to register its operation, its legal personality shall arise from the time when it is recorded in the register. 3. The legal personality of a juridical person shall terminate from the time of termination of the juridical person.
Bộ luật dân sự@87: Civil liability of juridical persons 1. A juridical person shall bear civil liability for the exercise of civil rights and performance of civil obligations established and performed by its representative in the name of the juridical person. A juridical person shall bear civil liability for obligations established and registered by its founding members or their representatives, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise prescribed by law. 2. A juridical person shall take civil liability with its property; shall not take responsibility for civil obligations established and performed by its persons in the name of the juridical person, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 3. A person of a juridical person shall not bear civil liability for civil obligations established and performed by the juridical person, unless otherwise prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@88: Consolidation of juridical persons 1. Juridical persons may be consolidated into a new juridical person. 2. After consolidation, the former juridical persons shall cease to exist from the time the new juridical person is established; the civil rights and obligations of the former juridical person shall be transferred to the new juridical person.
Bộ luật dân sự@89: Merger of legal entities 1. A juridical person may be merged (hereinafter referred to as the merged juridical person) into another juridical person (hereinafter referred to as the merging juridical person). 2. After the merger, the merged juridical person shall cease to exist; civil rights and obligations of the merged juridical person shall be transferred to the merging juridical person.
Bộ luật dân sự@90: Split legal persons 1. A juridical person may be divided into several juridical persons. 2. After the division, the divided juridical person shall cease to exist; civil rights and obligations of the divided juridical person shall be transferred to the new juridical persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@91: Partial juridical person 1. A juridical person may be divided into multiple juridical persons. 2. After separation, the separated juridical person and the separating juridical person shall exercise their civil rights and perform their civil obligations in conformity with their operation purposes.
Bộ luật dân sự@92: Transformation of legal entities 1. A juridical person may be converted into another juridical person. 2. After the conversion, the legal entity to be converted shall cease to exist from the time when the transformed legal entity is established; the transformed legal entity shall inherit the civil rights and obligations of the transformed legal entity.
Bộ luật dân sự@93: Dissolution of legal persons 1. A juridical person shall be dissolved in the following cases: a) The charter; b) The inspection is carried out under a decision of a competent authority; c) The operation duration stated in the charter or decision of a competent state agency expires; d) Other cases as prescribed by law. 2. Before dissolution, a juridical person must fulfill all property obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@94: Settlement of assets of dissolved juridical persons 1. Assets of a dissolved juridical person shall be paid in the following order: a) Dissolution expenses; b/Debts on wages, severance allowances, social insurance and health insurance for laborers according to law provisions and other interests of laborers under the signed collective labor agreements and labor contracts; c) Tax debts and other debts. 2. After the dissolution costs and debts are fully paid, the remaining part of the proceeds shall belong to the owner of the juridical person and capital contributors, except for the case prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article or otherwise prescribed by law. 3. In case a social fund or charity fund has paid all dissolution expenses and debts specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the remaining assets shall be transferred to another fund with the same operation purpose. In case no other fund with the same operation purpose receives transferred assets or the fund is dissolved due to its operation in violation of law or contrary to social ethics, assets of the dissolved fund belong to the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@95: Bankruptcy of juridical persons The bankruptcy of a juridical person shall be governed by the laws on bankruptcy.
Bộ luật dân sự@96: Termination of legal entity existence 1. A juridical person shall cease to exist in the following cases: a) Consolidation, merger, full division, conversion, dissolution of juridical persons as prescribed in Articles 88,89,90,92 and 93 of this Code; b) The bankrupt is declared as prescribed by law on bankruptcy. 2. A juridical person shall cease to exist from the time of deletion of its name from the juridical person register or from the time determined in a decision of a competent authority. 3. When a juridical person ceases to exist, its property shall be settled in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@97: The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local state agencies in civil relations The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies, when entering into civil relations, shall be equal to other subjects and bear civil liability as prescribed in Article 99 and Article 100 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@98: Representative participating in civil relations The representation of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies in civil relations shall comply with regulations of law on functions, tasks, powers and organizational structure of regulatory agencies. The representation through other natural and juridical persons shall only be carried out in the cases and according to the procedures prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@99: Liability for civil obligations 1. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies shall be responsible for their civil obligations with property of which they represent the owner and shall uniformly manage such property, except for the case where the property has been transferred to a juridical person as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Legal entities established by the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central or local regulatory agencies shall not be responsible for civil obligations arising from civil relations of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central or local regulatory agencies. 3. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies shall not be responsible for civil obligations of juridical persons they establish, including state-owned enterprises, unless the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies guarantee civil obligations of such juridical persons as per the law. 4. Central and local regulatory agencies shall not be responsible for civil obligations of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, other central and local regulatory agencies, unless otherwise prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@100: Liability for civil obligations of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local state agencies in civil relations with a foreign state, legal entity or individual on one side 1. The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central and local regulatory agencies shall be responsible for civil obligations established by themselves with foreign state, juridical person and/or individual in the following cases: a) The treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory contains provisions on waiving immunity; b) The parties in the civil relation agree to waive their immunity; c) The Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central or local regulatory agencies waive their immunity. 2. The liability for civil obligations of the State and foreign regulatory agencies when entering into civil relations with the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, central regulatory agencies, local regulatory agencies, Vietnamese juridical persons and individuals shall be applied similarly to Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@101: Subject in civil relation with participation of households, co-operative groups, other organizations without legal status 1. In case a household, artel or another non-juridical person engages in a civil relation, its members shall be the entities that enter into or perform the civil transaction or authorize a representative to enter into or perform the civil transaction. The authorization must be made in writing, unless otherwise agreed. Any change of the representative must be notified to the parties involved in the civil relation. If a member of a household, artel or non-juridical person engages in a civil relation without authorization of other members to act as a representative, such member shall be the subject of the civil relation established and performed by such member. 2. The determination of subjects of civil relations involving land-using households complies with the Land Law.
Bộ luật dân sự@102: Common property of members of households, co-operative groups and other non-juridical persons 1. Common property of household members and their rights and obligations to such property shall be determined in accordance with Article 212 of this Code. 2. Common property of members of a co-operative group and their rights and obligations to such property shall be determined in accordance with Article 506 of this Code. 3. Common property of members of another organization without legal status and rights and obligations to such property shall be determined as agreed by members, unless otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@103: Civil liability of members of households, artels and other organizations without legal status 1. Civil obligations arising from the participation in civil relations of households, co-operative groups and other organizations without legal status shall be secured by common property of their members. 2. Where members do not have or do not have enough common property to perform common obligations, the obligee may request members to perform the obligations as provided for in Article 288 of this Code. 3. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties, agreed in the cooperation contract or provided by law, members shall bear civil liability specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article in proportion to their property contributions. If such proportion cannot be determined, equal proportions shall be determined.
Bộ luật dân sự@104: Legal consequences of civil transactions entered into and performed by unauthorized members or beyond the scope of representation 1. If a member without representation establishes or performs a civil transaction on behalf of other members of a household, artel or organization without legal status or a representative establishes or performs a transaction beyond his/her scope of representation, the legal consequences of the transaction shall comply with Articles 130,142 and 143 of this Code. 2. If a civil transaction entered into and performed by an unauthorized party or beyond the scope of representation causes damage to other members of a household, artel or organization without legal status or a third party, the involved party must pay compensation to the sufferer.
Bộ luật dân sự@105: Assets 1. Property means objects, money, valuable papers and property rights. 2. Property includes immovable property and movable property. Immovable property and movable property may be existing property and property to be formed in the future.
Bộ luật dân sự@106: Asset registration 1. Ownership rights and other rights to immovable property shall be registered in accordance with this Code and regulations of law on property registration. 2. Ownership rights and other rights to movable property are not subject to registration, unless otherwise provided by the law on property registration. 3. The registration of property must be public.
Bộ luật dân sự@107: Real estate and movable property 1. Real estate includes: a) Land; b) Houses and constructions on land; c) Other property on land, houses and construction works; d) Other property as prescribed by law. 2. Movable property means property other than immovable property.
Bộ luật dân sự@108: Existing assets and future assets 1. Existing property means property which has been formed and the subject has established ownership rights and other property-related rights before or at the time of establishment of a transaction. 2. Future assets include: a) Unconstructed property; b) Formed property whose ownership is established by the entity after the transaction is established.
Bộ luật dân sự@109: Yield, income 1. Yield means natural products brought about by property. 2. Profits mean profits earned from the exploitation of property.
Bộ luật dân sự@110: Primary and secondary objects 1. Primary objects are independent objects which can be exploited according to their utility. 2. Auxiliary object means an object directly serving the exploitation of the utility of a principal object, which is a part of the principal object but can be detached from the principal object. 3. When performing the obligation to transfer principal objects, the supporting objects must also be transferred, except otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@111: Divisible Objects and Indivisible Objects 1. A divisible object is an object which, when divided, retains its original properties and utility. 2. Undividable object means an object which, when divided, cannot retain its original nature and utility. When it is necessary to divide an indivisible object, it must be valued in money for division.
Bộ luật dân sự@112: Consumables and non-consumables 1. A consumable object is an object which, after being used once, loses or cannot retain its original nature, shape and utility. The consumable object cannot be the object of the leasing contract or lending contract. 2. Non-consumable object means an object which, after being used many times, basically retains its original nature, shape and utility.
Bộ luật dân sự@113: Fungible and Specified Objects 1. Fungible objects mean objects with the same form, nature and utility and identifiable in units of measurement. Objects of the same type and of the same quality may be interchangeable. 2. Special object means an object which can be distinguished from other objects by its particular characteristics in terms of signs, shape, color, material, characteristics and position. Upon performance of the obligation to transfer a specific object, the object must be delivered.
Bộ luật dân sự@114: Synchronous Objects A complete object is an object composed of parts or parts which are coherent and related to each other and constitute a whole but if one of these parts or parts is missing or there is a part or part of a piece or part of a piece or part of a piece or part of a piece or part of a piece is of improper specifications or of improper categories, it is unusable or its utility value is reduced. When performing the obligation to transfer a complete object, all parts or components of the object must be transferred, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@115: Property Rights Property rights mean the rights which can be valued in money, including property rights to subjects of intellectual property rights, land use rights and other property rights.
Bộ luật dân sự@116: Civil transactions A civil transaction is a unilateral contract or legal act that gives rise to, changes or terminates civil rights and obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@117: Conditions for a civil transaction to be effective 1. A civil transaction shall be valid when it fully meets the following conditions: a) The subject has civil legal capacity and capacity for civil acts in accordance with the established civil transaction; b) The subject participating in the civil transaction is completely voluntary; c) The purpose and contents of the civil transaction do not violate the prohibition of law and social ethics. 2. The form of a civil transaction is the effective condition of the civil transaction in cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@119: Forms of civil transactions 1. Civil transactions may be expressed verbally, in writing or in specific acts. Civil transactions made via electronic means in the form of data messages as prescribed by the law on electronic transactions shall be considered as written transactions. 2. Where the law requires that a civil transaction must be expressed in writing and notarized, certified or registered, such provisions must be complied with.
Bộ luật dân sự@120: Conditional Civil Transactions 1. Where the parties have agreed on the conditions for the arising or termination of a civil transaction, the civil transaction shall arise or be terminated upon the occurrence of such conditions. 2. If the conditions which give rise to or cancel a civil transaction cannot occur due to the intentional direct or indirect obstruction of a party, such conditions shall be deemed to have already occurred; if there is a direct or indirect influence of a party which intentionally promotes the occurrence of the conditions, such conditions shall be deemed not to have occurred.
Bộ luật dân sự@121: Interpretation of civil transactions 1. For civil transactions with unclear or confusing contents, which are understood in different meanings and do not fall under Clause 2 of this Article, their interpretation shall be carried out in the following order: a) According to the true will of the parties when establishing the transaction; b) In a sense consistent with the purpose of the transaction; c) The transaction is conducted according to the customary practice at the place where the transaction is made. 2. The interpretation of a contract shall comply with Article 404 of this Code; the interpretation of the contents of a will shall comply with Article 648 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@122: Invalid civil transaction Unless otherwise provided for by this Code, civil transactions which do not satisfy any of the conditions specified in Article 117 of this Code shall be invalid.
Bộ luật dân sự@123: Article 10.-Civil transactions are invalid due to violation of law or contrary to social ethics Civil transactions with purposes and contents in violation of law or contrary to social ethics are invalid. The prohibition of the law is that the provisions of the law do not allow the subject to perform certain acts. Social ethics are common codes of conduct in social life, which are recognized and respected by the community.
Bộ luật dân sự@124: Civil transactions invalid due to artifact 1. When parties enter into a civil transaction in a false manner to conceal another civil transaction, the false transaction shall be invalid while the concealed transaction remains valid, unless such transaction is also invalid as prescribed in this Code or other relevant laws. 2. If a civil transaction is made for the purpose of evading obligations towards a third party, such transaction shall be invalid.
Bộ luật dân sự@125: Article 10.-Invalid civil transactions established and performed by minors, persons losing their civil act capacity, persons with limited cognition and behavior control or persons with restricted civil act capacity 1. When a civil transaction is established and performed by a minor, a legally incapacitated person, a person with limited cognition and behavior control or a person with limited legal capacity, the Court shall, at the request of his/her representative, declare such transaction invalid if, as prescribed by law, such transaction must be established, performed or agreed by his/her representative, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. A civil transaction of a person referred to in Clause 1 of this Article shall not be invalidated in the following cases: a) Civil transactions of persons under six years of age or persons who have lost their civil act capacity to meet their daily essential needs; b) The civil transaction only gives rise to rights or exemptions from obligations of minor persons, legally incapacitated persons, persons with limited cognition and behavior control, persons with limited legal capacity from the persons who have entered into or performed the transaction with them; c) The civil transaction is recognized by the transaction establishor after the person has become an adult or has his/her legal capacity restored.
Bộ luật dân sự@126: Civil transaction invalid due to confusion 1. If a civil transaction is entered into by mistake and one or all parties fail to achieve the purpose of the transaction establishment, the mistaken party may request a court to declare the civil transaction invalid, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. A civil transaction with errors is not invalid if the parties have achieved the purposes of establishing the transaction or the parties can immediately rectify the errors that still achieve the purposes of establishing the transaction.
Bộ luật dân sự@127: A civil transaction is invalid due to deception, intimidation or coercion When a party to a civil transaction is deceived, threatened or coerced, it may request a court to declare such transaction invalid. Deception in civil transactions means an intentional act of a party or a third party to mislead the other party in the subject matter, nature of the object or contents of a civil transaction, thereby establishing such transaction. Threat or coercion in civil transactions means an intentional act of one party or a third party which compels the other party to perform a civil transaction in order to avoid damage to the life, health, honor, prestige, dignity or property of the other party or his/her relatives.
Bộ luật dân sự@128: A civil transaction is invalid because the person making the transaction is unaware and does not control his/her behavior A person with legal capacity who has entered into a transaction at the time when he/she is unaware and unable to control his/her acts may request a court to declare such civil transaction invalid.
Bộ luật dân sự@129: A civil transaction is invalid due to non-compliance with formality regulations A civil transaction which violates the provisions on conditions for effect in form shall be invalidated, except for the following cases: 1. If a civil transaction which is established under regulations must be made in writing but the written document is incompliant with law and one party or all parties has performed at least two-thirds of the transaction's obligations, the court shall, at the request of one party or all parties, issue a decision recognizing the validity of such transaction; 2. For civil transactions which have been established in writing but violate the compulsory regulations on notarization and authentication and one party or all parties has performed at least two-thirds of the transaction's obligations, the courts shall, at the request of one party or all parties, issue decisions to recognize the validity of such transactions. In this case, the parties shall not have to conduct the notarization or authentication.
Bộ luật dân sự@130: Partially invalid civil transactions A civil transaction shall be partially invalidated when part of the transaction is invalid but does not affect the validity of the remaining part of the transaction.
Bộ luật dân sự@131: Legal consequences of invalid civil transactions 1. An invalid civil transaction shall not give rise to, change or terminate the civil rights and obligations of the parties from the time the transaction is established. 2. When a civil transaction is invalid, the parties shall restore the original state and return to each other what they have received. In case of non-refundable in kind, the value of the property shall be in cash. 3. Bona fide parties in the collection of yields and/or profits shall not have to return such yields and/or profits. 4. The party at fault that causes damage shall pay compensation. 5. The settlement of consequences of invalid civil transactions related to moral rights shall be prescribed in this Code and relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@132: The statute of limitations for requesting a court to declare a civil transaction invalid 1. The prescriptive period for requesting a Court to declare a civil transaction invalid as prescribed in Articles 125,126,127,128 and 129 of this Code shall be 02 years from the date on which: a) The representative of a minor, a legally incapacitated person, a person with limited cognition and behavior control, or a person with limited legal capacity knows or should know that the represented person establishes and performs the transaction on his/her own; b) The person who is confused or deceived knows or should know that the transaction is established due to confusion or deception; c) The person threatening or coercing the violator stops threatening or coercing the violator; d) Persons who are unaware and unable to control their acts establish transactions; dd) A civil transaction is established in case the transaction does not comply with regulations on form. 2. If the time limit specified in Clause 1 of this Article expires and there is no request for declaring a civil transaction invalid, the transaction shall become effective. 3. For civil transactions prescribed in Article 123 and Article 124 of this Code, the statute of limitations for requesting Courts to declare such civil transactions invalid shall not be limited.
Bộ luật dân sự@133: Protection of the interests of bona fide third parties when civil transactions are invalid 1. If a civil transaction is invalid but the subject matter of the transaction is non-registered property and has been transferred to a bona fide third party, the transaction entered into and performed with the third party shall remain valid, except for the case prescribed in Article 167 of this Code. 2. In case a civil transaction is invalid but the property has been registered at a competent state agency and then transferred in another civil transaction to a bona fide third party who, based on such registration, establishes and performs the transaction, such transaction is not invalid. If the property subject to registration has not been registered at a competent authority, the civil transaction with a third party shall be invalidated, unless the bona fide third party receives such property through auction at a competent authority or the transaction with a person who is the property owner under a judgment or decision of a competent authority but is not the property owner after the judgment or decision is annulled or amended. 3. The owner has no right to reclaim the property from a bona fide third party if the civil transaction with this person is not invalidated as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article but has the right to initiate a lawsuit and request the party at fault that leads to the transaction being established with the third party to pay reasonable expenses and compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@134: Representative 1. Representation means an act whereby an individual or a juridical person (hereinafter referred to as representative) establishes and performs a civil transaction in the name and for the benefit of another individual or juridical person (hereinafter referred to as principal). 2. Each natural or juridical person may enter into and perform a civil transaction through his/her representative. Each natural person must not allow another person to represent him/her if the law requires that he/she must enter into and perform such transaction himself/herself. 3. If required by law, the representative must have civil legal capacity and capacity for civil acts in accordance with the civil transaction to be established and performed.
Bộ luật dân sự@135: Pursuant to the establishment of representation The right to representation shall be established under the authorization between the principal and the representative (hereinafter referred to as authorized representation); under a decision of a competent authority, the charter of the juridical person or as prescribed by law (hereinafter referred to as legal representation).
Bộ luật dân sự@136: Legal representative of individual 1. Parents for minor children. 2. Guardians of warders. Guardians of persons with limited cognition and behavior control shall act as representatives at law if they are appointed by courts. 3. Persons appointed by courts in case representatives specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article cannot be identified. 4. Persons appointed by courts, for persons with restricted civil act capacity.
Bộ luật dân sự@137: Legal representative of juridical person 1. Legal representatives of juridical persons include: a) Persons appointed by the juridical person according to the charter; b) The competent representative as prescribed by law; c) Persons appointed by the Court during the procedures at the Court. 2. A juridical person may have multiple legal representatives and each of them has the right to represent the juridical person as per Article 140 and Article 141 of this Law.
Bộ luật dân sự@138: Authorized representative 1. An individual or juridical person may authorize another individual or juridical person to enter into and perform civil transactions. 2. Members of a household, artel or organization without legal status may reach an agreement on designation of another natural or juridical person to act as an authorized representative to enter into and perform civil transactions related to common property of members of a household, artel or organization without legal status. 3. Persons aged between full fifteen years and under eighteen years may act as authorized representatives, except where the law stipulates that civil transactions must be established and performed by persons aged full eighteen years or older.
Bộ luật dân sự@139: Legal consequences of representation 1. A civil transaction entered into and performed by a representative with a third party in accordance with the scope of representation shall give rise to rights and obligations towards the principal. 2. A representative has the right to establish and perform necessary acts to achieve the purpose of representation. 3. If a representative still establishes or performs acts of representation due to misunderstanding, deception, intimidation or coercion, his/her rights and obligations toward the principal are not exercised or fulfilled, unless the principal knows or should know of such acts without objection.
Bộ luật dân sự@140: Term of representation 1. The term of representation shall be determined according to the written authorization, decision of the competent authority, charter of the juridical person or regulations of law. 2. In case the term of representation cannot be determined under Clause 1 of this Article, it shall be determined as follows: a) If the representation right is determined according to a specific civil transaction, the representation duration shall be counted to the time of termination of such civil transaction; b) If the representation right is not determined for a specific civil transaction, the representation term shall be 01 year from the time the representation right arises. 3. An authorized representative shall terminate in any of the following cases: a) As agreed; b) The authorization period expires; c/The authorized work has been completed; d) The principal or the representative unilaterally terminates the authorization; dd) The principal or the representative being an individual dies; the principal or the representative being a juridical person ceases to exist; e) The representative no longer satisfies the conditions prescribed in Clause 3 Article 134 of this Code; g) Other grounds that make the representation impossible. 4. The legal representative shall terminate in any of the following cases: a/The principal being an individual has become an adult or his/her civil act capacity has been restored; b) The principal being an individual dies; c) The principal being a juridical person ceases to exist; d) Other grounds as prescribed in this Code or other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@141: Scope of representation 1. A representative may only enter into and perform a civil transaction within the scope of representation on the following grounds: a) Decisions of competent authorities; b) Charter of the juridical person; c) Contents of authorization; d) Other regulations of law. 2. Where the scope of representation cannot be determined as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the legal representative has the right to enter into and perform all civil transactions for the benefits of the principal, unless otherwise provided for by law. 3. An individual or juridical person may represent different individuals or juridical persons but must not enter into or perform a civil transaction on behalf of the principal or the third party that is also the principal or the principal's representative, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 4. The representative must notify the transaction party of the scope of his/her representation.
Bộ luật dân sự@142: Consequences of civil transactions established and performed by unauthorized persons 1. A civil transaction entered into and performed by an unauthorized person shall not give rise to rights and obligations of the principal, except for one of the following cases: a) The principal has recognized the transaction; b/The represented persons know without objection within a reasonable time limit; c) The principal is at fault that the transactor does not know or cannot know that the person entering into and performing the civil transaction with him/her has no representation right. 2. If a civil transaction entered into and performed by an unauthorized person does not give rise to rights and obligations towards the principal, the unauthorized person must still perform obligations towards the person with whom the transaction was made, unless the transactor knew or should have known that the unauthorized person still transacted. 3. A person who has entered into a transaction with an unauthorized person shall have the right to terminate unilaterally the performance of or to terminate the established civil transaction and demand compensation for damage, except where such person knows or should know that the unauthorized person still enters into the transaction or the case stipulated in clause 1 (a) of this article. 4. If the unauthorized person and the person who has entered into a civil transaction deliberately enter into and perform such transaction, thus causing damage to the principal, they shall be jointly liable for compensation for such damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@143: Consequences of civil transactions established and performed by representatives beyond their scope of representation 1. A civil transaction entered into and performed by a representative beyond the scope of representation shall not give rise to rights and obligations of the principal with respect to the part of the transaction performed beyond the scope of representation, except for one of the following cases: a) The representative agrees; b/The represented persons know without objection within a reasonable time limit; c) The principal is at fault that the transactor does not know or cannot know that the person entering into and performing the civil transaction with him/her is beyond the scope of representation. 2.
