If a civil transaction entered into and performed by a representative beyond the scope of representation does not give rise to rights and obligations of the principal with respect to the part of the transaction entered into and performed beyond the scope of representation, the representative must perform obligations to the person with whom the transaction was entered into regarding the part of the transaction beyond the scope of representation, unless the transactor knew or should have known that the transaction was beyond the scope of representation. 3. A person who has entered into a transaction with a representative may unilaterally terminate or terminate the performance of a civil transaction for the part of the transaction beyond his/her scope of representation or the entire transaction and claim compensation for damage, unless such person knows or should know that the transaction is still carried out beyond his/her scope of representation or in the case specified at Point a, Clause 1 of this Article. 4. If a representative and his/her transactor intentionally enter into and perform a civil transaction beyond the scope of representation, thus causing damage to the principal, they shall jointly pay compensation for such damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@144: Expire Time 1. Time limit means a period of time determined from one point of time to another. 2. A time limit may be determined in minutes, hours, days, weeks, months or years or in an event that may occur.
Bộ luật dân sự@145: Apply Timeout Calculation 1. The method of calculating time limits shall comply with the provisions of this Code, except otherwise agreed upon or provided for by law. 2. The time limit shall be calculated according to the solar calendar, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@146: Regulations on time limit and time for calculation of time limit 1. Where the parties agree on a time limit of one year, half year, one month, half month, one week, one day, one hour or one minute, but the time intervals are not consecutive, such time limit shall be calculated as follows: a) A year shall be three hundred and sixty five days; b) Half a year is six months; c) A month shall be thirty days; d) Half of a month is fifteen days; e) A week is seven days; e) A day is 24 hours; g) One hour is sixty minutes; h) One minute is sixty seconds. 2. Where the parties agree on the time at the beginning of a month, the middle of a month or the end of a month, such time is prescribed as follows: a) The beginning of a month is the first day of the month; b) The middle of a month shall be the fifteenth day of the month; c) The end of a month shall be the last day of the month. 3. Where the parties agree on the time at the beginning of the year, the middle of the year or the end of the year, such time is prescribed as follows: a) The beginning of the year is the first day of January; b) The middle of the year is the last day of June; c) The end of the year is the last day of December.
Bộ luật dân sự@147: Time of commencement of the time limit 1. When a time limit is determined in minutes or hours, it shall start from the determined time. 2. When a time limit is determined by day, week, month or year, the first day of the time limit shall not be counted but counted from the day following the determined day. 3. When a time limit begins with an event, the date of occurrence of the event shall not be counted but counted from the date following the date of occurrence of such event.
Bộ luật dân sự@148: End of Timeout 1. When a time limit is counted in days, the time limit shall end at the end of the last day of the time limit. 2. If a time limit is counted in weeks, the time limit shall end at the end of the corresponding day of the last week of the time limit. 3. If a time limit is expressed as a month, the time limit shall end at the end of the corresponding day of the last month of the time limit; if the month of time limit termination does not have a corresponding day, the time limit shall end on the last day of that month. 4. When a time limit is counted in years, the time limit shall end at the end of the corresponding day and month of the last year of the time limit. 5. If the last day of the time limit falls on a weekend or a public holiday, the time limit shall end at the end of the working day following such holiday. 6. The end of the last day of a time limit shall be at 24 hours of such day.
Bộ luật dân sự@149: Prescriptive periods 1. Prescriptive period means a time limit prescribed by law which, upon the expiry of such time limit, causes legal consequences to the subject under the conditions prescribed by law. The statute of limitations shall comply with the provisions of this Code and relevant laws. 2. The Courts shall apply the provisions on statute of limitations only at the request of one party or the parties provided that such request must be made before the first-instance Courts issue judgments/decisions on the settlement of cases/matter. The beneficiary of the application of a statute of limitations may refuse to apply such statute of limitations, unless such refusal is for the purpose of shirking the performance of obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@150: Types of statute of limitations 1. The prescriptive period for enjoyment of civil rights is the period during which the subject enjoys civil rights upon the expiry of such period. 2. The prescriptive period for discharge of civil obligations is the period during which the person with civil obligations is discharged from performing their civil obligations upon the expiry of such period. 3. Prescriptive period for initiating lawsuits is the time limit during which an entity has the right to initiate lawsuits to request a court to resolve a civil case to protect its infringed legitimate rights and interests; if such time limit expires, the right to initiate lawsuits shall be lost. 4. The prescriptive period for filing a petition for resolution of a civil matter is the time limit during which an entity has the right to file a petition to a court for resolution of a civil matter to protect the legitimate rights and interests of individuals, legal persons, national interests, interests of the people and public interests; if such time limit expires, the right to file a petition shall be lost.
Bộ luật dân sự@151: Calculation of statute of limitations The statute of limitations shall be calculated from the beginning of the first day of the statute of limitations and terminate at the end of the last day of the statute of limitations.
Bộ luật dân sự@152: Effect of prescriptive periods for enjoyment of civil rights or release from civil obligations Where the law provides that the subjects are entitled to enjoy civil rights or to be exempt from civil obligations according to the statute of limitations, only after such statute of limitations expires shall the enjoyment of civil rights or the exemption from civil obligations take effect.
Bộ luật dân sự@153: Continuity of prescriptive periods for enjoyment of civil rights and waiver of civil obligations 1. The prescriptive period for enjoyment of civil rights or release from civil obligations shall be continuous from the beginning to the end. If an event interrupts the prescriptive period, the prescriptive period shall be recalculated from the beginning after the event ends. 2. The prescriptive period for enjoyment of civil rights or release from civil obligations shall be interrupted in one of the following events: a) There is a legally effective decision of a competent authority on the civil rights and obligations under the prescriptive period; b) The civil rights and obligations are under the prescriptive period but are disputed by persons with related rights and obligations and have been settled by a legally effective judgment or decision of the Court. 3. Prescriptive periods shall be continuously calculated in case the enjoyment of civil rights or the discharge of civil obligations is legally transferred to another person.
Bộ luật dân sự@154: Commencement of prescriptive periods for initiating legal action for civil cases and prescriptive periods for requesting resolution of civil matters 1. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit shall be counted from the date the person with the right to request knows or should know that his/her legitimate rights and interests are infringed upon, unless otherwise provided for by law. 2. The prescriptive period for filing a petition for resolution of a civil matter shall commence from the date on which the right to file a petition is exercised, unless otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@155: No statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits shall not apply in the following cases: 1. The request for protection of personal rights not associated with property; 2. The request for protection of ownership rights, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws; 3. Disputes over land use rights under the Land Law; 4. Other cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@156: The time not included in the statute of limitations for initiating a civil case or requesting settlement of a civil matter The time not included in the statute of limitations for initiating a civil case or for requesting the resolution of a civil matter is the period during which one of the following events occurs: 1. Force majeure events or objective obstacles prevent the subjects with the right to initiate lawsuits or to request from initiating lawsuits or making requests within the statute of limitations. Force majeure events are those which occur objectively, are unforeseeable and insurmountable despite all necessary and possible measures have been taken. Objective obstacles mean obstacles caused by objective circumstances to prevent persons with civil rights and obligations from being aware of the infringements of their legitimate rights and interests or from exercising their civil rights and performing their civil obligations; 2. There is no representative in case the person with the right to initiate a lawsuit or request is a minor, has lost his/her civil act capacity, has limited cognition or behavior control or has restricted civil act capacity; 3. Minors, legally incapacitated persons, persons with limited cognition and behavior control, persons with limited legal capacity who have no substitute representatives in the following cases: a) The representative dies if he/she is an individual or ceases to exist if he/she is a juridical person; b/The representative cannot continue to represent for a plausible reason.
Bộ luật dân sự@157: Resumption of the statute of limitations for initiating civil lawsuits 1. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit shall resume in the following cases: a/The obligor has acknowledged part or the whole of its obligations toward the plaintiff; b/The obligor recognizes or partially fulfills its/his/her obligations toward the plaintiff; c/The parties have reconciled themselves. 2. The statute of limitations for initiating a civil lawsuit shall resume on the date following the date of occurrence of the event specified in Clause 1 of this Article. Part Two OWNERSHIP AND OTHER PROPERTY-RELATED RIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@158: Ownership Ownership rights include the owner's right to possess, use and dispose of property in accordance with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@159: Other property-related rights 1. Other property-related rights mean the rights of entities directly holding or controlling property under the ownership of other entities. 2. Other property-related rights include: a) Right to adjoining immovable property; b) Usufruct right; c) Surface rights.
Bộ luật dân sự@160: Principles of establishment and exercise of ownership rights and other property-related rights 1. Ownership rights and other property-related rights shall be established and exercised in cases prescribed by this Code and relevant laws. Other property-related rights shall remain valid in case of transfer of ownership rights, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws. 2. The owner may perform all acts on his/her will with respect to property provided that such acts do not contravene the law, cause damage or affect national interests, public interests, legitimate rights and interests of other persons. 3. The holder of other property-related rights may perform all acts within the scope of rights provided for in this Code and relevant laws without causing damage or affecting national interests, public interests, lawful rights and interests of the property owner or other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@161: Article 13.-Time of establishment of ownership rights and other property-related rights 1. The time of establishment of ownership rights and other property-related rights shall comply with this Code and relevant laws; unless otherwise prescribed by law, the agreement between parties shall prevail; unless otherwise prescribed by law and agreed by parties, the time of establishment of ownership rights and other property-related rights shall be the time when property is transferred. The time when property is transferred is the time when the obligee or his/her lawful representative possesses the property. 2. Where the property has not yet been transferred but yields or profits arise, such yields or profits shall belong to the property-transferring party, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@162: Taking Asset Risk 1. Unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws, owners shall bear risks related to their property. 2. The holder of other property-related rights must bear the property-related risks within the scope of his/her rights, unless otherwise agreed with the property owner or otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@163: Protection of ownership rights and other property-related rights 1. No one may be illegally restricted or deprived of the ownership rights and other property-related rights. 2. In case of extreme necessity for reasons of national defense and security or national interests, state of emergency, natural disaster prevention and combat, the State shall compulsorily purchase or requisition property of organizations and individuals with compensation at market prices.
Bộ luật dân sự@164: Measures to protect ownership rights and other property-related rights 1. The owner or holder of other property-related rights may protect and prevent by themselves any person from infringing upon his/her rights by taking measures not contrary to law. 2. Owners and holders of other property-related rights may request courts or other competent state agencies to compel persons who infringe upon their rights to return their property, stop their acts of illegally obstructing the exercise of their ownership rights or other property-related rights, and request compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@165: Possession with a legal basis 1. Possession with a legal basis means the possession of property in the following cases: a) The owner possesses the property; b) Persons authorized by owners to manage property; c) The person whose right to possession is transferred through civil transactions in accordance with law; d) The person discovering and keeping derelict property, property of which the owner is unidentified, dropped, negligently left, buried, concealed or sunken property must conform to requirements set forth in this Code and other relevant laws; dd) Persons discovering and keeping stray domestic animals, poultry and aquatic animals in accordance with conditions prescribed in this Code and other relevant law provisions; e) Other cases prescribed by law. 2. The possession of property which is not conformable with Clause 1 of this Article is the possession without legal basis.
Bộ luật dân sự@166: Right to Reclaim Property 1. The owner or holder of other property-related rights may claim the property from the person possessing or using the property or the person gaining benefits from the property without a legal basis. 2. An owner has no right to reclaim property from the possession of an entity that has other rights to such property.
Bộ luật dân sự@167: Right to reclaim movable property without registration of ownership from bona fide possessors The owner may reclaim the movable property which is not subject to ownership registration from the bona fide possessor in case the bona fide possessor acquires such movable property through an indemnity-free contract with a person who has no right to dispose of the property; where this contract is a compensation-based contract, the owner may reclaim the movable property if such movable property is stolen, lost or otherwise possessed beyond the owner's will.
Bộ luật dân sự@168: Right to reclaim movable property subject to ownership registration or immovable property from bona fide possessors The owner of a movable property must register the ownership rights or immovable property from the bona fide possessor, except for the case prescribed in Clause 2 Article 133 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@169: The right to request the termination of acts of illegally obstructing the exercise of property ownership rights or other property-related rights When exercising the ownership rights or other property-related rights, the holder may request the person who illegally obstructs the exercise of his/her rights to terminate such act or may request a court or another competent state agency to force such person to terminate his/her violation.
Bộ luật dân sự@170: Right to claim damages Owners and holders of other property-related rights may request persons who infringe upon property ownership rights or other property-related rights to pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@171: Rights and obligations of owners and holders of other property-related rights in case of emergency 1. Emergency circumstance means the circumstance in which a person, in order to avoid a danger which is actually directly threatening the public interests, his/her or another person's legitimate rights and interests, has no other option but to take an act causing a damage smaller than the damage to be prevented. 2. In an emergency, the owner or holder of other property-related rights must not obstruct another person from using his/her property or causing damage to such property to prevent or reduce the danger or damage that may occur. 3. Causing damage in an emergency circumstance is not an act of infringing upon ownership rights or other property-related rights. The owner or holder of other property-related rights to the property which is damaged in an emergency circumstance shall be compensated for the damage in accordance with Article 595 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@172: Environmental protection obligation When exercising the ownership rights or other property-related rights, the owner must comply with the law provisions on environmental protection; if causing environmental pollution, he/she must stop the pollution-causing acts, take measures to overcome the consequences and pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@173: The obligation to respect and ensure social order and safety When exercising the ownership rights and other property-related rights, the owner must respect and ensure social order and safety, and must not abuse his/her rights to cause social disorder and/or safety, harm national interests, public interests, legitimate rights and interests of other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@174: The obligation to respect the construction rules When building a work, the owner or holder of other property-related rights must comply with the construction law, ensure safety, not build the work beyond the height or distance prescribed by the construction law and not infringe upon the lawful rights and interests of the owner or holder of other property-related rights to adjacent and surrounding immoveable property.
Bộ luật dân sự@175: Boundaries between real estate 1. The boundaries between adjacent immovable property shall be determined under the agreement or decision of a competent state agency. The boundaries may also be defined by custom or by boundaries that have existed for 30 years or more without dispute. It is prohibited to encroach upon, occupy or change boundary markers, even in cases where the boundaries are canals, ditches, trenches, ditches or field banks. All subjects shall have the obligation to respect and maintain the common boundaries. 2. Land users may use the space and underground space vertically from the boundaries of land plots in accordance with law and may not affect the use of land by other persons. Land users may plant trees and perform other activities within the land areas under their use rights and according to the determined boundaries; if the roots and branches of trees exceed the boundaries, they shall have to prune the roots, cut and prune the branches of the excess, except otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@176: Boundary markers separating real estate 1. The owner of real estate may only erect boundary markers, fences, plant trees and build partition walls on the land area under his/her use right. 2. The owners of adjoining immoveable properties may agree with each other on the setting up of landmarks, fences, planting trees, building of partition walls on the boundary to serve as boundary markers separating immoveable properties; these boundary markers shall be under the common ownership of such subjects. In case a boundary marker is built by only one party on the boundary and approved by the owner of the adjacent immoveable property, such boundary marker is under common ownership and construction expenses shall be borne by the builder, unless otherwise agreed. If the owner of the adjacent immoveable property disagrees with such request and has a plausible reason, the owner that has erected the marker post, fence, planted trees or built the separating wall shall dismantle it. 3. For boundary markers being common house walls, owners of adjacent immoveable properties may not install windows, ventilating holes or chisel walls to install construction structures, unless otherwise agreed by owners of adjacent immoveable properties. In case a house is built separately but its walls are closely adjoining, its owner may only drill the wall and install construction structures up to the boundary separating his/her walls. For trees being common boundary markers, the parties are obliged to protect them; the yields from trees shall be equally divided, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@177: Ensuring safety in case trees and works are likely to cause damage 1. In case trees or construction works are in danger of collapse onto adjacent and surrounding real estate, the asset owner shall immediately take remedies, fell trees, repair or dismantle these construction works at the request of the owner of adjacent and surrounding real estate or a competent state agency; if he/she fails to voluntarily do so, the owner of adjacent and surrounding real estate may request a competent state agency to allow the felling of trees or dismantlement. The cost of felling trees or dismantlement shall be borne by the owner of trees or construction works. 2. When digging a well or pond or building an underground work, the work owner shall dig or build it at a distance from the boundary marker prescribed by the construction law. When building sanitary works, toxic-contaminant warehouses and other works which may cause environmental pollution, owners of such assets shall build them at a reasonable distance from the boundary markers and at proper positions, ensuring hygiene and safety and not affecting other real estate owners. 3. In case of causing damage to owners of adjacent and surrounding real estate specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, owners of trees or works shall pay compensations.
Bộ luật dân sự@178: Tile the door onto the adjacent property 1. House owners may only display doors and windows facing adjacent houses, opposite houses and common paths under the construction law. 2. The underside of the roof above the door and the underside of the window facing the common path must be at least 2.5 meters away from the ground.
Bộ luật dân sự@179: The Concept of Possession 1. Possession means that an entity directly or indirectly holds or controls property as a holder of property rights. 2. Possession includes possession of owners and possession of non-owners. The possession of a non-owner cannot be the basis for establishing ownership rights, except for the cases specified in Articles 228,229,230,231,232,233 and 236 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@180: Possession in good faith Possession in good faith means possession whereby the possessor has grounds to believe that he/she has the right to the property being possessed.
Bộ luật dân sự@181: Possession without kindness Possession in breach of good faith means possession in which the possessor knows or should know that he/she has no right to the property being possessed.
Bộ luật dân sự@182: Continuous possession 1. Continuous possession means possession that is performed in a period of time without dispute over rights to such property or disputes that have not been settled by a legally effective judgment or decision of a court or another competent state agency, even when the property is assigned to another person for possession. 2. The intermittent possession shall not be considered as a basis for speculating on the status and rights of the possessor as provided for in Article 184 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@183: Possession publicly 1. Possession publicly means possession performed in a transparent manner without concealment; property under possession is used according to its functions and utility and is preserved and preserved by the possessor like his/her own property. 2. The non-public possession shall not be considered as a basis for speculation about the status and rights of the possessor as provided for in Article 184 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@184: Speculations about the status and rights of possessors 1. A possessor shall be presumed to be in good faith. A person who presumes that the possessor is not in good faith shall prove this. 2. In case of a dispute over a property right, the possessor shall be presumed to have that right. The disputing party and the possessor shall prove that the possessor has no right. 3. A person possessing property in good faith, continuously and publicly may enjoy the rights and yields and profits derived from his/her property under the provisions of this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@185: Protection of possession Where a possession is infringed upon by another person, the possessor has the right to request the person committing the infringing act to terminate his/her act, restore the original state, return the property and pay compensation for damage or request a court or another competent state agency to force such person to terminate his/her act, restore the original state, return the property and pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@186: Owner's Right to Own The owner may perform all acts at his/her will to hold and control his/her property but not in contravention of law or social ethics.
Bộ luật dân sự@187: Right to possess of the person authorized by the owner to manage the property 1. Persons authorized by owners to manage property shall possess such property within the scope, by modes and within the time limits determined by owners. 2. The person authorized by the owner to manage the property cannot become the owner of the property as provided for in Article 236 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@188: Right of possession of the person to whom the property is delivered through a civil transaction 1. When an owner delivers property to another person through a civil transaction which does not include the transfer of ownership rights, the person delivered of the property shall possess such property in accordance with the purpose and contents of the transaction. 2. The person who is transferred property shall have the right to use the transferred property and may transfer the right to possess and use such property to another person if so agreed by the owner. 3. The person delivered of property cannot become the owner of the property as provided in Article 236 of this Code. Subsection 2 USE RIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@189: Usage Right to use means the right to exploit the utility of, and enjoy yields and/or profits from, property. The right to enjoyment may be transferred to another person as agreed or as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@190: Owner's Right to Use The owner may use property at his/her own will but must not cause damage or affect the national interests, public interests or the legitimate rights and interests of other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@191: Non-owner's rights to use A non-owner may use the property as agreed with the owner or as prescribed by law. Subsection 3 RIGHT TO DEPARTMENT
Bộ luật dân sự@192: Right to dispose Right to dispose means the right to transfer the ownership of property, renounce the right to own, consume or destroy property.
Bộ luật dân sự@193: Conditions for exercising the right to disposal The disposition of property must be carried out by persons with civil act capacity in accordance with law. Where the law provides for the order and procedures for property disposition, such order and procedures must be complied with.
Bộ luật dân sự@194: The owner's right to disposal The owner has the right to sell, exchange, give, lend, inherit, renounce the ownership, use, destroy or perform other forms of disposal in accordance with the law on property.
Bộ luật dân sự@195: The right of non-owners to dispose Persons other than owners of property may dispose of property only under the authorization of owners or under law.
Bộ luật dân sự@196: Restriction on Decision - Making 1. The right to disposal shall be restricted only in cases prescribed by law. 2. When the property put for sale is an historical-cultural relic as provided for by the Law on Cultural Heritages, the State shall have the priority right to purchase it. Where an individual or juridical person has the right of priority to purchase a particular property as prescribed by law, upon sale of such property, the owner must reserve the right of priority to purchase such property to such subject.
Bộ luật dân sự@197: Property under the ownership of the entire people Land, water resources, mineral resources, resources in sea areas, airspace, other natural resources and property invested and managed by the State are public property under the ownership of the entire people and under the unified management of the State as the owner's representative.
Bộ luật dân sự@198: Exercise of the owner's rights to the people-owned property 1. The State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam shall act as the representative and exercise the owner's rights to property under the all-people ownership. 2. The Government shall uniformly manage and ensure the proper, efficient and economical use of the people-owned property.
Bộ luật dân sự@199: Possession, use and disposition of property under the people's ownership The possession, use and disposal of property under the people's ownership shall be carried out within the scope and in the order prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@200: Exercise of the all-people ownership of property invested in enterprises 1. When property under the people's ownership is invested in an enterprise, the State shall exercise the owner's rights to such property in accordance with regulations of the Law on enterprises, management and use of state capital invested in business operations of enterprises and other relevant regulations of law. 2. Enterprises shall manage and use capital, land, natural resources and other assets invested by the State in accordance with relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@201: Exercise of the all-people ownership of property allocated to state regulatory authorities and people's armed forces 1. When property under the all-people ownership is assigned to state regulatory authorities and people's armed forces, the State shall exercise its right to inspect and supervise management and use of such property. 2. State agencies and people's armed forces units shall manage and use property assigned by the State for proper purposes in accordance with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@202: Exercise of the all-people ownership of property allocated to political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations and socio-professional organizations 1. When property under the people's ownership is assigned to political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations or socio-professional organizations, the State shall exercise the right to inspect and supervise the management and use of such property. 2. Political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations, social organizations and socio-professional organizations shall manage and use property assigned by the State for proper purposes and within the scope of their functions and tasks as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@203: Rights of natural and juridical persons to use and operate public property Individuals and legal entities shall be entitled to use land, exploit aquatic resources, natural resources and other property under the entire people's ownership for the right purposes and with efficiency, and fulfill all obligations towards the State as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@204: Property under the people's ownership which has not been assigned to any natural or juridical person for management With regard to property under the people's ownership which has not been assigned to any natural or juridical person for management, the Government shall organize the protection, investigation, survey and planning for putting such property into operation. Subsection 2 SEPARATE OWNERSHIP
Bộ luật dân sự@205: Private ownership and property under private ownership 1. Private ownership means ownership of an individual or a legal entity. 2. The quantity and value of legal property under private ownership are not restricted.
Bộ luật dân sự@206: Possession, use and disposition of property under private ownership 1. An owner has the right to possess, use and dispose of property under his/her private ownership to meet daily-life, consumption, production and business needs and for other purposes not in contravention of law. 2. The possession, use and disposition of property under private ownership must not cause damage or affect national interests, public interests, lawful rights and interests of other persons. Subsection 3 GENERAL OWNERSHIP
Bộ luật dân sự@207: Common ownership and types of common ownership 1. Multiple ownership means ownership of property by multiple owners. 2. Multiple ownership includes ownership in common and joint ownership.
Bộ luật dân sự@208: Establishment of Common Property Common ownership rights shall be established by agreement, according to the provisions of law or custom.
Bộ luật dân sự@209: Ownership in part 1. Ownership in common is a common ownership whereby the ownership rights of each owner are determined for the common property. 2. Each co-owner has the rights and obligations toward the property under his/her common ownership corresponding to his/her ownership rights, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@210: Joint ownership 1. Multiple ownership means multiple ownership whereby the ownership rights of each owner in common are not determined for common property. Multiple ownership by consolidation includes divisible multiple ownership by consolidation and indivisible multiple ownership by consolidation. 2. The consolidated owners have equal rights and obligations to the assets under common ownership.
Bộ luật dân sự@211: Community ownership 1. Common ownership by a community means ownership by a family line, hamlet, village, mountain village, religious community or other residential community of property formed according to custom, property jointly contributed, donated or presented by members of the community or from other lawful sources for the purpose of satisfying the lawful common interests of the community. 2. Members of a community shall jointly manage, use and dispose of common property as agreed upon or according to customary practices for the common interests of the community but must not violate the prohibitions of law and must not contravene social ethics. 3. Common property of a community is indivisible common property under consolidation.
Bộ luật dân sự@212: Common property among family members 1. Property of cohabiting family members includes property contributed and jointly created by family members and other property whose ownership is established in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws. 2. The possession, use and disposition of common property of family members shall be effected by mode of agreement. In case of disposition of property being real estate, registered movable property or property being the principal source of income of the family, the agreement of all family members being adults with full civil act capacity is required, unless otherwise provided for by law. If there is no agreement, the provisions on multiple ownership in this Code and relevant laws shall apply, except for the case prescribed in Article 213 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@213: Common property of husband and wife 1. Multiple ownership between husband and wife means divisible common ownership by consolidation. 2. Husband and wife jointly create and develop their common property; have equal rights to possess, use and dispose of common property. 3. Husband and wife shall agree or authorize one another to possess, use and dispose of their common property. 4. Common property of husband and wife may be divided under agreement or court decisions. 5. In case husband and wife select the property regime as agreed in accordance with the marriage and family law, their common property shall be subject to this property regime.
Bộ luật dân sự@214: Common ownership in condominiums 1. The common areas, equipment and other assets in condominiums under the Housing Law shall be under the joint ownership by all owners of apartments in such condominiums and remain undivided, unless otherwise provided for by law or agreed upon by all owners. 2. Apartment owners have equal rights and obligations to manage and use the property as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, unless otherwise prescribed by law or agreed. 3. In case the apartment building is destroyed, the rights of the apartment owner shall comply with regulations of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@215: Mixed common ownership 1. Mixed multiple ownership means ownership of property contributed as capital by owners of different economic sectors for production and business with profits. 2. Property formed from capital contributions of owners, lawful profits earned from production and business activities or other lawful sources is mixedly owned property. 3. The possession, use and disposition of property under mixed multiple ownership must comply with Article 209 of this Code and regulations of law related to capital contribution, organization, business and production activities, management, administration, property liability and profit distribution.
Bộ luật dân sự@216: General asset management The co-owners shall manage the common properties on the principle of unanimity, except otherwise agreed upon or provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@217: Use of common property 1. Each co-owner in proportion to his/her share of ownership rights is entitled to exploit the utility of, and enjoy yields and profits from, the common property corresponding to his/her share of ownership rights, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided for by law. 2. The consolidated owners have equal rights to exploit the utility of, and enjoy yields and profits from, common property, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@218: Disposal of common property 1. Each co-owner in common has the right to dispose of his/her share of ownership rights. 2. The disposition of the consolidated common property shall be effected under the agreement of the co-owners or according to the provisions of law. 3. Where a co-owner sells his/her share of the ownership rights, the other co-owners shall have the preemptive right to buy it. If no owner of the multiple ownership property receives a notice of sale and conditions for sale within 03 months, applicable to immoveable property, or 01 month, applicable to movable property, from the day on which other owners of the property receive such notice, such owner may sell the property to another person. The notice must be made in writing and conditions for sale to other owners of the property must be the same as those for sale to non-owners of the property. In case of sale of a portion of ownership rights in violation of the purchase priority right, within 3 months after detecting such violation, the common owners in part of the common owners may request a court to transfer to them the rights and obligations of the purchaser; the party at fault that has caused damage shall pay compensation. 4. Where one of the co-owners of immovable property renounces his/her share of ownership rights or when this person dies without any heir, such share of ownership rights shall belong to the State, except for cases where the share is under the common ownership of the community, it shall belong to the other co-owners. 5. Where one of the owners of movable property renounces his/her share of the ownership rights or when this person dies without any heir, such share of the ownership rights shall belong to the remaining owners. 6. Where all owners renounce their ownership rights with respect to the common property, the establishment of ownership rights shall comply with the provisions of Article 228 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@219: Divide property under common ownership 1. In case of divisible common ownership, each owner may request division of the common property; if the status of the common property must be maintained for a period agreed upon by the owners or provided for by law, each owner may request division of the common property only upon the expiry of such period; when the common property cannot be divided in kind, the owner requesting division may sell his/her share of the ownership rights, unless otherwise agreed upon by the owners. 2. Where a person requests one of the co-owners to fulfill the payment obligation and such co-owner does not have his/her own property or his/her own property is not sufficient for payment, the requester may request the division of the common property and participate in the division of the common property, unless otherwise provided for by law. If the share of ownership rights cannot be divided in kind or the division is opposed by the other co-owners, the obligee has the right to request the obligor to sell his/her share of ownership rights to fulfill the payment obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@220: Termination of Common Property Multiple ownership shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The common properties have been divided; 2. One of the co-owners is entitled to all common property; 3. The common property no longer exists; 4. Other cases as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@221: Bases for establishment of ownership rights Ownership rights shall be established with respect to property in the following cases: 1. Due to labor, lawful production and business activities or creation of intellectual property objects; 2. To transfer the ownership rights as agreed upon or under judgments or decisions of courts or other competent State agencies; 3. Revenue from yield and income; 4. New property is created due to merger, mixing or processing; 5. To be inherited; 6. Possession under the conditions prescribed by law of derelict property, property of which owners are unidentifiable; buried, concealed or sunken property which have been found; property dropped or mislaid by others; stray cattle or poultry, or aquatic animals which have naturally moved; 7. Possession or gain of property as provided for in Article 236 of this Code; 8. Other cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@222: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to property acquired from labor, lawful production and business activities, or creation of subject matters of intellectual property rights Laborers and persons conducting lawful production and business activities have the ownership right over property earned from their labor, lawful production and business activities as from the time such property is obtained. Creative activities conducted by persons have the ownership rights to assets acquired from creative activities under the Intellectual Property Law.
Bộ luật dân sự@223: Establishment of contractual ownership Persons who are delivered property through sale and purchase contracts, gifting, exchange or lending contracts or other ownership transfer contracts as prescribed by law shall have the right to own such property.
Bộ luật dân sự@224: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to yields and profits The owner and user of property shall have the ownership right over the yield and income as agreed upon or provided for by law, as from the time such yield and income are obtained.
Bộ luật dân sự@225: Establishment of ownership rights in case of merger 1. Where property of different owners are merged to form an indivisible object and it is impossible to determine whether the property to be merged is the principal object or an appendage, the newly formed object shall be the property under the common ownership of such owners; if the property to be merged is both principal object and appendage, the newly formed object shall belong to the principal object owner. From the time the new object is formed, the owner of the new property shall have to pay to the appendage owner the value of such appendage, unless otherwise agreed upon. 2. Where a person merges the moveable property of another person with his/her own moveable property, even though he/she knows or should know that such property is not his/her own and does not obtain the consent of the owner of the merged property, the owner of the merged property shall have one of the following rights: a/To request the asset merging person to hand over the new asset to him/her and pay to the merging person the value of his/her asset; b/To request the asset merging person to pay for the value of his/her/its asset share and pay compensation for damage if refusing to receive new assets; c) Other rights as prescribed by law. 3. Where a person merges the moveable property of another person with his/her immovable property, even though he/she knows or should know that such property is not his/her own and without the consent of the owner of the merged property, the owner of the merged property shall have one of the following rights: a/To request the asset merging person to pay for the value of his/her/its asset share and pay compensation for damage; b) Other rights as prescribed by law. 4. Where a person merges his/her movable property with another person's immovable property, the owner of the immovable property shall have the right to request the merging person to demolish the illegally merged property and pay compensation for any loss or damage, or to retain the property and pay the value of the merged property to the merging person, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@226: Establishment of ownership in case of mix 1. Where property of different owners is mixed together to form a new indivisible object, the new object shall be the property under the common ownership of such owners as from the time of mixing. 2. Where a person has mixed the property of another person into his or her own property, although he or she has known or should have known that such property is not his or her own and without the consent of the owner of the property mixed, the owner of the property mixed shall have one of the following rights: a) Request the person who has mixed the property to hand over the new property to him/her and pay the part of the property value of such person to the person who has mixed the property; b/To request the person who has mixed the property to pay the value of his/her property portion and pay compensation for damage if he/she refuses to receive the new property.
Bộ luật dân sự@227: Establishment of ownership rights in case of processing 1. The owner of raw materials processed into a new object is the owner of the newly formed object. 2. A person who uses raw materials owned by another person for processing in good faith shall become the owner of the new property but shall pay the value of raw materials and compensate for damage to the owner of such raw materials. 3. Where the processors are not in good faith, the raw material owners may request the hand-over of new objects; if there are many raw material owners, these persons shall be co-owners of the portions of the newly formed objects, corresponding to the value of raw materials of each person. The owners of raw materials processed in bad faith may request the processors to pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@228: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to derelict property and property of unidentifiable owners 1. ownerless property means property whose owner has renounced the ownership rights to such property. Persons who have discovered or are managing derelict property being movables shall have the right to own such property, except otherwise provided for by law; if the property is immoveable property, it shall belong to the State. 2. Persons who discover properties with unidentifiable owners must notify or hand them over to the nearest commune-level People's Committees or commune-level police offices for public notification to owners for receipt of the properties. The handover must be recorded in writing, clearly stating the full names and addresses of the handers, the recipients, the conditions, quantity and volume of the handed-over property. The commune-level People's Committee or police office which has received the property shall notify the finder of the result of identification of the owner. If after one year from the date of public notification, the owner of a movable property is not identified, the ownership of such movable property shall belong to the finder. If after 5 years from the date of public announcement, no one is identified as owner of property being real estate, such property shall belong to the State; the finder shall be entitled to a reward amount according to law.
Bộ luật dân sự@229: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to buried, concealed or sunken property already discovered 1. The person discovering the buried, concealed or sunken property must immediately notify or return it to the owner; if he/she does not know the owner, he/she must notify or hand over the property to the nearest commune-level People's Committee or communal police or other competent regulatory authority in accordance with laws. 2. If the buried, concealed or sunken property has been found without any or no owner is identified, after deducting costs of search and preservation, ownership rights with respect to such property shall be determined as follows: a/All found property being historical-cultural relics under the Law on Cultural Heritage shall belong to the State; the finder shall be entitled to a reward amount as prescribed by law; b/A found property which is not a historical-cultural relic under the Law on Cultural Heritage and has a value ten times lower than the basic salary prescribed by the State shall belong to the finder; if the found property has a value ten times higher than the basic salary prescribed by the State, the finder shall enjoy a value ten times the basic salary prescribed by the State and 50% of the value of the portion in excess of ten times the basic salary prescribed by the State, while the remaining value belongs to the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@230: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to property dropped or mislaid by others 1. If the persons who discover property dropped or mislaid by other persons know the addresses of the dropped or mislaid persons, they must notify such persons thereof or return the property to such persons; if they do not know the addresses of the dropped or mislaid persons, they must notify such to the nearest commune-level People's Committees or commune-level police offices for public notification to the owners for receipt of the property. The commune-level People's Committees or police offices that have received the properties must notify the hand-overers of the results of the determination of owners. 2. If the owner of a property dropped or mislaid by another person is unidentifiable or the owner does not come to claim the property within 01 year from the date of public notification, the ownership rights to such property shall be determined as follows: a) If the value of a dropped or mislaid property is ten times smaller than the base salary prescribed by the State, the finder may establish ownership over such property in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws; if the value of a property is ten times greater than the base salary prescribed by the State, after deducting preservation expenses, the finder may enjoy a value ten times the base salary prescribed by the State and 50% of the value of the portion in excess of ten times the base salary prescribed by the State, the remaining value of which belongs to the State; b/If the dropped or mislaid property belongs to a historical-cultural relic under the Law on Cultural Heritages, such property shall belong to the State; the finder shall be entitled to a reward according to law.
Bộ luật dân sự@231: Establishment of ownership rights to stray cattle 1. The person who captures stray cattle must keep and keep and immediately report to the commune-level People's Committee where such person resides for public announcement to owner to receive back. After 06 months, from the date of public announcement or after 01 year for the cattle which are left free in accordance with custom, the ownership for the cattle and the number of cattle born during the time of keeping and keeping belongs to the person who captures the cattle. 2. In case the owner is entitled to receive back stray cattle, he/she must pay the remuneration for keeping and other expenses to the person who captured the cattle. During the time of keeping and keeping stray cattle, if the cattle give birth, the person who captured the cattle shall enjoy half of the number of birth cattle or 50% of the value of birth cattle and must pay compensation for damage if intentionally killing the cattle.
Bộ luật dân sự@232: Establishment of ownership rights to lost poultry 1. In case a person's poultry is lost and captured by another person, such person shall publicly notify such to the poultry owner for receipt. If no one comes to receive the stray poultry within one month after the public notification, the ownership over such poultry and the yields therefrom shall belong to the person who captured the stray poultry. 2. In case owners are allowed to receive back stray poultry, they shall pay feeding and keeping remuneration and other expenses to poultry capturers. During the period of feeding and keeping stray poultry, poultry capturers may enjoy the yields produced by the poultry and shall pay compensation for damage caused by intentional death of the poultry.
Bộ luật dân sự@233: Establishment of ownership rights with respect to aquatic animals When a person's aquatic animal moves naturally into another person's field, pond or lake, it shall be under the ownership of the owner of such field, pond or lake. In case the aquatic animal shows specific signs to determine that it is not under his/her ownership, the owner of such field, pond or lake shall publicly notify such to the owner for receipt of the aquatic animal. If no one comes to receive the aquatic animal within one month after the public notification, the ownership of such aquatic animal shall belong to the owner of such field, pond or lake.
Bộ luật dân sự@234: Establishment of ownership by inheritance An heir shall be entitled to establish ownership rights with respect to the inherited property in accordance with the provisions of Part Four of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@235: Establishment of ownership under judgments or decisions of courts or other competent state agencies Ownership rights may be established on the basis of legally effective judgments or decisions of courts or other competent state agencies.
Bộ luật dân sự@236: Establishment of ownership rights by statute of limitations due to possession or gain of property without legal basis A person possessing or gaining benefits from property without a legal basis but in good faith, continuously and publicly, for 10 years, for movable property, or for 30 years, for immovable property, shall become the owner of such property from the time of possession, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws. Subsection 2 TERMINATION OF OWNERSHIP RIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@237: Bases for termination of ownership rights Ownership terminates in the following cases: 1. The owner transfers his/her ownership to another person; 2. The owner renounces his/her ownership; 3. The property has been used or destroyed; 4. Property disposed of to fulfill obligations of the owner; 5. Properties compulsorily purchased; 6. Confiscated property; 7. The ownership over the property has been established for another person as prescribed in this Code; 8. Other cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@238: The owner transfers his ownership rights to another person When an owner transfers his/her ownership rights to another person through a contract on purchase and sale, exchange, donation or lending, or another contract on ownership rights transfer under law or through inheritance, his/her ownership rights to the property shall terminate from the time the ownership rights of the transferee arise.
Bộ luật dân sự@239: Renounce Ownership An owner may terminate his ownership rights with respect to his property by publicly declaring or performing acts showing that he waives his right to possess, use and dispose of such property. For property whose abandonment may cause harm to social order and safety or environmental pollution, the abandonment of ownership rights must comply with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@240: Property that has been established as ownership for others Ownership rights of persons who own property whose owners are unidentified; buried, concealed or sunken property which has been found; dropped or negligently left property; stray cattle or poultry; or naturally moving aquatic animals, which have been established for others under the provisions of Article 228 through 233 hereof, shall terminate. When the ownership rights of the possessor or the person who gains benefits from the property have been established under the provisions of Article 236 of this Code or other relevant laws, the ownership rights of the person having property under possession shall terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@241: Handling of assets to fulfill obligations of owners 1. Ownership rights with respect to an asset shall terminate when such asset is disposed of to fulfill the obligations of the owner under a court decision or another competent state agency, unless otherwise provided by law. 2. The handling of property for the performance of obligations of owners does not apply to property not subject to distraint under law. 3. Ownership rights with respect to property disposed of for the purpose of fulfilling obligations of the owner shall terminate at the time when ownership rights of the recipient of such property arise. 4. The handling of land use rights shall comply with the provisions of land legislation.
Bộ luật dân sự@242: Assets consumed or destroyed When property is consumed or destroyed, the ownership right over such property shall terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@243: Property that was compulsorily purchased In case the State compulsorily purchases property under law, the ownership over property of such owner shall terminate from the time the decision of a competent state agency takes legal effect.
Bộ luật dân sự@244: Confiscated property When property of owners is confiscated and remitted into the state budget due to crimes or administrative violations, the ownership over such property shall terminate from the time the judgments or decisions of courts or other competent state agencies take legal effect.
Bộ luật dân sự@245: Right to adjoining immovable property Right to adjoining immovable property means a right exercised on an immovable property (called right-bearing immovable property) in service of the exploitation of another immovable property under the ownership of another person (called right-bearing immovable property).
Bộ luật dân sự@246: Bases for establishing rights to adjoining immovable property The rights to adjoining immovable property shall be established by natural terrain, according to the provisions of law, agreement or testament.
Bộ luật dân sự@247: Effect of rights to adjoining immovable property The right to adjoining immoveable property shall be valid for all individuals and legal entities and shall be transferred when the immoveable property is transferred, unless otherwise provided for by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@248: Rules for exercising rights to adjoining immovable property The exercise of rights to adjoining immovable property shall be agreed by the parties. In case the parties have no agreement, the following principles shall apply: 1. To ensure the reasonable demands of the exploitation of the right-receiving immovable property in compatibility with the use purposes of both the right-receiving immovable property and the right-bearing immovable property; 2. Not to abuse the right to the right-receiving immovable property; 3. Not to obstruct or cause difficulties to the exercise of rights to the entitled immovable property.
Bộ luật dân sự@249: Change of the exercise of rights to adjoining immovable property Where there is a change in the use or exploitation of the entitled immovable property resulting in a change in the exercise of rights over the entitled immovable property, the owner of the entitled immovable property must notify such in advance to the owner of the entitled immovable property within a reasonable time limit. The owner of the entitled immovable property must create favorable conditions for the owner of the entitled immovable property in accordance with such change.
Bộ luật dân sự@250: Obligations of owners in rainwater drainage The owner of a house or other construction work shall install water drainage systems so that rainwater from the roof of his/her house or construction work must not flow into the adjacent real estate of the owner of the adjacent real estate.
Bộ luật dân sự@251: Obligations of owners in the drainage of wastewater The owner of a house or other construction work shall build a sewer or a drainage ditch to carry wastewater to a designated place, ensuring that the wastewater does not spill over the adjacent real estate or onto public roads or public places.
Bộ luật dân sự@252: Right to water supply and drainage through adjacent immoveable properties In case the water supply and drainage must go through another real estate due to its natural location, the owner of the real estate running through water must reserve an appropriate water supply and drainage channel, which must not obstruct or prevent the flow of water. The user of the water supply and drainage channel must minimize damage to the owner of the immoveable property through which water flows when installing the water supply and drainage channel; if causing damage, he/she must pay compensation therefor. In case natural water flows from a high position to a low position, causing damage to the owner of the immoveable property through which water flows, the user of the water supply and drainage channel shall not have to pay compensation therefor.
Bộ luật dân sự@253: Right to irrigation and drainage in cultivation The person having the right to use cultivation land, when having the need to irrigate and/or drain water, shall be entitled to request the surrounding land users to give him/her an appropriate water channel convenient for irrigation and/or drainage; the requested person shall have to satisfy such request; if the water channel user causes damage to the surrounding land users, he/she shall have to pay compensation therefor.
Bộ luật dân sự@254: Right of passage 1. An owner of an immoveable property surrounded by immoveable property of other owners who has no or insufficient access to public roads may request the surrounding owner of such immoveable property to provide him with a reasonable access to his land. A passage may be opened on an adjoining immoveable property which is deemed most convenient and reasonable, taking into account the specific characteristics of the location, the interests of the encircled immoveable property and the minimum damage caused to the immoveable property where the passage is opened. The owner of the immoveable property entitled to the passage must compensate the owner of the immoveable property entitled to such passage, unless otherwise agreed. 2. The location and length, width and height of a passage shall be agreed upon by the parties, ensuring convenience for travel and causing less troubles to the parties; if there is a dispute over the passage, the parties may request a court or another competent state agency to determine it. 3. Where a real property is divided into different parts for different owners and users, the necessary passage must be reserved for the persons inside as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article without compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@255: Get power lines, communication through other real estate The owner of a real property shall have the right to install a power transmission line or an information and communication line through the property of other owners in a reasonable manner, provided that such transmission line or communication line is safe and convenient for such owners. If any damage is caused, compensation must be paid.
Bộ luật dân sự@256: Termination of easements over adjoining immovable property The right to adjoining immovable property shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The entitled immovable property and the obliged immovable property are under the ownership of one person; 2. The use and exploitation of the real estate no longer gives rise to the demand for entitlement to rights; 3. As agreed upon by the parties; 4. Other cases as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@257: Usufruct right Usufruct right means the right of an owner to exploit the utility of, and enjoy yields and profits from, property under the ownership of another owner for a given period of time.
Bộ luật dân sự@258: Bases for establishment of usufruct right Usufruct right shall be established in accordance with the provisions of law, as agreed upon or under a will.
Bộ luật dân sự@259: Effect of usufruct right Usufruct right shall be established from the time of receipt of the property, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. The established usufruct right shall be valid for all individuals and legal entities, unless otherwise provided for by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@260: Duration of usufruct right 1. The term of usufruct right shall be agreed by the parties or prescribed by law but must not exceed the life of the first usufructary being an individual and the time when the legal entity ceases to exist but must not exceed 30 years if the first usufructary being a legal entity. 2. The usufructary may lease the usufruct right within the time limit prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@261: Rights of usufructary 1. To exploit, use or collect by themselves or allow others to exploit, use or collect yields and profits from subjects entitled to usufruct right. 2. Request the owner to fulfill the obligation to repair the property as prescribed in Clause 4 Article 263 of this Code; if the owner performs the obligation on behalf of the owner, he/she may request the owner to reimburse the costs. 3. Lease the usufruct right to the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@262: Obligations of usufructary 1. Receive property in its current conditions and register it if required by law. 2. Operate the property in conformity with its uses and purposes. 3. Preserve and preserve property as their own. 4. Maintain and repair property on a periodic basis to ensure normal use; restore the condition of property and remedy bad consequences caused to property due to failure to properly perform their obligations in conformity with technical requirements or property preservation practices. 5. Return the property to the owner upon expiry of the time limit for enjoyment of the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@263: Rights and obligations of property owners 1. Dispose of property without changing the usufruct right established. 2. To request courts to deprive usufruct right of usufruct right in case usufructary seriously breaches his/her obligations. 3. Not to obstruct or commit other acts which cause difficulties to or infringe upon the legitimate rights and interests of usufructary. 4. To fulfill the obligation to repair the property in order to ensure that the property does not suffer from any significant decline, thus making it unusable or losing its full utility and value.
Bộ luật dân sự@264: The right to enjoy yields and profits 1. The usufructary has the ownership right over the yields and/or profits earned from the property being the subject matter of the usufruct right during the time such right takes effect. 2. Where the usufruct right terminates while the yield or income is not yet due, upon the maturity of the yield or income, the usufructary shall enjoy the value of the yield or income earned corresponding to the time when he/she is entitled to the usufruct right.
Bộ luật dân sự@265: Termination of usufruct right Usufruct right shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The usufruct right term has expired; 2. As agreed upon by the parties; 3. The usufructary becomes the owner of the property being subject to the usufruct right; 4. The usufructary renounces or fails to exercise the usufruct right within the time limit prescribed by law; 5. The property being the subject of usufruct right no longer exists; 6. The case is decided by the court; 7. Other grounds as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@266: Return of property upon termination of usufruct right Unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law, property being the subject matter of usufruct right must be returned to the owner upon termination of usufruct right.
Bộ luật dân sự@267: Surface rights Surface rights mean the rights of an entity to the ground, water surface, space above the ground, water surface and underground which the land use right belongs to another entity.
Bộ luật dân sự@268: Grounds for establishing surface rights Surface rights shall be established in accordance with law, agreement or will.
Bộ luật dân sự@269: Effect of surface rights Surface rights shall take effect from the time when the holder of land use rights transfers land, water surface, space on land, water surface and ground to the holder of surface rights, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. Surface rights shall be valid for all individuals and legal entities, unless otherwise provided by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@270: Term of surface rights 1. The term of surface rights shall be determined in accordance with law, agreement or will but must not exceed the term of land use rights. 2. In case an agreement or will does not specify the term of surface rights, each party may terminate this right at any time but shall notify in writing the other party thereof at least 6 months in advance.
Bộ luật dân sự@271: Contents of surface rights 1. The holder of surface rights has the right to exploit and use the ground, water surface, space on the ground, water surface and underground which is under the land use right of another person for construction, planting or cultivation purposes provided that such exploitation and use is not in contravention of regulations of this Code, laws on land, construction, planning, natural resources and minerals and other relevant regulations of law. 2. Surface rights holders have the ownership rights to property created under Clause 1 of this Article. 3. In case surface rights are transferred in part or in full, transferees may inherit surface rights under conditions and within the scope corresponding to the transferred surface rights.
Bộ luật dân sự@272: Termination of surface rights Surface rights terminate in the following cases: 1. The time limit for enjoying surface rights has expired; 2. The holder of surface rights and the holder of land use rights are the same; 3. The holder of surface rights waives his/her rights; 4. The land use right with surface rights is recovered under the Land Law; 5. As agreed by the parties or as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@273: Handling of property upon termination of surface rights 1. When surface rights terminate, the holder of surface rights shall return the ground, water surface, space on the ground, water surface and ground to the holder of land use rights as agreed or prescribed by law. 2. The holder of surface rights shall dispose of the property under his/her ownership before the termination of the surface rights, unless otherwise agreed. In case the holder of surface rights does not handle the property before the surface rights terminate, the ownership of such property shall belong to the holder of land use rights from the time the surface rights terminate, unless the holder of land use rights does not receive such property. In case the holder of land use rights does not receive the property but has to handle the property, the holder of surface rights shall pay the property handling expenses. Part Three OBLIGATIONS AND CONTRACTS
Bộ luật dân sự@274: Obligations Obligation means a matter whereby one or more than one subject (hereinafter referred to as obligor) must transfer an object, transfer a right, pay a sum of money or valuable paper, perform or refrain from performing a certain act in the interests of one or more than one other subject (hereinafter referred to as obligee).
Bộ luật dân sự@275: Bases for the occurrence of obligations The obligation arises from the following grounds: 1. Contract; 2. Unilateral legal acts; 3. Performing acts without authorization; 4. Unlawful possession or use of property or acquisition of property benefits; 5. Causing damage due to illegal acts; 6. Other grounds as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@276: Subject matter of the obligation 1. Subject matter of an obligation is property or work which must be performed or must not be performed. 2. The subject matter of an obligation must be determined.
Bộ luật dân sự@277: Place of performance of obligations 1. The place of performance of an obligation shall be agreed upon by the parties. 2. Where there is no agreement, the place of performance of the obligation shall be determined as follows: a) The place where the immovable property is located, if the object of the obligation is immovable property; b) The place of residence or head office of the obligee, if the subject matter of the obligation is not real property. Where the obligee changes his place of residence or office, he shall notify the obligor and shall bear the costs increased by such change, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@278: Time limit for performance of obligations 1. The time limit for performance of an obligation shall be agreed upon by the parties in accordance with law or a decision of a competent agency. 2. The obligor must perform the obligation on time, unless otherwise provided by this Code or relevant laws. Where the obligor has performed the obligation ahead of time and the obligee has accepted the performance of the obligation, the obligation shall be deemed to have been fulfilled on time. 3. Where the time limit for performance of an obligation as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article cannot be determined, each party may perform the obligation or request the performance of the obligation at any time but must notify the other party thereof in advance.
Bộ luật dân sự@279: Performance of obligations to deliver objects 1. The obligor shall preserve the object until the delivery. 2. Where the to be-delivered object is a distinctive object, the obligor shall have to deliver it in the right quantity and in the right condition as committed; if it is of the same type, it must be delivered in the right quantity and with the agreed quality; if there is no agreement on the quality, it must be delivered with an average quality; if it is a synchronous object, it must be delivered in complete sets. 3. The obligor shall bear all costs of delivery of the object, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@280: Performance of the obligation to pay 1. The obligation to pay money must be fulfilled fully, on time, at the agreed place and by the agreed mode. 2. The obligation to pay money shall include the interest on the principal, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@281: Obligation to perform or not to perform an act 1. Obligation to perform an act means an obligation whereby an obligor must perform that act properly. 2. Obligation not to perform an act means an obligation whereby an obligor is not entitled to perform that act.
Bộ luật dân sự@282: Performance of obligations periodically Obligations shall be performed periodically as agreed upon, as provided for by law or under decisions of competent bodies. The late performance of a civil obligation in each period shall also be considered late performance of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@283: Performance of obligations through a third party With the consent of the obligee, the obligor may authorize a third person to perform the obligation on his behalf but shall be liable to the obligee if the third person fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@284: Conditional performance of obligations 1. Where the parties have agreed or the law provides for conditions for the performance of an obligation, the obligor must perform the obligation when such conditions arise. 2. If the conditions do not occur or occur due to the influence of one party, the provisions of Clause 2, Article 120 of this Code shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@285: Performance of obligations with optional objects 1. An obligation with an optional object means an obligation in which the object is one of many different property or jobs and the obligor may select at his/her own will, unless it is agreed upon or provided by law that the right to select is reserved to the obligee. 2. The obligor must notify the obligee of the property or work selected for the performance of the obligation. Where the obligee has determined the time limit for performance of the selected obligation, the obligor must fulfill it on time. 3. Where there is only one property or job left, the obligor must deliver that property or perform that job.
Bộ luật dân sự@286: Performance of surrogate obligations An alternative obligation means an obligation whereby the obligor fails to perform the original obligation, and may perform another obligation which has been accepted by the obligee in replacement of that obligation.
