Bộ luật dân sự@287: Performance of separate obligations Where several persons perform an obligation, but each person has a certain and separate part of the obligation, each person shall only have to perform his/her part of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@288: Performance of joint obligations 1. Joint obligation means an obligation to be performed by many persons and the obligee may request any of the obligors to perform the whole obligation. 2. Where a person has fulfilled his/her entire obligation, he/she has the right to request other persons with joint obligations to fulfill their part of the joint obligation toward him/her. 3. Where the obligee has appointed one of the joint obligors to perform the entire obligation but later waives such person, the other obligors shall also be exempt from the obligation. 4. Where the obligee only waives the performance of an obligation to one of the joint obligors from performing his/her part of the obligation, the other joint obligors must perform their part of the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@289: Performance of obligations towards multiple joint obligees 1. An obligation to multiple joint obligees is an obligation whereby each of the joint obligees may request the obligor to perform the entire obligation. 2. An obligor may perform its obligations to any of the joint obligees. 3. Where one of the joint obligees waives the obligor from performing the part of the obligation towards him/her, the obligor shall still perform the remaining part of the obligation towards other joint obligees.
Bộ luật dân sự@290: Performance of part-divisible obligations 1. Divisible obligation means an obligation in which the subject matter of the obligation can be divided into several parts for performance. 2. The obligor may perform part of the obligation, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@291: Performance of indivisible obligations by parts 1. Indivisible obligation means an obligation whose subject matter must be performed at the same time. 2. Where more than one person must perform an indivisible obligation, they must perform the obligation at the same time.
Bộ luật dân sự@292: Security for performance of obligations Security measures for the performance of obligations include: 1. Pledge of property; 2. Mortgage of assets; 3. Deposit; 4. Security collateral; 5. Escrow; 6. Title retention; 7. Guarantee; 8. Trust; 9. Lien on property.
Bộ luật dân sự@293: Scope of secured obligation 1. An obligation may be partly or wholly secured as agreed upon or provided for by law; if there is no agreement and the law does not prescribe the scope of security, the obligation shall be regarded as being fully secured, including the obligation to pay interests, fines and damages. 2. Secured obligations may be current obligations, future obligations or conditional obligations. 3. In case of security for future obligations, the obligations formed during the security period shall be the secured obligations, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@294: Security for future obligations 1. In case of security for future obligations, the parties may reach specific agreement on the scope of secured obligations and time limit for performance of secured obligations, unless otherwise provided for by law. 2. When a future obligation is formed, the parties are not required to re-establish security for such obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@295: Security assets 1. Collateral must be under the ownership of the securer, except for cases of property seizure or title retention. 2. Collateral may be described generally but must be identifiable. 3. Security assets may be existing assets or assets to be formed in the future. 4. The value of the security property may be greater than, equal to or smaller than the value of the secured obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@296: An asset used to secure the performance of many obligations 1. An asset may be used to secure the performance of many obligations if its value at the time of establishment of the security transaction is larger than the total value of the secured obligations, except otherwise agreed upon or provided for by law. 2. In case an asset is used to secure the performance of many obligations, the securing party shall notify the subsequent secured party of the fact that the security asset is being used to secure the performance of other obligations. Each security must be made in writing. 3. Where an asset must be disposed of in order to perform a due obligation, the other obligations, though not yet due, shall all be considered due and all co-securees may participate in the disposal of the asset. The securee that has notified the asset disposal shall have to dispose of the asset, unless otherwise agreed upon by the co-securees. Where the parties wish to continue performing the obligation not yet due, they may agree on the use of other property by the securer to secure the performance of the obligation not yet due.
Bộ luật dân sự@297: Antagonistic effect on third party 1. A security shall become effective against a third party from the time of registration of security or the secured party holds or appropriates the security asset. 2. When a security takes effect against a third party, the secured party may recourse the security property and have the right to payment under Article 308 of this Code and relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@298: Security interest registration 1. Security measures shall be registered as agreed upon or provided for by law. The registration is the condition for a security transaction to take effect only in cases prescribed by law. 2. If registered, the security shall take effect against a third party from the time of registration. 3. Registration of security interests shall comply with regulations of law on registration of security interests.
Bộ luật dân sự@299: Cases of disposal of security assets 1. The secured party fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation when it is due to perform the secured obligation. 2. The obligor must perform the secured obligation ahead of time due to breach of obligations as agreed upon or provided for by law. 3. Other cases as agreed upon by the parties or provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@300: Notification of collateral settlement 1. Before disposing of security assets, the securee shall have to notify in writing within a reasonable time limit the disposal of security assets to the securer and other co-securees. For security assets in danger of damage, which may lead to their devaluation or loss of their entire value, the securees may immediately handle them and at the same time notify the securers and other securees of the handling thereof. 2. In case the secured party fails to notify the disposal of security assets under Clause 1 of this Article, thus causing damage, it shall pay compensation to the securing party and other co-securees.
Bộ luật dân sự@301: - To hand over the security property for handling The holder of collateral is obliged to hand over the collateral to the secured party for disposal in one of the cases prescribed in Article 299 of this Code. If the lienor fails to transfer the property, the secured party may request a court to settle the case, unless otherwise provided by relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@302: Right to receive back the security asset Before the time of disposal of security assets, if the securer has fulfilled his/her/its obligations toward the securee and paid expenses arising from the late performance of obligations, he/she may take back such assets, unless otherwise provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@303: Method of handling pledged or mortgaged assets 1. The securer and the securee may agree on one of the following modes of handling the pledged or mortgaged property: a/Auction of property; b/The secured party sells the asset by itself; c/The securee takes the very property as replacement for the performance of the securer's obligation; d) Other methods. 2. In case there is no agreement on the method of disposal of security assets under Clause 1 of this Article, these assets shall be auctioned, unless otherwise provided for by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@304: Sale of pledged or mortgaged assets 1. The auction of pledged or mortgaged property complies with the law on property auction. 2. The pledgee's or mortgagee's self-sale of the pledged or mortgaged asset shall comply with the provisions on asset sale in this Code and the following provisions: a) The payment of the proceeds from the disposal of property shall comply with the provisions of Article 307 of this Code; b/After the results of the sale of property are available, the property owner and the party with the property-handling right shall carry out procedures prescribed by law to transfer the property ownership to the property purchaser.
Bộ luật dân sự@305: - To receive the very security property as replacement for the performance of the securer's obligations. 1. The secured party may receive the very security asset as replacement for the performance of the securing party's obligation if so agreed upon upon the establishment of the secured transaction. 2. If there is no agreement as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, the secured party may only receive the collateral as replacement for the performance of the obligation with the securing party's written consent. 3. Where the value of the collateral is greater than the value of the secured obligation, the secured party shall pay the difference to the securing party; where the value of the collateral is less than the value of the secured obligation, the unpaid obligation portion shall become unsecured obligation. 4. The securer shall have to carry out procedures for transferring the property ownership to the securee according to law provisions.
Bộ luật dân sự@306: Valuation of collateral 1. The securer and the securee may reach agreement on the security asset price or valuate it through an asset valuation organization when handling the security asset. If there is no agreement, the property shall be valued through a property valuation organization. 2. The valuation of security assets must ensure objectivity and conformity with market prices. 3. The valuation organization shall have to pay compensation for damage if it commits illegal acts, thus causing damage to the securer and/or the securee in the course of valuating the security property.
Bộ luật dân sự@307: - To pay the money amount earned from the handling of pledged or mortgaged properties 1. The proceeds from the disposal of pledged or mortgaged property after paying the costs of preservation, seizure and disposal of the pledged or mortgaged property shall be paid in the order of priority provided for in Article 308 of this Code. 2. In cases where the money amount earned from the disposal of pledged or mortgaged properties after the payment of expenses for preservation, custody and disposal of pledged or mortgaged properties is larger than the value of the secured obligations, the difference amount must be paid to the securers. 3. In case the sum of money earned from the disposal of the pledged or mortgaged asset after paying expenses for preservation, seizure and disposal of the pledged or mortgaged asset is smaller than the value of the secured obligation, the unpaid obligation portion shall be regarded as unsecured obligation, unless the parties agree to add security assets. The secured party may request the secured party to perform the unpaid obligation portion.
Bộ luật dân sự@308: Order of priority for payment between the co-securees 1. When an asset is used to secure the performance of many obligations, the order of priority for payment between the co-securees shall be determined as follows: a) If all security interests have the effect against a third party, the order of payment shall be determined according to the order of establishment of the effect against the third party; b) In case where a security takes effect against a third party and a security does not, the obligation to take such security shall be paid in advance; c) If all security interests do not generate any effect against a third party, the order of payment shall be determined according to the order of security interests. 2. The order of priority for payment specified in Clause 1 of this Article may change if the co-securees agree to change the order of priority for payment to each other. The party substituting the right to priority payment may only be given priority for payment within the scope of security of the party which it has substituted. Subsection 2 PLEDGE OF PROPERTY
Bộ luật dân sự@309: Pledged Properties Pledge of property means the hand-over of property under one party's ownership to another party (hereinafter referred to as pledgee) to secure the performance of obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@310: Effect of asset pledge 1. A property pledge agreement shall take effect from the date of conclusion, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise prescribed by law. 2. Pledge of property shall take effect against a third party from the time the pledgee holds the pledged property. In case immovable property is subject to pledge under law, the pledge of immovable property is effective against a third party from the time of registration.
Bộ luật dân sự@311: Obligations of the pledgor 1. To hand over the pledged properties to the pledgee strictly according to agreement. 2. Notify the pledgee of the third party's rights to the pledged property, if any; in case of failure to notify such, the pledgee may cancel the property pledge contract and claim damages or maintain the contract and accept the third party's rights to the pledged property. 3. To pay the pledgee reasonable expenses for the preservation of the pledged property, except otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@312: Rights of the pledgor 1. Require the pledgee to terminate the use of the pledged property in the case prescribed in Clause 3, Article 314 of this Code if the pledged property is in danger of losing its value or reducing its value due to its use. 2. To request the pledgee to return the pledged property and relevant papers, if any, when the obligation secured by pledge terminates. 3. Require the pledgee to compensate for any damage to the pledged property. 4. Sell, replace, exchange or give the pledged property if the pledgee so agrees or as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@313: Obligations of the pledgee 1. To preserve and preserve the pledged properties; if losing, misplaced or damaging them, to pay compensation therefor to the pledgor. 2. Not to sell, exchange, donate or use the pledged properties to secure the performance of other obligations. 3. Not to lease, lend, exploit the utility of, or enjoy yields or profits from, the pledged property, unless otherwise agreed. 4. To return the pledged properties and relevant papers, if any, when the obligations secured by pledge terminate or are replaced with other security measures.
Bộ luật dân sự@314: Rights of the pledgee 1. To request the persons who are illegally possessing or using the pledged properties to return such properties. 2. To dispose of the pledged properties by the mode agreed upon or according to the provisions of law. 3. To lease, lend, exploit the utility of the pledged properties and enjoy yields and/or profits therefrom, if so agreed upon. 4. To be paid reasonable expenses for the preservation of the pledged properties when returning the properties to the pledgors.
Bộ luật dân sự@315: Termination of asset pledge Pledge of property shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The obligation secured by pledge terminates; 2. The pledge of property is cancelled or replaced with other security measures; 3. The pledged property has been disposed of; 4. As agreed upon by the parties.
Bộ luật dân sự@316: Returning the pledged property When the pledge of property terminates under the provisions of Clauses 1 and 2, Article 315 of this Code or as agreed upon by the parties, the pledged property and papers related thereto shall be returned to the pledgor. Yields and profits earned from the pledged property shall also be returned to the pledgor, unless otherwise agreed. Subsection 3 MORTGAGE OF PROPERTY
Bộ luật dân sự@317: Asset mortgage 1. Mortgage of property means a party (hereinafter referred to as mortgagor) uses property under its ownership to secure the performance of obligations and does not hand over the property to another party (hereinafter referred to as mortgagee). 2. Mortgaged property shall be kept by the mortgagor. The parties may agree to assign a third party to keep the mortgaged property.
Bộ luật dân sự@318: Mortgaged property 1. In case of mortgage of the entire real estate or movable property with auxiliary objects, such auxiliary objects shall also belong to the mortgaged property, unless otherwise agreed. 2. In case of mortgage of part of immoveable property or movable property with auxiliary objects, the auxiliary objects attached to such property shall belong to the mortgaged property, unless otherwise agreed upon. 3. In case of mortgage of land use rights with land-attached assets under the ownership of the mortgagor, such assets also belong to the mortgaged assets, unless otherwise agreed. 4. In case mortgaged assets are insured, the mortgagee shall notify the insurer of the insured assets being mortgaged. The insurer shall pay insurance money directly to the mortgagee upon occurrence of an insured event. In cases where the mortgagee fails to notify the insurer of the fact that the insured property is being mortgaged, the insurer shall pay the insurance money according to the insurance contract and the mortgagor shall have to pay the mortgagee.
Bộ luật dân sự@319: Effectiveness of asset mortgage 1. A property mortgage contract shall take effect from the time of its conclusion, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. 2. The mortgage of property shall take effect against a third party from the time of registration.
Bộ luật dân sự@320: Obligations of the mortgagor 1. Deliver documents related to the mortgaged property as agreed by the parties, unless otherwise provided by law. 2. To preserve and preserve the mortgaged property. 3. To apply necessary remedies, including the suspension of the exploitation of the mortgaged property if, due to such exploitation, the mortgaged property is in danger of losing its value or reducing its value. 4. When mortgaged property is damaged, the mortgagor shall, within a reasonable period of time, repair or replace it with another property of equivalent value, unless otherwise agreed upon. 5. To supply information on the actual state of mortgaged assets to the mortgagee. 6. Deliver the mortgaged property to the mortgagee for disposal in one of the cases of disposal of collateral prescribed in Article 299 of this Code. 7. Notify the mortgagee of the rights of a third party to the mortgaged asset, if any. In case of failure to notify such, the mortgagee may cancel the asset mortgage contract and claim damages or maintain the contract and accept the rights of a third party to the mortgaged asset. 8. Not to sell, replace, exchange or donate mortgaged property, except for cases specified in Clauses 4 and 5, Article 321 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@321: Rights of the mortgagor 1. To exploit the utility of, and enjoy yields and/or profits from, the mortgaged properties, except where the yields and/or profits are also the mortgaged properties as agreed upon. 2. Investment in order to increase the value of mortgaged assets. 3. Retrieve the mortgaged property held by a third party and documents related to the mortgaged property held by the mortgagee when the obligation secured by the mortgage terminates or is replaced by another security measure. 4. To sell, replace or exchange mortgaged assets, if such assets are goods circulated in the production and business process. In this case, to request the purchaser to pay money, the proceeds from the sale of mortgaged assets, the assets formed from the proceeds, the replaced or exchanged assets become mortgaged assets. If the mortgaged asset is a warehouse, the mortgagor may replace the goods in the warehouse but shall ensure that the value of goods in the warehouse is as agreed. 5. Sell, exchange or give mortgaged property which is not circulated in the production and business process with the consent of the mortgagee or in accordance with law. 6. Lease out or lend the mortgaged property but must notify the lessee or borrower of the fact that the leased or lent property is being mortgaged and must notify the mortgagee thereof.
Bộ luật dân sự@322: Obligations of the mortgagee 1. Return documents to the mortgagor after the mortgage termination, in case the parties agree that the mortgagee keeps documents related to mortgaged assets. 2. To carry out procedures for disposal of mortgaged assets in accordance with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@323: Rights of mortgagee 1. Directly examine and inspect mortgaged assets without obstructing or causing difficulties to the formation, use and exploitation of mortgaged assets. 2. Request the mortgagor to provide information on the actual state of mortgaged assets. 3. Require the mortgagor to apply necessary measures to preserve the property and its value in case there is a risk of devaluation or devaluation of the property due to its operation and use. 4. To register the mortgage according to law provisions. 5. Require the mortgagor or the third party holding the mortgaged property to hand over such property to him/her for disposal when the mortgagor fails to perform or improperly performs his/her obligations. 6. Keep documents related to the mortgaged property as agreed by the parties, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 7. To dispose of mortgaged property in the cases specified in Article 299 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@324: Rights and obligations of the third party holding the collateral 1. The third party holding the mortgaged property shall have the following rights : a) Exploit the mortgaged property, if so agreed; b) Receive remuneration and expenses for preservation and maintenance of the mortgaged property, unless otherwise agreed. 2. The third party holding the mortgaged property shall have the following obligations : a/To preserve and preserve the mortgaged property; to pay compensation for any loss of the mortgaged property, loss of or deterioration of the mortgaged property; b) Cease the exploitation of the mortgaged property if the continued exploitation threatens to degrade or degrade the mortgaged property; c/To hand over the mortgaged properties to the mortgagee or the mortgagor as agreed upon or prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@325: Mortgage of land use rights without mortgage of land-attached assets 1. In case of mortgage of land use rights without mortgage of land-attached assets and land users are concurrently owners of land-attached assets, the to-be-handled assets include also land-attached assets, unless otherwise agreed. 2. In case of mortgage of land use rights in which the land user is not concurrently the owner of land-attached assets, when handling land use rights, the owner of land-attached assets may continue using the land within the scope of his/her rights and obligations; the rights and obligations of the mortgagor in the relationship with the owner of land-attached assets shall be transferred to the transferee of land use rights, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@326: Mortgage of property on land without mortgage of land use rights 1. In case only land-attached assets are mortgaged without mortgaging land use rights and the owner of land-attached assets is concurrently the land user, the to-be-handled assets include land use rights, unless otherwise agreed. 2. In case only land-attached assets are mortgaged without mortgaging land use rights and the owner of land-attached assets is not concurrently the land user, when disposing of land-attached assets, the transferee of ownership of land-attached assets may continue using the land within the scope of rights and obligations of the owner of transferred land-attached assets, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@327: Termination of asset mortgage The mortgage of property shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The obligation secured by mortgage terminates; 2. The property mortgage is cancelled or replaced with other security measures; 3. The mortgaged property has been disposed of; 4. As agreed upon by the parties. Subsection 4 DEPOSIT, SECURITY, DEPOSIT
Bộ luật dân sự@328: Deposit 1. Deposit means the delivery by one party (hereinafter referred to as the depositor) to the other party (hereinafter referred to as the depositor) of a sum of money or precious metals, gemstones or other valuable objects (hereinafter referred to as the deposited property) within a given time limit to secure the entry into or performance of a contract. 2. Where a contract is entered into or performed, the deposited property shall be returned to the depositor or deducted for the performance of the payment obligation; if the depositor refuses to enter into or perform the contract, the deposited property shall belong to the deposit receiver; if the deposit receiver refuses to enter into or perform the contract, it shall have to return to the depositor the deposited property and an amount equal to the value of the deposited property, except otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@329: Security collateral 1. Security collateral means a sum of money or precious metals, gemstones or other valuable objects (below collectively referred to as collateral) given by the lessee to the lessor within a specified time limit to secure the return of the leased asset. 2. Where the leased property is returned, the lessee shall be entitled to receive back the collateral after the rental is paid; if the lessee fails to return the leased property, the lessor shall have the right to reclaim the leased property; if the leased property is no longer available for return, the collateral shall belong to the lessor.
Bộ luật dân sự@330: Deposit 1. Escrow depositing means the obligor deposits a sum of money, precious metals, gems or valuable papers into a frozen account at a credit institution to secure the performance of the obligation. 2. Where the obligor fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation, the obligee shall be entitled to the credit institution where the collateral is made to make payment and compensation for damage caused by the obligor, after deducting the service fee. 3. Procedures for deposit and payment comply with law. Subsection 5 PRESERVATION OF OWNERSHIP RIGHTS
Bộ luật dân sự@331: Title retention 1. In a sale contract, the ownership of property may be reserved by the seller until the payment obligation is fully performed. 2. The title retention must be made in a separate document or stated in the sale contract. 3. The title retention shall take effect against a third party from the time of registration.
Bộ luật dân sự@332: Right to Reclaim Property Where the purchaser fails to fulfill the payment obligation to the seller as agreed, the seller has the right to reclaim the property. The seller shall return to the purchaser the amount paid by the purchaser after deducting the depreciation value of the property due to its use. Where the purchaser loses or damages the property, the seller has the right to claim compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@333: Rights and obligations of the purchaser 1. To use property and enjoy yields and profits therefrom within the effective duration of title retention. 2. To bear risks related to the property during the period of title retention, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@334: Termination of title retention Title retention terminates in the following cases: 1. The seller's payment obligation has been fulfilled; 2. The seller receives back the property with title retention; 3. As agreed upon by the parties. Subsection 6 GUARANTEE
Bộ luật dân sự@335: Guarantees 1. Guarantee means a commitment made by a third party (hereinafter referred to as the guarantor) to the obligee (hereinafter referred to as the guarantee) to perform the obligation on behalf of the obligor (hereinafter referred to as the guaranteed party) if the guaranteed party fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation when the time limit for performance of the obligation expires. 2. The parties may agree that the guarantor shall only perform the obligation on behalf of the guaranteed in case the guaranteed is incapable of performing the guarantee obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@336: Scope of guarantee 1. The guarantor may undertake to guarantee part or the whole of the obligation to the guaranteed. 2. Guarantee obligations include interests on principal, fines, damages and interests on late payment amounts, unless otherwise agreed upon. 3. The parties may agree to use security with property to secure the performance of guarantee obligations. 4. Where the guaranteed obligation is an obligation arising in the future, the scope of guarantee shall not include the obligation arising after the guarantor dies or the guarantee legal entity ceases to exist.
Bộ luật dân sự@337: Remuneration The guarantor shall enjoy remuneration if so agreed upon by the guarantor and the guaranteed.
Bộ luật dân sự@338: Multiple bail bonds Where several persons jointly guarantee an obligation, they must jointly perform the guarantee, except where it is agreed or provided for by law that the guarantee shall be made in independent parts; the obligee may request any of the joint guarantors to perform the entire obligation. Where one of the joint guarantors has performed the entire obligation on behalf of the guaranteed party, he/she shall be entitled to request the other guarantors to perform their part of the obligation towards him/her.
Bộ luật dân sự@339: Relationship between the guarantor and the guarantee 1. Where the guaranteed fails to perform or improperly performs its obligations, the guarantee has the right to request the guarantor to perform the guarantee obligation, except for the case where the parties have agreed that the guarantor shall only perform the obligation on behalf of the guaranteed in case the guaranteed is unable to perform its obligations. 2. The obligee shall not be allowed to request the guarantor to perform obligations on behalf of the obligor before the due date of such obligations. 3. The guarantor shall not have to perform the guarantee obligation in cases where the guarantee may clear the obligation with the guaranteed.
Bộ luật dân sự@340: The guarantor's right to request The guarantor may request the guaranteed to perform its/his/her obligations within the scope of the performed guarantee obligation, unless otherwise agreed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@341: - Exemption from the performance of the guaranty obligation. 1. In cases where the guarantor has to perform the guaranty obligation while the guarantee exempts the guarantor from performing the obligation, the guaranteed shall not have to perform the obligation toward the guarantee, except otherwise agreed upon or provided for by law. 2. Where only one of the joint guarantors is exempt from performing his/her guaranty obligation, the other guarantors shall still have to perform their guaranty obligations. 3. Where one of the joint obligees exempts the guarantor from performing the obligation to the joint obligee, the guarantor shall still perform the remaining obligation to the other joint obligees.
Bộ luật dân sự@342: Civil liability of the guarantor 1. Where the guaranteed fails to perform or improperly performs its obligation, the guarantor shall have to perform such obligation. 2. Where the guarantor fails to perform the guarantee obligation, the guarantee shall have the right to request the guarantor to pay the value of the violating obligation and compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@343: Termination of guarantee The guarantee shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The guaranteed obligation terminates; 2. The guarantee is cancelled or replaced with another security measure; 3. The guarantor has fulfilled the guarantee obligation; 4. As agreed upon by the parties. Subsection 7 THE CREDIT
Bộ luật dân sự@344: Guarantee by trust of socio - political organizations The socio-political organizations at the grassroots level may provide trust security for poor individuals and households to borrow a sum of money at credit institutions for production, business and consumption according to the provisions of law.
Bộ luật dân sự@345: Form and content of the trust The lending secured by trust must be made in writing with certification by the socio-political organization that has secured the trust on the conditions and circumstances of the capital-borrowing party. An agreement on trust security must specify the amount, purpose, term, interest rate, rights, obligations and responsibilities of the borrower, the lending credit institution and the socio - political organization that provides the trust security. Subsection 8 PLEDGE OF PROPERTY
Bộ luật dân sự@346: Asset holding Lien on property means that the obligee (hereinafter referred to as lienor) lawfully holding property being the subject matter of a bilateral contract is entitled to seize the property in case the obligor fails to perform or improperly performs the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@347: Establishment of property lien 1. Lien on property arising from the time of due performance of obligations which the obligor fails to perform or improperly performs. 2. Lien on property shall take effect against a third party from the time the lienor takes possession of the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@348: Rights of lienor 1. To request the obligor to fulfill all obligations arising from the bilateral contract. 2. Require the obligor to pay the costs necessary for the maintenance and preservation of the property. 3. Exploit the property to obtain yields and profits with the consent of the obligor. The value of the exploitation of the property shall be offset against the value of the obligation of the obligor.
Bộ luật dân sự@349: Obligations of lienor 1. To preserve and preserve the seized property. 2. Not to change the status of the property. 3. Not to transfer or use the property without the consent of the obligor. 4. To return the property in custody after the obligation has been performed. 5. Compensate for any loss or damage to the property.
Bộ luật dân sự@350: Termination of lien Lien on property shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The lienor no longer holds the property in reality; 2. The parties agree to use other security measures in lieu of the lien; 3. The obligation has been fulfilled; 4. The property is no longer in custody; 5. As agreed upon by the parties.
Bộ luật dân sự@351: Civil liability for breach of civil obligations 1. An obligor who breaches an obligation shall be liable to the obligee for civil liability. Breach of obligations means the obligor's failure to perform the obligation on schedule, to fully perform the obligation or to properly perform the obligation. 2. Where the obligor fails to perform the obligation due to force majeure events, he/she shall not be liable for civil liability, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided for by law. 3. An obligor shall not be liable for civil liability if it proves that the failure to perform an obligation is entirely due to the fault of the obligee.
Bộ luật dân sự@352: Responsibility for continued performance of obligations Where an obligor fails to perform its obligations, the obligee may request the obligor to continue performing the obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@353: Late performance of obligations 1. Late performance of an obligation means that the obligation has not yet been performed or is only partially performed after the time limit for performance of the obligation expires. 2. The party late in performing an obligation must immediately notify the obligee of the failure to perform the obligation on time.
Bộ luật dân sự@354: Deferred 1. Where an obligor is unable to perform an obligation on time, it must immediately notify the obligee and request postponement of the performance of the obligation. Where the obligor fails to notify the obligee, the obligor must compensate for any damage that may arise, unless otherwise agreed or the notification cannot be made due to objective reasons. 2. The obligor may postpone the performance of the obligation with the consent of the obligee. The performance of the obligation, when postponed, shall still be deemed to be performed on time.
Bộ luật dân sự@355: Late acceptance of performance of obligations 1. Late acceptance of the performance of an obligation means the time limit for performance of an obligation which has been performed by the obligor but the obligee does not accept the performance of that obligation. 2. In case of late receipt of the subject matter of the obligation being property, the obligor may deposit the property at the place where the property is kept or apply other necessary measures to preserve the property and may demand payment of reasonable expenses. In case the property is kept, the obligor must immediately notify the obligee. 3. The obligor has the right to sell property in danger of damage and must immediately notify the obligee, and must return to the obligee the proceeds from the sale of such property after deducting reasonable expenses for the preservation and sale of such property.
Bộ luật dân sự@356: Liability for failure to fulfill the obligation to deliver the object 1. Where the obligation to deliver a distinctive object is not fulfilled, the aggrieved party may request the infringer to deliver that particular object. If the object no longer exists or is damaged, the aggrieved party shall pay for the value of the object. 2. Where the obligation to deliver an object of the same type is not fulfilled, the aggrieved party may request the infringer to deliver another object of the same type; if there is no substitute object of the same type, the aggrieved party shall have to pay the value of the object. 3. If the breach of obligations prescribed in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article causes damage to the aggrieved party, the offending party shall pay compensation for such damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@357: Liability for late performance of the payment obligation 1. Where the obligor is late in paying the obligation, the obligor must pay interest on the late payment corresponding to the late payment period. 2. The interest on late payment of the money shall be determined as agreed by the parties but not exceeding the interest rate prescribed in Clause 1 Article 468 of this Code; if there is no agreement, Clause 2 Article 468 of this Code shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@358: Liabilities for failure to perform or permission to perform an act 1. Where an obligor fails to perform an act which it is obliged to perform, the obligee may request the obligor to continue performing such act or perform such act by itself or assign another person to perform such act and request the obligor to pay reasonable expenses and compensate for damage. 2. Where an obligor is not entitled to perform an act but does so again, the obligee shall be entitled to request the obligor to terminate the performance, restore the original state and compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@359: Liability for late acceptance of the performance of obligations The obligee that delays the performance of an obligation, resulting in damage to the obligor, shall pay compensation to that party and bear all risks and expenses arising from the time of delay, unless otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@360: Liability to compensate for damage caused by breach of obligations Where damage is caused by breach of an obligation, the obligor must compensate for all damage, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@361: Damage caused by breach of obligations 1. Damage caused by breach of obligations includes material and spiritual damage. 2. Material loss means a actually determined material loss, including loss of property, reasonable expenses for preventing, limiting and remedying damage, lost or reduced actual income. 3. Spiritual damage means a mental loss caused by infringement upon the life, health, honor, dignity, prestige or other personal interests of an entity.
Bộ luật dân sự@362: The obligation to prevent and limit damage The obligee must apply necessary and reasonable measures to prevent damage from occurring or to limit damage to itself.
Bộ luật dân sự@363: Compensation for damage in case the aggrieved party is at fault Where the breach of an obligation is partially due to the fault of the aggrieved party, the offending party shall only have to pay compensation for the damage corresponding to the extent of its fault.
Bộ luật dân sự@364: Fault in civil liability Fault in civil liability includes intentional fault, unintentional fault. Intentional fault means a case where a person is fully aware that his/her act will cause damage to another person but still commits it and wishes or unintentionally but lets the damage happen. Unintentional fault means a case where a person does not foresee that his/her act is likely to cause damage, though he/she must or may foresee damage to occur or foresees that his/her act is likely to cause damage but believes that damage will not occur or can be prevented.
Bộ luật dân sự@365: Transfer of Request Rights 1. The obligee may transfer the right to demand performance of an obligation to a subrogatee of the obligee as agreed, except in the following cases: a/To request alimony or compensation for damage caused by infringement upon life, health, honor, dignity or prestige; b) The obligee and the obligor agree or the law provides that the right to demand must not be transferred. 2. Where the obligee transfers the right to demand to a subrogatee, the subrogatee shall become the obligee. The transfer of the right to demand shall not require the consent of the obligor. The person transferring the right to demand must notify the obligor in writing of the transfer of the right to demand, unless otherwise agreed. If the person transferring the right to demand fails to notify the obligor of the transfer of the right and the obligor incurs costs, the person transferring the right to demand shall pay such costs.
Bộ luật dân sự@366: The obligation to provide information and transfer papers 1. The person transferring the right to demand must provide necessary information and transfer relevant documents to the subrogatee. 2. If the person transferring the right to demand breaches the obligations stipulated in clause 1 of this article and causes loss, he or she must compensate for such loss.
Bộ luật dân sự@367: Not liable after the transfer of right to demand The person transferring the right to demand shall not be liable for the ability of the obligor to perform the obligation after the right to demand has been transferred, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@368: Transfer of the right to request security for performance of obligations Where the right to demand performance of a secured civil obligation is transferred, the transfer of the right to demand shall include such security.
Bộ luật dân sự@369: The obligor's right to refuse 1. Where the obligor is not notified of the transfer of the right to demand and the subrogatee of the obligee fails to prove the authenticity of the transfer of the right to demand, the obligor shall have the right to refuse to perform the obligation with respect to the subrogatee. 2. Where an obligor has performed an obligation toward the person transferring the right to demand because the obligor was not notified of the transfer of the right to demand, the subrogatee of the obligee shall not be permitted to request the obligor to perform the obligation toward him.
Bộ luật dân sự@370: Transfer of obligations 1. An obligor may transfer an obligation to a subrogatee of the obligor with the consent of the obligee, unless the obligation is associated with the personal record of the obligor or the law provides that the transfer of the obligation is not allowed. 2. Upon the transfer of an obligation, the subrogatee of the obligor shall become the obligor.
Bộ luật dân sự@371: Transfer of secured civil obligations If a secured obligation is transferred, such secured obligation shall terminate, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@372: Termination of civil obligations The obligation shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The obligation is fulfilled; 2. As agreed upon by the parties; 3. The obligee waives the performance of the obligation; 4. The obligation is replaced by another obligation; 5. Offsetting obligations; 6. The obligee and the obligor merge into one; 7. The prescriptive period for discharge of civil obligations expires; 8. The obligor being an individual dies or the obligor being a juridical person ceases to exist and the obligation must be performed by such individual or juridical person; 9. The obligee being an individual dies and the right to demand does not belong to the inherited estate or the obligee being a juridical person ceases to exist and the right to demand is not transferred to another juridical person; 10. The distinctive object being the subject matter of the obligation no longer exists and is replaced by another obligation; 11. Other cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@373: Performance of obligations An obligation shall be discharged when the obligor has performed the whole or part of the obligation but the obligee waives the remainder.
Bộ luật dân sự@374: Performance of civil obligations in case the obligee is late in accepting the subject matter of the civil obligation Where the obligee is late in accepting the subject matter of an obligation which is property, the obligation shall be fulfilled when the property has been deposited at the place of bailment as provided for in Clause 2 Article 355 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@375: Termination of obligations as agreed Parties may agree to terminate their obligations at any time but shall not be allowed to cause harm to the national interests, the public interests, the legitimate rights and interests of other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@376: Termination of civil obligations due to exemption from civil obligations 1. An obligation shall terminate when the obligee waives the performance of the obligation to the obligor, unless otherwise provided by law. 2. When a secured obligation is waived, the security shall also terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@377: Termination of civil obligations due to replacement of other civil obligations 1. Where the parties agree to replace the original obligation with another obligation, the original obligation shall terminate. 2. An obligation shall also terminate if the obligee has taken over property or other works in lieu of the property or works as agreed. 3. Where an obligation is an obligation to support or to compensate for damage caused by the infringement upon life, health, honor, dignity or prestige, or other personal obligations which cannot be transferred to another person, it must not be substituted with another obligation.
Bộ luật dân sự@378: Termination of civil obligations due to obligation clearing 1. Where the parties have the same type of property obligations towards each other, when they are due, they shall not have to perform their obligations towards each other and the obligations shall be deemed to terminate, except otherwise provided for by law. 2. Where the value of the property or work is not equivalent, the parties shall pay each other the difference. 3. Objects with monetary value may also be offset against the obligation to pay money.
Bộ luật dân sự@379: Cases in which obligations may not be offset An obligation shall not be cleared in the following cases: 1. The obligation is in dispute; 2. The obligation to pay compensation for damage caused by the infringement upon life, health, honor, dignity or prestige; 3. Support obligation; 4. Other obligations prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@380: Termination of civil obligations due to integration of obligor and obligee Where an obligor becomes the obligee with respect to the obligation, the obligation shall terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@381: Termination of civil obligations due to expiration of the prescriptive period for discharge of civil obligations When the prescriptive period for discharge of an obligation expires, the obligation shall terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@382: Termination of civil obligations when the obligee being natural person dies or the juridical person ceases to exist Where it is agreed by the parties or provided by law that an obligation shall be performed only for an individual or a juridical person being the obligee, and such individual dies or the juridical person ceases to exist, the obligation shall also terminate.
Bộ luật dân sự@383: Termination of a civil obligation when a particular object no longer exists The obligation to deliver objects shall terminate in cases where the to be-delivered objects being special objects no longer exist. The parties may agree to replace the object or to compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@384: Termination of obligations in case of bankruptcy In case of bankruptcy, the obligation shall terminate in accordance with the Law on Bankruptcy.
Bộ luật dân sự@385: Contract concept A contract is an agreement between parties on the establishment, change or termination of civil rights and obligations.
Bộ luật dân sự@386: Offer to enter into a contract 1. A proposal for conclusion of a contract means a clear indication of the proposal's intention to enter into a contract and its binding on the determined party or on the public (below collectively referred to as the requested party). 2. Where an offer to enter into a contract clearly states the time limit for reply, if the offeror enters into a contract with a third party while awaiting the offeror's reply, the offeror shall have to pay compensation for damage caused to the offeror but shall not be allowed to enter into the contract if damage arises.
Bộ luật dân sự@387: Information in entering into contracts 1. In case one party has information affecting the acceptance of the other party to enter into a contract, it shall notify such to the other party. 2. If a party receives secret information from the other party during the conclusion of a contract, it shall keep such information confidential and may not use such information for its own purposes or for other illegal purposes. 3. The party that commits the violations in Clause 1 and Clause 2 of this Article and causes damage shall pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@388: The date on which the offer to enter into a contract takes effect 1. The time when an offer to enter into a contract takes effect shall be determined as follows: a) The valuation is determined by the requesting party; b) If the requesting party does not fix the contract, the proposal shall take effect from the date on which the requested party receives such proposal, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 2. The following cases shall be considered as having received the proposal for conclusion of contract: a/The request is transferred to the place of residence, if the requested party is an individual; or to the head office, if the requested party is a legal person; b) The request is put into the official information system of the requested party; c) The requested party is aware of the offer to enter into the contract through other means.
Bộ luật dân sự@389: Change, withdrawal of offer to enter into contract 1. The offeror may change or withdraw its offer to enter into a contract in the following cases: a/The requested party receives a notice of the change or withdrawal of its request before or at the time of receipt of the request; b) Conditions for change or withdrawal of the application arise in case the applicant clearly states the change or withdrawal of the application when such conditions arise. 2. When the requesting party changes the contents of the request, it is a new request.
Bộ luật dân sự@390: Rescind the offer to enter into a contract The offeror may rescind the offer if such right has been stated in the offer and the offeror receives the notice of rescission of the offer prior to the notice of acceptance of the offer.
Bộ luật dân sự@391: Termination of offer to enter into contract An offer to enter into a contract shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The party proposed to enter into the contract; 2. The requested party replies that it does not accept the request; 3. The time limit for reply on acceptance has expired; 4. When the notice on the change or withdrawal of the application takes effect; 5. When the notice on cancellation of the application takes effect; 6. As agreed upon by the requesting party and the requested party pending the requested party's reply.
Bộ luật dân sự@392: Amendments to the request proposed by the requested party When the proposed party has accepted to enter into a contract but has stated conditions or amended the proposal, such person shall be deemed to have made a new proposal.
Bộ luật dân sự@393: Accept Offers to Conclude Contracts 1. Acceptance of a proposal for conclusion of a contract means the response of the to be-requested party to the acceptance of the whole contents of the proposal. 2. The silentness of the requested party shall not be deemed to be acceptance of the offer to enter into a contract, unless otherwise agreed or habitually established between the parties.
Bộ luật dân sự@394: Time limit for acceptance of contract conclusion 1. When the offeror fixes a time limit for reply, the reply accepting shall be valid only when it is made within such time limit; if the offeror receives a reply upon the expiry of the time limit for reply, such acceptance shall be considered a new offer of the party which is late in reply. When the requesting party does not specify the time limit for reply, the reply accepting shall be valid only if it is made within a reasonable time limit. 2. In case the notice of acceptance of the contract comes late for objective reasons which the proposal maker knows or should know, the notice of acceptance of the contract remains valid, unless the proposal maker promptly replies that he/she disagrees with such acceptance of the proposed party. 3. When the involved parties directly communicate with each other, even via telephone or other means, the requested party shall immediately reply whether it accepts or does not accept the request, unless the involved parties agree on the time limit for reply.
Bộ luật dân sự@395: In case the party requesting conclusion of the contract dies, loses civil act capacity or has limited cognition or behavior control In case the requesting party dies, loses civil act capacity or has limited cognition or behavior control after the requested party replies to accept the conclusion of a contract, the proposal for conclusion of a contract remains valid, unless the contents of the contract are associated with the personal identity of the requesting party.
Bộ luật dân sự@396: In case the party proposed to enter into the contract dies, loses his/her civil act capacity or has limited cognition or behavior control In case the requested party has accepted to enter into a contract but later dies, loses his/her civil act capacity or has limited cognition or behavior control, the reply of acceptance of the contract is still valid, unless the contents of the contract are associated with the personal identity of the requested party.
Bộ luật dân sự@397: Withdrawal of notice of acceptance of contract The party proposed to enter into a contract may withdraw the notice of acceptance if the notice of withdrawal comes before or at the same time the proposal receives the reply accepting the entry into a contract.
Bộ luật dân sự@398: Contents of the contract 1. The parties to a contract may agree on the contents of the contract. 2. A contract may contain the following details: a) Expire date of contract; b) Quantity and quality; c) Price and method of payment; d) Duration, location and method of contract performance; dd) Rights and obligations of parties; f/Liabilities for contract breaches; g) Dispute settlement method.
Bộ luật dân sự@399: Place of entry into contract The place of entry into a contract shall be agreed upon by the parties; if there is no agreement, the place of entry into a contract shall be the place of residence of the individual or the head office of the legal person that has proposed the entry into a contract.
Bộ luật dân sự@400: Time of Contract conclusion 1. A contract is entered into at the time when the requesting party is accepted to enter into the contract. 2. Where the parties agree that the silent treatment is the acceptance of the conclusion of a contract within a time limit, the time of conclusion of the contract shall be the last time of such time limit. 3. The time of verbal conclusion of a contract is the time when the parties have agreed on the contents of the contract. 4. The time of concluding a written contract is the time when the last party signs the document or in another form of acceptance indicated in the document. Where a contract is entered into verbally and then established in writing, the time of entering into the contract shall be determined according to Clause 3 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@401: Effect of the contract 1. A contract legally entered into shall take effect from the time of its entry into force, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. 2. From the effective date of the contract, the parties shall exercise their rights and fulfill their obligations to each other as committed. The contract may be amended or cancelled only as agreed by the parties or as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@402: Major types of contracts Contracts include the following principal types: 1. Bilateral contract means a contract whereby each party has obligations toward another; 2. Single-agency contract means a contract whereby only one party has obligations; 3. Primary contract means a contract whose effect does not depend on sub-contracts; 4. Auxiliary contract means a contract whose effect depends on the principal contract; 5. Contract for the interests of a third person means a contract whereby the contracting parties must perform the obligations and the third person benefits from the performance of such obligations; 6. Conditional contract means a contract whereby the performance of a contract depends on the occurrence, change or termination of a certain event.
Bộ luật dân sự@403: Contract Appendix 1. An appendix may be enclosed to the contract to detail some terms and conditions of the contract. The appendix is as effective as the contract. The contents of the appendix must not contravene the contents of the contract. 2. Where an appendix contains a provision contrary to the contract's provisions, such provision shall be void, unless otherwise agreed. Where the parties agree to the appendix containing a provision contrary to the contract's provisions, such provisions shall be deemed to have been amended.
Bộ luật dân sự@404: Interpretation of contracts 1. Where a contract contains unclear terms, the interpretation of such terms must be based not only on the wording of the contract but also on the will of the parties expressed in the entire process before, at the time of establishment and performance of the contract. 2. Where a contract contains terms or wording which may be interpreted in different ways, the interpretation thereof must be in the sense most suitable to the purpose and nature of the contract. 3. Where a contract contains terms or wording which is difficult to understand, it must be explained according to the customary practice at the place where the contract is entered into. 4. The terms of the contract must be explained in a way that the meaning of these terms is consistent with the entire contract. 5. Where there is a conflict between the general will of the parties and the wording used in the contract, the general will of the parties shall be used to explain the contract. 6. In case the drafting party inserts contents unfavorable to the other party in the contract, the contract interpretation must be in favor of the other party.
Bộ luật dân sự@405: Form of Contract 1. A standard form contract is a contract containing terms and conditions set by one party according to a standard form for the other party to reply within a reasonable period of time. If the requested party accepts the reply, it shall be regarded as having accepted the whole contents of the standard form contract already set by the requesting party. A model contract must be publicized so that the requested party knows or should know the contents of the contract. Procedures for publishing model contracts shall comply with regulations of law. 2. Where a standard form contract contains an unclear provision, the party issuing such standard form contract shall be disadvantaged in explaining such provision. 3. In case a standard form contract contains a provision on exemption from liability of the party giving the standard form contract, increase in liability or removal of legitimate interests of the other party, this provision is not effective, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@406: General trading conditions in conclusion of contracts 1. General trading conditions are stable terms announced by one party for general application to the party proposed to enter into a contract; if the proposed party accepts to enter into a contract, these terms are regarded as accepting. 2. General trading conditions shall be valid only for the parties establishing transactions in case these trading conditions have been publicized for the parties establishing transactions to know or must know about such conditions. Procedures for publishing general transaction conditions shall comply with regulations of law. 3. General trading conditions must ensure equality between parties. In case general trading conditions provide for the exemption from liability of the party that sets general trading conditions, the increase in liability or the removal of legitimate interests of the other party, these provisions are not effective, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@407: Contract null and void 1. The provisions of Articles 123 through 133 of this Code on invalid civil transactions shall also apply to invalid contracts. 2. The invalidation of the principal contract shall terminate the sub-contract, except where the parties agree that the sub-contract shall replace the principal contract. This provision shall not apply to measures to secure the performance of obligations. 3. The invalidation of sub-contracts shall not terminate the principal contract, except where the parties agree that the sub-contract is an integral part of the principal contract.
Bộ luật dân sự@408: The contract is invalid due to unrealizable objects 1. Where the contract has an unrealizable subject matter from the time of entry into force, such contract shall be invalidated. 2. Where a party knows or should know that a contract has an unrealizable object but fails to notify the other party thereof, thus the latter enters into a contract, the other party shall have to pay compensation for damage caused to the other party, except where the other party knows or should know that the contract has an unrealizable object. 3. The provisions of Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article shall also apply to cases where a contract has one or several parts which cannot be performed by the objects but the remaining part of the contract remains valid. Subsection 2 EXECUTION OF CONTRACTS
Bộ luật dân sự@409: Performance of single-agency contracts In the case of a unilateral contract, the obligor must perform the obligation in accordance with the agreement and may only perform the obligation prior to or after the time limit with the consent of the obligee.
Bộ luật dân sự@410: Performance of bilateral contracts 1. In a bilateral contract, when the parties have agreed on the time limit for performance of their obligations, each party shall perform its obligations when they become due; it may not postpone the performance on the ground that the other party has not yet performed its obligations toward it, except for cases specified in Articles 411 and 413 of this Code. 2. Where the parties do not agree on which party shall perform the obligation first, the parties shall have to perform the obligation simultaneously against each other; if the obligation cannot be performed simultaneously, the obligation which takes longer to be performed must be performed first.
Bộ luật dân sự@411: Right to postpone performance of obligations under bilateral contracts 1. The party that has to perform the obligation first may postpone the performance of the obligation if the other party's ability to perform the obligation has been so seriously reduced that it is impossible to perform the obligation as committed until the other party is capable of performing the obligation or has measures to secure the performance of the obligation. 2. The party that has to perform the obligation later may postpone the performance of the obligation when it becomes due if the party that has performed the obligation earlier has not yet performed its obligation when it becomes due.
Bộ luật dân sự@412: Lien on property in bilateral contracts Where the obligor fails to fulfill his/her obligations, the obligee shall establish the right to lien on the obligor's property in accordance with regulations laid down in Article 346 through Article 350 hereof.
Bộ luật dân sự@413: The obligation is not fulfilled due to the fault of one party In a bilateral contract, when one party fails to perform its obligation due to the fault of the other party, it may request the other party to perform its obligation towards it or cancel the contract and claim damages.
Bộ luật dân sự@414: Failure to fulfill obligations not due to the parties' faults In a bilateral contract, if one party fails to perform its obligation and neither party is at fault, the party that fails to perform its obligation has no right to request the other party to perform its obligation toward it. In case one party has performed part of its obligation, it has the right to request the other party to perform the corresponding part of its obligation toward it.
Bộ luật dân sự@415: Performance of contracts for the benefit of third parties When performing a contract in the interests of a third party, the third party may directly request the obligor to perform the obligation toward him/her. If the parties to the contract have disputes over the performance of the contract, the third party may not request the performance of the obligation until the dispute is settled. The obligee may also request the obligor to perform the contract in the interests of a third party.
Bộ luật dân sự@416: The right of a third party to refuse 1. Where a third person denies his/her interests before the obligor performs the obligation, the obligor shall not have to perform the obligation but shall have to notify the obligee thereof and the contract shall be deemed to be canceled and the parties shall have to return to each other what they have received. 2. Where a third party waives its interests after the obligor has performed the obligation, the obligation shall be deemed to have been fulfilled and the obligee shall still have to fulfill its commitment to the obligor. In this case, the interests arising from the contract shall belong to the party that is the beneficiary of the contract if it is not for the interests of the third party, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@417: No amendment or cancellation of the contract shall be made in the interests of the third party. Where a third party has agreed to enjoy the benefits, the contracting parties may not amend or cancel the contract even though it has not yet been performed, except where it is so agreed by the third party.
Bộ luật dân sự@418: Agreement on penalty for violations 1. Penalty is an agreement between the parties in a contract whereby the party breaching the obligation shall have to pay a sum of money to the aggrieved party. 2. The fine levels shall be agreed upon by the involved parties, except otherwise provided for by relevant laws. 3. The parties may agree that the party breaching the obligation shall be subject to only a fine for the breach but not to pay compensation for damage or both a fine and compensation for damage. Where the parties have agreed on fine but fail to agree on both the payment of fine and compensation for damage, the party breaching the obligation shall only have to pay the fine.
Bộ luật dân sự@419: Compensation for damage caused by breach of contract 1. The damage to be compensated for breach of contractual obligations shall be determined according to the provisions of Clause 2 of this Article, Article 13 and Article 360 of this Code. 2. The obligee may claim compensation for damage to the interests he/she would have enjoyed under the contract. The obligee may also request the obligor to pay expenses arising from the failure to fulfill the contractual obligations which do not overlap with the compensation for damage to the contractual interests. 3. At the request of the obligee, the court may force the obligor to pay compensation for mental suffering to the obligee. The compensation level shall be decided by the court based on the case.
Bộ luật dân sự@420: Performance of contracts when circumstances change substantially 1. The circumstances change substantially when the following conditions are fully met: a) The change of circumstances due to objective causes occurs after the conclusion of the contract; b) The parties cannot anticipate the change of circumstances at the time of concluding the contract; c) The circumstances change so greatly that if the parties knew in advance, the contract was not entered into or was entered into but with completely different contents; d) The continued performance of the contract without any change in the contract contents will cause serious damage to one party; dd) The affected party has applied all necessary measures within its capacity and in accordance with the nature of the contract but it is unable to prevent or minimize the extent of affecting the benefits. 2. Where the circumstances substantially change, the party with affected interests may request the other party to renegotiate the contract within a reasonable time limit. 3. In case the parties cannot reach an agreement on the contract modification within a reasonable time limit, one of the parties may request the court to: a) The contract is terminated at a specified time; b) Amend the contract to balance the legal rights and interests of the parties due to the fundamental change of circumstances. The court may decide to modify a contract only in case the termination of the contract will cause greater damage than the costs of performance of the contract if it is modified. 4. During the negotiation on contract modification or termination, the court shall settle the case and the parties shall continue performing their obligations under the contract, unless otherwise agreed. Subsection 3 AMENDMENTS AND TERMINATION OF CONTRACTS
Bộ luật dân sự@421: Contract amendment 1. The parties may agree to modify the contract. 2. A contract may be amended in accordance with Article 420 of this Code. 3. The amended contract must comply with the form of the original contract.
Bộ luật dân sự@422: Termination of contract The contract shall terminate in the following cases: 1. The contract has been completed; 2. As agreed upon by the parties; 3. The individual entering into the contract dies or the legal entity entering into the contract ceases to exist and the contract must be performed by that individual or legal entity; 4. The contract is cancelled or unilaterally terminated; 5. The contract cannot be performed because the object of the contract no longer exists; 6. The contract terminates under Article 420 of this Code; 7. Other cases prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@423: Termination of contract 1. A party may cancel the contract and is not required to pay compensation for damage in the following cases: a/The other party breaches the contract, which is the cancellation condition agreed upon by the parties; b) The other party seriously violates the contractual obligations; c) Other cases prescribed by law. 2. Serious breach means failure to properly perform one party's obligations to the extent that the other party fails to achieve the purpose of concluding a contract. 3. The party that cancels the contract must immediately notify the other party of the cancellation; if the failure to notify causes damage, the party that cancels the contract must pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@424: Termination of contract due to late performance of obligations 1. Where an obligor fails to perform the obligation in accordance with the right to demand performance of the obligation within a reasonable time limit but the obligor fails to perform the obligation, the right to obligor may rescind the contract. 2. Where, due to the nature of the contract or the will of the parties, the contract will not achieve its purpose if it is not performed within a certain period of time and the obligor fails to perform the obligation by the end of that period, the other party may cancel the contract without having to comply with the provisions of Clause 1 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@425: Contract cancellation due to inability to perform Where the obligor is unable to perform part or all of its obligations, which makes the purpose of the obligee unachievable, the obligee may rescind the contract and demand compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@426: Termination of contracts in case of loss or damage of property Where one party loses or damages property being the subject matter of the contract but cannot return or compensate by other property or cannot repair or replace by property of the same type, the other party shall have the right to cancel the contract. The violating party must compensate in cash equal to the value of the property lost or damaged, unless otherwise agreed or as prescribed in Clause 2 and Clause 3 Article 351 and Article 363 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@427: Consequences of the contract cancellation 1. When a contract is cancelled, it will be invalid from the time of conclusion and the parties are not required to perform the agreed obligations, except for agreements on fines for violations, compensation for damage and dispute settlement. 2. The parties must return to each other what they have received after deducting reasonable expenses for contract performance and expenses for preservation and development of the property. The refund shall be made in kind. In case of failure to refund in kind, the value of money shall be used for refund. Where the parties are both obliged to refund, the refund must be made at the same time, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. 3. The aggrieved party shall be compensated for the breach of obligations of the other party. 4. The settlement of consequences of contract cancellation related to moral rights shall be prescribed by this Code and other relevant laws. 5. Where the termination of a contract is not pursuant to Article 423, Article 424, Article 425 and Article 426 of this Code, the party terminating the contract shall be deemed to be the party breaching its obligations and shall be liable for civil liability due to failure to properly perform its obligations as provided for in this Code and other relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@428: Unilateral termination of contract performance 1. A party may unilaterally terminate the performance of a contract without having to pay compensation for damage when the other party seriously breaches its contractual obligations as agreed upon by the parties or provided for by law. 2. The party unilaterally terminating the performance of a contract shall immediately notify the other party of the termination of the contract. If the failure to notify the other party of the termination of the contract causes damage, it shall pay compensation therefor. 3. When a contract is unilaterally terminated, the contract shall terminate from the time the other party receives the termination notice. The parties are not required to continue performing the obligation, except for agreements on fine and compensation for damage and dispute settlement. The party that has performed the obligation may request the other party to pay for the performed obligation. 4. The aggrieved party shall be compensated for the failure to fulfill the obligations specified in the contract by the other party. 5. If the unilateral termination of the performance of a contract is not supported by any of the grounds specified in Clause 1 of this Article, the party unilaterally terminating the performance of the contract shall be determined as the party breaching its obligations and shall have to fulfill its civil liability in accordance with this Code and other relevant laws due to its failure to properly perform its obligations stated in the contract.
Bộ luật dân sự@429: Statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit over a contract The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits to request a court to settle a contract dispute is 3 years from the date the person entitled to request knows or should know that his/her lawful rights and interests are infringed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@430: Property sale contract Contract for property purchase and sale means an agreement between parties whereby the seller transfers ownership of property to the purchaser and the purchaser pays the seller. Contracts for purchase and sale of houses or for other purposes shall comply with regulations of this Code, the Law on Housing and relevant laws.
Bộ luật dân sự@431: Subject matter of the sale contract 1. Property specified in this Code may all be subject to sale contracts. Where the transfer of property is prohibited or restricted as prescribed by law, the property subject to sale contracts must comply with such provisions. 2. The property sold is under the ownership of the seller or the seller has the right to sell it.
Bộ luật dân sự@432: Quality of assets purchased and sold 1. The quality of the property for sale and purchase shall be agreed upon by the parties. 2. In case the quality standards of property have been announced or prescribed by competent state agencies, the parties' agreement on the property quality must not be lower than the property quality determined according to the announced standards or regulations of competent state agencies. 3. When the parties have no agreement or have an unclear agreement on the quality of the purchased and sold property, the quality of the purchased and sold property shall be determined according to the announced property quality standards, regulations of competent state agencies or professional standards. In case there is no quality standard of the property announced, regulations of competent state agencies and industry standards, the quality of the property for sale and purchase shall be determined according to common standards or specific standards suitable to the purpose of entering into contracts and the Law on Protection of Consumer Interests.
Bộ luật dân sự@433: Price and method of payment 1. The price and payment method shall be agreed upon by the parties or determined by a third party at the request of the parties. In case the law prescribes that the price and payment method must comply with regulations of competent state agencies, the parties' agreement must comply with those regulations. 2.
