The person performing the act without authorization dies, for individuals, or ceases to exist, for legal persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@579: Reimbursements 1. A person possessing or using property of another person without any legal basis shall return it to the owner or holder of other property-related rights; if the owner or holder of other property-related rights cannot be found, the property shall be transferred to a competent authority, except for the case prescribed in Article 236 of this Code. 2. A person who has gained benefits from property without any legal basis and thereby causes damage to another person must return such benefits to the aggrieved person, except for the case prescribed in Article 236 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@580: Returning property 1. A person possessing or using property without a legal basis shall return all the property he/she has obtained. 2. Where the to be-returned property is a specific object, such particular object must be returned; if such specific object is lost or damaged, compensation must be made in cash, except otherwise agreed upon. 3. Where the returned property is an object of the same type but is lost or damaged, the object of the same type must be returned or compensation must be made in cash, except otherwise agreed upon. 4. Unlawfully beneficiaries of property benefits must return such property benefits in kind or in cash to the damage sufferers.
Bộ luật dân sự@581: Obligation to return yield and income 1. A person possessing or using property or a person benefiting from property unlawfully or in breach of good faith shall return the yield and income derived from the time of unlawfully possessing or using property or enjoying benefits from property. 2. A person possessing or using property or a person benefiting from property without a legal basis but in good faith must return the yield and income obtained from the time such person knows or should know that the possession or use of property or the benefit from property is without a legal basis, except for the case specified in Article 236 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@582: The right to demand a third party's return Where a person possessing or using property without legal basis has delivered the property to a third party, the third party shall be obliged to return the property upon request of the owner or holder of other property-related rights, unless otherwise provided by this Code. If the property has been paid in cash or has been compensated, the third party may request the person who has delivered the property to him/her to pay compensation for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@583: Payment obligation Owners and holders of other property-related rights, and persons suffering loss or damage who are returned property shall be liable for necessary costs incurred by persons possessing or using property or persons benefiting from property in a non-lawfully but bona fide manner to preserve or increase the value of property.
Bộ luật dân sự@584: Grounds for arising liability 1. Any person who infringes upon the life, health, honor, dignity, prestige, property, legitimate rights and interests of another person and causes damage shall pay compensation, unless otherwise provided for by this Code or relevant laws. 2. The person causing damage shall not be liable for compensation in case the damage is caused by a force majeure event or entirely at the fault of the aggrieved party, unless otherwise agreed or otherwise provided by law. 3. If the property causes damage, the owner or possessor of the property shall pay compensation for such damage, except for the damage caused as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article.
Bộ luật dân sự@585: Principles of compensation 1. The actual damage must be compensated in full and in time. The parties may agree on the compensation level, form of compensation in cash, in kind or for performing an act, and the mode of compensation in lump sum or in installments, unless otherwise provided for by law. 2. The person liable for damage may be reduced the compensation level if he/she is not at fault or unintentionally at fault and the damage is too great for his/her economic capability. 3. When the compensation level is no longer suitable to reality, the aggrieved party or party causing damage may request a court or another competent state agency to change the compensation level. 4. Where the aggrieved party is at fault in causing damage, he/she shall not be entitled to compensation for the damage incurred by his/her fault. 5. The party with infringed rights and interests shall not be compensated if the damage is caused by the failure to apply necessary and reasonable measures to prevent or limit the damage to itself.
Bộ luật dân sự@586: Individuals' capacity to pay compensation 1. Persons aged full 18 years or older, who cause damage, shall have to pay compensation therefor by themselves. 2. If a person under fifteen years of age causes damage and his/her parents are still involved, his/her parents must compensate for the entire damage; if the property of his/her parents is not enough to pay compensation and the child who has caused damage has his/her own property, such property shall be used to pay the deficit, except for the case prescribed in Article 599 of this Code. A person aged between full fifteen years and under eighteen years, who causes damage, shall have to compensate therefor with his/her property; if his/her property is not enough to pay compensation, his/her father or mother shall have to pay the deficit with his/her property. 3. If a minor, a legally incapacitated person or a person with limited cognition and behavior control causes damage and has a guardian, such guardian may use the property of the ward to pay compensation; if the ward has no property or has insufficient property to pay compensation, the guardian shall pay compensation with his/her property; if the guardian can prove that he/she is not at fault in the guardianship, he/she is not required to use his/her property to pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@587: Pay compensation for damage caused by multiple people. Where many persons jointly cause damage, such persons must jointly pay compensation to the damage sufferer. The compensation liability of each person jointly causing damage shall be determined corresponding to the extent of each person's fault; if the extent of fault cannot be determined, they must pay compensation in equal parts.
Bộ luật dân sự@588: The statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits to claim compensation for damage The statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit to claim compensation for damage is 3 years from the date the person entitled to claim knows or should know that his/her lawful rights and interests are infringed upon.
Bộ luật dân sự@589: Damage caused by property infringement Damage caused by property infringement includes: 1. Property is lost, damaged or destroyed; 2. The interests associated with the use and exploitation of the property are lost or decreased; 3. Reasonable expenses for preventing, limiting and remedying damage; 4. Other damage as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@590: Damage caused by health infringement 1. Damage caused by infringement upon health includes: a/Reasonable expenses for the treatment, health fostering and rehabilitation as well as the loss or decrease of the affected persons' health and/or functions; b) Loss or decrease in actual income of the sufferer; if the sufferer's actual income is unstable and cannot be determined, the average income of the same type of laborers shall apply; c/Reasonable expenses and lost actual incomes of the persons taking care of the victims during the treatment period; if the victims lose their working capacity and need regular caretakers, the damage shall include reasonable expenses for taking care of the victims; d) Other damage as prescribed by law. 2. A person liable for compensation in case of infringement upon health of another person shall pay compensation for damage under Clause 1 of this Article and another sum of money to offset his/her mental suffering. The level of compensation for mental suffering shall be agreed upon by the parties; if no agreement can be reached, the maximum level for a person with infringement upon health must not exceed fifty times the basic salary prescribed by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@591: Damage caused by compromised life 1. Damage caused by infringement upon life includes: a) Damage caused by harm to health as prescribed in Article 590 of this Code; b) Reasonable funeral costs; c/Aids for those whom the victims have the obligation to support; d) Other damage as prescribed by law. 2. The person liable for compensation in case of infringement upon the life of another person shall pay compensation under Clause 1 of this Article and another sum of money to compensate for mental suffering for relatives of the first-rank heirs of the sufferer. If these relatives are not available, this sum of money shall be paid to the person whom the sufferer has directly nurtured or directly nurtured the sufferer. The level of compensation for mental suffering shall be agreed upon by the parties; if no agreement is reached, the maximum level for a person whose life is infringed upon must not exceed one hundred times the basic salary prescribed by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@592: Damage caused by infringement upon honor, dignity or prestige 1. Damage caused by infringement upon honor, dignity or prestige includes: a) Reasonable costs for limiting and remedying damage; b) Actual income is lost or reduced; c) Other damage as prescribed by law. 2. A person liable for compensation in case his/her honor, dignity or prestige is infringed upon shall pay compensation under Clause 1 of this Article and another sum of money to offset his/her mental suffering. The level of compensation for mental suffering shall be agreed upon by the parties; if no agreement can be reached, the maximum level for a person with infringed honor, dignity or prestige must not exceed ten times the basic salary prescribed by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@593: Time limit for compensation for damage to life or health 1. Where a sufferer loses his/her full working capacity, he/she shall be entitled to compensation from the time of losing his/her full working capacity until his/her death, unless otherwise agreed. 2. In cases where the victims die, the persons whom they are obliged to support while they are alive shall enjoy the support money from the time the persons whose lives are infringed upon die within the following time limits : a/Minors or already pregnant persons who are children of the deceased and are still alive after birth are entitled to support money until they reach full eighteen years of age, except for persons aged between full fifteen and under eighteen years who have participated in labor and earned incomes sufficient to support themselves; b/Adoption allowances for adults who are incapable of working shall be paid until their death. 3. For the deceased's already conceived children, the support money shall be calculated from the time such persons are born and still alive.
Bộ luật dân sự@594: Compensate for damage in case of excess of the limit of legitimate defense The person causing damage in case of legitimate self-defense shall not have to pay compensation to the damage sufferer. The person causing damage by exceeding the limit of legitimate defense must compensate the aggrieved person.
Bộ luật dân sự@595: Compensation for damage in case of exceeding the requirements of the emergency situation 1. Where the damage is caused by the excess of the requirements of the emergency circumstances, the damage causers must pay compensation for the damage caused by the excess of the requirements of the emergency circumstances to the victims. 2. Persons who have caused emergency circumstances which lead to damage shall have to pay compensation to the victims.
Bộ luật dân sự@596: Compensate for damage caused by the user of the stimulant 1. Persons who, due to their drinking of alcohol or the use of other stimulants, fall into the state of losing their cognition and behavior control, thus causing damage to other persons, must pay compensation therefor. 2. When a person intentionally uses alcohol or other stimulants to cause another person to lose his/her act perception and control, thus causing damage, he/she must pay compensation therefor to the damage sufferer.
Bộ luật dân sự@597: Compensation for damage caused by the juridical person's personnel A juridical person must compensate for damage caused by its personnel during the performance of duties assigned by the juridical person; if the juridical person has compensated for the damage, it has the right to request the person at fault for causing damage to reimburse a sum of money as prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@598: Compensation for damage caused by law enforcers The State shall pay compensation for damage caused by illegal acts of public-duty performers under the Law on State Compensation Liability.
Bộ luật dân sự@599: Compensation for damage caused by persons under fifteen years of age or persons losing civil act capacity during the time of direct management by schools, hospitals or other legal persons 1. If a person under fifteen years of age, during the period of direct management of a school, causes damage, the school must compensate for such damage. 2. If a legally incapacitated person causes damage to another person while under the direct management of a hospital or another juridical person, such hospital or juridical person shall pay compensation for such damage. 3. Schools, hospitals and other legal entities specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article are not required to pay compensation if they can prove that they are not at fault in their management. In this case, parents or guardians of persons aged under fifteen years or persons losing their civil act capacity shall pay compensation.
Bộ luật dân sự@600: - To pay compensation for damage caused by laborers or trainees. Individuals and legal entities shall pay compensation for damage caused by their employees or trainees while performing their assigned jobs and may request employees or trainees who are at fault in causing damage to refund a sum of money in accordance with law.
Bộ luật dân sự@601: Compensate for damage caused by sources of extreme danger. 1. Sources of extreme danger include motorized communications and transport means, electricity transmission systems, operating industrial plants, weapons, explosives, inflammables, toxins, radioactive substances, dangerous animals and other sources of extreme danger prescribed by law. The owner of sources of extreme danger must operate, use, preserve, guard and transport sources of extreme danger in accordance with law. 2. Owners of sources of extreme danger shall pay compensations for damage caused by such sources; if owners have assigned other persons to possess and use such sources, such persons shall pay compensations, unless otherwise agreed upon. 3. The owner, possessor or user of sources of extreme danger must compensate for damage even when he/she/it is not at fault, except for the following cases: a) The damage is caused entirely by the intentional fault of the sufferer; b) Damage caused by force majeure events or emergencies, unless otherwise prescribed by law. 4. In case sources of extreme danger are illegally possessed or used, persons who illegally possess or use sources of extreme danger shall pay compensations for damage. Where the owner, possessor or user of the source of extreme danger is at fault in letting the source of extreme danger be illegally possessed or used, he/she shall have to jointly compensate for damage.
Bộ luật dân sự@602: Compensation for damage caused by environmental pollution Entities that pollute the environment and cause damage shall pay compensation in accordance with law, even when such entities are not at fault.
Bộ luật dân sự@603: Compensation for damage caused by animals 1. The owner of an animal must compensate for damage caused by the animal to another person. The person possessing or using the animal must compensate for damage during the period of possession or use of the animal, unless otherwise agreed. 2. Where the third party is totally at fault in causing the animal's damage to other persons, the third party shall have to pay compensation therefor; if the third party and the owner are both at fault, they shall have to jointly pay compensation therefor. 3. Where the animals are illegally possessed or used, thus causing damage, the persons who illegally possess or use them must pay compensation therefor; when the owners, the persons who illegally possess or use the animals are at fault in letting the animals be illegally possessed or used, they must jointly pay compensation therefor. 4. If animals are left free in accordance with customary practice and cause damage, owners of such animals must compensate according to customary practice but not contrary to law and social ethics.
Bộ luật dân sự@604: Compensation for damage caused by trees The owner, possessor and manager must compensate for damage caused by the trees.
Bộ luật dân sự@605: Compensation for damage caused by houses and other construction works The owners, possessors and/or persons assigned to manage and/or use houses and other construction works shall have to pay compensation for damage caused by such houses and/or other construction works to other persons. Where the builders are at fault in letting houses and other construction works cause damage, they must jointly compensate therefor.
Bộ luật dân sự@606: Compensation for damage caused by infringement upon corpses 1. Individuals and legal entities that infringe upon corpses shall pay compensation for damage. 2. Damage caused by infringement upon corpses includes reasonable expenses for limiting and remedying damage. 3. The person liable for compensation for an infringed body shall pay compensation under Clause 2 of this Article and another sum of money to make up for mental suffering of relatives of the deceased's first-rank heirs. If these relatives are not available, the person directly raising the deceased may receive this sum of money. The level of compensation for mental suffering shall be agreed upon by the parties; if no agreement is reached, the maximum level for each infringed body must not exceed thirty times the basic salary set by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@607: Compensation for damage caused by infringement of graves 1. Any natural or juridical person who infringes upon the grave of another person must compensate for damage. 2. Damage caused by infringement upon tombs and graves includes reasonable expenses for limiting and remedying damage. 3. The person liable for compensation in case a grave of another person is infringed upon shall pay compensation under Clause 2 of this Article and another sum of money to make up for mental suffering of relatives in the order of the deceased's inheritance; if these relatives are not available, the person directly rearing the deceased may enjoy this sum of money. The level of compensation for mental suffering shall be agreed upon by the parties; if no agreement is reached, the maximum level for each infringed grave must not exceed ten times the basic salary prescribed by the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@608: Compensation for damage caused by violation of consumers' interests Individuals and legal entities that produce and/or trade in goods and/or services but fail to ensure the goods and/or service quality, thus causing damage to consumers, shall have to pay compensation therefor. Part Four INHERITANCE
Bộ luật dân sự@609: Right to Inherit An individual shall have the right to make a will to dispose of his or her property; to leave his or her property to an heir at law; to inherit property in accordance with the will or with law. An heir shall not be an individual entitled to inherit the property in accordance with the will.
Bộ luật dân sự@610: The right of individuals to equal inheritance All individuals are equal in the right to leave their property to others and the right to inherit property in accordance with wills or by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@611: Article 16.-Time and place of opening of inheritance 1. The time of opening an inheritance shall be the time when the property owner dies. In cases where a court declares that a person is dead, the time of opening an inheritance shall be the date determined in Clause 2, Article 71 of this Code. 2. The place of commencement of an inheritance shall be the last place of residence of the bequeather; if the last place of residence cannot be determined, the place of commencement of an inheritance shall be the place where the whole or most of the estate is located.
Bộ luật dân sự@612: Legacy An estate includes the deceased's personal property and the deceased's share of property in common with other persons.
Bộ luật dân sự@613: Heirs An heir being an individual must be alive at the time of commencement of an inheritance or be born alive after the time of commencement of an inheritance but conceived before the deceased dies. If the heir under a will is not an individual, he/she must exist at the time of commencement of an inheritance.
Bộ luật dân sự@614: Article 16.-Time when the rights and obligations of the heirs arise From the time of opening an inheritance, the heirs shall have the property rights and obligations left by the deceased.
Bộ luật dân sự@615: Performance of property obligations left by the deceased 1. Heirs shall be responsible for fulfilling property obligations within the scope of the estate left by the deceased, unless otherwise agreed. 2. Where an estate has not yet been divided, the property obligations left by the deceased shall be performed by the estate administrator as agreed upon by the heirs within the estate left by the deceased. 3. Where an estate has been divided, each heir shall perform the property obligations left by the deceased, but not exceeding the part of the estate he/she has received, unless otherwise agreed. 4. Where an heir other than an individual inherits an estate under a will, he/she must perform the property obligations left by the deceased as if the heir were an individual.
Bộ luật dân sự@616: Legacy Managers 1. An administrator of an estate shall be appointed by a person appointed in a will or by an agreement of the heirs. 2. Where a will does not appoint an administrator of an estate and the heirs have not appointed an administrator of the estate, the person currently possessing, using or managing the estate shall continue to manage such estate until the heirs appoint an administrator of the estate. 3. Where an heir has not yet been identified and the estate has not yet been managed under the provisions of Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, the estate shall be managed by competent State bodies.
Bộ luật dân sự@617: Obligations of the administrator of the estate 1. An administrator of an estate as defined in Section 1 and Section 3, Article 616 of this Law shall bear the following obligations: a) Make a list of estates; recover estates of deceased persons which are possessed by other persons, unless otherwise provided for by law; b) Preserve the estate; do not sell, exchange, give, pledge, mortgage or dispose of the property in other manners without the written consent of the heirs; c) Notify the heirs of the estate; d) Compensate for any damage if the violator causes damage; dd) Deliver back the estate at the request of the heir. 2. Persons possessing, using or managing an estate as defined in Clause 2, Article 616 of this Code have the following obligations: a) Preserve the estate; do not sell, exchange, give, pledge, mortgage or dispose of the property in other manners; b) Notify the heirs of the estate; c) Compensate for any damage if the violator causes damage; d) To return the estate as agreed upon in the contract with the estate bequeather or at the request of the heirs.
Bộ luật dân sự@618: Rights of the administrator of the estate 1. The administrator of an estate as defined in Section 1 and Section 3, Article 616 of this Law shall have the following rights: a) Represent the heirs in the relationship with the third party related to the inheritance; b/To enjoy remuneration as agreed upon with heirs; c) Receive payment for the costs of preservation of the estate. 2. A person possessing, using or managing an estate as defined in Section 2, Article 616 of this Law shall have the following rights: a) To continue using the estate as agreed upon in the contract with the estate bequeather or with the consent of the heirs; b/To enjoy remuneration as agreed upon with heirs; c) Receive payment for the costs of preservation of the estate. 3. Where an agreement on remuneration is not reached with the heirs, the administrator of the estate shall be entitled to a reasonable amount of remuneration.
Bộ luật dân sự@619: Inheritance by persons entitled to inherit each other's estate who die at the same time Where all persons entitled to inherit each other's estate die at the same time or are deemed to die at the same time due to the impossibility to determine which person died first (hereinafter referred to as the death at the same time ), they shall not be entitled to inherit each other's estate and each person's estate shall be inherited by his/her heir, except for cases of succession inheritance as provided for in Article 652 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@620: Disclaimer of inheritance 1. An heir shall have the right to refuse to receive an estate, except in cases where the refusal is made to shirk the performance of his/her property obligations towards another person. 2. The refusal to receive an estate must be made in writing and sent to the estate administrator, other heirs and the person assigned with the task of distributing the estate for information. 3. The disclaimer of an estate must be expressed before the time of distribution of the estate.
Bộ luật dân sự@621: Persons not entitled to inherit 1. The following persons shall not be entitled to inherit the estate: a) Persons convicted of intentionally infringing upon the life or health or of seriously ill-treating or persecuting the estate leavers, seriously infringing upon the honor or dignity of such persons; b/Persons seriously breaching the obligation to nurture the estate leaver; c) Persons convicted of intentionally infringing upon the life of other heirs in order to enjoy part or the whole of the estate which such heirs are entitled to enjoy; d) Persons who commit acts of deceiving, coercing or obstructing the estate leavers in making testaments; forging testaments, modifying testaments, canceling testaments, concealing testaments in order to enjoy part or whole of the estate against the will of the estate leavers. 2. The persons referred to in paragraph 1 of this article shall be entitled to inherit the property if the bequeather has known of the acts of such persons but has nevertheless allowed them to inherit the property in accordance with the will.
Bộ luật dân sự@622: Properties without inheritors Where there is no heir under a will or under the law, or there is an heir but he/she is not entitled to inherit or refuses to receive the inheritance, the remaining property, after the performance of property obligations, shall belong to the State.
Bộ luật dân sự@623: The statute of limitations for inheritance 1. The prescriptive period for an heir to request division of an estate shall be 30 years in the case of immoveable property and 10 years in the case of movable property from the time of commencement of the inheritance. Upon expiry of this period, the estate shall belong to the heir managing such estate. Where there is no heir managing the estate, the estate shall be settled as follows : a) The estate is under the ownership of the possessor as prescribed in Article 236 of this Code; b) The estate belongs to the State, if there is no possessor defined at Point a of this Clause. 2. The prescriptive period for an heir to request the certification of his/her right to inherit or the rejection of the right to inherit of another person shall be 10 years from the time of commencement of the inheritance. 3. The statute of limitations for requesting an heir to fulfill the property obligations of the deceased is 3 years from the time of commencement of the inheritance.
Bộ luật dân sự@624: Will A will is a statement of the individual's will to transfer his or her property to another person after death.
Bộ luật dân sự@625: The testator 1. An adult who satisfies all the conditions prescribed in Point a Clause 1 Article 630 of this Code is entitled to make a will to dispose of his/her property. 2. A person who is fifteen to eighteen years of age may make a will if his or her parents or guardian agree.
Bộ luật dân sự@626: Rights of testators The testator shall have the following rights: 1. To appoint heirs; to deprive heirs of the right to inherit the estate; 2. To determine the portion of the estate to each heir; 3. To reserve part of the estate for presentation as gifts or worship; 4. To assign obligations to the heirs; 5. To appoint a testator, an administrator of the estate, or an assignor of the estate.
Bộ luật dân sự@627: Form of will A will must be made in writing. If a written will cannot be made, an oral will may be made.
Bộ luật dân sự@628: Written wills Written wills include: 1. A written will without witnesses; 2. Witnessed written wills; 3. Written wills, notarized; 4. A certified written will.
Bộ luật dân sự@629: Mouth will 1. Where a person's life is in danger of death and a written will cannot be made, an oral will may be made. 2. If the testator is alive, sound and clear, and has not deviated from the oral will within three months from the date of the oral will, the oral will shall be automatically annulled.
Bộ luật dân sự@630: Legal will 1. A will must satisfy the following conditions to be considered legitimate: a) The testator is sound and clear-headed during the test preparation; he/she is not deceived, intimidated or coerced; b) The contents of the will do not violate the prohibitions of the law, social ethics; the form of the will does not contravene the law. 2. A will of a person who is fifteen to eighteen years of age must be made in writing and must be approved by his or her father, mother or guardian. 3. A will of a person with physical limitations or an illiterate person must be made in writing and notarized or certified by a witness. 4. A written will which is not notarized or certified shall be deemed lawful only if it satisfies all the conditions stipulated in clause 1 of this article. 5. An oral will shall be deemed to be lawful if the testator expresses his or her final will in the presence of at least two witnesses and immediately after the testator expresses his or her final will, the witnesses shall record the will and sign or fingerprint it. Within 05 working days from the date on which the testator expresses his or her final will, the will must be certified by a notary public or a competent authority to certify the signatures or fingerprints of the witnesses.
Bộ luật dân sự@631: Contents of the will 1. A will shall contain the following principal details: a) Date of the will; b) Full name and place of residence of the testator; c/Full names of the person, agency or organization entitled to inherit the estate; d) The estate to be left and the place where the estate is located. 2. Apart from the contents specified in Clause 1 of this Article, a will may contain other contents. 3. A will must not be abbreviated or written in symbols; if the will consists of many pages, each page must be numbered and bear the signature or fingerprint of the testator. Where a will contains erasures or corrections, the person who has written the will himself or herself or the witness to the will must sign next to the erasure or correction.
Bộ luật dân sự@632: Witness to the making of a will All persons may testify against the will except the following: 1. The testator's heir under a will or at law; 2. Persons with property rights and obligations related to the contents of the will; 3. Minors, legally incapacitated persons, persons with limited cognition and behavior control.
Bộ luật dân sự@633: A written will without witnesses The testator must write and sign the will himself. The preparation of written wills without witnesses shall comply with Article 631 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@634: Written wills with witnesses Where a testator does not write his or her will by himself or herself, he or she may type or request another person to type the will, but the testator must have at least two witnesses. The testator must sign or fingerprint the will in the presence of witnesses; the witnesses shall certify the signature and fingerprint of the testator and sign the will. The preparation of written wills with witnesses must comply with the provisions of Articles 631 and 632 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@635: Notarized or certified wills The testator may request the notarization or authentication of his or her will.
Bộ luật dân sự@636: Procedures for making a will at a notary office or the commune-level People's Committee The preparation of a will by a notary practising organization or by the commune people's committee must comply with the following procedures: 1. The testator shall declare the contents of the will before a notary public or a person authorized to certify by the commune-level People's Committee. The notary public or the person authorized to certify by the commune-level People's Committee shall have to record the contents declared by the testator. The testator shall sign or press his/her fingerprint on the will after certifying that the will has been accurately recorded and has expressed his/her will. The notary public or the person authorized to certify by the commune-level People's Committee shall sign the will; 2. Where a testator cannot read or hear the will, sign or fingerprint it, he/she must ask a witness who must sign the will in the presence of a notary public officer or a competent person of the commune-level People's Committee for certification. The notary public officer or a competent person of the commune-level People's Committee shall certify the will in the presence of the testator and the witness.
Bộ luật dân sự@637: Article 10.-Persons who are not allowed to notarize or certify testaments Notaries and competent persons of commune-level People's Committees may not notarize or certify testaments in any of the following cases : 1. The testator's heir under a will or at law; 2. Persons whose parents, spouses or children are heirs under testaments or at law; 3. Persons having property rights and obligations relating to the will.
Bộ luật dân sự@638: A written will shall be as valid as a notarized or certified will. 1. A will of an active duty serviceman must be certified by the head of the unit of company or higher level, if the serviceman is unable to request notarization or authentication. 2. A will made by a person travelling on a ship or aircraft, with certification by the commander of such vessel or aircraft. 3. A will made by a person who is undergoing treatment at a hospital or another medical treatment or nursing establishment, certified by the person in charge of such hospital or establishment. 4. A will made by a person conducting surveys, explorations or researches in mountainous areas or islands, certified by the person in charge of the unit. 5. A will of a Vietnamese citizen who is living abroad, certified by a consular office or a Vietnamese diplomatic representative in that country. 6. A will made by a person who is held in custody or temporary detention, serving an imprisonment sentence or serving an administrative measure at an educational institution or a medical treatment establishment, certified by the person in charge of such institution.
Bộ luật dân sự@639: A will shall be prepared by a notary at his or her place of residence. 1. A testator may request a notary to come to his or her place of residence to make a will. 2. The procedures for making a will at a place of residence shall be the same as those for making a will at a notary practising organization as provided for in article 636 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@640: Amendment, replacement, annulment of wills 1. A testator may amend, supplement, replace or rescind a will which he or she has made at any time. 2. Where a testator adds to a will, the established will and the additional part shall have the same legal effect; if a part of the established will and the additional part are inconsistent, only the additional part shall have the same legal effect. 3. Where a testator replaces a will with a new will, the previous will shall be annulled.
Bộ luật dân sự@641: Custody of Will 1. A testator may request a notarial practice organization to keep or send another person to keep his/her testament. 2. Notary practising organizations which retain testaments shall be required to preserve and preserve them in accordance with this Code and the law on notarization. 3. The custodian of a will shall have the following obligations: a) Keep secret the contents of the will; b) Preserve the will; if the will is lost or damaged, immediately notify the testator; c) Deliver back the will to the heir or the person authorized to announce the will when the testator dies. The delivery of the will must be made in writing, signed by the person delivering and receiving it and witnessed by at least two witnesses.
Bộ luật dân sự@642: Lost and damaged will 1. Where a will is lost or damaged to the extent that it cannot express the will of the testator as fully as possible and there is no evidence to prove the true will of the testator as from the time of commencement of the inheritance, the will shall be deemed to have been absent and the provisions on inheritance in force shall apply. 2. Where a will has been found in the estate which has not been divided, the estate shall be divided according to the will. 3. During the prescriptive period for requesting division of an estate, if the will has been found after the division of the estate, it must be re-divided according to the will if the heir under the will so requests.
Bộ luật dân sự@643: Effect of will 1. A will shall take effect as from the time of commencement of the inheritance. 2. A will shall be wholly or partially ineffective in the following cases: a) The heirs under the will die before or at the same time as the testator; b) The agency or organization designated as the heir no longer exists at the time of commencement of the inheritance. Where a will has been made to inherit many heirs, but one of them dies before or at the same time as the testator, or one of the agencies or organizations designated to inherit the will no longer exists at the time of commencement of the inheritance, only the part of the will related to such individual, agency or organization shall be invalid. 3. A will shall be void if the estate left to the heirs no longer exists at the time of commencement of the inheritance; if the estate left to the heirs is only partially retained, the will shall remain valid in respect of the remaining part of the estate. 4. Where a will contains parts which are unlawful but do not affect the validity of the remaining parts, only such parts shall be ineffective. 5. Where a person has left many wills for a single property, only the last will shall be effective.
Bộ luật dân sự@644: The inheritor is independent of the contents of the will 1. The following persons shall still be entitled to an estate share equal to two-thirds of the share of an at-law heir if the estate is divided according to law, in the event that they are not entitled to such share of the estate or are entitled to such share of the estate less than two-thirds of the share of the share of the estate: a) Minor children, parents, spouse; b) Their children are adults but they have no working capacity. 2. The provisions of Clause 1 of this Article shall not apply to persons who refuse to receive the estate as provided for in Article 620 or who are persons who are not entitled to inherit the estate as provided for in Clause 1, Article 621 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@645: The legacy of worship 1. Where a testator leaves a part of his or her estate for worship purposes, such part shall not be inherited and shall be given to the person appointed in the will for management in order to perform the worship; if the appointed person fails to perform the will correctly or not in accordance with the agreement of the heirs, the heirs shall have the right to give the part of the estate for worship purposes to another person for management. Where the deceased does not appoint a person to administer the estate for worship purposes, the heirs shall appoint a person to administer the estate for worship purposes. Where all heirs under a will have died, the portion of the estate used for worship purposes shall belong to the person lawfully managing such estate among the heirs at law. 2. Where the entire estate of a deceased person is not sufficient to pay for his/her property obligations, part of the estate may not be used for worship purposes.
Bộ luật dân sự@646: Dios 1. A gift means a part of an estate given by a testator to another person. The gift must be clearly stated in the will. 2. The bequeathed person must be alive at the time of commencement of the inheritance or be born and alive after the time of commencement of the inheritance but conceived before the deceased dies. If the bequeathed person is not an individual, he/she must exist at the time of commencement of the inheritance. 3. The bequeathed person shall not be required to perform the property obligation with respect to the part of the estate to be inherited, unless the whole estate is not sufficient to pay for the property obligation of the testator, the part of the estate to be inherited shall also be used to perform the remaining part of the estate obligation of the testator.
Bộ luật dân sự@647: Announcement of Will 1. In case a written will is kept at a notarial practice organization, a notary shall announce it. 2. Where a testator designates a person to announce a will, such person shall be obliged to announce the will; if the testator does not designate or designates a person but the designated person refuses to announce the will, the remaining heirs shall agree to designate a person to announce the will. 3. After the time of commencement of the inheritance, the person announcing the will must duplicate and send the will to all persons related to the contents of the will. 4. The recipient of a copy of a will shall have the right to request comparison with the original will. 5. Where a will is made in a foreign language, such will must be translated into Vietnamese and must be notarized or certified.
Bộ luật dân sự@648: Interpretation of the contents of the will Where the contents of a will are unclear and lead to different interpretations, the testators must explain the contents of the will together based on the deceased's previous true wishes, taking into account the relationship between the deceased and the testator. If these persons disagree over the interpretation of the contents of the will, they may request a court to settle the case. Where part of the will is unexplained but does not affect the rest of the will, only the unexplained part shall be ineffective.
Bộ luật dân sự@649: Inheritance at law Inheritance at law means inheritance according to the line of inheritance, the conditions and order of inheritance prescribed by law.
Bộ luật dân sự@650: Cases of inheritance under law 1. Inheritance at law shall apply in the following cases: a) Having no will; b) The will is unlawful; c) The heirs under the will die before or at the same time as the testator; the beneficiary of the will no longer exists at the time of commencement of the inheritance; d) Persons who are appointed as heirs under a will but do not have the right to inherit or refuse to receive the estate. 2. Inheritance at law also applies to the following parts of an estate: a) The part of the estate not disposed of in the will; b) Parts of the estate related to parts of the will which have not taken legal effect; c) Parts of the estate related to the heirs under the will who have no right to inherit the estate, refuse to receive the estate, die before or at the same time as the testator; or parts of the estate related to the agency or organization entitled to inherit the estate under the will, which no longer exists at the time of commencement of the inheritance.
Bộ luật dân sự@651: Heirs at law 1. The heirs at law are prescribed in the following order: a) The first line of inheritance includes: wife, husband, natural father, natural mother, adoptive father, adoptive mother, natural child, adopted child of the deceased; b) The second line of inheritance includes paternal grandfathers, paternal grandmothers, maternal grandfathers, maternal grandmothers, siblings of the deceased; grandchildren of the deceased who are paternal grandfathers, maternal grandfathers, maternal grandfathers; c) The third line of inheritance includes paternal great-grandparents of the deceased; paternal uncles, maternal aunts, maternal uncles of the deceased; paternal grandchildren of the deceased who are paternal uncles, maternal uncles; and great-grandchildren of the deceased who are paternal great-grandparents. 2. Heirs of the same rank shall inherit the same share of the estate. 3. The successors of the line of succession shall only be entitled to inherit if there is no one in the line of succession left, due to their death, their inability to inherit, their disallowance of the right to inherit or their refusal to receive the estate.
Bộ luật dân sự@652: Succession to the throne Where a child of the deceased dies before or at the same time as the deceased, his or her grandchildren shall inherit the portion of the estate which his or her father or mother would have been entitled to have enjoyed if he or she were still alive; if his or her grandchildren also die before or at the same time as the deceased, his or her grandchildren shall inherit the portion of the estate which their father or mother would have enjoyed if they were still alive.
Bộ luật dân sự@653: Inheritance between an adopted child and his/her adoptive father or mother and his/her natural father or mother An adopted child and his/her adoptive father or mother may inherit each other's estate and may also inherit it under the provisions of Articles 651 and 652 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@654: Inheritance between stepchild and stepfather, stepmother A stepchild and his/her stepfather or stepmother, if having the same care and nurturing relationship as father or mother, may inherit each other's estate and may also inherit the estate under the provisions of Articles 652 and 653 of this Code.
Bộ luật dân sự@655: Inheritance in case a spouse has divided his/her common property; a spouse is applying for divorce or is married to another person 1. Where a spouse has divided his/her common property while the marriage is still in existence but later one of them dies, the surviving spouse may inherit the estate. 2. In case a spouse applies for a divorce which has not yet been granted or has been granted by a court a divorce by a judgment or ruling which has not yet taken legal effect, if one of them dies, the surviving spouse may inherit the estate. 3. A person who is the wife or husband of a person at the time of his/her death may inherit the estate even if he/she later marries another person.
Bộ luật dân sự@656: The heirs' reunion 1. After the announcement of the opening of an inheritance or the publication of the will, the heirs may meet to reach agreement on the following matters: a) Appoint a person to manage the estate, assign a person to divide the estate, and determine the rights and obligations of such person if the bequeather does not appoint such person in the will; b) Method of division of the estate. 2. All agreements of heirs must be made in writing.
Bộ luật dân sự@657: The distributor of estates 1. A distributor of an estate may concurrently be the administrator of the estate, as designated in a will or as agreed upon by the heirs. 2. The distributor of an estate must distribute the estate in accordance with the will or agreement of the heirs at law. 3. The distributor of an estate shall be entitled to a remuneration if so permitted by the bequeather in the will or agreed by the heirs.
Bộ luật dân sự@658: Order of priority for payment Property obligations and expenses related to inheritance shall be paid in the following order: 1. Reasonable funeral expenses according to customary practices; 2. The deficit of alimony; 3. Expenses for the preservation of the estate; 4. Allowances for dependants; 5. Remuneration; 6. Compensation for damage; 7. Taxes and other amounts payable into the State budget; 8. Other debts owed to individuals and/or legal persons; 9. Fines; 10. Other expenses.
Bộ luật dân sự@659: Distribution of estates by will 1. The distribution of an estate shall be carried out at the will of the testator; if the will does not specify the share of each heir, the estate shall be equally distributed to the persons designated in the will, unless otherwise agreed. 2. Where a will determines that an estate shall be distributed in kind, the heirs shall be entitled to receive the estate in kind together with the yield and income derived therefrom or shall be liable for the reduced value of the estate in kind as of the time of distribution of the estate; if the estate in kind is destroyed due to the fault of another person, the heirs shall have the right to demand compensation for damage. 3. Where a will only determines the division of an estate in proportion to the total value of the estate, such proportion shall be calculated on the value of the estate which is still in existence at the time of division.
Bộ luật dân sự@660: Distribution of estates by law 1. When dividing an estate, if there is an heir who has become pregnant but has not yet been born, part of the estate equal to the portion of the estate to which another heir is entitled must be retained so that such heir may enjoy the estate if he/she is alive at birth; if he/she dies before he/she is born, the other heirs may enjoy the estate. 2. The heirs may request the distribution of the estate in kind; if the distribution cannot be made equally in kind, the heirs may agree on the valuation of the estate in kind and on the person to receive the estate in kind; if they fail to reach agreement thereon, the estate in kind shall be sold for distribution.
Bộ luật dân sự@661: Restriction on Legacy Distributive Where, by the will of the testator or by agreement of all heirs, the estate is distributed only after a certain period of time, the estate shall be distributed only after that period has expired. In case of requesting the division of an estate, if the division of the estate seriously affects the life of the surviving spouse and family, the surviving spouse may request a court to determine the portion of the estate to be inherited by the heirs but may not permit the division of the estate for a certain period of time. This period must not exceed 3 years from the time of commencement of inheritance. Past this period, if the surviving spouse can prove that the division of the estate still seriously affects the life of his/her family, he/she may request the court to extend the time limit once for no more than 3 years.
Bộ luật dân sự@662: Distribution of estates in case of new heirs or heirs whose right to inherit has been denied 1. Where a new heir appears after the division of an estate, the re-distribution of the estate shall not be effected in kind but the heirs who have received the estate must pay the new heir an amount of money equal to his/her share of the estate at the time of division of the estate in proportion to the share of the estate they have received, unless otherwise agreed. 2. Where an heir has been divided his or her estate but his or her right to inherit has been rejected, such heir shall return the estate or pay an amount equal to the value of the inherited property at the time of division to the heirs, unless otherwise agreed. Part Five LAWS APPLICABLE TO CIVIL RELATIONS INVOLVING FOREIGN ELEMENTS
Bộ luật dân sự@663: Scope of application 1. This section deals with the law applied to civil relations involving foreign elements. If other laws provide for laws applied to civil relations involving foreign elements not in contravention of regulations from Article 664 to Article 671 of this Code, such laws shall apply; otherwise, relevant regulations of Part 5 of this Code shall apply. 2. Civil relations involving foreign elements are civil relations falling into one of the following cases: a) At least one of the parties is a foreign natural or juridical person; b) The parties are Vietnamese citizens or Vietnamese juridical persons but the establishment, change, implementation or termination of such relationship occurs overseas; c) The parties are Vietnamese citizens or Vietnamese juridical persons but the subjects of such civil relation are overseas.
Bộ luật dân sự@664: Determination of applicable laws on civil relations involving foreign elements 1. The law applied to civil relations involving foreign elements shall be determined according to the international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory or Vietnamese law. 2. In case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory or a law of Vietnam provides that the parties have the right to select, the law applied to civil relations involving foreign elements shall be determined according to the parties' choice. 3. In case the applied law cannot be identified under Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article, the applied law is the law of the country with the closest relationship with the civil relations involving elements of that country.
Bộ luật dân sự@665: Application of treaties to civil relations involving foreign elements 1. In case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory provides for rights and obligations of parties to a civil relation involving foreign elements, such treaty prevails. 2. In case a treaty to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory contains provisions different from those of this Part and other laws on civil relations involving foreign elements, such treaty prevails.
Bộ luật dân sự@666: International practices Parties may select international custom in the cases specified in Clause 2, Article 664 of this Code. If the consequences of the application of such international custom are contrary to the fundamental principles of Vietnamese law, Vietnamese law shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@667: Application of foreign laws In cases where foreign laws are applied but with different interpretations, the application thereof must comply with the explanations of competent bodies in such countries.
Bộ luật dân sự@668: Scope of law referred to 1. Laws referred to include regulations on determination of applicable laws and regulations on rights and obligations of parties to civil relations, except for the case specified in Clause 4 of this Article. 2. In case of reference to Vietnamese law, Vietnamese law on rights and obligations of parties to civil relations shall apply. 3. If the third country's law is referred to, regulations of the third country's law on rights and obligations of parties to civil relations shall apply. 4. With regard to the case prescribed in Clause 2 Article 664 of this Law, the law chosen by the parties shall provide for rights and obligations of the parties to the civil relation, excluding regulations on determination of applicable law.
Bộ luật dân sự@669: Application of laws of countries with multiple legal systems In case the law of a country with many legal systems is referred to, the applicable law shall be determined on the principle provided for by the law of that country.
Bộ luật dân sự@670: In case of non-application of foreign laws 1. The foreign law referred to shall not apply in the following cases: a) The consequences of the application of foreign laws contrary to the basic principles of Vietnamese laws; b) The contents of the foreign law are unidentifiable despite the application of necessary measures as prescribed by the procedural law. 2. In case foreign laws are not applied as prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article, Vietnamese laws shall apply.
Bộ luật dân sự@671: Prescriptive periods The prescriptive period for a civil relation involving foreign elements shall be determined in accordance with the law applied to such civil relation.
Bộ luật dân sự@672: Pursuant to the laws applicable to stateless persons and multi-nationality persons 1. If the law referred to in this case is the law of the country of which the individual has nationality but he/she is stateless, the applicable law shall be the law of the country where he/she resides at the time of the occurrence of the civil relation involving foreign elements. If the individual has multiple places of residence or his/her place of residence is unidentifiable at the time of the occurrence of the civil relation involving foreign elements, the applicable law shall be the law of the country where he/she has the most close relationship with the foreigner. 2. If the law referred to in this case is the law of the country of which the individual has nationality but he/she has multiple nationalities, the applicable law shall be the law of the country of which such person has nationality and resides at the time of the occurrence of the civil relation involving foreign elements. If such person has multiple places of residence or cannot identify his/her place of residence or his/her place of residence and place of nationality are different at the time of the occurrence of the civil relation involving foreign elements, the applicable law shall be the law of the country of which such person has nationality and is most closely related. If the law of the country of which the individual holds nationality is referred to but such individual holds multiple nationalities, including Vietnamese nationality, the law of Vietnam shall prevail.
Bộ luật dân sự@673: Legal personality of individual 1. The civil legal capacity of an individual shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country of which such person holds nationality. 2. Foreigners in Vietnam have the same civil legal capacity as Vietnamese citizens, unless otherwise provided for by Vietnamese law.
Bộ luật dân sự@674: Legal capacity of individual 1. The civil act capacity of an individual shall be determined under the law of the country of which he/she holds nationality, except the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. In case a foreigner establishes or performs civil transactions in Vietnam, his/her legal capacity shall be determined in accordance with Vietnamese law. 3. The determination of individuals who have lost their civil act capacity, had limited cognition or behavior control or restricted civil act capacity in Vietnam shall comply with Vietnamese law.
Bộ luật dân sự@675: Identify missing or deceased individuals 1. The determination of a missing or dead individual shall comply with the law of the country of which such person is a citizen before the time of receiving the last information on such person, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. The determination of a missing or dead individual in Vietnam shall comply with Vietnamese law.
Bộ luật dân sự@676: Legal persons 1. The nationality of a juridical person shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where such juridical person is established. 2. The civil legal capacity of a juridical person; name of the juridical person; legal representative of the juridical person; organization, reorganization and dissolution of the juridical person; relationship between the juridical person and its members; responsibilities of the juridical person and its members for its obligations shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country of which the juridical person is a national, except for the case prescribed in Clause 3 of this Article. 3. In case a foreign legal entity establishes and performs civil transactions in Vietnam, its civil legal capacity shall be determined in accordance with Vietnamese law.
Bộ luật dân sự@677: Asset classification The classification of property as movable property or immovable property shall be subject to the laws of the country where such property is located.
Bộ luật dân sự@678: Property rights and other property-related rights 1. Establishment, exercise, change and termination of ownership rights and other property-related rights shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the property is located, except for the case specified in Clause 2 of this Article. 2. Ownership rights and other rights to movable property during transportation shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the movable property is moved to, unless otherwise agreed.
Bộ luật dân sự@679: Intellectual Property Intellectual property rights shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the subject of intellectual property rights is requested to be protected.
Bộ luật dân sự@680: Inheritance 1. Inheritance is determined in accordance with the law of the country of which the bequeather has nationality immediately before his/her death. 2. The exercise of the right to inherit immovable property shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where such immovable property is located.
Bộ luật dân sự@681: Will 1. The capacity to make a will, to change or to rescind a will shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country of which the testator is a citizen at the time of making, changing or rescinding the will. 2. The form of a will shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the will is made. The form of a will shall also be recognized in Vietnam if it is consistent with the law of one of the following countries: a) The country where the testator resides at the time of testation or at the time of his death; b) The country of which the testator has nationality at the time of testation or at the time of his/her death; c) The country where the immovable property is located, if the inherited property is immovable property.
Bộ luật dân sự@682: Guardianship Guardianship shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the ward resides.
Bộ luật dân sự@683: Contract 1. Contracting parties may agree to select the applicable law, except for the cases prescribed in Clauses 4,5 and 6 of this Article. If the contracting parties do not agree on the applicable law, the law of the country with the closest relationship to the contract shall prevail. 2. The law of the following countries shall be considered the law of the country with the most close relationship to the contract: a) The law of the country where the seller, if being an individual, resides or the country where the seller, if being a legal entity, is established, regarding the goods sale contract; b/The law of the country where the service provider, if being an individual, resides or the service provider, if being a legal person, is established, for the service contract; c) The law of the country where the transferee resides if he/she is an individual or the country where he/she is established if he/she is a juridical person in terms of the contract for transfer of the right to use or intellectual property rights; d) The law of the country where the employee regularly performs his/her work, applicable to employment contracts. If the employee regularly performs his/her work in different countries or the place where the employee regularly performs his/her work is not identifiable, the law of the country with the most close connection to the employment contract shall be the law of the country where the employer resides, applicable to individuals, or the country where the employer is established, applicable to legal entities. dd) The law of the country where the consumer resides with respect to the consumer contract. 3. If the law of a country other than the one specified in Clause 2 of this Article proves to be more closely related to the contract, the applicable law shall be the law of that country. 4. Where the object of a contract is immovable property, the law applicable to the transfer of ownership rights and other rights to immovable property, the lease of immovable property or the use of immovable property to secure the performance of obligations shall be the law of the country where exists the immovable property. 5. Where the law chosen by the parties in the labor contract or consumer contract affects the minimum interests of employees and consumers as prescribed by Vietnamese law, the Vietnamese law shall apply. 6. The parties may agree to change the applicable law but such change must not affect the rights and legitimate interests of the third party before the change of the applicable law, unless the third party agrees. 7. The form of the contract shall be determined in accordance with the law applicable to such contract. Where the form of the contract is not consistent with the form of the contract as prescribed by law but consistent with the form of the contract as prescribed by the law of the country where the contract is entered into or the law of Vietnam, such form of contract shall be recognized in Vietnam.
Bộ luật dân sự@684: Unilateral legal act The law applied to unilateral legal acts is the law of the country where the individual establishing such acts resides or where the juridical person establishing such acts is established.
Bộ luật dân sự@685: Obligation to return property acquired or used without a legal basis The obligation to return property which is possessed, used or gained unlawfully shall be determined in accordance with the law of the country where the possession or use of property is made or where the benefits are gained unlawfully.
Bộ luật dân sự@686: Perform Work Without Proxy Contracting parties may agree to select the law applied to the performance of the act without authorization. If there is no agreement, the applied law shall be the law of the country where the act is performed without authorization.
Bộ luật dân sự@687: Extra-contractual damage compensation 1. Contracting parties may agree to select the law applied to the compensation for non-contractual damage, except for the case prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article. If there is no agreement, the law of the country where the consequence of the damage event occurs shall prevail. 2. Where the party causing damage and the aggrieved party have their place of residence, for individuals, or their place of establishment, for legal persons, in the same country, the law of that country shall apply. Part Six IMPLEMENTATION PROVISIONS
Bộ luật dân sự@688: Transitional provisions 1. With regard to civil transactions established before the effective date of this Code, the application of law is prescribed as follows: a) If a civil transaction has not been performed but its contents and form are different from those prescribed in this Code, the transferee shall continue to comply with regulations of the Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11 and legislative documents elaborating the Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11, unless the parties of the transaction agree to amend the contents and form of the transaction to comply with this Code and apply regulations of this Code. If a civil transaction in progress has contents and forms different from those prescribed in this Code, regulations of the Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11 and legislative documents elaborating the Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11 shall apply; b) If a civil transaction has not been executed or is being executed and its contents and form are conformable with this Code, this Code shall apply; c) Disputes over civil transactions which are completed before the effective date of this Code shall be settled in accordance with Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11 and legislative documents elaborating on Civil Code No. 33/2005/QH11; d) The prescriptive period shall comply with regulations of this Code. 2. This Code shall not be applied to appeal according to cassation or reopening procedures against cases and matters which have been settled by Courts according to the provisions of civil law before the effective date of this Code.
Luật Điện ảnh@1: Scope This Law provides cinematographic activities; rights, obligations and responsibilities of agencies, organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities; and state management of cinematography.
Luật Điện ảnh@2: Subjects of application 1. Vietnamese agencies, organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities in Vietnam and abroad. 2. Foreign organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities in Vietnam. 3. State management agencies in charge of cinematography; agencies, organizations and individuals involved in cinematographic activities.
Luật Điện ảnh@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Cinematography is a general art branch applying audio-visual technology and composing methods to film production. 2. Film means a cinematographic work with contents presented in consecutive motion pictures or images created by technical or technological equipment; with or without sound and other effects on the principle of cinematographic language; recorded in materials, digitally or by other technical means and disseminated to viewers, including feature films, documentaries, scientific films, cartoons and films of various types. A film does not include a recording intended to disseminate news on radio, television, or cyberspace; an art performance or video game; a recording of the activities of one or more people, or a description of a reality show, event, situation or program. 3. Cinematographic activities include film production, distribution, dissemination, promotion of cinematographic development, film deposit and archival, and training of cinematographic human resources. 4. Cinematography industry means a creative economic branch in the cultural domain, which uses artistic talents and cultural potentials in combination with business technologies and skills to create cinematographic works and cinematographic services. 5. Cinematographic establishment means an enterprise, non-business unit or another organization established by an organization or individual and carrying out cinematographic activities under this Law and other relevant laws. 6. Film production means the process of creating a film from screenplay to film completion. 7. Film distribution means the exchange, purchase, sale, lease, export and import of films. 8. Film dissemination means the introduction of films to viewers through film projection in cinemas, public film projection venues, offices of foreign diplomatic missions or cultural establishments established in Vietnam, on television systems, cyberspace and other audiovisual media. 9. Film classification means the appraisal of film contents and classification of films for dissemination to suit viewers' age groups or to those who are not permitted to disseminate them. 10. Screenplay means the whole film contents expressed in writing or other characters on materials, digitally or by other technical means. 11. Film owner means an organization or individual that makes financial investment and provides physical and technical foundations for film production, purchases film ownership rights, is donated or inherits film ownership rights and other forms under law. 12. Vietnamese film means a film permitted for dissemination in Vietnam under this Law and having at least two of the following three elements: a director holding Vietnamese nationality, a Vietnamese cinematographic establishment participating in film production, and a Vietnamese organization or individual being its owner or co-owner. 13. Provision of film production services means the provision of equipment, facilities, technical equipment, setting, personnel and other activities related to film production. 14. Studio means a place where a shot is taken, which meets the conditions on space and technical equipment for setting up a scene suitable to film production, including indoor and outdoor studios. 15. Public film projection venue means a theater, cultural house, exhibition house, cultural center, club, accommodation service establishment, food and drink service establishment, dance hall, store, store, stadium, sports arena, square, public means of transport and other means and public places where film projection is organized.
Luật Điện ảnh@4: Principles of cinematic activity 1. To build an advanced Vietnamese cinematography deeply imbued with national identity, meeting the people's cultural and art enjoyment needs and international integration. 2. Preserve and promote traditional cultural values, ensure humanity, aesthetics and entertainment. 3. Respect and guarantee the right to freedom of creation within the framework of law, protect intellectual property rights of organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities. 4. To ensure equality and fair competition among organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities and development of the cinematographic industry. 5. To develop the cinematographic industry in accordance with market rules and treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. 6. To efficiently, publicly, transparently and with focuses and priorities state budget funds and social resources for investment in and support of cinematography, giving priority to highland, mountainous, border, island, ethnic minority and rural areas. 7. To observe law, social ethics and professional ethics and have the responsibility to build a healthy business culture.
Luật Điện ảnh@5: State policies on cinematographic and cinematographic industry development 1. The State shall adopt policies to mobilize resources, apply measures to ensure a healthy investment and business environment, develop the cinematographic market, and create favorable conditions for organizations and individuals to participate in cinematographic activities in order to build the cinematographic industry in association with socio-economic development and international integration. 2. The State shall invest in and support the following activities : a/Producing films under plans to serve political tasks on historical and revolutionary subjects, leaders, celebrities, national heroes, children, highland, mountainous, border, island and ethnic minority areas, and to conserve and promote Vietnamese cultural values; b/Conducting screenplay, distributing and disseminating films, providing funds for film dissemination, means and technical equipment for serving highland, mountainous, border, island, ethnic minority and rural areas; serving children, the armed forces and performing other political, social, external relation and educational tasks; c/Organizing national film festivals, international film festivals, specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film programs and film weeks in Vietnam; national and international film awards and contests; and overseas Vietnamese film festivals, film programs and film weeks; d) Receive transfer of ownership and right to use screenplays and films of high ideological and artistic value for propagation, education, research, storage and serving political tasks; edit, translate and subtitle films to serve the introduction of Vietnam and its people; e/To develop cinematographic theoretical and critical activities; to propagate, introduce and orient cinematographic aesthetics; f/To research into and apply scientific and technological advances to cinematographic activities; g/To build and promote national cinematographic brands; h/Building and repairing material-technical foundations and film studios in service of film production, distribution, dissemination, deposit and archival; i/To build a system of statistical infrastructure and databases of the cinematography industry. 3. The State shall adopt preferential credit, tax and land policies for organizations and individuals engaged in cinematographic activities in accordance with law. 4. The State encourages organizations and individuals to participate in the activities specified in Clause 2 of this Article and the following activities: a/Producing, distributing and disseminating films; promoting and promoting cinematographic development; carrying out international cooperation, scientific research, technology transfer and providing digital services for cinematographic development; b/Providing financial, credit, guarantee and mortgage of intellectual property rights and insurance products for cinematographic development; c/Financing and donating to cinematographic activities and the cinematographic development support fund set up by organizations or individuals. 5. The Government shall elaborate Point d and Point e Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Điện ảnh@6: Film workforce development 1. The State shall adopt policies to attract, train, foster and create conditions for the development of cinematographic talents, giving priority to and supporting young talents; and provide appropriate treatment to raise the quality of cinematographic human resources. 2. The State prioritizes investment in and construction of a number of cinematography training institutions and disciplines up to international standards; supports cultural and art training institutions to provide specialized cinematography training or associate training in cinematography at home and abroad. 3. The State encourages training, retraining and technology transfer in order to develop cinematographic human resources for film production, distribution and dissemination through the implementation of state programs and projects and cooperation with foreign countries; to combine cinematographic human resource training with scientific and technological research and application.
Luật Điện ảnh@7: Socio - political and professional organizations, cinematographic socio - professional organizations Socio-political-professional organizations and cinematographic socio-professional organizations established and operating under the law on associations have the following responsibilities: 1. To protect the legitimate rights and interests of members according to law provisions; 2. To participate in formulating, disseminating and educating in cinematography policies and laws; 3. To participate in cinematography promotion, advertisement, training and retraining; to create a healthy professional and business environment for its members; to mobilize social resources for cinematographic activities in accordance with law; 4. To formulate and organize the implementation of professional ethics; to mobilize its members, organizations and individuals to participate in cinematographic activities to strictly comply with law; 5. To detect and propose competent state agencies to handle violations of the cinematography law.
Luật Điện ảnh@8: Foreign investment cooperation in cinematographic activities 1.
