Foreign organizations and individuals may cooperate with Vietnamese cinematographic establishments in investment in film production, distribution and dissemination in accordance with the investment law in the following forms : a) Establishing a foreign-invested business entity, contributing capital, buying shares, buying stakes, in which the foreign investor's capital does not exceed 51% of the charter capital; b/Business cooperation contracts. 2. Vietnamese cultural houses, film projection units, public film projection clubs and associations and mobile film projection teams may not enter into business cooperation contracts or joint ventures with foreign service providers.
Luật Điện ảnh@9: Article 10.-Prohibited contents and acts in cinematographic activities 1. Cinematographic activities with the following contents are strictly prohibited: a) Violate the Constitution and law; incite opposition or sabotage the implementation of the Constitution and law; b) Propagating against the Socialist Republic of Vietnam; undermining the great national unity bloc; harming national interests, nationalities and cultural values of Vietnam; offending the national flag, the Party flag, the national emblem and national anthem; c) Propagating and inciting wars of aggression, causing hatred and discrimination among nations and peoples of countries; spreading reactionary ideas and social evils; undermining culture and social morality; d) Distorting the national history, denying revolutionary achievements; offending the nation, famous people, national heroes; misrepresenting, infringing upon the national sovereignty; slandering, hurting the prestige of agencies, organizations and honor, dignity of individuals; dd) Spreading and supporting terrorism and extremism; e) Incite or insult folk beliefs and religions; propagate and encourage illegal folk belief and religious activities; g) Disclosing state secrets, personal privacy and other secrets as prescribed by law; h) Incite violence or criminal acts by showing in detail the methods of performance, images, sounds, wording, scenes of savage and brutal beatings, torture, murder and other acts that offend human dignity, except for the case of showing such contents to criticize, denounce or condemn crimes, uphold the cause and honor traditional and cultural values; i) Showing details of images, sounds, pornographic, debauching or incestuous dialogue; k) Breaching the legitimate rights and interests of children and/or minors; l) Violations against the principles of gender equality, gender prejudice and gender discrimination. 2. The following acts are strictly prohibited: a) Distributing or disseminating films in cinemas, on television systems or at public film screening places without film classification permits granted by a competent cinematography state agency (below referred to as film classification permits) or broadcasting decisions of press agencies possessing television operation permits (below referred to as broadcasting decisions); b) Disseminating films in cyberspace without classifying or displaying the classification results as prescribed in this Law; c) Changing or falsifying the contents and film classification results of the films that have been issued with the License to classify films or the decision on broadcasting; d) Producing, distributing, disseminating, depositing, or storing films against this Law, the Law on Intellectual property, and relevant laws; dd) Distributing or disseminating films subject to a decision on revocation of the license to classify films or decision on broadcasting; f/Reproducing films without the consent of film owners, unless otherwise provided for by the Intellectual Property Law; g) Failure to notify competent authorities when disseminating films at public places; h) Appraising and issuing the license to classify films against the law.
Luật Điện ảnh@10: Article 10.-Rights and obligations of cinematographic establishments producing films 1. Rights of cinematographic establishments producing films include : a/Producing or cooperating in film production; providing film production services for domestic and foreign organizations and individuals; b/Participating in the production of films funded with the state budget; c/Participating in film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs or film weeks. 2. Obligations of cinematographic establishments producing films include : a/To ensure film production according to the registered business contents, assigned or approved functions and tasks; b/To implement the contents of written appraisal of screenplays for state-funded films; c/To ensure security, social order and safety, health, fire and explosion prevention and fighting, environmental protection, protection of cultural heritages and other relevant matters in the film production process according to law; d/To send written commitments not to violate Article 9 of this Law to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism in case of film production cooperation with foreign organizations or individuals or receipt of financial supports from foreign organizations or individuals for film production; dd) Comply with regulations of this Law and other relevant regulations of law.
Luật Điện ảnh@11: Rights and obligations of film producers, screenwriters, directors, cameramen, actors and other members of film crews 1. Rights of film producers, screenwriters, directors, cameramen, actors and actresses and other members of film crews include: a) Artistic creation within the framework of law; b) Enjoy intellectual property rights according to regulations of law on intellectual property; c/To have their legitimate rights and interests related to cinematographic activities protected. 2. Obligations of film producers, screenwriters, directors, cameramen, actors and actresses and other members of film crews include: a) Comply with regulations of this Law and other relevant regulations of law; b/To perform contracts with cinematographic establishments engaged in film production on the basis of agreement and in accordance with law; c) Comply with rules of professional ethics and code of conduct of persons involved in the art sector.
Luật Điện ảnh@12: Background operation 1. To organize film management and administration or cooperation, joint venture or association in film production. 2. To provide film production services and other services in accordance with law.
Luật Điện ảnh@13: Film production activities in Vietnam of foreign organizations and individuals 1. Foreign organizations and individuals that produce films in Vietnam shall use film production services provided by Vietnamese cinematographic establishments. 2. Foreign organizations and individuals that use film production services in Vietnam must satisfy the following conditions : a/Having written agreement or contract on film production service provision with a Vietnamese cinematographic establishment; b/Films using film production services in Vietnam which do not violate Article 9 of this Law; c) The cinematography using Vietnam's setting must be licensed by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 3. A dossier of application for a license to provide cinematographic services using Vietnamese setting to a foreign organization or individual comprises : a) An application form for the license using the form prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) The film summary and detailed screenplay of the filming contents using the Vietnam setting in Vietnamese; c) Written agreement or contract for provision of cinematographic services using Vietnam's setting with foreign organizations and individuals; d/A written commitment of the foreign organization or individual using cinematographic services using settings in Vietnam not to violate Article 9 of this Law. 4. The order and procedures for granting licenses to provide cinematographic services using Vietnamese setting to foreign organizations and individuals are specified as follows: a) A foreign entity that uses cinematography using settings in Vietnam or a Vietnamese cinematographic establishment providing cinematography using settings in Vietnam shall submit 01 application via the National public service portal, by post or directly to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) Within 20 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall issue the license. In case of rejection, a response and explanation shall be provided in writing. If the script has to be revised due to violations of Article 9 of this Law and other relevant regulations of law or the application has to be revised at the request of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, within 20 days from the day on which the revised script or the revised application is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall issue the license. 5. In case of changes in the contents specified at Points a, b and c, Clause 3 of this Article after obtaining a license for cinematographic services in Vietnam, a foreign organization or individual or a Vietnamese cinematographic establishment shall apply for re-grant of a license according to the order and procedures specified in Clause 4 of this Article; except for changes specified at Points a and c, Clause 3 of this Article, within 5 working days after receiving a complete and valid dossier, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall grant a license. 6. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism may decide to revoke licenses for cinematographic services in Vietnam in the following cases : a/Violating Article 9 of this Law in the film production process: a/Violating the provisions of Article 9 of this Law; b) Information in the application for the License is forged; c) Failing to comply with the contents of the License.
Luật Điện ảnh@14: State-funded film production 1. The production of films funded with the state budget for political tasks specified at Point a, Clause 2, Article 5 of this Law shall be carried out in the form of assignment, placement of orders or bidding. 2. Investors of state-funded film production projects are ministries, ministerial-level agencies, government-attached agencies, central bodies of political organizations, socio-political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations and provincial-level People's Committees. 3. Investors of state-funded film production projects have the following responsibilities: a/Carrying out the process of selecting film production projects; b/Set up screenplay appraisal councils and film production project selection councils under regulations of the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 4. Investors of state-funded film production projects may mobilize other lawful financial sources for film production. 5. The ownership of films and intellectual property rights to state-funded films comply with the Intellectual Property Law and other relevant laws. 6. The Government shall elaborate Clause 1 and Point a Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Điện ảnh@15: Rights and obligations of film distribution cinematographic establishments 1. Rights of cinematographic establishments distributing films include : a/Distributing films in Vietnam and foreign countries; b/Exchanging, purchasing, selling, renting, exporting and importing films in accordance with law. 2. Obligations of film distribution cinematographic establishments include : a/To ensure the distribution of films according to the registered business contents, assigned or approved functions and tasks; b/To ensure that films circulated in accordance with this Law and other relevant laws; c/To take responsibility before law for the contents of films to be distributed.
Luật Điện ảnh@16: Film exchange, purchase, sale, and renting Organizations and individuals shall exchange, purchase, sell and lease films under this Law and other relevant laws.
Luật Điện ảnh@17: Film export and import 1. Organizations and individuals may only export films already licensed for film classification or broadcasting decisions. 2. Film importers shall make written commitments on film contents not violating Article 9 of this Law and send them to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 3. Heads of film importers shall take responsibility before law for the contents of imported films for dissemination; manage and use films for research, education, storage and internal circulation. 4. The State encourages and creates conditions for organizations and individuals to participate in film export.
Luật Điện ảnh@18: Article 10.-Rights and obligations of cinematographic establishments disseminating films 1. Rights of cinematographic establishments disseminating films include : a/To disseminate films according to law provisions; b) Advertising films and other services for viewers as prescribed by law. 2. Obligations of cinematographic establishments disseminating films include : a/To ensure the dissemination of films according to the registered business contents, assigned or approved functions and tasks; b/To disseminate only films with film classification permits or broadcasting decisions, except for cases of self-classification of films under Point b, Clause 2, Article 21 of this Law; c/To ensure conditions for film dissemination in each form of film dissemination; d) Display film classification levels and warnings as prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; e/To stop the dissemination of films at the written request of competent state agencies.
Luật Điện ảnh@19: Film popularity in cinemas 1. A cinematographic establishment disseminating films in cinemas must satisfy the following conditions : a) Being enterprises, non-business units established under the provisions of law; b) Having cinemas meeting technical regulations as prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 2. Cinematographic establishments disseminating films in cinemas have the following rights : a) Refuse to serve the viewers if they use banned substances, stimulants; bring weapons, inflammable materials, explosives, radioactive substances, toxic substances, banned substances, stimulants into the cinema; cause disturbances in the cinema; b) Preventing the illegal reproduction, audio and video recording, transmission and distribution of films; c) Request the violator mentioned in Point a and Point b of this Clause to leave the cinemas, request the competent agencies and individuals to handle the violator. 3. Cinematographic establishments disseminating films in cinemas shall ensure the performance of the obligations specified in Clause 2, Article 18 of this Law and the following provisions : a/To ensure the percentage of Vietnamese film screenings, Vietnamese film projection time frames, time volume and time frames for screening children's films; b/To ensure that film viewers are of the age group specified in film categories; c) Exemption and reduction of ticket prices for the elderly, the disabled, people with meritorious services to the revolution, children, people in extremely disadvantaged circumstances and other subjects as prescribed by law; d) Implement data connection and reporting regime at the request of competent state agencies. 4. Cinematographic establishments are encouraged to disseminate films in cinemas and disseminate films to propagate state policies and laws before film shows. 5. The Government shall elaborate Point a and Point c Clause 3 of this Article.
Luật Điện ảnh@20: Broadcasting on television 1. Press agencies licensed to disseminate films on television systems must satisfy the following conditions : a) Having license of television operation as prescribed by law on press; b) Having a decision to broadcast films on Vietnam's television system or on requested television services or on requested television services in cyberspace. 2. Press agencies defined in Clause 1 of this Article that disseminate films on television shall fulfill the obligations specified in Clause 2, Article 18 of this Law and ensure the ratio of time volume for broadcasting Vietnamese films to foreign films, time frame for broadcasting Vietnamese films, time volume and time frame for broadcasting children's films on domestic television channels according to the Government's regulations. 3. The issuance and revocation of broadcasting decisions shall be decided by the heads of press agencies licensed for television operation as prescribed by law. 4. To encourage the dissemination of Vietnamese films produced with the state budget and films donated by organizations and individuals.
Luật Điện ảnh@21: Video dissemination in cyberspace 1. Entities allowed to disseminate films in cyberspace are enterprises, public service providers and organizations that disseminate films in accordance with this Law and relevant laws. 2. The entities that disseminate films in cyberspace mentioned in Clause 1 of this Article shall fulfill the obligations specified in Points c and d Clause 2 Article 18 of this Law, other relevant regulations of law, and the following provisions: a/Not to disseminate films in violation of Article 9 of this Law and other relevant laws; b) Before disseminating films in cyberspace, ensure fulfillment of conditions for film classification as prescribed by the Government and take legal responsibility for the classification contents and results. In case of failure to satisfy the conditions for film classification, request the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism or an agency authorized by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism to classify films that have not been licensed or broadcasted according to the procedures specified in Clause 3 and Clause 4 Article 27 of this Law; c) Notify the list of films to be disseminated and the classification of films to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism before disseminating films in cyberspace; d) Take necessary technical measures and instruct parents or guardians of children to control and manage themselves, ensure that children watch popular videos in cyberspace in a manner that is appropriate for their age; enable service users to report films that violate this Law; dd) Provide contact points and information to receive and handle requests of regulatory authorities; complaints and denunciations of service users; f/To remove films violating Article 9 of this Law and other relevant laws at the written request of competent state agencies. 3. Organizations and enterprises having digital media platforms for film dissemination in Vietnam shall : a/To apply technical solutions and coordinate with competent state management agencies in removing and preventing violating films; b) Security for the performance of obligations specified at Points a and d, Clause 2 of this Article. 4. Organizations and enterprises having telecommunications networks shall prevent access to infringing films at the request of competent state agencies. 5. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall arrange personnel and technical equipment to examine the contents of films, classify and display the classification results of films disseminated in cyberspace; cooperate with the Ministry of Information and Communications, the Ministry of Public Security, and relevant authorities in taking measures for preventing and taking actions against violations of law. 6. The Government shall elaborate Points b, c, d and d Clause 2, Point a Clause 3 and Clause 4 of this Article.
Luật Điện ảnh@22: Film distribution at public film screening venue 1. Film dissemination organizations at public film projection places must satisfy the following conditions : a) Ensuring conditions on security, social order and safety, health, fire and explosion prevention and fighting, environmental protection and other relevant conditions as prescribed by law; b/To supply lists of films to competent state agencies in localities where they make business registration. 2. Film dissemination organizations at public film projection places shall notify in writing competent state agencies of film projection contents and programs under the Government's regulations. Within 5 working days after receiving such notices, if no reply is given, film dissemination organizations may disseminate films at public film projection places. In case of disapproval, they shall issue written replies clearly stating the reason. 3. Organizations and individuals that manage and use public film projection places shall ensure the performance of the obligations specified in Clause 2, Article 18 of this Law and the following provisions : a) Comply with regulations on business activities, conditions for security, social order and safety, health, fire and explosion prevention and fighting, environmental protection and other relevant regulations of law; b/Changing film projection time or scale at a public film projection place at the request of a competent state agency. 4. To encourage the dissemination of films at public film shows to propagate state policies and laws before film shows.
Luật Điện ảnh@23: Dissemination of films serving political tasks in highland, mountainous, border, island, ethnic minority and rural areas 1. The dissemination of films for political tasks in highland, mountainous, border, island, ethnic minority and rural areas is a regular activity under annual plans decided by local administrations and furnished with equipment for film dissemination and means of transport suitable to the practical situation of each locality. 2. The state budget shall cover 100% of expenses for film dissemination in highland, mountainous, border, island and ethnic minority areas; and at least 50% of expenses for film dissemination in rural areas. 3. Cinematographic establishments are encouraged to intensify the application of information technology to film supply for dissemination in highland, mountainous, border, island, ethnic minority and rural areas.
Luật Điện ảnh@24: Film dissemination at offices of foreign diplomatic missions and cultural establishments established in Vietnam The dissemination of films at offices of foreign diplomatic missions or cultural establishments set up in Vietnam to subjects other than officials and employees of such organizations must comply with the following regulations : 1. Comply with international treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory; 2. To exercise the rights and perform the obligations specified in Articles 18 and 22 of this Law.
Luật Điện ảnh@25: Film advertising 1. Organizations and individuals may advertise films through film introductions or information related to films before, during, and during the process of film production, distribution or dissemination in accordance with the advertisement law and may not violate Article 9 of this Law. 2. Organizations and individuals may not show the entire contents of films for advertisement without film classification permits or broadcasting decisions.
Luật Điện ảnh@26: Advertising for products, goods, and services in films Advertisements for products, goods and services in films shall comply with the law provisions on advertisement and other relevant law provisions.
Luật Điện ảnh@27: Issue of film classification license 1. Competence to grant film classification permits is provided as follows : a) The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall issue licenses to classify films popular in cinemas, public cinemas, cyberspace in the cases specified in Point b Clause 2 Article 21 of this Law, at diplomatic missions and foreign cultural institutions established in Vietnam in accordance with Article 24 of this Law; b/Provincial-level People's Committees may grant film classification permits when meeting the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 2. Film classification permits granted by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism or provincial-level People's Committees are valid nationwide. 3. A dossier of application for a film classification license comprises : a/An application for a film classification license, made according to the form set by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b/A copy of the document proving the lawful film ownership or use right; c) Complete film copy; d/A Vietnamese film explanation, for foreign films. 4. The order and procedures for granting film classification permits are specified as follows: a) The applicant shall submit 01 application through the National public service portal, by post or directly to the competent authority specified in Clause 1 of this Article; b/Within 15 days after receiving a complete and valid dossier, a competent state agency shall grant a film classification license, made according to the form set by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism. In case of refusal, it shall issue a written reply clearly stating the reason. In case the film contents must be adjusted or the dossier must be modified and supplemented at the request of a competent state agency specified in Clause 1 of this Article, within 15 days after receiving the adjusted film copy and 10 days after receiving the dossier with all information modified and supplemented, the competent state agency shall grant a license.
Luật Điện ảnh@28: Change the film contents and title in the License to film classification 1. In case of change in contents of films already licensed, organizations and individuals shall apply for re-grant of film classification licenses under Article 27 of this Law. 2. In case of changing the title of a film without changing the contents of the licensed film, the organization or individual shall notify such in writing to the competent state agency that has granted the film classification license. Within 05 working days from the day on which the notification is received, the competent authority shall provide explanation in writing if the application is rejected.
Luật Điện ảnh@29: Revoking License to classify films 1. State agencies competent to grant film classification permits defined in Clause 1, Article 27 of this Law shall decide to revoke film classification permits in the following cases : a) The license to classify films is issued against regulations; b/Information in the dossier of application for a film classification license is forged. 2. Film classification permit-granting agencies and organizations and individuals that have their film classification permits revoked shall remedy violations of Clause 1 of this Article. The application for a film classification license shall be continued after the violations are eliminated in accordance with Article 27 of this Law.
Luật Điện ảnh@30: Stop Popularizing Movies 1. State agencies competent to decide on film dissemination termination are film classification permit-granting agencies, agencies receiving notices of film projection contents and programs at public film projection places or inspection agencies under the Government's regulations. 2. Competent state agencies shall issue decisions to stop the film dissemination, clearly stating the reason for, and time and time limit for, stopping the film dissemination in one of the following cases : a) The organization/individual violates regulations in Article 9 of this Law; b) The ship is damaged due to national defense and security, natural disasters, epidemics or emergency. 3. If wishing to continue disseminating films, organizations shall send written proposals on further dissemination of films to competent state agencies for consideration and decision. Within 5 working days after receiving a written proposal on continued film dissemination, a competent state agency shall consider and decide on the film dissemination and notify in writing the result to the organization that has proposed the film dissemination. 4. Organizations suspended from film dissemination shall publicize the suspension of film dissemination on the mass media and take responsibility for ensuring the interests of concerned organizations and individuals in accordance with law.
Luật Điện ảnh@31: Film appraisal and classification council 1. Competence to set up film appraisal and classification councils is provided as follows : a/The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall set up a film appraisal and classification council of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b/Provincial-level People's Committee chairpersons shall set up film appraisal and classification councils of their provinces or centrally run cities; c/Heads of press agencies possessing television operation licenses shall set up film appraisal and classification councils of their press agencies. 2. Film appraisal and classification councils shall advise competent state agencies before granting film classification permits or broadcasting decisions. A film appraisal and classification council is composed of cinematographic professionals, experts and managers in related fields, ensuring gender equality. 3. The Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall provide for the organization and operation of film appraisal and classification councils.
Luật Điện ảnh@32: Video Classification 1. Films shall be classified according to their contents for dissemination suitable to viewers' age groups or not permitted for dissemination as follows: a/Class P: Films are permitted for dissemination to viewers of all ages; b) T18 (18+) : distributed to viewers aged 18 years or older; c) T16 (16+) : distributed to viewers aged 16 or older: 50%; d) T13 (13+) : distributed to viewers aged 13 or older; dd) Picture of type K: The content is distributed to viewers under 13 years of age with the participation of their parents or guardians; f/Class: Films are not permitted for dissemination. 2. Film classification criteria applicable to film dissemination shall be stipulated by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
Luật Điện ảnh@33: Film Depository 1. Cinematographic establishments having films licensed for film classification shall deposit one copy of each film to the licensing agency. Screenplays and documents enclosed with Vietnamese films funded with the state budget must be submitted. 2. The time limit for deposit of Vietnamese films is 12 months after the date the films are granted film classification permits; the time limit for deposit of imported films complies with the film classification permits. 3. Upon the expiration of the film depository time limit, film depository-receiving agencies have the following responsibilities : a) Transferring unencrypted deposited films, screenplays and other documents enclosed with films to film archive establishments for films produced by Vietnam funded by the State budget; b/Transferring deposited film copies to film archive establishments, for Vietnamese films produced without the state budget; c/Return deposited film copies to film depository establishments, for imported films. 4. Cinematographic establishments shall open film passwords for comparison and checking at the request of film classification permit-granting agencies.
Luật Điện ảnh@34: Movie Storage 1. Film archive establishments of cultural, sports and tourist agencies shall archive Vietnamese films already licensed for film classification. 2. Film archive establishments of press agencies licensed for television operation shall archive films of their agencies or units. 3. Film archive establishments of ministries or branches shall archive internally circulated films; scientific research institutions shall archive their own films.
Luật Điện ảnh@35: Rights and responsibilities of the Film Archive 1. To archive and supply copies, print and extract materials to film owners and competent state agencies in accordance with law. 2. To cooperate with domestic and foreign organizations and individuals in film preservation, storage and restoration; to exploit films under agreements with film owners. 3. Purchasing and receiving valuable films at home and abroad in service of research, teaching and learning activities. 4. To provide archival services; to sell, lease and disseminate archival films as agreed upon with film owners. 5. To ensure safety for film copies, scripts and enclosed documents according to technical standards. 6. To take responsibility before law for assuring intellectual property rights to films archived at their establishments.
Luật Điện ảnh@36: Article 13.-Rights and obligations of film owners in the deposit and archival activities 1. To have film archive establishments ensure safety for film copies, documents and materials accompanying films; to have intellectual property rights protected under law. 2. To decide on the sale, lease, dissemination and use of services related to archival films. 3. To deposit films under Article 33 of this Law. 4. To open film passwords for comparison and examination at the request of competent state agencies.
Luật Điện ảnh@37: Film development promotion contents 1. To promote Vietnamese films, cinematographic environment, film production ecosystem, cultural identity, Vietnamese country and people. 2. To build and promote national, regional, local and enterprise cinematographic brands; to study and develop domestic and foreign cinematographic markets. 3. To conduct propaganda to raise social awareness about cinematography, contributing to ensuring a safe, healthy and civilized cinematographic environment. 4. To mobilize and seek opportunities for, and mobilize resources for, investment in cinematographic development; to diversify film genres and raise the quality of Vietnamese films.
Luật Điện ảnh@38: Film festivals, film awards, film contests, film shows and film weeks in Vietnam 1. Central state agencies, political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations and provincial-level People's Committees may organize specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs and film weeks in Vietnam according to the following regulations : a/Heads of agencies or organizations shall organize film festivals, specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs and film weeks; b/Films participating in film festivals, specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs and film weeks must be granted film classification permits or broadcasting decisions; c/To notify the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism of implementation plans at least 5 working days before the date of organization and implementation results at least 5 working days after the end of a film festival, specialized film festival, theme film festival, film award, film contest, film program or film week. 2. Vietnamese agencies and organizations other than central state agencies, political organizations, socio-political-professional organizations and provincial-level People's Committees may organize specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs and film weeks in Vietnam when satisfying the conditions specified by the Government and complying with Clause 1 of this Article. 3. International organizations, foreign organizations, diplomatic missions and foreign cultural institutions that organize film festivals, specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film awards, film contests, film programs and film weeks in Vietnam shall obtain licenses from the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism. 4. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall assume the prime responsibility for organizing national and international film festivals in Vietnam on a periodical basis. 5. A dossier of application for a license to organize a film festival, specialized film festival, theme film festival, film award, film contest, film program or film week specified in Clause 3 of this Article is specified as follows: a/The dossier comprises : a/A dossier of application for a license to hold a film festival, specialized film festival, theme film festival, film prize or film contest comprises a written application for a license, made according to a form set by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a scheme clearly stating the purpose, significance and criteria, contents, organizational structure, funds, assignment of tasks and organization of implementation; and a charter clearly stating participants, prize structure and composition of the judging panel; b/A dossier of application for a license to organize a film program or film week comprises a written application for a license, made according to a form set by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism; a list of films to be included in a film program or film week; and a copy of the film classification license. 6. The order and procedures for licensing film festivals, specialized film festivals, theme film festivals, film awards, film contests, film programs and film weeks are provided as follows: a) The applicant shall submit 01 application through the national public service portal, by post or directly to the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism; b) Within 15 days from the day on which the satisfactory application is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall issue the license. In case of rejection, a response and explanation shall be provided in writing. If the application must be adjusted or supplemented at the request of the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, within 10 days from the day on which the adjusted or supplemented application is received, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall issue the license. 7. In case of change of the contents specified at Point a, Clause 5 of this Article after being granted a license, the agency or organization shall apply for re-grant of a license under Clauses 5 and 6 of this Article. Within 5 working days after receiving a complete and valid dossier, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall grant a license. 8. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall decide to revoke licenses in the following cases : a) The organization of a film festival, specialized film festival, theme film festival, film award, film competition, film program, or film week violates Article 9 of this Law; b) Information in the application for the license is forged; c) Failing to comply with the contents of the license.
Luật Điện ảnh@39: Organization of Vietnamese film programs and weeks overseas 1. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall organize overseas Vietnamese film programs and film weeks according to plans. 2. Other agencies and organizations that organize overseas Vietnamese film programs or film weeks shall notify in writing Vietnamese diplomatic missions in host countries or localities of the contents and plans of their organization at least 20 days before the date of organization. 3. Vietnamese diplomatic missions in host countries or localities shall support and facilitate the organization of Vietnamese film programs and weekends overseas and notify the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism of inappropriate contents. 4. Heads of agencies and organizations shall be responsible for organizing Vietnamese film programs and film weeks in foreign countries.
Luật Điện ảnh@40: Film contests, film awards, film contests, film shows, film weeks in Vietnam and abroad 1. Films participating in film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film programs or film weeks in Vietnam or abroad are those which have been granted film classification permits or broadcasting decisions. 2. In case rules of an international film festival or film award state that the film to be participated in is a national representative film, the selection of films shall be prescribed and organized by the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism.
Luật Điện ảnh@41: Preferential regime for foreign organizations using film production services in Vietnam Foreign organizations producing films with the setting shot in Vietnam and film production services provided by Vietnamese organizations are entitled to tax incentives under the tax law.
Luật Điện ảnh@42: ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE FUND FOR DISTRIBUTION OF COMMERCIAL DEVELOPMENT 1. Cinematographic development support fund means an extra-budgetary state financial fund which is funded with charter capital by the State, established and operates under law; has independent financial capacity; has revenue and spending sources not identical to those of the state budget; has the legal person status, its own seal and account, and is established under the Prime Minister's decision and its organization and operation charter is approved. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Điện ảnh@43: Purpose of the Cinematographic Development Assistance Fund 1. Supporting projects on production of experimental films, first-time films and films of young authors. 2. To support authors, film production projects and outstanding Vietnamese films participating in overseas film festivals, film prizes, film contests, film fairs, film programs and film weeks. 3. To support other activities for cinematographic development.
Luật Điện ảnh@44: The operation principles of the Cinematographic Development Assistance Fund 1. Not for profit; preserve charter capital and self-finance management expenses. 2. To conduct revenues, expenditures, final settlement, publicity of finance, assets and accounting work according to law provisions. 3. To submit to the state examination, inspection and audit of activities of the Cinematographic Development Assistance Fund. 4. To ensure publicity, transparency, thrift, efficiency and proper use for proper purposes and in accordance with law, not overlap with state budget allocations for cinematographic non-business activities. The Fund does not support state budget-funded film production projects. 5. The previous year's fund balance of the Cinematographic Development Assistance Fund shall be carried forward to the subsequent year for further use.
Luật Điện ảnh@45: The responsibility for state management of cinematography of the Government and the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism 1. The Government performs the unified state management of cinematography. 2. The Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism shall assist the Government in performing the state management of cinematography and have the following responsibilities : a/To promulgate or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation, and organize the implementation of, policies and legal documents on cinematography, strategies and plans on cinematographic development; b/To provide information on, propagate, disseminate and educate in the cinematography law; c/To formulate national standards and technical regulations on cinematographic activities; statistical indicator systems and cinematography database; d/Training, retraining and development of cinematographic human resources; e/To enter into international cooperation in cinematographic activities; to promote and promote cinematographic development at home and abroad; f/To research into and apply science and technology to cinematographic activities; g/To grant and withdraw permits in cinematographic activities; to stop the dissemination of films according to its competence; h/To perform emulation and commendation work in cinematographic activities; i/To inspect, examine, settle complaints and denunciations and handle violations of law in cinematographic activities according to its competence.
Luật Điện ảnh@46: Ministries and ministerial-level agencies' responsibilities for state management of cinematography Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, coordinate with the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism in performing the state management of cinematography.
Luật Điện ảnh@47: The responsibilities of People's Committees at all levels for state management of cinematography 1. People's Committees at all levels shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the state management of cinematography in their localities; ensure security, social order and safety, health, fire and explosion prevention and fighting and environmental protection at film production, distribution and dissemination places. 2. Provincial-level People's Committees shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the tasks specified in Clause 1 of this Article and the following tasks : a/To formulate, promulgate and implement cinematographic development plans suitable to local realities; b/To promulgate or submit to competent state agencies for promulgation support and attraction policies in order to facilitate cinematographic development in their localities; c/Investing in cinematographic development; building, consolidation and consolidation of film distribution and dissemination organizations and activities in localities; d/To receive and reply to notices of film dissemination at public film projection places under their management; e/To grant and withdraw film classification permits and stop the dissemination of films according to its competence; f/To inspect, examine, settle complaints and denunciations and handle violations of law in cinematographic activities according to its competence.
Luật Điện ảnh@48: Amendments to the Law on Investment No. 61/2020/QH14 amended by the Law No. 72/2020/QH14 and the Law No. 03/2022/QH15 Section 192 of Appendix IV - List of conditional business lines enclosed with the Law on Investment No. 61/2020/QH14 amended by the Law No. 72/2020/QH14 and the Law No. 03/2022/QH15 is amended as follows: 192 Film dissemination services business
Luật Điện ảnh@49: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2023. 2. The Law on Cinematography No. 62/2006/QH11, which was amended by the Law No. 31/2009/QH12, the Law No. 35/2018/QH14 and the Law No. 61/2020/QH14, shall be annulled from the effective date of this Law.
Luật Điện ảnh@50: Transitional provisions 1. Film dissemination permits and broadcasting decisions issued under the Law on Cinematography No. 62/2006/QH11, which was amended and supplemented under Law No. 31/2009/QH12, Law No. 35/2018/QH14 and Law No. 61/2020/QH14, shall continue to be valid under these permits and broadcasting decisions. Licenses for cooperation or joint venture in film production or provision of film production services for foreign organizations and individuals issued under the Law on Cinematography No. 62/2006/QH11 amended by the Law No. 31/2009/QH12, the Law No. 35/2018/QH14 and the Law No. 61/2020/QH14 shall remain effective until the expiry date of the license. 2. For films which have been granted film dissemination permits or broadcasting decisions but have not yet been warned and displayed film classification levels to viewers under regulations of the Minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism, within one year after this Law takes effect, they shall additionally warn and display film classification levels to viewers in case of continued dissemination. Luật Trọng tài thương mại@1: Scope This Law provides for the competence of commercial arbitration, forms of arbitration, arbitration institutions and arbitrators; arbitration order and procedures; rights, obligations and responsibilities of parties in arbitral proceedings; courts' competence to conduct arbitral activities; organization and operation of foreign arbitrations in Vietnam, and enforcement of arbitral awards.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@2: Arbitration's jurisdiction to settle disputes 1. Disputes between parties arising from commercial activities. 2. Disputes arising between parties, of which at least one party conducts commercial activities. 3. Other disputes between parties which, as prescribed by law, shall be settled by arbitration.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@3: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Commercial arbitration means a mode of dispute settlement agreed upon by the parties and conducted in accordance with this Law. 2. Arbitration agreement means an agreement between the parties on the arbitration of a dispute which may arise or has arisen. 3. Disputing parties are Vietnamese or foreign individuals, agencies and organizations participating in arbitral proceedings as plaintiffs or defendants. 4. Dispute involving foreign elements means a dispute arising in commercial or other legal relations involving foreign elements as prescribed in the Civil Code. 5. Arbitrator means a person selected by the parties or appointed by an arbitration center or a court to settle a dispute under this Law. 6. Institutional arbitration means a form of dispute settlement at an arbitration center under this Law and rules of proceedings of such arbitration center. 7. Ad hoc arbitration means a form of dispute settlement under this Law and the order and procedures agreed upon by the parties. 8. Venue for dispute settlement means a place where the arbitration council settles disputes as agreed upon by the parties or decided by the arbitration council if the parties have no agreement thereon. If the venue for dispute settlement is located in the Vietnamese territory, the award must be regarded as being pronounced in Vietnam regardless of the place where the arbitration council holds a meeting to issue such award. 9. Arbitration decision means a decision of the arbitration council in the course of dispute settlement. 10. Arbitral award means a decision of the arbitration council to settle the whole content of a dispute and terminate arbitral proceedings. 11. Foreign arbitration means an arbitration established under the foreign arbitration law and selected by the parties to settle disputes outside or within the Vietnamese territory. 12. Foreign arbitral award means an award issued by a foreign arbitrator outside or within the Vietnamese territory for dispute settlement as agreed upon by the parties.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@4: Principles of dispute resolution by arbitration 1. An arbitrator shall respect the agreement of the parties provided that such agreement does not violate prohibitions and contravene social ethics. 2. Arbitrators must be independent, objective, impartial and comply with law. 3. Disputing parties are equal in rights and obligations. The arbitration council shall create conditions for them to exercise their rights and perform their obligations. 4. Dispute settlement by arbitration shall be conducted in an open manner, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 5. Arbitral awards are final.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@5: Conditions for dispute settlement by arbitration 1. Disputes shall be settled by arbitration if the parties reach arbitration agreements. Arbitration agreements may be made before or after disputes occur. 2. In case a party to an arbitration agreement being an individual dies or loses his/her act capacity, the arbitration agreement remains valid for his/her heir or at-law representative, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 3. In case a party to an arbitration agreement being an organization has to terminate its operation, go bankrupt, dissolve, consolidate, merge, divide, split up or transform its organization, the arbitration agreement remains valid for the organization that takes over its rights and obligations, unless otherwise agreed by the parties.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@6: The court shall refuse to accept the case in case of an arbitration agreement In case the disputing parties have reached an arbitration agreement but one party initiates a lawsuit at court, the court shall refuse to accept the case, unless the arbitration agreement is invalid or cannot be implemented.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@7: DETERMINATION OF THE COUNTRY AUTHORITIES WHICH ARE AUTHORIZED FOR ARTICLES 1. In case the parties have agreed to select a specific court, the competent court is the court selected by the parties. 2. In case the parties do not agree to select a court, the jurisdiction of the court shall be determined as follows: a/For the designation of arbitrators to set up ad hoc arbitration councils, the competent court is the court of the place in which the defendant resides, for individuals, or the place in which the defendant is headquartered, for organizations. In case there are many defendants, the competent court is the court of the place in which one of these defendants resides or is headquartered. If the defendant has a residence or office in a foreign country, the competent court is the court of the place where the plaintiff resides or is headquartered; b/For the replacement of arbitrators of an ad hoc arbitration council, the competent court is the court in the place in which the arbitration council settles the dispute; c/For a request for settlement of a complaint about an arbitration council's decision on an invalid arbitration agreement, an irrevocable arbitration agreement or the arbitration council's jurisdiction, the competent court is the court in the place in which the arbitration council issues the decision; d) Regarding a request for evidence collection by a court, the competent court is the court where the evidence to be collected is available; dd) For a request for application of a provisional emergency measure, the competent court is the court in the place in which such measure should be applied; e) The court in charge of summoning witnesses shall be the court in the place where witnesses reside; g/For a request for cancellation of an arbitral award or registration of an ad hoc arbitral award, the competent court is the court in the place in which the arbitration council has pronounced the arbitral award. 3. Courts competent to conduct arbitration activities specified in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article are provincial-level People's Courts.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@8: To identify judgment enforcement agencies competent to enforce arbitral awards or arbitral tribunal decisions on application of interim urgent measures. 1. Civil judgment enforcement agencies competent to enforce arbitral awards are civil judgment enforcement agencies of provinces or centrally run cities in which arbitration councils issue arbitral awards. 2. Civil judgment enforcement agencies competent to enforce arbitral tribunal decisions on application of interim urgent measures are civil judgment enforcement agencies of provinces or centrally run cities in which interim urgent measures should be applied.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@9: Negotiation and conciliation in arbitral proceedings During arbitral proceedings, the parties may freely negotiate and reach agreement on the settlement of their dispute or request the arbitration council to conciliate them so that they can reach agreement on the settlement of their dispute.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@10: Language 1. For disputes involving no foreign elements, the language used in major procedures shall be : Article 10.-The Vietnamese language used in the dispute is Vietnamese, except for cases where at least one party is a foreign-invested enterprise. In cases where the disputing party cannot use Vietnamese, it may choose a Vietnamese interpreter. 2. For disputes involving foreign elements or disputes involving at least one party being a foreign-invested enterprise, the language used in arbitral proceedings shall be agreed upon by the parties. If the parties have no agreement, the language used in arbitral proceedings shall be decided by the arbitration council.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@11: Venue for dispute resolution by arbitration 1. The parties may agree on a dispute settlement place; if there is no agreement, the arbitration council shall decide on such place. A dispute settlement place may be within or outside the Vietnamese territory. 2. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties, the arbitration council may hold a meeting at a place considered appropriate for the exchange of opinions among its members, the taking of testimonies of witnesses, consultation with experts or assessment of goods, property or other documents.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@12: Sending notifications and the order of sending notifications Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, the method and order of sending notices in arbitral proceedings are specified as follows: 1. The written explanations, transaction documents and other documents of each party must be sent to the arbitration center or arbitration council in a sufficient number so that each member of the arbitration council has one copy, the other has one copy and one copy is kept at the arbitration center; 2. Notices and documents sent by the arbitration center or arbitration council to the parties shall be sent to the addresses of the parties or to their representatives at the addresses notified by the parties; 3. Notices and documents may be sent by the arbitration center or arbitration council directly, by registered mail, by fax, telex, telegram, email or another method with the sending certification; 4. Notices and documents sent by the arbitration center or arbitration council are regarded as having been received on the date the parties or their representatives received them or regarded as having received them if such notices and documents have been sent in accordance with Clause 2 of this Article; 5. The time limit for receipt of notices and documents shall be counted from the date following the date of being considered the receipt of notices and documents. If the following date is a holiday or a day-off prescribed by the country or territory where the notices and documents have been received, this time limit shall start from the following first working day. If the last day of this time limit is a holiday or a day-off prescribed by the country or territory where the notices and documents have been received, the expiry date shall be the end of the following first working day.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@13: Loss of Objection In case a party detects a violation of this Law or the arbitration agreement but continues conducting arbitral procedures and does not protest against the violation within the time limit prescribed by this Law, it will lose the right to protest at the arbitration or court.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@14: The Law on Dispute Settlement, 1. For disputes involving no foreign elements, arbitration councils shall apply Vietnamese law to settle them. 2. For a dispute involving foreign elements, the arbitration council shall apply the law selected by the parties. If the parties fail to reach agreement on the applicable law, the arbitration council shall decide to apply the law it deems most appropriate. 3. In case Vietnamese law or a law selected by the parties does not provide specific provisions on the dispute, the arbitration council may apply international practices to settle the dispute if such application or consequences of such application are not contrary to basic principles of Vietnamese law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@15: State management of arbitration 1. The State management over arbitration covers the following contents: a/To promulgate and guide the implementation of legal documents on arbitration; b/To grant and withdraw establishment licenses and operation registration certificates of arbitration centers; branches and representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam; c/To publicize lists of arbitrators of arbitration institutions operating in Vietnam; d/To propagate and disseminate the arbitration law; to enter into international cooperation in arbitration; to guide the training and retraining of arbitrators; e/To examine, inspect and handle violations of the arbitration legislation; e) Settle complaints and denunciations related to the activities specified in Points b, c, d and dd of this Clause. 2. The Government shall perform the unified state management of arbitration. 3. The Ministry of Justice shall take responsibility before the Government for performing the state management of arbitration. 4. Departments of Justice of provinces and central-affiliated cities shall assist the Ministry of Justice in performing a number of tasks as prescribed by the Government and this Law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@16: Forms of arbitration agreement 1. An arbitration agreement may be established in the form of an arbitration clause in a contract or in a separate agreement. 2. An arbitration agreement must be made in writing. The following forms of agreement are also regarded as being made in writing: a/Agreement made through communication between the parties by telegram, fax, telex, email or other forms as prescribed by law; b) The agreement is made through exchange of information in writing between the parties; c) The agreement is recorded in writing by a lawyer, notary or competent organization at the request of the parties; d/In the transaction, the parties refer to a document expressing the arbitration agreement such as contract, document, company charter and other similar documents; e/Through exchange of petitions and self-defense statements which show the existence of agreements reached by one party and not denied by the other.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@17: Consumer right to choose dispute resolution method For disputes between goods and service suppliers and consumers, although arbitration clauses have been noted in general conditions on goods and service provision drafted by suppliers in arbitration agreements, consumers may choose arbitration or courts to settle their disputes. Goods and service suppliers may initiate lawsuits at arbitration only when so approved by consumers.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@18: Arbitration Agreement Invalid 1. Disputes arising in the domains falling beyond the arbitration's jurisdiction specified in Article 2 of this Law. 2. The arbitration agreement maker has no competence as prescribed by law. 3. The arbitration agreement maker has no civil act capacity under the Civil Code. 4. The form of the arbitration agreement is incompliant with Article 16 of this Law. 5. One of the parties is deceived, intimidated or coerced in the course of establishing an arbitration agreement and requests declaration of such arbitration agreement to be invalid. 6. The arbitration agreement violates a law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@19: Independence of arbitration agreement An arbitration agreement is independent of the contract. The modification, extension or cancellation of a contract or the invalid or unrealizable contract does not invalidate the arbitration agreement.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@20: Standards of arbitrators 1. Persons who fully meet the following criteria may act as arbitrators: a) Having full civil act capacity as prescribed by the Civil Code; b/Possessing a university degree and having worked in the discipline for 5 years or more; c/In special cases, experts who have high professional qualifications and practical experiences but fail to satisfy the requirements specified at Point b of this Clause may also be selected as arbitrators. 2. Persons who fully meet the criteria prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article but fall into one of the following cases shall not be allowed to act as arbitrators: a/Persons who are judges, procurators, investigators, executors or civil servants of people's courts, people's procuracies, investigation agencies or judgment enforcement agencies; b) Persons who are suspects, defendants, serving criminal sentences or have completely served their sentences but have not had their criminal records expunged. 3. Arbitration centers may additionally set criteria higher than those specified in Clause 1 of this Article for their arbitrators.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@21: Rights and obligations of arbitrators 1. Accept or refuse to settle disputes. 2. To be independent in dispute settlement. 3. To refuse to supply information related to the dispute. 4. To enjoy remuneration. 5. To keep confidential contents of disputes they settle, except for cases in which information must be provided to competent state agencies under law. 6. Ensuring impartial, quick and timely settlement of disputes. 7. To observe the rules of professional ethics.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@22: The Referees' Association An arbitration association is a socio-professional organization of arbitrators and arbitration centers nationwide. The establishment and operation of an arbitration association comply with the law on professional associations.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@23: Functions of the Arbitration Center Arbitration centers have the function to organize and coordinate dispute settlement by statute arbitration and provide administrative, office and other supports for arbitrators in the course of arbitral proceedings.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@24: Conditions and procedures for establishment of arbitration centers 1. An arbitration center shall be established when it is established by at least five founding members being Vietnamese citizens who fully satisfy the conditions for being an arbitrator specified in Article 20 of this Law and are granted an establishment license by the Minister of Justice. 2. A dossier of request for establishment of an arbitration center comprises : a) An application form for establishment; b/A draft charter of the arbitration center, made according to the form promulgated by the Ministry of Justice; c/A list of founders and enclosed papers evidencing their satisfaction of the conditions specified in Article 20 of this Law. 3. Within 30 days after receiving a complete and valid dossier, the Minister of Justice shall grant an arbitration center establishment license and approve its charter. In case of refusal, he/she shall issue a written reply clearly stating the reason.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@25: Registration of the Arbitration Center Within 30 days after receiving its establishment license, an arbitration center shall register its operation with the provincial-level Justice Department of the locality where it is headquartered. Past this time limit, if the arbitration center fails to register its operation, its license will be invalidated. Within 15 days after receiving a registration request, the provincial-level Justice Department shall grant an operation registration certificate to the arbitration center.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@26: ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE AUTHORITY 1. Within 30 days after being granted an operation registration paper, an arbitration center shall publish on a central daily or a newspaper of the locality where it registers its operation for three consecutive issues the following principal contents : a/Name and address of the arbitration center's head office; b/The field of operation of the arbitration center; c) Number of the Certificate of operation registration, issuing authority, date of issue; d/Time of commencement of operation of the arbitration center. 2. An arbitration center shall post up at its head office the contents specified in Clause 1 of this Article and the list of its arbitrators.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@27: Legal status and structure of arbitration centers 1. Arbitration centers have the legal person status and their own seals and accounts. 2. Arbitration centers operate for non-profit purposes. 3. Arbitration centers may set up branches and representative offices at home and abroad. 4. An arbitration center has an executive board and a secretary board. The structure and apparatus of an arbitration center are specified in its charter. The arbitration center's executive board is composed of the chairman, one or several vice chairmen and may have a secretary general appointed by the arbitration center's chairman. The arbitration center's chairman is an arbitrator. 5. An arbitration center has a list of arbitrators.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@28: Rights and obligations of arbitration centers 1. To elaborate their charters and rules of proceedings in accordance with this Law. 2. To formulate criteria for arbitrators and the process of selecting and listing arbitrators and deleting names of arbitrators from their lists of arbitrators. 3. To send the list of arbitrators and changes in the list of arbitrators of arbitration centers to the Ministry of Justice for announcement. 4. To designate arbitrators to establish arbitration councils in the cases specified in this Law. 5. To provide arbitration and conciliation services and other modes of settlement of commercial disputes in accordance with law. 6. To provide administrative, office and other services for dispute settlement. 7. To collect arbitration charges and other lawful amounts related to arbitration activities. 8. To pay remuneration and other expenses to arbitrators. 9. To organize refresher courses for arbitrators to improve their dispute settlement qualifications and skills. 10. To annually report on the operation of their arbitration centers to provincial-level Justice Departments with which they have registered their operation. 11. To archive dossiers and supply copies of arbitral awards at the request of disputing parties or competent state agencies.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@29: Termination of operation of arbitration centers 1. An arbitration center shall terminate its operation in the following cases: a/Cases specified in the arbitration center's charter; b) The establishment license or the Certificate of operation registration is revoked. 2. The Government shall specify cases in which establishment licenses or operation registration papers of arbitration centers are revoked and the order and procedures for termination of operation of arbitration centers.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@30: The lawsuit petition and enclosed documents 1. In case a dispute is settled at an arbitration center, the plaintiff shall file a lawsuit petition with the arbitration center. In case the dispute is settled by ad hoc arbitration, the plaintiff shall file a lawsuit petition and send it to the defendant. 2. A lawsuit petition contains the following details: a/Date of making the lawsuit petition; b) Names and addresses of the parties; names and addresses of witnesses, if any; c/Summary of the dispute; d/Grounds and evidence for initiating the lawsuit, if any; e/Specific requests of the plaintiff and the value of the dispute; f/Name and address of the person selected by the plaintiff as arbitrator or proposed by the plaintiff to be appointed as arbitrator. 3. Enclosed with the lawsuit petition must be the arbitration agreement and the originals or copies of relevant documents.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@31: Commencement of arbitral proceedings 1. In case a dispute is settled at an arbitration center, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, the time of starting arbitral proceedings is the time the arbitration center receives the plaintiff's petition. 2. In case a dispute is settled by ad hoc arbitration, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, the time of starting arbitral proceedings is the time the defendant receives the plaintiff's petition.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@32: Notification of the petition Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, within 10 days after receiving the lawsuit petition, enclosed documents and arbitration charge advance payment documents, the arbitration center shall send to the defendant copies of the plaintiff's lawsuit petition and documents specified in Clause 3, Article 30 of this Law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@33: Article 17.-Statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits for dispute settlement by arbitration Unless otherwise provided by specialized laws, the statute of limitations for initiating lawsuits according to arbitral procedures is 2 years from the time when lawful rights and interests are infringed upon.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@34: Arbitration fees 1. Arbitration charge means a revenue from the provision of dispute settlement services by arbitration. Arbitration charge includes : a/Remuneration, travel expenses and other expenses for arbitrators; b/Charge for expert consultation and other supports at the request of the arbitration council; c) Administrative fees; d/Charge for designation of ad hoc arbitrators by arbitration centers at the request of disputing parties; e/Charges for use of other utility services provided by the arbitration center. 2. The arbitration charge shall be set by the arbitration center. In case a dispute is settled by ad hoc arbitration, the arbitration charge shall be set by the arbitration council. 3. The losing party shall bear arbitration charges, unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the rules of arbitral proceedings or allocated by the arbitration council.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@35: Self - protection and submission of self - protection 1. A self-defense statement contains the following details: a) The date of making the self-defense statement; b) Name and address of the defendant; c) Self-defense bases and evidences, if any; d/Name and address of the person whom the defendant selects as arbitrator or requests designation as arbitrator. 2. For a dispute to be settled at an arbitration center, unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, within 30 days after receiving the petition and enclosed documents, the defendant shall send to the arbitration center a self-defense statement. At the request of one party or all parties, this time limit may be extended by the arbitration center based on specific circumstances of the dispute. 3. For disputes settled by ad hoc arbitration, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, within 30 days after receiving the plaintiffs' lawsuit petitions and enclosed documents, the defendants shall send to the plaintiffs and arbitrators the self-defense statement, names and addresses of the persons they have selected to act as arbitrators. 4. If the defendant believes that the dispute does not fall under the arbitration's jurisdiction, there is no arbitration agreement, the arbitration agreement is invalid or cannot be implemented, such must be clearly stated in the self-defense statement. 5. In case the defendant fails to submit the self-defense statement as prescribed in Clause 2 and Clause 3 of this Article, the dispute shall still be settled.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@36: Defendants' countersuit 1. Defendants are entitled to re-claim plaintiffs regarding matters related to disputes. 2. The defendant's counter-petition shall be sent to the arbitration center. In case a dispute is settled by ad hoc arbitration, the counter-petition shall be sent to the arbitration council and the plaintiff. The counter-petition shall be filed simultaneously with the submission of the self-defense statement. 3. Within 30 days after receiving a counter-petition, the plaintiff shall send a self-defense statement to the arbitration center. If the dispute is settled by ad hoc arbitration, the plaintiff shall send a self-defense statement to the arbitration council and the defendant. 4. The arbitration council settling the plaintiffs' lawsuits shall settle counter-claims in accordance with this Law on the order and procedures for settling plaintiffs' lawsuits.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@37: Withdrawal of petitions or re-claims; amendment and supplementation of petitions, re-claims or self-defense statements Before the arbitration council issues an arbitral award, the parties may withdraw their petitions or re-petitions. 2. In the course of arbitral proceedings, the parties may modify or supplement their petitions, counter-claims or self-defense statements. The arbitration council may reject these modifications or supplementations if seeing that they may be abused to cause difficulties or delay the issuance of arbitral awards or fall beyond the scope of the arbitration agreement applicable to the dispute.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@38: Negotiation in arbitral proceedings From the time of starting arbitral proceedings, the parties may negotiate and agree to terminate the dispute settlement by themselves. In case the parties reach agreement on termination of dispute settlement, they may request the arbitration center's chairman to issue a decision to terminate the dispute settlement.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@39: Members of the arbitration council 1. An arbitration council may be composed of one or more arbitrators as agreed upon by the parties. 2. In case the parties have no agreement on the number of arbitrators, the arbitration council is composed of three arbitrators.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@40: ON THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE AUTHORITY COUNCIL IN THE AUTHORITY Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, the establishment of an arbitration council is specified as follows: 1. Within 30 days after receiving the lawsuit petition and request for Trọng If the defendant fails to select an arbitrator or request the arbitration center's chairman to designate an arbitrator, within 7 days after the expiration of the time limit specified in this Clause, the arbitration center's chairman shall designate an arbitrator for the defendant; 2. For a dispute involving many defendants, within 30 days after receiving a lawsuit petition sent by the arbitration center, the defendants shall agree to select an arbitrator or request designation of an arbitrator. If the defendants cannot select an arbitrator, within 7 days after the expiration of the time limit specified in this Clause, the arbitration center's chairman shall designate an arbitrator for the defendants; 3. Within 15 days after arbitrators are selected by the parties or designated by the arbitration center's chairman, these arbitrators shall elect another arbitrator to act as the arbitration council's chairman. Past this time limit, if the election cannot be conducted, within 7 days after the expiration of the time limit specified in this Clause, the arbitration center's chairman shall designate the arbitration council's chairman; 4. In case the parties agree that the dispute will be settled by a sole arbitrator but fail to select an arbitrator within 30 days after the defendant receives the petition, at the request of one or all parties and within 15 days after receiving such request, the arbitration center's chairman shall designate a sole arbitrator.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@41: ON THE SETTING UP OF ACADEMIC COUNCILS Unless otherwise agreed by the parties, the establishment of an ad hoc arbitration council is specified as follows: 1. Within 30 days after receiving the plaintiffs' lawsuit petitions, the defendants must select arbitrators and notify the plaintiffs of the arbitrators they have selected. Past this time limit, if the defendants fail to notify the plaintiffs of the names of the arbitrators they have selected and the parties do not otherwise agree on the designation of arbitrators, the plaintiffs may request competent courts to designate arbitrators for the defendants; 2. In case a dispute involves many defendants, the defendants shall agree to select an arbitrator within 30 days after receiving the plaintiff's petition and enclosed documents. Past this time limit, if the defendants cannot select an arbitrator and the parties do not otherwise agree on the designation of an arbitrator, one party or all parties may request a competent court to designate an arbitrator for the defendants; 3. Within 15 days after being selected by the parties or designated by the court, arbitrators shall elect another arbitrator to act as chairman of the arbitration council. If the arbitration council chairman cannot be elected and the parties have no other agreement, they may request a competent court to designate the chairman; 4.
