In case the parties agree that the dispute will be settled by a sole arbitrator but fail to select an arbitrator within 30 days after the defendant receives the petition, if the parties fail to agree to request an arbitration center to designate an arbitrator, the competent court shall designate a sole arbitrator at the request of one party or all parties. 5. Within 7 days after receiving the parties' requests specified in Clauses 1,2,3 and 4 of this Article, the chief judge of the competent court shall assign a judge to designate an arbitrator and notify such to the parties.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@42: Change of Arbitrator 1. An arbitrator shall refuse to settle a dispute and the parties may request change of an arbitrator to settle the dispute in the following cases : a/The arbitrator is a relative or representative of a party; b/The arbitrator has related interests in the dispute; c/There are clear grounds showing that the arbitrator is not impartial and objective; d/Having worked as a conciliator, representative or lawyer of any party before bringing the dispute to arbitration for settlement, unless it is so agreed in writing by the parties. 2. After being selected or designated, an arbitrator shall notify in writing the arbitration center or arbitration council and the parties of circumstances which may affect his/her objectivity and impartiality. 3. For a dispute settled at an arbitration center, if the arbitration council has not yet been set up, the arbitration center's chairman shall decide to change the arbitrator. If the arbitration council has been set up, the change of the arbitrator shall be decided by the remaining members of the arbitration council. In case the remaining members of the arbitration council cannot decide on the change or if the arbitrators or the sole arbitrator refuse to settle the dispute, the arbitration center's chairman shall decide on the change of the arbitrator. 4. For disputes settled by ad hoc arbitration councils, the replacement of arbitrators shall be decided by the remaining members of the arbitration council. In case the remaining members of the arbitration council cannot decide on the replacement or if the arbitrators or the sole arbitrator refuse to settle the dispute, within 15 days after receiving a request of one or more of the arbitrators or of one or more of the disputing parties, the president of a competent court shall assign a judge to decide on the replacement of the arbitrator. 5. Decisions of the arbitration center's chairman or the court, for the cases specified in Clauses 3 and 4 of this Article, are final. 6. In case an arbitrator cannot continue participating in dispute settlement due to a force majeure event or objective obstacles or is replaced, the selection or designation of a substitute arbitrator must comply with the order and procedures specified in this Law. 7. After consulting the parties, the newly established arbitration council may reconsider matters raised at its previous dispute settlement meetings.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@43: The arbitration council's competence to consider an invalid arbitration agreement or an irrevocable arbitration agreement 1. Before considering the contents of a dispute, the arbitration council shall consider the effect of the arbitration agreement, whether or not the arbitration agreement can be implemented and its competence. If the dispute falls within its settling competence, the arbitration council shall settle it in accordance with this Law. If the dispute does not fall within its settling competence and the arbitration agreement is invalid or the arbitration agreement cannot be implemented, the arbitration council shall decide to terminate the settlement and immediately notify the parties thereof. 2. In the course of dispute settlement, if detecting that the arbitration council is beyond its competence, the parties may lodge a complaint with the arbitration council. The arbitration council shall consider and make a decision. 3. In case the parties have agreed to settle disputes at a specific arbitration center but this arbitration center has terminated its operation without an arbitration institution inheriting it, the parties may agree to select another arbitration center. If they fail to reach agreement thereon, they may initiate a lawsuit at a court for settlement. 4. In case the parties have agreed upon in detail the selection of an ad hoc arbitrator but the arbitrator cannot participate in settling the dispute at the time of dispute occurrence due to force majeure circumstances or objective obstacles, the parties may agree to select another arbitrator to replace them. If they fail to reach agreement, they may initiate a lawsuit at court for settlement. 5. In case the parties have reached an arbitration agreement but fail to specify the form of arbitration or cannot identify a specific arbitration institution, when a dispute arises, the parties shall re-agree with the form of arbitration or the specific arbitration institution for dispute settlement. If they fail to agree, the selection of the form or the specific arbitration institution for dispute settlement shall be decided at the plaintiff's request.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@44: Complaints and settlement of complaints about decisions of arbitration councils on the non-existence of arbitral agreements, invalid arbitral agreements, unrealizable arbitral agreements, competence of arbitration councils 1. In case of disagreeing with an arbitration council's decision specified in Article 43 of this Law, within 5 working days after receiving such decision, the parties may file a written request with a competent court for re-considering the arbitration council's decision. The complainant shall concurrently notify the arbitration council of the complaint. 2. A complaint must contain the following principal details: a) Date of making the complaint; b) Name and address of the complainant; c) The contents of the request. 3. A complaint must be enclosed with a copy of the lawsuit petition, arbitration agreement and arbitration council's decision. Enclosed papers in a foreign language must be translated into Vietnamese and lawfully certified. 4. Within 5 working days after receiving a complaint, the president of a competent court shall assign a judge to consider and settle the complaint. Within 10 working days after being assigned, the judge shall consider and make a decision. The court decision is final. 5. While the court settles the complaint, the arbitration council may continue settling the dispute. 6. If the court decides that the dispute falls beyond the arbitration council's jurisdiction, there is no arbitration agreement, the arbitration agreement is invalid or unrealizable, the arbitration council shall issue a decision to terminate the dispute settlement. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties, they may initiate a lawsuit at court. The statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit at court is determined under law. The period from the date the plaintiff initiates a lawsuit at arbitration to the date the court issues a decision to accept the dispute for settlement is not included in the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@45: The arbitration council's competence to verify matters In the course of dispute settlement, the arbitration council may meet or exchange opinions with the parties in the presence of the other party in appropriate forms to clarify matters related to the dispute. The arbitration council may itself or at the request of one or more parties inquire into the matter from a third party in the presence of the parties or after informing the parties thereof.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@46: The arbitration council's competence to collect evidence 1. The parties have the right and obligation to provide evidence to the arbitration council to prove matters related to the disputed contents. 2. At the request of one party or all parties, the arbitration council may request witnesses to provide information and documents related to dispute settlement. 3. The arbitration council may itself or at the request of one party or all parties request assessment and valuation of assets in a dispute to serve as a basis for dispute settlement. Assessment and valuation charges shall be advanced by the assessment or valuation requester or allocated by the arbitration council. 4. The arbitration council may consult experts by itself or at the request of one or all parties. Expert expenses shall be advanced by the consultation requester or allocated by the arbitration council. 5. In case the arbitration council, one party or all parties have applied necessary measures to collect evidence but cannot collect evidence by themselves, they may send written requests to competent courts for request of agencies, organizations and individuals to supply readable, audible or visible documents or other exhibits related to the dispute. Such a request must clearly state the contents of the dispute being settled at the arbitration, evidence to be collected, reasons for the failure to collect evidence, names and addresses of agencies, organizations and individuals that are managing or keeping such evidence. 6. Within 07 working days from the receipt of the evidence collection request, the chief judge shall assign a Judge to consider the request. Within 05 working days from the date on which the Judge is assigned, the Judge shall request the organization or individual that manages or keeps the evidence to provide evidence for the Court and send the request to the Procuracy at the same level to perform the functions and tasks prescribed by law. Agencies, organizations and individuals that are managing or keeping evidence shall fully and promptly supply evidence at the request of courts within 15 days after receiving such request. Within 5 working days after receiving evidence provided by an agency, organization or individual, the court shall notify such to the arbitration council and requester for evidence delivery and receipt. Past the prescribed time limit, if agencies, organizations or individuals fail to supply evidence as requested, the court shall promptly notify such to the arbitration council and requester and concurrently request in writing competent agencies or organizations to handle the case in accordance with law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@47: AUTHORITY 'S COMPETENCE TO SUBMIT THEIR WORKERS 1. At the request of one party or all parties and when deeming it necessary, the arbitration council may request witnesses to be present at the dispute settlement meeting. Witness expenses shall be borne by the requester or allocated by the arbitration council. 2. In case a witness who has been duly summoned by the arbitration council fails to attend the meeting without a plausible reason and his/her absence obstructs the dispute settlement, the arbitration council shall send a written request to a competent court for issuing a decision to summon the witness to the arbitration council's meeting. Such request must clearly state the case being settled at the arbitration center; full name and address of the witness; reason for summoning the witness; and time and place for the witness to attend. 3. Within 7 working days after receiving the arbitration council's written request for summoning of a witness, the president of the competent court shall assign a judge to consider and settle the request. Within 5 working days after being assigned, the judge shall issue a decision to summon the witness. A decision to summon witnesses must clearly state the name of the arbitration council requesting the summon; the dispute; full name and address of the witness; and time and place for the witness to be present at the request of the arbitration council. The court shall promptly send this decision to the arbitration council and witnesses and concurrently to the same-level procuracy for the latter to perform its functions and tasks in accordance with law. Witnesses are obliged to strictly execute court decisions. Witness expenses comply with Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@48: The right to request the application of provisional emergency measures 1. Disputing parties may request arbitration councils or courts to apply interim urgent measures in accordance with this Law and relevant laws, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 2. The request for application of provisional urgent measures by a court is not regarded as rejection of the arbitration agreement or waiver of the right to dispute settlement by arbitration.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@49: Competence of arbitration councils to apply interim urgent measures 1. At the request of one of the parties, the arbitration council may apply one or several interim urgent measures to the disputing parties. 2. Provisional emergency measures include: a) Prohibiting the change of the current conditions of the disputed properties; b/To prohibit or force any disputing party to perform one or several certain acts in order to prevent acts adversely affecting the arbitral proceedings; c) Distraining disputed properties; d/Requesting the preservation, storage, sale or disposition of any property of one or all disputing parties; dd) Temporary request for payment between parties; f/Prohibiting the transfer of property rights over disputed properties. 3. In the course of dispute settlement, if any of the parties has requested the court to apply one or several interim urgent measures specified in Clause 2 of this Article but later requests the arbitration council to apply these measures, the arbitration council shall refuse such request. 4. Before applying interim urgent measures, the arbitration council may force the requester to perform the financial security obligation. 5. If the arbitration council applies another interim urgent measure or beyond the request for application of the requester's interim urgent measure, causing damage to the requester, the party to be applied or a third party, the sufferer may initiate a lawsuit at court to claim compensation in accordance with the civil procedure law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@50: Procedures for application of provisional urgent measures by arbitration councils 1. The requester for application of a provisional urgent measure shall send an application to the arbitration council. 2. A written request for application of provisional urgent measures must contain the following principal details: a) Date of making the application; b) Name and address of the party requesting the application of provisional emergency measures; c/Name and address of the party requested to be applied the provisional urgent measure; d/Summary of the dispute contents; dd) Reasons for application of provisional emergency measures; e) Provisional emergency measures to be applied and specific requirements. Enclosed with a request for application of a provisional urgent measure must be evidence to prove the necessity to apply such provisional urgent measure to the arbitration council. 3. Under an arbitration council's decision, the requester for application of interim urgent measures shall deposit a sum of money, precious metals, gemstones or valuable papers determined by the arbitration council corresponding to the value of damage likely to be caused by improper application of interim urgent measures to protect the interests of the party requested to be applied interim urgent measures. The sum of money, precious metals, gemstones or valuable papers shall be deposited in a frozen account at a bank decided by the arbitration council. 4. Within 3 working days after receiving a request, right after the requesting party has taken security measures specified in Clause 3 of this Article, the arbitration council shall consider and issue a decision to apply interim urgent measures. In case of rejection of a request, the arbitration council shall notify such in writing to the requesting party, clearly stating the reason. 5. The arbitration council's decision on application of interim urgent measures shall be enforced under the law on enforcement of civil judgments.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@51: Competence and procedures for changing, supplementing or canceling interim urgent measures of arbitration councils 1. At the request of a party, the arbitration council may change, supplement or cancel interim urgent measures at any time in the course of dispute settlement. 2. Procedures for changing or adding provisional urgent measures comply with Article 50 of this Law. 3. The arbitration council may cancel the applied interim urgent measure in the following cases : a) The requester for application of interim injunctive relief requests cancellation; b) The party that has to implement the decision on application of provisional emergency measures has handed over its property or another person has taken measures to secure the performance of obligations towards the requesting party; c) The obligor's obligations terminate as per the law. 4. Procedures for canceling provisional urgent measures are as follows: a/The written request for cancellation of a provisional urgent measure is made according to the form in Appendix III to this Circular (not printed herein). a/The requesting party shall send to the arbitration council a written request for cancellation of the interim urgent measure; b/The arbitration council shall consider and issue a decision to cancel interim urgent measures and consider and decide to let the requester to apply interim urgent measures take back the security asset specified in Clause 3, Article 50 of this Law, unless the requester is liable for compensation for the wrongful request causing damage to the party subject to interim urgent measures or a third party. Decisions to cancel provisional urgent measures must be immediately sent to the disputing parties and civil judgment enforcement agencies.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@52: Responsibilities of the requester for application of provisional urgent measures The party requesting the application of provisional emergency measures shall be responsible for its request. In cases where the party requesting the application of provisional emergency measures is not correct and causes damage to the other party or to the third party, it shall have to pay compensation therefor.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@53: Competence, order and procedures of courts to apply, change or cancel provisional urgent measures 1. After filing a lawsuit petition, if its/his/her legitimate rights and interests are infringed upon or are in direct danger of being infringed upon, a party may file a petition with a competent court requesting the application of one or several provisional urgent measures. 2. Within 3 working days after receiving a written request for application of a provisional urgent measure, the president of a competent court shall assign a judge to consider and settle it. Within 3 working days after being assigned, the judge shall consider and decide to apply or not to apply such provisional urgent measure. The judge shall issue a decision to apply such provisional urgent measure right after the requester takes security measures. In case of rejection of the request, the judge shall notify such in writing to the requester, clearly stating the reason. 3. A party may request the court to change, supplement or cancel interim urgent measures. The assignment of a judge to consider and settle a written request for change, supplementation or cancellation of interim urgent measures complies with Clause 2 of this Article. 4. The order and procedures for application, change, supplementation or cancellation of provisional urgent measures and control of law observance in the application of provisional urgent measures by courts comply with the Civil Procedure Code. 5. In the course of dispute settlement, if any of the parties has requested the arbitration council to apply one or several interim urgent measures but then files a written request for the court to apply these measures, the court shall refuse such request and return the written request, unless the request for application of interim urgent measures falls beyond the arbitration council's competence.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@54: Preparation for dispute settlement meetings 1. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, the arbitration council shall decide on the time and venue of the meeting. 2. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties or provided by the arbitration center's rules of proceedings, a summons to a meeting must be sent to the parties at least 30 days before the meeting opens.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@55: Participants and procedures for dispute settlement meetings 1. A dispute settlement meeting shall be held in an open manner, unless otherwise agreed by the parties. 2. The parties may directly attend or authorize their representatives to attend dispute settlement meetings; may invite witnesses and defense counsels of their rights and legitimate interests. 3. With the consent of the parties, the arbitration council may permit other persons to attend the dispute settlement meeting. 4. The order and procedures for conducting dispute settlement meetings comply with the arbitration center's rules of arbitral proceedings; for ad hoc arbitration, the order and procedures shall be agreed by the parties.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@56: Absence of Parties 1. A plaintiff who has been duly summoned to a dispute settlement meeting but is absent without a plausible reason or leaves the meeting without the arbitration council's approval is regarded as having withdrawn his/her lawsuit petition. In this case, the arbitration council shall continue settling the dispute if the defendant so requests or files a counter-claim. 2. If the defendant who has been duly summoned to a dispute settlement meeting is absent without a plausible reason or leaves the meeting without the arbitration council's approval, the arbitration council shall continue settling the dispute based on available documents and evidence. 3. At the request of the parties, the arbitration council may, based on the dossier, hold a dispute settlement meeting without the presence of the parties.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@57: Suspended dispute resolution session When having a plausible reason, one or all parties may request the arbitration council to postpone a dispute settlement meeting. A request for postponement of a dispute settlement meeting must be made in writing, clearly stating the reason and enclosed with evidence, and sent to the arbitration council at least 7 working days before the meeting opens. If the arbitration council receives no request within this time limit, the requester shall bear all arising expenses, if any. The arbitration council shall consider and decide to accept or reject the request and promptly notify the parties thereof. The arbitration council shall decide on the postponement duration of the meeting.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@58: Conciliation, recognition of successful conciliation At the request of the parties, the arbitration council shall conduct conciliation for the parties to reach agreement on the settlement of the dispute. When the parties reach agreement on the settlement of the dispute, the arbitration council shall make a record of successful conciliation, bearing signatures of the parties and certification of the arbitrators. The arbitration council shall issue a decision recognizing the parties' agreement. This decision is final and valid as an arbitral award.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@59: Suspension of dispute settlement 1. A dispute shall be suspended from settlement in the following cases : a) The plaintiffs or defendants being individuals have died and their rights and obligations are not inherited; b) The plaintiffs or defendants being agencies or organizations have terminated their operations, gone bankrupt, been dissolved, consolidated, merged, divided, separated or transformed without any agencies or organizations accepting the rights and obligations of such agencies or organizations; c) The plaintiff withdraws his/her lawsuit petition or is considered to have withdrawn his/her lawsuit petition under Clause 1, Article 56 of this Law, unless the defendant requests further dispute settlement; d/The parties agree to terminate the dispute settlement; e/The court has decided that the dispute falls beyond the arbitration council's jurisdiction, there is no arbitration agreement, the arbitration agreement is invalid or unrealizable under Clause 6, Article 44 of this Law. 2. The arbitration council shall issue a decision to terminate dispute settlement. If the arbitration council has not yet been set up, the arbitration center's chairman shall issue a decision to terminate dispute settlement. 3. When a decision on termination of dispute settlement is issued, the parties are not entitled to initiate a lawsuit to request the arbitration to re-settle the dispute if the subsequent lawsuit does not differ from the previous dispute in terms of plaintiff, defendant and the disputed legal relation, except the cases specified at Points c and e, Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@60: Rules for making judgments 1. The arbitration council shall issue arbitral awards by majority voting. 2. In case a majority of votes is not obtained, an arbitral award shall be issued based on opinions of the arbitration council's chairman.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@61: Article 16.-Contents, forms and effect of arbitral awards 1. An arbitral award must be made in writing and contain the following principal details: a) Date and place of issuance of the judgment; b/Names and addresses of the plaintiff and defendant; c/Full name and address of the arbitrator; d) Summary of the petition and issues of dispute; e/Grounds for issuing the judgment, unless the parties agree that the grounds need not be stated in the judgment; f/Dispute settlement results; g) The time limit for execution of the award; h/Allocation of arbitration expenses and other related expenses; i/Signature of the arbitrator. 2. When an arbitrator refuses to sign an arbitral award, the arbitration council chairman shall write this in the award and clearly state the reason. In this case, the arbitral award remains valid. 3. An arbitral award shall be issued right at the meeting or within 30 days after the end of the last meeting. 4. An arbitral award shall be sent to the parties right after its issuance date. The parties may request the arbitration center or ad hoc arbitration council to issue copies of the award. 5. An arbitral award is final and effective on the date of its issuance.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@62: Registration of ad hoc arbitration awards 1. At the request of one or all disputing parties, an ad hoc arbitration award shall be registered at the court in the place in which the arbitration council issued the award before requesting a competent civil judgment enforcement agency to organize the enforcement of such award. The registration or non-registration of an arbitral award does not affect the content and legal validity of the award. 2. Within 1 year after the date of issuance of an arbitral award, the requester for registration of an ad hoc arbitral award shall send an application for registration of the arbitral award to a competent court specified in Clause 1 of this Article, enclosed with the original or valid certified copy of the following documents: a/Arbitral award issued by the ad hoc arbitration council; b/The minutes of the ad hoc arbitration council's dispute settlement meeting, if any; c/The original or a lawfully certified copy of the arbitration agreement. The petitioner shall be responsible for the authenticity of the documents sent to the Court. 3. Within 5 working days after receiving an application for judgment registration, the court president shall assign a judge to examine the application. Within 10 days after being assigned, the judge shall examine the authenticity of documents enclosed with the application and carry out the registration. If determining that an arbitral award is untruthful, the judge shall refuse to register the award, return the application and enclosed documents and immediately notify such to the requester and clearly state the reason. Within 3 working days after receiving the court's notice, the requester may lodge a complaint with the court president about the refusal to register the arbitral award. Within 3 working days after receiving the complaint, the court president shall consider and issue a complaint settlement decision. The court president's decision on settlement of the complaint is final. 4. Contents of registration of an arbitral award include : a) Time and location of registration; b/Name of the court conducting the registration; c/Name and address of the registration requester; d) The registered award; dd) Signature of the competent person and seal of the Court.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@63: Correction and interpretation of the judgment; additional judgment 1. Within 30 days after receiving an award, unless otherwise agreed by the parties, a party may request the arbitration council to correct obvious spelling errors, errors in figures caused by mistake or miscalculation in the award but shall promptly notify the other party thereof. If the arbitration council finds such request reasonable, it shall correct errors within 30 days after receiving the request. 2. Within 30 days after receiving an award, unless otherwise agreed by the parties on the time limit, a party may request the arbitration council to explain a specific point or part of the award but shall promptly notify the other party thereof. If the arbitration council finds such request reasonable, it shall give explanations within 30 days after receiving the request. Such explanations constitute part of the award. 3. Within 30 days after issuing an award, the arbitration council may take the initiative in correcting errors specified in Clause 1 of this Article and immediately notify such to the parties. 4. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties, within 30 days after receiving an award, a party may request the arbitration council to issue an additional award for a request presented in the course of legal proceedings which is not indicated in the award and shall promptly notify such to the other party. If the arbitration council considers such request justifiable, it shall issue an additional award within 45 days after receiving the request. 5. When necessary, the arbitration council may extend the time limit for correction or explanation or issue additional rulings under Clauses 1,2 and 4 of this Article.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@64: Document Archive 1. Arbitration centers shall archive dossiers of accepted disputes. Dossiers of disputes settled by ad hoc arbitration shall be archived by parties or arbitrators. 2. Arbitration dossiers shall be archived for 5 years after the issuance of arbitral awards or decisions to terminate the dispute settlement by arbitration.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@65: Voluntary enforcement of arbitral awards The State encourages parties to voluntarily execute arbitral awards.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@66: Right to request enforcement of arbitral awards 1. Upon the expiration of the time limit for enforcement of an arbitral award, if the party obliged to enforce the award fails to voluntarily enforce it and docs not request cancellation of the award under Article 69 of this Law, the party acquitted of the arbitral award may request in writing a competent civil judgment enforcement agency to enforce the arbitral award. 2. For an ad hoc arbitration award, the award winner may request in writing a competent civil judgment enforcement agency to enforce the award after the award is registered under Article 62 of this Law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@67: Enforcement of referee decisions Arbitral awards shall be enforced under the law on enforcement of civil judgments.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@69: Right to request cancellation of arbitral awards 1. Within 30 days after receiving an arbitral award, if a party has sufficient grounds to prove that the arbitration council has issued an award falling into any of the cases specified in Clause 2, Article 68 of this Law, it may file an application with a competent court to request cancellation of the arbitral award. Such a request must be enclosed with documents and evidence proving that the request is grounded and lawful. 2. In case of late submission due to a force majeure event, the duration in which such event occurs will not be included in the time limit for requesting cancellation of an arbitral award.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@70: Request for cancellation of the arbitral award 1. A written request for cancellation of an arbitral award must contain the following principal details: a) Date of making the application; b/Name and address of the requesting party; c/Request and grounds for cancellation of the arbitral award. 2. The application must be enclosed with the following papers: a/The original or a lawfully certified copy of the arbitral award; b/The original or a lawfully certified copy of the arbitration agreement. The papers enclosed with the application in foreign language (s) must be translated into Vietnamese and the translation must be duly authenticated.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@71: The court shall consider a request for cancellation of an arbitral award 1. After accepting a written request for cancellation of an arbitral award, the competent court shall immediately notify such to the arbitration center or arbitrators of the ad hoc arbitration council, disputing parties and the procuracy of the same level. 2. Within 7 working days after accepting a petition, the court president shall designate a Panel to consider the petition, which is composed of 3 judges, including one judge acting as the chairperson as assigned by the court president. Within 30 days after being designated, the Panel shall open a meeting to consider the request for cancellation of the arbitral award. The court shall transfer the dossier to the same-level procuracy for study 7 working days before the meeting opens for participation in the meeting of the court which has considered the request. Past this time limit, the procuracy shall return the dossier to the court for opening a meeting to consider the request. 3. A meeting shall be conducted in the presence of the disputing parties, their lawyers, if any, and the procurator of the same-level procuracy. In case any of the parties requests the Council to consider the application in his/her absence or has been duly summoned but is absent without a plausible reason or leaves the meeting without the Council's approval, the Council shall still consider the application for cancellation of the arbitral award. 4. When considering a petition, the council shall base itself on Article 68 of this Law and enclosed documents to consider and decide on the petition; it shall not retry the dispute it has settled. After examining the petition and enclosed documents and listening to opinions of the summoned persons, if any, and the procurator presents the procuracy's opinions, the council shall discuss and decide by majority. 5. The Panel may issue a decision to cancel or not to cancel an arbitral award. In case the requester withdraws the request or is absent without a plausible reason after having been duly summoned or leaves the meeting without the Panel's approval, the Panel shall issue a decision to terminate the consideration of the request. 6. Within 5 working days after issuing a decision, the court shall send it to the parties, the arbitration center or ad hoc arbitrator and the procuracy of the same level. 7. At the request of a party and when finding it appropriate, the examination council may suspend the consideration and settlement of the request for cancellation of an arbitral award for no more than 60 days to create conditions for the arbitration council to remedy errors in arbitral proceedings from the arbitration council's viewpoint in order to remove grounds for cancellation of the arbitral award. The arbitration council shall notify the court of the remedy of errors in proceedings. If the arbitration council fails to remedy errors in proceedings, the council shall continue examining the request for cancellation of the arbitral award. 8. In case the Panel considering the request issues a decision to cancel the arbitral award, the parties may reach agreement on bringing the dispute to arbitration for settlement or either party may initiate a lawsuit at court. In case the Panel considering the request does not cancel the arbitral award, the arbitral award shall be enforced. 9. In all cases, the time for dispute settlement at arbitration and the time for carrying out procedures for canceling arbitral awards at court will not be included in the statute of limitations for initiating a lawsuit. 10. A court decision is the final and effective one.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@72: Court fees related to arbitration Charges for requesting courts to appoint arbitrators, apply interim urgent measures, request cancellation of arbitral awards, and registration of arbitral awards and other charges comply with the law on court costs and fees.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@73: Conditions for operation of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam Foreign arbitration institutions which have been lawfully established and operating in foreign countries and respect the Constitution and law of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam may operate in Vietnam under this Law.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@74: Form of operation of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam Foreign arbitration institutions operate in Vietnam in the following forms: 1. Branches of foreign arbitration institutions (below referred to as branches); 2. Representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions (below referred to as representative offices).
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@75: Branch 1. Branch means a dependent unit of a foreign arbitration institution, which is established and conducts arbitration activities in Vietnam under this Law. 2. Foreign arbitration institutions and their branches shall take responsibility before Vietnamese law for their branches' operations. 3. A foreign arbitration institution shall appoint an arbitrator to act as the branch head. The branch head is the authorized representative of the foreign arbitration institution in Vietnam.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@76: Article 10. Rights and obligations of branches of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam 1. To rent office buildings, hire and purchase means and equipment necessary for the operation of branches. 2. To recruit Vietnamese and foreign laborers to work at their branches according to the provisions of Vietnamese law. 3. To open Vietnam-dong and foreign-currency accounts at banks licensed to operate in Vietnam in service of their branches' operations. 4. To transfer incomes of their branches abroad according to the provisions of Vietnamese law. 5. Having a seal bearing the name of the branch in accordance with the law of Vietnam. 6. To designate arbitrators to establish arbitration councils under the authorization of foreign arbitration institutions. 7. To provide arbitration and conciliation services and other modes of settlement of commercial disputes in accordance with law. 8. To provide administrative, office and other services for dispute settlement by foreign arbitration councils. 9. To collect arbitration charges and other lawful revenues. 10. To pay remuneration to arbitrators. 11. To organize training courses for arbitrators to improve their dispute settlement qualifications and skills. 12. To archive dossiers and supply copies of arbitral awards at the request of disputing parties or competent Vietnamese state agencies. 13. To operate in the domains stated in their establishment licenses or operation registration papers. 14. To observe the provisions of Vietnamese law related to the branch's operations. 15. To annually report on the branch's operation to the provincial-level Justice Department with which it has registered its operation.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@77: Representative offices 1. Representative office means a dependent unit of a foreign arbitration institution which is established and seeks and promotes arbitration operation opportunities in Vietnam under this Law. 2. Foreign arbitration institutions shall take responsibility before Vietnamese law for the operation of their representative offices.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@78: Rights and obligations of representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam 1. To seek and promote arbitration operation opportunities of their arbitration institutions in Vietnam. 2. To rent working offices, hire and purchase means and equipment necessary for the operation of representative offices. 3. To recruit Vietnamese and foreign laborers to work at their representative offices according to the provisions of Vietnamese law. 4. To open foreign currency and Vietnam dong accounts at banks licensed to operate in Vietnam and to use these accounts only for the operation of their representative offices. 5. Having a seal bearing the name of the representative office in accordance with Vietnamese law. 6. To operate for the purposes, within the scope and within the time limit stated in the representative office establishment license. 7. Not to conduct arbitration activities in Vietnam. 8. To conduct only arbitration promotion and advertising activities in accordance with Vietnamese law. 9. To observe Vietnamese law related to the operation of representative offices. 10. To annually report on the operation of their representative offices to provincial-level Justice Departments with which they have registered their operation.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@79: Operation of branches and representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam The establishment, registration, operation and termination of operation of branches and representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam comply with Vietnamese law and treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party. The Government shall detail procedures for the establishment, registration and termination of operation of branches and representative offices of foreign arbitration institutions in Vietnam.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@80: Application of the Law to arbitration centers established before the effective date of this Law Arbitration centers established before the effective date of this Law are not required to carry out re-establishment procedures. Arbitration centers shall modify and supplement their charters and rules of arbitral proceedings in accordance with this Law within 12 months after the effective date of this Law. Past this time limit, if they fail to modify and supplement their charters or rules of arbitral proceedings, their establishment licenses shall be revoked and they shall terminate their operation.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@81: Implementation effect 1. This Law takes effect on January 1,2011. 2. Ordinance No. 08/2003/PL-UBTVQH11 on Commercial Arbitration ceases to be effective on the effective date of this Law. 3. Arbitration agreements concluded before the effective date of this Law must comply with the law at the time of conclusion of arbitration agreements.
Luật Trọng tài thương mại@82: Implementation detailing and guidance The Government, the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuracy shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, detail and guide the implementation of articles and clauses of this Law as assigned to them; and guide other necessary contents of this Law to meet the state management requirements. This Law was passed on June 17,2010, by the XIIth National Assembly of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam at its 7th session. - THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Phu Trong
Luật Thanh niên@1: Young people The youth are Vietnamese citizens aged between full 16 and 30 years.
Luật Thanh niên@2: Scope This Law provides for rights, obligations and responsibilities of the youth; state policies towards the youth; responsibilities of agencies, youth organizations, other organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals towards the youth; and state management of the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@3: Subjects of application This Law applies to the youth; regulatory bodies, organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals.
Luật Thanh niên@4: Roles, rights and obligations of the youth 1. The youth constitute a large, pioneering and creative social force taking the lead in the cause of renewal, building and defense of the socialist Vietnamese Fatherland; and play an important role in the cause of national industrialization and modernization, international integration and socialism building. 2. The youth have the rights and obligations of citizens as prescribed by the Constitution and law.
Luật Thanh niên@5: Principles of ensuring the exercise of the rights and obligations of the youth and the State's policies towards the youth 1. Rights and obligations of the youth shall be recognized, respected and protected and guaranteed to comply with the Constitution and law. 2. Youth rights and obligations are performed regardless of ethnicity, gender, social class, belief, religion, educational level and occupation. 3. The State, organizations, educational institutions, families and individuals shall enable the youth to exercise their rights and fulfill their obligations in accordance with the Constitution and law. 4. State policies towards the youth must ensure youth development objectives; enable the youth to exercise their rights, fulfill their obligations and responsibilities and develop their capabilities; and be formulated or integrated into policies of sectors, fields and localities. 5. Formulation and implementation of state policies towards the youth must ensure the youth's participation; respect and listen to opinions and aspirations of the youth. 6. Enable overseas Vietnamese youth to participate in activities towards the Fatherland, preserve and promote national cultural identity. 7. Promptly and strictly handle agencies, organizations and individuals that fail to perform or improperly perform their responsibilities under this Law.
Luật Thanh niên@6: Resources for implementation of the State's youth policies 1. The State shall ensure resources for formulating and implementing youth policies in accordance with regulations of law. 2. Financial sources for implementation of youth policies include state budget; donations, aids, sponsorships and other lawful contributions of domestic and foreign organizations, enterprises and individuals.
Luật Thanh niên@7: National Committee for Vietnamese Youth 1. The National Committee for Vietnamese Youth is an interdisciplinary organization functioning to advise and assist the Prime Minister on youth-related work. 2. Tasks and powers of the National Committee for Vietnamese Youth shall be defined by the Prime Minister.
Luật Thanh niên@8: International cooperation on youth 1. International cooperation in youth affairs must ensure equality, respect for independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity, conformity with laws of each country, treaties to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory and international practices. 2. International cooperation on youth affairs shall focus on the following contents: a) Participation in international organizations; conclusion and implementation of international treaties and agreements on youth; international cooperation programs and projects on youth; b) Exchange information, management experience, youth policies and laws; c) Exchange between Vietnamese youth and other youth countries.
Luật Thanh niên@9: Youth Month 1. March every year is Youth Month. Youth Month is organized to promote the pioneering, voluntary and creative spirit of the youth to participate in activities for the community and society's interests and mobilize organizations and individuals to invest in youth development. 2. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union shall take charge and cooperate with relevant authorities, organizations and individuals in organizing Youth Month activities. 3. The Government and local governments at all levels shall provide mechanisms, policies and resources to support Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union of the same level in organizing Youth Month activities. Heads of agencies and organizations shall provide conditions and support for youth to participate in Youth Month activities.
Luật Thanh niên@10: Dialogues with Young People 1. The Prime Minister and Chairpersons of People's Committees at all levels shall hold dialogues with the youth at least once a year on matters related to the youth; heads of agencies, organizations and people's armed forces shall hold dialogues with the youth at the request of youth organizations specified in this Law. 2. The person in charge of holding dialogues with the youth prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article shall direct preparation of the dialogue plan and program and publish it on the website or website or post it at the head office of the organization at least 30 days before the date of the dialogue; handle or request the competent authority to handle the youth's recommendations through the dialogue. 3. Within 10 days from the date of the talk, the contents of the talk conclusion must be publicized on the web portal, website or posted at the head office of the agency, organization or unit and sent to the relevant agencies, organizations and units; in case the content of the talk is complicated and related to many fields, this time limit is 15 days. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Thanh niên@11: To apply treaties on children's rights to youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old The State shall apply treaties on children's rights to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a contracting party to youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old in conformity with Vietnam's conditions.
Luật Thanh niên@12: Responsibilities to the Fatherland 1. To promote the nation's tradition of national construction and defense; to take the lead, create and take the lead in the cause of renewal, construction and defense of the socialist Vietnamese Fatherland. 2. Be ready to defend the Homeland, protect independence, maintain national sovereignty, security, unity and territorial integrity; undertake arduous and urgent tasks upon the request of the Homeland. 3. Fighting against plots and activities which cause harms to national interests.
Luật Thanh niên@13: Responsibilities to the State and society 1. Be exemplary in observing policies and laws and fulfilling civic obligations 2. To participate in maintaining social order and safety, national defense and security. 3. Proactively propose ideas and initiatives in the process of formulating policies and laws; participate in state and social management. 4. Actively participate in propagating and mobilizing the people to implement the Constitution and law. 5. To build models of production and business to create jobs; to participate in environmental protection and activities in the interests of communities and society. 6. Actively participate in child care, education and protection activities.
Luật Thanh niên@14: Family responsibilities 1. To care for family happiness; to preserve and promote fine traditions of Vietnamese families. 2. Respect and be dutiful to grandparents, parents and respect other family members; take care of and educate children in their families. 3. Actively prevent and combat domestic violence, and eliminate backward marriage and family customs and practices.
Luật Thanh niên@15: Self-Responsibility 1. Nurture virtues, personality, cultured lifestyle and civilized behavior; fulfill civic duties and sense of law observance; prevent and control negative practices, social evils, illegal acts and social ethics. 2. Actively study and improve knowledge, knowledge and skills; approach, research and apply science and technology to reality. 3. Proactively learn about the labor market; select appropriate occupations and jobs; train sense of responsibility, labor discipline and professional manners; create and improve techniques to improve labor productivity. 4. Train, protect, care for and improve health, develop physically and mentally; provide knowledge, life skills, reproductive health care skills, sexual health care skills, disease prevention skills; do not abuse alcohol; limit tobacco use; do not use drugs, narcotic substances and other stimulants banned by law; do not prevent cyberspace harms. 5. Actively participate in healthy cultural, physical training and sport activities and movements; protect, preserve and promote national cultural identities; and absorb the quintessence of human culture.
Luật Thanh niên@16: Science and learning policy 1. Ensure equality in access to education and enable the youth to participate in scientific research. 2. Promulgate and ensure the implementation of programs on education about morality, national ideals and traditions, cultural lifestyles, life skills and sense of law observance for the youth. 3. Introduce policies on credit, scholarships, tuition exemption and reduction for the youth as prescribed by law. 4. Encourage and assist the youth in learning and improving their professional qualifications; creativity, research and application of scientific and technological advances. 5. Provide incentives and assistance for organizations and individuals to invest in scientific research and innovation of the youth; participate in training in life skills and other necessary skills for the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@17: Labor and employment policies 1. Provide career counseling and orientation, provide information about the labor market for the youth; provide training in professional skills and ethics for the youth; ensure that the youth are not forced to work or exploit their labor. 2. Enable the youth to have jobs; create on-the-spot jobs for the youth in rural areas, mountainous areas and islands in conformity with each region, area and each stage of national development. 3. Enable the youth to take concessional loans from the National Employment Fund and other legal credit sources to create jobs and develop their business.
Luật Thanh niên@18: Entrepreneurship Policy 1. Provide youth with startup knowledge and skills. 2. Provide market information; legal, scientific and technological assistance, investment promotion, human resource development; grant loans from credit institutions as prescribed by law. 3. Facilitate entrepreneurship and application of science and technology by young people. 4. Provide incentives and assistance for organizations and individuals participating in provision of startup services; encourage establishment of startup funds for the youth as prescribed by law.
Luật Thanh niên@19: Health protection, care and improvement policies 1. Provide youth health counseling and support; prevent and control domestic violence, school violence and sexual assault; prevent and control drug use, HIV/AIDS; prevent sexually transmitted diseases, other social diseases and risks to physical and mental health of the youth. 2. Ensure that the youth are provided with information and access to friendly services related to reproductive and sexual health protection and care; and are given pre-marriage counseling and health check-ups. 3. Encourage organizations and individuals to invest in and provide healthcare services for the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@20: - Culture, physical training and sport policies 1. Encourage and assist youth in participating in activities and creativity in culture, physical training and sports. 2. Enable the youth to actively participate in preserving and promoting national cultural values and acquiring the quintessence of human culture. 3. Disseminate information and raise awareness of and protect youth safety in cyberspace. 4. Encourage organizations and individuals to invest in the construction of cultural, sports and physical training institutions for the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@21: National defense policies 1. Ensure that the youth are educated in national defense and security, patriotism, revolutionary heroism and sense of national construction and defense. 2. Ensure the youth's fulfillment of military service; the obligation to join the People's Public Security Force, the Militia and Self-Defense Force; the obligation to join the reserve army and build the all-people national defense and the people's security in accordance with laws. 3. Youth who have fulfilled their military service and service in People's Public Security Forces shall be entitled to vocational training support policies and other preferential policies in accordance with laws.
Luật Thanh niên@22: Policies for youth volunteers 1. Young pioneers are youth's shock forces participating in socio-economic development, employment generation, youth education, training and training and other unexpected, urgent and arduous tasks in national construction and defense. 2. The State shall promulgate policies to enable youth pioneers to perform the following tasks: a) Participate in socio-economic development projects assigned by the State; b) Participate in remedying consequences of natural disasters and epidemics; environmental protection; maintain social order and safety, national defense and security; c) Participate in production of goods, provision of services, transfer of technological advances to support production, provide vocational training in association with job creation for the youth; d) Unscheduled, urgent, arduous and difficult tasks as prescribed by law. 3. The State shall ensure funding, facilities and equipment necessary for youth volunteer organizations to perform tasks assigned by the State. 4. Young Volunteers units shall be entitled to regimes and policies during and after they complete their tasks. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Thanh niên@23: Policies for youth volunteers 1. voluntary youth means a youth voluntarily participating in activities for the community and society in accordance with regulations of law. 2. The State shall promulgate policies towards youth volunteers as follows : a) Create channels for youth to access and participate in volunteer activities; b/To formulate programs and projects to send young volunteers to areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions, border areas and islands; c) Encourage organizations and individuals to support youth in volunteering for the community and society. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Thanh niên@24: Policies for talented youth 1. The State shall adopt policies to discover, train, retrain, attract, employ and treat talented youth. 2. Heads of agencies and organizations shall implement policies for talented youth within the ambit of their functions, tasks and powers.
Luật Thanh niên@25: Policies towards ethnic minority youth 1. Give priority to ethnic minority youth in terms of learning, labor, employment, entrepreneurship, healthcare, physical training and sports. 2. Assist youth of ethnic minorities in preserving and promoting national cultural identity, building a civilized lifestyle, and fighting and eliminating backward customs and practices. 3. Prioritize selection of training and education programs and inclusion of these programs in the planning scheme to create leadership and management resources for cadres, public servants and officers who are ethnic minority youth in state-owned entities, organizations and units. 4. Encourage enterprises and organizations to prioritize recruitment of ethnic minority youth.
Luật Thanh niên@26: - Policies towards youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old 1. Ensuring the completion of educational universalization as prescribed by law. 2. Prioritize and facilitate participation in cultural, sports, recreational and entertainment activities suitable for their capacity and age for comprehensive development. 3. Provide training and advice on selecting occupations and jobs suitable for the age group. 4. Equip the youth with knowledge and skills to protect themselves against physical and mental health risks; ensure that support and intervention measures are taken to ensure safe and healthy lives for youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old. 5. Ensuring the implementation of criminal, administrative and civil policies as prescribed by law. 6. Prioritize the quick settlement of cases causing harm to the physical and mental health of youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old. 7. Encourage organizations and individuals to discover and provide training in talent for youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old. 8. The Government shall provide for mechanisms, policies and measures for implementing policies for youths aged between full sixteen and eighteen years old.
Luật Thanh niên@27: Youth organizations 1. Youth organizations include Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, Vietnam Youth Union, Vietnam National Union of Students and other youth organizations established, organized and operating under law. 2. Youth organizations play the role of uniting and rallying the youth, representing them in caring for and protecting the legitimate rights and interests of the youth; and promoting the youth's role in national construction and defense. 3. Youth organizations shall study the youth's demands and aspirations and propose them to competent agencies and organizations; coordinate with the youth state management agency and related agencies in propagating, educating and implementing youth policies and laws; and organize youth to participate in movements for the community and society's interests and national construction and defense.
Luật Thanh niên@28: Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union 1. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union is a socio-political organization of Vietnamese youth, playing the key role in youth movements and youth organizations; guiding activities of teenagers and children and taking charge of Ho Chi Minh Young Pioneer Organization. 2. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union shall supervise and give social criticism for youth policies and laws as per the law; consolidate and report opinions and proposals of the youth to competent authorities. 3. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union shall participate and cooperate with relevant regulatory bodies in formulating, propagating and organizing the implementation of youth policies and laws. 4. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union shall carry out youth external relation activities.
Luật Thanh niên@29: Vietnam Youth Union and Vietnam Students' Union 1. The Vietnam Youth Union is a widespread social organization of Vietnamese youth and a youth organization aiming to unite and rally all strata of Vietnamese youth for the cause of national construction and defense. 2. The Vietnam Student Association is a social organization of Vietnamese students with a view to uniting and rallying Vietnamese students to strive to study, train and contribute to the country. 3. Vietnam Youth Federation and Vietnam National Union of Students shall cooperate with Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union in supervising and criticizing youth policies and laws as per the law.
Luật Thanh niên@30: The State's policies towards youth organizations 1. Enable youth organizations to participate in formulating and implementing youth policies and laws. 2. Enable youth organizations to perform tasks assigned by the State. 3. To support and create conditions for youth organizations to mobilize youth for implementation of socio-economic development programs and projects and other programs and projects. 4. State agencies, organizations and units shall create conditions for Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union to organize supervision and social criticism activities in the formulation and implementation of youth policies and laws.
Luật Thanh niên@31: Responsibilities of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front 1. Formulate plans and programs for unifying actions of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front for youth consolidation, solidarity and development. 2. Cooperate with Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union and other member organizations of Vietnamese Fatherland Front in implementing social criticism programs for youth policies and laws and youth affairs. 3. Mobilize members of the Vietnamese Fatherland Front to take care of and protect legitimate rights and interests of the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@32: Responsibilities of social organizations 1. Mobilize their members to enable the youth to study, work, participate in cultural, sports and physical and intellectual development activities; foster the national moral values and traditions and civic sense; take the lead in creative labor and national defense. 2. Cooperate with youth authorities in formulating and implementing youth policies and laws. 3. Cooperate with youth organizations in caring for and protecting legitimate rights and interests of the youth. 4. Provide resources as prescribed by law and social organizations' charters for youth development.
Luật Thanh niên@33: Responsibilities of economic organizations 1. Ensure safe working environment and conditions; provide sufficient knowledge and information about occupational safety and hygiene for employees who are young people. 2. To take care of the life of young laborers; to support young laborers in learning and participating in cultural, physical training and sport activities; to take care of and protect their health. 3. To create conditions for the establishment and operation of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union and the Vietnam Youth Union. 4. Encourage and assist young people in starting businesses; providing vocational training and life skills; investing in construction of cultural and sports facilities for young people.
Luật Thanh niên@34: Responsibilities of educational institutions 1. Educate the youth on traditional values, ethics and healthy lifestyles. 2. Create a safe, friendly and healthy educational environment; take measures to prevent and control school violence and sexual abuse of the youth. 3. Promote creativity in learning and scientific research; improve self-learning capacity and practice skills; provide youth with career counseling and orientation. 4. Provide psychological counseling on social issues and school psychology; provide life skills, knowledge about healthcare, reproductive health, sexual health and gender, and skills in prevention and control of school diseases and social evils for the youth. 5. Enable the youth to participate in cultural, sports, recreational and other extracurricular activities. 6. Facilitating the establishment and operation of Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union and Vietnam Students Association.
Luật Thanh niên@35: Family responsibilities 1. Respect and listen to opinions and expectations of the youth; provide youth with care, education, encouragement and favorable conditions for exercising their rights, fulfilling their obligations and fulfilling their responsibilities as prescribed by law. 2. Respect the rights of the youth in marriage and family; gender and gender equality education and necessary knowledge about marriage and family. 3. Take care of and educate youth to develop physically, mentally, intellectually, morally and personality; develop a healthy cultural lifestyle, become dutiful children of families and citizens useful to society. 4. Equip the youth with life skills; educate the youth about labor sense and discipline; respect and create conditions for them to select their occupations and seek employment. 5. Enable the youth to access safe information sources and protect the youth in cyberspace.
Luật Thanh niên@36: Contents of state management of the youth 1. Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate and organize the implementation of legislative documents on the youth; provide for measures for implementing youth policies. 2. Formulate and organize the implementation of youth development strategies, policies, programs and plans. 3. Produce statistics, provide information and report on the youth and implementation of youth policies and laws. 4. To build a contingent of cadres and civil servants performing the state management of youth. 5. Disseminate youth policies and laws. 6. Carry out inspections, take actions against violations, settle complaints and denunciations; carry out preliminary and final reviews, emulation and commendation in implementation of youth policies and laws. 7. Carry out international cooperation in youth affairs. 8. Promulgate policies on support for and encouragement of organizations and individuals to participate in youth policies.
Luật Thanh niên@37: Responsibilities of the Government The Government shall perform the unified state management of the youth and have the following responsibilities: 1. Ensure effectiveness of state management of the youth; 2. Ensure mechanisms and measures for cooperation between Ministries, ministerial agencies, Governmental agencies, local governments and relevant organizations in formulating and implementing youth policies and laws; 3. Ensure the establishment and achievement of youth development objectives and targets in long-term, medium-term and annual socio-economic development strategies, programs and plans of the country, sectors and fields; 4. Report the implementation of youth policies and laws at the request of the National Assembly.
Luật Thanh niên@38: Responsibilities of the Ministry of Home Affairs The Ministry of Home Affairs shall take responsibility before the Government for performing the state management of the youth and have the following responsibilities : 1. Promulgate or request competent authorities to promulgate youth policies and laws; youth development strategies, programs and plans; 2. To propose the integration of youth development policies, targets and objectives when formulating sectoral socio-economic development policies, strategies, programs and plans. To guide ministries and branches in incorporating statistical indicators on Vietnamese youth into their indicator systems; 3. To guide ministries, ministerial-level agencies and provincial-level People's Committees in performing the state management of youth; to organize training and retraining in knowledge and skills for cadres and civil servants performing the state management of youth; 4. Take charge and cooperate with relevant authorities in managing, using and publishing data on the youth and youth development indexes; 5. To assume the prime responsibility and coordinate with the ministries, the ministerial-level agencies, the agencies attached to the Government and the Central Committee of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union in formulating and organizing the implementation of policies and laws towards the youth; 6. Inspect and settle complaints, denunciations and petitions; conduct preliminary and final reviews, emulation and commendation; handle violations within their competence or propose competent authorities, organizations and individuals to handle violations against youth policies and laws; 7. Submit annual reports on implementation of youth policies and laws and state management of youth to the Government; 8. Take charge and cooperate with relevant authorities in managing international cooperation in youth affairs as prescribed by law.
Luật Thanh niên@39: Responsibilities of Ministries and ministerial-level agencies Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, coordinate with the Ministry of Home Affairs in performing the state management of the youth and have the following responsibilities : 1. To promulgate policies and mechanisms to create conditions for the youth to participate in branch or domain development programs; 2. To incorporate youth development policies, targets and objectives in the formulation of sectoral socio-economic development policies, strategies, programs and plans; to incorporate statistical indicators on Vietnamese youth into the system of indicators of ministries and sectors; 3. Provide guidance for People's Committees of provinces on implementation of youth policies and laws within their competence; 4. Submit annual reports on implementation of youth policies and laws by sector and sector to the Ministry of Home Affairs for consolidation and reporting to the Government.
Luật Thanh niên@40: Responsibilities of provincial-level People's Councils and People's Committees 1. Within the ambit of their tasks and powers, provincial-level People's Councils have the following responsibilities: a) Promulgate resolutions on youth development in their provinces to implement policies and laws of the State on youth; b) Decide youth development targets and objectives in local socio-economic development resolutions on an annual and periodical basis; c) Decide allocation of budget estimates for implementation of youth development policies, laws, strategies, programs and plans in their provinces; d) Supervise the implementation of youth policies and laws in their provinces; dd) Decide payroll of the authority assigned to perform state management of the youth. 2. Provincial People's Committees, within their tasks and powers, shall perform state management of the youth and have the following responsibilities: a) Organize the implementation of youth development policies, laws, strategies, programs and plans in their provinces; b) Incorporate youth development targets and objectives in formulation of annual and periodical local socio-economic development programs and plans; c) Develop officials and public employees in charge of state management of the youth; d) Ensure legitimate rights and interests of the youth when investing in development of educational institutions, health facilities, health counseling centers, cultural and sports facilities; dd) Manage, use and publish statistical data on the youth and youth development index in their provinces; e) Carry out statistical work and send annual reports on implementation of youth policies and laws to the Ministry of Home Affairs for consolidation and reporting to the Government; g) Carry out inspections, take actions against violations, settle complaints and denunciations and recommendations about the youth; h) direct and instruct inferior People's Committees to perform state management of the youth.
Luật Thanh niên@41: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from January 01,2021. 2. The Law on Youth No. 53/2005/QH11 shall be annulled from the effective date of this Law. This Law is passed by the 14th National Assembly of Socialist Republic of Vietnam during its 9th session on June 16,2020. THE PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL ASSEMBLY (Signed) Nguyen Thi Kim Ngan
Luật Giáo dục@1: Scope This Law provides for the national education system; educational institutions, teachers, learners; state management of education; rights and responsibilities of agencies, organizations, and individuals related to education.
Luật Giáo dục@3: Educational nature and principles 1. The Vietnamese education is a socialist education of a people-oriented, national, scientific and modern character, based on Marxism-Leninism and Ho Chi Minh Thought. 2. Educational activities shall be carried out on the principle that learning goes hand in hand with practice, theory is closely associated with practice, education at school is combined with family education and social education.
Luật Giáo dục@4: Educational development 1. Educational development is the top national policy. 2. Education development must be associated with the needs of socio-economic development, scientific and technological advances, national defense and security consolidation; standardization, modernization and socialization; balancing the structure of professions, qualifications and human resources and regional compatibility; expanding the scale on the basis of ensuring quality and efficiency; combining training with employment. 3. To develop the open education system, build a learning society with a view to creating opportunities for all people to have access to education, to study at all levels and in all forms, and to study throughout their life.
Luật Giáo dục@5: Interpretation of terms In this Law, the terms below are construed as follows: 1. Formal education means the course-based education in an educational institution to implement a certain educational program, which is established according to the objectives of different educational grades and training levels and is granted diplomas of the national education system. 2. Continuing education is education to implement a certain educational program, which is organized flexibly in terms of program implementation form, time, method and location, meeting learners' lifelong learning needs. 3. Education quality assessment means the assessment and recognition of educational institutions or training programs meeting education quality standards issued by competent agencies or organizations. 4. Year-based education means a form of organizing the education and training process according to the school year. 5. Credit refers to a unit used for measuring the amount of knowledge, skills and learning outcomes accumulated over a specified period of time. 6. Module is a learning unit that is fully integrated between knowledge, skills and attitude to help learners have capacity to fully perform one or some tasks of a profession. 7. Outcome standard means the required quality and capacity of a learner after completing an education program. 8. Universalization of education means the process of organizing educational activities so that all citizens of all ages can study and reach a certain educational level as provided for by law. 9. Compulsory education means education that all citizens in the prescribed age group must study in order to attain the minimum educational level as prescribed by law and the State ensures conditions for such study. 10. amount of general secondary education knowledge means basic and core knowledge and skills in the upper secondary education program that learners must accumulate to continue to study at higher vocational education level. 11. investor means an organization or individual making non-state investment in education, including domestic and foreign investors. 12. Educational institution means an organization that carries out educational activities in the national education system, including schools and other educational institutions.
Luật Giáo dục@6: National education system 1. The national education system is an open and transferable education system, including formal education and continuing education. 2. Educational levels and training qualifications of the national education system include: a) Early childhood education, including nursery and kindergarten education; b) General education includes primary education, lower secondary education and upper secondary education; c) Vocational education at elementary, intermediate and college level and other vocational training programs; d) Higher education at bachelor's degree, master's degree and doctorate degree. 3. The Prime Minister shall decide to approve the structural framework of the national education system and the Vietnamese Qualifications Framework; stipulate training duration, standards for each training level, minimum academic load for vocational education and higher education levels. 4.
