The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within their duties and powers, regulate the admission thresholds for college-level and undergraduate programs in pedagogy and healthcare.
Luật Giáo dục@7: Requirements for educational contents and methods 1. Educational contents must ensure the basic, comprehensive, practical, modern, systematic and regularly updated nature; attach importance to ideological education, moral qualities and civic consciousness; inherit and promote the fine traditions and national cultural identity, and absorb the quintessence of mankind's culture; and be suitable to the physical, intellectual, psychological and physiological development of learners of different ages and their capabilities. 2. The educational methods must be scientific, promote the learners' activeness, voluntariness, initiative and creative thinking; foster the learners' self-study and cooperation, practice capability, study passion and will to rise.
Luật Giáo dục@8: Educational programs 1. Educational programmes must reflect the educational objectives; stipulate the standards of knowledge, skills, the requirements to be met in terms of learners' qualities and capabilities; the scope and structure of educational contents; the methods and forms of organizing educational activities; the ways of evaluating the educational results of the subjects in each class, each educational level or the subjects, modules and disciplines for each training level. 2. Educational programs must ensure scientificity and practicality; inherit and promote transferability among educational grades and training levels; facilitate the channeling and transferability between training levels, disciplines and forms of education in the national education system so that localities and educational institutions can proactively implement appropriate educational plans; meet gender equality goals and international integration requirements. Educational programs are the basis for all-round education quality assurance. 3. Standards of knowledge, skills, qualities and capacity of learners prescribed in the education program must be specified in textbooks for general education; syllabi and teaching materials for vocational education and higher education. Textbooks, syllabi and teaching materials must meet the requirements of educational methods. 4. Educational programs shall be implemented in an academic year for preschool education and general education; in an academic year or by the method of module or credit accumulation or combination of credit and academic year for vocational education and higher education. The results of study of a subject, credit or module that a learner has accumulated while following an educational program shall be recognized to consider the conversion value of the corresponding subject, credit or module in another educational program when the learner moves to another discipline/major, learning method or higher education level/training qualification. 5. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, provide for the implementation of educational programs and recognition of the value of conversion of study results in higher education and vocational education at different levels specified in this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@9: Career orientation and segregation in education 1. Career orientation in education means a system of measures taken inside and outside educational institutions to help pupils acquire knowledge about occupations and select occupations on the basis of combining their personal aspirations and strengths with the social labor demands. 2. Streaming in education is a measure to organize educational activities on the basis of vocational guidance in education, creating conditions for pupils who have graduated from lower secondary schools or upper secondary schools to continue their study at higher educational levels or degrees or to attend vocational education or to take part in labor activities suitable to their capabilities and specific conditions as well as social demands, contributing to regulating the job structure of the labor force in conformity with the national development requirements. 3. The Government shall detail the vocational orientation and channeling in education in each period, suitable to the socio-economic development demands.
Luật Giáo dục@10: Transferability in education 1. Transferability in education means the use of available learning results for further study at other educational levels and levels of the same training disciplines or professions or when changing to other training disciplines, professions, forms of education and training levels in conformity with the requirements of corresponding contents, ensuring transferability among educational levels and training levels in general education, vocational education and higher education. 2. The bridge program in education must satisfy quality assurance conditions. The educational program shall be designed towards inheritance and integration of knowledge and skills based on the outcome standards of each training level in the Vietnamese Qualifications Framework. Learners shall not have to relearn knowledge and skills accumulated in previous educational programs. 3. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on bridge programs between educational grades and training levels in the national education system.
Luật Giáo dục@11: Languages and scripts used in educational institutions 1. Vietnamese is the official language used in educational institutions. Basing itself on the educational objectives and specific requirements on educational contents, the Government shall prescribe the teaching and learning in foreign languages in educational institutions. 2. The State encourages and creates conditions for ethnic minority people to learn their ethnic languages and scripts according to the Government's regulations; deaf and speechless people may learn sign language while visually impaired people may learn Braille according to the Law on Persons with Disabilities. 3. Foreign languages specified in educational programs are languages commonly used in international transactions. Foreign language teaching in educational institutions must ensure continuous and effective learning for learners.
Luật Giáo dục@12: diplomas and certificates 1. Diplomas of the national education system shall be awarded to learners after they graduate from an educational level or after completing an educational program, and attain the graduation standards of the corresponding qualifications as provided for by this Law. 2. Diplomas of the national education system include lower secondary diplomas, upper secondary diplomas, intermediate vocational diplomas, college diplomas, bachelor's degrees, master's degrees, doctoral diplomas and diplomas of equivalent degrees. 3. Certificates of the national education system shall be granted to learners to certify their study results after they have been trained and retrained to raise their educational and professional qualifications or granted to learners taking certificates examinations according to regulations. 4. Diplomas and certificates issued by educational institutions of all types and forms of training in the national education system have the same legal validity. 5. The Government shall promulgate the system of higher education diplomas and prescribe diplomas of equivalent level of some particular intensive training disciplines.
Luật Giáo dục@13: Rights and obligations of citizens to study 1. Learning is the rights and obligations of citizens. All citizens, regardless of their ethnicity, religion, belief, gender, personal characteristics, family origin, social status and economic circumstances, are equal in learning opportunities. 2. The State shall ensure social justice in education, create a safe educational environment, ensure inclusive education and enable learners to develop their potentials and aptitudes. 3. The State shall give priority and create favorable conditions for learners who are children in special circumstances as prescribed in the Law on Children, learners who are disabled as prescribed in the Law on Persons with Disabilities, learners from poor households and near-poor households to exercise their learning rights and fulfill their learning obligations.
Luật Giáo dục@14: Universalization of education and compulsory education 1. Primary education is compulsory education. The State shall universalize preschool education for 5-year children and lower secondary education. 2. The State shall be responsible for implementing compulsory education nationwide; making decisions on plans and ensuring conditions for educational universalization. 3. All citizens within the prescribed age group shall have the obligation to study in order to carry out the educational universalization and complete compulsory education. 4. The family and guardian shall be responsible for creating favorable conditions for family members of the prescribed age to study in order to implement educational universalization and complete compulsory education.
Luật Giáo dục@15: Inclusive education 1. Inclusive education is an education method that aims to meet different demands and abilities of learners; ensures equal learning rights, education quality and conformity with learners' demands, characteristics and abilities; respects diversity and differences of learners and does not discriminate. 2. The State shall adopt policies on support for inclusive education provided for disadvantaged children as prescribed in the Law on Children, disabled students as prescribed in the Law on Persons with Disabilities and other relevant regulations of law.
Luật Giáo dục@16: Socialization of education 1. Educational development and building of a learning society are the cause of the State and the entire people. 2. The State plays the leading role in the development of education. Diversifies types of educational institutions and forms of education; encourages, mobilizes and creates conditions for organizations and individuals to participate in the development of education; encourages the development of people-founded and private educational institutions to meet the social demand for high-quality education. 3. Organizations, families and individuals shall have to care for the cause of education, coordinate with educational establishments in realizing the educational objectives, building a safe and healthy educational environment. 4. Organizations and individuals that record achievements in the educational cause shall be commended and/or rewarded according to law provisions.
Luật Giáo dục@17: Investment in education 1. Investment in education is development investment. Investment in education is an investment in conditional business lines and is eligible for investment incentives and assistance as prescribed by law. 2. The State shall prioritize investment in and attract other investment sources for education; prioritize investment in education universalization and development in mountainous areas, islands, ethnic minority areas, areas with extremely difficult socio-economic conditions and areas with industrial parks. The State encourages and protects the legitimate rights and interests of domestic organizations and individuals, overseas Vietnamese and foreign organizations and individuals investing in education. 3. The State budget plays the leading role in the total investment resources for education.
Luật Giáo dục@18: Roles and responsibilities of education managers 1. Education managers play an important role in organizing, managing and administering educational activities. 2. Education managers shall be responsible for learning, training and improving moral qualities, professional qualifications and managerial capacity, and implementing standards and regulations as per the law. 3. The State shall work out plans on building and raising the quality of the contingent of education administrators.
Luật Giáo dục@19: Scientific and technological activities 1. Scientific and technological activities are a duty of educational institutions. 2. Educational institutions shall carry out or cooperate with science and technology organizations, business and service establishments in providing training, conducting scientific research and technology transfer to serve socio-economic development. 3. The State shall create conditions for educational institutions to conduct scientific and technological activities, combine training with scientific research and production in order to raise the education quality; build educational institutions into cultural, scientific and technological centers of localities or the whole country. 4. The State shall adopt policies to prioritize the development of scientific and technological activities in educational institutions. The educational undertakings and policies must be formulated on the basis of scientific research results, suitable to Vietnamese realities and international trends.
Luật Giáo dục@20: Do not spread religion in educational institutions Not to propagate religion or conduct religious rituals in educational establishments of the national education system, State agencies, political organizations, socio-political organizations and people's armed forces.
Luật Giáo dục@21: Forbidding the abuse of educational activities 1. It is prohibited to abuse educational activities to distort the State's guidelines, policies and laws, oppose the State of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, sow division among the great national unity bloc, incite violence, propagate invasion wars, undermine fine customs and practices, spread superstitions and bad customs, and involve learners in social evils. 2. It is prohibited to abuse educational activities for self-seeking purposes.
Luật Giáo dục@22: Prohibited acts in educational institutions 1. Offend the dignity and honor of teachers, officials and employees of educational institutions and learners. 2. Distort educational contents. 3. Cheating in learning, testing, examination, enrollment. 4. Smoking; drinking alcohol; disturbing security and order. 5. Forcing students to take extra classes to collect money. 6. Taking advantage of educational sponsorship and support to force contributions in cash or kind.
Luật Giáo dục@23: Position, Roles and Objectives of Early Childhood Education 1. Preschool education is the first level of education in the national education system, laying the foundation for the comprehensive development of Vietnamese people, nurturing, caring for and educating children aged from 03 months to 06 years. 2. The preschool education aims to comprehensively develop children physically, emotionally, intellectually and aesthetically, form the first element of their personality, and prepare them for the first grade.
Luật Giáo dục@24: Requirements for contents and methods of preschool education 1. Contents of preschool education must be appropriate to the psycho-physiological development of children; ensure harmony between child protection, care and education; ensure comprehensive development of physical, emotional, social, intellectual and aesthetic skills; respect for differences; suit different age groups and connect with primary education. 2. The method of preschool education is prescribed as follows: a) The preschool education establishment must facilitate children's active activities and play activities, create the bond between adults and children; stimulate the development of senses, emotions and psycho-physiological functions; b) Preschool education must enable children to play, experience, explore and explore the surrounding environment in various forms to meet their needs and interests.
Luật Giáo dục@25: Early childhood education program 1. Programmes of preschool education must satisfy the following requirements: a) The preschool education objectives; b) Specify requirements for each age group, educational activities, methods and forms of educational activities, educational environment, and assessment of children's development; c) Ensure consistency across the country and flexibility in implementation of this Circular in conformity with specific conditions of each locality and preschool institution. 2. The Minister of Education and Training shall establish the National Council for appraisal of preschool education programs to appraise the preschool education program. The Council shall be composed of teachers, education administrators, experienced and prestigious scientists in education and representatives of relevant agencies and organizations. At least one-third of the Council's members must be teachers who are teaching in preschool education. The Council and its members shall take responsibility for the appraisal contents and quality. 3. The Minister of Education and Training shall promulgate the preschool education program after it is appraised by the National Council for Appraising the Preschool Education Program; provide standards and procedures for development and revision of the preschool education program; provide standards and selection of toys and learning materials used in preschool education institutions; provide tasks, powers, operation methods, standards, number and structure of members of the National Council for Appraising the Preschool Education Program.
Luật Giáo dục@26: - The pre-school education establishments Institutions of preschool education include: 1. Kindergartens and independent preschool education groups that admit children aged from 03 months to 03 years; 2. Senior kindergartens and independent senior kindergarten classes that admit children aged from 3 to 6; 3. preschool or independent preschool class means an educational institution that combines kindergartens and nursery schools and receives children aged 03 months to 06 years.
Luật Giáo dục@27: Early childhood education development policies 1. The State shall adopt policies on investment in preschool education development; prioritize the development of preschool education in mountainous areas, islands, ethnic minority areas, areas with extremely difficult socio-economic conditions and areas with industrial parks. 2. The State shall adopt policies to encourage organizations and individuals to invest in preschool education development in order to meet social demands. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article. Subsection 2 GENERAL EDUCATION
Luật Giáo dục@28: Education levels and age of general education 1. The educational grades and age levels of general education are prescribed as follows: a) Primary education lasts for 05 school years, from the first grade to the fifth grade. The age of a student entering the first grade is 06 years and is calculated by years; b) Lower secondary education lasts for 04 school years, from sixth grade to ninth grade. Students must complete primary education before entering sixth grade. The age of students entering sixth grade is 11 years and calculated by year; c) Upper secondary education lasts for 03 school years, from tenth grade to twelfth grade. Students must obtain lower secondary education diplomas before entering tenth grade. The age of students entering tenth grade is 15 years and calculated by year. 2. Cases in which a student is allowed to skip a class or study at an older age specified in Clause 1 of this Article include: a) Students skipping class in case of early intellectual development; b) Students at an older age in case of students who are in the same grade, students in areas with extremely difficult socio-economic conditions, students who are ethnic minority people, disabled students, students with poor physical or intellectual development, orphans without support, students of poor households, students who come back from abroad and other cases as prescribed by law. 3. General education is divided into basic education and vocational education. Basic education includes primary education and lower secondary education; vocational education includes upper secondary education. Students in vocational education institutions are entitled to study the amount of general secondary education knowledge. 4. The Minister of Education and Training shall regulate teaching and learning Vietnamese for ethnic minority children before they enter the first grade; teaching of general secondary education knowledge in vocational education institutions; and cases specified in Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@29: Objectives of general education 1. General education aims to comprehensively develop learners in morality, intellect, physical strength, aesthetics, basic skills, personal capacity, dynamism and creativity; form the personality of the socialist Vietnamese and civic responsibility; prepare learners to continue to study the higher education and vocational education programs or to participate in labor, national construction and defense. 2. Primary education aims to form the initial basis for the development of morality, intellect, physical strength, aesthetics and capabilities of pupils; to prepare pupils for further secondary education. 3. Lower secondary education aims to consolidate and develop the results of primary education; ensure that pupils have basic general education, minimum necessary technical and vocational knowledge for further study in upper secondary education or vocational education programs. 4. Upper secondary education aims to equip students with civic knowledge; ensure that students consolidate and develop the results of lower secondary education, complete their general education and acquire common technical and vocational knowledge; have conditions to bring into play their personal capabilities in order to select development directions, continue to study the higher education and vocational education programs or participate in labor, national construction and defense.
Luật Giáo dục@30: Requirements for contents and methods of general education 1. The contents of general education must ensure the general, basic, comprehensive, career-oriented and systematic nature; be associated with the practical life, suitable to the psycho-physiological conditions of pupils of different age groups, and meet the educational objectives at each educational level. 2. Requirements for general education contents at different educational levels are prescribed as follows: a) Primary education must provide students with a foundation for comprehensive development in physical, emotional and social skills; simple and necessary understanding of nature, society and people; social ethics; basic skills in listening, speaking, reading, writing and calculation; physical training and hygiene; initial knowledge of singing, dancing, music and art; b/Collegial secondary education consolidates and develops the contents already learned at primary education, ensuring that pupils have basic general knowledge about Vietnamese, mathematics, national history; other knowledge about social sciences, natural sciences, law, informatics and foreign languages; and minimum necessary technical and vocational knowledge; c/The senior secondary education consolidates and develops the contents already learnt in junior secondary education, completes the contents of general education; ensures the basic and comprehensive general knowledge standards and career-orientation for pupils, with the advanced contents in a number of subjects for developing their capabilities and meeting their aspirations. 3. The general education method promotes the positive, voluntary, proactive and creative character of students in accordance with the characteristics of each subject, class and the characteristics of students; fostering the method of self-study, interest in learning, cooperative skills, independent thinking ability; comprehensively developing the qualities and capabilities of learners; strengthening the application of information technology and communication in the educational process.
Luật Giáo dục@31: General education program 1. Programmes of general education must satisfy the following requirements: a) The target of general education; b) Stipulate requirements for students' qualities and capabilities to be achieved after each educational level, compulsory education contents for all students nationwide; c) Stipulate methods and forms of organizing educational activities and assessing educational outcomes of subjects in each class and level of general education; d) Ensure consistency across the country and flexibility in implementation of this Circular in conformity with specific conditions of each locality and general education institution; dd) Be widely commented by organizations and individuals and experimented before promulgation; be publicly announced after promulgation. 2. The Minister of Education and Training shall establish the National Council for appraisal of general education programs to appraise general education programs. The Council shall be composed of teachers, education administrators, experienced and prestigious scientists in education and representatives of relevant agencies and organizations. At least one-third of the Council's total members must be teachers teaching at the corresponding educational level. The Council and its members shall take responsibility for the appraisal contents and quality. 3. The Minister of Education and Training shall be responsible for the quality of general education programs; promulgate general education programs after they are appraised by the National Council for Appraising General Education Programs; provide standards and procedures for development and revision of general education programs; provide for objectives, subjects, scale and duration of pilot implementation of certain new educational contents and methods in general education institutions; provide for duties, powers, operating methods, standards, number and structure of members of the National Council for Appraising General Education Programs.
Luật Giáo dục@32: Textbooks of general education 1. Textbooks of general education are specified as follows: a) Textbooks must implement general education programs, concretize requirements of general education programs on educational objectives and contents, requirements on qualities and capabilities of students; orientate teaching methods and methods of examining and assessing education quality; contents and forms of textbooks must not bear racial, religious, professional, gender, age and social status prejudices; textbooks must be printed, Braille books and electronic books; b) Each subject shall have one or some textbooks; private sector involvement in textbook development shall be mobilized; textbook publishing shall comply with regulations of law; c) The People's Committee of the province shall decide the selection of textbooks for stable use in local general education institutions in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Education and Training; d) Local educational materials shall be compiled by provincial People's Committees to meet the needs and suit the characteristics of the localities, appraised by provincial appraisal councils and approved by the Minister of Education and Training. 2. The Minister of Education and Training shall establish the National Textbook Appraisal Council according to each subject and educational activities at each educational level to appraise textbooks. The Council consists of teachers, education managers, experienced and prestigious scientists in education and representatives of relevant agencies and organizations. At least one-third of the Council members must be teachers teaching at the corresponding educational level. The Council and its members must be responsible for the appraisal contents and quality. 3. The Minister of Education and Training shall be responsible for textbooks of general education; approve textbooks for use in general education institutions after they are appraised by the National Council for Textbook Appraisal; stipulate standards and procedures for compilation and revision of textbooks of general education; stipulate the selection of textbooks in general education institutions; stipulate the tasks, powers, operation methods, standards, number and structure of members of the National Council for Textbook Appraisal and provincial-level appraisal councils. 4. Presidents of provincial People's Committees shall decide the establishment of provincial-level assessment council for assessment of local educational materials.
Luật Giáo dục@33: General education institutions Institutions of general education include: 1. Primary schools; 2. Lower secondary schools; 3. Upper secondary schools; 4. Mixed compulsory education schools.
Luật Giáo dục@34: Certification of primary and upper secondary education completion and award of lower secondary and upper secondary education diplomas 1. Students who finish primary education and meet the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training shall be certified by the school principal of their completion of primary education. 2. Students who finish the lower secondary education program and meet the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training shall be granted lower secondary education diplomas by the heads of the specialized educational agencies of the district-level People's Committees. 3. Students who finish the upper secondary education program and meet the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training may sit for examinations; those who pass the examinations shall be granted upper secondary diplomas by the heads of the specialized educational agencies under the provincial-level People's Committees. Students who finish upper secondary education and are eligible for taking the exam as prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training but fail to take the exam or fail the exam shall be issued with the certificate of completion of general education program by the school principal. The certificate of completion of general education program shall be used for registration for taking the examination for the high school diploma when the learner has a need or for attending vocational education and used in specific cases as prescribed by law. 4. Students who have lower secondary diplomas and attend vocational secondary education institutions, after learning and taking exams for the required volume of general secondary education knowledge as prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training, shall be granted certificates of sufficient upper secondary education knowledge by heads of educational institutions that organize the teaching of the required volume of general secondary education knowledge. The certificate of completion of the general secondary education knowledge shall be used for attending a higher level of vocational education and in specific cases as prescribed by law. Subsection 3 VOCATIONAL EDUCATION
Luật Giáo dục@35: Vocational education levels Vocational education provides basic, intermediate and college-level training and other vocational training programs for learners to meet the demand for human resources directly involved in production, business and service provision.
Luật Giáo dục@36: Objectives of vocational education Vocational education aims to train human resources directly serving production, business and services, who have practice capacity corresponding to their training level; have good ethics, health, professional responsibility, creativity and adaptability to the international integration environment; ensure the improvement of productivity and quality of workers; enable learners to find jobs, self-employ or take higher education courses after completing the courses.
Luật Giáo dục@37: Organization and operation of vocational education Organization and operation of vocational education shall comply with regulations of this Law and the Law on Vocational Education. Subsection 4 HIGHER EDUCATION
Luật Giáo dục@38: Higher education levels Higher education provides undergraduate, master's and doctoral training.
Luật Giáo dục@39: Objectives of higher education 1. To train human resources of high qualifications, raise the people's intellectual standards and foster talents; to conduct scientific and technological research to create new knowledge and products in service of socio-economic development, defense and security maintenance and international integration. 2. Train learners to develop comprehensively in morality, intellect, body and aesthetics; have knowledge, skills and professional responsibility; have ability to grasp scientific and technological advances corresponding to the training level, self-study ability, creativity and adaptability to working environment; have entrepreneurship spirit and sense of serving the people.
Luật Giáo dục@40: Organization and operation of higher education Higher education organization and operation shall comply with regulations of this Law and the Law on Higher Education.
Luật Giáo dục@41: Objectives of continuing education Continuing education aims to enable people to learn in-service, study continuously and study throughout their lives in order to develop their personal capacity, improve their personality, expand their knowledge, improve their educational and professional levels in order to find jobs, create jobs for themselves and adapt to social life; and contribute to building a learning society.
Luật Giáo dục@42: Duties of continuing education 1. Illiteracy eradication for people in the prescribed age group. 2. Provide training and refresher courses to improve working capacity; update and provide necessary knowledge and skills in life for all people; provide opportunities for people who wish to improve their educational level.
Luật Giáo dục@43: Continuing education programs, forms, contents and methods 1. Programmes of continuing education include: a) The program on eradication of illiteracy; b) Educational programs must meet learners' demands; knowledge and skill update and technology transfer; c) Training programs for improvement of professional capacity; d) Educational programs that are included in the diploma-granting programs of the national education system. 2. Forms of continuing education program implementation include: a) In-service training; b) Distance learning; c) Guided self-study; d) Other learning forms according to learners' demands. 3. Continuing education programs specified in Points a, b and c Clause 1 of this Article must ensure practicality and help learners improve their working capacity, production, working and quality of life. Continuing education programs specified in point d of clause 1 of this Article, in order to meet a level in the structural framework of the national education system and the national level framework of Vietnam, must meet requirements concerning contents of educational programs at the same educational level and training qualification as prescribed in Article 31 hereof, provisions laid down in the Law on Vocational Education and the Law on Higher Education. 4. Continuing education methods must promote the learners' initiative, attach importance to fostering self-learning capacity; use modern means and technologies to raise the teaching and learning quality and efficiency. 5. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, specify continuing education programs, textbooks, teaching materials and materials.
Luật Giáo dục@44: Continuing education institutions 1. Continuing education shall be provided at continuing education institutions, general education institutions, vocational education institutions, higher education institutions, cultural institutions, at workplaces, residential communities, via means of mass media and other means. 2. Institutions of continuing education include: a) Continuing education centers; b) Vocational education and continuing education centers; c) Community learning centers; d) Other continuing education centers. 3. Implementation of continuing education programs by continuing education institutions is prescribed as follows: a) Continuing education centers, vocational education-continuing education centers shall implement the programs specified in Clause 1, Article 43 of this Law, except for the educational programs for obtaining intermediate-level diplomas, college diplomas and bachelor's degrees; b) Community learning centers shall implement the programs specified in point a and point b of clause 1 of Article 43 herein; c) Other continuing education centers shall implement the programs specified in Point b and Point c Clause 1 Article 43 of this Law. 4. General education institutions, vocational education institutions and higher education institutions, when implementing continuing education programs, must ensure their educational and training tasks and only implement the programs specified at Point d, Clause 1, Article 43 of this Law when so permitted by competent state management agencies in charge of education. 5. The joint training program at university level in the form of in-service training shall comply with the Law on Higher Education.
Luật Giáo dục@45: Evaluation and recognition of learning outcomes 1. Learners participating in the illiteracy eradication program who meet the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training shall be recognized as having completed the illiteracy eradication program. 2. Learners who complete the lower secondary education program as prescribed in Point d Clause 1 Article 43 of this Law and meet the conditions prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training shall be issued with lower secondary diplomas by the head of the education authority affiliated to the People's Committee of the district. 3. Learners who complete the upper secondary education program as prescribed in Point d Clause 1 Article 43 of this Law and meet the requirements prescribed by the Minister of Education and Training may take the examination. If they pass the examination, the head of the education authority affiliated to the People's Committee of the province shall issue the upper secondary diploma. If they fail the examination or fail the examination, the head of the continuing education center shall issue the certificate of completion of general education program. 4. Learners who complete the training program and meet the outcome standards of a training level as prescribed in the Vietnamese Qualifications Framework shall be issued with diplomas corresponding to their training levels. 5. Learners of refresher courses in different forms may take examinations and, if they meet the requirements on outcome standards of educational programs specified at Points b and c, Clause 1, Article 43 of this Law, shall be granted certificates corresponding to the study programs.
Luật Giáo dục@46: Continuing education development policies 1. The State shall adopt policies to invest in continuing education development, provide education for all people, promote the study of adults, build a learning society; encourage organizations and individuals to participate in and provide quality continuing education services to meet learners' lifelong learning needs. 2. Agencies and organizations shall create favorable conditions for cadres, civil servants, public employees and laborers to regularly study and study throughout their lives in order to develop themselves and improve the quality of life. 3. Vocational education institutions and higher education institutions shall cooperate with continuing education institutions in providing learning materials for continuing education institutions to meet learners' learning demands; educational institutions providing teacher training shall conduct research into educational science, train and foster teachers of continuing education institutions.
Luật Giáo dục@47: Types of schools in the national education system 1. Schools in the national education system are organized in the following forms : a) Public schools invested, guaranteed by the State, and represented by the owner; b) People-founded schools invested by local communities including organizations and individuals in hamlets, villages, communes, wards and towns to build facilities and ensure conditions for operation. People-founded schools shall only be applied to preschool education institutions; c) Private schools invested and guaranteed by domestic or foreign investors. A non-profit private school is a school that the investor has undertaken and implemented the commitment to operate for non-profit purposes, which is specified in the decision on establishment or conversion of the school; operates for non-profit purposes, does not withdraw capital and does not enjoy profits; the annual accumulated profit is under indivisible common ownership by consolidation for further investment in school development. 2. The conversion of school types in the national education system shall comply with the following principles: a) Only conversion of the school from a private school to a non-profit private school; b) Comply with regulations of the charter, regulations on organization and operation of the school type at each educational level and training level; c) Ensuring the rights of teachers, lecturers, education managers, employees and learners; d) Not to cause loss of land, capital and assets. 3. The Government shall provide detailed guidance on conversion of school types as prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@48: Schools of state agencies, political organizations, socio-political organizations and people's armed forces 1. Schools of state agencies, political organizations and socio-political organizations are tasked to train and retrain cadres, civil servants and public employees. Schools of the people's armed forces are tasked to train and retrain officers, non-commissioned officers, professional army men and defense workers; and to train leaders and state management officials in defense and security tasks and knowledge. Schools of regulatory agencies, political organizations, socio-political organizations and people's armed forces are educational institutions of the national education system, organized and operated in accordance with the Law on Vocational Education, Law on Higher Education and school charters at each educational level and training level. Schools that meet socio-economic development requirements and are permitted by competent authorities to carry out educational activities and educational programs shall be issued with diplomas and certificates of the national education system. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@49: Conditions for establishment of schools and conditions for educational operation 1. A school shall be established when it has a scheme on school establishment in line with the socio-economic development planning and the educational institution network planning as prescribed by the Law on Planning. The proposal for establishment of the requesting institution must clearly define objectives, missions, curriculum framework and outline; land, facilities, equipment, intended construction site, organizational structure, financial and other resources; guidelines and strategies for school construction and development. 2. A school may conduct educational activities when fully meeting the following conditions: a/The school has a good educational record; a) The requesting school must have land, facilities and equipment that meet educational operational requirements; the location for construction of the requesting school must ensure that the educational environment, teachers and employees are safe; b) Having educational programs and teaching and learning materials as prescribed suitable to each educational level and training level; having teachers and administrators who meet the prescribed standards, are sufficient in quantity and synchronous in structure to ensure the implementation of educational programs and organization of educational activities; c) Have sufficient financial resources as prescribed to maintain and develop education activities; d) The school must adopt the statutes of organization and operation of the school. 3. Within the prescribed time limit, if the school fully meets the conditions prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article, it shall be permitted by the competent State agency to conduct educational activities; upon the expiry of the prescribed time limit, if the school fails to fully meet the conditions prescribed in Clause 2 of this Article, its establishment decision or establishment-approving decision shall be withdrawn.
Luật Giáo dục@50: Suspension of educational activities 1. A school shall be suspended from educational activities in the following cases: a) The school has committed any fraudulent act in order to obtain the license for educational operations; b) One of the conditions prescribed in Clause 2 Article 49 of this Law is not satisfied; c) The licensee does not have the right to license the educational provision; d) Failing to carry out educational activities within the prescribed time limit from the date of being permitted to carry out educational activities; dd) The school has committed any violation against laws on education to the extent that it is subject to the suspension imposed as an administrative penalty; e) Other cases as prescribed by law. 2. The decision on suspension of educational operations of a school must clearly specify reasons for such suspension, duration of suspension, measures to ensure rights and benefits of teachers, educational administrators, learners and employees working in the school, and must be made known to the public through mass media. 3. During the suspension period, if the reasons for suspension are eliminated, the competent person who makes decision on suspension shall issue a decision to allow the school to resume its educational activities.
Luật Giáo dục@51: Merging, dividing, splitting and dissolving schools 1. The school must meet the following requirements upon merger, division or split-up: a) Conform to the socio-economic development planning and the educational institution network planning as prescribed in the Law on Planning; b) Meet the socio-economic development demands; c) Ensuring rights and interests of teachers and learners; d) Contribute to improving the quality and efficiency of education. 2. A school shall be dissolved in the following cases: a) The school has committed serious violations against regulations on management, organization and operation of the school; b) Upon expiration of the duration of suspension of educational operations, causes resulting in such suspension have not yet been corrected; c) Educational objectives and contents specified in the establishment decision or the decision on permission for establishment of the requesting institution are no longer relevant to socio-economic development demands; d) The education quality is not guaranteed; dd) The dissolution is requested by the organization or individual founding the school. 3. The decision on merger, division, separation and dissolution of a school must clearly state the reasons therefor, measures to ensure the rights and interests of teachers, educational administrators, learners and employees in the school and must be publicized on the mass media.
Luật Giáo dục@52: Competence and procedures for establishment or permission for establishment; permission for educational activities, suspension of educational activities; merger, division, separation and dissolution of schools 1. The authority to establish public schools and permit the establishment of people-founded schools and private schools is prescribed as follows: a) Presidents of district-level People's Committees shall be vested with authority to issue decisions on establishment of preschools, preschool education establishments, primary schools, lower secondary schools, mixed-level general schools of which the lower secondary education level is the highest level, and ethnic minority semi-boarding general schools, except for the cases prescribed in point d of this clause; b) Presidents of the People's Committees of provinces shall make decisions on upper secondary schools, combined secondary schools of which the highest level is upper secondary school, boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, and vocational secondary schools in provinces, except for the cases specified in Point c and Point d of this Clause; c) Ministers, heads of ministerial-level agencies shall make decisions on affiliated vocational secondary schools; d/The Minister of Education and Training shall decide on pre-university schools, pedagogical colleges and schools under the Ministry; pre-schools, kindergartens, primary schools, lower secondary schools and upper secondary schools at the proposal of foreign diplomatic missions or inter-governmental international organizations; dd) The Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall have authority to issue the decision on establishment of colleges, except pedagogical colleges; e) The Prime Minister shall make decisions on higher education institutions. 2. The Minister of Education and Training shall permit the educational activities of higher education institutions. The competence to permit the educational activities of schools at other educational levels and training levels shall comply with the Government's regulations. 3. The competent person vested authority to establish or grant permission for establishment of a school shall be vested with authority to revoke the decision on establishment or permission for establishment, or the decision on merger, division, splitting and dissolution of that school. The competent person vested authority to grant permission for educational operations shall be vested with authority to issue the decision on suspension of educational operations. In case of merger of schools established by competent authorities of the same level, the higher competent authority shall make decision; in case the competent authorities are equal in establishing schools, such competent authorities shall reach an agreement on decision. 4. The Government shall provide detailed guidance on conditions and procedures for establishment or permission for establishment; permission for educational activities, suspension of educational activities; merger, division, separation and dissolution of schools as prescribed in Article 49,50,51 and 52 of this Law.
Luật Giáo dục@53: - The Statute and Regulation on organization and operation of the educational institution. 1. School charters are generally applicable to preschool education, general education and vocational education schools and have the following principal contents : a) Duties and powers of the school; b) Organize educational activities in the school; c) Duties and rights of teachers; d) Duties and rights of learners; dd) Organization and management of the school; e) Finance and property of the school; g) Relationship between the school, family and society. 2. The Regulation on organization and operation of an educational institution shall specify the contents of the school charter applicable to each type of educational institution. 3. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, promulgate school charters and regulations on organization and operation of educational institutions.
Luật Giáo dục@54: Investors 1. Investors making investments in education include: a) Domestic investors being individuals holding Vietnamese nationality, organizations established under Vietnamese law; b) Foreign investors being individuals with foreign nationality, organizations established under foreign laws. 2. Rights and responsibilities of investors are prescribed as follows: a) Approve the school development plan in accordance with laws and regulations proposed by the school council; b) Decide total capital contributed by investors, the university's investment and development project, mobilization of investment capital (if any); plan for use of the annual difference between revenues and expenditures or plan for handling of losses of the university; approve annual financial statements; c) Elect, appoint, dismiss and discharge members of the University Council; d) Supervise and assess the operation of the university council; dd) Decide to issue, amend and supplement financial rules; approve financial and asset-related contents of the university statutes and regulations; e) Contribute capital in full and on schedule, supervise the capital contribution to the university according to the establishment plan; g) Consider and take actions against any violation of the university council that causes damage in accordance with laws and the university statutes and regulations; h) Decide the school's reorganization and dissolution in accordance with laws; i) Publish the list of organizations and individuals contributing investment capital on the university's website; k) The investor in the establishment of a non-profit private school shall be honored for his/her contribution of capital to the school establishment, construction and development. 3. The investor in the establishment of a private educational institution may choose one of the following methods: a) Invest in establishing business entities in accordance with the Law on Investment and the Law on Enterprises in order for business entities to establish private educational institutions in accordance with this Law; b) Directly invest in the establishment of private educational institutions as prescribed in this Law.
Luật Giáo dục@55: School Board 1. The school board of a public school is the school administration organization, exercising the right to represent the ownership of the school and parties with related interests and is prescribed as follows: a) School council for kindergartens, nursery schools, general education institutions shall decide on the operation orientation of the school, mobilize and supervise the use of resources for the school, connect the school with the community and society, ensure the implementation of educational objectives. The school board of a kindergarten, preschool or general education institution shall be composed of the executive secretary, principal, president of the trade union, secretary of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, representatives of the specialized team, representative of the office team, representative of the local authority, the parent committee and representative of students of a lower or upper secondary school; b) School council of a vocational education institution shall comply with regulations of the Law on Vocational education; c) The school board of a higher education institution shall comply with the Law on Higher Education. 2. School council of a people-founded nursery school, preschool or preschool education establishment is an organization exercising the right to represent ownership of the school as recommended by the community that establishes the school; shall be responsible for deciding on the operating direction, development planning and proposal, organization, personnel, finance and property, and ensuring the fulfillment of educational objectives in accordance with laws. The school council shall be composed of representatives of residential communities, commune-level local authorities and persons contributing capital to the construction and maintenance of the school's operations. 3. The school council of a private school is the school administration organization, exercising the right to represent the investor and parties with related interests, and taking responsibility for implementing the investor's decision. The composition of the school board of a private school invested by domestic or foreign investors includes representatives of investors, members inside and outside the school elected and decided by the investor conference according to the capital contribution percentage. The composition of the school board of a non-profit private school invested by domestic investors includes representatives of investors elected and decided by investors according to the proportion of capital contribution; members inside and outside the school. The school board includes members who are naturally the secretary of the executive committee of the Communist Youth Union, the president of the Trade Union, the representative of the Executive Committee of the Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union who are the school's students (if any) and the principal; elected members are representatives of teachers and employees elected by the plenary conference or the conference of delegates of the school. The outside board includes representatives of leaders of managers, educators, business people and alumni elected by the plenary conference or the conference of delegates of the school. 4. Procedures for establishment, organizational structure, duties and powers of the school board with respect to junior kindergartens, senior kindergartens, preschools and general education institutions shall be stipulated in the school statutes and regulations. Transfer of authority of the management board to the school board with respect to junior kindergartens, senior kindergartens, preschools and general education institutions shall be subject to regulations adopted by the Minister of Education and Training.
Luật Giáo dục@56: Principal 1. The Principal is the person responsible for managing and administering the school's activities, appointed or recognized by the competent authority. 2. The principal of a school in the national education system must be trained and retrained in school management and must meet the principal standards. 3. Standards, duties and powers of the School President; procedures and processes for appointment of the Principal of the preschool or general education institution shall be stipulated by the Minister of Education and Training. 4. Standards, duties and powers of the university's Principals; procedures and processes for conferring the Principals' duties at vocational education institutions and higher education institutions shall comply with the Law on Vocational education, the Law on Higher education and other relevant laws.
Luật Giáo dục@57: Advisory board in school 1. The Advisory Council in the school is established by the Principal to advise and assist the Principal to implement his duties and powers. 2. The organization and operation of the advisory council shall be stipulated in the school charter.
Luật Giáo dục@58: Organization of the Party at school The Communist Party of Vietnam organization in the school leads the school and operates within the framework of the Constitution and law.
Luật Giáo dục@59: - Mass and social organizations in schools. The mass and social organizations in the school shall have to contribute to the achievement of the educational objectives and operate according to law provisions.
Luật Giáo dục@60: Duties and powers of the school 1. The school has the following tasks and powers: a) Publicly announce the educational objectives, programs and plans, conditions for education quality assurance, results of education quality assessment and accreditation; the system of diplomas and certificates of the school; b) Organize the enrolment, education, training, scientific research, transfer of training results and scientific research in accordance with functions, tasks and powers; certify or grant diplomas and certificates within its competence; c) Proactively propose demands and participate in recruitment of teachers and employees in public schools; manage and employ teachers and employees; manage learners; d) Mobilize, manage and use resources in accordance with regulations of law; build facilities to meet standardization and modernization requirements; dd) Cooperate with families, organizations and individuals in educational activities; enable teachers, employees and learners to participate in social activities and community service. 2. The performance of tasks, organizational apparatus, personnel and finance of public universities are prescribed as follows: a) Preschool education institutions and general education institutions shall implement democratic regulations in their schools; be responsible for explaining to the society, learners and regulatory bodies; ensure the participation of learners, families and the society in school management. Management in public preschool education institutions and general education institutions shall comply with regulations of the Government; b) Vocational education institutions and higher education institutions shall exercise autonomy and accountability in accordance with the Law on Vocational education, Law on Higher education and other relevant regulations of law. 3. People-founded schools and private schools shall have the autonomy and self-responsibility for school development plannings and plans, organize educational activities, build and develop the contingent of teachers, mobilize, use and manage resources for the achievement of educational objectives.
Luật Giáo dục@61: Boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, semi-boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, pre-university schools 1. The State shall establish boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, semi-boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, pre-university schools for ethnic minority pupils and pupils of families permanently residing in areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions. 2. Boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, semi-boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, pre-university schools shall be given priority in arranging teachers, material foundations, equipment and budget. 3. The Minister of Education and Training shall provide for conditions for students to attend boarding general education schools for ethnic minority pupils, semi-boarding general education schools for ethnic minority pupils and pre-university schools.
Luật Giáo dục@62: Specialized schools, schools for gifted students 1. Specialized schools shall be established at upper secondary level for students with excellent study results in order to develop their aptitudes in a number of subjects on the basis of ensuring comprehensive general education, creating sources for talent training, meeting the national development requirements. Schools for gifted students in the arts, physical training and sports are established to develop the talents of students in these fields. 2. The State shall give priority to the arrangement of teachers, material foundations, equipment and budget for specialized schools and schools for gifted pupils set up by the State; and adopt preferential policies towards schools for gifted pupils set up by organizations and individuals. 3. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, prescribe advanced education programs and organization and operation regulations of specialized schools and schools for gifted pupils.
Luật Giáo dục@63: Schools and classes for disabled people 1. The State shall establish and encourage organizations and individuals to establish schools and classes for disabled people in order to assist disabled people in functional rehabilitation, learning of general education, vocational training and community integration. 2. The State shall give priority to the arrangement of teachers, facilities, equipment and budget for schools and classes for disabled people established by the State; adopt preferential policies for schools and classes for disabled people established by organizations and individuals.
Luật Giáo dục@64: Reformatory schools 1. Reformatories are tasked to educate juvenile offenders so that they can train and develop healthily, become honest persons capable of reintegrating into social life. 2. The Minister of Public Security shall assume the prime responsibility for, and coordinate with the Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs in, defining educational programs for reformatories.
Luật Giáo dục@65: Other educational institutions 1. Other educational institutions in the national education system include: a) Independent preschool education groups, classes, literacy classes, foreign language classes, computer classes, classes for disadvantaged children who are unable to attend school, and classes for disabled children; b) Continuing education centers, vocational education-continuing education centers, vocational education centers, community learning centers, inclusive education development support centers and other centers performing continuing education tasks; c) Academies and institutes established by the Prime Minister under the Law on Science and Technology are permitted to provide doctoral training. 2. Heads of other educational institutions prescribed in Clause 1 of this Article shall take responsibility for the education quality, management and administration of their educational institutions in accordance with law. 3. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on conditions and authority to establish, permit the establishment, merge, divide, split, dissolve and suspend operations of educational institutions specified in point a and b of clause 1 of this Article, except for vocational education centers. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs, within their duties and powers, shall regulate the statutes of organization and operation of educational institutions specified in point a and b of clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@66: Position and roles of educators 1. Teachers shall perform the task of teaching and educating in educational institutions, except for those specified in point c of clause 1 of Article 65 herein. Teachers of pre-school education institutions, general education institutions and other educational institutions who teach elementary and intermediate level are called teachers; teachers of college level or higher are called lecturers. 2. Teachers play a decisive role in assuring the education quality, have an important position in the society and are honored by the society.
Luật Giáo dục@67: Standards of educators Teachers must meet the following criteria: 1. Having good qualities, ideology and ethics; 2. Meet professional standards for each working position; 3. Have skills to update and improve professional capacity; 4. To ensure their health according to professional requirements.
Luật Giáo dục@68: Professor, Associate Professor 1. Professor or associate professor means a title of a teacher who is teaching or conducting scientific research at a higher education institution and satisfies the criteria for a professor or associate professor appointed by a higher education institution. 2. The Prime Minister shall prescribe the criteria and procedures for appointment and dismissal of the professor and associate professor titles.
Luật Giáo dục@69: Duties of teachers 1. Teach and educate according to the objectives and principles of education, fully and qualitatively implement the educational program. 2. Be exemplary in fulfilling the duties of a citizen, the school's charter and the code of conduct of a teacher. 3. Preserve the quality, prestige and honor of teachers; respect and treat learners fairly; protect the legitimate rights and interests of learners. 4. Study and train to improve moral qualities, political and professional qualifications, renovate teaching methods and set good examples for learners.
Luật Giáo dục@70: Rights of teachers 1. To teach according to their training specialties. 2. To be trained and retrained to raise their political and professional qualifications. 3. Be contracted to teach or do scientific research at other educational institutions or scientific research institutions. 4. To be respected and protected of their dignity, honor and body. 5. To have summer vacation according to the Government's regulations and other holidays prescribed by law.
Luật Giáo dục@71: Visiting teaching 1. Visiting lecturing means the invitation of educational institutions to teach persons who fully meet the criteria prescribed in Article 67 of this Law. Persons invited by educational institutions to teach are called visiting teachers or visiting lecturers. 2. Visiting teachers and lecturers must perform the tasks specified in Article 69 of this Law. Visiting teachers and lecturers who are cadres, civil servants and public employees must ensure the fulfillment of their tasks at their workplaces. 3. Encourage the invitation of Vietnamese teachers, scientists, scientists who are Vietnamese residing abroad and foreigners to teach at educational institutions as visiting teachers.
Luật Giáo dục@72: Standard educational level of teachers 1. The standard training level of teachers is prescribed as follows: a) A college degree or higher in pedagogy, applicable to preschool teachers; b) Obtain at least a bachelor's degree in teacher training major for primary, lower secondary and upper secondary school teachers. In case of subjects in which there are not enough teachers possessing bachelor's degrees in teacher training, they must have bachelor's degrees in relevant majors and certificates of pedagogical training; c) Master's degrees, for teachers of university level; doctoral degrees, for teachers of master's theses and doctoral theses; d) Qualification standards of teachers in institutions of vocational education shall comply with Law on Vocational education. 2. The Government shall provide for the roadmap for improvement of qualifications of preschool teachers, primary teachers and lower secondary teachers prescribed in Point a and Point b Clause 1 of this Article. The Minister of Education and Training and Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, regulate the employment of teachers who fail to satisfy the requirements in Clause 1 of this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@73: Training and retraining of teachers 1. The State shall adopt policies on training and retraining to raise political and professional qualifications and skills of teachers; teachers sent for training and retraining are entitled to salaries and allowances as prescribed by the Government. 2. Educational institutions shall be responsible for creating favorable conditions for teachers to be trained and retrained to meet the statutory standards.
Luật Giáo dục@74: Educational institutions providing training for teachers and education managers shall : 1. Educational institutions providing training and refresher training for teachers include pedagogical schools, educational institutions with pedagogical faculties and educational institutions licensed to provide training and refresher training for teachers. 2. Educational institutions providing training and refresher training for education administrators include pedagogical schools, higher education institutions with education administration faculties and educational institutions licensed to provide training and refresher training for education administrators. 3. Teachers' schools established by the State to train and foster teachers and education administrators shall be given priority in recruitment of teachers, arrangement of education administrators, investment in construction of material foundations and dormitories and assurance of training funds. Teachers' schools shall have practice schools or establishments. 4. The Minister of Education and Training and the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, provide for the performance of the task of training and retraining teachers and education administrators and educational institutions licensed to train and retrain teachers and education administrators.
Luật Giáo dục@75: Vietnamese Teacher's Day November 20 is the Vietnamese Teacher's Day.
Luật Giáo dục@76: Salary Teachers shall be paid salary in line with their working positions and occupational labor; and given priority to enjoy professional allowances under the Government's regulations.
Luật Giáo dục@77: Policies for teachers 1. The State shall adopt policies on recruitment, employment, preferential treatment and assurance of necessary material and spiritual conditions for teachers to perform their roles and tasks. 2. Teachers working at specialized schools, gifted schools, boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, semi-boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, pre-university schools, schools and classes for the disabled, reformatories or other special schools, and teachers providing inclusive education shall be entitled to allowances and preferential policies. 3. The State shall adopt policies to encourage and preferentially provide allowances and other policies for teachers working in areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@78: Confer the title of People's Teacher and Teacher of Merit Teachers, educational administrators and educational researchers who fully meet the criteria prescribed by law shall be conferred the State's titles of People's Teacher and Teacher of Merit.
Luật Giáo dục@79: Awarding the title of Honorary Doctor, Honorary Professor 1. Political and social activists of international prestige, teachers and scientists who are overseas Vietnamese or foreigners who have made many contributions to the cause of education and science in Vietnam shall be conferred the title of honorary doctor by higher education institutions. 2. Political and social activists of international prestige, teachers and scientists who are overseas Vietnamese or foreigners who have made many contributions to the cause of education and science in Vietnam, possess doctoral degrees and are conferred the title of Emeritus Professor by higher education institutions. 3. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@80: Learners Learners are those who are studying at educational institutions in the national education system, including: 1. Children of preschool education institutions; 2. Pupils of general education establishments, job-training classes, vocational education-continuing education centers, vocational education centers, professional secondary schools, pre-university schools; 3. Students of colleges and universities; 4. Learners of master's training institutions; 5. Doctoral students of doctoral training institutions; 6. Learners of continuing education programs.
Luật Giáo dục@81: Children's rights and policies towards children at preschool education institutions 1. Children at preschool education institutions have the following rights : a) Receive care, nurture and education according to the preschool education program promulgated by the Minister of Education and Training; receive health care and protection as prescribed in the Law on Children and other relevant regulations of law; b) Receive ticket price exemption or reduction for public entertainment services. 2. The Government shall provide for policies for children at preschool education institutions.
Luật Giáo dục@82: Duties of the learner 1. Study and train according to educational programs, plans and code of conduct of educational institutions. 2. Respect teachers, officials and employees of the educational institution; unite and help each other in learning and training; comply with internal regulations of the educational institution; comply with law provisions. 3. To participate in labor, social activities and environmental protection activities suitable to their age groups, health and capacity. 4. Preserve and protect the property of the educational institution. 5. Contribute to the construction, protection and promotion of the tradition of the educational institution.
Luật Giáo dục@83: RIGHTS OF THE LEARNERS 1. To be educated and studied in order to develop comprehensively and bring into the fullest play their potentials. 2. To be respected and have equal educational and learning opportunities; to develop their talents, aptitudes, creations and inventions; to be fully provided with information on their study and training. 3. Be entitled to skip classes, shorten the duration of the program, study at an older age, extend the duration of the program, repeat classes, be provided with conditions for learning educational programs as prescribed by law. 4. To study in a safe and healthy educational environment. 5. Be issued with qualifications and certificates after graduation from the educational level, training level and completion of educational program as prescribed. 6. To participate in activities of mass and social organizations in the educational establishments according to law provisions. 7. Use facilities, libraries, equipment and means for learning, cultural, sporting and athletic activities of the educational institution. 8. Propose solutions to the educational institution to build the educational institution, protect the rights and interests of learners directly or through their legal representatives. 9. To enjoy the State's priority policies on recruitment into State agencies if they graduate with good marks and have good ethics. 10. To appoint their representatives to join the school council according to regulations.
Luật Giáo dục@84: Educational credit The State has preferential credit policies on interest rates, conditions and term of money loans for learners to have conditions to study. Encouraging the socialization of educational credit activities.
Luật Giáo dục@85: - Scholarships, social allowances, tuition exemption and reduction, tuition support and living allowances and expenses. 1. The State shall adopt policies on grant of academic incentive scholarships to students who achieve excellent academic results in specialized schools or gifted schools specified in Article 62 of this Law and learners who have good academic and training results or higher at vocational education institutions and higher education institutions; grant policy scholarships to students enrolled by nomination, students of pre-university schools, boarding general education schools for ethnic minorities, learners at vocational education institutions for war invalids and disabled and handicapped people. 2. The State shall adopt policies on subsidies, exemption and reduction of tuition fees for learners who are social policy beneficiaries, ethnic minority people in areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions, orphans, helpless children, the disabled, members of poor and near-poor households. 3. The State encourages organizations and individuals to grant scholarships or allowances to learners according to law provisions. 4. Pedagogy students shall be entitled to tuition support and living allowances for the entire course. Those who are entitled to tuition support and living allowances, after 02 years from the graduation date, do not work in the education sector or do not work for the prescribed period, must reimburse the State's support amounts. The maximum time limit for reimbursement is equal to the training duration. Teachers' pupils and students shall enjoy policies on study promotion scholarships, social allowances, tuition exemption and reduction prescribed in Clauses 1 and 2 of this Article. 5. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
