Luật Giáo dục@86: Public service ticket exemption and reduction for pupils and students Pupils and students are entitled to ticket price exemption or reduction when using public services on traffic, entertainment, visiting museums, historical relics and cultural works under the Government's regulations.
Luật Giáo dục@87: Appointment regime 1. The State shall recruit students who are ethnic minority people with very small number of people and ethnic minority students in areas with exceptionally difficult socio-economic conditions where ethnic minority cadres, civil servants and public employees are not available or are few; adopt policies to create sources for nomination and create favorable conditions for these subjects to attend boarding ethnic minority general education schools and increase the pre-university study duration. 2. The provincial People's Committee shall, based on the local demands, propose and allocate the recruitment quotas; send learners to school according to the approved criteria and quotas; consider recruitment and arrange jobs for learners after graduation. Educational institutions shall be responsible for supporting learners who are enrolled by appointment to ensure the outcome. 3. Learners who are enrolled by nomination shall return to work in the locality where they are sent to study; be considered for recruitment and assigned jobs. 4. The Government shall provide detailed regulations on criteria and beneficiaries of nomination-based enrolment; organization of implementation of nomination-based enrolment and recruitment of students following nomination-based enrolment after graduation.
Luật Giáo dục@88: Reward students Learners who record achievements in learning and training shall be commended by educational institutions and education authorities; those who record particularly outstanding achievements shall be commended as per the law.
Luật Giáo dục@89: Responsibilities of the school 1. The school shall be responsible for implementing the plan for educational universalization and code of conduct; actively coordinating with the family and society to organize or participate in educational activities according to the school's plan, ensuring safety for teachers and learners; notifying the students' learning and training results to their parents or guardians. 2. Other educational institutions may apply the regulations related to schools in this Chapter.
Luật Giáo dục@90: Family responsibilities 1. Parents or guardians shall be responsible for nurturing, educating, caring and enabling children or wards to study, carry out universalization of education, complete compulsory education, train and participate in school activities; respect teachers, and must not offend dignity and honor or infringe upon their bodies. 2. Family members shall build cultured families and create a favorable environment for all-sided moral, intellectual, physical and aesthetic development of their children; the elderly shall educate and set examples for their children and join schools in raising education quality and effectiveness.
Luật Giáo dục@91: Responsibilities of parents or guardians of students 1. Receive information about the learning and training results of their children or the ward. 2. Participate in educational activities according to the school's plan; participate in activities of the parent committee of the school. 3. Cooperate with the school and education authorities in settling issues related to the education of the child or the ward as prescribed.
Luật Giáo dục@92: Representative board of parents of students and preschoolers 1. The parent committee of a school shall be established in each school year of general education and preschool education and appointed by the parents or guardian of each class or school to cooperate with the school in caring, nurturing and educating students and preschoolers and shall operate in accordance with regulations of the Minister of Education and Training. 2. No inter-school and administrative-level parent committees are organized.
Luật Giáo dục@93: The responsibility of society 1. Agencies, organizations and individuals shall have the following responsibilities: a) Support and cooperate with the school in organizing educational activities and scientific research; facilitate teachers and students' visits, experience, practice and scientific research; b) Participate in the construction of a safe and healthy educational environment, and prevent any activity that may cause adverse impacts on learners; c) Enable citizens of the prescribed age to fulfill their learning obligations to universalize education and complete compulsory education so that learners can enjoy healthy recreational activities, cultural, physical training and sports activities; d) Provide resources for education development according to their capacity. 2. The Vietnam Fatherland Front and its member organizations shall have to mobilize the entire population to take care of the education cause. 3. Ho Chi Minh Communist Youth Union, Ho Chi Minh Young Pioneer Organization shall coordinate with the school to educate, mobilize the youth, teenagers and children to be exemplary in learning, training and participating in development of education cause.
Luật Giáo dục@94: - Study promotion fund, education sponsoring fund. The State encourages organizations and individuals to set up study promotion funds and education sponsoring funds. The setting up and operation of study promotion funds and education sponsoring funds comply with law.
Luật Giáo dục@95: Financial sources invested in education Financial sources invested in education include: 1. The State budget; 2. Legal investment capital of domestic and foreign organizations and individuals; 3. Revenues from education, training, science and technology services; services serving and supporting educational activities of educational institutions; revenues from business and production activities; bank deposit interests and other lawful revenues as prescribed by law; 4. The State's funding for order placement and task assignment; 5. Loan capital sources; 6. Sponsorship, aid, donations from domestic and foreign organizations and individuals.
Luật Giáo dục@96: State budget investment in education 1. The State shall give the top priority to the allocation of education budget, ensuring that the State budget spends at least 20% of the total State budget expenditure on education and training. 2. The State budget expenditures on education shall be allocated on the principle of publicity and democracy, based on the educational scale and socio-economic development conditions of each region; ensuring budget for educational universalization and development in ethnic minority areas and areas with particularly difficult socio-economic conditions. The State shall have to allocate adequate and timely funding for the educational universalization and in line with the tempo of the school year. 3. Education authorities and education facilities shall manage and use the allocated budget for education and other sources of revenue effectively as prescribed by law.
Luật Giáo dục@97: Priority in financial investment and land for school construction Ministries, ministerial-level agencies, People's Councils and People's Committees at all levels shall incorporate the construction of schools, physical training, sports, cultural and art works in service of education into socio-economic development plannings and plans of their respective branches and localities; prioritize financial and land investment in the construction of schools and dormitories for pupils and students in socio-economic development plans.
Luật Giáo dục@98: Encouraging investment in education 1. The State encourages and creates conditions for organizations and individuals to invest in and contribute their intellects, labor and property to education. 2. Contributions and grants to education of organizations and individuals shall be deducted when determining taxable incomes in accordance with tax laws. 3. Organizations and individuals investing in the construction of works in service of education; making contributions, financial supports or donations in cash or kind for the development of the educational cause shall be considered for recognition in appropriate forms.
Luật Giáo dục@99: Tuition fees, fees for educational and training services 1. Tuition is the amount of money that learners must pay to pay part or all of the costs of education and training services. The tuition rates are determined according to the roadmap for assurance of education and training services prescribed by the Government; vocational education institutions and higher education institutions shall comply with the Law on Vocational education and the Law on Higher education. 2. Costs of education and training services include all salary costs, direct costs, administrative costs, fixed asset depreciation costs directly and indirectly serving education activities according to the education program. Admission fees payable by candidates for non-exam admission and admission exams shall be determined according to the roadmap for correct and adequate calculation. 3. Primary schoolers in public educational institutions are not required to pay tuition fees; in areas where there are not enough public schools, primary schoolers in private educational institutions shall be supported tuition fees by the State. The level of support shall be decided by provincial People's Councils. 4. Pre-school children aged 05 years living in hamlets, communes meeting with exceptional difficulties, ethnic minority areas, remote and isolated areas, coastal areas and islands shall be exempted from tuition fees. 5. 5-year-old preschool children other than those specified in Clause 4 of this Article and lower secondary school pupils are exempt from school fees according to the roadmap set by the Government. 6. The mechanism for collection and management of tuition fees and service charges in educational activities is prescribed as follows: a) The Government shall provide for the mechanism for collecting and managing tuition fees of public preschool education institutions, compulsory education institutions, vocational education institutions, and higher education institutions; b) The provincial People's Council shall decide the tuition frame or specific tuition rate, the revenues of services and support of educational activities of the school for the public educational facilities under the authority of state management on education at the proposal of the provincial People's Committee; c) Provincial People's Committees shall regulate the collection and use of fees for enrolment services at all levels under the management of local governments after they are approved by provincial People's Councils; d) People-founded and private educational institutions are entitled to proactively set tuition fees and other service charges to cover their costs and ensure reasonable accumulation. Publicly announce costs of educational and training services and charge rates as committed in the school establishment scheme, and for each course, level and school year in accordance with law.
Luật Giáo dục@100: - Tax preferences for textbooks, teaching materials and equipment The publishing of textbooks, teaching materials; the production and supply of teaching equipment and toys for children in the preschool education institutions; the import of books, newspapers, teaching and learning materials, teaching equipment and research equipment used in the educational institutions shall enjoy tax preferences by the State according to the provisions of tax legislation.
Luật Giáo dục@101: Financial regime applicable to educational institutions 1. Public educational institutions shall manage their financial revenues and expenditures, manage the use of their assets in accordance with the Law on State Budget, the Law on Management and Use of Public Property and other relevant regulations of law; comply with regulations on accounting, audit, taxation and financial disclosure as prescribed by law. 2. People-founded and private educational institutions shall operate on the principle of financial autonomy, comply with the accounting, audit, tax, property valuation and financial publicity regimes as provided for by law. Revenues of people-founded and private educational institutions shall be used to cover expenses for their operations, fulfill their obligations toward the state budget, set up development investment funds and other funds of educational institutions, the remainder shall be divided to investors according to their capital contributions, except for non-profit educational institutions. 3. Educational institutions must publicly announce the cost of educational and training services and the rate of fees for each school year for preschool education and general education; for each school year and expected for the entire course for vocational education and higher education.
Luật Giáo dục@102: Property ownership rights and capital transfer rights of people-founded schools and private schools 1. Property of people-founded schools shall be under the ownership of the school's legal person status. Property of people-founded schools shall be protected by the State according to law provisions. 2. Property of a private school shall be owned by investors and formed from capital contributed by investors and determined in the investor's capital contribution record. The transfer of contributed property to the school shall comply with law. 3. The transfer of capital of people-founded schools and private schools must ensure the stability and development of the schools and comply with the Government's regulations.
Luật Giáo dục@103: Preferential policies for people-founded schools and private schools 1. People-founded schools and private schools shall be allocated or leased land, allocated or leased facilities by the State, receive budget support when performing tasks ordered by the State, enjoy tax and credit incentives; and receive funding from the State to implement policies towards learners as prescribed in Article 85 of this Law. 2. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@104: Contents of state management of education 1. Formulate and direct the implementation of strategies, planning, plans and policies on education development. 2. Promulgate and organize the implementation of legislative documents on education; promulgate school charters, standards of educational institutions, regulations on organization and operation of educational institutions, charters of parent committees; regulations on teaching and education activities inside and outside the school; regulations on assessment of learning and training results; rewards and disciplinary actions for learners. 3. Stipulate standards for job titles and working regime of teachers and education administrators; list of job positions and number of employees in educational institutions; standards for heads and deputy heads of educational institutions; standards for heads and deputy heads of education authorities affiliated to provincial and district-level People's Committees; professional standards for teachers; promulgate code of conduct for teachers and educational institutions; regulations on conditions, standards and methods of teacher recruitment. 4. Define objectives, programs, contents of education; national qualifications framework; standards of teachers; standards and norms for use of facilities, libraries and school equipment; compilation and use of textbooks and teaching materials; examination, examination, enrolment, joint training and management of diplomas and certificates; recognition of diplomas issued by foreign educational institutions and used in Vietnam. 5. Regulate education quality assessment; organize and manage education quality assurance and education quality assessment. 6. Carry out statistical work and provide information about educational organization and operation. 7. Organization of the educational administration apparatus. 8. To organize and direct the training, fostering and management of teachers and educational administrators. 9. Mobilizing, managing and using resources for educational development. 10. Organizing and managing the research and application of science and technology in the field of education. 11. Organizing and managing international cooperation and foreign investment in education. 12. Inspect the compliance with the law on education; settle complaints and denunciations, provide rewards, and take actions against violations of the law on education.
Luật Giáo dục@105: State management agencies in charge of education 1. The Government shall perform the unified state management of education. The Government shall submit to the National Assembly before deciding on major policies affecting the rights and obligations to study of citizens nationwide, policies on reform of curriculum contents of a grade; annually report to the National Assembly on educational activities and implementation of education budget; submit to the National Assembly Standing Committee before deciding on the mass application of new policies in education which have been successfully piloted and the mass application will affect the rights and obligations to study of citizens nationwide. 2. The Ministry of Education and Training shall be responsible to the Government for exercising the state management of pre-school education, general education, higher education, postsecondary-and college-level pedagogy, and continuing education. 3. The Ministry of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs shall be held accountable to the Government for performing state management of vocational education, except for pedagogical intermediate and college levels. 4. Ministries and ministerial-level agencies shall, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, coordinate with the Ministry of Education and Training and the Ministry of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs in performing the state management of education. 5. People's Committees at all levels shall perform state management of education as decentralized by the Government and, within the ambit of their tasks and powers, perform the following tasks : a) Inspect the compliance with the law on education of local educational institutions; b) Ensure the conditions of teachers, finance, material facilities, libraries and teaching equipment of public schools under their management; c) Develop types of schools, carry out private sector involvement in education; ensure the fulfillment of requirements for expansion of scale and improvement of education quality and efficiency in the province; d) Implement policies of the State and local governments to ensure autonomy and accountability for the performance of duties and education quality of educational institutions under their management; dd) Take responsibility for the results of implementation of strategies, planning, plans and policies on education development in their provinces.
Luật Giáo dục@106: Principles of international cooperation in education The State shall expand and develop international cooperation in education on the principle of respect for national independence and sovereignty, equality and mutual benefit.
Luật Giáo dục@107: Cooperation in education with foreign countries 1. The State encourages and creates conditions for Vietnamese educational institutions to cooperate with foreign organizations and individuals and overseas Vietnamese in teaching, learning and scientific research. 2. The State encourages and creates conditions for Vietnamese citizens to go abroad to teach, study, conduct scientific research and conduct academic exchange in the form of self-financing or with funding allocated by domestic or foreign organizations and individuals. 3. The State shall set aside budget to send persons who meet the criteria on quality, ethics and qualifications to study and/or study abroad in key branches, occupations and domains in service of the cause of national construction and defense. 4. The Government shall stipulate the Vietnamese citizens' overseas teaching, study, scientific research and academic exchange; the educational cooperation with foreign organizations and individuals and overseas Vietnamese.
Luật Giáo dục@108: Foreign cooperation and investment in education 1. Foreign organizations and individuals, international organizations and overseas Vietnamese shall be encouraged and enabled by the State to teach, study, invest, sponsor, cooperate, conduct scientific research, apply and transfer education technologies in Vietnam; have their legitimate rights and interests protected in accordance with Vietnamese laws and international agreements to which the Socialist Republic of Vietnam is a signatory. 2. Educational cooperation with Vietnam must ensure that learners are educated in personality, quality and civic capacity; respect national cultural identity; achieve educational objectives, requirements on educational contents and methods suitable to each educational level and training level in the national education system; and conduct educational activities in accordance with Vietnamese law. 3. Foreign cooperation and investment in education in Vietnam include : a) Educational and training association; b) Establishment of representative offices; c) Establishment of the branch; d) Establishment of educational institutions; e/Other forms of cooperation and investment. 4. The Government shall elaborate this Article.
Luật Giáo dục@109: Recognition of foreign diplomas 1. Diplomas granted by foreign educational institutions shall be recognized for use in Vietnam in the following cases: a) The diplomas are granted by foreign general education institutions, higher education institutions to learners after finishing the quality education program as prescribed by the country granting diplomas and recognized by the competent educational agencies of that country; b) The qualifications are issued by the foreign educational institution that is operating legally in another country, is permitted by the educational authority of the two countries to establish a campus or cooperate in training and satisfy the requirements in Point a of this Clause; c) The qualifications are issued by foreign educational institutions legally operating in Vietnam, carrying out educational activities in accordance with regulations on educational cooperation and investment promulgated by the Government, approved by competent authorities and meeting the requirements specified in Point a of this Clause. 2. The Minister of Education and Training, within the scope of his/her duties and powers, shall sign international agreements on equivalence of diplomas or mutual recognition of diplomas; provide detailed regulations on conditions, procedures and competence for recognition of diplomas; provide information on quality assurance higher education institutions recognized by host countries. Recognition of foreign vocational education qualifications shall comply with the Law on Vocational education.
Luật Giáo dục@110: Objectives, principles and subjects of education accreditation 1. Objectives of education accreditation are specified as follows: a) Ensuring and improving the education quality; b) The certification of the fulfillment of the targets of the educational institution or the training program in each period; c) Serve as the basis for educational institutions to explain to the owner, competent authorities, relevant parties and the society about the current state of education quality; d) Serve as the basis for learners to select educational institutions and training programs, and for employers to recruit employees. 2. The education accreditation must ensure the following principles: a) Independence, objectivity and compliance with laws; b) Honesty, openness and transparency; c) Equitable, compulsory, periodic. 3. Subjects of education accreditation include: a) Institutions of preschool education, general education and continuing education; b) Educational institutions and training programs at all levels in vocational education and higher education.
Luật Giáo dục@111: State management of education accreditation 1. Issue regulations on standards for education quality assessment; process and frequency of education quality assessment at each educational level and training qualification; operating principles, conditions and standards of organizations and individuals involved in education quality assessment; issue license for education quality assessment; issue and revoke education quality assessment certificates. 2. Manage the accreditation of training programs and educational institutions. 3. Provide guidance for organizations, individuals and educational institutions on the education quality assessment and accreditation. 4. Inspect and assess the implementation of regulations on education quality assessment.
Luật Giáo dục@112: Education accreditation organizations 1. Education accreditation organizations include: a) State-owned education accreditation organizations; b) Education quality assessment organizations established by domestic and foreign organizations and individuals; c) Foreign education accreditation organizations. 2. The education accreditation shall be organized as follows: a) The Government shall regulate conditions and procedures for establishment, operation permission, suspension and dissolution of education accreditation organizations; stipulate conditions and procedures for recognition of foreign education accreditation organizations' operation in Vietnam; b) The Minister of Education and Training shall decide the establishment or permit the establishment, operation, suspension, dissolution of the education accreditation organization and define the responsibilities and powers of the education accreditation organization for preschool education, general education and continuing education; decide the recognition and revocation of the decision on recognition of the foreign education accreditation organization operating in Vietnam; stipulate the supervision and assessment of the education accreditation organization; c) The education quality assessment of vocational education and higher education shall comply with the Law on Vocational education and the Law on Higher education.
Luật Giáo dục@113: Amendments to some Articles of the Law on Vocational Education No. 74/2014/QH13 amended by the Law No. 97/2015/QH13 and the Law No. 21/2017/QH14 1. Point a and Point b Clause 3 Article 32 are amended as follows: a) Holders of upper secondary degrees or certificates of completion of general education programs or certificates of completion of upper secondary education knowledge, and Diploma Level 4 of VQF or higher and registered to study the same major or occupation; b) Holders of upper secondary diplomas or certificates of completion of general education programs or certificates of completion of the upper secondary education knowledge, good-quality intermediate vocational training diplomas, who have worked for at least 2 years in the trained disciplines or professions and registered to study the same disciplines or professions;. 2. Clause 3 of Article 33 is amended as follows: 3. The annual college-level training period shall be 02-03 years depending on the discipline/major of the person having the upper secondary education diploma; 01-02 years depending on the discipline/major of the person having the vocational secondary education diploma of the same discipline/major and the upper secondary education diploma or the certificate of completion of general education program or the certificate of completion of the upper secondary education knowledge. The duration of a college-level training program by the method of module or credit accumulation refers to the time length during which a person has completed his/her upper secondary education diploma or the certificate of completion of general education program or the certificate of completion of the upper secondary education knowledge..
Luật Giáo dục@114: Implementation effect 1. This Law comes into force from July 01,2020. 2. The Law on Education No. 38/2005/QH11, amended and supplemented by the Law No. 44/2009/QH12, the Law No. 74/2014/QH13 and the Law No. 97/2015/QH13, shall be annulled from the effective date of this Law, except for the cases specified in Article 115 of this Law.
Luật Giáo dục@115: Transitional provisions Pedagogy students and learners of pedagogy training courses enrolled before the effective date of this Law shall continue to be governed by regulations laid down in Clause 3 Article 89 of the Education Law No. 38/2005/QH11 amended and supplemented by the Law No. 44/2009/QH12, the Law No. 74/2014/QH13 and the Law No. 97/2015/QH13.
